Customer 307.Content:
The entire staff is simply amazing, our food was prepared exactly as requested, this is an amazing restaurant with a classic and contemporary feel. 

We are looking forward to our next visit.

Customer 309.Name: JohnS
Customer 309.Content: Excellent meal for our visiting family.

Customer 310.Name: BP10
Customer 310.Content:
Average so so steaks , not much to brag about food wise.  
Service , again not so special !
I much prefer the Capital Grill or El Gaucho .
Thought we'd give it a try and after dinner we all four agreed that most likely not again .

Customer 311.Name: alanb
Customer 311.Content: Steaks were average - ones we cook at home are better. Salmon and prime rib were overcooked. Wine list is absurdly expensive with few reasonably priced bottled.

Customer 312.Name: Laurie
Customer 312.Content: Very nice restaurant. Local friend suggested it for us and we were not disappointed.

Customer 313.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 313.Content: As always, the food and service were exceptional.

Customer 314.Name: RichardL
Customer 314.Content: Best lobster tails, best steaks, best onion soup in the Northwest

Customer 315.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 315.Content: I’ve been to met 20 times in 20 years and this was a uniquely average steak , service and table. Never had a tough fillet at a steakhouse with a dull knife and stained table

Customer 316.Name: Tfhsmail
Customer 316.Content: Great service. Food was excellent but service was better.

Customer 317.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 317.Content: The Met never fails to deliver.  It is always first class.

Customer 318.Name: ME123
Customer 318.Content: Had a wonderful lunch at the Metropolitan Grill. The Lobster Bisque is out of this world good and the crusty bread to dip in it was excellent. Can not wait for next visit to Seattle to come back for either lunch or dinner.  I also had the crab cakes that were pretty good, but the sauce could use more flavor.

Customer 319.Name: Sparky
Customer 319.Content: Always have a wonderful time/meal here.  Our favorite place when we’re in Seattle.  Jade was a fantastic server!

Customer 320.Name: JR2022
Customer 320.Content:
We ordered a wonderful Sauvignon Blanc and enjoyed it.

The streak is divine!

Customer 321.Name: DanielleMarie
Customer 321.Content: We decided on the Met for dinner before a night at Benaroya Hall- and once again it did not disappoint! Fantastic food and service

Customer 322.Name: Greg51
Customer 322.Content: We pulled off a surprise for my wife’s birthday!! The staff was great big thank you!! The food was wonderful. Can’t wait to go back!! Very classy place.

Customer 323.Name: SupraMike
Customer 323.Content: Birthday party of 4. Meals and service were Excellent  - Brussel Sprouts appetizer was the Best. Great place for a SPECIAL OCCASION!

Customer 324.Name: OpinionatedSnob
Customer 324.Content:
The Met is a somewhat noisy steakhouse that offers oversized expensive steaks in all the right ways. 

My experience has been that there is zero benefit to ordering the Japanese steak or the Wagyu, they generally don’t taste as rich as the actual Kobe in Tokyo - so you’re not getting the true marbling. You’re just getting the breeding ... no massaged/beer fed super meat here. 

But the “normal” meat is absolutely awesome too. 

You’ll be happy if you like steak.

Customer 325.Name: Dante
Customer 325.Content: Noisy, stuck in a back corner, diner style service, mediocre steak, exhorbinate price.

Customer 326.Name: JamesC
Customer 326.Content: Excellent place to go for dinner and drinks.  The only issue is the mandatory 20% service charge which limits the options of the customer to acknowledge the service quality they receive.

Customer 327.Name: Cinhart
Customer 327.Content: We had lunch steak sandwiches and wine. Our server was very friendly. We stayed a long time at our table visiting our friend and she never made us feel rushed. I love the atmosphere here.

Customer 328.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 328.Content: We were in town for the weekend for a birthday trip and had attended the Seahawks Game. When we arrived the Metropolitan Grill was packed. The decor is striking and as we were escorted to our table we were wowed with photos of many celebrities hung on the walls. Even with the busy atmosphere we found our booth private and welcoming. Our waiter was prompt and charismatic, very engaging and very knowledgeable about the menu. Our food was phenomenal- excellent cuts of meat cooked to perfection. A great experience overall. Would definitely recommend.

Customer 329.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 329.Content: Food was great! Service was slow but nice.

Customer 330.Name: Love2eat
Customer 330.Content: Everything was delicious! The fish was so fresh

Customer 331.Name: Mandysu
Customer 331.Content: Service was outstanding. Food was excellent.

Customer 332.Name: Fun4Me
Customer 332.Content: Excellent dining experience. Plan to visit again soon.

Customer 333.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 333.Content: Steak was a bit over done.

Customer 334.Name: MadisonS
Customer 334.Content: The food was amazing but the overall experience was not. We made our dinner reservations and indicated we were celebrating our Anniversary, when we got to the restaurant I even confirmed with the host and she said she was on top of it. The entire evening went on without them even mentioning a congratulations or doing anything at all. We got our family with us to celebrate and had a let down from the restaurant. There also has to be more clarity ahead of time on letting clients know all parties are being charged a 20% service fee, Tell us ahead of time so we know, and if you’re confirming you have something set for us your clients to celebrate- actually do it and not just leaves wondering what happened and leave dissatisfied and disappointed. The experience left us with a bad taste for the place

Customer 335.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 335.Content: It was a great dinner, would certainly recommend again!

Customer 336.Name: RossW
Customer 336.Content: Always great! My go to steak & seafood house in Seattle.

Customer 337.Name: Suze
Customer 337.Content:
Wonderful time with an incredible server!
Memorable!!

Customer 338.Name: Brian
Customer 338.Content: The Metropolitan Gill has a classic American vibe, great food, a wide selection of wines (including half bottles) and friendly, helpful staff. It's a great spot for a celebration!

Customer 339.Name: RobertO
Customer 339.Content: The Met is simply amazing. Service is top notch, the food is the BOMB. Unless you are well off, this is not a place you go to on a weekly basis. But if you are looking for a place to celebrate something special you have to check this place out. We love it!

Customer 340.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 340.Content: Our go to restaurant for any celebration. Love it!

Customer 341.Name: sargent51
Customer 341.Content: So...they are “trying something new” at the Met. My bill, $325, included a 20% “service charge” that will be kept by the company in its entirety. Additionally, according to the manager I spoke with, the servers are now being paid commission (I’m ok with that) at a rate of 13%.  When the server brought us the check she pointed out the new service charge  but omitted the fact that she was on commission.  So, in fact, with a 20% tip and 13% commission she would have made banked a pretty robust tip.  I’m all for tipping according to service received. But there’s some smoke and mirrors here that most people are not throwing a fit over. I did, and got the service charge removed. My meal was ~really~ $250 (see attached receipt.)  The 20% “service charge” ($50) + a 20% tip on the entirety of the check ($65) would have totaled $105 on $250 check. This is a BAD practice and I will not return. There lots of upscale steak houses in Seattle. Oh...and that Woodford Double Oak for $14?  A 1 oz pour. Simple highway robbery.

Customer 342.Name: VinceM
Customer 342.Content: Nice atmosphere but the steak was overcooked and came out early while we were eating our salads. A tad disapointing espeically with the price of the dinner.

Customer 343.Name: HarveyS
Customer 343.Content: Service and food were excellent like always.

Customer 344.Name: bereiter
Customer 344.Content: I have enjoyed many great meals at the MET.  I was disappointed to discover the 20% pretax service fee at the end of our meal.  While I truly enjoy the food and atmosphere, this new policy(and expense) may limit my visits.

Customer 345.Name: OsmondG
Customer 345.Content: The food was great. Dressing to the hilt is not required to enjoy a great meal.

Customer 346.Name: methodechampenoise
Customer 346.Content: Food was fine, service was great. Learned about a new policy - as of 10/7 The Met moved from tip to commission for their servers and the 20% pre-tax service charge on your bill doesn’t include tip because there’s an additional tip line. Not sure why only 13% of the service charge goes to the staff.

Customer 347.Name: none
Customer 347.Content: Lunch for 3 people i didn’t know it’s included 20% served changed. I would like the service let us know. I added another 25% on top of that. It’s not right

Customer 348.Name: Jonvilliers
Customer 348.Content:
They are now adding a 20% "service charge" to the bill that goes to management, not the server.  

Maybe someone on a business expense account this isn't a big deal, but prices are already near the top for restaurants in Seattle.  And then on top of it, tax is charged on that amount, effectively making it a 22% upcharge.  There is a notation on the menu of a 3% service charge, not 20%.  Made us all VERY uncomfortable when the check arrived.  Not the kind of experience you want to have with a family dinner out.

We will not be returning.

Customer 349.Name: Dufferman12
Customer 349.Content: This is a wonderful steak place but is getting really pricey. Great food, not a great value but good service.

Customer 350.Name: StevenS
Customer 350.Content: Too costly (priced by asparagus tip), surcharged (?for time), limited seafood choices, much too noisy for this classification and age of restaurant, waiter limited knowledge of block surroundings, parking. Having unloaded all that, the small piece of salmon for $48 wasn't bad (alone).

Customer 351.Name: Rich
Customer 351.Content: The atmosphere was electric but my steak came out cold. Given the cost of the meal it was not worth it by a long shot. I've had many really good lunches and dinners over the years here but this one fell flat.

Customer 353.Name: KathyP
Customer 353.Content: The food and service were both amazing, as always. This is our favorite place to go for special occasions.

Customer 355.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 355.Content: Everything was amazing from the time we stepped in the door until we left! 5 Star steakhouse experience, one of the best I’ve been to.

Customer 356.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 356.Content:
結婚記念日ディナーに活用。
賑やかではあるものの、声はきちんと通るし、ソファなどの設えのおかげか雰囲気は落ち着いていて、とても居心地良かったです。

ウェイターもこまめに気をかけてくれるし、にこやかだし、素敵な接客でした。

ステーキは柔らかく、それ以外もスタンダードな味付けの中にもレベルの高さを感じました。(意外性のある味付けとかはないけれど、どれもレベル高く美味しい)

安定感のあるステーキハウスとして今後も重用しそうです。

Customer 357.Name: LosMachucAs
Customer 357.Content: This was our second trip to Seattle and Metropolitan Grill was exactly what I wanted for my Birthday! The staff is always so courteous and helpful. They always make sure our experience is the best! And the food...perfection. Please do not let the pricing turn you away. It is worth every penny! I fully intend on making Metropolitan Grill a must on every Seattle trip. A great steak, a great bottle of wine and marvelous atmosphere for dining with loved ones and friends.

Customer 358.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 358.Content: Not their best showing. Sorry the service quality isn’t what it used to be.

Customer 359.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 359.Content:
Ohmi filet
New York peppercorns steak

Customer 360.Name: Enjoyable
Customer 360.Content: The service was excellent, setting was lovely, food was good,  a good value.

Customer 361.Name: Fentafool
Customer 361.Content: Way overpriced for average food at best. This place is no longer an iconic Seattle restaurant but a worn out has been.

Customer 362.Name: Kaleandbeetsreg
Customer 362.Content: Awesome night great food staff was very good especially the server’s assistant. Loved his personality and great humor.

Customer 363.Name: KateyZ
Customer 363.Content: One of the best restaurants I've ever eaten in. Everything was top notch. Truly exceptional.

Customer 364.Name: SleepyinSeattle
Customer 364.Content: Best steak in the House is the chateaubriand for two carved table side.  If you think it pricey, save up for it and GO, it’s worth it.  Service was comfortable & friendly as always, ambiance noisy but restrained — The Met is a busy and popular place, deservedly so.

Customer 365.Name: AndrewK
Customer 365.Content: 3 out of the 4 steaks were extremely salty. To their credit they asked if we wanted them to do something about it, albeit in a way that made us feel bad about mentioning it. Got a bottle of wine with the meal that was blindly chosen by the somm after asking about our budget and not much else. We found out later that the bottle was at the absolute limit of our budget and wasn't really that enjoyable

Customer 366.Name: Happy
Customer 366.Content: Our deuce was right next to the kitchen and was very noisy.   Took a long time to get our food

Customer 367.Name: CaitlinE
Customer 367.Content: The food and drinks were delicious as usual. I had requested beforehand that our server bring out a surprise piece of their amazing carrot cake for my boyfriends birthday, and his timing was impeccable!

Customer 368.Name: Kurt
Customer 368.Content: This place is legendary. Amazing experience and worth every cent. Waitstaff is exceptional along with the food.

Customer 369.Name: NYCfoodie
Customer 369.Content:
Very average food and way overpriced.  I definitely wouldn’t recommend it unless you want to waste your
Money

Customer 371.Name: Alupigus
Customer 371.Content:
Overrated and overpriced
Gastronomic culture from 100y ago
Demands 2% surchatge on the menue for employers mandats and then makes it 3% on the check!
Congrats!
For the ordered Filet mignon just see attached picture!
The Schöfferhofer Hefeweizen was served in a softdrink glass - what a culture!
For a few hundred bucks thanks, but no thanks!
What a joke!

Customer 372.Name: HollyS
Customer 372.Content: Our evening started out fine, cocktails from the bar were quite good. We had to keep reminding our server we wanted to order a bottle of wine with dinner and our steaks arrived before our wine was ordered. The experience went on a downward spiral when a large party was seated directly behind us. While they were quite loud and boisterous, we did not fault them their fun. The server, however, had to "scoot" between the back of my chair and the back of the chair of one of their party. She chose to use my chair as leverage to squeeze between multiple times. A portable table was set up next to our table effectively narrowing the aisle so that servers were squeezing between it and our table. It was so uncomfortable I finally just asked for the bill so we could leave! Really not the service we were expecting from The Met.

Customer 373.Name: SkipB
Customer 373.Content: Food and beverages are top-notch at Metropolitan Grill.  Service is excellent as well.  Unfortunately, though, this has become one of many restaurants in which the  noise level is so high that it is very difficult to have a conversation across the table or even to hear the waiter.  The noisy environment motivates diners in groups to become louder still in order to be heard at larger tables.  Couples sitting across a table from one another can either shout at one another, give up on conversation, or dine elsewhere.

Customer 374.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 374.Content:
I had Filet Mignon, my steak of choice wherever I go. I had them prepare us medium rare as I don’t want it over cooked. Despite the sharp steak knife, the steak was tough; like low end restaurant tough. For $78 / 13oz, it needed to be the best steak I’ve ever had. Yes, Seattle is a seafood town, but that’s no excuse at these prices. I’m from Denver and the steak melts like butter, and is at least $20 cheaper.

Service was just ok, our server seemed eternally more interested in flying by and quickly deviating by saying “let me just attend to this or that and I’ll be right back” (but didn’t come back for at least 10 minutes or so). He also never offered us any dessert.

I would not recommend this restaurant, unless you want to pay high prices for mediocre food. The environment is lovely and cozy, hence the three stars.

Customer 375.Name: AlejandroB
Customer 375.Content: wonderful food great service great ambience

Customer 376.Name: Pete
Customer 376.Content: Steaks were cooked to perfection and service was excellent.

Customer 377.Name: MIch
Customer 377.Content: I have written many reviews on Met Grill as we go at least once a year.  We always have amazing service and food and the wine it amazing.

Customer 378.Name: Elizabeth
Customer 378.Content:
The Met was one of the first restaurants that my now husband took me to when we started dating 5 years ago, so it holds a special place in my heart, and it was a lot of fun to come back to celebrate my birthday there. We each had a bowl of soup (clam chowder for him and French onion for me!), then shared the Chateaubriand, and the apple "pie" for dessert. Everything was amazing, about the experience from the time we arrived (about 30 minutes prior to our 7:30pm reservation, but they were able to accommodate immediate seating) until the time we walked out the door. I highly suggest ordering anything prepared tableside, as you'll get to have a great conversation as your food is being prepared. Our server, Lance, was prompt and professional and the combined team created an exceptional experience. 

While I gave The Met 4 stars for "Value", you don't really go there for a "value" meal - you go there for the experience that only fine dining gives you.

Customer 379.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 379.Content: 100% coming back. The 9 layer chocolate cake and prime rib combo I pulled together was over the top!

Customer 380.Name: MarkM
Customer 380.Content: This continues to be an Awesome restaurant. The food, wine and service is excellent. I highly recommend it. Jim our waiter did an excellent job!

Customer 381.Name: JimR
Customer 381.Content: Always terrific and I think the best steak house in the country. Stacks up well against Capital Grill, Flemings, Mortons, and Lawry’s

Customer 382.Name: Stardestroyer
Customer 382.Content: A top notch experience every time! The service is always very professional and can read your table pretty well. Our server had excellent suggestions and did a great job describing the differences between the Japanese beef selections. I ordered the Hokkaido snow beef and it was without a doubt the best filet I've ever had. The asparagus on the side was lovely, too. We drank a lot, in addition to ordering the expensive steaks, so our bill was high ($800+ for four), but worth every penny.  Thank you for making a last minute dinner on a Wednesday evening such a wonderful time!

Customer 383.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 383.Content: All the time! It is hands down my favorite restaurant!

Customer 384.Name: Craig
Customer 384.Content: Service good .. food warm at best .. on past visits service excellent and food superb and hot .. no longer my fav restaurant in Seattle

Customer 385.Name: Aaron
Customer 385.Content: Excellent all the way around. Noise level was a little high but exactly what we expected after Seahawks game.

Customer 386.Name: msbobh
Customer 386.Content: The met is my go to restaurant for Steak, always good and consistent. I have never had "bad" experience. However this last time there were a couple of issues that need to be highlighted. We were a party of 5 and ordered 5 different steaks,  I tasted them all and they were all excellent,45 day rib-eye, Waygu-Angus NY, NY and Filet, no complaints on the steaks or their preparation. The same can't be said for the sides. The garlic mashed potatoes were super dry and cakey, I don't recall them being like this in the past. Also the cauliflower side was mediocre, the preparation with almonds and feta is promising but the execution was off, the florets could have been better caramelized to add to the complexity of the dish. It also seemed like something was missing to bring it all together. The Brussels sprouts were also disappointing, again the preparation held promise but the execution lacked. I recall some roasted caramelized sprouts that i had a scout restaurant several years ago. They were simply amazing, like vegetable candy, so i know the lowly Brussels sprout can achieve greatness. That is what i would expect from a restaurant of the Met's caliber. The met prepares truly memorable steaks but the need to up their game on the sides. Also it is a bit noisy for my taste, call it energetic if you will but it makes conversation difficult.

Customer 388.Name: reidsworld
Customer 388.Content: Great place but my wife steak undercooked, the sommelier was a snob and curt and overall not that great for the amount of money we spent.  The server we had was outstanding.

Customer 389.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 389.Content: Incredible cuts of meat cooked to perfection. The staff is very friendly and made dining with them into an unforgettable experience.

Customer 391.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 391.Content: Server and service was amazing. Noi??? Not sure of spelling.  Gentlemen from Thailand. Amazing service. Food was flawless. Will request to sit in his section always. Hope that was his name!

Customer 393.Name: DanS
Customer 393.Content: We've been to the Met multiple times over the past 15 years, but this trip was exceptional.  The food, our waiter (Scott), the beverages - everything was terrific.  Going to be another 6 months before we'll get back to Seattle, but we never go with out a trip to the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 394.Name: JimB
Customer 394.Content: Our second visit. Our waitstaff, Chad, was a delight. Catema Merlot was excellent and very reasonably priced. Sour dough bread, House Salad, Caesar salad, filet mignon, rib eye—all delicious.  Valet parking guys also very nice.

Customer 396.Name: Renae
Customer 396.Content: This place is a must every time I stay in the city... the Dungeoness Crab Cocktail is delectable and worth every penny! I am never disappointed with the food and the service is impeccable.  Love that we can dress up or down and still fit right in - top notch from the minute you walk in the door.

Customer 397.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 397.Content: I come here a few times a year and it seems to be on the decline.  Steaks are great rest so so.

Customer 399.Name: finedining
Customer 399.Content: I had the Snow Beef, which is the most expensive steak around.  It was without a doubt the best piece of meat I’ve had in my life and worth every cent!

Customer 400.Name: JT19
Customer 400.Content: Always a great time! Great food, great wine, amazing service!

Customer 401.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 401.Content: Food is fine. Service is excellent but all in all I think overpriced for the experience.

Customer 402.Name: DrRichardG
Customer 402.Content:
This restaurant was absolutely OUTSTANDING. The service, the food and the ambiance was remarkable.
Not inexpensive but worth every dollar. Highly recommend it for A DINING EXPERIENCE.

Customer 403.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 403.Content: Food was too salty and the Brussels spouts under cooked.

Customer 404.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 404.Content: I have had better steaks for similar money.  Seafood was good, but not as good as other local restaurants. It was a nice place but not the greatest value.

Customer 405.Name: constancec
Customer 405.Content: Very loud. Crazy patron ruined our night. Food quality was not as outstanding as before. Prices higher than before. $70 for a add on lobster tail after ordering a $70 steak. King Crab legs were weak and spindly seemed like snow crab vs king crab. Sad.

Customer 406.Name: jennifern
Customer 406.Content: Love this restaurant. Service is so thoughtful. Everyone makes sure this is a real dining experience. So worth it. The food is fabulous.

Customer 407.Name: smbmax
Customer 407.Content: The food as always was fabulous.   I also enjoyed the lower prices on the lunch menu.  Key lime tart was a great way the end our meal.

Customer 408.Name: LeslieBD
Customer 408.Content: This is the favorite old time steak house for Seattle.  We were disappointed with the seasoning on our steaks.  It was way too salty.  Our steaks were also quite gristly.  Hope if we get a chance to come again we will have a different experience.  Our service was fabulous!!!!!

Customer 410.Name: MarkS
Customer 410.Content: We got a small table by the kitchen....not good. Food and service was great. Don’t get the calamari...soggy

Customer 411.Name: Noongster
Customer 411.Content: We had our sons 34th birthday party. Everything was excellent from the hostess to our favorite waiter Noi. If I could change anything, it would be sitting in the middle of the floor.

Customer 412.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 412.Content: Been to The Met many times. First time I’ve said, food was just “ok”. Steak was good, scallop potatoes were warm, not hot, and wild mushrooms were...ok. Great friendly service, dessert was amazing (Carrott Cake). Drinks above average. Overall, a B+

Customer 414.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 414.Content: It was as expected except for wagyu strip. Probably one on the worst cuts of meat I have had in a while.

Customer 415.Name: CharlesE
Customer 415.Content: Have been there before and thoroughly enjoyed it, but this time was disappointing

Customer 416.Name: EricD
Customer 416.Content: This restaurant is fantastic and our server Todd was the best and most dedicated I’ve ever had. This is a must visit!

Customer 417.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 417.Content: The Met always delivers.  When you’re there you feel like royalty. You can’t beat the food and the service is both utterly professional and welcoming at the same time. Our server, Tyler, was fantastic. Our Server Assistant, who’s name I didn’t catch, was also right on point. A great lunch with my wife and her parents.

Customer 418.Name: geoffreym
Customer 418.Content:
We were having a reunion dinner with a niece and nephew and they were wanting to eat here
The experience was somewhat underwhelming 
Service was kind of hit or miss and we felt passed over all night
The Steaks were a bit salt forward and the Porterhouse was more like a T-bone  and not a great char like the loin cap and the wagyu filet others had
Sides were ok just did not really pop
We shared a piece of 9 layer cake  bit dry and icing too sweet
Not sure if we will return

Customer 419.Name: JodyB
Customer 419.Content:
The service and food were amazing! 
Had a wonderful time.

Customer 420.Name: Barbara
Customer 420.Content: I made a special request in my reservation, and the staff honored the request without question!  I had low expectations that the request would be even noticed.  Service cannot get much better than that!

Customer 421.Name: Richard
Customer 421.Content: I used to love to go to the Metropolitan Grill.  It had been a few years since I had been there and this time I took important clientele with me. I shared how wonderful my past dining experiences had been and stated that this was my favorite place to eat in the United States.  I enjoyed going there because of the ambiance, the level of attire, the wait staff, and the food. This time they were letting in people in shorts and t-shirts and sandals and the noise level was extremely high. The food was good but certainly not worth the amount of money that I paid for it. I was so disappointed and embarrassed after extolling the positive attributes of this restaurant to my clients.  It is doubtful that I will ever take anyone there again.

Customer 422.Name: JasonF
Customer 422.Content: Great place for lunch.  Good service and great food.

Customer 423.Name: Gardenofhope
Customer 423.Content: Our second experience at the Metropolitan Grill, as wonderful and consistently excellent as the first several years back. One of the best steakhouses in the country!

Customer 424.Name: ChrisyM
Customer 424.Content: Stellar service as usual. Food was fabulous. Great evening to enjoy for a date night

Customer 425.Name: Nardo
Customer 425.Content: We had the Chateaubriand.  Very well prepared, and cut right at the table!!   Wonderful meal from the premier steakhouse in Seattle!!

Customer 426.Name: BrandonD
Customer 426.Content: Service is amazing it’s a Seattle vibe that doesn’t make you feel stuffy or uncomfortable. Attire from shorts and t-shirts to full up business suits all treated the same. Steaks are great, I’d say top 5 In the area and drinks are worth the money. Had a great time

Customer 427.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 427.Content: Could not have been any better

Customer 428.Name: MWin95003
Customer 428.Content: 2nd time here. Portions are big so plan for leftovers. Great service and food. Not pushy.

Customer 429.Name: TravisO
Customer 429.Content: Our 29th wedding anniversary dinner could not have been any better! Service was excellent! Food was also excellent - we split the long bone ribeye.  Treat yourself to The Met when in Seattle!

Customer 430.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 430.Content: Everything was great except for our waiter. He was knowledgeable enough and cordial but he disappeared for long periods of time. We had to wait over 25 minutes after we were finished before he remembered to return and ask if we were ready for our check.

Customer 431.Name: DSWU
Customer 431.Content: Too much dressing on the spinach salad.  Not tasty at all.  The steaks were barely warm, the potatoes were cold and the steak quality for the price was very poor.  We were very disappointed.  The server was great and the creme brûlée was very good.

Customer 432.Name: LiLi2024
Customer 432.Content: It was not our first time at the restaurant.  We go there to celebrate special occasions.  This time it was very disappointing starting with the service and continuing with the food.  We will not be back!

Customer 433.Name: KateK
Customer 433.Content: No disappointments and especially good service.

Customer 434.Name: JamesB
Customer 434.Content:
Most extensive wine list I’ve ever seen and sommelier knew his stuff. 
Outstanding selections for steaks, they have something for everyone (big appetite or small)

Customer 435.Name: MichaelM
Customer 435.Content: Steaks were as good as they get. Service was very good.

Customer 436.Name: toddpay
Customer 436.Content: Great atmosphere!  Bartender Ryan was professional and friendly. Waiter Bruno did a great job. Excellent personality, very professional. This is his calling. Food is great, wine list is exhaustive.

Customer 437.Name: CherylP
Customer 437.Content: A disappointing visit. Steak was average, baked potato room temperature, and very expensive compared with other top steakhouses. Will not be returning.

Customer 438.Name: ChuckT
Customer 438.Content: Great food as always, bit it seemed a bit noisier than usual. Might have been the table location.

Customer 439.Name: KenT
Customer 439.Content: Great Food ! Got seated right away and service was fantastic. Onion rings to die for as a great starter. Rack of Lamb was top shelf and cooked perfectly.. A bit pricey but it’s the best.

Customer 440.Name: Lunjj
Customer 440.Content: Dohui provided exceptional service. Great personality and fun. Food was great too. Loved the French onion soup and the snow and ohmi steaks were amazing!

Customer 441.Name: Vici
Customer 441.Content:
As always, the food was great
- we had the King Salmon.  The service was great if a little slow. Been going to The Met for years and have never been disappointed!

Customer 443.Name: DanielK
Customer 443.Content: This is our favorite restaurant in the Pacific Northwest and we always have a wonderful time. Great for special occasions and a chill bar for drinks as well. Amazing service.

Customer 444.Name: JamesC
Customer 444.Content: My wife and I ate at the Metropolitan Grill about 20 years ago and thoroughly enjoy it.  However visiting their this past week we were thoroughly disappointed.  The food was so-so and the cost was extremely high.  We'll never go back.

Customer 445.Name: RyanJ
Customer 445.Content: Celebrated a birthday dinner that was fantastic. Our server, Todd, was fantastic and took great care of us. We ordered appetizers, food and desert and everything was cooked and baked to perfection. I can't wait to come back for more visits.

Customer 446.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 446.Content: Best steak house in Seattle! wide range selections of steaks in traditional American way. They also have the best fine wine selections and services. Don’t leave Seattle without dinning here if you’re steak lover!

Customer 447.Name: JohnS
Customer 447.Content: Anniversary dinner so we split the “long bone” ribeye, which was cooked perfectly and both tender and flavorful.

Customer 451.Name: Nick
Customer 451.Content: First visit to the restaurant and loved it. It was the epitome of a steakhouse, dark wood walls, white table clothes, wait staff in white jackets and ties. The service was spot on and the steak was fantastic! We will return the next time we are in Seattle.

Customer 452.Name: JamesH
Customer 452.Content: Brilliant experience. The setting, the service, and the cuisine was outstanding.

Customer 453.Name: MarkT
Customer 453.Content:
Happy Birthday!  My Wife and a couple of friends (twins) celebrated their close together Birthday's.  I've been a regular at the Met for many years.  Jim Falls is my go to guy.  Jim took spectacular care of all our needs.  The food is as always...prepared and served perfectly.  Everyone had a wonderful time.
We got a 28 oz Lobster to share as we began.  We had the Chateaubriand while our friends had the 12 oz Prime Rib and 35 Day Aged Cap Top Steak.  Jim was ever the best of best and presented my Wife and friends with polite Birthday desserts.  As no meal is ever complete without a show, the Hot Apple Pie finds room if any was available to be completely satisfied.  I've head that steak houses are available East of the Met.  If I'm ever going to head East for a Steak, I'll just go to Chicago!

Customer 454.Name: Bentley
Customer 454.Content: We love this Resturant !  It is a special place from time gone by!  The food is wonderful, but the prices are high!  You do get what you pay for😋

Customer 456.Name: BRIAN
Customer 456.Content: Great food, great service, great place to be!  And great leftovers for late night at home!

Customer 457.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 457.Content:
Every plate of food we ordered was just the best. Definitely try the bananas fosters - a bit of tables use fire and a whole lot of ice cream and fun.

While making the reservation here and when later MG mailed me to confirm reservations they ask you about the occasion. We were celebrating my husband's birthday. So I was expecting a warm greeting or a note at the table. But I didn't see anything. Was slightly disappointed but not something that would drop my ratings for the place.

Customer 458.Name: FFTG
Customer 458.Content: Great waiter, ambiance, staff attitude, great cuts available and great time. We just had arrived from Miami and felt at home, thank u guys we enjoyed it!!

Customer 459.Name: GoGoGirl
Customer 459.Content: Always a tasty food and great experience. The Manhattan was strong, but very tasty. The only drawback, the waitress messed up our take home leftovers. I got all the steak and my my baker was thrown out! Why would I eat someone else’s leftover?!?

Customer 460.Name: reginag
Customer 460.Content:
The halibut was outstanding and My guest  thought his steak salad was extraordinarily good.

Our server was friendly knowledgeable and attentive

Thanks 
Regina Glenn

Customer 461.Name: Yakivegas
Customer 461.Content: 3rd visit here, another great experience. Wonderful food, attentive and friendly service.

Customer 462.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 462.Content:
We lived the restaurant our sever Bruno and our Sommelier who chose a great Washington State Bordeaux style blend to pair with our steak. The meat we ordered came out very sinewy and stringy. It was just a bad piece of meat. Our server immediately has a new piece of meat prepared that was much better. The restaurant made up for it by comping our desert.
All in all I would return for a very good experience, but we have had much better meat at other establishments.

Customer 463.Name: TimR
Customer 463.Content: Always great food and service at The Metropolitan Grill. You're never disappointed.

Customer 465.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 465.Content: I took my customers here for dinner. We were all visiting from out of town and were blown away by the service, the food, and the atmosphere!

Customer 466.Name: SeaTacGuy
Customer 466.Content: Enjoyed an excellent Copper River salmon, crab cakes appetizer was very good as well.  And the service from Juergen is always superb.

Customer 467.Name: ChaunG
Customer 467.Content: Dinner was great.  Ricky, our bus boy, was a very refreshing addition to the evening.  He was friendly and genuinely interested in making our evening a delight.

Customer 468.Name: WFDen
Customer 468.Content: The facility is nice an ambience is good.  I have been going here for over 20 years and have finally realized the price point has out paced the experience and value. Disappointing but just is what it is.

Customer 469.Name: SydneyInSeattle
Customer 469.Content: The food was good and the service was great. Our server was lovely and very helpful.

Customer 470.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 470.Content: Best steak I’ve ever eaten...pure deliciousness!  Our waitress Dohi was amazing, very knowledgeable and funny!

Customer 471.Name: DawnD
Customer 471.Content: Excellent customer service and food and drinks were delicious.

Customer 472.Name: Jin1
Customer 472.Content: You will have a chance to taste one of the best steak in your life.

Customer 473.Name: samB
Customer 473.Content: MAKE A RESERVATION if you plan on getting a table but we sat at the bar for 30 mins waiting for our table even though we made a reservation is the ONLY complaint I have. We had the prawn cocktail and artichoke hearts for appetizer and for dinner lamb for two my husband got a loaded potato and I got mashed, we also got the Dungeness crab and prawn fettuccine that NEVER disappoints Even after almost ten years of it on the menu will definitely be joining again

Customer 474.Name: Brystock
Customer 474.Content: Our nephew was visiting, so my husband and I wanted him to experience an amazing dinner at The Met.  The evening was delightful from beginning to end.  Jim's service was stellar and the food was, as always, perfectly prepared and delicious.  We are already looking forward to our next special event at The Met.

Customer 476.Name: VickiC
Customer 476.Content: Celebrating our 3 kids birthday dinners. Great night.

Customer 477.Name: LisaS
Customer 477.Content: Great food and service, always a great dining experience!

Customer 478.Name: MikeB
Customer 478.Content: Profound service and wonderful food. You do pay for what you get ... place is pricey, however the food, combined with service, is most definitely worth it!

Customer 479.Name: Pete
Customer 479.Content: Overall, the Met would always be my first choice; but that surcharge related to minimum wages really sticks in my craw. Although it was a small portion of the bill, I don't think I will be back until it is gone.

Customer 480.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 480.Content: The best stake I have ever eaten. The staff was great and worked hard to accommodate multiple allergies. If I’m back in Seattle I’ll be back agin

Customer 481.Name: vicci
Customer 481.Content: The food was great but the service was simply sensational. Bruno waited on us and he made our evening just delightful. Thank you metropolitan grill for a wonderful evening!

Customer 482.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 482.Content:
Steve was AWESOME!!!!!!
I’ll be back, sooner than later!

Customer 483.Name: Jess
Customer 483.Content: Amazing steaks and service! We were surprised with a delicious creme brûlée for our anniversary! They also offer table side cooked bananas foster and cherries jubilee (not on the menu but they can do it).

Customer 484.Name: DanKar
Customer 484.Content: The celebratory lunch was dampened by the noticeable lack of the normal good service. Our wait person never came by once our food was served...were not able to order additional drinks; did not ask how the food was; failed to bring out the pre-ordered dessert. We waited 10 mins after finishing entrée and then had to cancel the dessert as we ran out of time.

Customer 486.Name: NilsN
Customer 486.Content: This steak house has definitely gone down in quality. Prices hi but not providing the kind of service and food quality you would expect. Go somewhere else...

Customer 487.Name: AlRIII
Customer 487.Content: The Metropolitan Grill never seems to fail always great service always great food did not disappoint

Customer 489.Name: Princess
Customer 489.Content: Everything about this restaurant is great

Customer 490.Name: Blythe
Customer 490.Content: Our server, Nick, was friendly and down to earth but extremely knowledgeable. He was rad. Steaks were very flavorful but not over seasoned. The mac n cheese could have used salt but the sauce was hella cheesy and not grainy like some other Steakhouses.  Loved the classic Steakhouse ambiance.  EAT HERE. You won't be sorry.

Customer 491.Name: Bman
Customer 491.Content: Everyone was awesome. The Banamanger, the manager of bananas foster, was exceptional

Customer 492.Name: Tony
Customer 492.Content: Great steaks!  Knowledgeable and attentive staff.  Huge coconut cake for dessert.  Very enjoyable meal.  We shall return.

Customer 493.Name: Foodies
Customer 493.Content: Great food and service had a great time with the sommelier this is a traditional steakhouse. You can’t go wrong.

Customer 494.Name: rastas
Customer 494.Content: This place is superb, the customer service is pretty good but the food is something out of the ordinary, you of course pay the price for it but if you love meat you won't regret spending some money for a special occasion

Customer 495.Name: Willis
Customer 495.Content: A Seattle favorite that has yet to disappoint. Expensive but worth it for a special night out!

Customer 496.Name: AnnP
Customer 496.Content: Wonderful dinner at The Met, always delicious.

Customer 497.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 497.Content: Our server was not present, and we were put at an added table at the bottom of the stairs.

Customer 498.Name: AnniversaryDinner
Customer 498.Content: I wish I was rich and could eat here all the time! We only were able to come because we had received a giftcard. It was A-MAZING! The steak was so tender you could cut it with just the side of your fork! I unfortunately can't afford to go more often, otherwise I definitely would!

Customer 499.Name: SanDiegoResident
Customer 499.Content: The people sitting at an adjoining table said they came to The Metropolitan Grill every anniversary, and this was their 10th visit in a row.  This is a place for special occasions or a special meal.  Food is outstanding, service is impeccable and although this restaurant is not cheap, it is worth what you pay.  And, the restaurant does not make you feel like you are slighted.  Without even a comment, the waiter comped the coffee because there were too many grinds; something had gone wrong.

Customer 500.Name: DandyC
Customer 500.Content: We came based on the recommendation of a friend. All we were told was to go and the rest was history. Overall such a great experience, from walking in to being seated, to the ambience and the first class treatment OH and the food!! 👌🏽👌🏽

Customer 501.Name: Irony
Customer 501.Content:
We had come to celebrate three consecutive birthdays. We got a warm and friendly welcome that started the evening in a very pleasant way. We then got help on selecting appetizers, entrees, and wine. During the entire meal the staff was very polite, gave us our space, was attended to our needs and progress throughout the meal itself. At the end we got, without requesting, three small deserts that were just the right size for us to complete a very pleasant evening.
We do definitely recommend this restaurant for any festive occasion. We are sure you will enjoy as much as we did.

Customer 502.Name: Shulie
Customer 502.Content: This was a luncheon where typically the portions are smaller ,  there typically is a luncheon menu and luncheon specials.  This was all true.  But a copper river salmon dish was verbally mentioned along with  written specials. However, the portion was not smaller but very small and the price was outrageous.  Almost as tasty as that available at a nearby  very good seafood restaurant the day before - but  two and a half times the cost and 1/2 size the portion.

Customer 503.Name: RyanJ
Customer 503.Content: Fantastic service and amazing food. It's the absolute best place to go.

Customer 504.Name: mjr2377
Customer 504.Content: Great bourbon selection, seafood platter was outstanding and the ribeye was superb. I highly recommend this place.

Customer 505.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 505.Content:
Reservation was cancelled by the system stating I missed my reservation . The email was sent at 1:00 for a 6:00 reservation the same day . 
We rescheduled for the next day . 
Open table or Metropolitan issue ?

Customer 506.Name: havingfun2
Customer 506.Content: Excellent food and service. We sat in the back area which is quieter and recommended. Would return again for a special occasion

Customer 507.Name: JohnO
Customer 507.Content: My son and I celebrate his birthday each year trying a variety of steak restaurants. As we told our server, MG is the best overall experience we've enjoyed. The bar is superb, and except for a couple faux pas with sides, the meat measured up to our expectations. Classic ambiance and low noise level allowed us to share a lot of good conversation. Highly recommended.

Customer 508.Name: winelover98
Customer 508.Content: We love going to the Met!  We had Michael as our server and he was amazing!

Customer 509.Name: Spokane1
Customer 509.Content: Still the best steakhouse in Seattle and one of the best in the country

Customer 510.Name: sr2078
Customer 510.Content: Best meal I have ever had hands down!!!

Customer 511.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 511.Content: We had amazing dinner with the carmel bacon appetizer and table side carving of the 40oz long bone rib eye.  The rib eye was cooked to perfection and tasted better then I could have imagined.  All the staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the food and drinks.  Although it was on the pricey side, it was worth every penny.

Customer 512.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 512.Content: Wished we could of got a booth instead of sitting below in the lower dining area. Server was awesome!!!

Customer 514.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 514.Content: It was our anniversary! Delicious food, cozy booth. It was great!

Customer 515.Name: GretchenS
Customer 515.Content: Great service and food.  Our waiter was very helpful and engaging.

Customer 517.Name: Islandhoppers
Customer 517.Content: Going to the Metropolitan Grill is consistently a memorable experience.  The food & service are always top of the line!  We were seated in the back area to the right of the bar.  It is a quieter back there and we appreciate that.  We were celebrating an anniversary and they provided a complimentary dessert that we enjoyed. The MET is our "go to" spot when entertaining guests or for a special occasion.

Customer 520.Name: Redd
Customer 520.Content:
Seems like a great old Seattle girl.
We started with the scallops which were mediocre, however the beef and the service were very good.
Oh, and they had our cocktail down perfectly!

Customer 521.Name: JenD
Customer 521.Content:
What a fun place to visit and experience! The cocktails were out of this world amazing and so was the steak. Come prepared to spend a fair amount of money (Doubtful you could walk away spending less than $150 per person) but it's a wonderful treat.

The steak truly melted in my mouth - I was in heaven. I had never had steak tartar but it was bursting with flavor. I can't wait to have it again! 

The ambiance was perfect - swank 1920s feeling. Service was great, our needs more than met.

Customer 522.Name: Scotts
Customer 522.Content: as good a steakhouse as any in america !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Customer 523.Name: RyanC
Customer 523.Content: best food i've ever had thannk you for every thing

Customer 525.Name: Sparky
Customer 525.Content: Our server, Tim, is the best!  We live out of state and come to the Met a handful of times a year - he remembers us and gives us the best service!  Thanks Tim!

Customer 526.Name: ChesterJay
Customer 526.Content: Service was amazing. Server (wish I got his name) knew everything off the menu without a notebook to write on. he knew the sides, drink menu, and also surprised my girlfriend and I with a creme’ brûlée to celebrate our anniversary :) would totally come back to dinner here for a special occasion.

Customer 527.Name: NancyM
Customer 527.Content: I was expecting an extraordinary dining experience. It was not. It was less than expected by a large margin. The noise level was the first disappointment. It was too loud. The service was adequate with just a bit of a longer wait than I would have wanted. The food was good but nothing exceptional. I was especially disappointed in the house cabernet.

Customer 528.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 528.Content: Service was exceptional. The server had a back up server.  I thought that was cool.

Customer 529.Name: VictoriaP
Customer 529.Content: Excellent service, presentation, and suggestions for our meal. We made a last minute reservation and they were easy to accommodate. I wrote easily go back here if I was closer.

Customer 530.Name: Spikemobile
Customer 530.Content: A  simple, but outstanding, lettuce salad with a remarkably good, creamy dressing, started our meal on a high note, preceded by a good Manhattan. Our shared T bone was very well cooked and expertly divided  between us at table  by a waiter who clearly knew his craft. Side dishes very satisfying, with the creamed spinach particularly noteworthy. We felt we had had slightly better marbled and flavorful aged, prime steaks from our butcher, and wished, since this is not a cheap evening, that perhaps we had gone for an even more expensive cut, but it was still above average. Sommelier gave us excellent advice on a great Italian wine form the lengthy, wine list, well within our preferred price range. Desert was shared: a well-made flourless, chocolate concoction.  All in all, a very good meal and dining experience.

Customer 531.Name: JeSa
Customer 531.Content: I'd never been to the Met - my husband chose it for Mother's Day and my Law School graduation, which happened to be the same day.  Three months prior, I made reservations for 6 people at 6:00 pm, and noted the celebrations on my table.  When we arrived, we were escorted to a table for 10.  Only 5 of us were able to actually attend - one had a last-minute cancellation - so, we ended up being 5 people at a banquet round for 10.  We spent the two hours there, not able to hear what anyone else at the table was saying (that was just the accoustics, nothing to do with the baby which screamed next to our table for 3/4 of our time at the Met - that was just unlucky).  The food was quite good.  The service was good until the entrees arrived, at which point our server, and all other staff, forgot we existed.  My husband really talked up the Met, as have many others, so it was very disappointing to have this experience for such a meaningful celebratory event.

Customer 532.Name: AndyB
Customer 532.Content: Simply the best. I have tried every Steak House around and I always say the Met is the best for service, ambience and great food. Aaron was a great server.

Customer 533.Name: KA1974
Customer 533.Content: Food was excellent and our server was attentive and really fantastic!

Customer 534.Name: TeriH
Customer 534.Content: A little noisy when full so I like to go early and enjoy a fabulous meal whenever I stay in Seattle while traveling.

Customer 535.Name: DiverJoe
Customer 535.Content: Met all my expectations in every category. Like it says on the menu, "This is the best steak available". And you can't beat the service or atmosphere.

Customer 536.Name: Mauirob
Customer 536.Content: My go to place for great steaks and wine. Excellent seafood alternatives too. Latest was a good my lunch with my USMC Lt son.

Customer 537.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 537.Content: Steak was very good as always but the Coconut cake was overpowering and not a good match for my taste. Also surprisingly my Martini was not to my taste either with way too much Vermont.

Customer 538.Name: KimP
Customer 538.Content: We had a wonderful time here, a big part of that because of our amazing waiter, Victor. He made the experience for us and any time I return I will make a point to ask to sit in his section. There are many places one can get good food, but not many where the entire experience is worth the trip. Coming here, with the old school ambiance, excellent food and interacting with Victor makes the Metropolitan Grill worth the trip.

Customer 539.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 539.Content: Food and service were both outstanding. Thank you so much

Customer 540.Name: RobertB
Customer 540.Content: Fantastic service and great food.  Professional staff and quiet ambience.

Customer 541.Name: ThomasC
Customer 541.Content:
It was my B-day on Saturday the 4th and I invited 8 friends to join me @ the Met to sit in the Bar and have dinner. The server in the Bar had to many tables and I know from my resturant experience working in fine dining that we should have had our dedicated server or managment should have had his back. It was a long time for our between visits (only b/c he had to many tables) for drinks and for our dinner order to be taken. One of dinner was ice cold and I asked for horse radish on 2 occasions 1st time with the seafood sampler and the 2nd time with my prime rib dinner only never to make it to the table.
I love your resturant and was truly dissapointed in the entire experience. Thank you 

Tom Campi

Customer 542.Name: LisaL
Customer 542.Content: This was our first time in Seattle and at this restaurant,  what a great experience,  the food was delicious, the cocktails were perfect and the staff were very attentive and kind. Our sever Ashley was very informative and an absolute gem! We had such a great experience and can't wait to go back!!

Customer 543.Name: DavidH
Customer 543.Content: Overall it was a great experience. I had received a $250 gift card to MG for my birthday and my wife and I decided to make a trip into Seattle for a special dinner. We had predetermined that we wanted to try the chateaubriand, substituting creamed spinach and Yukon Gold potato cakes as sides. Our waiter, Bruno, who was outstanding,  suggested the almond-crusted scallops as an appetizer. The scallops were the best we've ever tasted, and the chateaubriand, carved tableside, was memorable. The sides were just OK. The ambiance was friendly and fairly elegant, and the noise level, though not whisper-quiet, was fine for normal conversation. I had two glasses of The Devil You Don't Know syrah (also Bruno's suggestion) and my wife had one. We shared the Hot Apple Pie for dessert. We hadn't paid close attention to the prices, so we were a little surprised that the $250 didn't quite cover the meal and gratuity, but we'll definitely return for a special meal in the near future.

Customer 544.Name: GinaS
Customer 544.Content: The food was absolutely amazing. Steak melts in your mouth! Wish the costs were a little lower, but so worth it!

Customer 545.Name: SherriP
Customer 545.Content: Wonderful dining experience.  Impressive choice of beef cuts - the Cap Top is amazing.  Accompaniments quite good as well, with old favorites and creative choices.  One of the best places I know for a properly-made cocktail.  Restaurant has a legacy feel to it, yet in a comfortably-modern way.  Service as good as I've ever experienced.

Customer 546.Name: MarcoL
Customer 546.Content: I’ve been to The Met a number of times, and the service and quality is always top notch! Always our go-to for a nice date night!

Customer 547.Name: antoniol
Customer 547.Content: been at the Met many times ( since 2005). However the filet Mignon was not a true cut of meat. It was chewy. I was disappointed but I chose not to say anything. Will try again next month.

Customer 548.Name: RebeccaH
Customer 548.Content: Kimberley was an absolutely delightful server! We had an amazing meal, with even better service, and will definitely be back for special occasions for years to come!

Customer 549.Name: PatriciaW
Customer 549.Content: We enjoyed our seating arrangement.  Our servers were friendly, prompt and attentive.  The food was excellent!

Customer 550.Name: JonaG
Customer 550.Content: Perfect place for romantic fancy dinner! Will definitely going back and will recommend!

Customer 551.Name: RICKL
Customer 551.Content:
Awesome as always!
Lamb Chops were to die for!
Never had anything there but great nights.

Customer 552.Name: oldschoolfoodie
Customer 552.Content: Thursday lunch was busy! Great, lively buzz and obviously, after many years, Met Grill is still a go-to lunch spot. The steak salad was delicious, with a generous portion of perfectly cooked steak sliced up on top of fresh, tasty greens and tangy blue cheese. The kind of salad that you crave a few days afterwards and want to go back and eat it again. Daily special was beef stroganoff, a tasty and ample serving of tender meat and creamy sauce with the depth of flavor coming from mushrooms and onions. Delicious comfort food. The service here is absolutely top-notch. It's an easy spot to love and return to. Thank you for a great mean and a great experience.

Customer 554.Name: IanS
Customer 554.Content: Wonderful steak dinner. Bananas Foster was delicious

Customer 555.Name: DJ4417
Customer 555.Content: The food was good. The server was excellent. It was my wife’s birthday. We had a great time.

Customer 556.Name: Anon
Customer 556.Content: Great food and even better service.

Customer 557.Name: KevinK
Customer 557.Content: The steak was perfect. The wine list was extensive and modestly priced. Dessert was fantastic. Service was the best. I travel nationally, home base is Boston and the Metropolitan Grill was exceptional in all aspects, the best dining experience I've had in a decade.

Customer 558.Name: NatashaB
Customer 558.Content: My experience at the Metropolitan Grill was that absolute best. The service was amazing - our waitress was very friendly, quick and knowledgeable. And the food was just as amazing. It was well worth the money and I will most definitely be back again.

Customer 559.Name: LaurieW
Customer 559.Content: Amazing food, awesome staff! Always a favorite! Highly recommend!

Customer 560.Name: kdm24
Customer 560.Content: The food was amazing and our waiter was awesome! We had ordered the Hokkaido Beef steak and it was as tender as I had imagined it to be. Our waiter was very helpful and was on top of things like getting us refills or periodically checking in on us. This was our first time dining at the restaurant and we had gone on my birthday, which made my experience even more enjoyable.

Customer 561.Name: Pappasmurf
Customer 561.Content: Our waiter, Bruno, made our dinner very enjoyable. From the correctness of the meat cooking, to the house cab, everything was top notch. Only if the table of 5 young men would have been quieter it would have been perfect.

Customer 562.Name: BrianW
Customer 562.Content: Best steak house in the country. The service is fantastic. The Apple Pie May be the best dessert ever.

Customer 563.Name: DaveG
Customer 563.Content: I got the prime rib and thought it was great. My mother whose favorite cut is filet was disappointed. She got the 4oz wagyu and 4Oz prime filet combo. Apparently both were seared too heavily and the meat was too tough. Not what you expect for one of the best steakhouses and one ofor the most expensive.

Customer 564.Name: Tony
Customer 564.Content: The chateaubriand was delicious and our server was outstanding! It was a very enjoyable experience.

Customer 565.Name: John
Customer 565.Content:
The dining experience was quite good, as usual. The service was also very good. However, I think we caught the kitchen on a night that wasn't their best. My wife ordered the king salmon, and had to send it back because it was dry. I ordered the bone-in Delmonico, and while it was wonderfully flavorful it was also chewy and had a streak of gristle. I decided not to send mine back.
The waitstaff did a great job of taking care of the issue with the salmon. One of the nice things about the Met is that the waitstaff is very attentive, things get taken care of quickly, but they are never intrusive.

Customer 566.Name: MarleneR
Customer 566.Content:
I had the pastrami sandwich which was cut thick and very dry.  I ended up taking it home and tried eating it as leftover the next day but the dryness of the pastrami was so unappetizing!

I did have the French Onion soup and that one was great.

Customer 567.Name: dspopp
Customer 567.Content: Good service but very generic. Wham Bam Thank You Ma’am. Nothing special about this place.

Customer 568.Name: Steakloverl
Customer 568.Content: Excellent meal as expected. Such a delight to experience such great service!  We always visit when in Seattle.

Customer 569.Name: CarolineW
Customer 569.Content: Excellent restaurant. Loved the food, drinks, service and ambiance. Highly recommend and will definitely return.

Customer 570.Name: RickyP
Customer 570.Content: Great place! First time was 10 years ago and it was amazing. Portions have shrunk a bit but not the prices.

Customer 571.Name: RobertF
Customer 571.Content: I had an awesome experience introducing a couple of friends to the top steakhouse experience.   The Met did great.

Customer 572.Name: LaurieB
Customer 572.Content: Not impressed by service.   We brought a guest for his first time.  No introduction, no explanations of types of steaks, in fact she rushed us, didn’t offer specials, and we were back by kitchen area.   So many steak houses in Seattle.  My fave restaurant just lost a forever customer.

Customer 573.Name: MMSea
Customer 573.Content:
It was my husband’s request for his birthday. We had a dinner at 6pm on Saturday. Our server was McKenzie who was very welcoming and comfortable to talk and ask any questions that we had. He totally made my husband’s birthday night special. 
We definitely want to come back to say hello to McKenzie soon again! Our steaks Chateaubriand were cooked medium rare perfectly. The sides mashed potatoes and roasted vegetables were also large portions and very tasty. We made a reservation a week ahead and seated right away. By the time we were done and came out from dining, there were a long line in front of the restaurant.
Overall the experience last Saturday was perfect. My husband was very happy.

Customer 574.Name: Billvb
Customer 574.Content: Amazing, warm, professional staff helps to make each meal a memorable experience.

Customer 575.Name: MonteJ
Customer 575.Content: Wonderful service and old school steakhouse feel. The wait staff was very attentive but, not overbearing. Naturally the steak was outstanding. You. Ant go bad  eating at the Met.

Customer 576.Name: JRMECR
Customer 576.Content: We had a relatively quiet corner for two, very attentive and helpful service, and our overall experience was just perfect.

Customer 577.Name: Pickles
Customer 577.Content: Quality of cuts was top notch.  Wait staff very attentive. Table next to us became a bit boisterous and waiter came whispered something to shut it down immediately. Keeping those around them continuing to have a nice evening out.

Customer 578.Name: bry577
Customer 578.Content: Pretty straight forward steakhouse. Server was nice, was glad that they had a creme brulee for my wife's birthday. Unfortunately, my wife didn't enjoy the night, so that kind of made everything else moot. She was disappointed that the majority of other guests were dressed casually (some in jeans and tshirts), whereas she had hoped for a quiet, classy evening. Not the restaurant's fault at all (hard to implement and enforce a dress code nowadays), but it is what it is.

Customer 579.Name: TamaraB
Customer 579.Content: Always a treat to come here.  Lunch is an awesome value. Love this place!

Customer 580.Name: AriskaT
Customer 580.Content: This was scheduled for a coworker leaving our team. It appears everyone enjoyed their food and each other.

Customer 581.Name: CatherineF
Customer 581.Content:
.  Our service was fantastic and the wine selection superb.  I had a bone-in filet and my friend had a rib eye.  They were cooked perfectly to medium rare as we requested.  I like that you can get a half bottle of wine without having to buy an entire bottle, particularly since my friend was drinking red and I was drinking white.  The appetizer we shared of Coconut Prawns was excellent.  The older woman who was our waiter could not have been nicer and took good care of us.

Thank you Met for a great dinner.

Customer 582.Name: ShawnO
Customer 582.Content: Worst steak experience ever and my wife and I have been to many steak or chop houses.

Customer 583.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 583.Content: The service was great, but the food... not so much. How do you screw up a ribeye steak?? Smh

Customer 585.Name: ErikD
Customer 585.Content: The Met is a legend...and old grand dame of a steakhouse.  The food is extremely well done, although don’t go expecting new age, modern takes.  These are the old standards, and they are great.  What you pay for here, is the service, which is fantastic.  The wine list, which can scarcely find an equal, and the ambience, which takes decades to develop.  If you want an all-American, classic, high end steakhouse experience, this is the one in Seattle.

Customer 586.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 586.Content: Great experience.... first time dining at the MG. The food was amazing , steak so tender you don’t even need a knife .... the apple pie is a must.... service and staff was great!!!!

Customer 587.Name: Pinky
Customer 587.Content: Eating here is special. The ambience is inviting and warm. The food is amazing. The service was outstanding. Shout out to Bruno for making this such a special evening and also to the entire team that works seamlessly together.

Customer 589.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 589.Content: The waiter was very knowledgeable of all the cuts. Drinks were great!

Customer 590.Name: KristinB
Customer 590.Content:
We had an amazing time at the Metropolitan Grill! It was my husband's birthday and also a very special trip to Seattle and this dinner was absolutely perfect! Our waitress was the absolute best we feel like we made a new friend.
Thank you so much Kristin & Chris Bouchard ❤

Customer 591.Name: Abenton253
Customer 591.Content: Wonderful as always…been coming here for years and love their delicious steaks. Cooked to perfection! Prime rib is tasty but I love the steak salad. Great panoramic views!. Service is friendly and efficient…always!

Customer 592.Name: FrancineK
Customer 592.Content: a little pompous for me, food was fair but service was lacking and we were not there on a busy night.

Customer 593.Name: DHarp
Customer 593.Content: The visit was a nice surprise, as they had more "walls" removed, and it made it easier to have a business chat.  The food was delicious, as it always is, the server was very good.  The only minor compliant was my business guest ordered an Ice Tea, and we never saw it.  Guest didn't want to complain, so just drank water.  Still a great place for a business lunch!

Customer 595.Name: SallyV
Customer 595.Content: Delicious steaks and lobster tail. Service is excellent. So special of a dining experience.

Customer 596.Name: RyanL
Customer 596.Content:
Great Food, spectacular service.  The menu was very easy to navigate.   Our waitress was extremely helpful with her suggestions.   The prime cut beef was cooked perfectly.   The wine list was fantastic and the dessert menu was simple yet perfectly executed.   This was my second time dining and it did not disappoint.  Cheers Seattle 
R.Lahner

Customer 597.Name: JimG
Customer 597.Content: Our dinner was for an anniversary celebration. We had rack of lamb and it was prepared to perfection. The service was excellent,as our waitress was attentive without being obtrusive. She made several suggestions about ordering the degree of doneness for our entre and pairing appropriate side dishes. To top off the meal she served a dish of creme brulee on the house to help celebrate our more than 50 years of marriage.

Customer 598.Name: Jefe
Customer 598.Content: Great food.  One steak was not a good cut and the restaurant made it right.  Bruno is an AMAZING server!

Customer 599.Name: BrontaF
Customer 599.Content: My experience was good and I would recommend it to other colleagues.

Customer 600.Name: OscarB
Customer 600.Content: Food so good, ambience so quiet and have a romantic music. If I’ll be back  to Seattle I will eat again.

Customer 601.Name: RhodoraE
Customer 601.Content: Diane Soller, our waitress, was outstanding.  She was very attenentive and not intrusive. You can tell that she is a true professional because her recommendations were spot on.  The food was delicious and the ambiance was welcoming. Will definitely come back.

Customer 602.Name: KellyM
Customer 602.Content: We only had 1 night in Seattle to dine and The Metropolitan Grill was highly recommended by friends and our concierge. We are so glad we took their advice! The food and service were wonderful! Diane was great! Also nice upon leaving there were town cars waiting to drive you for a flat $10 rate. The taxi there was $8 so it was an easy choice to get back to the hotel.

Customer 603.Name: DebbieP
Customer 603.Content: Use to love this place but the last time we were their it just wasn’t that same great place as in the past.  We felt like we were rushed through our meal. Didn’t get time to finish our salads before our meal arrived then tried taking our plates before we were finished eating dinner. Felt like they were trying to turn the table over to fast. Just not a relaxing dinner.

Customer 604.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 604.Content: Great experience as always at the Met.. Steaks were cooked perfectly as always, and our service was amazing!

Customer 605.Name: alanb
Customer 605.Content: Always a solid choice; old fashioned chop house atmosphere; excellent wine selection; attentive service

Customer 606.Name: Lindymc16
Customer 606.Content: This was my first time there. The entire experience was fantastic. The service was great, our server very knowledgeable and friendly. Even the busser and water guy we're attentive and helpful. The food was Soo good. Almond crusted scallops were exquisite. Wagyu fillet melted in my mouth. I asked for no butter on anything and the chef accommodated very nicely. Overall, wonderful experience. I will be back.

Customer 607.Name: R206
Customer 607.Content: Always check out the daily specials!  I enjoyed the London Broil.

Customer 608.Name: BryanK
Customer 608.Content: The steak is not as good as it once was.

Customer 610.Name: Joanaronia
Customer 610.Content: Overall a very good experience. Our waiter, Lance, gave us exceptional service and friendliness! He even provided an after dinner crème brûlée that was a complete and lovely surprise. Although we had less expensive cuts.of beef, the prime rib and New York strip were unremarkable. Potatoes were huge and tasty.

Customer 611.Name: STEPHANIE
Customer 611.Content: Great food,  ambiance top notch staff. Big thanks to our waiter Jerry. Thanks for making it a happy 23 anniversary.

Customer 612.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 612.Content: In town for a ball game.

Customer 613.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 613.Content: Celebrated my birthday here with my fiancé, and I was blown away at the exceptional service. Our waiter really catered to our needs and made sure we had a wonderful time. The 10 oz Wagyu Filet Mignon was phenomenal! We also enjoyed the tuna appetizer, garlic mashed potatoes, asparagus, and topped it off with the chocolate lava cake a la mode! Best meal I’ve had in a long time, and well worth the price!

Customer 614.Name: PhilL
Customer 614.Content: Amazing food, but our server was fantastic-knowledge, appropriate amount of table time, and had a sense of humor.

Customer 615.Name: KathyH
Customer 615.Content: I enjoyed my lunch at the Met, along with good company. Will return again.

Customer 616.Name: PatM
Customer 616.Content: Outstanding waiter was well versed in suggesting cocktails to our steaks. One of our favorite restaurants in Seattle

Customer 617.Name: MarkR
Customer 617.Content: My absolute favorite place to take friends, family, or a date when I'm in the Jet City!

Customer 619.Name: Scott
Customer 619.Content: We were at the Met for a birthday party. The service was amazing. If we so much as said something to ourselves the waiter was over immediately. The waiter was very knowledgeable about wine, food , deserts and went out of the way to make people happy. And the food here is just incredible.

Customer 620.Name: SteveB
Customer 620.Content:
The food was great.
The service was fantastic.
Noise level was a little high but okay.
Lot of people there.

Customer 621.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 621.Content: Service was horrible! Waited 45 minutes for our food and when it arrived, only the main entree was hot. All of the sides (potatoes and vegetables) were cold. Needed to ask for water to be refilled several times. Sadly, the restaurant did not appear to be that busy.

Customer 622.Name: Clem
Customer 622.Content: First class kitchen. Friendly service. Do bring time.

Customer 623.Name: Kathy
Customer 623.Content: Menu a little uninspired, but it is, after all, a steak house.   But both my husband's steak and my prime rib were overcooked.   I would have sent them both back if we weren't guests.   But they have a detailed descriptions of degrees of doneness, and certainly a steak house should be able to get this right without the customer having to make a call.

Customer 624.Name: ElizabethD
Customer 624.Content: The food is sincerely awful.  Tasted like there was MSG on everything.   I asked for fresh lime juice in my drink, which the waiter said was no problem at all, only to then Bring my drink and proudly say that the lime juice is pressed off site.  It was awful too.  I would have just asked for another drink with a lime had he just told the truth.  But honestly, the fact that they can’t even squeeze their own lime says it all about the general food quality.  Overpriced, uninspiring and yucky.   Skip this one.

Customer 625.Name: MichaelM
Customer 625.Content:
Exceptional experience,Service,Food,Ambiance.
Remodel worth every nickle

Customer 626.Name: PaulC
Customer 626.Content:
Steaks were perfect but two side dishes arrived lukewarm to cold.

Service was outstanding

Customer 627.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 627.Content: Surprised my husband for our 11th wedding anniversary with a trip to Seattle and dinner here! Best steak I’ve ever had hands down. Amazing service, fantastic food. Will go again!

Customer 628.Name: JasonB
Customer 628.Content: Always a great meal and fun time. We always make a point to sit in Bruno's section, he definitely makes it an enjoyable experience.

Customer 629.Name: Nic685
Customer 629.Content: Incredible steak, highest level of service. The Met is the best dining experience, hands down.

Customer 630.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 630.Content: Great service, perfectly prepared food. Nice ambiance

Customer 631.Name: PhilF
Customer 631.Content: Epic steaks. Epic drinks. Epic service. Epic ambiance.

Customer 632.Name: BobLobLaw
Customer 632.Content: Service was very slow and we had to keep getting the attention of staff walking past to order, ask where our food was, and get the check. Very slow for a business lunch crowd.

Customer 633.Name: TimQ
Customer 633.Content: The lunch specials are a great way to treat yourself and others to the Met and is fine cuisine.

Customer 634.Name: SupraMike
Customer 634.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is always consistent with delicious meals, excellent service and affordable prices. I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone.

Customer 635.Name: Mojoo
Customer 635.Content: Enjoyed the fresh salmon lunch entree with broccoli and asparagus. Delicious bread too. Victor provided attentive service! Just a all-around excellent restaurant with a great menu to please everyone.

Customer 636.Name: JAMESG
Customer 636.Content:
exquisite  and  friendly 

(but there was a little confusion about finding my OpenTable reservation on your records...?)

Customer 637.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 637.Content: Overall, excellent experience. We shall return one day!

Customer 638.Name: PhilS
Customer 638.Content: Everything was great food service expensive but worth it once in a while 😀

Customer 639.Name: Mojoo
Customer 639.Content:
Had the fresh salmon lunch with broccoli and asparagus 

and it was delicious. Great bread too! Terrific service from Victor.

Customer 640.Name: KEKEE
Customer 640.Content: The Met offers great tasting food and amazing service!  Thank you!

Customer 641.Name: PattyD
Customer 641.Content: Might recommend. Some food outstanding. Some, like chateaubriand at $140 for 2 people not as good. Too much seasoning. Couldn't enjoy flavor of the meat.

Customer 642.Name: DavidY
Customer 642.Content: Wonderful food - salmon however was a bit over cooked and dry.  Overall wonderful

Customer 643.Name: HeatherS
Customer 643.Content: Amazing dining experience.  The Metropolitan Grill provides not only amazing food but excellent service.  Thank you!

Customer 644.Name: SarahR
Customer 644.Content: Always delicious and so accommodating- love this place!

Customer 645.Name: vwheavy
Customer 645.Content: Everything was perfect. Wildly, obscenely expensive.

Customer 646.Name: RobertM
Customer 646.Content: Excellent food, service and atmosphere. Expensive but worth it.

Customer 647.Name: ELIZABETHM
Customer 647.Content: We usually enjoy The Met experience on special occasions, this one being our 43rd Anniversary. As in the past, an evening at The Met is just that; an experience. You get pampered, but not intruded on, the ambiance is exciting yet totally relaxing, and the food is amazing. The person serving us, Marla, was someone we had in the past for a Christmas gathering with our children. And it was like being served by a good friend you've known for a long while. Everyone from the person seating us, to the wine sommelier, to all the other people stopping by the table just to pour some more wine or to remove an empty appetizer plate, or to "dress" a baked potato were there when needed, and not when not needed.
