Customer 1212.Content: The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The chicken dish I ordered was so delicious and cooked to perfection.  Crispy on the outside, and juicy and succulent on the inside.  I've told several friends about that particular dish.  I plan on returning very soon.

Customer 1213.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1213.Content: Birthday dinner - amazing service. Everyone needs to try the chocolate cake!

Customer 1214.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1214.Content: I think they were pretty busy, but the food was amazing!

Customer 1215.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1215.Content: IMHO a bit pricey for the quality

Customer 1216.Name: DawnO
Customer 1216.Content: The pace was very harried and the service was rushed.  They gave me the wrong to go box and I had to refuse the wine due to taste.

Customer 1217.Name: Jamie
Customer 1217.Content: The food is exceptional and the service is phenomenal. This is why I never hesitate to spend and continue to dine here regularly.

Customer 1218.Name: AZbites
Customer 1218.Content: They have a Wagyu beef burger (“The Works”) that you can customize and can swap fries for grilled asparagus.  I highly recommend The Works customized as peppercorn burger with bacon and bleu cheese, no bun.   It was incredible!

Customer 1219.Name: JeffD
Customer 1219.Content: This place was great! Had a very tasty bone-in rib eye steak for dinner and the cherries jubilee is off the hook! Noi and Craig were great and will definitely return when in the area.

Customer 1220.Name: CJTraveler
Customer 1220.Content: We are in Seattle for a few days and wanted a good steak dinner.  After doing some research we chose the Met Grill and we weren’t disappointed.  Our waiter was fantastic.  He really took care of us.  The steak was cooked perfectly and all of the accompaniments were delicious as well.  We started with the crab cakes (not the best we’ve had but good), then the wedge salad (delicious...just wish it were chilled more) and finally their special bone in ribeye with creamed spinach.  We didn’t drink so the bill came to $220 for 2 people without tip.  We’d go again.

Customer 1222.Name: Guillaume
Customer 1222.Content: Great steaks and other foods and very kids friendly. Perfect combination.

Customer 1223.Name: JillP
Customer 1223.Content: This time, my prime rib dip was great.  This must have been the first time in 3 times that the server asked how I wanted my beef cooked.  It was perfectly prepared medium.  The other times they didn’t even ask me, and the meat was well done and tough, which was my complaint before.

Customer 1224.Name: Jeffrey
Customer 1224.Content: The Met was awesome as always.. Mckensie our server was excellent. Top of the line food and service... Thank you!!

Customer 1225.Name: ChuckL
Customer 1225.Content: Outstanding service and excellent food.  We took our granddaughter for her 20th birthday and they really made her feel special.  The scallops were out of this world,  and we had bananas foster to top off the meal. Best bananas foster I have ever had.

Customer 1226.Name: ThomasR
Customer 1226.Content: We traveled from NJ to Seattle for vacation and it was our first visit to the Emerald City. I found this restaurant while planning the trip. Figured this would be our expensive meal for the trip, even though you cant have a breakfast in Seattle for under $60. The server was great. She explained everything and was very polite and professional with a sense of humor. We ordered three different salads. They were all excellent and the plate was loaded. We then ordered three different meals. My son had what I believed they called the top hat sirloin and a baked potato. It was cooked to perfection he said. He loved it as he should for a $72 steak. I had the peppercorn crusted NY Strip. Though it was cooked the way I liked it it was too fatty for me. So for $64 I wasn't thrilled. My wife had a seafood Alfredo that she said was good but it had mushrooms in it which she didn't realize when ordering. Though a minor setback.  We then split a dessert that was white chocolate and coconut cake which was outstanding. Overall it was good but not sure if we would return on our next trip back. The bill was $300 and honestly we go to Ruth Chris in our state often and we think it is better and a little cheaper.

Customer 1227.Name: TinaS
Customer 1227.Content: My husband and I went here for the first time for a date night and were super excited., because of all the hype we had heard about this place.  The quality of the food was not nearly as good as we expected, especially considering the prices. We also waited at least an hour to get our main food and this was with us being the second ones in the place for dinner. My steak was way to thick an not tender at all (I only eat about half of it).  When I order the same type of steak at our local steak house it is melt in your mouth perfect and about 1/3 the price. The field salad was good and the lava cake was our saving grace for this dinner. If we had only gone for drinks and dessert we would have left happy. The staff was very friendly. We will not be going back.

Customer 1228.Name: TBS7
Customer 1228.Content:
Excellent experience as usual.
Thank you, Marla and entire staff.

Customer 1229.Name: Jinghao
Customer 1229.Content: The food was great. The one thing that bothered me a little was that the server had a bit of an unpleasant body odor. His friendliness just accentuated this unfortunate problem.

Customer 1230.Name: TiffanyW
Customer 1230.Content: Great time celebrating our 10th anniversary. We were given a free creme brulee for dessert. The wait staff were wonderful.

Customer 1231.Name: DarrenC
Customer 1231.Content: Very good, only the fries had way to much salt. Service was outstanding, wine list is world class and the beef was what you expect

Customer 1232.Name: ThomasK
Customer 1232.Content:
Great steakhouse
Great cocktails
Excellent service
Will visit the next time I am in seattle

Customer 1233.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1233.Content: Took my daughter and had a great experience

Customer 1235.Name: EricD
Customer 1235.Content: Wow, just wow. Go for the ohmi or snow beef, it’s the best piece of meat you will ever ever eat. Great service to boot!

Customer 1236.Name: MurrayF
Customer 1236.Content: Not bad just touristy and over priced.  Hit Ruth Chris's and expectations will be met.

Customer 1237.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1237.Content: We had the bone in rib eye and the 8oz Filet, and they were both the best steaks we have ever had

Customer 1239.Name: JayL
Customer 1239.Content: Great evening! Really appreciate Sergio’s attention as that’s how he wanted to be referred to.... ha. Had a nice pre dinner drink, great service, and the chateaubriand was delicious. Thank you team for a great evening!

Customer 1240.Name: ChuckF
Customer 1240.Content: Very attentive service with good daily specials. We particularly enjoyed being able to conduct business in a very good setting with comfortable booth seating.

Customer 1241.Name: Brystock
Customer 1241.Content: We were dining with out of town family who had heard our great comments regarding The Met.  All four of us had a wonderful evening with excellent service by James and perfectly prepared food.

Customer 1242.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1242.Content: Excellence is what I expect from the Metropolitan Grill and my expectations were met and exceeded!!

Customer 1243.Name: NoreenR
Customer 1243.Content: Really enjoyed this steakhouse but the real bonus was our exceptional waiter Todd. His attention to detail and knowledge of the menu helped create a memorable dinner that we will always remember.

Customer 1244.Name: Foodie
Customer 1244.Content: If you're a carnivore, this is the place.  The meats are of the highest quality and the service impeccable.  Needless to say, it is expensive.  However, all things considered, it is worth every cent.  I give it my highest ranking among steak houses.

Customer 1245.Name: JillP
Customer 1245.Content: Food was good.  I went for lunch, so service was a little slow. Overall, a pretty good experience.

Customer 1246.Name: RachelM
Customer 1246.Content: The wagyu fillet was absolutely amazing.  Louie our waiter was perfect and we finished with a show of banana fosters. Couldn't ask for a better night!

Customer 1247.Name: AppleB
Customer 1247.Content: You can't go wrong with Metropolitan Grill. Their steaks are indeed the best in town. Service superb! Tod explained everything we need to know about the menu. And plus we saw Russell Wilson and scored a selfie with him!  Super highly recommended!

Customer 1248.Name: Jkt1
Customer 1248.Content: Great food and good service but the wine list is over priced.

Customer 1249.Name: RobertB
Customer 1249.Content: We chose what we remembered as the best steak restaurant in Seattle for our wedding anniversary.  The most flavorful steak should have been the ribeye, but it had no marbling thus no flavor, too lean and was rather chewy. The baked potato looked like yesterdays.  Everything else was great.  Sorry...

Customer 1250.Name: Goodfoodluver
Customer 1250.Content: The service was wonderful. We were saying goodbye to a judge visiting from Kenya. Our server heard us teasing her about leaving the US without getting dessert and offered her a free one. Thr apple pie made at the table was fun, delicious and enough for all 3 of us. She felt so special.

Customer 1251.Name: AlbertoC
Customer 1251.Content: A good restaurant for a special occasion, good food and an outstanding Alaskan King Crab.

Customer 1253.Name: Jewell
Customer 1253.Content: We had early reservations and there were plenty of open booths, but they sat us in an open table right by doors staff were constantly going in and out of.  I thought my husband was going to speak up to have us moved, but he just sat down. I was so surprised to be put there. It’s not like we weren’t dressed nice-dress slacks and jacket for him, pretty outfit for me. The food and service were excellent. No complaints there. I meant to leave room for some apple pie, but was just too full! Next time I will have to CALL ahead to make sure we get a booth.  Just reserving on Open Table must not be enough.

Customer 1254.Name: MauiLA
Customer 1254.Content: Excellent service and great food.  We love dining here!

Customer 1255.Name: SherryB
Customer 1255.Content: Reliable level of meal expectations, always a good meal no matter what is chosen.  They know how to do a steak!  Good all around service.  I would send anyone there who appreciates an excellent meal and top level service.

Customer 1256.Name: MichaelC
Customer 1256.Content: We had a great dinner before heading to an M's game. Always a top notch Steak and great service and atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Customer 1257.Name: darylK
Customer 1257.Content: The met is really the only place I eat when I come into town.  The steak is amazing and I have never have service remotely as good anywhere else.  The bill is usually steep, but I go into know that and never mind opening my wallet.  I would recommend asking for Bruno, though all staff is pleasant

Customer 1258.Name: Drdave
Customer 1258.Content: I along with my wife and our 2 younger girls, ages 18 & 13, dined at The Metropolitan Grill on Friday, 7/20 near the end of a week's vacation in the Seattle area. This was by far the best meal and dining experience we had all week, and there were other really good ones. Our waiter Bruno, with the distinct baritone voice, was at once engaging and knowledgeable and may be reason enough by himself to return here should we pass this way again! He was truly a pleasure to engage with while making it fun for the girls and informative for us.  And our dessert waiter Craig, who expertly prepared the deconstructed apple pie (a must have) alongside our table was equally delightful. He even followed us outside to take a pic of us with the restaurant as backdrop - a bonus for sure. Both of these gentlemen have worked here over 20 years and, upon playing our family game post-meal describing the experience in 1 word, I chose 'professional', for they truly epitomize the term. And the food? As good as the service was the steaks & potatoes we were served were near the top in taste & quality as any we've had. This is an old-school steakhouse with pricing to match, but well worth it for special occasions, important business liaisons or when you just want a great meal with service to match!

Customer 1259.Name: TomS
Customer 1259.Content:
Server slow getting to table
Cocktails arrived with salads. 
Lack of accountability blamed on seating 
Server now intrusive 
Server asking us to ask for him next time to make right on this time

I expect more

Customer 1260.Name: Svenskagirl
Customer 1260.Content: This is a wonderful downtown Seattle dining venue for any age group and for any occasion. The summertime tourists love it. With fresh ingredients, servers who are "in the know" and just as efficient as you wish them to be, this is a win-win for all. We will return !!!

Customer 1261.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1261.Content: Reviews looked so good that we chose this place for special birthday dinner which was not acknowledged in anyway by the staff even though we made a point of letting them know. That wasn’t the biggest deal, but we were so looking forward to a wonderful tasty steak. We were both very disappointed in the quality of the meat that was served.  The bone in ribeye was OK, but not great. The fillet was most disappointing. How do you have gristle and grainy stuff in a fillet?  We shared the wedge salad and it was good, and the baked potato was outstanding.  If the price point had been about half of what it was, we still would not have been impressed. Given the price point though, we were shocked.  Wouldn’t go back and wouldn’t recommend it.

Customer 1262.Name: Sues
Customer 1262.Content: Good, but not special.  Food was good, service was good, ambiance was good, am I at 50 yet?

Customer 1263.Name: Jenna
Customer 1263.Content: Best to make reservations. Arrived early with my husband and sat at the bar for drinks and an appetizer. Surprised to have seen that the bar is big but only 1 person tending it. Figured the service would not be good and I was right. Took forever to get a drink order, including 2 glasses of water. We were going to order appetizers but with how long it took for us to get our drinks we skipped it and just waited until our table was ready. Once we were seated, things were much better. Skirt steak is wonderful.

Customer 1264.Name: GeorgeC
Customer 1264.Content: Our waiter was outstanding. Food is excellent as usual.

Customer 1266.Name: winnie
Customer 1266.Content: It’s our first time here and we are celebrating my boyfriend’s birthday. Upon entering the resturant, front desk lady welcome us to with a pretty warm smile. :) Our server was super friendly and introduced us their menu. Food is prepared just right and tasty as well! Recommend for special occasion or just a regular date.

Customer 1267.Name: JimE
Customer 1267.Content:
Great food. Steak was particularly good. Loved the creamed spinach. 
Service was outstanding. We actually ate in the bar which accounted for the higher sound level than the normal dining room. 
Ask for Rachel she was very attentive and knowledgeable about the vast menu. Friendly and positive attitude.

Customer 1268.Name: Horrible
Customer 1268.Content:
Great service. The steaks were cooked perfectly and great flavor. 
And as if we needed it the carrot cake at the end  was AWESOME ! Highly recommended.

Customer 1269.Name: Vhar
Customer 1269.Content: Excellent steak, great atmosphere with amazing service

Customer 1270.Name: MilesG
Customer 1270.Content: One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle, The Met is consistently excellent on all levels. The food is great and the service is impeccable. The Met is always my go to place for a steak.

Customer 1271.Name: RogerL
Customer 1271.Content: The seating of restaurant was poor. They had us next to the restrooms and the booths were cramped and dark. It was NOT a great experience for a first time guest.

Customer 1272.Name: BobC
Customer 1272.Content: As always, steak superb -- both great ingredients and excellent cooking! Staff excellent, even comped the desert for the special occasion. If you want the best steakhouse in Seattle, this is it.

Customer 1273.Name: JeffR
Customer 1273.Content: I was sad that our favorite table was no loner there (147) was a nice booth in a corner away from the noise. Now it appears to be a set up as a large group area. Food was great and service always is top notch.

Customer 1274.Name: raindrop
Customer 1274.Content: Great ambiance and service.  The kids menus are well priced...$6 cheeseburger with fries and tastes 1000x better than Red Robin.

Customer 1275.Name: TinaA
Customer 1275.Content: Such a great atmosphere and great food!  Husband and I came for our anniversary and I would recommend to anyone looking for a completely different experience than you get at most restaurants.  The staff is above amazing!

Customer 1277.Name: ReiszaS
Customer 1277.Content: Our server was amazing and did a wonderful job explaining the menu. Thank you so much for the great night.

Customer 1278.Name: WillienTess
Customer 1278.Content:
This is our must-stop when we visit Seattle.  Mckenzie was nothing short of amazing.  He was courteous, accommodating, personable, attentive and we never had to wait for anything.  His suggestions were spot on.  We were a bit of a handful since we were seated right next to a group of 5 guys so of course there was a lot of cross-talk between the tables and Mckenzie never missed a beat! 
The meal was perfect.  The bar staff was courteous and friendly as well.  We will be back for sure!!!  We appreciate the level of service we always receive when we are there.

Customer 1279.Name: Peter
Customer 1279.Content: I prefer the steak at Joule in Fremont at about 25-50% less.

Customer 1280.Name: WilliamK
Customer 1280.Content: The Met is ALWAYS fantastic. If you wanna feel like a million bucks, go to dinner at the Met. Worth EVERY penny. If you choose Ruth’s Chris over the Met, gtfo of Seattle with a quickness.

Customer 1281.Name: jamesv
Customer 1281.Content:
As usual the food was outstanding and the service was just average . I have always wondered how an upscale restaurant can justify its mediocre waiter service ? 
We found the other service to be above average , but they need to get some serious help with their waitstaff

Customer 1282.Name: ATLguest
Customer 1282.Content: Everything was good except the steak. I hate to say it but it is a steak restaurant and the steak was not great. We had 3 different steaks at our table and none of them were very good. The sides and the salad were delicious. The service and atmosphere were great. The steak was not. We have eaten at famous, pricey steak restaurants all over the U.S. and the steak we had on this night tasted like it came from Outback, except it cost 10 times more. I don't care how many famous people have eaten there, when your dinner cost $100 for each person (not including alcohol) then your steak better be great.

Customer 1283.Name: LindsayR
Customer 1283.Content: Delicious meal & amazing service. Thank you for making these out of towners feel special on our 5th wedding anniversary!

Customer 1284.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1284.Content: Amazing as always!  Best restaurant in Seattle.

Customer 1285.Name: Bainbmimi
Customer 1285.Content: Not as happy as have been In the past.  From the start I asked for 2 separate tickets we had one person not be able to get there so it was 2 tickets of 4 with only one seat change for the entre portion so we were sitting in 2 groups. The 2 tickets didn’t happen but besides that the food was not worth the price. The Brussels sprouts were wilty with very little bacon and both the Oscar style and crap cakes seems to lack flavor.  A closer restaurant option for us would have been john howies in Bellevue.

Customer 1286.Name: KristyC
Customer 1286.Content: Generally, I have a good experience at the MG.  This time service was very lousy.

Customer 1287.Name: DennisM
Customer 1287.Content: Food was good, but not WOW as expected.    I have had better steak at other locations at lower price.  The mushrooms were delicious.

Customer 1288.Name: StanW
Customer 1288.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is simply and consistently one of America's great steakhouses.

Customer 1289.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1289.Content: Great steaks & sides. Special promotion made it more affordable.

Customer 1290.Name: TimO
Customer 1290.Content: Our group has been coming to The Met for years for special occasion dinners. Our recent visit was everything we have come to expect with one exception. Our table was in a very noisy area, there was a banquet room on one side with lots of traffic and the opening and closing of the large doors, booths on either side of us, and a roving carving cart continuely in use. All of this made it difficult to visit and hear our own conversation.

Customer 1291.Name: AlisonK
Customer 1291.Content: The service was extremely slow, especially when we ordered drinks.

Customer 1292.Name: PrestonB
Customer 1292.Content: Still, the best Old Seattle dining.  The setting, the wait-staff, and the generous lunch portions... great place to take a business partner to seal the deal!

Customer 1293.Name: IanT
Customer 1293.Content: Great Metropolitan Grill experience. The food was excellent and came exactly as ordered. I used a "Meet at the Met" voucher which made what would have been an expensive meal into a well priced fantastic dining experience...

Customer 1294.Name: Dan1
Customer 1294.Content: Outstanding service and terrific food. Best dinner in town.

Customer 1296.Name: TVCdiner
Customer 1296.Content: Excellent steaks and king crab. Sides are too much food. Kevin (busser) and waitress from Elliott’s were very attentive. Great Manhattan. Figure $100+ per person.

Customer 1297.Name: TraceyC
Customer 1297.Content: The food is always delicious and this time was no exception. We had prime rib, salmon, and steak tartare and it was all delicious. We split the green salad 4 ways and they were very generous portions. The onion rings were gigantic and yummy as were the coconut shrimp. This is an excellent surf and turf steak house with very professional and attentive staff, cozy booths, and a great location within a few blocks of the Fairmont.

Customer 1298.Name: Greg
Customer 1298.Content: Used 4 for 2 coupon. Server gave an appetizer free and a free birthday desert.  Great service even upon suggesting the medium priced steaks. Classic dining. VIP member even though no longer counting points but good enough for free valet. Should have tipped more than 20%.....

Customer 1299.Name: NotWorthTheCost
Customer 1299.Content:
This was a special meal with our son, daughter and our son’s girlfriend. I asked for a ‘quiet area’ table and our party of five was seated at a banquet round typically for 8-10. This would have been ok, but the restaurant used the room for a party with two five or so year old girls who ran back and forth throughout the room and neither the parents or the management thought to stop the activity. Mid way through the meal they added a family with a new born to another banquet table in the mix and, fortunately, she or he slept.

Service was poorly timed and we had a wait if 30-40 minutes between appetizer course and main entre. My blackened prime rib ordered medium (pink throughout by restaurant definition) was medium well. It was also 1/2 fat. My wife had a regular prime rib and it was almost cold and also not prepared as ordered. Entres were not dropped together which also seemed odd. The bread were a stingy portion and we had to ask for more rather than it being replenished. On a side table were four floral arrangements which could have been placed on the four banquet tables making the evening more festive.

For $665 we could have easily found a much better meal at a chain steakhouse for 2/3 the cost or less for our party of five. The Met came highly recommended by a former Seattle resident ... unfortunately it appears time has worn on the rep of the Metropolitan Grill. Beware and save yourself some money and have a better experience elsewhere!

Customer 1300.Name: lancelot
Customer 1300.Content:
Steaks had too much fat

Steamed Broccoli cold as was the cheese sauce

Caesar Salad dressing was too fishy even tho anchovies left off 

Valet parking too expensive

Customer 1301.Name: danm
Customer 1301.Content: waiter was too chatty.  waiter was late bringing wine.  noise level much too loud.  $16.00 for a glass of wine? Far. FAR over priced.  Steak and prime rib FAR FAR OVERPRICED.  We will never eat there again.

Customer 1302.Name: sarden1
Customer 1302.Content: My party of four ate at the Metropolitan Grill yesterday. I had made reservations through OpenTable, specifically: Table for 4 on Sunday, July 8, 2018 at 4:45 pm and specified that the occasion was “Anniversary.”  Our dining experience was very good but our anniversary was not acknowledged in any way. I contacted Metropolitan Grill and their response was "We received your inquiry about your visit with us last night, Sunday July 8th. I looked into the matter, and saw that on your OpenTable reservation we did not receive any notes about a special occasion. I am so very sorry that we did not receive the message, as we always love to spoil our guests on their special days, especially anniversaries! Wishing a very happy (belated) anniversary to you, and I sincerely hope this will not deter you from thinking of us to celebrate in the future." I think their response was underwhelming. We were very disappointed to not receive the special treatment that Metropolitan Grill advertises.

Customer 1303.Name: BrianJ
Customer 1303.Content: My wife and I had a great time for our 9 year anniversary. Michael was our server and he did a great job.

Customer 1304.Name: BigRed
Customer 1304.Content:
I do not eat meat, yet I found myself completely satisfied with the options I had at the Metropolitan Grill. I came for the company and was pleasantly surprised at my options on the menu.

 The service was impeccable to a degree of being annoying as the Metropolitan Grill has set my new standard for service and no other restaraunt, in the foreseeable future, will match it guaranteed. 

I will say this; you get what you pay for.

Customer 1305.Name: LeAndreM
Customer 1305.Content: Great food and outstanding service.  I will recommend to all my friends and associates.

Customer 1306.Name: keegbaba
Customer 1306.Content: everything was what I had expected from previous visits (very very good service and atmosphere).  however I must say that my top of the line $72 USA Cap Top steak was not very good - I was pretty surprised, much of it was very very tough and I've had much better tasting steaks before (even at the Met).

Customer 1307.Name: Gaspasser
Customer 1307.Content: Wife and I had the prime rib. Not their specialty but expected better. Was very salty and had an off kind of spoiled taste. Also meat was tough and fatty rather than rich. Daughter’s filet just so so. No where near worth the price.

Customer 1309.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1309.Content:
Waiter was clearly distracted and more interested in talking than serving. Prime rib was dry and asparagus was cold. Had to ask for drinks repeatedly and the bill finally arrived after chasing down the server twice, the expediter and then the hostess.
Left disappointed and hungry.

Customer 1310.Name: DonovanL
Customer 1310.Content:
Decided to have a meet 'n' greet lunch with a prospective hire and a co-worker, and what better place than The Met? Even though my prospect ordered fish and chips (and received a very well-deserved cheerful razzing from the hostess for it) and the rest of us ordered chophouse burgers, food was served quickly and was excellent like always. 

Whether it's for up-scale casual dining or for going all-out with some of the amazing steaks, I love The Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 1311.Name: PhilC
Customer 1311.Content: Great food and our waiter Bruno was awesome!!

Customer 1312.Name: DianeH
Customer 1312.Content: A best experience time after time.  Lovely ......always a treat.  Thank you.

Customer 1313.Name: joyf
Customer 1313.Content: Love the service! Everybody was helpful and accommodating. This will be my next go to steak house.

Customer 1314.Name: JoelM
Customer 1314.Content: Wow!! I'd strongly suggest the Porterhouse,  it was incredible!! Great food, great staff and a comfortable environment. We'll be back!

Customer 1315.Name: MIReviewer
Customer 1315.Content: Stepping out of the city hustle into this lovely restaurant was a perfect start to our sightseeing day!  The service is outstanding and the food was excellent.  The clam chowder was delicious and my husband said the steak sandwich was the best he had ever had.  Everything was also beautifully presented.  Looking at the many photos of famous people who have come here was fun, too.  A Seattle must-see!

Customer 1316.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1316.Content:
Food was great, presented well, service was above and beyond what I’ve grown to expect. 
I was treated like family

Customer 1317.Name: rk1013
Customer 1317.Content:
The porterhouse and bone-in ribeye were well pepared and delicious. The sides were fantastic, and the baked potato outstanding.

It was our anniversary and they brought us a cake that was visually impressive and the white chocolate was savory, rich and a perfect way to wrap the meal.

The Manhattan’s are also very well done.

Customer 1318.Name: MarlenaA
Customer 1318.Content: Sunday night dinner was delicious! Had fun watching the tableside action with the "Long Bone" Ribeye Steak and Bananas Foster dessert. The Porterhouse steak practically melted in your mouth. Everyone loved their dishes. It was a great evening.

Customer 1319.Name: Robin
Customer 1319.Content:
Loved Mac Kenzie, our  server
Wine steward amazing, too
Romantic table
Expensive, but worth it 
My 3rd date & we loved it-our special place. We will be back ASAP

Customer 1320.Name: AlanE
Customer 1320.Content: Old school classy. Best steak I've had since Ringside in Portland. Great Mojito as well.

Customer 1321.Name: jenifer
Customer 1321.Content: I had a friend who had never been, this was my second time.  The food is very good, staff very professional (and patient with my older friend who can't make up her mind nor hear very well).  Its super expensive but no more so than El Gaucho or Ruth Chris.  I would say they all are similar, Ruth Chris is a bit more trendy, El Gaucho is more quirky, dark, romantic, and the Met is old school.  I recommend the coconut white chocolate cake and the garden salad with walnuts and pears.

Customer 1322.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1322.Content: Wonderful food, but the wait staff were exceptional!  Always look forward to eating at The Met.

Customer 1323.Name: monste
Customer 1323.Content: We had excellent service and a wonderful meal to celebrate our son's birthday.  Would highly recommend to others that want a fine dining experience.

Customer 1324.Name: DorisL
Customer 1324.Content: I was anticipating an awesome experience but was very disappointed. I was meeting my brother and his family who I had not seen in quite awhile.  I had made reservations about a week and a half beforehand. The hostess was very nice but everything went downhill from there on. We were a party of 5 and led to a table that sets at least 10. It had an odd flower arrangement on it that looked like it was left over from a shower or something, no big deal though. The service was mediocre at best, took quite a long while for anyone to come over and ask if we wanted drinks and even longer for the drinks to be delivered. Needless to say the prices here are not for the faint of heart which is truly fine if you have an incredible experience. That was not the case. The person who delivered our meals was not the original waitress and had no idea who had what. We were passing plates around until it was straightened out.  I had ordered my stake medium but it was very rare, it was also cold, by the time anyone came by again it was 15 minutes into our meal and too late to send back and since it took so long to get to us anyway I was not about to hold everyone up by sending it back. Bottom line, SO expensive and I have had a better steak at Outback. Think they are trying to cash in on their history as a great steak house in years gone by but trust me this is not the place it used to be.

Customer 1325.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1325.Content:
My food was really good!! Little noises hard to hear.
But over great tasting food.

Customer 1326.Name: jeramyh
Customer 1326.Content: Beautiful as always! Best effing steak in Seattle!

Customer 1327.Name: Michellebothor
Customer 1327.Content:
Waiter was excellent, the food fantastic.
Everything was cooked to perfection. This is a classy fine dinning restaurant so the price was not unexpected. Can’t wait to find here on our next trip to Seattle

Customer 1328.Name: Lori
Customer 1328.Content: Each time I dine at The Metropolitan Grill I've been wowed by impeccable service, friendly staff and outstanding food.

Customer 1329.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1329.Content: Excellent wait staff. Been a patron for many years, the porterhouse has definitely declined in quality. I expect the best here and sadly no longer the case.

Customer 1330.Name: MichaelL
Customer 1330.Content:
Ok !  This was an amazing spot to get reconnected to our Aunt who was in town for the weekend .
Talk about a classic steakhouse experience.
Every detail was memorable.
Treat yourself to some old school delicious, mouthwatering steak!
We look forward to our next Met Grill experience!

Customer 1331.Name: MoaniR
Customer 1331.Content: Food was amazing! The service was even better and I couldn’t have asked for a better first time visit.

Customer 1332.Name: MaryHelenS
Customer 1332.Content: Best prime rib in the US, maybe the world. The wedge salad is excellent.

Customer 1333.Name: MegM
Customer 1333.Content: The service and food was amazing!! I got fish and my boyfriend got the bone in filet. The steak was definitely the best! My fish was also really good but not as good as the steak! We also started with the calamari and french onion soup, which is my favorite.

Customer 1334.Name: LOVEFOOD
Customer 1334.Content: Excellent dinner at end of vacation trip to USA. Our previous visit, 2 weeks before wasn’t so good as no Prime Rib and badly located table too near kitchen. We asked for a booth and prime rib for our return visit and both were provided. Expensive but excellent restaurant

Customer 1335.Name: PatE
Customer 1335.Content: As usual impeccable steak and service, great wine list, great cocktails

Customer 1337.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1337.Content: Amazing steaks and all the starters and sides were incredible too!

Customer 1338.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1338.Content:
Really good food, nice selection and knowledgeable waiter. (We asked a lot of questions) 
THATS👏HOW👏 YOU 👏DO👏 IT!

Customer 1339.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1339.Content: It was a very nice and well out together restaurant however the food wasn’t as good as I would’ve hoped for. Perhaps it was just my meal in particular. Great service.

Customer 1340.Name: MarkG
Customer 1340.Content: The ONLY restaurant we recommend to everyone we know! I have been dining at The Met for 30 years and my wife and I have been visiting together since we met in 2001. We have even flew into Seattle multiple times a year just for dinner here when we live out of state. Not only is the food out of this world, but the service is magnificent (we haven't met a member of the wait staff that hasn't been there under 15 years). We have tried every menu item over the years and never have we had a bad meal.

Customer 1341.Name: PatF
Customer 1341.Content: Everything was great.  5 of us each a different meal and they were all great.Thanks

Customer 1342.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1342.Content: Great dinner for Father’s Day. Service was excellent. My pear lemon drop was on point!!! Food was delicious!

Customer 1343.Name: poubah
Customer 1343.Content: Undoubtedly one of the best steak houses in America

Customer 1344.Name: MaryD
Customer 1344.Content: Food and service as usual were excellent. Very good attention without being in your face asking foolish questions when you have a mouth full of food. We have enjoyed each and every dinner tried. You will not be disappointed, PLEASE try the carrot cake, it is the best.

Customer 1345.Name: Dufferman12
Customer 1345.Content: You have to love this place. No other place is quite like it but it ain't cheap. Our service was beyond outstanding.

Customer 1346.Name: AmyC
Customer 1346.Content: I was told to go experience an A5 steak at the MG so I did. The steaks we had here went on to set the bar for other A5 steaks. From start to finish everything was superb. I don’t head to Seattle often but when I do this will be a stop for sure.

Customer 1347.Name: ReneC
Customer 1347.Content:
The food was wonderful and we had a great server.
We went there for my husbands birthday was great got a free desert.
We will certainly go back and will recommend this restaurant to others

Customer 1348.Name: TRAVELGUY
Customer 1348.Content: Steak overcooked..did not finish,Fries were dripping in horrible amount of oil. Server seems too busy to care!

Customer 1349.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1349.Content: The lobster bisque was decadent. The tenderloin was the most tender and juicy steak I’ve ever had!

Customer 1350.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1350.Content: We went for my birthday meal. The service was amazing. Let's just say, best steak I've ever had. Food was prepared perfectly, service was seriously on point. Could not have asked for a better dinning experience. Highly recommended. Will return again for sure. Hands down best meal I've ever had. Thank you for a great experience.

Customer 1351.Name: CathyM
Customer 1351.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a Seattle classic. Big over stuffed booths and white table cloths. I hadn't been here for several years and never during the day.  I love the intimate and warm feel even in daylight hours.  I thought it was going to be a bit loud for a business meeting but it wasn't. The hostess and waiter were excellent. I had a great Cobb salad and 2 other guests had the steak salad. I'll be back but not wait so long.

Customer 1352.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1352.Content: A friendly greeting to a pleasant thank you, with excellent wait service

Customer 1353.Name: KatieH
Customer 1353.Content: McKensie (not sure if that is his first or last name) was our server and was FABULOUS!  His enthusiasm and wonderful suggestions made the whole night such a pleasure.

Customer 1354.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1354.Content:
Service was excellent. Great waitress and support staff! 

Hubby loved his rib eye and baked potato. 
My fish was not very good - dry and not the quality I was expecting. 
Onion rings were great. 
Scallops, I wanted to love them but they were just ok. Rubbery and lacking flavor. 
Nothing was bad but just not great! 
We had a reservation and yet got sat at a table in a station that had just opened so we were in a quiet area at a two top for a while. Seemed odd considering there were lots of small booths open. Again, not bad, just could have been better. 
We left very full and had no room for dessert. 
Would go back for the hubby’s steak and the great service!

Customer 1355.Name: RodneyK
Customer 1355.Content:
I would consider The Metropolitan Grill the top Chop house in the region not just the state and could compete with any in the nation.
Perhaps the best wine list I have seen.
Great atmosphere and very knowledgeable staff.  
Always a go-to restaurant for out of town friends, clients and for special occasions.

Customer 1356.Name: LesleyB
Customer 1356.Content: Excellent service and the steak was amazing.  The crab cakes were mealy, and a dissapointment. The mushrooms were fresh and tasty, mashed potatoes perfect.  The waiter was top notch for aervice. Overall the experience was excellent

Customer 1357.Name: NWeonphile1
Customer 1357.Content: Still one of the best in Seattle.  Decided to come here with my bride of 47 years for an Anniversary Dinner and was not disappointed. The food and service were excellent from the valet to the sommelier.  We had a great meal. Warning, the steaks are cooked to traditional standards; that is, if you ask for med rare, you will get red and warm in the middle. Most folks who want "medium rare" really want "pink" in the middle, which is "medium" here and and at most other first tier steak houses.  My only surprise was a 3% Surcharge added to my bill. The manager, Paul, happened to walk by and when I asked him, he did a very good job of explaining why this was added. With the recent minimum wage in Seattle and the increase in "hotel and restaurant" taxes, their choice was to raise prices (already very high with most steaks going for $60+) or to add an automatic 18% gratuity. He explained that a "tip" was not a right but given for good service, and also that the tips only went to the wait staff who were already the highest paid employees in the restaurant. Rather than doing that, they added this 3% surcharge which was then divided among all of the employees equally.  That made more sense to me and sounds like a creative and more fair solution. And again, the service from everyone was five star.  I would recommend this place for it's excellent food, unbelievable wine list, excellent service and great atmosphere. Just  be prepared for a high end price for this high end meal.

Customer 1358.Name: MarcL
Customer 1358.Content: The server was excellent. I ordered the scampi, I thought scampi usually comes with pasta, tho the shrimp were huge. The nine layered carrot cake had to be one best I've ever had.

Customer 1359.Name: Neugan
Customer 1359.Content: We were visiting from Dallas. Best steak I’ve had in a while. Excellent service and knowledgeable, friendly staff. 5stars.

Customer 1361.Name: MaryO
Customer 1361.Content: As usual, the food and  and the service was great. We had a great dinner for my son’s graduation. Thanks for a great dinner.

Customer 1362.Name: David
Customer 1362.Content: Fabulous steak, appetizers, dessert. Relatively expensive but worth it (for occasional experiences).

Customer 1363.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1363.Content: Best steakhouse and service in Seattle. They've recently added a mandatory 20% gratuity, bad idea.

Customer 1364.Name: Name
Customer 1364.Content: Upscale restaurant with great service. I’m vegetarian and the waiter offered to have the chef alter any selection made. Delicious food.

Customer 1365.Name: FrancescaV
Customer 1365.Content: We have dined at metropolitan grill for many years .. we have never once been disappointed. The staff are impeccable !!  Food is outstanding.

Customer 1366.Name: MichaelR
Customer 1366.Content: We love the Met It's been part of our family for over 30 years. The Staff are so Gracious and more than willing to do what ever it takes to make it special.

Customer 1367.Name: Britt
Customer 1367.Content: This is an upper scale dining experience. The food was great the atmosphere was great but it is very pricey. So if you choose to dine at this establishment you will have a great meal with great service but a big final bill. So realize this. It

Customer 1368.Name: LisaS
Customer 1368.Content: Fantastic meal, filet was so incredible, as was the bone in ribeye. Diane was our server, and she was the best ever. She made our evening perfect.

Customer 1369.Name: Aaron
Customer 1369.Content: The food, service, atmosphere and overall experience was outstanding! Our server Kat was really personable, knowledgable, fun and accommodating.

Customer 1370.Name: Hellboy
Customer 1370.Content: Diane did a great job of taking care of us.  We were deep in conversation most of the time.

Customer 1371.Name: LeonM
Customer 1371.Content:
Best steak in town great dinner
 Our server was very  helpful

Customer 1372.Name: diegosar
Customer 1372.Content: Great  for Meat lovers. Well cooked and presented. I will return

Customer 1374.Name: LeighF
Customer 1374.Content: Wonderful all the way around, taste, service, and ambiance. My new favorite place! Delicious appetizers, cocktail and mains and desserts. Highly recommended!

Customer 1375.Name: BruceE
Customer 1375.Content:
Seems we were put in the kids section. We were in the back and it was very noisy. 

Our waiter and bus boy were very good. 

Food quality was average. I would pout both Daniels Broiler and John Howie above it.

Customer 1376.Name: crEDIBLE
Customer 1376.Content: The steak was good. My understanding is a number of things on the menu are frozen (lobster tails from Australia, steak fries bought from a restaurant supplier...). Crab cakes were not good - overwhelming bread crumbs and peppers with very little to no crab flavour which is unacceptable for a port town. French onion soup was pretty good. Cost-wise, dinner came to about 50% more than it would have been worth if everything was good.

Customer 1377.Name: Brystock
Customer 1377.Content: We have never had a bad experience when dining at The Met.  The service is always excellent, the food (best steak in town) is perfectly prepared, and the surroundings are warm and very comfortable.  I highly recommend the 10 oz Wagyu Filet Mignon!!

Customer 1378.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1378.Content: They have a server named Victor during lunch time that will automatically add 20% gratuity if he thinks you won’t tip. He hands you their little tablet for the payment already on the signature screen, but there’s a screen before that with the tip selection screen. If he thinks you won’t tip, he takes the liberty of choosing the tip for you and then hands you the tablet for a signature and doesn’t mention anything. The Met does not have an automatic gratuity.

Customer 1379.Name: TeresaL
Customer 1379.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was a wonderful experience. I searched and searched for the best steak house in Seattle and found it. Best steak ever.

Customer 1380.Name: HeesBonafide
Customer 1380.Content: Always a tasty meal!  Have always enjoy the Met for business and pleasure.

Customer 1381.Name: lynh
Customer 1381.Content: This is the best restaurant steak I ever tasted.   The sides were also perfect.  We had a wonderful wine unfamiliar to us.  The entire evening was a joy of fun and fabulous food.

Customer 1382.Name: Stellarlim
Customer 1382.Content: Great services and steak was super good! I highly recommand this restaurant

Customer 1383.Name: BrentB
Customer 1383.Content: Food quality is high. Excellent steaks, but in my opinion over-salted. Bread, mushrooms, asparagus, dessert were all of the highest quality. Just cut back on the salt, unnecessary for such high quality meat.

Customer 1384.Name: BruceU
Customer 1384.Content:
Nice restaurant.  Waiter was kind.   He made  a recommendation for us ( 3 males).  Recommended a 40 ounce steak to be divided.  I must say, it wasn’t bad but it wasn’t that good either.  When the meat came out, it literally took one of the waiter at least 10 min to finish dividing our portions.  By that time, the meat has cooled down.  I am a believer in hot food fresh off the grill/oven or whatever.  When you pay for high end product, you need to give high end results.  We should have ordered individual plates.  Also, side orders were warm as well. 
We had a good time because it was about our friendship and we were from out of town ( California).  Let’s just say, the restaurant did not leave up to the hyped.

Customer 1385.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1385.Content: Everything was great except for my Fillet with bone in. I ordered it “Medium Rare” when it came it was burnt and dry on the first half the last half was fine. Would not order it again.

Customer 1386.Name: Noongster
Customer 1386.Content: 1 year anniversary of being revived from my coma! 3 months asleep! Celebrated with my surgeon and family and our favorite waiter Noi. No better way to spend it than eating your favorite food with your favorite people and the man that saved you.

Customer 1387.Name: WestTXGal
Customer 1387.Content: Still a classy place with great food!  The staff are so professional and have a great sense of humor!

Customer 1388.Name: JACTAN
Customer 1388.Content:
Had a great meal, 
A wine specialist came over to recommend wine, the server knew a lot about the steaks and specials it was- The Best Steak Ever!!

Customer 1390.Name: DebbieJ
Customer 1390.Content: This was one of the best meals I've ever had!!!  Everything was amazing.  My friend & I were there for 3 hrs and never once felt rushed.  Staff was so very nice.   Todd Spadafore was excellent, he explained everything, did not rush us, excellent service!  Thank you so much for a great experience (my 1st time there) and a great Birthday!!

Customer 1391.Name: ElizabethL
Customer 1391.Content: Great food and excellent service!  Will come again next time I'm visiting Seattle.

Customer 1392.Name: Abenton253
Customer 1392.Content: Always great service and quality…never disappointed!  What I love about this place unlike the other high end steak places, you get your basic sides with an order of steak!

Customer 1393.Name: GregK
Customer 1393.Content: Extremely overrated. I'd much rather go to Ruth's Chris or El Gaucho. Additionally, we were seated close to where the servers hang out when they're not doing anything, and they were gossipping and complaining the entire time, and one of them treated a bus boy like he was garbage. We gave our tip to the bus boy.

Customer 1394.Name: FRANCESCAB
Customer 1394.Content: We had a beutiful dinner. Everything  was perfect!

Customer 1395.Name: Coffeelover
Customer 1395.Content: Excellent restaurant for a business lunch, happy hour and a special occasion. The food here is superb and the portions are quite large. It’s a bit on the pricey side, but worth it. The service is spectacular and the waitstaff goes out of their way to ensure everything is to your liking.

Customer 1396.Name: davew
Customer 1396.Content: Historic place that I’ve known from its get go. Food is great but over priced in the marketplace. Service is stiff but I got them to open up by engaging them. There lines are too scripted. Ambiance is great and classy. The front bar has its tradition which still rules. Martinis pours are too short from the top of the glass which is a classic NY pour. Just saying 4 out of 5 with $$$$$$$$

Customer 1397.Name: michibear76
Customer 1397.Content: The seafood sampler was the best part of the meal.  The steak, was a little dissapointing.  Ordered what was said in the menu as their signature steak, the rib eye.  When our waiter cut our meat for sharing, it was already taking a turn for the worst.  He was a little confused on how to cut it and then when we got it, we realized it's because it was a really bad cut of rib eye.  It was stringy and can barely eat it.  By then it was too late to say anything cause if they brought out another, there was no way we were going to finish it.  It's a good thing the seafood sampler was really good.

Customer 1398.Name: CJ82
Customer 1398.Content: Overall very good certainly not excellent and certainly not a top restaurant in Seattle. Request was made for a special occasion for two- the table we sat at was exceptionally small and not convenient for the amount of food we ordered.  Also the table was adjacent to a service area so it wasn’t romantic or quiet for a special occasion- so poor request accOmadation by the restaurant.  The service definitely wasn’t aware of the occasion so didnt make it a surprise- somewhat of a lapse and on the restaurants part.  The initial service felt somewhat rushed- seemed like the server was trying to cram the entire order at one sitting which was annoying.  Food was very good but was overprIced- 70$ for a great steak is Steep.  Desert was tasty but far from memorable- we had creme Brulee.  Overall i liked and didn’t love this spot. Thought the food was good but not memorable and given lapses in requests and price point- I think there are better options available in Seattle.

Customer 1399.Name: BrentDavidFraser
Customer 1399.Content: Their history speaks for itself, the Met is simply one of the best dining experiences one can find anywhere.

Customer 1400.Name: AndrewS
Customer 1400.Content:
My steak was thin and very chewy and I gave up after 3 mouthfuls.  Our waiter disappeared and I could not get him until everyone else at the table had finished eating.  While he offered another steak, by then it was obviously too late.  At no time did he apologize or seem at all concerned.  I asked for some cheese to try to get some food while the others got coffee.  He said they did not have any.
So all I got to eat was a wedge lettuce.
This was an annual dinner with friends where we meet at steak houses all over the country.  This is way up there as one of the worst.  The last time in Seattle we ate at Daniel's Broiler.  Go there instead.

Customer 1401.Name: JeffC
Customer 1401.Content: I asked for my steak to be rare.  It was medium well and hard.

Customer 1402.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1402.Content: Always an enjoyable place to dine, food was great and our server was more than outstanding. Loved the service and the atmosphere.

Customer 1403.Name: NicolasD
Customer 1403.Content: This was perhaps the greatest experience I have had at any restaurant establishment. From the service and setting, to the taste and the presentation. They were each filled with class, eloquence, and passion. Most upscale restaurants in the Seattle area pale in comparison to the impressive service of The Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 1404.Name: RachelD
Customer 1404.Content: Amazing! It was pricy we spent $240 +tip for 2 people. That was with 2 drinks an appetizer and two entrees. It was worth it! Very good service to our waitress was very knowledgeable on everything on the menu and gave great suggestions.

Customer 1405.Name: Leslie
Customer 1405.Content: Service was impeccable start to finish. Sommelier was very helpful in picking wines suitable on our price range. And the food is superb. This steak house has a great vibe but is very expensive so don’t go if you’re on s budget

Customer 1406.Name: creekside
Customer 1406.Content: Excellent service, excellent food, excellent experience! Can't wait until we have the opportunity to visit again.

Customer 1407.Name: Laksh
Customer 1407.Content: Servers were very friendly. Food was great. Ambiance was unique.

Customer 1408.Name: svt13
Customer 1408.Content: The food at The Met was amazing! We visited for my fiance's birthday dinner and thoroughly enjoyed our meal. We tried the wagyu filet, lobster mac & cheese, and bananas foster. It is expensive but worth it!

Customer 1409.Name: Brad
Customer 1409.Content: We loved the service and the food was well prepared and delicious.  We will go back soon and recommend it to others.

Customer 1410.Name: Awsome
Customer 1410.Content: An amazing selection of top quality beef, wine and whiskey!!! Service is the best, they treat you like a king. Prices do reflect the high quality of food and service.

Customer 1411.Name: RussB
Customer 1411.Content: Outstanding environment and service. Would recommend this to anyone for a special occasion. Keep up the good work!

Customer 1412.Name: YunK
Customer 1412.Content: My family and I enjoyed our dining experience at the Met Grill. The food was great and the service was even better. Our waiter was friendly, knowledgeable, and professional. Thank you Met Grill.

Customer 1413.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1413.Content: Amazing food and service as always

Customer 1414.Name: Wmn2
Customer 1414.Content: Great food but not a great table. Table too small.

Customer 1415.Name: KonradA
Customer 1415.Content: Best meal ever. We expected it to be excellent and it exceeded expectations.

Customer 1416.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1416.Content: Visiting Seattle for a few days. Really enjoyed the dinning. Our service was excellent.

Customer 1417.Name: CaitlynJ
Customer 1417.Content: Had amazing service from both our waiter and busser. Was the best part of the visit. The food was amazing as well!

Customer 1418.Name: JimW
Customer 1418.Content: We had a fantastic experience. Food was amazing and service was excellent from the waiter Michael to the Sommelier and his assistance selecting a wine. We had bone in ribeyes & filets and seafood...All were amazing and prepared perfectly. Desserts are insane!

Customer 1419.Name: ToddB
Customer 1419.Content: We were sat I the back at a both (close to the restroom) after being sat at a round table, requested a both with our reservation. Party of four. Both was very small. The lighting was far to bright.

Customer 1420.Name: TomS
Customer 1420.Content: Friends in from Arkansas. The dinner was amazing.

Customer 1421.Name: Betty
Customer 1421.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was an excellent dinner experience, from the moment we were greeted by the Maitre d ... throughout our fabulous meal, topped off with a wonderful dessert. This was our first time and all the rave reviews we have heard are absolutely true!

Customer 1423.Name: KurtB
Customer 1423.Content: Usually superb service was a bit off, mostly main server over explaining and over suggesting items.  Food superb as always

Customer 1424.Name: Greenie
Customer 1424.Content: One of finest restaurants we have ever visited.  We ordered the Chateaubrian.  Presentation was impressive.  Food was excellent.  Service - impeccable.

Customer 1425.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1425.Content: This was our first time at the Metropolitan Grill! We were celebrating our anniversary and a birthday. The waiter was so kind in explaining the menu and took time to answer our questions. Every person on staff was polite and kind. The food was amazing and worth the price. At the end of our meal our waiter brought out a dessert with a candle in it for our two special occasions. Overall, the night was magical.

Customer 1426.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1426.Content: Very happy with the service!  Great job!

Customer 1427.Name: Jonathan
Customer 1427.Content: It was a very good experience. Was looking for a restaurant that says “Seattle’s fine dining”. Truly an amazing place and great food!! Service couldn’t get any better as well.

Customer 1428.Name: KimberlyH
Customer 1428.Content: Expensive even for the value. Food was good and service was great but way too pricey even for what you get.

Customer 1429.Name: KathyB
Customer 1429.Content: This was our first visit to the Metropolitan Grill.  We enjoyed our food and the service was great.

Customer 1430.Name: anonymous
Customer 1430.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill serves the best prime rib I have ever eaten, bar none.  The ambiance is traditional, old school Seattle.  It is a treat to go there.

My only complaint is that even though my family and I were on time for our reservation and very well dressed, the hostess seated us in the worst table right next to the front door.  I think she did this because we had our children with us (who are extremely well behaved and eat off of the adult menu).  I watched people come into the restaurant wearing sweat pants, ripped jeans and ball caps and all of them were given better tables than us.  In retrospect I should have requested a better table.  Next time I won't accept the discrimination.

Customer 1431.Name: facetofacenursejen
Customer 1431.Content: This is a superb restaurant.  Quality across the board. Exceptional service.  Each time we have come in we have been treated like royalty.  I felt special.  Thank you.

Customer 1432.Name: MaryW
Customer 1432.Content: As always, amazing experience worth every penny. Our waiter Pai and his assistant John made it magical. Love the Met!

Customer 1433.Name: EPCortez
Customer 1433.Content: Wonderful staff! Delicious meal and worth the price!

Customer 1434.Name: Kendra
Customer 1434.Content: My husband and I absolutely LOVE Metropolitan Grill! The service is always superb, food is delectable and the drinks are goodness in a glass. It can be expensive, but it is well worth it!!

Customer 1435.Name: Joel
Customer 1435.Content: Great place for lunch.  Mercedes always remembers my name and favorite table.

Customer 1436.Name: TeresaL
Customer 1436.Content: Every staff member we encountered there was very friendly & professional, and the food was fantastic.

Customer 1437.Name: JosefG
Customer 1437.Content: We are both Seattle(ites) born and raised in the metropolitan area. The Met Grill is the first place we think of when we want to celebrate a special occasion. They are known for their famous cuts of meat however their salmon and other seafood dishes are exceptionally delicious. Whether you're set on an awesome cut of meat or you're more of the seafood type you won't be disappointed. Eating at the Met Grill  is a dining experience you won't forget!

Customer 1438.Name: Greg
Customer 1438.Content: Friendly staff, outstanding food and beverage selection. Lance was excellent as usual.

Customer 1439.Name: Jim374
Customer 1439.Content: The food and service was excellent allowing for a really good business discussion.

Customer 1441.Name: Meiriceanach
Customer 1441.Content: Simply put, I love the Met. My favorite Seattle restaurant no contest.

Customer 1442.Name: MelanieA
Customer 1442.Content: I took my three kids for a nice dinner out after a swim meet nearby. I had been there for a business lunch but had never had dinner. All the kids were very excited to go.  They are 19, 16, and 7 and all enjoyed it. Everyone loved their food and the service was outstanding. We all had different dishes, halibut, steak, salmon, and a plain hamburger :). For dessert we had the Apple pie and that was an experience and was also delicious! Several people came to check on us to ensure we were taken care of and the waitress was amazing.

Customer 1443.Name: TimC
Customer 1443.Content: Went for our wedding anniversary. The steaks were amazing with very good service. The price is high but worth every bite. We will be visiting again.

Customer 1444.Name: 1SkiDog
Customer 1444.Content: I’ve eaten at 7 of  the 10 BEST INDEPENDENT STEAKHOUSES in the country.  The Metropolitan Grill is the BEST!

Customer 1445.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1445.Content: Russel was an excellent server, and made sure we were well taken care of ....Louis made excellent Lemon Drops. Great happy hour

Customer 1446.Name: danieldduck
Customer 1446.Content: Excellent steaks. Flavorful. Lobster was not done enough. Still somewhat raw- like. Hard to cut   Roasted vegetables were still raw. Needed to be cooked more.

Customer 1447.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1447.Content: Second time in and just about as wonderful as the first time :)

Customer 1448.Name: Sammy3
Customer 1448.Content: Very good, but not the best steaks we have had at a steakhouse.  Worth a visit at least once, but bring your wallet!

Customer 1449.Name: Aaron
Customer 1449.Content: Asked for a table in the bar area- it was just a wonderful experience through and through from the service, atmosphere, food and the entire experience!  This is THE premier steak house in Seattle!  Our server, Kat, was so nice and accommodating!

Customer 1450.Name: AprilH
Customer 1450.Content: Had the most delicious filet and the asparagus and spinach side with it was perfect.  The steak was a little too much for me to eat while there at the restaurant but due to them grilling it perfectly to my request I was able to eat the rest of it at home for another meal and it was still delicious.  very flavorful ...perfect seasoning.

Customer 1451.Name: JeanneL
Customer 1451.Content: I haven’t been to the met in about 20 years...still so good! A must if you’re looking for a great place to steak!

Customer 1452.Name: Leib
Customer 1452.Content:
Excelent meat. The best one I ate in my life of 68 years. 
The waiter was extremely kind and I noticed that he was doing his job with love.
The maitre was very receptive too.
The place: serious, not for kids, wooden and low light. Pleasant.
I recommend it for an anniversary,  a couple , and a business meeting too.
Just wonderful place.

Customer 1453.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1453.Content: The Met is always excellent! Best steaks in Seattle, hands down. The service is always top notch, and overall experience is great.

Customer 1454.Name: ErnieK
Customer 1454.Content: Great food with exceptional service.  Pricey but worth every penny!

Customer 1455.Name: CCooper
Customer 1455.Content: Scott our waiter was fabulous. Very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu.

Customer 1456.Name: Foody2018
Customer 1456.Content: Great food . Great ambiance. Steak is amazing. Excellent service

Customer 1457.Name: AnitaM
Customer 1457.Content: Was last here 2 years ago and we were very excited to return- it didn’t disappoint us with the great food, wine and service. Definitely worth going to. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves again.

Customer 1458.Name: clteats
Customer 1458.Content: Everything about the Met is always wonderful. One of the best steak houses I’ve ever been to. A bit spendy but well worth it. They cook steak to perfection. Lemon drops are also great.

Customer 1459.Name: EmilyS
Customer 1459.Content: Best steak I've ever had! I splurged and tried the Hokkaido filet mignon. Comfortable, upscale setting with outstanding service. Easy to have engaging conversations. Great lighting where you can actually see your food! Next time I'll use the valet parking.

Customer 1460.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1460.Content: Normally our service is excellent this time it was somewhat mediocre I think it had to do with the set up of our servers section

Customer 1462.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1462.Content: I was visiting my daughter in Seattle and meeting her boyfriend for the first time. They both turned 21 a few weeks ago. Everything was fabulous, the steaks were marbled so well that every bite just melted in your mouth.

Customer 1463.Name: GUSB
Customer 1463.Content: The experience was fantastic, just as I remembered it.   And their steaks are still the best in the world.......the wine selection was the best.......we enjoyed some Cote Bonneville Carriage House and it was probably the best wine I've ever had.........all my out of town friends agreed, it was the best experience they had ever had !!

Customer 1464.Name: EmilyK
Customer 1464.Content: Every aspect of The Met, from cocktails, to food, to service is exceptional.

Customer 1465.Name: CherylG
Customer 1465.Content: We enjoyed everything about our experience at the Metropolitan Grill.  The food was wonderful.  The proportions were generous.   The service was outstanding.  Our waiter was very attentive.  Loved it.  We will be back soon.

Customer 1466.Name: Svenskagirl
Customer 1466.Content:
This is one of the best all-time dining venues in Seattle. You can NEVER go wrong here.
All of the food preparations are delicious with fresh ingredients. The clam chowder is the best... comforting and dessert-like!!!  But, it is the service which shines here... many of the servers have been here for years and they know what to do and when. Never have our iced tea glasses become empty. This is a place to go with someone who is special. It is worth it in every way.

Customer 1467.Name: Chris
Customer 1467.Content: Great old school steakhouse with all the traditional trappings that go along with these types of places.  I washed down a beautiful bone-in ribeye with a delicious Amarone, then headed out to SeaTac for a redeye back to the east coast.  Slept like a baby on that plane.  What a way to end a great Seattle business trip!

Customer 1468.Name: LeoJ
Customer 1468.Content: Everything is great except when we’re about to pay the waitress that is showing us how to do it on the tablet automatically hit the tip button, without asking us if that is the right amount we wanted to give. Resulting for us to pay a higher amount than we expected.

Customer 1469.Name: JackieM
Customer 1469.Content: Service was outstanding, our anniversary celebrated with an on the house dessert.  We started with calamari, which was outstanding.  Split the prime ribeye and a small lobster.  The steak had great texture, but was FULL of fat and lacked flavor.   The lobster was dry, tough and tasteless.  Garlic mashed potatoes were great.  Including one cocktail each, our bill came to nearly $200 - not including the tip.  Such a disappointment, as we've brought out of town family and friends there on numerous occasions  - not up to our usual experiences.

Customer 1471.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1471.Content:
My husband and I were in Washington for our Anniversary. I found the Metropolitan Grill on our final stop for our Anniversary Dinner.  It was rated at one of top spots to eat in Seattle.

My husband is a big steak and seafood guy. Back home in DC, the Capital Grill is his go to spot. I do not eat red meat...or seafood, but being a very special night, I decided to give steak a go! 

The ambiance of the Metropolitan was very laid and bright and I very much enjoyed this.  They greeted us warmly and took our reservation right away, along with our coats. 

Unfortunately, I think we got probably the very worst waiter in the restaurant.  And my husband grumbled about him all night long.  He did not explain the different cut of meat, the menu, or offer any service to write home about.  We longed at the other tables and their wait staff wishing we were seated anywhere but where we were. The others were bright, enthusiastic and so detailed about the menu it had you excited about your meal! 

However, I will say, the lovely gentlemen who explained the wine menu to us and who made my husband’s Apple crisp made the evening bearable! 

Oh, and the food!!!!! Definitely made up for the lack of service.  The steaks were cooked to perfection! We started with the onion rings with curry Sauce and finished with carrot cake and apple crisp.

Overall, a wonderful place to eat, if you can get the right service!

Customer 1472.Name: ZevinS
Customer 1472.Content: Amazing meal, easily the best restaurant in Seattle. I've been going to the Met for thirty years and have never been disappointed.

Customer 1473.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1473.Content: It was wonderful. Service was amazing and so was the food.

Customer 1474.Name: RexFred
Customer 1474.Content:
We reserved for lunch and asked for the Rib steak for two from the Dinner menu the Chef and staff accommodated is perfectly!  
A perfect occasion!

Customer 1475.Name: SeattleFoodieLover
Customer 1475.Content:
So knock it off with the foodie trend dining crap -- put the salt and pepper back on the table  and GET RID OF THE ODD SHAPED PLATES.  Also please return to the previous bread service -- they dark rolls were excellent.  

It is bad enough you got rid of your VIP program.......guess you have to be the ULTA rich now for that......

Customer 1477.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1477.Content: We had a wonderful time. Diane and Craig were so great

Customer 1480.Name: Noongster
Customer 1480.Content: Service is I always expect, perfect! Noi, our waiter our usual waiter was perfect and on point, we even consider him part of our family. Lol. Only issue is we got seated in the middle of the restaurant, and really don’t like that spot but we did make the reservations kind of late.

Customer 1481.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1481.Content: We enjoyed every minute our visit, can't wait to go back!

Customer 1482.Name: kathyz
Customer 1482.Content: The food was delicious. I had their halibut and root vegetables. Everything was perfectly cooked, not over seasoned. The service was great. I will definitely go back.

Customer 1483.Name: MeredithM
Customer 1483.Content: We had an amazing dinner! The staff was friendly and know the wine list!

Customer 1484.Name: Marla
Customer 1484.Content: From the meal, to the drinks, to the dessert, everything was amazing.  Prices are up there, so expect to pay for what you get, but it is definitely a "fine dining experience".

Customer 1485.Name: DavidB
Customer 1485.Content: Great restaurant..The personalized service of our waiter was great.

Customer 1486.Name: LeeR
Customer 1486.Content: Was here a few times a decade ago... Was back in Seattle... And it didn't dissapoint. Go yes!

Customer 1487.Name: campfire
Customer 1487.Content: Wonderful service and food! Much better than 4 years ago - new chef??

Customer 1488.Name: JulioB
Customer 1488.Content: Excellent service. Good food. What else can one day? We will be back.

Customer 1489.Name: TiffanyM
Customer 1489.Content: Waitstaff was awsome, could not have asked for a better meal! Steak was phenomenal!!!

Customer 1490.Name: CherieS
Customer 1490.Content: Never disappointed when coming to the MET. The service, food and ambiance is always great.

Customer 1491.Name: Meghan
Customer 1491.Content: I've only been to a few steak houses, but our steaks were over cooked when we asked for medium rare. We both didn't want to be rude and send it back. The servers were amazing even though the food just didn't hit the benchmark we expected for the amount of money we spent.

Customer 1492.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1492.Content: Amazing everything... absolutely delicious. Very pricey, but big portion sizes and AMAZING dessert (if you can save some room)!

Customer 1493.Name: JoshuaR
Customer 1493.Content: Amazing steaks and wine as always!  We had the Ohmi filet mignon - it melted in your mouth!  This is my favorite steak restaurant!

Customer 1494.Name: JeffH
Customer 1494.Content: It is a great place to go and they always have great food and service.  Never have been disappointed.

Customer 1495.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1495.Content: It was my 15 year old daughters birthday.  Our waiter, Kevin, made every single second very special and amazing for her.

Customer 1496.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1496.Content: Over all a great experience. I would recommend making a reservation, we were there for about two hours. I feel like an open table there would be hard to come by if you were to just walk in.

Customer 1497.Name: WayneP
Customer 1497.Content: We always have a great time at the Met.  We go a couple of times a year to celebrate birthdays and have yet to be disappointed.  Great food and great service.  No complaints

Customer 1498.Name: oscarf
Customer 1498.Content: If you want steak that melts like butter, this is the place. We will be a long time customer longing for our aged steak.

Customer 1499.Name: FernandoR
Customer 1499.Content: Fantastic restaurant . Service was absolutely amazing. our server was a really great guy and very well informed. The rack of lamb was absolutely to die for. i strongly recommend this place and will be definitely coming back.

Customer 1500.Name: AndreasS
Customer 1500.Content: Best steak in town.  Great service.  Fantastic evening.

Customer 1501.Name: Westender
Customer 1501.Content: Took my kids out to dinner. OMG. This was our second visit. This is THE  place for steak in Seattle. Seattle’s version of Maestro’s or Delmonico’s. I had the raw oysters. Briny and meaty. Need I say more?  The girls shared the teriyaki sirloin bites which my 9 year old gobbled up. My 18 year old inhaled the Japanese tartare. Per the suggestion of Phai, our server, my 9 year old ordered the sirloin from the kids menu at about a fifth of the cost of the adult version. I had the king crab legs and my 18 year old ordered the filet on bone with peppercorn sauce in the side. Everything was spot on in terms of prep and flavor. Couldn’t fault anything. Service, ambiance and food were excellent. Reminds me of the old school steak places. Great food with warm friendly service. Thanks for a lovely and satisfying meal.

Customer 1502.Name: Ekoorb907
Customer 1502.Content: We love the metropolitan grill - it is exactly what it is supposed to be and what others have tried to imitate - a classic american steakhouse. Do the filet sampler  - a great way to try different beef and to really appreciate the variance in flavors and texture. The dungeness crab cocktail is simple and delicious. The bananas foster fall flat, you are better off with their chocolate cake....

Customer 1503.Name: LeahS
Customer 1503.Content: The Metropolitan does not disappoint. The service is impeccable. The steaks are incomparable.

Customer 1504.Name: jennya
Customer 1504.Content: We had a wonderful dinner at The Met on Friday night, we were seated right away for our reservations and started the meal off with a wonderful Pear/Lemon drop along with a beer for my husband.  The Crab Cocktail was delicious.  Then we both had some very delicious French Onion Soup and Clam Chowder.  The Filet Mignon cut like butter and the Cajun Blackened Prime Rib was seasoned wonderfully.  We topped off our meal with some Bananas Foster and Champagne.  A great evening and we will definitely be back!

Customer 1505.Name: LTCRPh
Customer 1505.Content: This was a spur of the moment lunch idea. Meal was great. Service was exceptional. Victor was an outstanding waiter. If you want a real treat, ask for Victor. You will not be disapointed

Customer 1506.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1506.Content: Not a better restaurant in Seattle

Customer 1507.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1507.Content: Our beef were not cooked properly, 1 way overdone and the other 2 overdone - none of the 3 were as described by the waitstaff.  Very disappointing, especially for the exorbitant price!

Customer 1508.Name: SuzetteE
Customer 1508.Content: Although the service was exceptional and the food was very good, for the cost of the meal the noise level was more like a bar.  The pricing is way too high for more than a special occasion.  I've been in places with better (quieter) atmosphere for a more reasonable price.  We truly enjoyed the service and food but won't go back.

Customer 1509.Name: AriskaT
Customer 1509.Content: I meet a dear friend for dinner, Birthday.  Our wait staff made the event more enjoyable than what I expected. Waier was knowledgable about the Pinot Gris. I always enjoy myself here and the staff appears to enjoy their jobs. Pleasant

Customer 1510.Name: ErikM
Customer 1510.Content: I absolutely love the Met - it is my very favorite restaurant in the entire Seattle Metro area.

Customer 1512.Name: KenT
Customer 1512.Content: Had a great soup and salad lunch, the clam chowder was fantastic

Customer 1513.Name: 999er
Customer 1513.Content: We arrived before the noon rush, but it took almost an hour to get our food.  Our server did not ask us if we wanted anything to drink other than water, and was completely inattentive.  We had to ask someone to flag him down to get an update on our food.  Finally, when the food came out, one of the orders was wrong.  An excuse was given but no apology.  Not acceptable for this caliber of restaurant.

Customer 1514.Name: AllyT
Customer 1514.Content:
Restaurant was loud. Wagyu steak was cooked rare, asked for mid rare. Food didn't impress me for the price I was paying. 

Our server was fantastic! She was sweet, patient, catered to our every desire. Would go back just to see her. 

Would not recommend for a special occasion, esp a romantic one.

Customer 1515.Name: Isco
Customer 1515.Content: Service was bad. Food was a disappointment for the price.

Customer 1516.Name: barbarac
