Customer 1516.Content: It was quite expensive, but the food was outstanding and the service was impeccable!  No kid's menu, but my picky grandson enjoyed his mac and cheese, which was identified as a side dish on the menu.  A steak at the Met was on my daughter's bucket list, and it fully met her expectations!

Customer 1517.Name: miamidiner
Customer 1517.Content: My servers Roger and Nathan were incredible and made dinner fun. The bar is awesome and has a ready supply of "Pappy's". Steaks are cooked to perfection.

Customer 1518.Name: DawnC
Customer 1518.Content: Best steak I’ve ever had. Well worth the price. Highly recommended the Omhi Tenderloin.

Customer 1519.Name: MichelleL
Customer 1519.Content: We are from Chicago and can be very selective about our steakhouses.  The Metropolitan Grill was fabulous.  Our steak was so tender you could almost cut it with a fork.  Everyone was friendly and appreciative of our compliments.  They did not rush us through dinner at all. When we make it back to Seattle, this will be a must for us.

Customer 1520.Name: Crow
Customer 1520.Content: Exceptional food, great atmosphere.. a little pricey but a nice treat

Customer 1521.Name: Foodie
Customer 1521.Content: All of the food was served cold and there was no apology or compensation offered.   Shame on them!!!

Customer 1522.Name: arikohn
Customer 1522.Content: For more than 10 years this restaurant has been a favorite of mine.  No more!  In my wildest dreams, I never thought for a second I would encounter overt racism at The Metropolitan Grill - but we did.  I had a scholarship recipient of our non-profit with us.  In fact, the lunch was for him.  In all the many years I as a white male have eaten at this restaurant (frequently) I have never, not once, been lectured by wait-staff when I ordered a refill of a strawberry lemonade (or any drink) that refills are not included in the original price, that a refill would cost.  But when our African American student ordered a refill he was given an overt, rude, lecture that refills are charged.  Frankly, I lost it and let the waiter know in no uncertain terms I was, really, thunderstruck by his rudeness and message.  Lola, FareStart, Wild Ginger, are not within a block of my office, as is The Metropolitan Grill, but that is where I will be going in the future.  Almost assuredly never again will I carry my wallet into The Metropolitan Grill.  Postscript:  the blond white lady (another guest of mine) and I (white male) had our entrees arrive expeditiously.  For our student (black male), I had to complain to management that his entree had not yet arrived even as of when we were through with our lunches.

Customer 1523.Name: JoannM
Customer 1523.Content: Great steak, but veggies had a broken toothpick in it, which I swallowed half of. Waiter said chef was rosemary stem. It was certainly not that. Reguardless, there were no spologies made. Only an offer of free dessert. Dissaponted. Expected more since it was higjly recommended by a colleague snd TA.

Customer 1524.Name: KristiS
Customer 1524.Content: Service was exceptional and the food was quickly served and delicious.

Customer 1525.Name: ChristineP
Customer 1525.Content: Amazing service. I ordered the half Au jus sandwhich no cheese and the green salad. The salad comes with blue cheese which I didn't know. The server, knowing that I ordered a sandwich without cheese brings my salad with the blue cheese on the side. Good call. Food was delicious!

Customer 1526.Name: Ramiyer
Customer 1526.Content: Great place to unwind with your tream post a long day of hard work

Customer 1527.Name: Yosh
Customer 1527.Content:
Food’s quality excellent 
Service can be pretentious, fake and condescending.
this can work with some people but not with everyone 
I don’t mind high price, leave $120 tips for a table of 4, an overall better service would add to the experience

Customer 1528.Name: DavidE
Customer 1528.Content:
My initial exposure to The Metropolitan began in the 1980's upon our business transfer to the PNW, which necessitated incorporating the standard "business lunch", into our regimen. In all cases, the experience never failed to impress.
Even during afternoon lunch, the setting, ambiance, ..(and food), was spot on.
For this current occasion, we brought some European friends, who are investigating a potential move to the U.S, for their introductory experience. Simply put, ...they were openly (almost) overwhelmed.
The food was, as usual, superior. 
Our waiter, (Todd), was, as usual, the perfect spokesperson for the restaurant....Friendly, knowledgeable & informed on nuances that might have slipped past others (our female guest LOVED the blue cheese suggestion !)
Overall, in my personal opinion, this place continues, to set the bar others HOPE to achieve. 
It simply cannot & will not, fail to impress.
Even with the recent remodel, the "feel" remains the same,..(for me).
Needless to say, we'll keep going back...ESPECIALLY if /when we are inclined to treat ourselves to any of the(ir) outstanding beef offerings.
TEN STARS!!

Customer 1529.Name: RalphE
Customer 1529.Content: Excellent food served by polite and attentive professionals.

Customer 1530.Name: MichaelS
Customer 1530.Content: Service was premimum very attentive without being abtrusive and food is great!

Customer 1531.Name: Mace
Customer 1531.Content: We had an amazing experience.  They were very accommodating to my son who is Vegan.  They made him a special dish, which he loved.  Thank you...

Customer 1532.Name: DeniseT
Customer 1532.Content: Lady at front desk was extremely rude. She was busy on the phone for a long time so I asked someone in the bar if they would seat us; she came up to me after she got off the phone 10 mins later and was argumentative. However, the waiter was attentive, professional and the food was most excellent.

Customer 1533.Name: LisaB
Customer 1533.Content: We hadn't been there in a couple years and it was just as good as I remembered. Literally everything we ordered was delicious. The wait staff was really good and had a wonderful sense of humor. Everyone should try the Met at least once!

Customer 1534.Name: M2RMukilteo
Customer 1534.Content: Excellent quality of beef!  Very pricey!  Celebrating Birthday!

Customer 1535.Name: ShirleyM
Customer 1535.Content: We have posted on Facebook, told our friends, written thank-you notes to our children -- all for the very best dining experience we have ever had in Seattle.  Every bite was better than the last!  Our waiter was beyond comparison.  We couldn't order enough food (including the to-go items we ordered when we sat down) to use up the $250 gift certificate our kids had bought us for Christmas.  The leftovers are to die for!

Customer 1536.Name: JeremiahL
Customer 1536.Content: Drinks and food were great and the service was outstanding. Thanks to our waitress Marla.

Customer 1537.Name: TiffanyW
Customer 1537.Content: This was my first trip to Seattle and MG was recommended by several Uber drivers.  The service was OUTSTANDING!!  Bruno was polite, knowledgeable and accommodated all of our requests.  There were four of us and we all thoroughly enjoyed our meals:  steak, salmon, lobster tail, vegan entree.  And let's not talk about the dessert.  Bananas Foster, artfully crafted table-side.  The restaurant is very elegant, high end but not stuffy.  I'm definitely glad I dined there and look forward to returning.

Customer 1538.Name: ColleenD
Customer 1538.Content: Roger and the rest of the service staff were fantastic! The food was delicious and the old fashions were perfect. We enjoyed our experience and we will be back. Thank you!

Customer 1539.Name: Eddie
Customer 1539.Content:
What a disappointment!  We were in town and wanted a steak dinner. We heard all the hype about this place ( which was generated by the restaurant's  own advertising itself)
The menu suggests your food will be of extraordinary quality ( I supposed to match the price point)
Having eaten at multiple other restaurant chains such as Ruth Chris and local non franchise steak joints I can say this place isn't worth it!
Unless you want the illusion of going to a great restaurant with food that is just ok save some money and go somewhere else. No kidding!

Customer 1540.Name: CharlesD
Customer 1540.Content: We're a family of foodies, and this all-family dinner was for a special occasion (the patriarch retired).  It was one of the best meals any of us could recall.  The menu was extensive, the bar/wine list complete. the service perfect.  This dinner will be the bar to which our future family celebrations aspire.

Customer 1541.Name: mchandler
Customer 1541.Content: Excellent service - Very pleasant staff.  Amazing dinner!

Customer 1542.Name: Seattle
Customer 1542.Content: I dined with the Met on multiple occasions but this time was the worst.  My business partner and I  had to wait for half  an hour with no attendant coming by to ask if we need some water.  I  tried to make some eye contact but no one really paid attention to us.  The food came out pretty quickly though and we finished the meal pretty fast since we needed to hurry back to catch another meeting.  We  asked for the check but we had to wait for another half hour to get the check only after we reminded the attendant  three times.  I understood the business of the the restaurant but my business partner did not for her first time dining experience with the Met. So  disappointed with the service on that day.

Customer 1543.Name: PaulG
Customer 1543.Content: Took the family out to The Metropolitan Grille for a special dinner.  The refrigerated display curio in the lobby showed some of there cuts of aged beef and was only the beginning of a wonderful experience.  Waitstaff are very professional but also take the time to be conversational and friendly.  The 4 different entrees were which we had Rib Eye one the bone, Salmon, Crab and Prawn Mac and Cheese and Bacon wrapped Pork Chops were all delicious and very high quality.  The coconut cake with white chocolate frosting was just right with the dense cake having the perfect texture and taste.

Customer 1545.Name: John
Customer 1545.Content: Excellent meal and service. Bruno and Scott were fabulous. Impeccable service and attention to detail. From the blue cheese wedge to the bone in ribeye with a baker the size of a small football and topped off with a seven layer carrot cake served with Madagascar vanilla bean ice cream.....it was all delicious!

Customer 1546.Name: RDBCooks
Customer 1546.Content: Lunch at the Metropolitan Grill is an outstanding experience.  The French onion soup is perhaps the best in Seattle, and the lunch combinations include the ability to get the onion soup with neither the roast beef or turkey sandwiches, both of which are outstanding. The Metropolitan Grill State Salad and the Classic Cobb are terrific lunch choices.  They also have an excellent smoked vegetable sandwich. Because of the layout of the restaurant which includes many booths, it is easy to find a quiet place to talk business.

Customer 1547.Name: MartR
Customer 1547.Content: Good and service were good. Seating in a banquet for 4 was very cramped

Customer 1548.Name: SteveV
Customer 1548.Content: The Met was amazing as always.  The wait staff are very knowledgeable and will help you put together as memorable meal as your budget allows.  Our Waiter had been there 19 years and it showed.  The food is amazing, service level is great without interrupting every two bites to see how your doing.  The French Onion soup on a cold, wet Seattle evening can brighten the dampest of spirits. Can't say enough good things about "The Met."

Customer 1549.Name: Lola8888
Customer 1549.Content: Absolutely amazing dinner....and dining experience.  One of my all time favorite restaurants in the world

Customer 1550.Name: BeforeConcert
Customer 1550.Content: Food was phenomenal, especially ordering one of the big sharing desserts where they flambe it tableside. It was such a big portion of dessert, I think a family of 4-6 could've shared it. Every dish we had was phenomenal. I loved that the entrees still came with sides, unlike some other fine dining steakhouses. So I didn't have to spend extra to get my asparagus with hollandaise sauce on the side of my steak. We got to dinner a little early (5:45) so we got a wonderful quiet booth and dinner remained rather intimate. As we were leaving (after 7), it did seem like the restaurant was bustling more. Service was great; the wait staff was friendly, but not too obtrusive. They let us enjoy our meal without constantly coming over, or rushing us near the end of our meal. We got to take our time savoring the experience.

Customer 1551.Name: MelissaK
Customer 1551.Content: Great service - the best.   Matched by great food.  This is a Seattle Original and they kept it in the old style following a 2 month renovation of sorts.   Glad to see the food and service were kept up to par and did not falter.

Customer 1552.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1552.Content: Best steak house in Seattle, bar none.

Customer 1553.Name: Silverfox74
Customer 1553.Content: I rated our service low, not do to our waiter but it took over an hour to get our main course.   Our waiter offered free dessert.   Food was superior, best Lobster Bisque in the world...

Customer 1554.Name: CherylF
Customer 1554.Content: My husband and I have enjoyed your restaurant for many years. He asked me to marry him 11 years ago in your restaurant. Saturday night we brought friends from out of state. We couldn't have had a nicer evening. We started with drinks in the bar and finished with a beautiful steak and seafood dinner. All of us were impressed with the food and wonderful service. We live in Silverdale so it's a quick walk to the ferry and home. Thank you for the great evening.

Customer 1556.Name: BrittanyC
Customer 1556.Content: It was okay. I don’t believe it is worth the price. The French onion soup is amazing though!

Customer 1557.Name: DawnO
Customer 1557.Content: The best steak in Seattle and humanely raised and slaughtered according to the recommendations of  Dr. Temple Grandin.

Customer 1558.Name: DianaH
Customer 1558.Content: Another amazing experience at The Met...when I made the reservation, I asked for a booth but never expected such a great location for a special evening...away from the bar and perfect.  ALL of the staff was outstanding.  We dropped off our special wine early so they could decant it for us; a service never before offered anywhere.  Even the coat check lady was kind and helpful.  All in all, a beautiful evening...did I mention the onion rings?  Over the top delicious....we will be going back soon.

Customer 1559.Name: colinr
Customer 1559.Content: We have been to the MG several times in the past few years. It has always been a top rated dining experience, except this time. The drinks, mine was a Manhattan Met, was short on depth, just bourbon, your completion, some 60 miles north, "The Bistro at San Martin", that is a Manhattan of depth and substance.  You guys need to rise to the occasion. My other nit is the failed crab cakes. I don't remember there being noticeable carrot pieces in the cake, like this time. Also, who ever was cooking them became distracted as the bottom of the cakes were dark and hard, requiring a knife to cut them. There was minimal breading on two of the cakes, as expected from past experience, but the third, it was doughy, about half of it was that way. The Met and the Bistro had been neck and neck on the carb cakes, this time, your cakes were very disappointing. I left a review on the Met's web site as well. I live in Arlington, so coming to Seattle to the Met is a serious effort to be pleased. Not this time. The wedge salads were excellent as was our steaks, but they could not make up for the poor performance on the drinks and crab cakes. The staff was excellent as always, I should have brought up my concerns at the time but I didn't want any bad reflection of the wait staff.

Customer 1560.Name: StanF
Customer 1560.Content: I can now see why the Metropolitan Grill was voted one of the best steakhouses in the United States.  Everything we ordered (there were five of us) was prepared perfectly, and our waiter was delightful.  The drinks and cocktails he recommended were also spot on, and very delicious.  I would definitely come back again the next time I'm in Seattle.  A totally wonderful dining experience!

Customer 1561.Name: KateDetroit
Customer 1561.Content: Excellent evening at the Metropolitan Grill. This place never disappoints. Steaks are cooked to perfection. The side choice of root vegetables was a welcome surprise. I wanted the pea salad from the lunch menu and, although it was touch and go for a minute, the waitress found a way to make it happen. The wine list is huge. Perhaps overwhelming but lots of great wines. Highly recommend this place. 😄

Customer 1562.Name: Stacy
Customer 1562.Content: You can just never go wrong with the Met. Pricey, but absolutely worth every penny. Great for a special occasion.

Customer 1563.Name: SherryL
Customer 1563.Content: Our waiter Victor is amazing!  He is friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable about the menu.  Go back just for him! He remembers people.

Customer 1565.Name: ChristinaH
Customer 1565.Content: The Met never disappoints. The food is incredible!

Customer 1566.Name: dave
Customer 1566.Content: Had a great business meal at the Met.  The food was fantastic.  I had the blackened Prime Rib and it was cooked to perfection and the taste was outstanding.  I will go back again when in Seattle.

Customer 1567.Name: JeffK
Customer 1567.Content: The steak was over cooked. The food wasn’t delivered all together. The cream brûlée was runny. This is the second bad meal in two years. At $270.00 for two this restaurant needs to get its act together. The only positive experience was the service was impeccable.

Customer 1568.Name: carolynt
Customer 1568.Content: We had a birthday dinner for six.  Our round table was somewhat in the pathway of the servers and our guests had to "squeeze" in on either side.  Our waiter was clearly perturbed either by us or something else.  Our service was extremely slow from start to finish.  We had to ask bus people to locate our server twice.  The reservation was at 7:30 and our entrees did not arrive until 930. My son, whose birthday we were celebrating, had to run off immediately after finishing his entrée because the service took so long.  It made for an uncomfortable dining experience.  The food was fine but the overall experience was actually stressful as we were concerned about Server's attitude AND the slowness of the meal. This experience cost $1,000.  My son always requests the Met for special occasions.  We have celebrated several there but will reconsider before taking a group again.

Customer 1569.Name: JapViet
Customer 1569.Content: Even though the service/wait time was extremely POOR, the food was wonderful (and this has been the case for me my last five visits there!

Customer 1572.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1572.Content: This is one of my favorite places for a full on steak night in the Western US. They have a broad menu, comprehensive wine list and the service has always been on point.

Customer 1573.Name: CarolineG
Customer 1573.Content: Save room for the carrot cake!!! Everything we ate was delicious. I had the 4oz prime filet and 4 oz American Wagyu filet, my husband had the ribeye, and we split the Japanese tartare. One of the best meals we've ever had.

Customer 1574.Name: CarolR
Customer 1574.Content: What a wonderful place for a slow paced meal.  The service was exceptional and the food, as always, beyond compare.

Customer 1575.Name: sunshine
Customer 1575.Content: Unfortunately this was a dinner I’d rather forget and that was due to the quality of food mainly.  My family and I have been loyal members to the Met for the last three decades, we come in for special occasions and always look forward to the experience we’ve come to expect.  Our dinner Saturday night was not up to par however, three different steaks were ordered and all three were not good, one had to be sent back for being undercooked after requesting medium well and wasn’t served until everyone else had finished eating.  The service was decent and the server refunded the steak that was sent back and ultimately wasn’t eatable but the food overall was sub par.  As we drove home and discussed our meal  we realized we should let someone at the Met know.  I sent them a message via Facebook that night and a rep responded stating a manager would follow up, however that was four days ago and I’ve checked back once and was told thanks for my patience.  Not only did this meal wreck my family’s  mental picture of the Met but their lack of follow up makes me feel they don’t value me as the loyal customer that I have been since the early 90’s. Unfortunately I wouldn’t recommend the Met as I wouldn’t want this same experience to happen to anyone else, especially considering the price you pay for this upper end food.

Customer 1576.Name: MichelleB
Customer 1576.Content: Had a great time! Will definitely go again!  The service was amazing as well as the food. Went for my birthday this weekend!

Customer 1577.Name: GordonC
Customer 1577.Content: First time ever I left The Met less than happy. Kobe Meatballs were outstanding. The top cap 35 Day aged steak was ok. Nothing like what I usually get here. It was dry for medium rare. Service was just ok. Ordered wine a few minutes before our meal arrived. I was almost done with my steak when it finally  arrived. Same with desert. Ordered a desert wine at the same time as the we ordered desert. All the deserts came out, but we had to wait again for the wine. I’ll chalk this up to an off night because I’ve always had exceptional services and food here.

Customer 1578.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1578.Content: Always a great time.  Delicious food and amazing service make this my go to steak place

Customer 1579.Name: HBris
Customer 1579.Content: Wonderful meal and service! Such a fun night!

Customer 1581.Name: Seattlelawyer
Customer 1581.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is a reliably excellent downtown institution; great spot for work-related meetings as there are booths so you don't have to listen to others' conversations or worry about being overheard.  The service is excellent, the food always very very good.

Customer 1582.Name: Timewarp
Customer 1582.Content: Service was slow 45 mins to serve our meal over the lunch hour.

Customer 1583.Name: Richard
Customer 1583.Content: Enjoyed the meal, service and ambiance.  Prime rib was delicious. Great value.

Customer 1584.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1584.Content: We had the most amazing meal. We shared a 16 oz cut of the waygu beef, French onion soup and Cesar salad. We would go back anytime. Excellent service.

Customer 1585.Name: Ryan
Customer 1585.Content: Always a great experience at The Met

Customer 1586.Name: Db11
Customer 1586.Content: Client dinner. They were great. Mike took good care of us.

Customer 1587.Name: Shocked
Customer 1587.Content: Overall, I was super disappointed.  The restaurant was cozy, friendly and authentic, but the food was not exceptional as expected for the price.  The food was good, but nothing super special that has me wishing to return anytime soon.  The wine list and options were good.  The bread and butter was the best thing I ate!!!  The rib-eye was solidly good - even better than either of the offered Wagyus.  We got our steaks cooked medium to medium well and they were very 'chewy' and did not have the taste and flavor anticipated and certainly did not match the price.  The au jus was really good and essential to the steaks flavor.  The baked potato was very good, but how can you mess up a baked potato.  The lobster mac and cheese was just okay- a little fishy tasting and not super cheesy.  The service was mostly attentive.  If I returned, I would go for the ribeye or porterhouse for the best value.

Customer 1588.Name: Holmes
Customer 1588.Content: I have been to the Met numerous times and it is by far the best Steakhouse in town. It has an old fashioned vibe with lots of energy. The food is top notch and the service is extremely attentive without lingering. This is by far my wife and my favorite place in Seattle.

Customer 1589.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1589.Content: Fantastic place as always with excellent cuts. Recommend the Wagyu Olive-fed beef, top notch!

Customer 1590.Name: Alyssadlayland18
Customer 1590.Content: I love it! It’s cool seeing the supplies we sell to you guys actually in use. :) love the food and the staff was amazing. We will be coming again!

Customer 1591.Name: MarloS
Customer 1591.Content: The employees were awesome people and made our experience even more enjoyable.

Customer 1592.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1592.Content: Doesn’t get any better than the metropolitan grill. Period.

Customer 1593.Name: KapnKz
Customer 1593.Content: The Metropolitan Grill always provides great service and delicious food no matter what the occasion.

Customer 1594.Name: bob1
Customer 1594.Content: One of the country's great steak house.  A little pricey but still a great memory.

Customer 1595.Name: SueS
Customer 1595.Content: Wonderful all around. Great service, great food, great ambiance!

Customer 1596.Name: foodie90210
Customer 1596.Content: This is a Seattle institution.  Great for a steak meal - very high quality beef, interesting menu choices, including plenty of non-beef options, and a nice place to treat business colleagues.  I don't eat beef often, and when I do, I want this kind of quality.  I recommend the steak salad for lunch - the protein portion is generous and a good cut.  Nice for lunch without feeling weighed down.

Customer 1597.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1597.Content: Took awhile to get service, drinks, soup didn’t come out prior to main course. Sever forgot drinks

Customer 1598.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1598.Content: Wonderful food, superb service. A must visit for all - something I’ll cherish dearly and make certain to revisit.

Customer 1599.Name: Adie
Customer 1599.Content: I loved the atmosphere, food and service.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  It was a real treat.

Customer 1600.Name: NavfeT
Customer 1600.Content: I have nevers had a bad experience at the met. And I NEVER finish my plate, which makes breakfast the next day AMAZING!!!  Always good food and great service.

Customer 1601.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1601.Content: For whatever reason our food was really slow to come out and it made us late for the theater

Customer 1602.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1602.Content: Wonderful food and very nice staff!

Customer 1603.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1603.Content: Fantastic food and service for a nice romantic evening!

Customer 1604.Name: BrettP
Customer 1604.Content: I was told about the Metropolitan Grill and thought it sounded like a great steak-house.  I was pleasantly surprised that it was So Much more than that!  The food was exceptional - the beef was outstanding and cooked to perfection, the scampi were large and had a mesquite flavor and again were cooked perfectly.  Every item from start to finish was over the top and the service took it from great to phenomenal!  I travel often and rarely do you get this type of experience - I’d recommend to everyone!

Customer 1605.Name: cperi
Customer 1605.Content: Some of the silverware were dirty. Service could have been better for the price you pay. Food was great.

Customer 1606.Name: Normundo
Customer 1606.Content: A wonderful dining experience for us and our close friends.  We travel together often and really liked the great food.  We knew that it was going to be on the upper end of expense but were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food.  Great steaks!  Service was very good.  The Sommelier was very good and even prepared apples flambeau at table side for us.  Very well done.

Customer 1607.Name: BrettB
Customer 1607.Content: We had a really great time. The fastest 2 hours we've ever spent. The service was excellent. The food was tremendous. We would definitely go back.

Customer 1608.Name: SusanJ
Customer 1608.Content: Exceeded our expectations! All 8 of us very pleased with our meals and dining experience.  Can’t wait to go back!!

Customer 1609.Name: Kiki79
Customer 1609.Content: The staff was great as soon as we walked in the door.  Very attentive and made sure we had what we needed.  The food was amazing.  I recommend the calamari to start.  It was the best I’ve had.  Overall experience was perfect for our date night.  Quiet and classy.

Customer 1610.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1610.Content: Our server went above and beyond to make our evening special. The food was cooked perfectly and our reserved table was ready when we arrived. Couldn't have asked for a better dining experience. Thank you !!

Customer 1611.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1611.Content: Forget the other steak houses, this is the place to be

Customer 1612.Name: BrittanyC
Customer 1612.Content: Food was mostly great but the service was subpar for the price. Wish our experience was kore personalized.

Customer 1613.Name: LisaandShawn
Customer 1613.Content: As always consistent high quality food and service.

Customer 1615.Name: SupraMike
Customer 1615.Content:
Enjoyed Valentine's Day lunch with my wife.  Food was delicious.
Metropolitan Grill is consistently a favorite of ours for SPECIAL Occasions.

Customer 1616.Name: RochelleB
Customer 1616.Content: Best experience ever!!! I will be back for sure. Thank you

Customer 1617.Name: HaroldB
Customer 1617.Content: Swanky place with excellent steaks and attentive service. Wagyu Filet Mignon was cooked to perfection - nicely seared and full of flavor. The brussle sprouts tasted well and the Metropolitan Cabarnet proved to be a great pairing. Can't wait to go back.

Customer 1619.Name: DanP
Customer 1619.Content: Thank you for making out 30th Wedding Anniversary special.....

Customer 1620.Name: mdmass
Customer 1620.Content: We love the Met for a special dinner out. The service and dependable quality of the food have kept us coming for years. However, we make it a once a year outing because the expense is so great for a single meal. We love cooking and can come close to, if not match, the same quality at home. We go for the experience, and are never disappointed in that.

Customer 1621.Name: JonT
Customer 1621.Content: Great food and great staff!! If your low carb this is the best steak house.

Customer 1623.Name: Pleen
Customer 1623.Content: Very pricey restaurant but definitely worth it to impress for that special occasion. Stunning encyclopedia of a wine list with the most expensive wines I've ever seen. White-coat, trained servers that gave us good wine recommendation and made sure it was within the budget we were comfortable with. Friendly and very accommodating service. Steaks were all perfectly done. Petit filets were perfect and I could tell the difference between the sirloin and Wagyu. Plating was done nicely as well. One side comes with main meat entree. Both garlic mashed potatoes and roast veggies done very well. Nothing too salty or overcooked. Comfy booth seating. Showstopping (but tad too sweet) desserts. Easy street parking on Sunday dinner. Easy reserving the table.

Customer 1624.Name: PhilipL
Customer 1624.Content:
Overall the experience at The Met is always nice. This time though it seemed we had a slow/inexperienced waiter. 

We had to ask multiple times for normal service items (Like sour cream/onions for our baked potato, bread for the table)
Also, there was plenty of wait time between courses. We wanted to order dessert, however we waited about 15 minutes after we were done eating our main courses to even receive our dessert menus. Then we had to wait to order the dessert. 
Finally, when our left overs were packaged, we usually get a bag to take them home- instead we just received the boxes without bags.

Food was still good, although my steak seemed more on the medium than the medium rare side. I give this a pass because you should speak up if you don't like it the way it was served. I decided it wasn't over-cooked enough to make a big stink about it and therefore, it was on me.

People choose restaurants like this not just for the food, but the overall consistency in service, presentation, food, experience. From that baseline, i would say this was a less than average experience when i compare it to the many times i've come before.

Customer 1625.Name: SophisticatedDiner
Customer 1625.Content: What Steak House runs out of ribeyes at 6:45pm.  Really?  Substitute New York Strips were a B+ not an A, which the pricing should have commanded.

Customer 1626.Name: MarlenaA
Customer 1626.Content: Great dinner and birthday dessert! Our server was very accommodating!

Customer 1627.Name: tedkFC
Customer 1627.Content: Hands down the best steakhouse in Seattle.  Excellent food, service, and ambiance.

Customer 1629.Name: EDDIET
Customer 1629.Content: Friendly but our Ribeye was pretty dry even though we got medium rare.  Their steak used to be tasty and juicy.

Customer 1630.Name: AngelaM
Customer 1630.Content: I received a rib I steak I could have gotten at Safeway instead of the Delmonico steak I ordered and paid for. The server was very unfriendly. The cakes less than average. It was a shame, I had looked forward to eating here for six weeks.

Customer 1631.Name: KatL
Customer 1631.Content: Food was excellent! Server was great. Didn’t really care for the little back room where we were seated felt like I was in a closet. But everything  else was great.

Customer 1632.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 1632.Content: I absolutely love the Metropolitan Grill! The food is excellent great steaks, healthy salads, lots of healthy choice as well comfort food. Wonderful atmosphere and ambiance. We love the food and ambiance, but actually come there for the great service! Bruno, Mike, Michael and Craig. The Staff is amazing! I love them like family and they treat us like family!

Customer 1633.Name: GregoryC
Customer 1633.Content: The service and food was good but only thing I have problem was the bathroom!! The toilet was broken!! When I pick it up almost fell off.. don't know how the women bathroom was good thing she didn't go to the bathroom because if the women was like that would be sad.. was a early Valentine's date..

Customer 1634.Name: TwinWrangler
Customer 1634.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary which is close to Valentine's day.  The restaurant was very busy and we ended up seated in what felt like an overflow area in a back room.  It was a little disappointing to not get the full experience of the place - there were about 6 tables total in the room.  Our waiter was relaxed, but was clearly busy.  We had noted on the reservation that this was an anniversary, but that info didn't seem to go anywhere... Not sure why they asked the question.  Overall, the food was good and we enjoyed the trip. Hopefully next time we get to sit in the main dining area.

Customer 1635.Name: MarkG
Customer 1635.Content: My wife and I have been guests of The Met for 20 years and have never left disappointed. This trip the 10oz American Wagyu was no exception!

Customer 1636.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1636.Content: We love visiting the Met...but my husband and I look young so we are usually put in the back by the door if we don’t specify that we’d like to sit in a certain spot, which we did not do this time. We were freezing the whole time! But the food is excellent, as always.

Customer 1637.Name: Joseph
Customer 1637.Content: Good.  Better than it's been for the last couple of years.

Customer 1638.Name: EliQ
Customer 1638.Content: This was my wife and I's first time at this restaurant.  We wanted to find a steak that compared to Gordon Ramsey's Steakhouse in Vegas.  The steaks here are top notch, the service is great, and knowledge of the staff is impressive.  If you go here, please make sure you go all out and get the Colby beef steaks.  You won't regret it.  My wife had the off menu Wagyu Olive Strip and I had the American Wagyu Filet.  They were both outstanding and would recommend both!  We will be back.

Customer 1639.Name: KayBee
Customer 1639.Content: The service was absolutely the best - we were treated like royalty!  Everyone was so wonderful and the food is outstanding - worth every penny!  Love this restaurant

Customer 1640.Name: TONYE
Customer 1640.Content: This place is just amazing when it comes to steak, it is still the best prime rib I’ve ever had. The atmosphere is unique with all the pictures on the wall of all the famous people that have dined there in the past. It is pricey but once you get a taste of their food you will decide it was worth it. We go once or twice a year and are never disappointed. Great place for a special occasion!

Customer 1642.Name: Samyo
Customer 1642.Content: Wonderfully organized.  From valet, to bar, to reserved table, all costs were consolidated automatically. Food was amazing.

Customer 1643.Name: JohnC
Customer 1643.Content: This was our first time there and the food was very good. Highly recommend the ribeye steak with bone -outstanding.

Customer 1644.Name: SupraMike
Customer 1644.Content: Metropolitan Grill is consistently delicious food for Lunch or Dinner.  Nice place for "Special Occasions".  Have dined there for over 40 years.

Customer 1645.Name: Tedd
Customer 1645.Content: A bad experience.  NY steak sandwich was cold and fries also lukewarm.  Wife’s broccoli was undercooked.  We were very disappointed, normally a great meal, not this time.

Customer 1646.Name: Daylia
Customer 1646.Content: The Met has slipped from its hey day. The wagyu New York

Customer 1647.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1647.Content: Everything in the restaurant was perfect. Only the vallet refuse to receive our car for the last time slot 9h30.

Customer 1648.Name: KristaB
Customer 1648.Content: This place never disappoints!!! Great food, lovely service!

Customer 1649.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1649.Content: I always enjoy, and have a great restaurant experience  when I dine at the The Met. However I did not know if our waiter was off his game but I felt like we did not get the 100 % satisfaction that we usually receive. It was like being ignored. He took forever to get our menu order's and bread/butter I had to go to greeters to ask for this to happen. Then towards the middle of our lunch I asked if I could get a strawberry lemonade then after 10 minutes of waiting for my beverage  that once again I had to flag down another waiter to let our waiter know I am not interested since the group I was with were pretty much done with our meals.

Customer 1650.Name: MicheleP
Customer 1650.Content: Always great food and the same great servers that have been there for years!

Customer 1651.Name: WendyR
Customer 1651.Content: Wonderful spot for lunch. Great choices and wonderful service.  Our waiter was wonderful.  Answered our questions and made suggestions.

Customer 1653.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1653.Content:
Absolutely Perfect
Servers make the evening outstanding !!!!!

Customer 1654.Name: AmiB
Customer 1654.Content: Wonderful time, as usual. I did experience a very rude bartender, which has never happened before. When I informed him that we had dinner reservations at 6 (it was 5:30) he looked at me and shrugged and then told me to go tell the dining staff in a sarcastic manner. Really uncalled for and really not appreciated. Sort of tainted my view of the evening.

Customer 1656.Name: JodiS
Customer 1656.Content: Outstanding service and staff! Great food and wine. Family dinner was amazing got the bone in steaks with the lava cake dessert! Daughters (18 and 16) had a wonderful experience, wife was very happy, and greatly enjoyed the wine selections by Brian! The atmosphere of the renovated restaurant is perfect for our family dinner. We will defiantly keep this on the short dial of our #1 places to eat in Seattle!

Customer 1657.Name: LadyKatherine
Customer 1657.Content: We had requested a booth to accommodate six of our family for a joint birthday dinner for my husband and our grandson. We had gifts so wanted to be as out of the way as possible. Their staff did a great job for us. Service was as perfect as it gets. Both from our server — she was so sweet — and the amazing sommelier. We had a variety for steaks and one seafood entree plus decadent desserts. Some prepared table side and a ginormous piece of the best carrot cake ever. We were happy we chose the Met!

Customer 1658.Name: DoryB
Customer 1658.Content: AMAZING steak!  Everything else was wonderful too but it was the beef that was the star of the show.

Customer 1659.Name: Andy
Customer 1659.Content: I've visited this restaurant a few times over the years and it's always excellent. Food is amazing!

Customer 1660.Name: JohnL
Customer 1660.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary and had a great experience.  The staff was great, recommended wine and helped us select the best food to fit our expectations.   It is our favorite restaurant in Seattle.

Customer 1661.Name: DebbieP
Customer 1661.Content: Excellent experience all around, love the ambiance, the good and our waiter Jim was the absolutely the best.

Customer 1662.Name: BaseballFan
Customer 1662.Content: Just an overall terrific experience.  I  was there on a business dinner but I saw families, couples, you name it  all having a great time

Customer 1663.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1663.Content: Met is usually impeccable in food and service. Tonight they were really off.  Service was like any restaurant.  Ordered a American Wagu steak medium rare and It came out well done. The service was mediocre at best.  They made it right, but still was not what you expect from the top steak house in major metropolitan area.

Customer 1664.Name: MattM
Customer 1664.Content: Very cool ambience. A little pricey, but worth it for a special occasion. Crab Cakes delicious. Steak was to perfection. Definitely visit again.

Customer 1665.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1665.Content: Great choice of meat/steaks prepared just the way you want.  Many fine cuts of meats to choose from.  Steaks are not cheap but they are all quality cuts.  Not the place for non-meat eaters as other menu items are very limited.  Valet parking available and can be charged to your dinner bill.

Customer 1666.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1666.Content: Have been to the Met many times and this was the best of the best. Our server Nick was great ... he kept the drinks flowing as all good servers should. The apple pie desert for 2 was awesome but there was enough for 4.

Customer 1667.Name: Joe12
Customer 1667.Content: Nice steak house. Haven't been in awhile, prices went up significantly. I ordered the same dish I did 7 years ago (84 today, 49 then). While waiting for table I went to restroom. Came back and wife was gone, they seated her. Since being there before I ventured out to look for her, couldn't find her. Went back and they told me where they seated her, down stairs to left. Not there. Went back and was escorted to our table, downstairs, to the RIGHT. All the while passing bus, wait, and maitre d employees without offering any help.  The steak was ok, not great (for the price). FYI, we ordered 2 meals and one martini ($14), no appetizer or dessert and with tip = $260

Customer 1669.Name: ScottM
Customer 1669.Content: We had an outstanding evening. The kitchen made a mistake on our meals (there were four of us and we split two Châteaubriands) and only cooked/brought out one. Our waiter was very apologetic and took care of us with dessert. The second Châteaubriand came out 10 minutes later and all was well. Great meal, great friends, a wonderful evening.

Customer 1670.Name: Tast
Customer 1670.Content: Service was very slow. We asked 3 waiters & busboy walked by our table for refilling more hot water for us , we were told that we have to wait for our Server/Lance to do it . We waited for longer than 25 minutes just for more hot water .

Customer 1671.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1671.Content: Celebrating my parents and all of the ways they help us!

Customer 1672.Name: KennethC
Customer 1672.Content: Pricey, but always good. My favorite in Seattle for steak.

Customer 1673.Name: clydene
Customer 1673.Content:
The food is really great as is the ambiance (so glad you kept the same look/was very 
worried what we would see there).  The price point is high enough that we cannot
come very many times a year.   Going to try lunch and happy hour.  Also, do appreciate
the yearly special that you do and we always try to take advantage of that for our anniversary
(58th this year).  Service was terrific as usual.

Customer 1674.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1674.Content:
Magnificent steak! Perfect cook. 
Try the Clam Chowder as well!! It’s delicious

Customer 1675.Name: LaurelJ
Customer 1675.Content: The steaks are fantastic! Our server was helpful but not overly intrusive. Her wine recommendation was perfect. We told her our favorite grape and she came up with the match for our steaks which is now our new favorite.

Customer 1676.Name: TacomaTaster
Customer 1676.Content: Great friendly service.  Food pretty strong as usual.

Customer 1677.Name: ROBERTJ8496
Customer 1677.Content: IN ALL THE YEARS WE HAVE DINED THERE WE NEVER HAD A BAD MEAL. BUT THIS WAS OUR FIRST THE CUT OF PRIME RIB  I HAD WAS HORRIBLE  I ALWAYS ORDER RARE AND LEAN  THE CUT WAS HALF FAT AND SINEW TOUGH AS HELL. WE PAID THE BILL AND WENT TO ANOTHER PLACE.

Customer 1679.Name: CharlesG
Customer 1679.Content: The Met has always been a go-to for special occasions.  It is pricy, but you usually get what you pay for.  This time the meal was meh.  They got really busy and the food came late, understandable.  Steaks had such high tendon content, it was not good, unacceptable.  The presentation and flavor of the bananas foster was great.  Just can’t look past the steak... at a Steak restaurant.  So given the price, I’d say low value this time.

Customer 1680.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1680.Content: We were quickly seated and offered beverages. Our waiter was very helpful but not hovering. Service was excellent as was the food.  We all had different cuts of steaks and they were perfect.

Customer 1681.Name: BrianW
Customer 1681.Content: Service and food were wonderful.  We arrived 3 minutes past our reservation time and the hostess turned to a suit and said in a muffled breath, "they're late."  Entirely uncalled for for only 3 minutes with Seattle rain and traffic. Was not a good why to start!!!

Customer 1682.Name: Billb
Customer 1682.Content: We've been to the MG numerous times.  It never disappoints.  Great time and food.

Customer 1683.Name: westseattlefoodie
Customer 1683.Content: I wanted to buy the team I manage a nice lunch as a thank you and I remembered my own experience at The Met 15 years ago when I was fairly new in my career. Unfortunately, the experience with my team was terrible yesterday. Our server was almost rude and absolutely not interested in providing us the kind of customer experience I remember The Met having. The food was just ok, the exception being their clam chowder, it is still fabulous. I will not be returning and based on conversation around the table, neither will my 6 colleagues.

Customer 1684.Name: CorinneF
Customer 1684.Content: My fiancé and I were so excited to try this place for the first time to celebrate our recent engagement, but we left utterly disappointed. We ordered the calamari to start and it was delicious. Large portion and the dipping sauce had just the right kick to it. For dinner, I ordered the prime rib medium rare and my fiancé had the New York Strip I medium rare.  Knowing steaks were what they were famous for, we knew that's what we wanted to try and our expectations were pretty high. His steak came out with absolutely no pink to it. It was dry, tough, and not even the overly salty au jus sauce could bring any flavor to it. Although my prime rib came out medium rare, I was not wowed by the flavor. The garlic mash potato side was more of a hard lump lobbed on the side of plate. Our waiter was very kind and attentive, but neither of us are ones to send food back or make a scene, more of lesson learned people, plus we had a show to attend without the time for our food to be redone. $250 later and a bitter taste in our mouth, we will not be returning or recommending it to anyone.

Customer 1685.Name: luv2dine
Customer 1685.Content: The dinner we had at the Metropolitan Grill was excellent. It was a business dinner; we had a private room. Dinner was top notch. Service excellent. Wonderful wine list. A variety of choices for steaks or fish.  Well spaced. We had time for business conversation and time to enjoy each other's company. Wine was very good  - although candidly every bottle did not need to be decanter-ed.  Worth the drive. Excellent

Customer 1686.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1686.Content: We have our annual Board of Directors meeting at the MG.  Like everything about this restaurant!

Customer 1687.Name: sandy
Customer 1687.Content:
Syeak was very good.   A little more done for medium but it was fine for me.  My colleague had the Salmon...one would think Salmon would be a good pick in Seattle, it was terrible, stringy texture...over done.

Vegetables were good.    If you want a clubby masculine atmosphere and very good steak this is the place.  If you want inventive ...skip a steak house.

Customer 1688.Name: greatlocalgem
Customer 1688.Content: Great steaks and pork chops--my son had salmon, and loved it! Always attentive service. Noise level is a bit of a distraction, depending on where you are seated. Enjoyed a moderately priced wine, recommended by the wine expert.

Customer 1689.Name: PoorCorkage
Customer 1689.Content: Great service and amazing steaks! The staff seemed to go out of their to make dinner a great experience for us. Will definitely go back!

Customer 1690.Name: Sweet
Customer 1690.Content: Though we dine here several times per year, this was our annual Anniversary combined with a close friend's Birthday. The service was, as always, always, exemplary! The Food outstanding. We brought wine and took recommendations for our before dinner bubbly, which was fabulous. Even the non-bubbly members of the party liked it. Made new acquaintances with Julie our server, who is A Number One in my book. David our Sommelier was wonderful. We will certainly request to be seated in their sections again and again.

Customer 1691.Name: Katie
Customer 1691.Content: Always a consistently delicious meal that you can count on.

Customer 1692.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1692.Content: The steak fell far short of my expectations. Overcooked, underseasoned, and not a very fatty cut for a ribeye. One of my bottom 20% of steaks. However, every other part of the meal was exceptional. The French onion soup is the best I've ever had, and their bananas foster dessert was a very generous portion and artfully prepared. Outstanding service throughout. I would go back, but perhaps not risk the steak again.

Customer 1693.Name: Miles123
Customer 1693.Content: Food is great even though comes with a hefty price tag , front of house service is very good but the bar service and table service  ( James ) was terrible the server was rude .

Customer 1694.Name: ReneeK
Customer 1694.Content: We had a wonderful time celebrating my husband's 40th birthday. Our waiter had spot on recommendations for drinks and best cuts of steak and the ambiance was perfect.

Customer 1695.Name: AmyMc
Customer 1695.Content: 2nd time there and while the food was good, our table was toward the back and it was incredibly noisy as it was by a service area. Much better experience the first time we dined there

Customer 1696.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1696.Content: We had a wonderful time! Luckily we were in a corner so it was intimate and fairly quiet. Our server was great! Portions sizes are fabulous!  We will be back!

Customer 1697.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1697.Content: It was our 27th anniversary. Great experience!

Customer 1698.Name: EVZIL
Customer 1698.Content: Amazing place to eat! This is a great restaurant for all venues!

Customer 1699.Name: Jack
Customer 1699.Content: The thing is, every meal is excellent, and the professional wait staff are tops.  This is the place to go when you want a great stake or crab cakes.  Enjoy!

Customer 1700.Name: Marco
Customer 1700.Content: Juergen and Kevin provided excellent service and allowed us to make a serious 3-hour experience out of a birthday dinner. The tri-tip was some of the best southwestern steak I’ve had since growing up in Nevada and not something I expected to have at the Met. My husband went more traditional with their Ohmi Strip. We were at a loss for words. Buttery? Succulent? Amazing. Will be back.

Customer 1701.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1701.Content: We were there to celebrate my daughter’s birthday and requested a window view. We were sat in a back area at a table with other guests nearby. Waitress a little too chatty. Food excellent.

Customer 1702.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1702.Content: great food and service quick polite clean good place food steaks

Customer 1703.Name: johnc5215
Customer 1703.Content: This restaurant means a $300 dinner for two.  That's my estimate for the works--salad, entrée, some wine, dessert, coffee and tip.  Everything about the menu and the service are outstanding--for a price.  You come here for the steaks, with a huge selection.  Arguably, the best red meat in Seattle.  Other entrees are available, but who cares?  I had the "Delmonico Prime," bone in for $74, and my wife had the 8-oz. fillet for $62.

Customer 1704.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1704.Content: A wonderful evening!  It was a “big” birthday and so we decided to treat ourselves well and try out the Met - Delicious!!!  I was treated like a queen and the food and atmosphere was everything you hope a high end steakhouse would be.  Thank you Metropolitan Grill!

Customer 1706.Name: Metlover
Customer 1706.Content: Todd and Craig are the BEST!

Customer 1707.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1707.Content: Dinner was very good.   Not EXCEPTIONAL as I have had during prior visits.  We were treated very well and certainly appreciated the complimentary desserts for my friends celebrating their birthdays.

Customer 1708.Name: TwinPeaks
Customer 1708.Content: The food took too long to arrive at the table. When the food was served it seemed as though it had been sitting. The potatoes were like glue and the steak would have been much better served sooner.

Customer 1709.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1709.Content: As always the metropolitan grill delivered on its promise of great steaks.  One of seattle’s Best steakhouses.  The appetizers, sides, and desserts were also good with some seasonal additions to their standard favorites.  The wine selection was sooooo good.  The selections the wine steward made for our group made everyone happy.  Wish we could've enjoyed another bottle of the bottle from Seven Hills but our waitress, Marla, kept us on schedule to get to the musical on time.  Marla was the best.  She’s been working there for 38 years and knows everything, plus she is thoughtful, and keeps you on schedule making it all seem effortless.   Our family has gone to Metro Grill over the years and we will absolutely keep going there.

Customer 1710.Name: AlbertB
Customer 1710.Content: Celebrated my 75th birthday.  Excellent Steaks, amazing wine list and great wait staff.  Would definitely return.

Customer 1711.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1711.Content: Dinner was very good.  They even made it ver special for my son’s 8th Birthday.  Service was excellent!

Customer 1712.Name: CHARLESL
Customer 1712.Content: I do feel that the restaurant is overrated. It has been an iconic place in Seattle but it has lost its charm.  Service has definitely dropped in years.  We were greeted warmly  at the door by the door man. There was coat service but none provided. There was confusion whether tables were ready when there was a reservation made and only a half an hour into opening.  The server tried to make small talk and name drop of all the people who has dined there to accentuate the place.  It took over an hour for the main course to arrive. No explanation whatsoever.  We mentioned that we had another event to catch and offered our card. The server took the card and of course forgot about bringing back the tab. Overall it was a disappointment. Price is hefty but the food didnt match it. It wasnt worth to mention to others back home. It was overrated and recommend other places to dine for special occasion or when visiting Seattle.

Customer 1713.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1713.Content: Our food was excellent! Our server was superb! Will recommend this restaurant for sure!

Customer 1714.Name: LoriT
Customer 1714.Content:
Excellent food and Amazing service . Great wine list .
A little pricey for every day dining. I have already booked for Valentines Day !

Customer 1715.Name: LeslieD
Customer 1715.Content: We make a point of reserving a table at the Metropolitan Grill annually on our Anniversary. We save all year long to take part in this wonderful treat. We were exceptionally happy with this year’s venture. We both ordered medium rare Filet Mignon and New York steaks from Double R Ranch. The steaks were superb! ...as were our Manhattan cocktails. Equally wonderful we’re the lauded baked  potato and the creamer spinach. The highlight of our meal was a made-at-the-table cherries jubilee for dessert. Our server made a special trip into the kitchen to see if they had ingredients to make cherries jubilee, since only bananas foster and apple jubilee have been on the menu the last two years. We were really happy to hear they would make Cherries Jubilee for our anniversary celebration. Metropolitan Grill is NOT cheap, but we think it is well worth saving all year to visit!

Customer 1716.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1716.Content: Best restaurant in Washington! Service was superb!

Customer 1717.Name: JaneeB
Customer 1717.Content: Waiter was the best!!!!! New years was fun there, food was fantastic we enjoyed ourselves

Customer 1718.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1718.Content: The seats in the booth were sacked out and need to be replaced.  We moved to another booth which was just as bad.  Based on the seating alone we would not come back.  Tables were so tight to your body it was very uncomfortable.

Customer 1719.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1719.Content:
We made reservations following a Seahawks game on NYE.  There was no dress code listed, so I figured business casual might be okay.  When we came to check in, I thought we might be a tad under-dressed in nice jeans and sweaters (there were several patrons wearing much finer clothing, it was NYE afterall), but then I saw numerous other football fans still wearing their Seahawks game attire and beanie hats.  I didn't feel quite so out of place after that.  lol

The ambiance is a tad fancier than we're used to, but not snobbishly so.  The menu was easy to read and pretty straight forward.  The waitstaff was super friendly and helpful.  They poured au jus on our steaks, they fixed up our potatoes for us, and dished up all the toppings for them as well, they even boxed up our leftovers FOR us!

The steak was amazing.  The baked potato was amazing.  The cheese sauce they pour on it is to die for.  Honestly I'll be back.  Since Seattle is a 3 hour trip away it's not going to be anytime soon, but the next time the boyfriend and I have a weekend away - I'll definitely consider heading back to Seattle and The Met again.

Customer 1720.Name: CraigP
Customer 1720.Content: This was our first visit to The Metropolitan Grill. In a word, the meal and service was a little disappointing. Appetizer was the best part of the meal, nice dessert options, steaks were tasty but my wife's was overcooked and eventually replaced though I'm not sure the waiter felt this was necessary (and it certainly was). I was expecting much more - comparing this evening to some of the steak restaurants we've visited across the country, it fell short in my estimation. Would we return for another meal? Probably not though it appears we are in the minority.

Customer 1721.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1721.Content:
Had a reservation for 1:15 on a Sunday (Wife's B-day).  Didn't know they had a brunch menu, expected normal menu.  Got seated at a small booth for two and waited and waited.  It took the busboy 15 minutes to bring water and I said hi and thank you, he didn't even look up or engage.  Another 10 minutes waiter swung by and said I'll be right with you...  He came back in 5.  I asked about the menu and he gave us a regular menu.  We ordered a soup and some salad then some fillets for the main course.  Fillets were cooked as ordered but really lacked flavor and had a weird fatty part on the side.  Once finished with the main course I had to ask for a desert menu, nothing was offered.  Ordered the chocolate cake which was the best part of the meal.  

Overall, I expected more from the Met.  Service was lacking, very slow however he was friendly when with us. The food was less than what one would expect form a well established well reviewed place like this. 

I don't think I will return as there are far better places (Service and food) that  have similar menus...

Customer 1722.Name: HeatherR
Customer 1722.Content: Michael was a fabulous server, with a wonderful Seahawks tire and a great set of dimples!

Customer 1723.Name: LyndenneG
Customer 1723.Content: Very impressed with the warm, professional and kind service. Our water was always filled, our needs met. The steaks were superior and cooked the way each person requested. The  metropolitan steak house is  food experience, not just dinner. Price is a little steep but so well worth it!!  Wish parking was easier down town.  My husband and I did valet parking but other members of our group had to drive around a bit.

Customer 1724.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1724.Content: Our server Patrick was awesome!! Snow Beef all the way!!

Customer 1725.Name: JonathanK
Customer 1725.Content: Incredible food, service, and atmosphere. Truly a memorable evening!

Customer 1726.Name: VivianR
Customer 1726.Content: I had high hopes for this restaurant (we came from the east side of the state) and had heard great things. We made our reservation approximately 2 months in advance. Our table was right next to the kitchen. There were other tables for two, but we were in the worst spot. First off  my husbands soup was totally forgotten while I was eating my salad.  My Salmon was over cooked and my husbands steak, while good, was nothing special. We were extremely disappointed.

Customer 1727.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1727.Content:
Omg some of the best steaks I have ever had!!!
Service was excellent...

Customer 1728.Name: jada
Customer 1728.Content: We've always loved the Met and it hasn't changed much over the years. The steaks are consistently great as is the service.  We also had a near perfect Old Fashioned, which we have found to be a rare occurrence unless we make it ourselves.

Customer 1729.Name: GaryB
Customer 1729.Content: Being a fairly well travelled person who has had the pleasure of dining in some pretty amazing restaurants, I must say that the Met is absolutely the BEST of the BEST in every respect!  The steaks are incredible, the accompaniments are delicious, and the desserts are to die for!  There is really no way to adequately describe how good this restaurant is!  You simply have to experience it for yourself!

Customer 1730.Name: AppreciatesGreatFood
Customer 1730.Content:
Of the four of us ordering steak, two had perfectly cooked steaks and two had really really underdone steaks/cold.  We planned for an hour and 45 minutes for dinner and finally departed after two full hours- and two undercooked steaks - at one point we hadn’t seen our waiter for 40 minutes.  Root vegetables were not fully cooked either - the flavor would have been fine but they were crunchy and not warm.  
The manager was very apologetic and compensated part of the meal.  The restaurant recently reopened after a remodel- maybe they’re not up to speed yet?  Frankly, there are too many good restaurants in town to repeat this experience.

Customer 1731.Name: NatalieD
Customer 1731.Content: Iconic steak restaurant and I haven't been for a while.  Holiday lunch with family and while the ribeye steak tasted good, it was really thin and presentation was odd with it being so thin.  Large baked potato overshadowed the steak on the plate.  Do not recommend the cheese sauce for the future.  Kobe meatball starter was very nice.

Customer 1734.Name: RobertH
Customer 1734.Content: I had an amazing experience. Our host and wait staff were very professional and the food was outstanding!

Customer 1735.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1735.Content: In all candor , the food was average. The value proposition  was  poor

Customer 1736.Name: BobP
Customer 1736.Content:
Exceptional experience.  Only detractor is the feel like some of the tables are the quality level of a typical banquet table instead of the luxurious feel you would expect.  

Craig Summers (Maitre D') is a pro!  Personality, demeanor, presentation.  Thank you!

Customer 1737.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1737.Content:
In Seattle and looking for a steak place with a great atnosphere...look no further...do not go there if you look fast food..
Place is packed and you need to understand that...use wine masters advice...xcellent. see u next time dudes!!!

Customer 1738.Name: Derek
Customer 1738.Content:
This is the best restaurant in downtown Seattle. The staff are all very professional, the wine list has a wide variety off bottles, from $50 up, and the food is always perfect. 

It is quite expensive, expect to pay around $250 per person with four courses and drinks.

Customer 1739.Name: Brystock
Customer 1739.Content: Our 10-oz Wagyu Filet Mignon was beyond delicious, and the service was excellent. The entire dining experience was delightful.  Great place for celebrating our anniversary.

Customer 1740.Name: Yumsin
Customer 1740.Content: The service was excellent. We had a very attentive, helpful and engaging lady in Marla. We were going out for our Christmas as I was visiting from MN. We had wonderful Cab Franc. My son and his wife each had the ribeye. My granddaughter had the prime rib. The appetizers and sides were great. Every one was pleased with their meal. My own personal disappointment was that the flavor of the small filet I had was a bit bland. Our Bananas Foster was the dramatic and delicious finale.

Customer 1741.Name: hyjude
Customer 1741.Content: Always a favorite.  Have been bringing grandchildren here since they used strollers.  The staff was always kind and understanding.  Of course my kids were always well behaved, even as infants.

Customer 1742.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1742.Content: The Met is truly a special place. The food is very good and the Servers are amazing

Customer 1743.Name: DrBob
Customer 1743.Content: All items on our dinner - drinks, appetizers. Salads, steaks and dessert was outstanding. Service we received was also!!

Customer 1744.Name: TimmyT
Customer 1744.Content:
First, I want to mention I was there for Christmas Eve dinner.  Having a light snow falling in downtown made the evening more festive.

I haven't been to the Met in alittle while because I need to watch what type of protein I eat for my health.  Thinking it would be a nice treat for myself on Christmas Eve to eat a big piece of meat.  
In the beginning, I was properly meet with the server, and he told me all the specials for the evening.  He delivered my appetizer, my drink, and my entree efficiency with grace and nice chatting.  The food is good, I had the bone rib-eye with the largest baked potato I have seen for sometime.  

What bothered me was the lack of attentive care after I finished my entree.  I waited more than 15 minutes after my plate was taken by the bus person before I could order my cheese cake.  Then when I finished my dessert, I waited another 25 minutes plus to get my check.  I don't know if it was being on a holiday evening or the lack to keep up on who the server is covering when they may be preoccupied with another table.  I had to ask the bus person again for assistance.  Everything in beginning was good, but the 3rd act was lacking in service.  It surprised me alittle being this establishment is on the higher end on the price range.  The food is really good, and service from the start was positive.  Just afterwards it left me having doubts on coming back again.  It's possible I need to go there on a non holiday evening or is it possible solo diners are treated differently?

Customer 1745.Name: lovetodine
Customer 1745.Content: The food was fantastic, but our server McKenzie was amazing!  He recognized us from our previous visit in October!. He made great recommendations on our dinner and his service was excellent!

Customer 1746.Name: KMMpm
Customer 1746.Content: Seattle classic. Never a bad meal or experience.

Customer 1747.Name: shauna
Customer 1747.Content: Was supposed to meet up with my brother and newly married wife to celebrate their wedding and both their birthdays but . . . he forgot about our dinner date so we had a nice meal anyway.

Customer 1748.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1748.Content: It was freezing cold and we were about half way in to the room

Customer 1749.Name: Coconut54
Customer 1749.Content: We take our family to the Met for a pre Christmas dinner.  This was our 25th holiday dinner with the family at The Met. The food and cocktails were perfect.  Great time was had by all!!

Customer 1750.Name: TheresaA
Customer 1750.Content: We had a reservation, really recommended, but ended up staying to eat at the bar because we were so comfortable. We came early and Teddy the bartender was taking good care of us. He engaged in a highly educational and fun conversation about the variety of steak options.  Thought we were pretty smart before talking to him, but we gained some really interesting info.  The bill for eating here is high, but we were not disappointed.  For an authentic steak house, with a local flair, we highly recommend the Met.

Customer 1751.Name: Yumyumforeure
Customer 1751.Content:
Everything about this place was beyond delicious and amazing. The food was top notch and beyond expectations. 
If there was one thing that I wish was different it would be that the music could’ve been a tad bit softer. But beyond that, I really wish I could come here everyday

Customer 1752.Name: DrAndy
Customer 1752.Content: Enjoyed our dinner very much. My filet was delicious!

Customer 1753.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1753.Content: As always the food and service at the Metropolitan Grill is beyond compare.  The cuisine and ambiance is first rate.  The bacon wrapper tenderloin with lobster Oscar was hmmmmm.  If you are in Seattle, you must dine at the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 1755.Name: MIch
Customer 1755.Content: As always the food was wonderful.  The bone-in filet is the way to go

Customer 1756.Name: LarisaT
Customer 1756.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a fantastic place to celebrate a special occasion, particularly if you like steak.  That being said, the salmon is my go to and it is delicious.  Allow plenty of time to enjoy the dining experience, it is not the place to 'grab a bite'.

Customer 1757.Name: LauraF
Customer 1757.Content: We told our waitperson we had an event to get to and he assured us our food would be delivered in time for us to make it.  Unfortunately, it was delivered late and my steak was not cooked enough but there was no time to send it back.

Customer 1758.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1758.Content: Outstanding experience. Excellent food, wonderful service. We left full and happy!

Customer 1759.Name: ChristmasOfficeLunch
Customer 1759.Content: Asked for medium well (butterflied), received medium rare, but steak was excellent quality.

Customer 1760.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1760.Content: Everything about The Met was wonderful, except for the location of our table.  It was near the kitchen and the bar, lots of traffic and noise made it hard to enjoy.

Customer 1761.Name: TammieC
Customer 1761.Content: Always enjoy the food and service!

Customer 1762.Name: Jhunterfalk
Customer 1762.Content: They closed to remodel...what remodel? We were seated next to a scratched up wall with an old salad cart and a dish rag... service was slow, food overpriced, and our annual special dinner was a complete disappointment. We left to have dessert at the goldfinch. Sadly, the Met is living off of a dated reputation and needs a re-boot.

Customer 1763.Name: Vici
Customer 1763.Content: As always, the food was delicious!  However, the service was slow.  Perhaps with the holidays, there are more groups eating so that slowed the service?  The last time I was at The Met, the service was also slow.....  I hope this is not a continuing trend.

Customer 1764.Name: Nadia
Customer 1764.Content: My husband and I went for dinner after a Seahawks game, the food is delicious, friendly staff and we got to see some Seahawks players dining there 👍🏼👍🏼

Customer 1765.Name: MissyL
Customer 1765.Content: Amazing food, great service... you get what u pay for here..

Customer 1766.Name: EllieC
Customer 1766.Content: We have eaten here several times, but this was the worst.  We had reservations at 11:00 and were seated at 11:15.  I understand that it was a Seahawk game day and they were very busy.  We ordered our food right away but did not receive our food  until an hour later.  When my burger arrived, it was cold and the fries were barely warm.  Very disappointed, especially since the meal and drinks cost $80.

Customer 1767.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1767.Content: Had a great breakfast before the Seahawks game.  Service was great as always!

Customer 1768.Name: RodM
Customer 1768.Content: We came to the Metropolitan Grill for dinner prior to going to watch the Seattle Symphony.  The Metropolitan Grill has great food and the service was exceptional.

Customer 1769.Name: BRANNEN7
Customer 1769.Content:
My wife and I always dine here when in Seattle. We flew up from Los Angeles for our 22nd Anniversary for one night.  I booked a 5:15pm reservation on Open Table. We quickly got seated in a four person booth in the main dining room to my request even though there were only two of us. I like the extra room especially on a special occasion. The wine selection is incredibly large. We chose a bottle of Duckhorn Cab. My wife had the Filet Oscar and I had the Porterhouse; both great steaks w a side of mash potatoes. For dessert we had the banana Foster's for two presented at table side and took home the Key Lime pie. 
When in Seattle, you have to hit the Met! Didn't have time for the bar, but it's great too!

Customer 1771.Name: Kimmie
Customer 1771.Content: Always stands up to expectations. Never disappoints!

Customer 1775.Name: KarenS
Customer 1775.Content: Perfect place to celebrate a benchmark Birthday. Thank you!

Customer 1776.Name: Kasebier
Customer 1776.Content:
13oz Filet...Excellent...more like 16oz.  Claim best steak in town and that would be difficult to argue about.  Excellent wine list.  Excellent staff.  Bananas Foster so what else can be said.

Highly recommend.

Customer 1777.Name: GolfPro
Customer 1777.Content: "I love the relaxed feel of this place – like a comfortable dining room in a friends home. I definitely would return to try more dishes. The filet mignon - prepares to perfection. Service was well-timed and friendly, all the staff - even the valet service was courteous and prompt.

Customer 1778.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1778.Content:
So me and my gf have been here twice and had completely different experiences. The first time we ordered the filet platter with ohmi, American wagyu, and prime. We also got scallops, and lobster Mac and cheese.  It was perfection all the way around from service to food to ambiance. 

Second time around completely the opposite. The service was slow and the food was meh. We ordered the snow beef which was way below the quality of the ohmi. I’d compare it more to prime. It was also severely under cooked, purplish in the middle. Also ordered the 35 year aged top cap, which was very good (better than the $120 snow beef). It was an unfortunate experience for us because we held met grill in such high regard and recommended it to all our friends. Also it’s pricey for 2 people a couple drinks and food was $400. Honestly the snow beef filet was equal to $60 filets  we’ve had at multiple restaurants and the marbeling left a lot to be desired when compared to ohmi or even American wagyu. We both tend to think we got a prime cut on accident. We’ll chalk this up to a bad day and we’ll give them another chance one day.

Customer 1779.Name: SandraW
Customer 1779.Content:
I want to bathe in the Lobster Bisque.  It's so rich and golden it puts The Donald to shame.  

Three of us ordered the chophouse burger and none of us could eat more than half.  Really delicious beef smothered in my personal fave, onion-bacon jam.  The Met should bottle that stuff and make a fortune.  I'd eat it all by itself, with a spoon, in a dark room.

Customer 1780.Name: LLey
Customer 1780.Content: The Metropolitan is consistently excellent in their enjoyable ambiance, quality service and top-notch food. Our dinner this week was no exception. Nick, our waiter, did a great job in guiding us through the menu and voluminous wine list and ensured we enjoyed our dinner!

Customer 1781.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1781.Content: Chateaubriand was overcooked, medium well instead of medium rare.  For price, should have been better.  The Met clearly hasn't recovered from its remodel- I would pick Daniels Broiler instead.

Customer 1782.Name: JohnS
Customer 1782.Content: Always exceptional service, food and an all star staff.

Customer 1783.Name: Steven
Customer 1783.Content: Great steak house a big cut above the high-end chains.

Customer 1784.Name: Matt
Customer 1784.Content: The  worst experience I have had at the met grill ever.  Took 10  minutes to get our menus.  Then 10 minors to take our orders and 15 minutes to get our food.  My salmon was over cooked.  It then took 15 minors to get the check only after I asked another waiter to find our server.  I used to hold the Met kit as my favorite place for a high class business lunch but after today I’m done!

Customer 1785.Name: BenH
Customer 1785.Content: After many visits over the last decade, i say with confidence that this place knows their beef. From drinks to dessert, I have never had a bad sip or bite. Break out the wallet once and while and treat yourself, you will not be disappointed with the met.

Customer 1786.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1786.Content: Absolutely phenomenal restaurant with a history to match. Food has always been outstanding and worth every penny. Also, if you're a cherries lover, ask for the Cherries Jubilee for dessert (it's a secret option) it's to die for.

Customer 1788.Name: MichelleD
Customer 1788.Content:
Details: Party of 6 at 4:45pm on Sunday, December 10, 2017. 
TL;DR? Read the last paragraph.

My family and I came to the Met for a Christmas feast.
