The Met has a reputation of being a fine dining restaurant and my husband and I were ready to pay the price to treat the family to a very nice, classy meal. Everything was going peachy keen until the first course came. I ordered a spinach salad and as I was picking at my salad for a choice bite, I found a hair. Of course the waiter, Juergen, was extremely apologetic and offered to send a new salad; I just couldn’t eat another morsel. It completely ruined my appetite. The GM (well, who I thought was the GM because he was dressed in a tuxedo) came to the table and apologized profusely—probably because I was morose and the errant hair killed my vibe. You think I’m moody? Well, who wouldn’t get grossed out by something like that? (Questions racing in my head during dinner: What part of the body did this hair come from? Why is it at the bottom of my plate?) I’m just glad our other family members didn’t have an issue—I would have been completely mortified.

In order to remedy the situation, the Met comped my salad, comped the dessert course which consisted of tableside bananas foster, the nine-layer chocolate cake, the white chocolate coconut cake, and a big scoop of the a la carte ice cream. They also comped my mother-in-law’s and my valet tickets. They probably did the absolute best they could in order to fix the first course mishap, which I do appreciate.

Do I think the Met is a fine dining restaurant? No. The website says the dress code is business casual and people are walking in with jeans and hooded sweatshirts (also, the hair issue).
Does the staff care about their customers? Yes. However, you can’t expect to lift the mood of a customer after you start your meal with a hair.
Is the food good? Yes, but be wary. Quality Control in the kitchen isn’t up to snuff, especially at the prices the customer pays to dine there.

Customer 1789.Name: SeaTacGuy
Customer 1789.Content: A wonderful meal, as always. We dine here often, and the food is always very good, the service very attentive. They make us feel special and welcome.

Customer 1790.Name: Vicki
Customer 1790.Content: I have been to the Met probably 13 times over the years.  Until the last visit, the food and service for myself and the others I was with has been great.  This last visit I reluctantly sent my steak back as it was way over-cooked.  They cooked another one and gladly comp'd the steak.  The wait time for all meals was quite long compared to usual and could be because it was Dec. 9th & I've not been there in December before.  It was very busy.  That being said. I will absolutely return. The 2nd steak was perfect and their crab cocktails are the best and I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Customer 1791.Name: Finediner
Customer 1791.Content:
My wife and I dine here frequently. It is our favorite restaurant. The food was exceptional, as always. Our table was near the door on a cold night. We kept getting cold air, cigarette smoke and automobile exhaust in from the door, which, understandably, opened and closed incessantly.  Usually our servers are charismatic and friendly. Our server this time was neither, and seemed rushed and annoyed the entire evening, and wasn't inclined to discuss menu items very much. 
Nevertheless, a fine meal was had. Hopefully next time we'll get a better table and a friendly server!

Customer 1792.Name: Kelseyn7
Customer 1792.Content: I splurged for a fine dining experience for my wonderful boyfriends birthday who loves steak 🥩. We had a lovely staff help us order an amazing steak for two and we had a very cozy, relaxing and fine dining experience being catered to. I had the best steak I have ever had. It was delicious. If you ever want to splurge on a good steak come to the Met! Loved it and worth the money 💰

Customer 1793.Name: janesotto
Customer 1793.Content: We've been to the Metropolitan Grill on five different occasions and every meal was absolutely outstanding.  The wait staff is so professional, courteous and knowledgeable.  They've taken good care of us every time. We live 90 minutes away and it's absolutely worth the drive... It's a special restaurant.

Customer 1794.Name: DanJ
Customer 1794.Content: Roger is fabulous! He always makes the meal so enjoyable. Great food and ambiance.

Customer 1795.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1795.Content: Service was nice! We might visit again!

Customer 1796.Name: CynthiaB
Customer 1796.Content: Great service although he did try to rush us a bit. Good food.

Customer 1797.Name: TerryJ
Customer 1797.Content: I ordered ribeye and scampi prawns.   My wife had prime rib and prawns.  Waiter forgot to bring the prawns and missed my order of prawns completely.  I believe he brought the prawns that had been sitting on the warmer for sometime as they were dry and without the butter.  My steak was cooked to order however both meats must have sat a bit as they came to the table cold.  The table next to us was a party of 6 or 7 and was very loud and used very profane language for our entire meal.  You could tell the staff recognized the situation however chose not to address any of it. Very disappointing night for a well respected restaurant.  Probably will not return.  To many other options.

Customer 1798.Name: 1rishEyz
Customer 1798.Content: Best steak in town.  Tremendous service - fabulous food - great wine list. My favorite place for special occasions with family and friends.  Also great to take clients.

Customer 1799.Name: TerriH
Customer 1799.Content: We really enjoyed our dining experience here and will be back!

Customer 1800.Name: Vici
Customer 1800.Content: The food, as usual, was fabulous!  We must have had a new waiter (I didn't recognize him from previous meals); he made several mistakes - but DID try his best to rectify the long waits and mis-orders by comping us.  I highly recommend the Pear Bread Pudding if you want dessert - more than enough to share!

Customer 1801.Name: AnnieK
Customer 1801.Content: Exceptional service that makes you feel comfortable from the moment you step in off the street. The most notable thing about this place, is the quality of the proteins. Any fish or steak you order may be one of the best you've ever had. The value is well worth the price.

Customer 1802.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1802.Content: My boyfriend and I indulged in the snow beef and the olive beef. They were life changing. Craig was a great maitre d! As always. Will return, again and again!! Thank you!

Customer 1803.Name: KennyL
Customer 1803.Content: The Met has the best steaks and great service.  The lobster mac-n-cheese is a must get side dish and the apple pie desert to out of this world that they cook table-side.

Customer 1804.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1804.Content: Great food, excellent service. Valet parking out front makes it so easy. Not a place to go for a quick bite. The portions are huge, the salad is too big to have with the meal so share one, and you can probably plan for a great meal with leftovers. Entree prices are outside my comfort level for anything but a special occasion, but fair enough for the quality and quantity.  My friends and I totally enjoyed the experience.

Customer 1805.Name: Brian
Customer 1805.Content: Valet guys know me, everyone else forget the VIP thing.  No biggie I guess im not famous just direct business meals there which I could change to another easy.

Customer 1806.Name: JohnT
Customer 1806.Content: We had a  pre-game meal before the  Seahawks game. Food, wine and service was outstanding.  Always enjoy the time when we go to the MET!

Customer 1807.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1807.Content: Waiter was Louie.  Great service and the off the menu selections were our of this world

Customer 1808.Name: MikeB
Customer 1808.Content: As always, great food. Only issue was not a good table.......close to front door so outside table members were chilled most of the night.

Customer 1809.Name: nicktjacob
Customer 1809.Content: The best steakhouse in Seattle. Period. Everything about The Met is first-class, from the food to the service. And if you haven't had the Bananas Foster for dessert, you need to treat yourself the next time you're here for dinner. It will change your world. 10/10.

Customer 1810.Name: HUGE
Customer 1810.Content: Our waiter Roger was truly outstanding!  It’s Obvious that he loves his job. He was energetic he was fine and he made the night and experience that we enjoyed

Customer 1811.Name: Nator
Customer 1811.Content: Wonderful place for a birthday dinner! Best crime brûlée ever!

Customer 1812.Name: jennifern
Customer 1812.Content: We love this place and always go there when we are in Seattle. The steaks are sensational and service is wonderful. It's an old fashioned casual with a formal service that is much appreciated.

Customer 1813.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1813.Content: Glad to have the Met back as a classic Seattle business restaurant.  Even lunch or dinner in the bar is amazing, which I prefer actually.  The bar servers are excellent, have been there for many years and are very welcoming to guests - including returning and new guests.  Favorite lunch business place for me.

Customer 1814.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1814.Content: $60 my strip steak wasn’t very good and only came with one side. Wasn’t a very good value.

Customer 1815.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1815.Content: Best steaks and service my wife and I have had in over 30 years. It has been over 15 years since my wife and I have had a real date night and it was perfect.

Customer 1817.Name: Damian
Customer 1817.Content: Had friends visiting from out of town, ordered the “snow beef” was fanatastic. Get the bananas foster for desert, it’s amazing. Couldn’t be happier with this visit.

Customer 1818.Name: RoderickD
Customer 1818.Content: Server was great! ... Thank you, we'll be back soon!

Customer 1819.Name: Sparks
Customer 1819.Content: I had a business lunch at the Met Grill the other day and it was perfect. Their lunch selection is great, they had really pretty and tasteful holiday decorations and the booth was perfect for the conversation. I would highly recommend

Customer 1820.Name: ytakai
Customer 1820.Content: 1人旅の最終夜に利用。ブログでも１人利用が複数見られるので問題はないと思う。適度に放置してくれるので、居心地が悪いこともない。ただ昼にハンバーガー食べてたのもあり、プライムステーキとオニオンスープ・ビール２杯とデザートを頼んだが、最後は満腹で苦しかった。18時頃の訪問だったが、周りに人通りは少ない。帰りは20時頃だったが、ほとんど歩いている人がいない。ここからスタバの１号店までは歩いて10分ぐらいだったが、危険とは思わなかったが、道中は浮浪者も多かったので注意は必要かと。

Customer 1821.Name: David
Customer 1821.Content: Always a pleasure being at the Met!  Great service in both the restaurant and the bar...warm, friendly environment...not too stuffy!!  Always enjoy being at this exceptional restaurant.

Customer 1822.Name: JeremyW
Customer 1822.Content:
I have to say I was very underwhelmed by our dining experience. The servers were outstanding, prompt and friendly. The drinks were spot on. The calamari appetizer we had was clumpy and doughy. I had the rib cap steak with root vegetables. The steak was cooked nicely but the root vegetables varied from borderline raw to mush. My wife had the bacon wrapped filet and mashed potatoes. I was surprised to see the fillet was cut into 2 very thin portions. I would think that a steak house of this level would understand it is hard to get a perfect medium rare on such thin pieces of meat. Her fillet was medium to medium well. My daughter had the fettuccine with prawns and crab. The prawns were nicely cooked. The amount of crab and prawns was acceptable. The fresh noodles needed another minute or two in the water as they were way too firm. The sauce was greasy and seemed to have broken. 
Our sides were lobster mac and cheese and Brussels sprouts. The top of the mac and cheese had been left under the broiler so long that the  noodles had the texture of raw packaged noodles. The Brussels sprouts were nicely caramelized on the outside but raw crunchy in the middle. 
The desert cakes were the best part of the meal and delicious. 
After reading all the reviews and deciding on eating at the Metropolitan Grill, for the money we spent I would expect that they could figure out how to properly prepare the sides of the meal.  Serving what they call world class steaks with haphazardly thrown together sides is just not acceptable. Very disappointed that our first visit will be our last. We have eaten far superior meals for much less.

Customer 1823.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1823.Content: Ordered steaks were thin and not right cut. I can buy prime steaks at Costco and grill at home much better.

Customer 1824.Name: MarianneE
Customer 1824.Content:
Just the best!
We had 4 appetizer and shared a pasta.
All different, all good.
Very professional service.

Customer 1825.Name: PatriciaH
Customer 1825.Content: Our server was very nice and attentive.  Liked the velvet booth.  Portions are huge.  My only drawback was that we ordered medium rare and the New York came out very rare/fleshy.  I've had better mashed potatoes.

Customer 1826.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1826.Content: everything was great....everything was great....everything was great....everything was great....

Customer 1827.Name: Michaelbrock
Customer 1827.Content: The service was great and you are definitely made to feel like you are special, however the food was nothing special and not worth the money spent. I would not put it much higher than the Keg. Transportation can also be arranged for 10 dollars to any point downtown.

Customer 1828.Name: HelenNW
Customer 1828.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary and asked to be seated in a quieter area. There was a big group across from us and they were being quite loud. The service was really good. The food was pretty good. I was looking forward to the creme brûlée but I regretted it when I got it. My husband had a chocolate lava cake and that was much better. The creme brûlée came warm and running. Not my cup of tea, and I love creme brulee.

Customer 1829.Name: LesW
Customer 1829.Content: Outstanding food, excellent service. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Customer 1830.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1830.Content: We had a very good meal and my wife turn 50 and she looked so beautiul.

Customer 1831.Name: Sweet
Customer 1831.Content: The Met is our favorite place. We have celebrated our anniversary there every year for the last fifteen years. This was just a special night out for us. We had a nice drink in the bar before being seated at a cozy table. Every table has a view of the hustle and bustle. What a great surprise to find that Bruno was taking care of us. We often request a table at Bruno's service area. This time it was just a surprise. Bruno permitted us the leisure we wanted and was superb in his recommendations as I was looking to expand my beef horizons a bit. Likewise Aaron and Lance teamed up to choose a special wine for us after I basically turned them loose to surprise us with something out of my usual choices. A perfect evening all round. WE will be returning soon for our next anniversary celebration as we simply would not consider dining anywhere else.

Customer 1832.Name: BuellH
Customer 1832.Content: My favorite Seattle restaurant. Great decor and service coupled with unbeatable food. Simply outstanding !

Customer 1833.Name: Stefan
Customer 1833.Content: First time there after the remodel, they have really done a nice job, it looks fresh while being authentic and true to themselves. Top notch service and yummy food as always.

Customer 1834.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1834.Content:
Great service at the met. Wanted a special wine and they were able to find the perfect bottle. Nicely done. 
Overall food was good, but our blackened prime rib was only available in med or more done. Should have taken the hint, as both were dry.  Good taste, just far too dry.  The steaks were good. 
Ambience is very good. Right amount of attention from the staff.

Customer 1835.Name: grubber403
Customer 1835.Content:
Had the crab cake app and sirloin waygu burger. Both were rich and delicious. The service at lunchtime was a bit rough, but worth it. If you ask to hurry in/out, they will do their best -service wise which is awesome. 

Mimosa's were made with really good OJ.

Customer 1836.Name: BethT
Customer 1836.Content: We’ve been here several times and really enjoyed it. Lunch today was a disappointment.

Customer 1837.Name: TxSenator
Customer 1837.Content: Newly remodeled Met retains all of the charm of Seattle’s longtime #1 Steakhouse!

Customer 1838.Name: deand
Customer 1838.Content: Delicious filet. Wine was substandard at a premium price. Service was excellent. Sides were tasty but a little too rich. Enjoyed Brooklyn down the street more for half the cost. This restaurant is a once a year visit at best.

Customer 1839.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1839.Content: The Met never fails to live up to the highest ratings.  It is an experience everyone who loves quality beef and can pay a premium for quality service should enjoy.

Customer 1840.Name: AlexC
Customer 1840.Content: I told my friends we would have a Great time and a Great Steak, and no one was disappointed.

Customer 1841.Name: Kpearl
Customer 1841.Content: Fabulous wine list and a great selection of everything meat. The apertizers were awesome. The wait staff was very attentive and loved the atmosphere. Will certainly be back.

Customer 1842.Name: Swingle
Customer 1842.Content: The Met does not disappoint. After all these years it is still one of the iconic restaurants of Seattle. When the servers have been there for a long time (20+ years), you know you are in a place where quality is important in all ways. Plan to spend a paycheck, but know it will be worth every bite!

Customer 1843.Name: dj9033
Customer 1843.Content: Great steakhouse - one of the best in town.  Metropolitan Grill has been around for some time and they do not disappoint.  We were here for our anniversary and tried their 40 oz. bone-in ribeye for two.  It could have fed 4 people easily.  We took 1/2 of it home and enjoyed it the next day as well.  Great friendly service, our server Jim was very pleasant and helpful, got a nice surprise at the end with a special anniversary dessert.  Very happy with the evening

Customer 1844.Name: GGGG
Customer 1844.Content:
excellent beef, as always.  We had a table for six with guests from out of country co-celebrating an upcoming important event.  

The sommelier was chatty but well informed.  

Unfortunately, the wait staff seemed rushed, harried, and at one point, they actually bickered with each other in front of everyone as the beef was being cut at the table.   The young man replenishing water and clearing the table interrupted conversations repeatedly (by leaning in front of the persons speaking as he filled water glasses).  The waitress spilled a glass of red wine over one of our guests. 

I would come back, as we have several times in the past, but the wait captain needs to have a long talk with several of the staff.

Customer 1845.Name: Brian
Customer 1845.Content: As vip, forgot my VIP stuff again and kept spilling water or drinks on me.  Service slipping???

Customer 1846.Name: Stickman
Customer 1846.Content: We were very pleased with our meal choices - the Beef Stroganoff Thursday special, Filet Mignon, and the French Onion Soup and Salad.

Customer 1847.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1847.Content: I was entertaining a business guest. I ordered the SW salad with calamari. The salad was over dressed and soggy; the calamari was over cooked, tough and cold. My guest enjoyed his steak sandwich and was gracious enough to not ask about me not eating half of my salad.

Customer 1848.Name: TerryO
Customer 1848.Content:
We booked a table to celebrate a birthday,we arrived quite early but this was no problem for the restaurant. We were shown to our table and our server Dhoia greeted us warmly before giving us our menus. Dhoia was attentive and informative without being intrusive as she took our orders and served our meals.Her pleasant disposition added to our overall dining experience. 
Thank you.

Customer 1849.Name: Avery
Customer 1849.Content: The atmosphere and food was to die for! However our server took 20 minutes to bring us our drinks and were hovering over us when we were finishing to take our plates and that left a bad taste in my mouth.

Customer 1850.Name: steveLiu
Customer 1850.Content: nice service, delicious food, good environment.....this is a very good place for people to date or small party

Customer 1851.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1851.Content: Always good, one thing , I don't get the cheez wizz offered to be poured on ?????

Customer 1852.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1852.Content: Marla and Steve gave amazing service.  Time for interior renovation to get up with the times.  Needs fresh hip.feel and upgrade to seats, carpet, curtains.

Customer 1853.Name: lovetodine
Customer 1853.Content: We were hesitant to go here, but we decided to try again after bad experience with a host last December.  This time our hostess was great (friendly and greeted us) and seated promptly.  Our sever was Mackenzie and he was fantastic too.  Our overall experience was great for our god son's first experience at this restaurant.

Customer 1854.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1854.Content:
Best beef dishes in Seattle.  All items are top level in quality and presentation.
The room is East Coat/European paneling and brass railing, white table cloth and formally attired wait staff.  Great value for a traditional meal in a traditional setting.

Customer 1855.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1855.Content: We were here for my husband’s birthday. Metropolitan Grill did not disappoint. The steak was delicious! The best so far in the City we’ve gone and tried. We will definitely come back.

Customer 1856.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1856.Content: This was my 60th Birthday and I could not have choosen a more fabulous place!!  From the carpaccio and beef tartare appetizer to the phenomenal Japanese Ohmi filet and so much more!!  The service was ultimately professional.  A wonderful memory!!!

Customer 1857.Name: SZlikesfood
Customer 1857.Content: We stopped by for dessert and a drink. We were sad that cherries jubilee was taken off the menu, but the bananas foster was to die for. So sweet and delicious. We also had a few cocktails, and they were strong yet tasty. The staff was very kind and sympathized with us about the missing dessert item.

Customer 1858.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1858.Content: I had made reservation for my husband and I to celebrate his homecoming from a deployment.  We were seated right way, our server Noi was very helpful with picking out drinks and explaining some of the menu items,we had never been to the restaurant before.  Everything came in a timely manner, and Noi made sure to check in on us.  The best part of dinner was the amazing, mouth watering ohmi filet I had.  I'm so happy I decided to try it. Highly recommend.  At the end when we were looking for a dessert, Noi walks over and places a burnt cream on the table and thanks my husband for his service.  That warmed my heart and I thank you Noi for your kind gesture.  Overall one the best experience we have had at a restaurant.   We will be coming back.

Customer 1859.Content: We had a wonderful time celebrating a friends birthday!  Marla our server was great!

Customer 1860.Name: Karen
Customer 1860.Content: We have dined at Metropolitan Grill several times and have found it to be a lovely experience. However, I do think the prices are a bit on the heavy side. The dinners are nice, though, just spendy.

Customer 1861.Name: friends
Customer 1861.Content: Came here for my boyfriend's birthday, and we had a wonderful experience. The service was excellent (and I find this level of service rare in Seattle), and the food was high quality and delicious. We ordered the lobster mac and cheese, almond-crusted scallops, and a spinach salad as appetizers and everything was great. We also got the ribeye steak and pot roast- it was a ton of food, but well worth it. The ribeye was the best I've ever had. The atmosphere reminds me of the "old school" style restaurants I used to go to in New York and New Jersey when I was a kid. It's cozy and welcoming and comfortable. The waiter was friendly and got to know us as people, which is important to me. We even found out he's our neighbor! I was also impressed that they surprised us with a birthday crème brûlée. Very great experience! Thank you.

Customer 1862.Name: DianneD
Customer 1862.Content: Excellent, my go to place for lunch meetings, celebrating client or staff appreciation events. You always know the food, service and atmosphere is always the very best.

Customer 1863.Name: rez42
Customer 1863.Content: Unfortunately the last wo Times I️ have had lunch at The Met it has been disappointing. The food has been cold, steak was over cooked and overall service fell below expectations. I hope they correct things as I do like The Met.

Customer 1864.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1864.Content: Kevin Bosley was great! He always takes great care of us and made sure Dianne’s bday was the best!

Customer 1865.Name: MichaelS
Customer 1865.Content: My 2nd visit in last few months, visiting from out of country. Had a reservation and was awarded a terrible table when many others were available. Was placed adjacent a servers cart which was moved in & out and when speaking to the Host, he said it was going to do that. He did not offer a substitute table (clearly available) or really cared. The serving table was actually used  for placing dirty dishes and cardboard boxes for take home leftovers that we were able to view throughout the dining experience. So, if you want to go to a place that thinks you should thank them for being able to eat there, this is your place. The low score on ambience is a reflection of this experience. The Sommelier said nothing when opening the wine, was disinterested when I commented on the wine (did not respond) and I guess cause my bottle was only $90.  My 1st visit was more enjoyable. The waiter was better but not particularly engaged but if not for him service would be 1 star. We also ate at Shucker's and Capitol Grill on this trip and both were far more inviting, interactive and enjoyable. Not sure I will be back to test the 3 is the charm. Food was good+ but not spectacular.

Customer 1867.Name: notquiteafoodie
Customer 1867.Content: Business lunch - I hadn't been here for a couple years, but still love the food. Ambience is a little dated and could use a little refresh, but food is incredibly well  prepared and generously portioned.  Wait staff is typically great - ours was a little less attentive than usual, but did not affect our meal.

Customer 1868.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1868.Content: I was expecting fine dining, but this wasn't the case. The presentation of the food was worse than a chain restaurant and the cut of meat I had (Top Sirloin) was not what I thought it would be.

Customer 1869.Name: JohnH
Customer 1869.Content:
VERY HAPPY OVERALL THE SERVICE IS ALWAYS GOOD AND THE FOOD IS AMAZING
THE BEST STEAK IN TOWN

Customer 1870.Name: ElaineD
Customer 1870.Content: I've dined at The Met Grill numerous times, & each time the wait staff is super attentive and the food is delicious!! Always a treat!! :))

Customer 1871.Name: PLTJ
Customer 1871.Content: Great dinner. Large portions. Roger was our server and was very personable.

Customer 1872.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1872.Content: I got fist-bumped by Russell Wilson while sitting at my table at the Met Grill; great place to go post game!

Customer 1873.Name: Keith
Customer 1873.Content: We always love The Met!  We go every Sunday before the Seahawks play.

Customer 1874.Name: rcgh
Customer 1874.Content: I was excited to take some out of town friends to the pre-Seahawk brunch the Metropolitan Grill is hosting prior to Seahawks early home games.  We had a reservation and were seated quickly, and water was served on the table immediately.  We didn’t see our server for another 10 minutes, and when he did come by he apologized for not being by sooner and thanked us for our patience... And said he’d be back soon... He returned 10 minutes later and we placed all orders- drinks, appetizers and meal - as we had no idea when he’d be back.  The drinks came a while later and they got one wrong, but quickly fixed it... Then we had the burger cut into 1/4s to share as an appetizer and it was perfect.  Then our meals were served.  Three of us had bagels with lox, and one had a scramble.  The scramble was ok... Nothing special, but ok.  The bagels were terrible.  All were hard, but one in particular was inedible... it was as if it had been stale, and then toasted too much, and then sat out until it cooled.  It was seriously too hard to eat... the “fixings” with it (lox, onion, cream cheese, etc.) were ok, but nothing special.  The other two bagels were also awful, but not as bad... It was truly disappointing.  We chose not to complain or send the bagels   back as we needed to get to the game - and everything had taken so long already.  We won’t make the mistake to go to the Met again.  We stopped at The Cherry Street Public House today for breakfast, and their “salmon toast”, which is served on a bagel, was perfect... It was as good as we should have been served at The Met.

Customer 1875.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1875.Content: This is a stable for Brunch for us before a Seahawks Game! Enjoyable experience with good food. Hope you bring back the Hanger Steak next season.

Customer 1876.Name: LosMachucAs
Customer 1876.Content: Phay was our server, if I remembered his name correctly. He was super nice and extremely knowledgeable/helpful! All the staff was super nice. The food was absolutely amazing! We had the blackened prime rib, macaroni and cheese, asparagus, and almond crusted scallops. And looking over at other tables and other peoples happy faces made us want everything on the menu! HAHA!  The wine list was impressive and extensive! Atmosphere was beautiful and cozy for our date. We will definitely be coming back and recommending to everyone!

Customer 1877.Name: JamesM
Customer 1877.Content: Steaks were great!!! The sides were horrible. Mashed potatoes were dry and hard and the veggies looked like they got it out of the dirt. Can’t complain about the steaks we had because they were the best we ever had. Scallop appetizer had no flavor. Waiter asked if they were good we said no and he said no problem I will get U something else. So we ordered the prawn cocktail and that was really good! Thought he would take it off the bill but he didn’t. Spending $100 a plate and an overall bill of around $450 and not including the tip I gave the waiter. I should’ve wrote this review when we were there last year at this time. We will be in Seattle next weekend celebrating my wife’s birthday again but not sure we will return.

Customer 1878.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1878.Content: Craig Was Great. Very friendly made our night. made my daughters birthday very special.

Customer 1879.Name: tbaseball21
Customer 1879.Content: Have visited a few times for anniversary dinner.  Enjoyed good and scenery.

Customer 1880.Name: willgoagain
Customer 1880.Content: Food was good, as was the server, however, it did take a very long time for the main course to come out.  Booth seating for four was quite cramped.

Customer 1881.Name: TONYE
Customer 1881.Content: I hadn’t been here for maybe 5 years but once again this place was amazing. The wait staff is friendly and always asking if we were happy. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a really good steak and doesn’t mind paying good money for it. This was our anniversary and we were given a free desert which was nice. If you get the chance, go.

Customer 1882.Name: kirkak
Customer 1882.Content: Our party of 5 had a great waiter. The food was solid, as expected. However, the sommelier was arrogant and not helpful. I was disappointed with the stemware as well as not having a true wine decanter for one of our wines which truly needed it. Our second wine arrived after we had started our meals and without any time for aeration . The response from the sommelier when we asked was that "people change their minds". This was the only negative aspect of our dining experience. It was a significant enough negative experience that I did relay it to the dining room manager.

Customer 1883.Name: Adele
Customer 1883.Content: The Metropolitan Grill does not disappoint!.. We had a fantastic evening spending a couple hours enjoying wine, a delicious appetizer, excellent steak and seafood entrees, authentic ny cheesecake, and a perfectly prepared cappuccino to top it all off... Our server, Mike, was a true pro!!! Lovely...

Customer 1884.Name: ThomasW
Customer 1884.Content: An unbelievable experience definitely going to be on my stops next time I'm in Seattle

Customer 1885.Name: DianneD
Customer 1885.Content: Love it at the Met....Thank you for making my Birthday special.

Customer 1886.Name: MatthewW
Customer 1886.Content: Business lunch with a long time colleague. Excellent beer cheese soup. Quiet November day. Service was excellent. One of my all time favorite places to go.

Customer 1887.Name: BrentDavidFraser
Customer 1887.Content: The most impressive, high quality service I've ever had at the Met, in all of many times I've dined there of the years. It reached this level of service because of Todd, our server, who has done his work there for 19 years and is incomparable. Todd is an ARTIST at work, not simply a good server or waiter, but a superior caliber person and an unparalleled exemplar of what truly expert "service" can be. I can wait to go back just to see him and enjoy another exceptional experience.

Customer 1888.Name: Private
Customer 1888.Content: Really impressed one of the best steak houses I have ever had the pleasure of dining at!

Customer 1889.Name: DianneD
Customer 1889.Content: Dohui was great, remembers how I want my food prepared. Great Service.

Customer 1890.Name: Thrive
Customer 1890.Content: It was a wonderful lunch and the service and food was the very best.  Love the attention to detail and quality of the food.

Customer 1891.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1891.Content: We always make it a habit to get reservations on Sunday nights after Seahawks games - we come from out of town, so we're not able to go to "The Met" more often. As usual, we were not disappointed! We love this restaurant.... Noi is an awesome server, and took very good care of us. I had the prime rib, which was done to perfection (I like "well", and it had just the slightest bit of pink, and was perfect);  my wife had the salmon and said it was the best she had ever eaten! To top all of this off, we had the chance to congratulate Russell Wilson (and his wife Ciara) on a great win that day! Russell is often seen there on game days, having dinner with family and friends after the game.  It was awesome all the way around! We'll definitely be back!

Customer 1892.Name: KirstenF
Customer 1892.Content: Spectacular service and delicious food. It’s noisy - so I wouldn’t recommend for romance. But part of the noise is fun, busy, celebratory — so if that is the mood you want, it is totally 5-stars all around.

Customer 1893.Name: NikiW
Customer 1893.Content: Great night with great food and service.  We had a prime table!  Awesome

Customer 1894.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1894.Content: Honestly, we were expecting a nice quiet dinner with good food for my girlfriend's birthday and the food was ok.  Some employee came by our table 6 times trying to remove our plates from our table with food still on them, our mouths chewing, obviously we were not finished eating. Was annoying!  He couldn't tell us what the 2 types of steak were on the Porterhouse, never got back to us on it.  Disappointing, we were over for the weekend for a special occasion and could have eaten anywhere.  Won't be back!

Customer 1895.Name: Max1
Customer 1895.Content: As usual the MG never disappoints. Best steakhouse on the west coast with the finest customer service professionals I've ever encounterd. And the quality of the food is unsurpassed.

Customer 1896.Name: ssflash
Customer 1896.Content:
Amazing food, love the 'Top Cap'
steak. Our waiter, Todd, is the best!

Customer 1897.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1897.Content: The best food and service we have ever had!  It is expensive, but worth it.

Customer 1898.Name: AnnaH
Customer 1898.Content:
Best Steaks in town, Service amazing!
We ll come back!

Customer 1899.Name: Cedarislander
Customer 1899.Content: Good service.  Great food done exactly ask ordered.

Customer 1900.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1900.Content: Outstanding food and impeccable service as always!!!

Customer 1901.Name: KeithW
Customer 1901.Content: Great food great service great quality definitely will return again

Customer 1902.Name: sunshine
Customer 1902.Content: We’ve loved the Met for 25 plus yrs. Always great food with great service (Bruno was our waiter this time-he was great). Only one bad experience so that’s a great record. We ask each other where to go for special occasions and we always come back to the Met. Awesome place

Customer 1903.Name: couples
Customer 1903.Content: We had an exceptionally nice and professional waitress. The sommelier was also excellent and attentive. This is a very good steak house- but get a place in the back with less noise if you want to talk.

Customer 1904.Name: KelleyU
Customer 1904.Content: As always, the Metropolitan Grill served meat that melted in your mouth.  The server was responsive and helpful, and knew when to stay away so that we could have a conversation. There's enough noise so that you can have a private conversation but without yelling across the table. In my opinion you cannot beat the Met for a business lunch.

Customer 1905.Name: CharlesM
Customer 1905.Content: Restaurant was ok. Nothing really stood out. Just your average steak house

Customer 1906.Name: Danele
Customer 1906.Content: Amazing steak, old school ambiance, well worth the treat for my partner's birthday! The remodel is gorgeous and well-done. It's still the same Met, but freshened up. I can't wait to go back.

Customer 1907.Name: DiningExtravaganza
Customer 1907.Content: Metropolitan Grill had some of the best steaks that I ever ate in my entire life.  The service was spot-on and the food was delicious.  Definitely recommend to anyone that loves steak.

Customer 1908.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1908.Content: My husband and I love The Met and have been going for years, but this last visit was exceptional.  We both opted to try the buffalo and are so glad we did.  It was perfectly prepared, juicy, tender and flavorful.  Vanessa was our waitress and was attentive and friendly, while giving us plenty of space to enjoy our evening.  What was shaping up to be an already wonderful evening was tipped to incredible when Aaron, the wine manager, stopped by our table and spent twenty minutes showing us around sauternes for dessert.  Can't recommend this iconic Seattle restaurant enough.  Top notch!

Customer 1909.Name: RichardN
Customer 1909.Content: Great meal and experience.  Service was excellent.  Not cheap but well worth the money for a great evening!

Customer 1910.Name: EricS
Customer 1910.Content: Great steak (rib eye), service was outstanding, wine list was like a phone book, price was on the high side easy $100 per person, based on what you get it is a value. So if you are looking for a great meal, spendy meal, this is the place, feeling like you dropped $200 but got $200 worthy of service and food.

Customer 1911.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1911.Content:
First visit in Seattle for dinner. Ordered the filet medium well at server's suggestion. Arrived at the table well done which she immediately noticed. Took them away and brought back a properly prepared filet that I would describe as OK but not a $59 steak. Side of  cauliflower was undercooked and flavorless. Spinach salad was excellent. 
Server Kimberlee was among the best I've had anywhere. Perhaps we caught the kitchen on an off night.

Customer 1912.Name: KaraS
Customer 1912.Content: Fabulous dinner!  Wonderful server Kimberly!  We had a lovely, leisurely dinner,  no rush.

Customer 1913.Name: Wriggy
Customer 1913.Content: Fabulous steaks and fish. Love their appetizers and shared sides. Big baked potato and their beer cheese sauce is a must. Good but pricey wine list. You have to look hard for reasonably priced wine but they are there. Desserts are good, bananas foster is special. Service is terrific. Overall, prices are really high but still my favorite Seattle restaurant by far.

Customer 1914.Name: Armenin2001
Customer 1914.Content: Very nice place for great steaks and somewhat formal dining.

Customer 1915.Name: TJ43
Customer 1915.Content: This is just a great,authentic restaurant!  Dry cifficult to beat the quality of the steak. This toppped of our visit to Seattle along with the Brooklyn and Tulio. Look forward to our next visit. This place is a must for serious dining.

Customer 1916.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1916.Content: It was excellent. Will go back again.

Customer 1917.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1917.Content: I wanted to make our last meal in Seattle special. Checking Open table for suggestions and reading reviews I decided to book The Metropolitan Grill. I was a little apprehensive that it might be a little too upmarket, but was soon put at ease by the warm friendly welcome.  Our waiting staff were absolutely fantastic, especially when ordering our dishes and giving recommendations . I had seen other reviews about the "Chateaubriand" and was informed that this would not only be an excellent choice but also experience.  So we ordered the Dungeness & Alaskan King crab cakes, the Almond crusted Scallops & the "Chateaubriand". The wine waiter provided assistance on choosing an excellent red to accompany our dish and we had the best meal ever! The staff make sure your experience is simply the best. We loved having the Chateaubriand carved at our table as  the person carving it was thoroughly engaging & entertaining albeit quite serious about his responsibility. Sadly but as expected we were unable to order desserts. This experience does not come cheap but in our opinion, it was the best money  ever spent on a dining out experience in 33 years. Thanks to all at The Metropolitan Grill, Seattle.

Customer 1919.Name: DalenP
Customer 1919.Content: Amazing as usual, has the snow beef you've not had a good steak until you've tried their snow beef, only 2 places in the US serve it and we are lucky enough to have one of those in our area. Our server Nick  as too notch and has been out waiter before. Highly recommended.

Customer 1920.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1920.Content: Anniversary everyone was friendly great staff. Recommend this restaurant to everyone!!!

Customer 1921.Name: JOBU
Customer 1921.Content: Phenomenal as always. Had the pleasure of being to the Met a few times and it has never disappointed.  Service, food and ambiance are all top notch.

Customer 1922.Name: Dral4pets
Customer 1922.Content: The food and service fall short of a high end steakhouse, although the prices are what you'd pay at Capital Grille, Ruth Chris, or Flemings. The menu is extensive, the ambience is that of a traditional steakhouse, and the servers are all in tuxedos. However, the ribeye steak was decidedly average. The waiter was not as attentive as we expected, and presented the bill while we were still eating, a faux pas. The desserts are wonderful. We had the bananas foster prepared tableside, which was excellent.

Customer 1923.Name: Nukegirl
Customer 1923.Content:
Normally I would rate this place a 5 star but my salmon was not cooked all the way through.
It’s a great place for a special occasion or once a year kind of thing.  Prices are pretty high not to have the experience with my food be better.  
We were celebrating a birthday, which we mentioned to our waitress, and we didn’t get a complimentary dessert offer.
I was bummed.

Customer 1924.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1924.Content: Very good place been going for years. Now is a FANTASTIC waiter always knows what's the specials are all the time and gives great recommendations

Customer 1925.Name: KenL
Customer 1925.Content: Steaks were excellent, service was excellent. A bit pricey but we expected that. We haven’t been here for about 25 years, I remember that meal just like I will remember this one.

Customer 1926.Name: arikohn
Customer 1926.Content: This lunch was to celebrate a friend's 500th birthday.  It was a special occasion for her.  The Metropolitan Grill made it super special with 200% attentive wonderful service - which I very, very much appreciated.  I left a $30.00 tip, but thinking back on it should have left a $50.00 tip.  Extraordinary service for which I am grateful!  Ari Kohn

Customer 1927.Name: Vici
Customer 1927.Content: Marlyn, our server, was great as always!  The wait was a little long, but we were there during the lunch crush.  We all chose the soup and sandwich deal and were VERY happy with our meals!  Thanks Met!

Customer 1928.Name: MBP23
Customer 1928.Content: Always the best. We go to the Met for the service because it is the most classic high level of service you don't get ANYWHERE else....the food isn't horrible either. :)

Customer 1929.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1929.Content: Absolutely fantastic experience all around. We were visiting from California and the metropolitan grill came highly recommended. As expected nothing was less than top notch. From the appetizers to our steaks and dessert. Todd was our server and guided us through the menu like a Sherpa. Thank you for such a memorable experience!

Customer 1930.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1930.Content:
I have been to the Metropolitan several times in the past and again it did not disappoint.
The service was excellent, very attentive to every request.  All four meals were cooked as ordered and everyone was completely satisfied with the results.  The steak in particular was tender and flavorful.  The desert was huge and one item was plenty for all to enjoy!

Customer 1931.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1931.Content: The food was great , put over priced in my opinion. From what I heard I guess unexpected more!

Customer 1932.Name: DianneD
Customer 1932.Content: I am able to depend on excellent food preparation and presentation as well as being served by Kevin who is very attentive.

Customer 1934.Name: EBoje
Customer 1934.Content: Another great experience at the Metropolitan Grill. Allways worth a visit everytime I am in Seattle.

Customer 1935.Name: Lorenzo
Customer 1935.Content: Great steaks & Awesome service! The wife & I have been making The Met our birthday go to restaurant  for the past 3 years.  Highly recommended for great Steaks, service & to top it off their banana foster for dessert!

Customer 1936.Name: RACHN
Customer 1936.Content: Food was good, steak was tender, however it was very plain. Garlic mashed potatoes were delicious. Cheesecake was good, however the berry sauce overpowered the dessert. Service was wonderful. Atmosphere was perfect for the occasion.

Customer 1937.Name: DanS
Customer 1937.Content: Had a great experience.   Very accommodating to schedule.   Roger was an excellent server.    Everything me was attentive.

Customer 1938.Name: CoopsReview
Customer 1938.Content: This has been a long time "go-to" old school favorite in Seattle.  I've never been disappointed at the Met Grill

Customer 1939.Name: Dennis
Customer 1939.Content: Great first-time experience.  Food was outstanding. Our waiter, Todd, knew more about steak than any waiter we’ve ever encountered.  We walked away saying Todd was the best waiter of anywhere we’ve ever dined, and we are frequent diners.

Customer 1940.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1940.Content: The food, service and experience was fantastic. My wife and I went here to celebrate our first anniversary together and we wouldn’t have changed a thing. We had Todd as our server who was a wealth of knowledge and extremely helpful throughout our time. We will definitely be returning.

Customer 1941.Name: Clams
Customer 1941.Content: The level of food quality is great. It is pricey but the food and service are very good. Also great house wine selection.

Customer 1942.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1942.Content: Fantastic we had the Russell wilson private room epic night with great friends after a great win by the hawks!!

Customer 1943.Name: JohnL
Customer 1943.Content: The worst waiter service I have ever experienced.  I have dined out at many fine dining restaurants, and have never experienced such poor service.  Incredibly disappointing!!!!!

Customer 1944.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1944.Content: Our waiter was great, very attentive and accommodating. The food was great. Quick service. It is pricy, so I would say it's a restaurant for special occasion or date.

Customer 1946.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1946.Content: We enjoyed an excellent, wonderful birthday celebration dinner.   The food and staff were both over the top.

Customer 1947.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1947.Content: Excellent service. Very pricey, but superior quality. Incredible filet mignon

Customer 1948.Name: KadinS
Customer 1948.Content: Arrived a little early and were seated right away. All the wait staff were very friendly and attentive. Food was delicious and cooked perfectly. Our waiter saw cards on the table, asked what our special occasion was and brought us a tasty dessert on the house :) great service!

Customer 1949.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1949.Content: Great restaurant. Great staff. We was looked af

Customer 1950.Name: ShattR
Customer 1950.Content:
Exceptional food !!
We had the the wegyu fillet and it was incredible. 

Great time !

Customer 1951.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1951.Content:
The food was amazing!  I don't usually order steaks in a restaurant as they rarely taste as good as my own, but this was the best.  My ribeye was moist, deeply flavorful and cooked perfectly.  There were good choices for my vegetarian wife (the potato pancakes were great, but not as good as mama's latkes).  The Old Fashioned I ordered was top notch and the wine list is extensive.  Oh, and the chocolate cake was decadent.  Dinner wasn't cheap (especially for two public school teachers) but the portions were generous and worth the splurge. 

Topping it all off was the great treatment we received from the staff.  Our waiter was  personable, there when we needed him and gone when we didn't.   I wish I remembered his name so I could compliment him  publicly. The busser was also very pleasant and unobtrusive.

Customer 1952.Name: KimM
Customer 1952.Content: Huge Rib-eye to split was too big for two less than burley men, but was excellent.  Sides were very good as well.  Raucous on a Friday night and it isn't cheap.  Service was good.

Customer 1953.Name: MindyP
Customer 1953.Content: Beautiful meal with amazing service by Bruno (one of the best waiters we've ever had!)

Customer 1954.Name: Tony
Customer 1954.Content: As always, fantastic steaks and even better service, I have never had a bad meal or bad service at the Met

Customer 1955.Name: Gojoman
Customer 1955.Content: Service was excellent!  Food was very good!

Customer 1956.Name: JBC2014
Customer 1956.Content: I was so disappointed in our experience that we will not return. My husband and I made a reservation to celebrate our 26th wedding anniversary and we're seated at the time of our reservation. It was the  35 minutes before we were acknowledged by our server and our order was taken. The service was inattentive and arrogant, when it occurred. We've eaten and many high-end restaurants and have never experienced something so disappointing. The food was good, but was overshadowed by the poor service.  This was a major fail by a place that should be better.

Customer 1957.Name: CarolynP
Customer 1957.Content: The food was great and the service was excellent.  Whenever we're back in Seattle, we'll certainly visit again.

Customer 1958.Name: DianneD
Customer 1958.Content: The refurbishing really was well done, I will be excited to see when it is refinished.

Customer 1959.Name: cidriveu
Customer 1959.Content:
Exceptional from the cocktails & apps 
My crab cakes moist succulent lightly fried with a crisp coating . We then had American wagayu , ohmi beef,  prime beef 3 different types of beef added to the excitement to compare! A must try for all who love fork tender cooked to perfection beef!!  Garlic mashed! Brussel Sprouts with bacon outstanding!

Customer 1960.Name: WendyR
Customer 1960.Content: Food was very tasty.  Had the pork shank and it was prepared perfectly. Wait staff was attentive but not overly attentive.  Allowed my guest and I to have a wonderful visit .  Love coming here.

Customer 1961.Name: SteveT
Customer 1961.Content:
Steak was cold and mashed potatoes were cold.
I'm  always saddened when a steakhouse can't deliver hot food to the table-I would think that's restaurant 101. The sommelier and waiter were very personal and knowledgable.  At least at Ruth's Chris you know the steak will be hot!

Customer 1962.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1962.Content: The food was awesome! I had the New York strip with peppercorn medium, and it was excellent. My girlfriend had the prime rib Cajun style and the was just as good!

Customer 1963.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1963.Content:
We were sat at a booth that was too tight, then we were moved downstairs to a table & chair area . Was not given the oppty to be sat at another boot not as tight.  This new area felt like a cafeteria. I like my steak medium but was told medium well would be pink all over. Since I like my steak pink in the middle I went with well done which was not pink in the middle instead there was no pink at all & the steak was dry, besides the fact that the piece I got was thin it also had fat all around the edge so basically leaving very little steak to eat as I don't eat the fat. Very very disappointed. Then for some reason I was served a potatoe soaked with butter already in it, when I told the waiter I didn't want butter in my potatoe he said "ok I'll go grab you another potatoe" and he did but it was almost cold, not fresh out of the oven. Then he slopped a huge amount of sour cream on top making it worst. A plate that cost +$70's
For a potatoe & steak should at least have a hot  Potatoe not one that has been seating around for a while.

Customer 1964.Name: NYLADY
Customer 1964.Content: As always, this establishment has the BEST steaks in TOWN!!! Undeniably a class act on all levels. We love coming here for our special occasions and always look forward to the next time!  Thank you for making my husband's birthday more special that ever!

Customer 1965.Name: DerekB
Customer 1965.Content:
I went to the Met with my kids for a birthday celebration and the steaks were great. Cooked perfectly, and delicious! The sides were ok, not great. They seemed kind of tired - like they'd been sitting on the plate waiting for the steaks to show up. 

Overall, my rating would be 4 stars, even though it was a bit pricey. But when the bill arrived, I noticed that they had added a 3% surcharge, and in bold letters, "THIS IS NOT A GRATUITY". Well, what is it then? Why don't they just make the menu items cost 3% more and be honest about the prices? I guess I should be grateful it wasn't a 50% surcharge?

So no, I won't be returning, because a surprise 3% surcharge (or any percentage) is an insult. 

I wonder if they would have appreciated it if I simply deducted an automatic 10% patronage discount?

Customer 1966.Name: Kyle
Customer 1966.Content: Food and service were phenomenal.  We would be back for the delicious food alone, but the staff took great care of my wife and me on our first anniversary as well. We will certainly be telling our friends and family about our great experience and will be back again in the future.

Customer 1967.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1967.Content: Expensive for what we got.  Potatoes were cold and meat was tough.... not what I was expecting for that type of priced meal.

Customer 1968.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1968.Content: Wanted a nice meal to treat my parents before a show, since they've done so much for me and I can afford it for the first time. It was just the atmosphere and quality I wanted: white coat service, knowledgeable, polite, and engaging staff, velvet booths and old world charm that can only be found at independent steak houses like these. Our steaks were excellent, make sure to have your server walk you through the menu and their "doneness" levels, since different places have different standards. I had the R&R filet and brussel sprouts, both fantastic. My mom's lobster bisque was some of the best I've tasted, clearly crafted with care. Our reservation was very early, but the room got fuller and louder as time went on. HUGE space but well designed seating imo so you don't feel too crowded in. Head here for a taste of an established Seattle institution.

Customer 1969.Name: caligirl12
Customer 1969.Content: Ordering a steak here is a must. The choice of beef and different cuts is phenomenal!! The staff is very knowledgeable if you're not sure  what to order. This was my first, but not last, time eating here.

Customer 1970.Name: Robin
Customer 1970.Content: Our server forgot to bring a couple things, but overall it was a good experience.

Customer 1971.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1971.Content: Hands down the best place you can eat within walking distance from the Seattle ferry!

Customer 1972.Name: SarahKatz
Customer 1972.Content: All four of our steaks were not as ordered. One we asked for medium, it was rare. The other two were ordered medium rare, both were very well done. Disappointed in paying so much for not cooked as we ordered them.

Customer 1973.Name: Piggy98168
Customer 1973.Content:
So excited that the Met Grill has reopened (after closing for several months to remodel kitchen).  I am disappointed that they did not update dining room décor but I understand them not wanting to mess with the classic steak house feel.  

Went here with friends from work.  Great lunch menu-something for everyone, great service (in and out in an hour without feeling rushed).  Affordable prices for top quality food.  

I will certainly be back.

Customer 1974.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1974.Content: Always a good steak. Nice staff location to everything

Customer 1975.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1975.Content: Service was excellent, food was nothing special and have had better in local restaurants.  Not worth the trouble of downtown Seattle or the very high price tag that comes with the food.

Customer 1976.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1976.Content:
One of the best afternoon lunches with my wife ever! The food is phenomenal, especially the filet with mashed potatoes and asparagus ! Kudos to the chef! The wine, a bottle of private label cab was spot on! Washington wine too! The server was friendly, responsive and conversational, which made the lunch a good experience ! 
My wife and I have traveled the globe, have had many, many delicious dishes and dinning experiences... this meal, this day was one of the top 5 best! 
Thanks Metropolitan Grill, and staff, for being on top of your game!

Customer 1977.Name: PatrickM
Customer 1977.Content: Totally exceptional. Splurge on the Wagyu. Worth it!

Customer 1978.Name: Brian
Customer 1978.Content: Favorite place in Seattle, service is amazing, staff is awesome, the valet guys are the best

Customer 1979.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1979.Content: Best steak I've had in a long time, and the chef cooking apple pie for dessert table side? Delicious, definitely going back again!

Customer 1980.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1980.Content: Second visit and tried hard to like it, but the food is OK at best and just because a customer is wearing a casual button down doesn’t mean service should change.

Customer 1981.Name: Kavaj
Customer 1981.Content: Had the steak salad for lunch, while the steak was great, the salad was very meh... I found 2 specks of blue cheese, when it said 'blue cheese crumbles' and 2 cherry tomatoes cut in half, the lettuce was  25% brown (old) and the fried onions as well as raw red onions was overwhelming. Very disappointing for $18.

Customer 1982.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1982.Content: Service was great, our steaks just didn't meet the high expectations we had unfortunately.

Customer 1983.Name: mrsmeyer
Customer 1983.Content: We celebrated our wedding anniversary here. Great food, amazing service and as a plus Russell Wilson stopped in to dine after their win against the niners.

Customer 1984.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1984.Content:
Very disappointing.  We have been to the Met on many occasions & always had good service & food.  Today the service was slow and not attentive to us.  The steak sandwich was fatty & not hot.  The Joes special was also not hot.
I hope this is not indicative of the recent remodel.

Customer 1985.Name: Deptiger
Customer 1985.Content: Great brunch menu for the game. The new look for the entry is welcoming and roomy.

Customer 1986.Name: dinner
Customer 1986.Content: Great brunch for the Seahawks. What a wonderful time. You must go and enjoy.

Customer 1987.Name: food
Customer 1987.Content: This is a well organized steakhouse with excellent service. The menu is robust & there are plenty of options. They also allow for some changes or requests. The food was variable: excellent seafood, vegetables,  above average steaks, sides were a mix of quality (as judged by the 4 of us who ate there). It seemed to take long to get our dinner once we ordered, but it was worth the wait. Overall, the experience was great & definitely recommend it.

Customer 1988.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1988.Content: The waiter and other staff were incredible. Dinner was delicious and as expected for a pricey steakhouse. None of the entrees were creative, basic high end steakhouse. I would say the quality of steak was better than Mortons or Ruth's Chris.  The steak options seemed higher quality and the staff was very knowledgeable about the cuts of meet, sourcing and preparation. The ambiance lacked slightly.  we were seated in the far corner of the restaurant which felt like a far walk from the entrance. The table had a significant draft although the server had management adjust the temperature to accommodate. If the service staff had not been as fantastic the rating would be lower but all in all a good dining experience for a high $$.

Customer 1989.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1989.Content: Probably the best steak house ever.  Every time we go to Seattle we make an effort to eat here.  We are never disappointed.

Customer 1990.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1990.Content: We have always wanted to go to the Met for a special celebration. We knew it was going to expensive but we weren't worried about that because it was a significant birthday celebration. We were very disappointed in the meal. The steaks were so so… Nothing special and rather tough. The lobster and the starter salad were very good, though. Liked that corkage fee was only $25. Service was good and friendly. With so many fine restaurants in Seattle, we would not return to the Met.

Customer 1991.Name: DavidD
Customer 1991.Content: The bone in prime rib and bone in ribeye were great. They were on the secret menu so be sure to find out what is on this. Our waiter was great. He was helpful suggesting menu items and very customer oriented, outgoing and friendly

Customer 1992.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1992.Content: The food fell below expectations. The wine list was great. We had the calamari to start which was nothing special but it was decent. We also had the lobster bisque, boneless ribeye steaks, roasted root vegetables, and the poblano scalloped potatoes.   For dessert, we had the crème brûlée and the chocolate lava cake. Both desserts were incredible!   The steaks were a huge letdown.   Everything else was just average.  They were tough to cut at times even with the steak knives.   The service was extremely friendly but never pushy.  Our drink glasses were always full.  This is the fourth steakhouse in the area I've visited and I'd rank them fourth by quite a ways.  It's popular so I'm not going to completely write off the Met but it will be a while before I return.

Customer 1993.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1993.Content: Disappointed in the food. Salads (spinach and house) were soggy and my steak was inedible. Steak was from Idaho and highly touted in their menu description. When I complained to the server she admonished me for ordering my New York Sirloin rare. Indicating that more done would have made my steak less tough. She said a manager would be over but that did not happen. They removed the steak from our bill but this did not make up for the poor service and tough steak. I had no problem with the price of the steak and only complained so they would be aware of the problem. Nice atmosphere but that was all our group of four found to praise.

Customer 1994.Name: LarryJ
Customer 1994.Content:
Food and service were just outstanding. Wine selection was superb, waiters very much new his menu, and was very proud and informative. The hourdorves we we'll time with dinner, the steak was the best I've ever had. 
It was just a 12 on a 10 scale. Would not change anything

Customer 1995.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1995.Content: Overall a great experience. The Metropolitan Grill has great food and the service is outstanding. High quality steaks, attentive staff, and a great atmosphere. From the wood walls, to the pictures of celebrity visitors...you'll definitely see why it's one of the best steakhouses in the country.

Customer 1996.Name: Gail
Customer 1996.Content: This restaurant is a bit expensive but well worth the cost.  The food is excellent and the staff is the best in the city.

Customer 1997.Name: Felicia
Customer 1997.Content: We just had the steak sandwich which was good, more than enough for two meals for me but very SALTY,  they fries were good as well, but I would ask for light on the salt.  Meat was prepared to order, perfect medium rare, which is RARE to find. :)

Customer 1998.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1998.Content: I think this restaurant was one of the best steak restaurant in USA. The food and ambiance was excellent. We could make a unforgettable memory in our  journey to Portland and Seattle from Japan.

Customer 1999.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 1999.Content: outstanding food, excellent and friendly service. A truly wonderful experience

Customer 2000.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 2000.Content: This is my favorite restaurant! They have excellent drinks, the food is great! Steaks are their specialty, but the Salmon, Buffalo, Pork Chops and Lamb are all worth the visit! The service and Server are all friendly and professional! I love the service here! It is an extraordinary place to celebrate any special occasion!

Customer 2001.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2001.Content: The server was some what inattentive, and very pushy about getting THE MOST EXPENSIVE of everything - I understand up selling, but he got awkward. Our chicken dish, and filet minion were spot on and delicious. The other guest's prime rib was tough, over cooked and VERY LEAN, definitely not the way he ordered it. The pear martinis were to die for, very delicious.

Customer 2002.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2002.Content: If you want to feel like a billion bucks and want to eat the best steak in Washington, go here!

Customer 2003.Name: MV2017
Customer 2003.Content: Promptly seated for 6:30 Monday night anniversary dinner reservation, started great, then became a mess.  Initial service was excellent, then dropped off quickly.  Large party we were seated by included a young child that repeatedly shrieked for nearly a half-hour until we had enough.  It seemed that the staff disappeared and didn't want to handle it.  Waiter went AWOL for 10-15 minutes as we sat with empty glasses and growing frustration.  I asked another waiter for the GM who heard us out and let us go before the entrée arrived.  Been to the Met many times over the years, no motivation to return.  Good Luck!

Customer 2004.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2004.Content: Normally my favorite place to eat in Seattle for over 25 years, but this meal was a disappointment.  I strayed from my old favorites and tried out the  4oz filet trio ( for $125!). The Japanese , high end cut was almost inedible. Just too many tendons ( and I know the difference  between tendons and marbling) made it very difficult to even cut with their awesome knives. for $60 for a 4 oz cut, I don't expect to have to knaw away by hand, especially on a filet cut. Because we were having a celebration I chose not to complain, which in hindsight, was not my best choice. Should have sent it back. I will always love the Met and the outstanding service, but will not be so quick to go out of my lane where I know I will be happy. My son had the 36 oz Porterhouse and it was awesome, as was the Wedge salad and the scallop app and lobster bisque

Customer 2005.Name: ChuckS
Customer 2005.Content: We had reservations before the Sounders game.  My wife and I, our daughter and her boyfriend wanted to try something out of the ordinary for a game day.  My wife and daughter split two entrees and were delighted.  I had the burger and it was fantastic.

Customer 2006.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2006.Content: Our dining experience was extremely disappointing and we won't be back.  I had the crab and prawn fettuccini and it was terrible.  The pasta was undercooked, the crab overcooked, and the sauce had no flavor.  I ate two bites and pushed it to the side.  The waiter never asked how our food was or why I barely touched it.  We will not be back and heard from others to spend our money at The Brooklyn or Captal Grille.

Customer 2007.Name: robertc
Customer 2007.Content: The Met is known for the best steaks in town but my wife had the crab and prawn fettuccine and I had the king salmon and both dishes were to die for.

Customer 2008.Name: Steakluvr
Customer 2008.Content: Excellent all the way around. The chateaubriand was perfect. Fantastic service. You definitely pay for it, but it was worth it.

Customer 2009.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2009.Content: We were in town to cruise to Alaska with my sister in law and brother in law.  We have eaten at the Metropolitan Grill before and wanted to take them for a good steak.  We were not disappointed.  Very good.

Customer 2010.Name: emergdoc
Customer 2010.Content: Wonderful steak. Excellent service. We loved it. Pricey but well worth it.

Customer 2011.Name: ArabellaC16
Customer 2011.Content: The steaks are really good. Best steak ever! All the staff are really nice. Good customer service and food.

Customer 2012.Name: LarryD
Customer 2012.Content: Whenever we go to Seattle, the Met is one of our favorite locations to go for dinner.  Like before, we were not disappointed, as it was fabulous.

Customer 2013.Name: BrianL
Customer 2013.Content:
Service and steak was terrific. 

The apps and side dishes were mediocre and our asparagus was served almost raw and stringy.

Customer 2014.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2014.Content: You can always count on the Met for great food and service!

Customer 2015.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2015.Content: Not is good as it used to be. The martinis were served warm and we ordered them twice. We will not be returning

Customer 2016.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2016.Content: Some of the best food in Seattle! Great service & seating!

Customer 2017.Name: Happy
Customer 2017.Content: I enjoyed our server.  She was knowledgeable, thorough, funny, and was paying attention.  The meal was much better than a visit a few months ago - as was the service.  I am glad that we decided to give it another try.

Customer 2018.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2018.Content: Great selection in the bar, the bartenders are friendy, best steaks in town and the wine list is huge.

Customer 2019.Name: Musteat
Customer 2019.Content: The best views in town! Great menu! Great ambiance! Great for celebrating!!!

Customer 2020.Name: PaulT
Customer 2020.Content: I thought the food was really salty and the service was like I was at a lower end restaurant but she was really nice

Customer 2021.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2021.Content: My fav place for my bday dinner. Good food and good service!

Customer 2022.Name: Shan
Customer 2022.Content: One of our favorite restaurants!  We go to The Met every year for our anniversary and maybe a time or two in between! Best steaks in Seattle!

Customer 2023.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2023.Content: Some of the best food I have had ever.  My wife ordered the steak and I had the Wyoming buffalo.  Thank you very much for the experience.  SInce it was our anniversary and we got a free desert, great place to eat highly recommended.  A+

Customer 2024.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2024.Content: Top notch. Been coming for years.  Now it's time to offer some real healthy choices. Too much fat on everything.

Customer 2025.Name: KHCA
Customer 2025.Content:
We had a out of town visitor. She really enjoyed the prime rib & potato. 
We shared prime rib cooked med rare - yum! Good seasoning. Overall, a 4 star experience. However, 2 little details prevented a 5 star experience: 1) my shared portion of prime rib had a couple pieces of string about 1.5 - 2 inches long, assuming it was used to tie up the prime rib but for a high end restaurant to overlook? and 2) the creamy horseradish was more liquid than creamy - disappointing.

Customer 2026.Name: DavidW
Customer 2026.Content:
Absolutely fantastic in all areas!! Went there with my wife Saturday‼️
 I remember this place as a teenager going with my dad.  I haven't been there since. I always talk about it to everyone‼️ It has stuck with me all these years😊‼️

Customer 2027.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2027.Content: We went out for dinner there actually to celebrate my Birthday and our Anniversary, on the exact date 9/2, unfortunately no one asked if we were celebrating anything.

Customer 2028.Name: EnD10
Customer 2028.Content: The Metropolitan is one of my husband's favorite restaurant. We have been going there for both business and casual dining for more than 15 years.  In the recent visit we were greeted by the  wonderful staff and received excellent service and attention from our waiter. We enjoyed couple of  appetizers and drinks, but the main course was not what we expect from the Metropolitan. I ordered the blackened prime rib and my husband ordered the bacon wrapped beef  medallion. Although, it states on the menu that the prim rib will contain some fat. I didn't expect that half of the portion would be fat. They were also a little  generous  with the spices on the prime rib, which made it hard to taste the meat flavor. Both my husband and I found the meat quality to be OK, but not up to our usual expectations.

Customer 2029.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2029.Content: We went to celebrate our 4th wedding anniversary and we really couldn't have chosen a better restaurant. The option to do valet during dinner hours was great. Parking was only $10, which is comparable to what we would have paid to park elsewhere in downtown Seattle, but we didn't have to deal with the headache of trying to find parking ourselves, so it was absolutely worth it. We were sat about 15 minutes before our reservation. The hostesses were incredibly friendly and our server was the best of the best. His knowledge of the menu was superb and he gave us incredible recommendations to help us choose the perfect meals and appetizers. The Alaskan salmon was the best salmon I've ever had. My husband had the skirt steak which was tender and flavorful. Definitely a "hidden gem" on the menu! The crab cakes were divine, as were the asparagus and Brussels sprouts we had as our side dishes, which we substituted for our potatoes. We received a complimentary dessert, the burnt creme, for our anniversary and it was absolutely decadent! I have a sweet tooth, so we ordered the white chocolate coconut cake to go and it was hands down the best cake I have ever had! This restaurant is absolutely worth the price. The quality of the food is excellent and the service is top notch!

Customer 2030.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2030.Content: Going to The Met is a great experience. From the moment you walk in you know you're in for a treat. The cuts of meat in the case as you walk in remind you that you're entering one of Seattle's best steakhouses. The staff are attentive and the food is exceptional. Definitely a place you should visit, and visit often.

Customer 2031.Content: The Met is better than ever with their recent renovation.

Customer 2032.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2032.Content: Service was great! Steaks are underwhelming. We really enjoyed our crab cakes as an appetizer.

Customer 2033.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2033.Content: Excellent service, meal preparation, and presentation. The food was top shelf.

Customer 2034.Name: sandrajeanw
Customer 2034.Content: Hard to hear due to music level but good food, service , and ambiance

Customer 2035.Name: Patricia
Customer 2035.Content: It was too noisy so I couldn't always hear the conversation across the table.  "Energetic" is a positive term.  I would use the word "noisy" which is a bit more negative.  The food was okay--not something I would order again.  The calamari was rather tasteless, I thought.

Customer 2036.Name: JAYP
Customer 2036.Content: This was for my wife's birthday, everyone had a great meal. The steaks were cooked perfectly.

Customer 2037.Name: RandyM
Customer 2037.Content: The fried spinach as an appetizer was divine ! I appreciated that the waitress recommended it, because I would never have thought it was so good ! My husband had a seafood dish I believe the name of it was (April )that was awesome, I will have it next time ! I had one called the Taylors and it was a filet already cut up, but too done for my liking, it came with potatoes and veggies and a 'lobster " roll which was a cold dish that I didn't care for.

Customer 2038.Name: Kevin
Customer 2038.Content: Great restaurant with 1st Class Food.  Very expensive but worth it for special occasions.  By far the best steakhouse in Seattle!!

Customer 2039.Name: Max1
Customer 2039.Content: When we visit Seattle we always dine at the Met Grill. Simply the best steakhouse on the west coast! The staff always treat you as old friends, even if you're newcomer. Their attention to even the smallest detail of your evening can't be overstated. And the quality of the food, the presentation and the service is consistently ten out of ten.

Customer 2040.Name: JoannaB
Customer 2040.Content: Lovely setting and food was amazing. Quite pricey but worth the money.

Customer 2041.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2041.Content: Had a reservation and being a new transplant, I naively asked for a city or lake view. They sat me near the kitchen area and I also had to wait  30 minutes before being seated. Waitress was really, really slow all night causing my birthday celebration to be less memorable.   Note once a local football celebrity showed up, his food was rushed to him and all 15 guests. I Will not go back!

Customer 2042.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2042.Content: I'm giving them a better review than they deserve because they just reopened and we have had great food and service in the past.
