We were sat over 40 minutes after our reservation time. The service was super slow. The food was slower and the wine sommelier never showed up. The highlights were that the steak wasn't ruined and not over cooked when it reached the table. Our server was a super nice guy and very apologetic and brought us a couple of free desserts. Hopefully they get their act together again because it was my wife's favorite restaurant.

Customer 2043.Name: luvtoeat
Customer 2043.Content:
It was delicious as always. Our favorite place fir steaks. We always spend our anniversary there. 
The employees are excellent and attentive. Scott was outstanding.

Customer 2044.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2044.Content: The servers and staff are amazing.   The food was perfect.   Best steak I've ever had. Wonderful ambience.  Did I say that the staff was amazing?

Customer 2045.Name: grantb
Customer 2045.Content: Lovely room with lots of booths on the first level and primarily tables on the lower. Good choice of steaks wit some pretty expensive cuts ask avaiable. Chicken, pork and fish available and a nod to vegetarians but the real reason to come here are the steaks. Fantastic wine list and they allow BYO at only £30 corkage which amazingly goes to the staff. Service was excellent from the greeting to the final bill.

Customer 2046.Name: Eatdrinkbmerry
Customer 2046.Content: Food was delicious...pricey but great!! Our waiter was wonderful...great service!!

Customer 2047.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2047.Content:
For 35 years I have given the Metropolitan Grill a five star rating. Yesterday was the first and only time my steak was cooked more than I ordered. I ordered a blackened prime rib cooked medium rare. I received one cooked medium. 

I kept cutting, hoping for a center that was medium rare. It never happened. It was still a good stesk, but not great as I've experienced all years prior. 

I will go back to the Metropolitan Grill,  but will cut it immediately to check the degree that it is cooked like they ask at Daniel's Broiler.

Customer 2048.Name: JerryN
Customer 2048.Content: One of our favorite places to dine in Seattle. Our waiter Lance was so nice. See you again on our next trip.

Customer 2049.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2049.Content: Excellent as always.  Date was blown away by The Met.  Highly recommended.

Customer 2050.Name: Lin1
Customer 2050.Content: Loved our table. My husband and I enjoyed celebrating his birthday in a intimate setting, so the fabulous booths were a draw to us.  It was a pleasure not to be squeezed into a restaurant on a postage stamp table and enjoy our delicious meal!   Our waiter was prompt and seasoned!!  They had a nice crowd, even on a Tuesday evening.  Prime rib was outstanding!!!   Great place!

Customer 2051.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2051.Content: Sooo yummy! Have to get the banana fosters!! Great service and food! Must come here at least once in your lifetime!

Customer 2052.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2052.Content: We flew in from Portland, OR for my partner's birthday. The food was amazing as was the staff! Kevin made our dining experience extra special so thanks so much! We'll definitely be back!

Customer 2053.Name: FatJeff
Customer 2053.Content: Food outstanding. Better than New York steakhouses. Great atmosphere. Service superior. Wine list great. Strongly recommend. My friend had rib eye. I had American Wagyu skirt steak. Both really enjoyed. The baked potato was super too. We both eat out a lot all over world. This was top shelf.

Customer 2054.Name: ElaineD
Customer 2054.Content: My family & I travel to Seattle a couple of times a year, & when we do, we're sure to eat at The Met Grill! Why!?! We love the nostalgic ambiance, the attentive & friendly wait staff, the steak dinners, & of course, cherries jubilee (no longer on the menu, but the staff managed to round up the ingredients so we could enjoy)!!! We already have our reservations set for this upcoming November with friends!! See you then!!

Customer 2055.Name: TravelingLina
Customer 2055.Content:
I am a vegetarian, but I bring business associates to steakhouses all the time.  Needless to say the bill is never small, therefore I expect great food and I always pre-notify that there will be 1 vegetarian.   I was highly disappointed by the overcooked pasta in jarred/canned red sauce and 2 lbs of mushrooms you gave me tonight.  Really? That's the best you can do for a vegetarian meal with no allergies and ok with dairy?  Everyone loved their steaks and seafood sampler, but you fail at veggies.
We disliked every single side-dish and salad.  Dinner is not just a slab of cow.

Customer 2056.Name: JerodB
Customer 2056.Content: Felt rushed, poor service considering the price and self promoted expectations.

Customer 2057.Name: Almchicago
Customer 2057.Content: Fabulous and the best steak I've ever eaten in my entire life

Customer 2058.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2058.Content: We came here in August 2017 the weekend after the reopening. Historically, we rated The Met as 5 stars across the board. This night was a giant step down though. We'll go back - hopefully it was just a rusty night after the hiatus...

Customer 2059.Name: JSASUALUM
Customer 2059.Content:
It was the first time bringing my wife to Metropolitan Grill.

The crab cake appetizer was delicious - full of crab.

The spinach salad was good but lacked dressing.

The Delmonico was cooked perfectly and had a lit of flavor.

Waiter was overwhelmed by too many tables with people with multiple requests or who were overly needy.

Customer 2060.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2060.Content: Service was excellent, had an early dinner before the Seahawks game, maybe that's why the baked potato wasn't cooked all the way and the side sautéed mushrooms were barely cooked, no flavor.  Steak flavor was excellent, just not use to having fat on my Fillet, don't like it that's why I don't order the rib eye, a bit dissapointing for the price.

Customer 2061.Name: Floridaman
Customer 2061.Content: I was really looking forward to bringing my wife to a restaurant I have always loved.  The first table they sat us at was really bad.  It was just outside the kitchen and frankly should not even exist. When I complained, they promptly moved us to a booth which was much better; however I felt like I was sitting too low in relation to the table.  The food was very good.  My one complaint was that we ordered the large porterhouse; which we planned to split. The steak was cooked perfectly; however the method they used to split the steak for us sort of ruined it in my opinion.  Instead of taking the strip and the filet off the bone and cutting it in slices, the waiter cut the steak in half lengthwise which yielded a piece of meat that looked more like a piece of prime rib than a steak.

Customer 2062.Name: Susie
Customer 2062.Content: Love the new decor and touches.  Kept the same overall ambience but updated the space.

Customer 2063.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2063.Content:
We were at the MG 16 years ago and had a memorable experience.
Returning after 16 years and very happy we were able to dine at the MG again. Reopened just in time.
Food excellent.
Service excellent

Customer 2064.Name: JohnLewis
Customer 2064.Content: Metropolitan Grill is GREAT for lunch or dinner !!!!

Customer 2065.Name: Maureen
Customer 2065.Content: Metropolitan Grill was highly recommended to us so maybe my expectations were high. It was the first day of their opening after a renovation, so I understand if they are working out kinks, e.g. Computer slow, dust on windows separating booths, etc   The good was I ordered and loved the wedge salad. It was excellent and the apple cinnamon flambe was outstanding. It is prepared tableside and three of us shared the dessert. Really was tasty and wonderful. I had a filet which was good, my daughter had a combination of waygu beef and regular beef and my husband had steak salad. Steak salad seemed to be prepared with very little left over steak and was not worth the price. The service seemed to be off. The server we had asked us to order entres before we even ordered drinks. Then he disappeared and eventually returned with water, then disappeared again. He may have been covering other tables but we felt alternately ignored and rushed.  For the cost of the meals and wine, I, personally, will try another dining option.

Customer 2066.Name: JohnLewis
Customer 2066.Content: Fantastic food.  Fantastic service.  Metropolitan Grill is my favorite restaurant in Seattle.

Customer 2067.Name: DenaD
Customer 2067.Content: Service was slow, but food was excellent!

Customer 2068.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2068.Content: The MET is the BEST!  Thank you! I would recommend to anyone!

Customer 2070.Name: BobC
Customer 2070.Content: I object to their surcharge on the bill that is obtensivly way to cover minimum-wage. A place with prices at this level should not be paying minimum wage. And they should not be making a political statement on the bill.

Customer 2071.Name: Sergetron
Customer 2071.Content: Delicious food and outstanding service. Try the Wagyu steaks, worth every penny.

Customer 2072.Name: MarkG
Customer 2072.Content: Our mainstay for the past 17 years.  We have always been accommodated when special requests have been made.  Our only regret is that they are closing for 6 weeks to remodel. We can't wait to see the new Metropolitan Grill!

Customer 2073.Name: EatYourVeggies
Customer 2073.Content: Though known for the steaks (which I'm told are great), I love the appetizer crab cakes, which make a substantial dinner. The wait staff is friendly and professional. This is one of my family's favorite places to celebrate special occasions.

Customer 2074.Name: Herbalist2023
Customer 2074.Content: Wonderful as usual!  I wish I lived closer to this place!  I can't wait to see remodel.  😊

Customer 2075.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2075.Content:
A 50th anniversary/75 year Birthday celebration was ruined as a result of the experience that my wife & I endured at this restaurant. Traveling from NJ to Seattle as part of  a celebration  gift  trip from our children we chose the highly recommended Metropolitan Grill. Unfortunately we were served two horrible steaks - both under cooked and one (mine) was more gristle than steak . When returned and re-served mine was still hard to chew.

The manager attempted to apologize, but wasn't really listening to our concerns- even as I explained that this was a really special occasion.

What really took the cake, however, was his ending when he asked, in an apparently sincere effort to make amends: "Do you have room for desert?" We took this to mean that the desert would be "on the house." No such luck! We were presented with the check and it included $26 charge for ...... (wait for it) ........desert. Again we were mislead.

The bottom line we paid $93 for: drinks- one cocktail /one ginger ale; two salads; desert-cheesecake / layer cake and coffee/tea. 

M.R.Baron

Customer 2076.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2076.Content: Big fan of met but this trip a bit disappointing.  Waited in bar for table as they forgot about us had to ask again for table which was then found as they gave ours away. Ended up right by door. Steak had no pink even on though asked for medium which I should have sent back but short on time.    Mix up in wine too but was minor.  No offers of extras.  Will be back but guess need to ask for extras.

Customer 2077.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2077.Content: It was a very awesome evening. Michael our server which I requested to be seated in his area awesome as always. I had friends coming in from out of town and they were very impressed with the sites, sound and energy of the restaurant.  we will be returning again. and not that I would not want to be served by any other server, but Michael just makes our night wonderful.

Customer 2078.Name: Chuck
Customer 2078.Content: Amazing food - friendly, knowledgeable and attentive staff - love the wine list - and the Long Bone Rib Eye could feed a family!  We had the pleasure of being served by 2 of the most gracious servers (Todd & Craig).  My wife and I felt like king and queen.  The Met Grill is one of those restaurants of days past.  Every time we visit Seattle, we enjoy at least one evening at the Metropolitan Grill and highly recommend it to anyone living in or visiting Seattle!

Customer 2079.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2079.Content: Fabulous service and even better food. This place is a must-visit in Seattle.

Customer 2080.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2080.Content: I have enjoyed the consistent quality of the Metropolitan grill for many years.

Customer 2081.Name: Greg
Customer 2081.Content: The service was excellent. I had the double steak (4oz. @) Prime and American Wagyu, and was surprised to find I preferred the Prime. I had the side of onion rings and they were good with the meal but would be a bit much as a separate side. So, all in all for a (what should have been a three hour meal but we had things to do so rushed it a bit (the Met was very accommodating on this) $400 meal for four (non of us drink alcohol) I'd say it was on par with other similarly priced venues. If you love steaks it's a must.

Customer 2082.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2082.Content: Great food and plenty of it.  Romantic atmosphere but able to accommodate a large group as well. The staff could not be any better. Extremely attentive and curious.

Customer 2083.Name: MarianneE
Customer 2083.Content:
Absolutely a perfect dinner, as always.
Love this place.
Don't be afraid to make a meal off the appetizer menu.
Such a treat and variety of foods and flavors.
Yumm!!!

Customer 2084.Name: WendyR
Customer 2084.Content: Food was very tasty.  Service was excellent.  Always a wonderful experience to had st The Metropolitan.  Sorry to see it closing for 2-3 months for renovation.  We look forward to coming back in September.

Customer 2085.Name: Luke
Customer 2085.Content: Greta meal, great service. Would highly recommend it.

Customer 2086.Name: JerryZ
Customer 2086.Content: Excellent food, good service, good atmosphere.  It all works.

Customer 2088.Name: Newbie
Customer 2088.Content: The service was excellent, the new outstanding, as always!  It is my fav place for lunch.

Customer 2089.Name: AlRIII
Customer 2089.Content: The Met is a Seattle tradition, The great service, great food  make it a must go for a special occasion or business power lunch!

Customer 2090.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2090.Content: My husband and I had dinner here last week and OMGEEEE the food was amazing! I usually eat seafood vs poultry or livestock, so I ordered the crab   pasta and it was delicious! I am pasta picky and prefer "grown up" very flavorful and savory pasta dishes, vs the usual bland and overly cheesy kiddie pasta most chains offer. For a steak house, the pasta was very impressive! It had several huge chunks of fresh crab meat too! My hubby ordered steak and I had a few bites and it was soooooooo good! The best steak I have had out before hands down! We also ordered the almond scallop appetizer, and it was ok but not worth the price. They cut the scallops in half and fry them in butter. We would have preferred a few full size scallops just seared instead. The heavily buttered crust and economy size cheapens the taste and appearance of the scallops IMO. I also had the pear lemon drop and it was stiff and tasty! We finished off with dessert, I got cheesecake and he ordered the ice cream, both were  great! Our server was charming, friendly, and very attentive. The decor was very dated for some reason...all forest green and brown inside and felt very 80's fine dining. However that didn't' really matter to us, but if you are wanting an aesthetically pleasing "wow e'm" modern setting then this isn't the place. If you're a foodie like us and mainly care about flavor and service, this is one of the best restaurants in WA, let alone Seattle! If its in your budget/want to have a special meal out, the Met is absolutely worth every penny. We left full and very happy :)

Customer 2091.Name: NycoletheFoodie
Customer 2091.Content: Such great service as well there is a lot of creativity with how they prepare their food. Get something made table side for entertainment and freshly made food!

Customer 2092.Name: pink3
Customer 2092.Content:
アペタイザーは、値段の割に少ないし高いです。味も特に代わり映えの無いフツーのメニューです。
お肉は、シャトーブリアンや、近江牛肉もろってます。
美味しく調理されてます。
わさびがあれば、もっとよかったかな。
付け合わせの野菜も、特に特徴がなく、面白みに欠けます。
デザートホットアップルパイがオススメです。パフォーマンスも味も最高

Customer 2093.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2093.Content: Very noisy and had we known this we would not have made reservations their but somewhere less noisy. Food was okay.

Customer 2094.Name: Newlylocal
Customer 2094.Content: The service staff was amazing and made some good recommendations for wine and entrees which we took and had a wonderful meal.

Customer 2095.Name: KitPtdiners
Customer 2095.Content: We came to celebrate our son's graduation and it was excellent - great steakhouse and service was also great.

Customer 2096.Name: Cathy
Customer 2096.Content: We were looking for a steak house and the Metropolitan did not disappoint. A classic steak house that has not lost its ability to turn out incredible food, expert service and classic ambiance. Ranks as one of our best restaurant experiences.

Customer 2097.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2097.Content:
Just plain and simple. Fantastic!
Todd provided excellent service for the entire evening.

Customer 2098.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2098.Content: Best restaurant we've ever been to so far! The waiters are super friendly, and even gave us free dessert on them (:

Customer 2099.Name: QisiZ
Customer 2099.Content: Wonderful night! We reserved for grad celebration. Received sweet cards and wishes from them! So sweet thank you guys!

Customer 2100.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2100.Content: 4 year Anniversary lunch for a work colleague

Customer 2101.Name: StephenG
Customer 2101.Content: One of the best steakhouses I have been to. Quality all throughout.

Customer 2102.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2102.Content: Todd Spadafore (Server) was wonderful and provided great service.

Customer 2103.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2103.Content: Great service. We had reservations for 7:30, but when our party arrived @ 7, they took us straight to a table no problem. Food was outstanding!

Customer 2105.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2105.Content: Amazing!!!! One of the best places I have ever been to! Highly recommend!

Customer 2106.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2106.Content: Outstanding service and excellent food!  I brought my son to dinner for his 21st birthday and it could not have been more perfect. Metro Grill was outstanding!

Customer 2107.Name: Cheryl
Customer 2107.Content: Metropolitan had excellent steak and salad...so tasty!

Customer 2108.Name: Kirk
Customer 2108.Content:
I love the restaurant and have been there many times. The food was good and atmosphere was typical for a stake house.
My disappointment came when reviewing the bill. I was charged a 2% surcharge for additional markup from the restaurant. The waiter explained it that it isn't a tip but was charged by management to cover extra costs. I had just spent almost $600 for dinner for 4 people and I left feeling like I was nickel dimed. Super disappointed in this great restaurant and I will not be going back anytime soon.

Customer 2109.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2109.Content: We went for my wifes birthday because we wanted a special dinner. Service was excellent. Ambiance was great as we requested a cozy booth. Appetizer was pretty good and the wedge salad was terrific. Steak sampler arrived under done and had to go back. The garlic mashed potatos also went back and were not good on their return. Steak sampler was a bit disappointing also.

Customer 2110.Name: Goop
Customer 2110.Content:
The usher gave us a very bad seat initially when there are plenty. We asked for a switch and we had a better seat.

Wide range of wine selections, great steaks and seafood and kind waiters/waitresses (didn't really remember seeing any waitress).

All in all, it's an fancy restaurant worth going.

Customer 2111.Name: IslandGramGram98282
Customer 2111.Content: We have been patrons of "The Met" for 30+ years....it is and has always been consistently excellent....superior customer service, professionalism and excellent food preparation and presentation!  One can not improve perfect!

Customer 2112.Name: JillP
Customer 2112.Content: The past 3 times I have eaten the french dip, the roll is too toasted, and falls apart after a few bites.   The meat is not very tender also.  Maybe I'll have to find a new favorite item to order.

Customer 2113.Name: wanana
Customer 2113.Content: Our server was the best!!  Julie A.!!!  Our food was, and is always scrumptious!!  Our favorite place to take the ferry and make wonderful memories!!  See you when you re-open!!

Customer 2114.Name: Brozzzi
Customer 2114.Content: Took my best friend there for their delicious Candied Salmon Salad which is a longtime favorite of ours .. great service and food. Only complaint is the deep bucket seats were great for adults but the 4 year old with us could not reach the table and they do NOT have booster seats or high chairs - so I would not describe the restaurant as family friendly

Customer 2115.Name: MichaelB
Customer 2115.Content: Great service from Michael and staff. One of best Porterhouses ever! Not cheap but worth every penny

Customer 2116.Name: grkgal26
Customer 2116.Content: Thought it was really overpriced for what it was.  It says its the best steak in Seattle and I think it was pretty good.  However, two drinks, two appetizers, and two steaks for 200.00 is a bit overdoing it for this place!!!

Customer 2117.Name: Cassie
Customer 2117.Content: The service was excellent, the atmosphere is classic, the steak can't be beat. I took my 10-year old son here for his first experience at a "nice" restaurant and he loved it. The staff was very engaging and he left feeling like a grown up :-)

Customer 2118.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2118.Content:
The food was great, as we had been told by friends (although my husband said he liked the steak better from places such as John Howie and Daniel's).  Wine selection was amazing, as they had a large amount of half bottles (perfect as only my husband drinks wine).  They also had three cider selections, which I was pleased with.  The calamari was amazing, probably the best I've ever had (high quality, perfect type & amount of breading, and a nice sauce).  The french onion soup was good.  Steak was great.  Asparagus with hollindaise was good.  Mashed potatoes were great.  Ceasar salad was great.  Creme brulee was amazing.

However, the ambiance was not what we have come to expect from high end steakhouses like this...the entire place is open (ie. not private), and the decor is dated.  Even the menus seemed cheap.  However, they are closing soon for 2 months for a remodel, so hopefully that will be fixed.  The service was great, but not amazing, like we would expect for a $300 dinner.  For example, after our dessert was cleared we waited about 20 minutes for the check.

Customer 2119.Name: robert
Customer 2119.Content: We enjoyed an amazing meal, celebrating a college graduation.

Customer 2120.Name: MarilynI
Customer 2120.Content: Food was fine.  Typical steakhouse menu.   The clam chowder was good.  They need better desserts.

Customer 2121.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2121.Content: For the price of the steak, cooking "doneness" was somewhat inconsistent.  Had the "Delmonico" based upon the recommendation of our waiter.  Normally I would have had a Ribeye and would order one next time or blackened prime rib.

Customer 2122.Name: KarinC
Customer 2122.Content: Haven't been to this restaurant in years don't plan on waiting that long again!! Wonderful evening

Customer 2123.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2123.Content: Just another steak house. Nothing interesting at any of them, which means the steaks better cut like butter.  I would say for the $236 we spent on the two of us, the bread and butter and baked potatoes were the stars- sadly. The filet mignon was nice, maybe should have gotten it med-rare instead of medium. The sirloin was a bit rubbery.  The $15 side of mushrooms were cold. Eh, call it a meal...

Customer 2124.Name: OingoBoingo
Customer 2124.Content: This was our first time at this restaurant and we enjoyed it.  I had the blackened prime rib and my wife had the scallops.  Everything was cooked to our liking and tasted amazing.  We will be back the next time we visit Seattle.

Customer 2125.Name: Lolli
Customer 2125.Content: Service is always outstanding at the Met.  My cocktails, appetizer, salmon and dessert were all delicious.  I was a bit disappointed with the creamed spinach - I would liked for it to be a bit creamier.   I'm told the lobster that my mother had was mushy.  At the price charged, it should have been cooked perfectly.  Unfortunately, she didn't say anything about it until we were on the way home!

Customer 2126.Name: AndyC
Customer 2126.Content: Fab dinner but don't forget to bring your cheque book as it is not cheap!

Customer 2127.Name: EdeL
Customer 2127.Content: A great evening out with friends celebrating my birthday eating excellent food, beverages served by very competant friendly staff.

Customer 2128.Name: MarkB
Customer 2128.Content: Great place to celebrate our anniversary!!!  Steak was outstanding.

Customer 2129.Name: GaryS
Customer 2129.Content: Every time we visit Seattle we enjoy visiting the Metropolitan Grill. The restaurant never disappoints. The servers are highly professional and take excellent care of the customers. The food and the cocktails are always on point and well worth the price. We had read they were closing this summer for a renovation so we knew on this trip it was a must stop. We were happy we did and are really looking forward to visiting the new Metropolitan Grill on our next visit to Seattle.

Customer 2130.Name: TTvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvvv
Customer 2130.Content: Absolutely stunning, great and amazing food, FABULOUS STAFF, the deserts are awesome, especially the bananas foster...delicious

Customer 2131.Name: DianeC
Customer 2131.Content: Amazing steaks, bananas foster and service! One of the top in seattle.

Customer 2132.Name: stevemarseattle
Customer 2132.Content:
What can I say about the Met Grill that hasn't already been said many times before. A first class dining experience. Impeccable service and spot on food recommendations from waiter Todd to friendly and knowledgeable conversation from Sommelier Aaron. 
Bone in rib eye was spectacular. A wonderful dining experience.

Customer 2133.Name: Anthonyf79
Customer 2133.Content: The Superior Farms Lamb Rack was absolutely  delicious! Thank you chef Eric for making this a great place to eat!

Customer 2134.Name: Billb
Customer 2134.Content: Great service.  Called saying traffic delayed us.  Told they'd hold our resrvation.  Promptly seated when arrived.  Great food.  Remarkable value, overall.

Customer 2135.Name: ShaunaB
Customer 2135.Content: Classic steakhouse with awesome service from Sean!

Customer 2136.Name: TomO
Customer 2136.Content: I met a friend for lunch and was really unimpressed with the food. Service was excellent, as always, but the grissly steak sandwich and cold french fries were not up to the Metropolitan Grill high standards. Dinner at the Met has always exceeded my expectations but lunch, not so much.

Customer 2137.Name: TysonL
Customer 2137.Content: The food and the service were phenomenal. Not cheap, but definitely not one of the more expensive steakhouses I've been to.

Customer 2138.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2138.Content: An amazing place to share a meal with special friends.

Customer 2139.Name: JenniferM
Customer 2139.Content: The Metropolitan Grill's decor has an old world charm in atmosphere and ambiance.  The menu selections are vast and the wine list is extremely impressive.  The food and dining experience is superb and the staff was friendly and attentive.  This restaurant is a gem!

Customer 2140.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2140.Content: The steaks were far below the standards I am used to receiving form the Met.  Very disappointed

Customer 2141.Name: PNWFoodie
Customer 2141.Content: Excellent meal and service.  The chateaubriand for two was fantastic - so much food we had to take home leftovers.  Dessert was fantastic as well - but come hungry!

Customer 2143.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2143.Content: Fantastic. Can't recommend this place enough.

Customer 2144.Name: Favoriteplaces
Customer 2144.Content: The food was great as expected and the waitstaff really make this place outstanding.

Customer 2145.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2145.Content: We wanted to celebrate our anniversary with a special dinner. Metropolitan Grill delivered. They are known for their steaks and they did not disappoint. Our waiter let us know that the kitchen prepares their steaks on the rare side so I ordered accordingly, my wife ordered the pork chops which were equally outstanding. I have had food at other quality restaurants that was as good but the service at Metropolitan Grill is OUTSTANDING to sum it up in a word,  pampered would be it, Our server was very frank with our menu choices and how we would best enjoy our evening, bussers, wine steward everyone was above our expectations. Thank you

Customer 2146.Name: Brian
Customer 2146.Content: First time in 10years waiter was slow and forgot stuff over and over

Customer 2147.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2147.Content: We brought a Client here and had an amazing experience. The service and food weren't just like any other restaurant, it was a true experience from start to finish. The special bone-in ribeye was the best steak I've ever had. Nothing but good things to say about our dinner.

Customer 2148.Name: Cindy
Customer 2148.Content: Always a great experience at the Met.  I have been going for business and family events for 20 years.

Customer 2149.Name: Kyle
Customer 2149.Content: Met Grill is always a nice place to go with good food and atmosphere.   Prices are a little higher for value of the dinner.    The Waygu prices are outrageous but consistent with its competitors.  The quality of the Waygu is not any better than its competitors.   Still.... it's not a bad place for business or to impress someone.

Customer 2150.Name: SHIGGY
Customer 2150.Content:
started with the bacon. This is not your typical strip bacon. This is thick chunks of pork belly that are so delicious and probably the best bacon ever!

Whisky list is the best I have come across in my travels. They had Yamazaki Sherry Cask for $85. That is a steal since a bottle not goes for $3,500!

Hokkaido beef is the best beef hands down! I have not experienced anything like it. It is so delicious. So tender. So moist and flavorful. Nothing can compare and I have had a fare share of quality beef including: Akaushi and Kuroge-Bohanan's, San Antonio TX; Salt River Farms-Chandler's, Boise ID; SRF, Tajima, Omaha, and Kuroge-John Howie, Bellvue WA. Nothing is like the Snow Beef "Hokkaido" and is not likely to be exceeded!

Customer 2151.Name: MonstrousJoe
Customer 2151.Content: The Met is great all around.

Customer 2152.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2152.Content: We had a very nice business lunch for 6 at the Metropolitan.  Service seemed a little slow since it was mostly salads and burgers, but everything else and everything else about the service was just great.

Customer 2153.Name: TexEx
Customer 2153.Content: Always timeless elegance.  It's right across from the office and I take every opportunity I can to take clients or team members there.

Customer 2154.Name: MerryMel
Customer 2154.Content: Friends and I have celebrated at the Met for 20+ years. When my cousin comes to town, she insists we go to the Met. Always great food, great service, a special event. Wait staff is stellar!!!

Customer 2155.Name: JMR0928
Customer 2155.Content: I come here 2-3 times a year and am always impressed, great food excellent service a bit pricy but worth it. A place to eat if visiting Seattle.

Customer 2156.Name: qoolala
Customer 2156.Content: As always, the meat was great! The prawn was overlooked in prawn cocktail. I'm glad they're renovating soon since this place does smell from being old.

Customer 2157.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2157.Content: A MOST UNUSUAL NIGHT: After one of the weirdest (& misery-filled) days of my life, as I was having a medical embolism crisis with my finger tip, my friend and I were scheduled for a late dinner after a ballgame and other activities. The waiter and staff were extremely sympathetic and delivered amazing service, even though they could clearly tell I wasn't having a good time. These people are true pros, their training, experience and expertise is rarely matched anywhere. I could hardly imagine a more "sad" couple customers they'd ever have to deal with than my friend & I. But they completely rose to the "occasion" and ended up having to essentially package up 98% of our large meals for later consumption (incredible Blackened Prime Rib). It's now 9 months later and I must go back to Seattle because my finger still isn't much better. I will be hoping to enjoy "The Met" this time, though, without the crisis of last time. And I have full confidence that they will deliver, as they ALWAYS DO, a great dining experience!

Customer 2158.Name: Kaokeno
Customer 2158.Content: Hands down some of the best food I've ever tasted. The employees are wonderful and extremely knowledgeable, the service was superb from start to finish. It's like the waiter knows what you want as soon as you sit down. The Chicago Cut 35 day aged steak was so incredibly tender i could eat it all day. The price may intimidate, but your not paying for the food, your paying for an experience you cant find anywhere else.

Customer 2159.Name: DavidM
Customer 2159.Content: The focus of our evening was steaks with some seafood.  We enjoyed the meal, but one of our steaks were undercooked compared to requested.  Also the butter served with the King Crab legs cooled quickly and made the crab less enjoyable.   Service was professional and efficient.  Extensive wine list.

Customer 2160.Name: Wenlau
Customer 2160.Content: Still my all-time fav whenever I am in Seattle! Everything was top notch! Food was cooked to perfection!

Customer 2161.Name: Chris
Customer 2161.Content: Great food and service. Ny steak is great as are the onion rings. A must have!

Customer 2162.Name: WaynesvilleFoodie
Customer 2162.Content: Outstanding experience. A group of business associates who meet in several cities always try to find the best steakhouse in each city we visit. This was an outstanding choice and everyone in our group of eight was very pleased with the experience. We would choose this restaurant on our next visit to Seattle.

Customer 2163.Name: Newbie
Customer 2163.Content: As always, treated with utmost respect, too.

Customer 2164.Name: ReneeG
Customer 2164.Content: Great steaks! A little noisy, as other reviewers had mentioned, but not enough to truly bother me. The service was awesome and the food was great. It is definitely expensive, but I think it's worth a special occasion trip if you enjoy steak.

Customer 2165.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2165.Content: Fantastic! Our server, Scott, was awesome! He was very professional, yet personal, in his style and demeanor. Too bad he loved his Seattle Seahawks so much - he'd be a FANTASTIC Carolina Panthers fan! ;)

Customer 2166.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2166.Content: excellent service.  excellent ambiance.   excellent meal

Customer 2167.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2167.Content: great food. friendly service. continues the noted "awesome spot" to eat in Seattle.

Customer 2168.Name: MarshaH
Customer 2168.Content: Seattle is known for some of the finest restaurants in the world.  Still, the Met cannot be beat for superb steaks.

Customer 2169.Name: Hichucho
Customer 2169.Content: Great place to celebrate any special occasion. One of the best steaks houses. Killer scallop appetizer. Awesome chocolate lava cake. We will be back for the Snow beef and ribeye.

Customer 2170.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2170.Content: As expected.  Met is always top notch

Customer 2171.Name: Deee
Customer 2171.Content: Another fantastic dinner at The Met.  Great food and service - never disappoints.

Customer 2172.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2172.Content: The Met is simply the best restaurant in Seattle. Food is head and shoulders above everything else and the staff is sublime.

Customer 2173.Name: John
Customer 2173.Content: Another fine anniversary dinner at the Met. As usual the service was outstanding, the food excellent for the most part, and the dining experience overall delightful. My only quibble was that my Wagyu New York strip was a bit chewier than I expected, but the flavor was wonderful.

Customer 2174.Name: Nancy
Customer 2174.Content: Our favorite place for special events.  Great, great food.

Customer 2175.Name: CarrieF
Customer 2175.Content: Lovely atmosphere but not a lovely meal. We had an outstanding waitor who educaducted is on every thing on the menu but when we received our orders nothing had taste that was expected.  The sbrimp cocktail was was bland, the salad with pears and walanuts was very tart a d the NY Strip lacked flavor. It was very charcoaled. Bunrnt on the out side. I would not go back!!!

Customer 2176.Name: Jethro
Customer 2176.Content:
Supposed to be a steak place. It was ok. Nothing special. They grill their steaks over charcoal I guess. I assume that's why it tasted like lighter fluid. 
I've had better steaks.  Way overpriced unless you are trying to impress someone.

Customer 2177.Name: MartyD
Customer 2177.Content: Hands down best steakhouse I've ever experienced.  The service was first class all the way the ambiance was very nice.  The food was exceptional and the star of the night.

Customer 2178.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2178.Content: A must stop on any visit to Seattle.  Best steak and the Bisque is amazing!

Customer 2180.Name: Kristab
Customer 2180.Content: Amazing service and food.  One of the best meals in the city without a doubt.  Wine list for days.

Customer 2181.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2181.Content: they were great. we had reservations and they took care of us promptly. we stayed till almost 2p (reservations was at 12n), they didn't hurry us. Food was great!

Customer 2182.Name: DianneD
Customer 2182.Content: Whether family has come to town or a client is in the office or just and everyday lunch, I truly enjoy the Met and the atmosphere.

Customer 2183.Name: 561diner
Customer 2183.Content: We always dine here when we visit Seattle.  We live in Hawaii

Customer 2184.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2184.Content:
The only reason I came here was the steak.....Everything was lovely- except the steak. Cooked perfectly and then...wait for it.....flavorless. So disappointed. 

I've heard nothing but fantastic reviews about the Met, but El Gaucho will be receiving all my steak business from here on out. Sorry Met! 
Your staff was FABULOUS though

Customer 2185.Name: TerryA
Customer 2185.Content: Wonderful food, wonderful service, wonderful ambiance. They made our 38th wedding anniversary so very special. What a treat!

Customer 2186.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2186.Content: Excelente cena y atencion por parte del personal que nos atendió, nuestro restaurante favorito en nuestras visitas a la Ciudad de Seattle, WA.

Customer 2187.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2187.Content: It was a wonderful meal,  the clam chowder is a must have.  I had the Halibut for my main course and it was perfect.  We finished our dinner with Carrot Cake, delish. Our server was excellent.

Customer 2188.Name: BrianB
Customer 2188.Content: Good place but we have been at much better. Not enough crab in crab cakes compared to what we normally have.  Service was awesome until resturant fills up then they are understaffed.  Steak was not cooked right

Customer 2189.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2189.Content: Truly a great experience.  The service is top-notch, wine steward was super knowledgeable.  Best steak I've had in Seattle in 2 years.  All parties agreed.

Customer 2190.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2190.Content: I have always enjoyed the Met as a place to have a great meal on special or not so special occasions.  My wife and I had a "Date Night" and just really enjoyed the opportunity to sit and talk as adults.  We have always enjoyed the staff at the Met and truly enjoyed the evening.  What a great and iconic Seattle Restaurant.

Customer 2191.Name: KerryBob
Customer 2191.Content: Wow We had a great meal and some fantastic pear bread pudding. Like Arnold We'll be Back

Customer 2193.Name: Jlexus
Customer 2193.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a true dining experience. Each course was better than the last culminating with the vanilla ice cream which was the best that I have ever tasted. Nick our server was outstanding

Customer 2194.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2194.Content: SERVICE was UPSETTING!!!!!  We were in town for our Anniversary.  I've been to the Metropolitan Grill before and I wanted to take my husband there for his first time.  The food was great but our server on that particular date of Easter Sunday was very condescending.  When our party of 4 wanted to share the bone in 40 oz steak, that's when we saw the change in his attitude.  It was a giant steak and we wanted to be able to try many other delicious side orders .  He no longer was engaging and when asked to get us a dipping sauce for our steak he replied, "Really?"   I don't think customers should explain their meal preference.  This was a special occasion and he made us feel unwelcome at this restaurant.  I'm am truly disappointed in our experience there.  A special occasion dinner has to have  the ambiance, great food and service for make this restaurant worth going to.   We have friends coming in this week to dine at this particular restaurant and I truly hope they will not get the  treatment we had.

Customer 2195.Name: patticake
Customer 2195.Content: Wonderful, as always. A great celebration for my birthday. Service is exquisite

Customer 2196.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2196.Content: The entire staff did a great job of making a lovely Easter dinner for my family..

Customer 2197.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2197.Content: The food was bonkers. The service was off the charts. Top 3 steaks I've ever had. I'll recommend this place to everyone I know who visits Seattle.

Customer 2198.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2198.Content: A Seattle classic! Always good. Skip the appetizers before your steak so you have room for the Banana' Foster. It's exquisite!

Customer 2199.Name: HappyCustomer
Customer 2199.Content: We were treated with the utmost respect and were accommodated in every way. When we asked on a busy Saturday night they upgraded our party of 6 to a private room to get us more leg room. The food was delicious, and the waitstaff is very knowledgeable and attentive. I highly recommend the Met for any special occasion.

Customer 2200.Name: EricfromWestVancouver
Customer 2200.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary at the MG. Meal was quite expensive (one of the most expensive I've ever had) but food quality and service were excellent. I had heard that it was the best steak in town and can't disagree. It's an old school steakhouse that is very popular and I can see why. Highly recommend reservations as it's a busy place. Maitre'd and wait staff are extremely professional and courteous.

Customer 2201.Name: applecart
Customer 2201.Content: The ribeye was chewy. Given it cost $64 that is not my idea of a good value.

Customer 2202.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2202.Content: Steaks were overdone and under done morels were Sandy and even the vegetables were undercooked.  Did not complain just ate our food and left atmosphere was great and service just not great food

Customer 2203.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2203.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was an unforgettable experience for us.  The food was outstanding, the service impeccable, and the atmosphere was perfect for splurging on a romantic celebration.  I cannot wait to go back.

Customer 2204.Name: Stork606
Customer 2204.Content: We live on the Eastside so we don't make it in to Seattle for "cow" very often but Metropolitan Grill does not disappoint, despite the many alternative options.  It's a classic place but quite comfortable and although they do feed a large number of people, the tables do feel personal.  Our waiter really paid attention to our desires and the meal was top notch.  In an age where various versions of cow are reproduced at many spots, this was really special including the lobster macaroni and cheese side and the crab beef medallion special.  These were both above and beyond what we have experienced and many other fine restaurants.

Customer 2205.Name: MarkD
Customer 2205.Content: This my first time at the Met and we selected this location because our friends from Denmark were in town.  The food was exceptional and the service was even better!

Customer 2206.Name: AdamJ
Customer 2206.Content: The Met is always excellent.  You are definitely paying for the experience, but it is worth the price.  The staff is great, pay attention to the details, and are willing to go above and beyond to make your experience fabulous.  The steaks are also awesome.  I'd recommend the American Wagyu fillet.  This continues to be my favorite Steak house experience in Seattle and it did not disappoint.

Customer 2207.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2207.Content: Good service. Good food. A little loud, but not obnoxious.

Customer 2208.Name: JeffB
Customer 2208.Content: This was an important dinner meeting. My guest and my steak were so fatty that I could only eat half and my guest the same. For face reasons, I knew my guest would not say anything. I'm disappointed when your waiter recommends the steak and doesn't notice the conditions of the meat and why we left all of the fat on the plate.

Customer 2209.Name: Dmeza74
Customer 2209.Content: Food was great.  Kat in the bar was awesome, she helped make it a great experience.   We will be back next time in Seattle

Customer 2210.Name: PHADEAUX
Customer 2210.Content:
As usual,the food is good here,but overpriced.
In this instance,the service was not equal to a DENNYS and certainly not commensurate with prices that average around $100/person for just food and not including alcohol

Customer 2211.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2211.Content: We had a great experience at the Metropolitan Grill! Great service from Dianne and amazing food. We definitely would recommend this restaurant!! We got the Rib eye and Delmonico with cream spinach, and we were not disappointed! The white chocolate coconut cake with raspberry was well worth it!

Customer 2212.Name: Dave
Customer 2212.Content:
Soups were very good.
Prime rib was bearly warm and dry, steak house fries bearly warm and mushi (old).
Was replaced by Top Sirloin (waited around 40 minutes) had grill marks, but again bearly warm and dry, steak house fries were hot (fresh) but very salty.
Had my wife birthday evening totally ruin for $214+tips.

Customer 2213.Name: Danieltodd20
Customer 2213.Content: The service is spot on. Best place in Seattle for work lunches.

Customer 2214.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2214.Content: The Metropolitan is a famous Seattle restaurant--with pictures of celebrities on the wall to prove it. They are known for their steaks. We had reservations but it did n't look strictly necessary. The wait staff were almost a little too solicitous--interrupting our conversation a little too much--but the service was prompt and excellent. It was more crowded and noisy than I had hoped for a business meeting. It would be a great place to come as a tourist although it is pretty pricey for lunch.

Customer 2215.Name: SeniorDrill
Customer 2215.Content: Great meal at this fantastic steakhouse.

Customer 2216.Name: Victor
Customer 2216.Content: The Met is one of my all time favorites and they always take care of me and my guests. I would highly recommend to all, from business diners to those dining for a special occasion. Fantastic!

Customer 2217.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2217.Content: Always an excellent experience here. Food is amazing. Wine list is extensive but the sommelier is excellent. Service never forgets that you are there for the food AND the service. I cannot think of anything negative to say except that the tables in the middle of the room can be a loud space. Get a booth if you want to talk easily.

Customer 2218.Name: Roman
Customer 2218.Content: Great, high quality steaks. The sides are pretty average.

Customer 2219.Name: Sammamish4
Customer 2219.Content: Went here for a nice Sunday dinner with the family.  Everything was great from the service to our meals.  My steak was perfect.  Everyone enjoyed what they ordered.  Pricey, so not something we'll do again very soon, but worth it.

Customer 2220.Name: Tamiandfamily
Customer 2220.Content: Best steak in town! The Wagyu filet was incredible, flavorful and prepared perfectly. I LOVE the cheese sauce for the potato. Service was on-point, attentive and accurate.

Customer 2221.Name: TravisandJulieC
Customer 2221.Content: Loved the place!  Our server Jim was great!!

Customer 2222.Name: LynnV
Customer 2222.Content: Started in the bar with great mixed drinks and very friendly bar tender.  Dinner service and food was amazing.  Sides were huge and more than enough to share between 4.  Even had to bring some home.  Tried the 3 filet tasting of Prime, Wagyu and Kobe.  Very good and a great way to try the three different qualities side by side.

Customer 2223.Name: kalindria
Customer 2223.Content: Awesome food, great service, and a fun bar. This is our 'go-to' place for special occasions. You won't be disappointed.

Customer 2224.Name: Kawehi
Customer 2224.Content: Service is always impeccable.  The food is always up to the standard that the restaurant is known for.

Customer 2225.Name: Tyyar
Customer 2225.Content: Best dining experience hands down! The food is excellent and the waitstaff is exceptional!

Customer 2226.Name: RobertC
Customer 2226.Content: Excellent beef. Service was outstanding. A treat to have such a knowledgeable server.

Customer 2227.Name: Streamin
Customer 2227.Content: This was the last restaurant on a great trip from Los Angeles all the way to Seattle on the West Coast. It was my children's spring break. It was also my birthday. I got the fillet and it was absolutely excellent! However, I think we could've gotten out of there in about 30 minutes based on how quickly it seemed that we were being  rushed. The waitress barely showed up after the introduction. She did bring me a birthday creme brûlée,  but really it was almost as if it was required. She had a very nice personality at first, but then really didn't care about us for the rest of the meal and I found it annoying.  So I have to say that the service was absolutely lousy. Dressed up nice, but not very cordial and not very enjoyable. Fortunately, the food was excellent!  If you're fortunate enough you know someone there who is already an excellent server with personality and care, then this is a golden place. If not, just understand what you're getting into. Absolutely great food, with service that's kind of cold.

Customer 2228.Name: Rick4thandPike
Customer 2228.Content:
I have been coming to the Metropolitan Grill since the first week it opened. For years my lunch routine was a bowl of clam chowder, the best in Seattle, a glass of wine and the Times sports page in the bar with either Diane or Penny waiting tables and charming patrons, most of us regulars. I had my bachelor party here and my retirement party here. And no matter what, I have always been treated like the only guy in the house. This place is every bit as good as any east coast, venerable old steak house. I know because I've eaten at many of them over the years.
It's not cheap but as they say, you get what you pay for. One last bit of advice; do not come to this place and order chicken. This is a steak house and beef is king.
Years ago I wrote a headline for another steak place that sums it all up for us meat lovers.
"There you are on your death bed wishing you could have one last rice cake."
The Met is the best.

Customer 2229.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2229.Content: The Met is awesome. Highly recommended. By far the best steakhouse in the Seattle Area.

Customer 2230.Name: Zippy
Customer 2230.Content: For price steak and sides were not indicative of atmosphere or price

Customer 2231.Name: metrotransit
Customer 2231.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill does a very good job with basic menu options (steak, chicken).  Our server was fabulous - charming and the right amount of interaction really enhanced the dining experience.

However, the drinks were not what we would expect from a first class restaurant (maraschino cherries in a whisky sour instead of premium cherries that are standard at other restaurants and bars).  The menu is unimaginative and definitely does not stand out in today's Seattle restaurant scene.  The interior needs to be updated - seems tired and not current.

Customer 2232.Name: SeaTacGuy
Customer 2232.Content: Outstanding meal, as always. Long bone rib-eye is out of this world, and we had enough left over for another meal. Fantastic wine recommendation was given.

Customer 2233.Name: John
Customer 2233.Content: Made a reservation weeks in advance on open table but it seemed that we were treated as if we had no reservation at all when it came to table selection.  Had to ask to be reseated twice.  Both the first two were very cramped and in high noise and traffic  locations.  Finally got a booth that was comfortable.    I would expect to take what was available without a reservation but this was not the case.  Has a very casual not at all classy atmosphere.  Most people looked like they just walked into Burger King.   This place must be coasting on its name which is not deserved.   I would recommend the Capitol Grill if you are looking for a better steakhouse experience.

Customer 2234.Name: Herbalist2023
Customer 2234.Content: We had a great time here!  Roger was our server and he was one of the best servers I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing!  He was knowledgeable,  funny & we just had a great time with him.  We will be back!

Customer 2235.Name: Miafrunt
Customer 2235.Content:
We always rave about Met Grill, but our last visit was mediocre.  We had invited our friends (who had never been there) for his birthday.  I ordered a $79 steak, and I had ordered it medium.  It came out charred, well done, and very hard.   They did re do my steak, which was a bit better, but still not up to Med Grill par.   My husbands came out charred.  A little char is good, but it looks like the cook left it unattended for a bit.   Our friends said their steaks were good, but they had more char than they should've.
We are supposed to go again soon, so I hope next time it will be back to their normal self.

Customer 2236.Content: Very poor service.  Waitress stopped taking our order( only one person left) to serve another table.  Had to repeatedly remind waitress, to order, to ask for check, etc.  Not a good experience.

Customer 2237.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2237.Content: Great downtown Seattle hot spot.  Our server, Marla was top notch.  Food and beverages arrived in a  timely manner.

Customer 2238.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2238.Content: Was absolutely amazing. Our waiter was very professional and catering. A little on the spendy side but you get what you pay for.

Customer 2239.Name: JoshS
Customer 2239.Content: Wonderful service, environment, and food. Was a date night and couldn't be happier with the choice. Obviously expect to spend some money, but well worth the cost!

Customer 2240.Name: Scorpion1
Customer 2240.Content: A great place for special occasions such as milestone birthdays.  Everything was first rate.

Customer 2241.Name: SeattleU92
Customer 2241.Content: Rob in bar great host for happy hour before a super dinner. Wonderful wine selections and great Scotch. Steaks out of this world!

Customer 2242.Name: JayL
Customer 2242.Content:
Fourth seating there but my last. Food was good not great but service was horrible considering amongst 5 people are bill was north of $1000. We waited for everything. Drinks were empty most of the evening. 

We had a much better meal and experience at a fish house by the market only rated 3 stars.

Customer 2243.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2243.Content: This was an awesome restaurant for a special occasion. Food was excellent and so was the service.

Customer 2244.Name: Billy2013
Customer 2244.Content: Made reservation for Sunday night, less than 1/3 full by 9, server really odd & weak, steak OVERcooked for what we ordered, but we were hungry & just ate it, pretty cocky workers...the "Sommelier" guy spent 20+ mins at the table of 3 next to us bragging about nearly everything about himself, he should have let the poor hungry people eat & socialize themselves...omg!

Customer 2245.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2245.Content: Our service was fabulous, from the server, host to the busser. And such amazing food. Never disappointed.

Customer 2246.Name: Natalie
Customer 2246.Content: Waitress was phenomenal! Food was prepared well and in a timely manner. Valet parking was very curious as well. Would definitely recommend to friends and family visiting.

Customer 2247.Name: Chief
Customer 2247.Content: Had an awesome dinner. The food, and the service, as usual, was above and beyond.  You get the idea they built this place just for you when your here.

Customer 2248.Name: MaryH
Customer 2248.Content: Always a favorite place for an excellent steak! None better.

Customer 2249.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2249.Content: Absolutely fabulous. Best steak we have ever had.  Done to perfection and the service was outstanding. Our new favorite place for special occasions.

Customer 2250.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2250.Content: We were both looking forward to trying the Met. We were seated promptly then waited at least 7 minutes for anyone to come to our table. The restaurant was not busy at the time and our server had walked by is at least 3-4 times. Once we were able to order our waiter was quite condescending when it came to the beer menu. The food was just ok, my wife had the crab fettucini with mushrooms and was really not very good. Really overloaded with mushrooms overpowering he taste of the fresh crab. I ordered the 18oz blackened prime rib. The flavor was very good but the dryness of a dish ordered rare was very apparent. Seriously not terrible but for a $150 bill we were both very disappointed, we expected and hoped for much more.

Customer 2251.Name: Hiro
Customer 2251.Content: When I have a chance to visit Seattle, I come here with my friends to taste good American steak.

Customer 2252.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2252.Content: This was such a disappointment! We went here for my husband's birthday dinner. We had the absolute worst server - she didn't explain any of the menu to us and was extremely rude. Worst of all - I ordered a mixed green starter salad that had a sweet dressing and candied walnuts and I found a shrimp in it! When I asked the waitress about it she apologized, but didn't even take it off the bill! Our dinner was not even good - I've had much better! Overall, it was a terrible dining expierence - we were rushed through dinner and were very disappointed. Would not recommend!

Customer 2253.Name: Mark
Customer 2253.Content: Seldom eat red meat, but if you do, this is the place.  I had a filet and it was great.  Bread was great, as wells as the onion rings.

Customer 2254.Name: Iowateah2017
Customer 2254.Content: I enjoyed the pomegranate martini.  It was very delicious. The food was amazing. I had the steak salad. Our service was phenomenal. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Customer 2255.Name: GlennM
Customer 2255.Content: Excellent staff, food, and overall experience. Thank you MG - Keep up the great service

Customer 2256.Name: ElaineL
Customer 2256.Content: Bruno and Dillon were fabulous, ask Bruno anything about steak and he will give you all the info you need

Customer 2257.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2257.Content: Service is always impressive and wonderful at the Met!  Meal was amazing and for a business lunch when you're watching the time . . . they'll get you back on the street timely if needed.

Customer 2258.Name: AFR1
Customer 2258.Content: Wonderful wine, delicious food, and a well informed and accommodating staff!

Customer 2259.Name: Jerry
Customer 2259.Content: Atmosphere exactly as hoped for.  Relaxed, elegant, attentive staff, thanks for a perfect celebration event. The food was perfect.

Customer 2261.Name: Jeffrey
Customer 2261.Content: Amazing service and food as always.... Will definantly be back there for dinner in a couple weeks..

Customer 2263.Name: Marcus67
Customer 2263.Content: Always love coming to the MET. Only place I take my big golf clients. Top 2 of all time bone in ribeye. Syrah recommended was so so. Otherwise, this is my favorite steakhouse.

Customer 2264.Name: Alcahuete
Customer 2264.Content: These guys are absolutely amazing!  Second time I've been there and the food is to die for.  Best steak ever!

Customer 2265.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2265.Content: We had a fantastic meal!! When money is not a factor and you want a meal that is cooked to perfection and you feel like celebrating this is the place. Great prompt and friendly service wish I could eat like that  everyday

Customer 2266.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2266.Content: We love it here but save your pennies!

Customer 2267.Name: Gene
Customer 2267.Content: Great food from first course through dessert. Decade coffee could have been better. Drink prices a bit steep. Service is excellent, attentive but non-intrusive. Great date night!!!

Customer 2268.Name: ChasC
Customer 2268.Content: Outstanding quality steaks at this Seattle institution that takes obvious pride in professional service. We had a large round table for eight in a room that allowed everyone to participate in table talk. Extensive wine list.

Customer 2269.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2269.Content: I wasn't as impressed this visit as I have been in the past.  First, the reservation staff was sitting a group of six in a semi-circular booth. Perhaps this table would be more appropriate for a cozy family - NOT a business dinner as was indicated on thee reservation . My steak was luke-warm, the bread offered was some sweaty-sourdough ends, and the asparagus was stick-like, woody and barely drizzled with hollandaise.  Also - I miss the martinis offered in years gone by. the pear lemon drop was awful.  a hard slice of pear skewered in a lemon infused vodka is not up to par with the Met.

Customer 2270.Name: GEOF
Customer 2270.Content:
The food was delicious and generous portions.
Service was good but had to wait several times for service.
Would recommend it to all.

Customer 2271.Name: Sweet
Customer 2271.Content: I was at The Met to meet with the Director of Wine to take care of items on my bucket list. Had lunch after meeting and it was great. Good service, excellent food choices and preparation.

Customer 2272.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2272.Content: Dined here for my 35th birthday with friends. Service was excellent and our steaks were fantastic. Prices are what you expect from a high end steakhouse. If your in the mood to splurge it is well worth it.

Customer 2273.Name: MarkP
Customer 2273.Content: Love The Met.  The service is top flight.  The style is traditional, classy and comfortable.  Wine list is seperior to most.  Steaks are the best quality, cooked to perfection.   Lobster appetizer fantastic.  Bananas Foster tableside an experience in itself and amazing.

Customer 2274.Name: DavidG
Customer 2274.Content: My 18oz Chicago style too sirlion steak was super. Been all over the country enjoying beef, both better and less expensive. It's very expensive and somewhat hard to justify. I will go back!

Customer 2275.Name: HG12
Customer 2275.Content: Sides were undercooked and steak was over cooked.  With so many competing options in Seattle I don't see the need to return.

Customer 2276.Name: JohnH
Customer 2276.Content: Dinner was excellent and our waiter, Todd, was outstanding!

Customer 2277.Name: Avery
Customer 2277.Content: Overpriced and overrated - burger was soggy and bland

Customer 2278.Name: awesomesteak
Customer 2278.Content: Years ago, I had one of the best meals I've ever had in a restaurant @ Metropolitan Grill. The meal the other night was one of the most forgettable meals, and at best, average. Too bad.

Customer 2279.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2279.Content: We were extremely happy with the whole experience. Food was great, had the best server, dessert was a show stopper, wasn't made to feel in a hurry to finish and leave.

Customer 2280.Name: DavidB
Customer 2280.Content: The dinner was great for me and my son. Our personal waiter was very knowledgeable in helping us through our evening meal and overall experience...Thank you

Customer 2281.Name: IcyT
Customer 2281.Content: Great steak house!! Very busy steak house. Highly recommended!! Reservations recommended. Lots selection of variety steaks and wonderful table-side dessert:)

Customer 2282.Name: ScottiJ
Customer 2282.Content: Reputation is a hard thing to maintain but The Met exceeds it almost every time.  The food, the staff, the atmosphere, the history all contribute to a wonderful dining and social experience.  When confirming a location for lunch all you have to say is "The Met" and everyone knows.

Customer 2283.Name: AngelicaSantana89
Customer 2283.Content: It was amazing! Our server  Sean was very pleasant and attentive. Food was amazing! I will definitely come back to the metropolitan grill!!

Customer 2285.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2285.Content: Had a great waiter, my boyfriend said it was the best steak he had ever had. I did not like my blackened prime rib. Great service though.

Customer 2286.Name: Mohammad
Customer 2286.Content: Excellent service and great food. Staff didn't seem to mind that I was in jeans and a hoodie. You can also check your coats with them.

Customer 2287.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2287.Content: One of our favorite places in Seattle for a special occasion - steaks and cocktails/wine list never disappoints.

Customer 2288.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2288.Content: Excellent steaks. You get what you pay for.   200 for 2 good steaks 4 good pints  and some shared sides.

Customer 2289.Name: FrankB
Customer 2289.Content: Outstanding steaks. Rivals the Bern in Tampa. Bring a large appetite because it will be satisfied. Don't miss the desserts

Customer 2290.Name: Terence
Customer 2290.Content: Great NYC quality food. Apps, sides and entrees all delicious! Provided dessert for my birthday which was a nice touch. Will definitely recommend and will definitely return!

Customer 2291.Name: Operadiner
Customer 2291.Content:
An iconic steak and meat lovers destination.  My 12 oz Prime Rib was fine but too much.  In fact I believe they could trim their portions by a few ounces and all but the most committed, glutenous carnivore would be happy.  That would also allow for scaling back the very high prices a notch.  
This is clearly an expense account or special occasion place to dine.  Do they offer a rewarding value for the money???  You would have to be the judge.
I came away feeling ok about my meal but not ok with how much our dinner for 2 cost (and we paid $25 corkage for our splurge wine from our vast (sic) wine cellar.)

Customer 2292.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2292.Content:
the service was extraordinary
the meal was heavenly
The meat melted in your mouth

Customer 2293.Name: Pete
Customer 2293.Content:
Our steaks were fantastic ! Presented exactly as we ordered them done . Brunello by the glass was perfect. Main was delivered 20-25 minutes, again, was perfect timing. Wait staff was really good. Explained all specials and the menu. Friendly and not pushy. Easy access via car or cab.
Next time in Seattle we wouldn't go anywhere else.

Customer 2294.Name: GordonC
Customer 2294.Content: Service is second to none. I love they let you choose the pace of the meal. Want to get in and out; no problem. Want to catch up with friends over a 2 1/2 hour meal; no problem. Food is alway amazing. On the rare occasion something has been off they make is right immediately. We live outside Seattle and always make it a point to have dinner at The Met when we are in the city. Always a wonderful experience. The fact that much of the same staff  have been there for the 15+ years we have been going there speaks volumes to the atmosphere and commitment to excellence.  I will always recommend them to anyone looking for an exceptional meal in Seattle.

Customer 2295.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2295.Content: Our server wasn't at all friendly. Not happy that you HAVE to pay an automatic gratuity when good service is not given. The busser was more attentive and had more personality. Thank goodness for that!! Food was mediocre.

Customer 2296.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2296.Content: Impeccable service! Very attentive and worth the pennies. Fantastic food!

Customer 2297.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2297.Content: Was there for a business gathering.  Our waiter, Todd, made the meal.

Customer 2298.Name: RogerF
Customer 2298.Content:
Arguably the best steaks in Seattle.  The Metropolitan Grill or "The Met" as it's known by has been an iconic Steakhouse for DECADES!  There's a reason why they are still in business and thriving!  It's the Food and the amazing Service. 

Great menu items.  Each food item is superb.  Needless to say you will not be disappointed.

Customer 2299.Name: ColleenM
Customer 2299.Content: Amazing service. The wait staff is what sets them apart. Great at suggestions, great at realizing their audience. Most of the wait staff has been there 20+ years and it shows! They do an incredible job of making you happy to spend alot of money.

Customer 2300.Name: JeffG
Customer 2300.Content: A Seattle classic.  Very good food.  Professional staff.  You can't go wrong.

Customer 2301.Name: HoustonFoodie
Customer 2301.Content: I make it to the Metropolitan more so for lunch than dinner.  Every time I dine here, I get great service and outstanding food.  The steaks are definitely top notch but they balance the menu with other fare including seafood and great sandwiches.  For lunch, I had the steak sandwich with fries.  It was awesome and would definitely recommend this place for anyone craving steak.

Customer 2302.Name: Downtown
Customer 2302.Content:
Great lunch meeting!  There are selections for all budgets and appetites, and the service is top notch!  Very friendly staff and the environment is very inviting.

I love going to The Met

Customer 2303.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2303.Content: Excellent food. Friendly and attentive waitstaff.  Nice atmosphere. The only negative is that their wine prices are VERY inflated. Would reserve again, but would probably stick to cocktails.

Customer 2304.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2304.Content: We got a last minute reservation while visiting Seattle.  The food and service were impeccable. Could not have asked for a better dining experience.

Customer 2305.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2305.Content: Superb food and service, everything cooked, prepared and served to perfection.  Extremely professional yet friendly waitstaff - the best.  Priced, though, only for special occasions.

Customer 2306.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2306.Content: I  was rippped off.  Waiters attitude was poor and we had to ask for one refill multiple times.  We got cold aujus twice and that cost us $160.  Never again!  Thanks and we still left a $21 tip :(

Customer 2307.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2307.Content: I booked the metropolitan grill for my husband's 30th birthday and the experience was great! Everything was very well done and the service was outstanding. I would definitely recommend this place if you are looking to celebrate a special occasion of any kind. Thanks again for the great experience. Will be back again.

Customer 2308.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 2308.Content: The food is excellent and amazingly, the Service is still better! Bruno, Craig, Kevin, Michael, Mike and so many more are delivering warm, charm, food and amazingly friendly service. They are the reason I keep coming back! I love this restaurant!

Customer 2309.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2309.Content: Our food was spectacular with the exception of the parmesan tomato concoction! Service!!! Mediocre!! For the price one pays at this restaurant and the lovely ambience, one would expect much better service! Got really tired sucking on ice cubes in my empty glass of water to quench my thirst! I've been to other local restaurants in this price point that run circles around the service staff at Metropolitan Grill! Again, food was superb but it's a package deal

Customer 2310.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2310.Content:
They cooked my $63 steak wrong twice. First time it was super rare when I ordered medium and second time it was medium well and charred on top. Also my side was served cold. I was expecting the best meal of my adult life and was very disappointed. It was my birthday too :(
Crab cake appetizer was good though.

Customer 2311.Name: JakobH
Customer 2311.Content: Wonderful steakhouse. Great food selection and drinks.

Customer 2313.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2313.Content: Phenomenal food.  One of the best steakhouse restaurants there is.

Customer 2314.Name: OregonVisitor99
Customer 2314.Content: This was our second attempt at Metropolitan Grill.  The second try was worse than the first.   Our server, Diana, started out friendly, and while she saw to the tables around us who were seated after us first, we were okay with it,  but whe we wanted to split a meal, things changed in a hurry.  She questioned our decision making asking if we realized that the 8 oz filet was small.  I guess I assume an 8 oz filet is....well, 8 oz.  I have ordered one before.  We ordered an appetizer of onion rings.  She wanted to know if we wanted soup or salad and when we declined, she seemed more miffed.   Our bread came and was plopped down in a hurry.  After a good amount of time, and the people around us were eating their appetizers and salads we are wondering if she perhaps forgot our onion rings.  Soon, here comes the entree with no onion rings.  When asked about it, Diana says "it is not my fault, it is the kitchen's fault".  Frankly, assuming the kitchen forgot (I'm not convinced of this), it is the servers responsibility to follow up with them and remind them that her order of onion rings is not ready.  Halfway through the entree, finally the onion rings come.  The onion rings themselves were awesome.  Probably the best I have ever had.  The steak was good....slightly "blue" in the center when we ordered medium, but we were afraid to speak to Diane any more at this point, and let it slide.  We ordered horseradish sauce with the steak which never came.  Again, we were intimidated into not mentioning it.  Finally, as with our last experience here, the baked potato is pre made and reheated.  This makes for a hard, lumpy lukewarm baked potato.    Needless to say, we won't be returning.

Customer 2315.Name: LaurieF
Customer 2315.Content: Great place to celebrate birthdays!!!!  Always amazing food and service!!!

Customer 2316.Name: JimS
Customer 2316.Content: Brought my boys with me on a business trip to Seattle.  Wanted them to experience a world class steakhouse.  My 11 year old son summed it up best: "This place is legit and gangster.  Amazing."

Customer 2317.Name: TerraJ
Customer 2317.Content: My office is just right across the street so it's convenient for lunch.  The food and the service are always good.  I look forward to the Chicken Noodle soup & Beef Stroganoff on Thursdays.

Customer 2318.Name: saladnvodka
Customer 2318.Content: Drinks and entrees were excellent. So were the service and drinks. Seafood sampler was good but the lobster was overcooked and in little bit sized chewy pieces. The table by the door was really cold to sit at. February air kept blowing in and I had to keep my jacket on.

Customer 2319.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2319.Content: Great food, wonder service! Bruno was a wonderful waiter and made our experience coming through town on vacation exceptional!

Customer 2320.Name: LisaP
Customer 2320.Content: I absolutely love eating at the Met.  If you enjoy great steak, you can't go wrong.  We split a salad and a Waygu 20 oz cut.  It was plenty of food and delicious.  The atmosphere is inviting and the service second-to-none.  While it is not an inexpensive place to eat, it's worth the splurge.  For those who want to save a few pennies, go for lunch.  The prices are lower and the food is every bit as good.

Customer 2321.Name: James
Customer 2321.Content: As always outstanding steaks and service.  The Met never disappoints.  Seattle's quintessential steakhouse.

Customer 2322.Name: Merran808
Customer 2322.Content: We were visiting from Hawaii and a friend who lives in Seattle recommended this restaurant.  The food was awesome, but more so than the food was the service from our server Cat who went above and beyond to help us find a pool hall and karaoke bar to go to after dinner.

Customer 2323.Name: GeorgeA
Customer 2323.Content: Best classic steakhouse in Seattle. You get what you pay for.

Customer 2325.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2325.Content:
Came here for my 5th anniversary.
Waiter gave us creme brûlée after finding out it was our anniversary which was very thoughtful. My steak was mostly delicious and best steak I ever had. We like our steak well done. Our steak was kind of fatty and in the middle it was very red so I had to cut around it. The parts that were well done were a amazing but I was disappointed the middle wasn't well done. Other than that our service and experience was 10/10.

Customer 2326.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2326.Content: We chose Metropolitan Grill for its Financial District location, athletic appeal and traditional steak house charm hoping to see the local flavor and left feeling like we were part of that attraction.  It was an amazing three hours.

Customer 2327.Name: Cookstersalibi
Customer 2327.Content: Been to the Metropolitan Grill a few times before. Several years ago I took a friend for his Birthday and bought him the Tomahawk steak for $100.  It looked amazing and tasted great.  We were all very pleased.  We went back on Saturday (February 18, 2017) and I got the same Tomahawk steak (big long rib bone).  It was less ounces than before and cost $120.  I was ok with that since I was expecting it to be amazing.  Boy! Was I disappointed... The taste was just not there as it looked like the steak lacked some of the marbling that I remembered from previous visit.  There were four of us and each got a different steak.  Just not impressed with the taste & portion size.  Sadly, I would say their steaks are way over valued and there are many better steak houses in the Seattle area where you can get a better tasting steak for a better value.  Sad...

Customer 2328.Name: OpenTable Diner
