Customer 2328.Content:
The service from arrival to departure is top notch.  You feel important and cared for throughout the experience.  The food is amazing and delicious.  We go for the great red meat.  So good, that you could cut some with just your fork.  

The price is on the higher end but an excellent value for an occasional visit.  Highly recommended!

Customer 2329.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2329.Content: Nice place, good food but not as good as the hype.

Customer 2330.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2330.Content: Great dining experience. Service was outstanding.  Meal was terrific.

Customer 2331.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2331.Content: We celebrated here a few nights ago and weren't disappointed! We had oysters to start. I really liked the gremolata type mignonette. I had the smaller prime rib with a side of asparagus. I added a lobster tail since I'd never had one. Pricey for what it was, but again, lobster novice here, so I tried it! My husband has the Chicago cute wagyu. It was delicious! We didn't have room for dessert! The restaurant is quite noisy, so if you're looking for quiet romantic ambiance, maybe go private dining? Overall, we enjoyed our meals very much and will probably go again for our next celebration!

Customer 2332.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2332.Content: Excellent food, drink and service. Very crowded and noisy though.

Customer 2333.Name: GDO1
Customer 2333.Content: Our dinner for a party of ten  was a retirement dinner for one of our managers.  The service started out well but once we ordered entrees and dinner was served we were neglected.  As the host, I dine out a lot and this was  a big disappointment. I don't believe my/our steaks were prime meat. At least 1/4 of my "prime" rib steak was unchewable.  The quality of the meat was a big disappointment for one of Seattle's "Prime" steakhouses.

Customer 2334.Name: Julie
Customer 2334.Content: The Food was delicious the service was very good, and the knowledge of the staff was spot on.  The price was over the top for the menu items  600.00 for 4 was much.  I'm glad we went but its not really something you can do frequently for that price.  A must if you haven't ever been and would like to enjoy the experience and not worry about the dollars.

Customer 2335.Name: RonaldoG
Customer 2335.Content: Classic stake house - reliable like a good friend.  Good food all around

Customer 2336.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2336.Content: Best steak I've ever had!!! Incredible service!! Highly recommend:)

Customer 2337.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2337.Content: I can honestly say this is the best restaurant I have ever been to, the food & service we're out of this world.

Customer 2338.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2338.Content: Regular night at the Met. Which means it was great.

Customer 2339.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2339.Content: Valentines Day. Tops the list on quality Steakhouses with friendly casual class. Will be a regular here!

Customer 2340.Name: GwenE
Customer 2340.Content: We enjoyed the service and the ambiance.  We had 2 young girls with us and we were all treated very well.  Food was excellent

Customer 2341.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2341.Content:
Service staff was VERY attentive yet not intrusive.
Chop Chop Southwestern Salad w/Calimari was filling and delicious.

Customer 2342.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2342.Content: We only come here on try special occasions, but we love the place. Service, quality are always impeccable. We will be back.

Customer 2343.Name: karent
Customer 2343.Content:
I took 2 friends there for dinner 2/12 . They never been in Metro Grill but heard about the delicious steaks in town . Unfortunately, the long bone was over cooked. We ordered as medium . However, when we mentioned to the waiter, he responded: "so, what do you want me to do".  We did not know how to respond to the waiter. Finally We said "oh, we just wanted to let you know" . The waiter walked away. Bad...Need to improve services!!!
We still left him 20% tips !ok 2 friends there for dinner 2/12 . They never been in Metro Grill but heard about the delicious steaks in town . Unfortunately, the long bone was over cooked. We ordered as medium . However, when we mentioned to the waiter, he responded: "so, what do you want me to do".  We did not know how to respond to the waiter. Finally We said "oh, we just wanted to let you know" . The waiter just walked away 😚Bad...Need to improve services!!!
We still left him 20% tips !

Customer 2344.Name: DJCarter
Customer 2344.Content: Long time diners at the Met. Go every year on the same Sunday night in February and sit at the same table with the same 3 couples. Every year. This year was a one off. Mediocre food. Poor service.

Customer 2346.Name: MariaP
Customer 2346.Content: Great food and a Seattle classic dining experience most suited for special occasions. I mentioned when making the reservation we were celebrating a family birthday and again to our server but nothing special was done on the part of the restaurant. I was expecting at least something small like a plate with "Happy Birthday" written out or a small complimentary dessert or drink for my mother who was the celebrant. Nada! Disappointing given the very high price point.

Customer 2347.Name: BensonG
Customer 2347.Content: The best. It doesn't get any better than The Met any where in or around Seattle if you love great steaks.

Customer 2348.Name: Outstanding
Customer 2348.Content:
Love it, the food, the Service, the experience.  It's been a favorite of mine for more than 20 years.  I had not been in the past five years or so and Ila's much as some things have changed like the quality food options the whole experience has remained top notch.  

I'll be back.

Customer 2349.Name: JennaMarie
Customer 2349.Content: The food was amazing & so was the service! Roger was our waiter and he was such a delight with a wonderful personality and knowledge of the menu. The manager, whom came out and cooked our dessert, was also a very kind man. From beginning to end, our experience was amazing. We'll definitely be going back.

Customer 2350.Name: Freebird
Customer 2350.Content:
We go to the every now and then to compare it against our local steakhouse (JaK's).  The thing that stands out at the Met is the service.  They are very professional, from the greeters, to the servers, to the wine personnel, etc...they truly know what they're doing and they don't rush you.  We all had steaks (one Wagu filet, and 3 filet mignons) and thought they were about a 7 out of 10.  Two of the filets were 8 oz, and were cut pretty thin which was disappointing (it appeared that they cut the larger 13 oz steak in half horizontally).  The Wagu filet was really tender but also not quite as good as expected.  The salads and various potatoes we got were very good, and the chocolate lava cake we had for dessert was very good, but didn't have a scoop of vanilla ice cream (thought that was a little odd).

All in all, the Met is a good spot for a business dinner or to take friends too if they want to eat downtown, and you have the budget for it.  Next time we'll order something other than the filets and see if that makes a difference.

Customer 2351.Name: Libertastic
Customer 2351.Content: So disappointing. Terrible service. Worst part was the terrible filet - literally one of the worst we've had.

Customer 2352.Name: RogerL
Customer 2352.Content: The entire experience was excellent.  The staff took great care of us.  The food was awesome.  My wire had the special with was 2 6oz filets done Oscar style with Lobster. Only problem was that my wife did not give me a bite.

Customer 2353.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2353.Content: Beautiful ambiance, delicate flavors and superb service. We'll be back.

Customer 2354.Name: MichelleG
Customer 2354.Content: Food was good, valet is nice since it's downtown. A little loud.

Customer 2355.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2355.Content: From the moment we stepped in the door, it was evident we'd chosen the proper location for our reunion. The entire staff was superb. However, Todd, our waiter, took the experience a step further and made us feel like family, not just customers.

Customer 2356.Name: RussR
Customer 2356.Content: Everything was fantastic except the steaks were served luke warm not hot like Ruths Chris. Steak was very, very tastely mind you but they were not hot - too bad

Customer 2357.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2357.Content: I can honestly say this was the best meal I've ever had the meat melted in my mouth the flavors were perfect the service was outstanding

Customer 2358.Name: TravelerFromCA
Customer 2358.Content: We have eaten at the Metropolitan Grill a couple of times now and it has never disappointed. The food is excellent and the service is top notch. We love to take our time and enjoy a leisurely meal and the Metropolitan never rushes us. We appreciate their excellent wine list and how it complements their awesome steaks.

Customer 2359.Name: Dana
Customer 2359.Content: I have always enjoyed the meals I have had at the Met! The steaks are delicious! The service impeccable!

Customer 2360.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2360.Content: Steak was too salty and burned out. Server was not interested in service. Just horrible experience.

Customer 2361.Name: Mojo
Customer 2361.Content: Great service and steaks, sides were below average.  The creamed spinach had a 1/2 inch of semi-warm coagulated cheese on top (should have sent it back) and the wild mushrooms just needed to be cooked and they would have been really good.

Customer 2362.Name: QStories
Customer 2362.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was fine....but I had read that it was one of the top Steak Houses in the US.  I am not sure about that.  I recently ate at Gordon Ramsey's Steak and I believe the quality was better at Ramsey's.  But, to be fair I ordered prime rib at Metropolitan and a filet at Ramsey's so it isn't comparing apples to apples.  The prime rib was on the tough side.  The prime rib cost $43 and the filet cost $65 so unfortunately that was the deciding factor for me.  Our waiter was charming, efficient and pleasant.  Ambience typical of traditional steak houses.

Customer 2363.Name: DANF
Customer 2363.Content: Always outstanding... fabulous steaks, phenomenal service, great bar and happy hour.  MG has it all.

Customer 2364.Name: JeffF
Customer 2364.Content: I have been going here at least once per year for the last several years. It really seems to have gone downhill the last couple years. Good is still great and servers are usually on point. However the last time a hostess was extremely rude because we asked a couple times how's much longer or wait would be. We had a reservation and was waiting for over 45 minutes so yes we were hungry and getting antsy waiting. No reason to be rude to us for asking. Luckily another hostess seated is and apologized but the damage was already done. I do not think I'll be returning anymore since I can get the same quality food elsewhere for the same if not less in price. Plus I'll never have to see the rude hostess again cause I'll probably go off on her if I see her again.

Customer 2365.Name: CFosterKane
Customer 2365.Content: The steaks remain outstanding, but the service seems to be slipping .  At this restaurant we should not have to ask to have water glasses refilled.  We were warned that the kitchen was behind and there would be a 40 minute delay - but is that our problem?

Customer 2366.Name: DianneD
Customer 2366.Content: Our server Dohui, was amazing, very attentive, acknowledgeable,  engaged in meaningful conversation with all twelve of my guests.  All commented on her abilities and demeanor.

Customer 2367.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2367.Content: As always the Met was great.  Both food and service were as good as one could ask for.

Customer 2368.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2368.Content:
Best steakhouse in town!!!
We were a large group and had a private room.

Customer 2369.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2369.Content: I had a reservation for a business dinner last Tuesday night for six. My client decided to bring along 3 other people from the board (surprise). I was of course thrown off when I arrived and seen that we had a total of nine instead of six who the reservations were made for. I stepped to the hostess desk and explained my situation. The hostess immediately said "your reservation is for 6 not 9, I can't help you". Understanding that it was my problem not hers, that the party increased, I asked if there was any other options that she could offer, she said "No, you can try someplace else". I was so very disappointed, not so much in the fact that they could not accommodate me, but in how she responded and handled the situation. We ended up sitting our clients (7 of them) at a table and My boss and I ended up eating in the bar (waiting for our clients to finish dinner so that we could pay for it). We spent almost $2,000 at the Met that night. It would have been nice to have had better customer service from the hostess.

Customer 2370.Name: ClintW
Customer 2370.Content: Still the best Steak in Seattle  about the only reason  to  go to Seattle  is to have  dinner at Metropolitan  Grill .Excellent  Steaks and side dishes.Must have the Banana  Foster !!!!

Customer 2371.Name: greatlocalgem
Customer 2371.Content: Great steak house, in classic downtown gem . Wonderful ambiance and service!

Customer 2372.Name: Nancy
Customer 2372.Content: The food was fabulous. The waitstaff was very attentive when we needed something. Four of us ordered different dishes and everyone was very pleased.

Customer 2373.Name: juliet
Customer 2373.Content: I have always loved the Met Grill.  However, the last two times I have been there it really has a stinky smell. It just feels like they need to recarpet, re-upholster, and paint.  For how great the Met is they need to do a little fixing up the interiors.

Customer 2374.Name: Matusa69
Customer 2374.Content: Great atmosphere, great location, great services and great food. Steak are the very good. Cooked at right grade. The only cons are the side plate that are poor and not great.

Customer 2375.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2375.Content: One of the best stwaks I have ever eaten. Double R porter is a winner.

Customer 2376.Name: EmilyT
Customer 2376.Content: Good high end steak house experience.  Salmon was also succulent.  Wine pours are generous.  Not a budget restaurant.

Customer 2377.Name: Jainy13
Customer 2377.Content: One of the best steaks and service!

Customer 2378.Name: azmia
Customer 2378.Content: Steak was. It hot, compared to steak houses in Los Angeles, it  doesn't compared especially since it was much more expensive than even Mastros

Customer 2379.Name: JerryM
Customer 2379.Content: This is the annual dinner for my girlfriend's birthday. Cozy booth seating. Everything is first class.  Sorry they did not have the Wygu steak. But top steaks we had were buttery tender and very tasty. Very pricey but worth it for a special ocassion. Highly recommended.

Customer 2380.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2380.Content: Good restaurant. Might be best steak in the area. However, too small room between table and chair. Little too dark. Other than that everything is perfect.

Customer 2381.Name: LynnO
Customer 2381.Content: We always think of the Metropolitan Grill when we want to celebrate. The food is dependably excellent, with plenty of choices for everyone. We usually end up ordering beef, because it's perfectly prepared. The service is superb. The lighting is great, and it's never too noisy. We have been there for birthdays, anniversaries, and just to treat ourselves. I know that if there are just two of us or a crowd, we will have a wonderful time.

Customer 2382.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2382.Content: The food and service were perfection.  We were there for our 43rd anniversary.  Mentioned that to the server and she surprised us with a creme brûlée.  The head waiter or manager came by to see how we were doing.  Everyone working there spoke to us - thanked us for coming in - as we walked out.  Bottom line I can't imagine a better restaurant.  Ribeye steak, steak medallions with lobster oscar - or some such.

Customer 2383.Name: Nancy
Customer 2383.Content: Always excellent.  Great food.  Love, love, love the French Onion Soup.

Customer 2384.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2384.Content: From the moment we arrived I knew we chose the right place for our special occasion. There was an element of surprising one member of our party and the staff were great in helping make it happen. The valet service was fast and professional. The waiter kept us informed and welcomed us. The table service was fantastic. Never had an empty cup. Pampered as expected. And of course the beef was amazing.  Thanks  to all that serve there.

Customer 2385.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2385.Content: We traveled from Utah for dinner and we were not disappointed!

Customer 2386.Name: fourfood2
Customer 2386.Content: Best steak ever I had. Oysters were fantastic.  Perfect service.  Will return.

Customer 2387.Name: douglasg
Customer 2387.Content:
We were from out of town for a my wife's birthday, and we both remarked that this dining experience was probably the best we have ever had.  Todd, Lance and Kevin made us feel part of the family, helped us out with wine since we knew very little, and went over the top with what can only be described as Excellent Service.   I would have given them 7 stars for that.  

The food was very, very good.  Next time we'll probably get a different cut of meat as what we got was nice, but not over the top crazy good like we were expecting.  Probably try the bone in rib-eye...   

I never take the time to leave reviews, but this team deserved it.  I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Customer 2388.Name: BG12
Customer 2388.Content: The service meets or exceeds the exceptional steaks.

Customer 2389.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2389.Content: We love the Metropolitan grill, they have outstanding food and service, never a disappointment when dining here. Although this time around the table next to us was robustly loud and we couldn't really have a conversation without yelling to each other over the other table, other than that it was still really delicious food and service!

Customer 2390.Name: Moho713
Customer 2390.Content: Best restaurant! Best staff!  We love this restaurant and we love Craig!  We highly recommend this restaurant.

Customer 2391.Name: MaryHelenS
Customer 2391.Content: We have been charged multiple times and my gift card was rejected until I questioned it.  Not a good show!

Customer 2392.Name: Nonickname
Customer 2392.Content: Best service, wonderful meal, Valet service was easy. Noise level was high on a Thursday night but  booths are very comfortable and private.  Will return

Customer 2393.Name: terij
Customer 2393.Content:
Our favorite waiter, Todd S.  

 Very professional, knows the menu well, easy to talk to.

Customer 2394.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2394.Content: Douhi is the most amazing server! We absolutely adore her. She gave us great suggestions and we loved everything that she recommended.

Customer 2395.Name: arikohn
Customer 2395.Content: Excellent as always!!  The service is always very, very good, but yesterday was exceptional.

Customer 2396.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2396.Content: My co-worker and I had half sandwich and clam chowder on Feb 1st. Not sure what kind of bread that was used that day for our half sandwiches but they were crunchy. They were hard to bite and the bacon and tomatoe slipped out of the sandwiches. It was a mess eating that sandwich. Also, the sourdough that day was quite crunchy. Clam chowder was good but it was a bit salty for me. The waiter was nice.

Customer 2397.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2397.Content: Absolutely amazing evening.  From the cocktails at the bar to the food and especially the service.  Definitely got what I paid for and don't regret it at all.  If I am ever back in Seattle this restaurant will be on my list.

Customer 2398.Name: Bean
Customer 2398.Content: The food was amazing. However, the server we got was extremely slow. He was nice but it took an hour to order our food and he rarely checked in on us. That was a little disappointing because the service is usually amazing. Hopefully we won't have the same server if we go next time.

Customer 2399.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2399.Content: It was incredible.  From the bar and drinks and Robbie our server. Was the best ever.

Customer 2400.Name: JeffP
Customer 2400.Content: Food was great. Our first waiter was fantastic and really paid attention to the table. The sommelier was not as good. Had to request drink refills and did not suggest any wine. He was not pushy almost introverted.   Great dinner will definitely be back.

Customer 2401.Name: ChristineL
Customer 2401.Content: The Met is always a special place for dining. Expensive, but worth it! This is my restaurant "go-to" for special occasions.

Customer 2402.Name: MarvinS
Customer 2402.Content: Everything was outstanding and awesome! The filet  and flank steak were cook just right and tender. The service was 2nd to none, it was friendly and great.

Customer 2403.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2403.Content: This is my favorite place to dine. The food never disappoints! The pork chops are my absolute favorite! Staff is amazing, food is amazing!

Customer 2405.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2405.Content: Once again, we had an outstanding trip to "The Met". The food was delicious, service was outstanding, and we gained yet another fabulous memory with dear friends.

Customer 2406.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2406.Content: The starter was good and the cocktails were good but the steak was outstanding (which is really why you come here) and they have quite an extensive wine and spirits list.

Customer 2407.Name: OpenTableMan
Customer 2407.Content:
Great food, great service. But, I think it's getting too popular - to be as good a its reputation. Some of the 2-top seating areas are way too small (and tight) - and I'm not a big person. Maybe it's the way we were dressed (business casual), or we didn't tip the hostess. But, I was not happy with the seating arrangements. It was similar to 'bar seating'. And, there was an entire row of these seats.
Enough about the seating. The wine list is extensive, including half-bottles. The food selections (if you like steak) are amazing. Now, there are options for non-steak diners, too.
I'll definitely be going back, but not for the 'diner seating'. And, there are better steak houses in Seattle.

Customer 2408.Name: Khiggi
Customer 2408.Content: Classic steakhouse, food and service exceptional.   Would go back next time in Seattle

Customer 2409.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2409.Content: Our waitress was terrible. She was slow and unknowledgeable about the menu. She ruined my dining experience in my wife's favorite restaurant.

Customer 2411.Name: Debbie
Customer 2411.Content: Great steak house - quite pricy but portions are good size to split. Wine list is exceptional, service impeccable.  Because of the price, I would likely choose this for special occasions.

Customer 2412.Name: DoyleM
Customer 2412.Content: For our first time at MG It was ok , service was good but table was very small , my wife's steak was very good but mine was tough to even cut . Severely disappointed. The dividing curtains at the table were very dirty and the young women up front we're not engaging at all . Our waiter was great though and made the time very pleasant and the rest of the meal was good.

Customer 2413.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2413.Content: friendly servers and helpful in making our selections. A bit pricey but it was worth the experience.

Customer 2414.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2414.Content: Great food, especially the steak, but the veggies were no slouch either. Excellent service and nice atmosphere. All round top eatery.

Customer 2415.Name: Aimee
Customer 2415.Content: Had a great time. Family with a 7 and 5 year old.

Customer 2416.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2416.Content:
A terrific place to enjoy a special evening. We all enjoyed crab cakes as an appetizer and more than ample salads. Steak entrees were fabulous, though our fish entree was undercooked. Be specific if you want your fish cooked well done.
Would definitely return for another visit!

Customer 2417.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2417.Content: Another superb outing at my fav dining place and as usual, the service was exceptional.

Customer 2418.Name: BrianT
Customer 2418.Content: We had a great time as always. Michael and Craig are always great and make sure you have everything you need. The best thing was we met some guys sitting next to us that were the most wonderful people we have ever met. It was my wife's birthday, at the end of the evening the gentlemen picked up the tab. Thanks to the guys next to us, Michael and Craig it is an evening we wont forget.

Customer 2419.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2419.Content: Excellent spot for business lunch.  Great value and great service.

Customer 2420.Name: Gizelle
Customer 2420.Content: The salmon was tasteless and my coworker got sick from the steak.

Customer 2421.Name: Murph
Customer 2421.Content: Fabulous favorite place  to eat and drink when visiting Seattle!

Customer 2422.Name: Choman
Customer 2422.Content:
Service was excellent. However, food was not up to standard. The hamburger, which is suppose to be one of the best in Seattle, was just average. Fries were seasoned and nothing special. Left most on the plate. The beef dip sandwich was really disappointing. The meat was very tough and hard to chew. The bread was way too thick. Made for difficult eating. The pea salad was okay, but not as good as Stanley and Seaforts. 
We have had many good meals at the Met so won't let this poor one from stopping us from returning.

Customer 2423.Name: Robyn
Customer 2423.Content: Had the London Broil on Monday. Cooked to perfection. Very tasty. Stellar presentation, too. Server was knowledgeable and friendly.

Customer 2425.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2425.Content: Everything is delicious! Can't go wrong with any choice off the menu!

Customer 2426.Name: SandraC
Customer 2426.Content: Service good,  absolutely wonderful steak, which is amazing considering I order well done!

Customer 2427.Name: Liquid
Customer 2427.Content: The Met is a real steak house! And the food is always great! If you don't like something they always make it right. If you love steak, you have to give this place a try!

Customer 2428.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2428.Content:
Service was excellent!  Atmosphere was great.  Maybe I had high hopes and set the "bar" too high but the steaks were average.
I'd go again for happy hour but I can't spend $300 on a dinner for two for average food

Customer 2429.Name: MICk
Customer 2429.Content: Great spot. Great spot. Great spot. Really really great spot

Customer 2430.Name: Noongster
Customer 2430.Content: As usual, everything from the service to the meal was excellent!

Customer 2431.Name: JeffL
Customer 2431.Content: Off the charts service as always, incredible food, great old school cocktails, worth every penny!

Customer 2432.Name: BettyM
Customer 2432.Content: Our meals ranged from fish to steak and everything was terrific....cooked to perfection, timely prep and served with panache.  MG continues to be a "must do" when we hit Seattle.  Simply the best.

Customer 2433.Name: JaneL
Customer 2433.Content: Food was great. Staff very attentive. The only lowlight - can be quite noisy.

Customer 2434.Name: LouD
Customer 2434.Content: High end establishment that has a very sophisticated staff. Great menu choices. Food was amazing. Everything was well prepared, perfectly seasoned, and wine selection also a good match to all items. A little pricey but you get what you pay for.

Customer 2435.Name: Hellboy
Customer 2435.Content: Marilyn and everyone who assisted her was great.  The steak and the Kale Winter Salad's were excellent.

Customer 2436.Name: GarrettG
Customer 2436.Content: It was overall fantastic. Our server was attentive and personable but not overbearing. The food was exactly what we expected. Perfectly cooked steak and lobster with a great side of scalloped potatoes. A little pricy but it is to be expected with the reputation of the establishment. A Seattle must.

Customer 2437.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2437.Content: Food took a very long time to come out (I arrived at  6:15 and after ordering within 20 minutes after arriving, the food came out later than 7:35).  The delmonico cut was extremely tough and was a chore to begin cutting through. The side of mash tasted well over-cooked. The porterhouse cut was pretty good though. However, for the 70+ dollar price tag per steak, I would expect a much better experience than I did.

Customer 2438.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2438.Content: I have enjoyed going here for 30 years.  Excellent service and great food.  A solid Seattle institution.

Customer 2439.Name: Bean1008
Customer 2439.Content: Excellent service!  Appetizer and salads were generously sized.   Some sides were actually included with your steak!  Choice of baked or mashed potatoes or root veggies.  All price points on bottled wine...started mid-$30 to the moon.  While on the expensive side ($500 for four with cocktails, bottle of wine, two apps, salads, entrées and two shared desserts) we had a wonderful dinner!

Customer 2440.Name: Toothdoctor
Customer 2440.Content: Our server Roger was the best we've had anywhere. We will always request him when we come again and will tell our friends to request him also.. He was full of information, and recommended many of our dishes which were perfect!! His energy and pleasant personality really made our evening.. And of course the food is ALWAYS excellent   See you again soon Dr Bruce Nixon 5 out of 5 stars

Customer 2441.Name: Tom9
Customer 2441.Content: A very good steak house. Good food. Not too pompous. Arguably the best place for a steak in the Seattle area.

Customer 2442.Name: Robertkm1972
Customer 2442.Content: By far, hands down the best steak I have ever had, nice atmosphere, wait staff was excellent and friendly, lastly cooking the dessert table side made the night very special. Thank you all.

Customer 2443.Name: RJPII
Customer 2443.Content: Best Steakhouse in Seattle. The 40z long bone Rib-Eye was phenomenal. The service was excellent and all employees were very helpful.

Customer 2444.Name: CCseattle
Customer 2444.Content: This was my second dinner this week there with colleagues. Tuesday night had sword fish and it was fantastic. Ordered the sword fish again tonight and was extremely disappointed. First fish was not completely cooked and arrived cold! On the other hand the mashed potatoes were warm. The rest of the dining experience was average. Overall not a very good experience.

Customer 2445.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2445.Content: Outstanding crabcakes, mediocre salmon, and one of the best steaks I've ever had.  However, the server seemed annoyed to be servicing me and my wife because we weren't of the same pedigree as the more common patrons.  The pricing was obnoxious but it was an experience that was worth a try.  I'll stick to the less upscale places in the future.

Customer 2446.Name: SteveT
Customer 2446.Content: Hands down the best steakhouse in town! All the food was incredible! The server was attentive but not intrusive. Great place to go for that special celebration! Special kudos to the manager, Craig Summers for making us feel like VIPs! Nothing like the Met! You do it better than anyone else!

Customer 2447.Name: MarcoL
Customer 2447.Content: As always, The Met experience is just that, an experience. From the staff to the food to the venue itself, a visit here is nothing less than impeccable!

Customer 2448.Name: nick1965
Customer 2448.Content:
Once again a wonderful evening at The Met. The food, the service, the wine were above expectation. I only get to the Met once or twice a year but every time I come away with a smile on my face.
I have been there when not too busy and when it is busy. Every time we are treated like we are the only ones there. Our server this time was Lance. He took the time to answer all our questions with a smile and was very informative. 
Highly recommend the peppercorn steak. Fabulous!
Other foods ordered
Swordfish w/lemon caper sauce, 10oz Filet mignon,  sides of mashed potato, scalloped potato and asparagus.
Dessert Pear bread pudding. ;-) yum!
No one left disappointed.
Thank you Metropolitan Grill for always being the place we want to go to for the dinner of the year.

Customer 2449.Name: Al106
Customer 2449.Content: Second time at the Met and it was even better than our first visit. The food is pricey but well worth Every dollar. You can cut the steak with your fork.  The staff are professional and friendly, and clearly love their jobs. Highly recommended.

Customer 2450.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2450.Content: Pretty spenThdy but the best steak in town. The peppercorn New York Strip was outstanding.

Customer 2451.Name: FrancesS
Customer 2451.Content: We love dining at the Met.  We plan to come more often.  We really enjoyed the meals for two.  That is a great menu option and a great value.  Because of that, we felt we should dine there more often cause of those choices.

Customer 2452.Name: Steakpro
Customer 2452.Content: Service was great and so were the appetizers. However, the ribeye did not taste like the ribeye, more like New York. The waiter claimed that it came from a certain rib, and different cuts have different textures. Whatever, I know my steaks. Value wise, it's a bit over the top. But overall it was a fun experience.

Customer 2453.Name: Sweet
Customer 2453.Content: We have celebrated every anniversary at The Met since number 30; this was number 45. The Met is absolutely my most favorite place for a special night out. Restaurants of this quality must never have an off night and to my knowledge they never have, certainly as far as my experience goes. The other biggies in Seattle have all let us down at one time or another. We will come back to the Met again and again. I had let it be known to The Met that this night was special for my wife, dear friend and me. I can't believe how they cared for us, making us feel like we were the only ones there. They brought us special appetizers, fussed over our wine selection, fabulous menu recommendations that we absolutely could not refuse and of course a complimentary dessert in honor of the occasion accompanied by a wonderful dessert wine; all on them. We had requested to be seated in Bruno's section and we were. Bruno is the absolutely the best! Matr'D Craig stopped by to say hi (I suspect it was he that ordered up all the special things for us). I asked, of Craig, a very special and secret favor for a future date  and he had Aaron, head of wines at The Met stop by to see if he could accommodate my special request. We have a future date for that; I am so honored that they will look after me in this manner. What a wonderful evening; fabulous treatment, equally fabulous food and wine. I only wish I could dine there every week!

Customer 2454.Name: BryantG
Customer 2454.Content: Now we know why Bill Gates is a repeat customer here

Customer 2455.Name: ErinH
Customer 2455.Content: Food is generally predictably good. I had the steak sandwich, which was good, but the French fries were nearly cold and the bread for the sandwich wasn't really toasted as it usually is. Felt like it waited out to be picked up by our server before getting to the table. Service was excellent but the food was less then what I've experienced before. I didn't complain at the meal as we were on a time limit and needed to get moving.

Customer 2456.Name: PauletteL
Customer 2456.Content: Haven't been in a few years! Happy to see the food is still amazing! I'm still full! Our server was fantastic! Great recommendations! We will return!

Customer 2457.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2457.Content: This place was amazing, first time there and extremely impressed with the service, food and coctails. Such a fun, inciting environment, pricey, but worth it!

Customer 2458.Name: LeslieD
Customer 2458.Content: This is our most favorite restaurant in the whole country.  We go to Metropolitan Grill every year for our anniversary. Tonight we had a perfectly prepared chateaubriand for two. Superb!

Customer 2459.Name: Dorothy
Customer 2459.Content: Went there to celebrate anniversary... Service was super good! Steaks are definitely one of the best in town but it might be too much for some people... No room for desserts.

Customer 2460.Name: MarknPam
Customer 2460.Content:
MG is always world class.  We had the absolute best desert this week the chocolate lava cake.

MG is a Seattle Gem.

Customer 2461.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2461.Content: Classic steakhouse setting with excellent service and food. Expansive menu selections, steaks are on point!! Exceptional wine list with selections from the globe! We had our two children and we felt very welcome. We have visited the Met a few times and we are looking forward to our next visit when we are in town!

Customer 2462.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2462.Content: This restaurant is amazing, quintessential American grill but with average meals being $60, it was way out of our budget. My husband ordered a steak and it was superb however I ordered salmon and it was a little dry. So if money is not an issue and you love steak, I'd definitely recommend this restaurant.

Customer 2463.Name: RAMONL
Customer 2463.Content: First time visiting this restaurant. Was in town with family for the New Year and found it on Best Steakhouses in America on the internet. Was very impressed with the décor and the knowledge of the food servers. Very professional! Will definitely visit again when I'm in Seattle.

Customer 2465.Name: Joseph
Customer 2465.Content:
Waiters and Servers in Tuxedos---clientele in Baseball hats and camouflage!!  
Dress  code needed!
Really gone downhill, IMHO.

Customer 2466.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2466.Content: The atmosphere is very old-style in a good way. Our waiter Roger is very helpful with food and wine selection. His knowledge is down to each piece of steaks. We are glad our 1st dinner of 2017 was here.

Customer 2467.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2467.Content: The best food I have had I a long time, such a great dining experience.

Customer 2468.Name: KateyK
Customer 2468.Content: The best steak I ever had -- and classic steakhouse decor, with plush velvet booths and a delightfully clubby atmosphere.  We were using a gift certificate, so the experience was especially lovely, but the Metropolitan Grill is absolutely worth a visit, even if you have to spend your own money!  We came early, so the place was relatively uncrowded, but I suspect the attentive service we received is typical.

Customer 2469.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2469.Content: Awesome awesome awesome. One of the best steak restaurants out there!

Customer 2470.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2470.Content: An EXCELLENT fine dining restaurant.  The food is worth every penny of the price and the service is on a parallel with the food.

Customer 2471.Name: RosalieS
Customer 2471.Content: This place was exquisite. From the service we received from our server and his staff to the gentleman who did the tableside bananas foster.. It was absolutely Amazing.

Customer 2472.Name: TrishaS
Customer 2472.Content: Never a disappointment!  Really appreciate the attentive service,  amazingly well prepared food and crafty cocktails.  Thanks again!

Customer 2473.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2473.Content: Had an enjoyable dinner.  Steak was one of the best I have ever had.  Little expensive, but overall an excellent experience.

Customer 2474.Name: vietnnguyen
Customer 2474.Content: This place has some of the best steaks in the country. No disappointments here.

Customer 2475.Name: Nancy
Customer 2475.Content: This is our favorite place to go for special occasions.  The food and service cannot be beat.  Consistently great.  They even indulge our special request for twice baked potatoes, which are no longer on the menu.

Customer 2476.Name: NuttyProf
Customer 2476.Content: Always get the steak! Desserts and sides/apps are good too. But, steaks are their specialty. You may as well take advantage b

Customer 2477.Name: NiezelC
Customer 2477.Content: Been in this place several times and it is absolutely awesome! They have excellent and beyond great quality food.. The food was cooked and prepared perfectly as expected.  The staffs are very nice, friendly, and attentive.  The ambiance is awesome and classy... Awesome steakhouse in Seattle!

Customer 2478.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2478.Content: Great waitress, excellent food and wonderful atmosphere.   What more could you ask for?

Customer 2479.Name: LisaP
Customer 2479.Content: Lunch was absolutely fantastic.  The steak sandwich has to be about the best value in Seattle!  Lisa P

Customer 2480.Name: LeeG
Customer 2480.Content: Not only a great dinner spot, but lunch is great here too.  Need to keep this one in mind more often for lunch.

Customer 2481.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2481.Content: Still the best steak in Seattle.

Customer 2482.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2482.Content: Seems tired to me. needs a revamp of space, menu, finish.  old and dated.  the bread service is terrible (used to be good); the vegtable sides were served cold.  Extremely expensive in my opinion.  Other better restaurants to choose from in my opinion.

Customer 2483.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2483.Content: we have been regular users of  the Met for some ten years but last Thursday's experience was particularly pleasing. The occasion was a family get together and the evening was greatly enhanced by the service , attention and helpful inputs from our server Roger. His personality and friendliness contributed greatly to our overall enjoyment of the evening.

Customer 2484.Name: gourmetnightfordinnerfor2
Customer 2484.Content:
An excellent steakhouse, not cheap but very premium food.
The wines are all very expensive so I would recommend a cocktail and a glass for dinner and save the bottle for later.

Customer 2485.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2485.Content: The food is always outstanding.  The service is top grade! It is obvious they know their business and answer all questions like it was the first time it was ever asked.  The steaks were excellent and they even made the vegetarian plate look appetizing to a meat-a-tarian.  We are looking forward to going back, soon.

Customer 2486.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2486.Content: Not worth the money. Not even close. Service was good. Management great.

Customer 2487.Name: CowDawg
Customer 2487.Content: Service and food were outstanding. We have some food allergy issues, they were very accommodating. The recommended wines were spectacular and paired very well with the steak. Can't wait to get back there!

Customer 2488.Name: JPak
Customer 2488.Content: I enjoyed the food and the service. I have been to many steak houses not only in Seattle but around America and the world. This place is good.

Customer 2489.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2489.Content: We sat for 20 minutes and no service, because the servers were confuse who was responsible for our table 😴

Customer 2490.Name: PowerLytix
Customer 2490.Content: Great service, personable waiters and delicious food. Arguably, the best restaurant in Seattle.

Customer 2491.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2491.Content: We went out with some friends to celebrate Christmas. We had a great evening. The wine we selected was not available but the Sommelier suggested another bottle similar in price and we liked it so much we got two bottles while we were there. The food was great and our server was fun and  he even gave us a beef 101 lesson.  The noise level was a bit high at times but for the most part it was ok. Would definitely reserve it for a special occasion but it is worth the price.

Customer 2492.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2492.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful meal and enjoyed our time there.  Our server was great and he brought desert on the house for no apparent reason (we did tell him it was our anniversary) other than our occasion which was unexpected and left us with a lasting impression.  Everything was fantastic but that silly $10 desert that was complimentary is the thing that stands out, it's the unexpected that people remember and it's what I will remember next time I'm making a reservation for a special occasion.  Thank you!

Customer 2493.Name: Rick
Customer 2493.Content:
We had a lovely anniversary dinner at the Met -- from the gracious and witty bartender and bar patrons who wished us a most happy night, to the waiter and bus dude who were attentive and helpful. And the food was amazing: great steaks, perfectly cooked, along with a wonderful winter kale salad that was to die for. There was only one small miscue all night, too-crispy roasted root vegetables, which I guess is the way that they cook them here. 

All in all, a beautiful dining experience, and a new favorite to come back to when we're back in Seattle.

Customer 2494.Name: Brystock
Customer 2494.Content: My husband and I were celebrating 37 years together and 4 years married. The Met helped make our evening memorable. The service and food were excellent. We look forward to our next special occasion at this wonderful restaurant.

Customer 2495.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2495.Content: Celebrated our anniversary here.  Delicious food, friendly and helpful staff, nice atmosphere.

Customer 2496.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2496.Content: Staff friendly and helpful, but not intrusive. Food fantastic and perfect temperature. Ambiance and noise level just right for lively but private dining experience. Wonderful experience!

Customer 2497.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2497.Content: Tenderloin was a bit tough. Service was great. Overall nice, but the $72 steak disappointed.

Customer 2498.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2498.Content: The service was timely, waitstaff very knowledgeable and kind, and the food was delicious.  We even showed up an hour early due to coming from Olympia, and they got us in within 5 minutes!  Our waiter gave my husband the pick of his after meal snack complementary for his birthday!

Customer 2499.Name: karent
Customer 2499.Content: Our Waiter Cesar provided Very good service  and the steaks were cooked the way we requested

Customer 2500.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2500.Content: Our family party of 8 spent Christmas Eve at The Metropolitan Grill while on vacation. Our server, Michael, took excellent care of us and we enjoyed a wonderfully relaxed evening full of good food and drinks. The cost is definitely something we'd reserve for a special occasion, which it was, and for that we cannot recommend it enough!

Customer 2502.Name: SeattleLady
Customer 2502.Content: It was my first time to dine here.  My friend, on the other hand, has been dining here for almost 20 years and raves about the food.  Our server was polite and warm.  For appetizers, we ordered crab cakes and lobster bisque.  Both were perfect-- great flavor, texture and temperature.  However, 5 minutes into enjoying our appetizers, another server comes to our table and served us our our main course. We both ordered medium rare NY Strip Loin.  We were both stunned because we were not yet even halfway through our appetizers.  I thought to myself, 'am I being rushed?'  Our server was still attending to his other tables so we decided to wait until he checks on us again.  Once he came to our table, the steak was already cold since it has sat there on the side for more than 10 minutes while we finished our appetizers.  We told him what happened and he brought the steaks back to the kitchen.  Sadly, both steaks were just re-plated and I assume was probably reheated or blasted in the salamander.  My friend who has dined with you for years said that she was shocked that the chef did not fire new steaks on the grill.  It was truly disappointing since it felt like I was eating leftover steak that was cooked the night before.  I think our server tried to make things right but honestly, the entire experience for me was just ruined. It was my first time to dine with you, and of all days, on Christmas Eve.  My friend and I left with such an underwhelming feeling.  We paid $150 for both steaks that was comparable to a $20 steak from Applebee's.  Maybe I'll come back for dinner next time but it'll take a while to be convinced that it's worth trying The Met Grill for a second time.

Customer 2503.Name: Mollydolly
Customer 2503.Content: The service was top notch, very friendly yet professional. Our beverages were replenished often, and our water glasses were never empty. My only complaint was that my meal was served luke warm and lacked in flavor. Three of us ordered this same entree and all of us felt the same. The other four people in our party loved their selection

Customer 2504.Name: She33
Customer 2504.Content: Always a smart choice.  You get to feel special even when you're dressed in your finest Seahawks gear.  Great food and service!

Customer 2505.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2505.Content: Always excellent!   The Waygu beef eggs Benedict is outstanding!

Customer 2506.Name: onel8grl
Customer 2506.Content: Awesome Sunday brunch. Comfortable, nice ambiance and the waiter was very attentive

Customer 2507.Name: Tedd
Customer 2507.Content: Service outstanding , very attentive to our schedule as well as our needs during meal.  Wish the background noise was a bit less but still overall experience was excellent.  This is the one place we come for special occasions.

Customer 2509.Name: JorgeG
Customer 2509.Content: Excellent steak, excellent service, nice place

Customer 2510.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2510.Content: The best steakhouse in Seattle and one of the best in the country.  Excellent food and service.  I highly recommend the Met!

Customer 2511.Name: RayHayes
Customer 2511.Content: Known for their steaks, we always get the seafood dishes. Tonight it was the Salman with French Fries replacing the mashed potatoes and Crab Fettuccini. Both were wonderful. You can easily spend hundreds of dollars but if you're careful you can eat at a decent price and get incredible food at a great value.

Customer 2512.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2512.Content: Going to the Metropolitan Grill has become an annual tradition for our family, around the holidays. It's nice to treat ourselves to such an exquisite experience, to celebrate an end to a successful year!

Customer 2514.Name: PaulT
Customer 2514.Content: I had a fantastic lunch with a long time friend and was well taken care of!   I will be back Met Grill!

Customer 2517.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2517.Content: We had a wonderful evening.  Every single person that we encountered was professional, helpful, personable, and made our dining experience we have come to expect the MET to be.

Customer 2518.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2518.Content:
I don't get here often. I go in knowing it is over priced.  The food should melt in your mouth.  This just disappointed.  The prime rib was dry, and so were the steaks.  For an occasional night out it is what it is, but there are soooo many better restaurants in Seattle to dine at. 
I go for the history and the ambiance, and that doesn't disappoint.

Customer 2519.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2519.Content: The hostess was very nice and we were seated right away. We were able to order our beverages and food in a reasonable amount of time. Beverages arrived quickly, but the food took quite a long time. The food was delicious once it arrived. We were unfortunate in that we were seated right in front of the hall that leads to the side kitchen door and the kitchen noise was very loud. We will definitely ask to be seated in a different area next time.

Customer 2520.Name: Metlover
Customer 2520.Content: Todd is the best server!  Such a great experience

Customer 2521.Name: Shar
Customer 2521.Content: Very good experience. Service was great!

Customer 2522.Name: ShorelineSue
Customer 2522.Content: So disappointing this time. This was our third visit and will be our last. The food was very average. I've eaten there before and had an average meal but had  not had steak so I thought I'd try a steak this time to see if it was a better choice but no, it wasn't. The meat was gristly, tough and served barely warm. The fries were pretty good and the Maker's Mark ice cream was great but all-in-all a big disappointment.

Customer 2523.Name: mikieJim
Customer 2523.Content: I realize it's Christmas time and the pace was very busy but my ribeye was way under cooked and distasteful.  Not to mention way overpriced.

Customer 2524.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2524.Content: I'm so happy we are here. Some of the lunch items are reasonably priced or you can splurge. Also the creme brûlée was superb

Customer 2525.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2525.Content: the steaks were delicious! parking is difficult & expensive. it would be nice if you could offer some parking or validation.

Customer 2526.Name: Alan
Customer 2526.Content:
We were celebrating our anniversary and, because we mentioned it in our online comments when we made our reservation, we were greeted with completely unsolicited anniversary wishes by both the hostess and the waiter -- a very welcoming start to the evening.
The service was polished and professional; the food was top notch, befitting the classic stature of the restaurant.  The lobster bisque was velvety smooth and the filet mignon and strip sirloin were done to perfection.  There was also absolutely no problem when we informed the waiter that we were intending to use 11 and 16 year old gift certificates (and recently reclaimed from a stack of long forgotten papers).  We'll be back; the Metropolitan Grill is a "class act."

Customer 2527.Name: lynnwoodfoodie
Customer 2527.Content: Perfect service and incredible food, can't wait to go back.  The staff remind me of Canlis and Salish Lodge, first class performance.

Customer 2528.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2528.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was once one of my favorite splurges to take family and out of town friends.  This latest dinner was to be a special treat for my daughter and me.  We both agreed we won't return.  The service was lax; the food arrived after a long delay; some of the food on my plate was barely warm; our desserts--cheese cake and chocolate cake--were just acceptable (barely).  The steaks were excellent but overall, not worth the price.  We'll go to Canlis for our next splurge instead.

Customer 2529.Name: KevinS
Customer 2529.Content: I have dined for years at this restaurant and have always enjoyed everything about it.  This time was a little disappointing.  EVERYTHING was warm....not hot.  I ordered French Onion soup which should have been left in the oven longer.  The cheese is supposed to be crusty but mine was soft and just melted and soup itself was just warm.  Our steaks were properly cooked but also just warm when brought to the table and the au jus the waiter brought to pour over the steak was luke warm which made the steak even cooler.  We ordered a side of mushrooms and like everything else....just warm.   I was so wanting something hot that I ordered an after dinner Spanish coffee and even asked that it be hot when it arrives.  The waiter did bring me a nice and hot Spanish coffee.....in a glass ....that was too hot to pick up.  I then flagged down a "Suit" and asked it my coffee could be served in a cup or glass with a handle so that I could enjoy it while it was hot.  We get to Seattle a couple times a year and always make it a point to dine at the Met.  I think next time we will expand our horizons as there are many good high end steak houses in Seattle.

Customer 2530.Name: Coop
Customer 2530.Content: Best Steakhouse in Seattle and maybe the country.

Customer 2531.Name: HankR
Customer 2531.Content: We ordered 2 appetizers - the scallops were outstanding, but the calamari was overcooked and rather dry (the dipping sauce was very good.) We ordered 3 steak items, all medium rare. Unfortunately, the ohmi (most expensive) steak was medium. It was still very, very good, but could've been better if it were cooked a minute or 2 less. Also, the french fries were way overcooked and only slightly warm and rubbery. Our waiter never returned to our table to ask how our meal was so we ate it ... like I said it was still good (we didn't eat the fries and only half the calamari.) When the bus boy came to clear he asked if we wanted to keep the fries so we told him of our dissappointment, but he just said that was a shame and then took our coffee & latte order.  The coffees never came. The bill quickly arrived on the corner of the table so we checked to make sure we weren't charged for the coffee which we were not. So we paid and left. It was still good, but not good enough to recommend considering the price.

Customer 2532.Name: RDBCooks
Customer 2532.Content: Something has happened to the Metropolitan Grill. Having eaten there many times in the past, I have never had a problem with them accommodating my wife's garlic allergy. Not so this time. Essentially nothing on the menu was made without garlic. They had Fettuccine Alfredo with Crab on the menu.  When I asked about it, the waiter, who was exceptional, came back and said the kitchen staff told him that there was garlic in the Fettuccine Alfredo. Fettuccine Alfredo should never be made with garlic, and especially when it is being served with fresh crab, as the garlic will overwhelm everything. When I asked if they could make it without garlic, the waiter was told no by the kitchen staff. I was somewhat shocked, as Alfredo sauce only has three ingredients and any marginally competent diner cook could make Alfredo sauce in about five minutes. After my suggesting, somewhat sarcastically,  to the waiter that he tell the chef that I could come back and make it for him, the chef then said he could do so. Why he did not just agree to make it in the first place I will never understand. Again, the waiter was outstanding in advocating for us, so I want to make it clear this is not a comment about the service, but is rather about the kitchen staff.  The service was outstanding. But this is one restaurant that has now been crossed off my list of places to dine, because if they put garlic in everything, they either lack creativity in the kitchen or they are trying to cover up for some second quality ingredients.  There are too many other outstanding restaurants to enjoy in Seattle without having to put up with this lack of flexibility by the kitchen staff.  So goodbye Metropolitan Grill. Next time I will go to El Gaucho or the Brooklyn.

Customer 2533.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2533.Content: Amazing steak, but bring your wallet. Plan to spend around $200 a person when it's said and done.

Customer 2534.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2534.Content: I was very impressed with the attention to detail.  I happened to drop my hat and scarf as I was leaving and the waiters were so attentive.  They returned them to me so quickly.  Now that's above and beyond on their service!!!

Customer 2535.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2535.Content: The best service at any restaurant. Meal was good. I recommend the Heart of Darkness cocktail.

Customer 2536.Name: lovetodine
Customer 2536.Content:
This was our Favorite, but due to poor service by the hostess, we are torn.  
We had a reservation at 8 and arrived at 7:45 pm.  We were seated at 8:25 pm!  
Meanwhile, other people who came after us and had reservations at 8 and8:15 were seated.  When I inquired about this situation, the hostess said they had small children, so they could fit a high chair in. However, when we walked by the tables for 8, there were 5 adults, not what she said.  Also, she lied to us twice... she kept on telling us that they are getting the table ready... but after 20 minutes of this, we asked her to check.  However, she told us that she couldn't leave the her place, but she did numerous time.  I should of known that we were going to have difficulties when we arrived and she ignored by having us stand in front of her for few minutes.

Customer 2537.Name: AlexaJoyner
Customer 2537.Content: Amazing food! Highly recommend the Blackened Cajun Prime Rib. Yum!

Customer 2538.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2538.Content: My third time here. First two times the Steak was unbelievable, this time more tough and a little bit gristle. I should have sent it back but I sent it back the first time for being too rare and I didn't want to eat alone while my guest watched.

Customer 2539.Name: GERALDH
Customer 2539.Content: Prime rib was tough..  Buffalo was mediocre..   Very disappointed.. Noisy

Customer 2540.Name: Rover12
Customer 2540.Content: Our food and sides weren't  cold, but they weren't hot either.

Customer 2541.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2541.Content: Don't make reservations on an evening with a Seahawks home game. Staff was overwhelmed, rude, and unable to accommodate in a timely manner those who had reservations (which are required on game days). I will never return. We were told to wait in the bar until our seat was ready for our reservation and that the bar was on a first come, first serve method. When we found a table in the bar which was with some of our friends, the maitre d came over after we were all seated and ready to order and in a tone that is completely unacceptable told us that bar table was going to be reserved and that he was going to call the police if we did not leave even though our friends were enjoying there meal. Quite shocking while embarrassing. However, he did hint that we could potentially have the table with a "donation"which equated to blackmail of someone who already has a reservation. Will never ever return.

Customer 2542.Name: MIch
Customer 2542.Content: As always the Metropolitan Grill does not disappoint.  The service is impeccable

Customer 2543.Name: Jets
Customer 2543.Content: Eating here was great, me and my wife were from from out of town celebrating an occasion and this was the perfect place. The staff as a whole was great making you feel very comfortable and treating you with respect, and the food was awesome. If you are in the area you need to give it a try

Customer 2544.Name: KeithP
Customer 2544.Content: I enjoy coming there to celebrate special occasions.  The food is great!!! The prices are reasonable for the product that you server. Thanks

Customer 2546.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2546.Content: Awesome.  Looking forward to going back my next time in Seattle.

Customer 2547.Name: KennyL
Customer 2547.Content: The best steaks in North America.  Always eat at the Met when in Seattle.  The steaks, the lobster mac-n-cheese, and bacon app are FANTASTIC!!  The service is always top notch.  Craig (Maitre'D) Bruno (server) provide excellent service and make the dinner special.

Customer 2548.Name: EdmondsResident
Customer 2548.Content: Overall a consistently good restaurant.  A little chilly sitting near the front entrance on a cold day.  Service generally good but today a little off.

Customer 2549.Name: Brian
Customer 2549.Content: Original reservation was for 5PM, got trapped in an Elevator with 10 people for 2 plus hours, they saved our spot when we showed up after the fire department finally freed us from the Elevator, I love the Met, amazing service, food and drink!  Been coming here since 1999.

Customer 2550.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2550.Content: Waiter came back and had to ask what our order was on 4 separate occasions. I was seated 20 minutes after my reservation time. It took over an hour to get a salad, grilled cheese and soup

Customer 2551.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2551.Content: Marilyn our waitress was fabulous! She was friendly and fun and took great care of our table of eight.

Customer 2552.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2552.Content: I had a BLT and cup of chowder. The chowder was excellent. The bacon on the BLT was very tasty, but very tough, so I wasn't able to finish eating it without removing the bacon. The waitress was not great. Had to flag her down a couple of times: beverages were empty, forgot request for tarter sauce twice, messed up our bill.

Customer 2553.Name: OL73
Customer 2553.Content:
Way overpriced for the quality of food. 
We were a group of 6 and none of us was impressed with the food regardless the price.

Customer 2554.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2554.Content: This was my first time dining at The Met and I have heard so many amazing reviews about it. After The Nutcracker, my boyfriend and I dined here and the food was exceptional! The crab cakes, Brie, asparagus, steak, and mashed potatoes were divine! Never have I ever had food this amazing! The Pear Lemon Drop is my new favorite cocktail. Our waiter was excellent, attentive, sweet, and fun to talk to. A fantastic dinner all around!

Customer 2555.Name: RobertB
Customer 2555.Content: This place was a "10" from the time we arrived until we left.  The wedge salad was the best ever, the steak was out of this world tasty and the service excellent, without being stuffy.  Jake, our waiter, gave us lots of information  about the different selections so we were able to order what we really wanted. The desert was wonderful, if not too much after that large meal.  Great place to eat on special occasions, and some would argue, anytime.  A bit pricy, but worth it.

Customer 2556.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2556.Content: The Met rarely fails to satisfy. It has a great "vibe" for an uptown steak house. A "GoTo spot for a power lunch or special dinner....... worth the cost, trip into town, every time!

Customer 2557.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2557.Content: We loved it. It was my girlfriend's 70th birthday dinner on a Sunday. We enjoyed the exquisitely crafted and cooked meal we had, the outstanding service and especially the maitre d's attention to my girlfriend making sure everything about the evening was good. The wine by the glass selections we made were excellent all the way around. My appreciation to the chefs for their incredibly well prepared and tasty dishes. Everything I remember from years past about this place was there and more this time around. Loved it.

Customer 2558.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2558.Content: My husband and I have been going to The Met for years for our birthdays and anniversary. We can always be sure to have the best service and food in a relaxed atmosphere. Whether we're dressed in shorts and sandals or black tie we feel comfortable in the environment and are always treated great! I highly recommend The Met!

Customer 2559.Name: MichaelD
Customer 2559.Content: Took my mother here for her birthday. It reminds her of the nice steak houses my father used to take her to when they were dating in San Francisco. It is a classic, and I hope it never changes. It was a bit noisey, but the MLS championship was playing in the bar, so understandable. Service was good. Our server was a delightful gentleman. Food was good as always.

Customer 2560.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2560.Content: I researched Seattle steakhouses for our annual holiday trip to Seattle and chose this restaurant on reviews.  Big mistake and after speaking with several locals, unfortunately AFTER our visit, would not book this reservation again.  The service staff was slow, we could not get cocktails delivered to our table and had to go to the bar to get them ourselves. Being from Southern California we wanted to try Washington wines and could not get a recommendation other than "there are several on the list".  The medium-rare filets arrived cold, the vegetables were cold. Dessert was great.  I would not recommend this restaurant, too pricey for the quality of food and service.

Customer 2561.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2561.Content: Our waiter was great, you could tell he put effort into his every day job.

Customer 2563.Name: Localattorney
Customer 2563.Content: Disappointed with service. Food served was cold.  So were the servers.  I will be calling the manager on Monday.

Customer 2564.Name: Jonathan
Customer 2564.Content: My wife and I wanted a special getaway overnight in Seattle and having dinner at the Met really set the tone for a special evening.  We had the Wagyu steak dinner for two and it was the best steak we've ever had.  Probably the best value on the menu too so I highly recommend it.  Ambiance was classy and pleasant, the service was great and it was a very relaxing meal.  Went to the symphony afterwards and thoroughly enjoyed our date night.  Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for a great steak.

Customer 2565.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2565.Content: It was amazing. I felt like a VIP from the moment I walked in the door. From the host to the runners to our server every employee is on point!

Customer 2566.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2566.Content: We had a lunch  reservation food was great as was the service, but they had a door open in the back for several minutes (assuming they were taking a delivery) and not only was it very cold, but we all smelled like we had been roasting marsh mellows around the camp fire.  Seems like taking a delivery for an extended period of time might be better between meals or early in the am.  While the food was great, would not recommend if there delivery window was in the middle of lunch.

Customer 2567.Name: TexEx
Customer 2567.Content: first, big fan of the Met.  On this day however, the bisque was lukewarm and the scallops were as well.  Might want to check on the temp before serving.

Customer 2568.Name: Scott
Customer 2568.Content: This was our first visit to the Metropolitan Grill.  Over the year I have had many friends recommend it, so I surprised my wife with a few days in Seattle for her birthday.  The staff was outstanding and the food was incredible.  We had a fabulous dinner, and would definitely recommend the Metropolitan Grill as the place to go for special occasions.

Customer 2569.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2569.Content: Excellent food and service. Definitely should rebrand it to reflect their top notch steaks

Customer 2570.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2570.Content:
I ordered the Hokkaido Snow Beef wagyu Filet, it was alright, wished they have had sirloin or ribeye part instead. Though they did not specify which farm or the kind of the wagyu it was, I think it would be nice if they did. 

The Caeser salad was way too sour to eat, and the creme brûlée was too sweet and thick, I need a sip of water for each spoon of it.

The scallop was really good by the way.

Lastly, the service was very slow. My waiter took forever on everything, too busy serving others I think.

I think this restaurent is overrated.

Customer 2571.Name: ANTHONYVANESSA1
Customer 2571.Content:
Exceptional experience! We arrived 20 minutes early and we were greeted immediately with a warm enviting host. She sat us immediately even though we expected to wait a bit for our 5:30 reservation. From the moment we entered to the moment we left, we felt special and well taken care of. Our server was amazing! Knowledgeable about the wines and the food and so skilled that we, not once, felt intruded upon. Our food was perfect and delectable! Every bite cooked perfectly! 
We have been to this establishment several times and have not once had a less than satisfying experience. Once again, the Met made our special evening (1 year anniversary) memorable and blew us away yet again!

Customer 2572.Name: MarthaS
Customer 2572.Content: Our waiter, Michael, was fabulous. Warm and friendly without being intrusive. The food was fantastic. We felt entirely comfortable.

Customer 2573.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2573.Content:
A wonderful culinary experience, even beyond what I have come to expect from The Met!
Thanks for letting me show off Seattle's best to my executive son and daughter in law.

Customer 2574.Name: BarbaraJ
Customer 2574.Content: The meal, & the service was amazing!  Hospitality was by far the best I've experienced.

Customer 2575.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2575.Content: The restaurant as very good as usual.  Great service.  A bit noisy overall but that is usually the case.  Great waiter.

Customer 2576.Name: Nicole
Customer 2576.Content: Ahhhh-Mazing!!! Hands down best steak house ever! We went before the Nutcracker ballet and it was the perfect start to a magical evening. Every bite of food was amazing and they offer half bottles of wine in case you don't want/ can't drink a whole one.

Customer 2577.Name: FinLandia
Customer 2577.Content: Better than advertised! Highly recommend if you are in the area.

Customer 2578.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2578.Content:
I had been to the Metrpolitan Grill before. But my partners had not. We are from Chilliwack BC. I wanted them to experience a steak from this place. I built it up. I set the bar high. Expectations were elevated. 
The Metropolitan Grill did not dissapoint. Everything was fantastic. Thank you. You didn't let me down.

Customer 2579.Name: Jimmy50
Customer 2579.Content: Great place to enjoy a great dinner. Staff is amazing service is great

Customer 2580.Name: Merry
Customer 2580.Content: The food was as awesome as you would expect. Portions were sharing size, so, huge!

Customer 2581.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2581.Content: Business dinner for seven.  Asked for quiet room and got Chairman's Room which we shared with another table of twelve or so.  Perfect ambiance.  Quiet enough for conversation but lively enough not to feel like a library.  Service was excellent.  Menu and food quality are fantastic.

Customer 2582.Name: SylviaF
Customer 2582.Content: Food was excellent. Had the cedar plank salmon

Customer 2583.Name: coquine
Customer 2583.Content: My favorite restaurant in all of Seattle!  The best food, the best service, and perfect for a special occasion!

Customer 2584.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2584.Content: Excellent service and steaks!  The only minor disappointment was the brussell sprouts as the were pretty plain.  Otherwise great place with a nice atmosphere!

Customer 2585.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2585.Content: Great food and great service! The only downside is that our bread plate kept disappearing.

Customer 2586.Name: Davidsonchick
Customer 2586.Content: Outstanding service from Victor.  He was charming and really enriched our experience!

Customer 2587.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2587.Content: From Chicago visiting our daughter.  Fantastic steaks and prime rib. Great service. Wine, cocktails, and scotch. The desserts were incredible. Memorable occasion with our daughter. She bought! (We raised her well:) We'll be back.

Customer 2588.Name: DanM
Customer 2588.Content: Treated like royalty as soon as we showed up, and the 3 hrs flew by, with no one rushing to clear the table.  The waiter was well-informed, extremely happy, and was attentive without being intrusive.  I've had better steaks, but not many and -- coming from Texas -- you can't hold that against the Metropolitan!  I will definitely go back there and recommend it to my friends (who aren't on a tight budget).

Customer 2589.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2589.Content: Probably the best steak I've ever had and the bill was less than I expected.

Customer 2590.Name: RichardT
Customer 2590.Content: The meal was very good but my wife and I thought I was a bit pricey.

Customer 2591.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2591.Content: Fabulous food and impeccable service, the perfect place to celebrate anniversary with family over the holiday weekend.   All of our food was cooked to perfection.  My French brother in-law who has worked in many renowned restaurants both in Europe and California enjoyed the meal there immensely.  Hats off to the staff in the kitchen and out front.  You all represent yourselves well.  Merci

Customer 2592.Name: RyanO
Customer 2592.Content: All four drinks ordered were received incorrect. Bread was not brought to the table until after dinner was over because of a "shortage".

Customer 2593.Name: donjuanjuliocabo
Customer 2593.Content: The absolute best steakhouse in Seattle. My go too everyone I come to town. Staff is fantastic and always accommodating. Wine list is amazing.

Customer 2594.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2594.Content: Sommelier was not knowledgeable.  Ordered one wine but a different year was brought to the tabe without informing us.  When noticed the sommelier was rude and tried to force the unordered wine on us.

Customer 2595.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2595.Content:
It was amazing food. We had our dinner carved table side and then also had bananas foster fired up right in front of us. Every last bite was scrumptious and the servings were generous enough for us to have plenty to take home for leftovers. 

The one complaint I might have is that the bathrooms are in desperate need of an update. Kind of a weird pet peeve of mine,  I feel like a restaurant of this quality should have classy commodes. I've literally been in teriyaki places with fancier bathrooms.

Customer 2596.Name: MattS
Customer 2596.Content: Its the met.  A Seattle institution.  Always good food and white coat service.  Quiet comfy seating and a touch of elegance.

Customer 2597.Name: Johnny18
Customer 2597.Content: Wonderful time!  Wonderful food! Our highlight was the American wagyu fillet. Would highly recommend

Customer 2598.Name: Dylan
Customer 2598.Content: It was excellent and definitely worth every penny.  The staff was amazing we had a reservation but we where running late due to traffic they where very accommodating the waiter was excellent.

Customer 2599.Name: MikeS
Customer 2599.Content: We had a wonderful evening at the Met this week. Service was terrific and the food was fantastic. Steaks, seafood, kids food, and dessert were all memorable. We know we are always going to enjoy our experience at the Met and will be back soon. Thank you again!

Customer 2600.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2600.Content: my steak in the steak salad was cold....as in room temperature, food service was very slow but the servers were very accommodating

Customer 2601.Name: Idahogem1
Customer 2601.Content: A little loud in the main dining area but the Monday Lunch London Broil special was amazing!

Customer 2602.Name: vanessal
Customer 2602.Content: Amazing amazing amazing food. Loved our waiter McKenzie! His service was top notch! Sweet, funny, professional and represented your establishment well.

Customer 2603.Name: Dub62
Customer 2603.Content:
Classic Steakhouse!!!! 
I try to get to the Metro Grill every time I get to Seattle.

Customer 2604.Name: DottieW
Customer 2604.Content: The staff is very helpful and caters to all your needs! Food was sensational and it did not take a long time to receive it.

Customer 2605.Name: Noongsters
Customer 2605.Content: as we've come to expect from the Met, everything was perfect.  our entire family request your establishment as their birthday dinner place.  Love the service, food.

Customer 2606.Name: FoodDude
Customer 2606.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is my absolute favorite steak restaurant.  If you are willing to spend the money the value is actually great compared to other high end steak restaurants.  The atmosphere is great and the staff is always top notch.  Our server Michael was awesome as was everyone we interacted with.
