Customer 2607.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2607.Content: Waiter Seeley was outstanding. Wonderful exciting crowd in restaurant

Customer 2608.Name: DEVONH
Customer 2608.Content: Been going to the Met for pre game Seahawks brunch for years. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Customer 2609.Name: BobH
Customer 2609.Content: The Met one of my all time Seattle favorites. Excellent as always!

Customer 2610.Name: Max1
Customer 2610.Content: Simply outstanding, as usual! The best steak house in the Pacific Northwest. Great value and the staff, and I mean everyone of them, are terrific. And, the quality of the food is unmatched.

Customer 2611.Name: ElaineD
Customer 2611.Content: Great steak & entrees!!! (Bananas foster is delicious)!!! Excellent, fun , & personable service!!! Thanks for making my daughters's 15th birthday dinner so memorable!!!

Customer 2612.Name: LkrGrl
Customer 2612.Content: Have the Waygu Skirt Steak. Absolutely delicious. You could split this particular meal with two people, order a side of Brussell Sprouts and you won't go home hungry at all. So good and I can't wait to go back.

Customer 2614.Name: Colin
Customer 2614.Content: The food was great, I knocked the rating down for the annoying table of people beside us. Also for the Hostess that seated us, whom gave us a dirty look like we would not be able to pay our bill, so why are you here look. The wait to order drinks and food was twice as long as it should of been for this level of establishment. So it doesn't matter how good the food was, the dinning experience did not meet expectations. Kinda made a birthday dinner less special.

Customer 2615.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2615.Content: Misunderstood the very clearly stated requirements (no pepper of any kind) and unfortunately for everyone involved one of our party was unable to speak within 40 minutes.

Customer 2616.Name: VickiA
Customer 2616.Content: I've been to the Metropolitan Grill for many occasions.  Business lunches, dinners, birthdays and no occasion at all.  I would highly recommend the restaurant to anyone looking for a fabulous place to eat.  The service is also excellent.

Customer 2617.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2617.Content: My husband got the blackened prime rib and I got the steak salad.  Both of our meals were extremely salty.   If I go back I would request no salt and add my own.  Service was awesome!

Customer 2618.Name: Philip
Customer 2618.Content: I planned on taking my new girlfriend out for a romantic birthday dinner while we visited Seattle. The Metropolitan Grill far exceeded our expectations! The food and service was impeccable!!

Customer 2619.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2619.Content: The Met is a classic Seattle establishment.  We had dinner there to celebrate a birthday.  The wait staff is excellent and knowledgeable about the menu.  They have a great wine list and the sommelier is always willing to help.  The food quality is consistent and what you'd expect from a steakhouse.  Overall the experience met expectations and consistent with previous visits.

Customer 2620.Name: DandSEdwards
Customer 2620.Content: Super amazing last time I was here (2005) it was just as amazing.  Dinner was fabulous the malbec was incredible.  We were in a back room that seated two tables and we took up one and the other was being used by another party and it was a lovely intimate setting.

Customer 2621.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2621.Content: The food was fantastic as always.   We really enjoyed the energy of the restaurant and staff.  I always recommend for special occassions.  Thank you!

Customer 2622.Name: EdmondsLocal
Customer 2622.Content: Loved the pear bread pudding - main reason I'll be back.  The rib eye steak was 30% fat - so I won't order that again.

Customer 2623.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2623.Content: Steak was cooked rare instead of medium well but instead of cooking a new steak they cooked both halves of the underdone steak and brought them back which never turns out as good as when cooked from raw (and whole), we did get comped a dessert but I would expect to be taken care of a little better from a restaurant of this caliber.  Our first visit was fantastic and thats why we were back but I can't honestly say we have plans to return after this previous visit.

Customer 2624.Name: HaleyW
Customer 2624.Content: Our server, Diane, was amazing! Gave us great recommendations. Craig was also amazing! Perfection from start to finish as usual!

Customer 2625.Name: Marc
Customer 2625.Content: We always feel comfortable and at home here.  Service is experienced and competent, and the food is always good.  If you're vegetarian who dines out regularly with a carnivore (as I do), they do have a veg option listed in the menu, but you can also ask for a "made-to-order" pasta dish that's sure to please.  This is a good "go to" place in our books!

Customer 2626.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2626.Content: Restaurant needs cleaning, bad smell. Crab cakes mushy, prime rib ordered med, came welldone, my guest ordered rib eye it was good, banana foster good. Custmer since 1996 when the food was yummy

Customer 2627.Name: Peter
Customer 2627.Content: The dining experience is first class.  the food is great.  every bite is delicious.

Customer 2628.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2628.Content: while our wait person was very pleasant , knowledgeable, and his humor fun, the table was not very clean. The lamp that was lighting the table had heavy film of dust and the base was dirty! My feeling is that if you are running such a high class restaurant all of the area should be clean.

Customer 2629.Name: tksmd
Customer 2629.Content: Had an excellent meal.  Crab cake appetizers were very tasty, and the center cut ribeye was cooked perfectly, and melted in your mouth.  Asparagus and creamed spinach sides were spot on.  However, the service was a bit spotty, but they did not rush you.  Overall, a good experience.

Customer 2630.Name: trojan4ever
Customer 2630.Content: Outstanding meal, wonderful time.  Truly enjoyed the dining experience.

Customer 2631.Name: JandR
Customer 2631.Content: Excellent, seasoned servers and high quality food as is par for the course at the Met.

Customer 2632.Name: KirklandDad
Customer 2632.Content: Overall our experience was positive with special recognition to service. This is a great place to go to if you're looking for a lot of options for steak. I think the plating and presentation could improve but otherwise a place I would go back to but if I'm in the area.

Customer 2634.Name: BSS1
Customer 2634.Content: Food is always great as is service. Clients always welcome meeting at Metropolitan Grill although can get a bit loud. Was also there for happy hour which is hard to beat. Great food deals and fun atmosphere.

Customer 2635.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2635.Content: We went here for dinner one night on out Honeymoon and it was fantastic!   I had a great Ceaser Salad!  She had clam chowder, both were amazing .  Steaks where perfect let cooked and tasted great.  A++++++

Customer 2636.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2636.Content: great food and great service...all fitting for a special occasion or a high end dining experience

Customer 2637.Name: HarryN
Customer 2637.Content: Once again a fabulous meal at our favourite restaurant in Seattle. What a combination, Seahawks win followed by the lamb at the Metropolitan. Go Hawks!

Customer 2638.Name: KenP
Customer 2638.Content: Service was great.  Server was able to answer all our questions and make it a very pleasant experience.

Customer 2639.Name: RyanMcQ
Customer 2639.Content: Always a great place to grab a steak in Seattle. Drinks and appetizers delicious as well and they turn tables around reasonable quickly.

Customer 2640.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2640.Content: Great service, and that's the only compliment I can give.  Every part of the meal (soup, steak, sides) was poor. I don't mind paying high prices for great quality - horrible value here.  This is the 3rd time I've been here with identical results.  I kept trying due to reputation but I'm done.

Customer 2641.Name: JoeB
Customer 2641.Content: The Met has been a top restaurant in Seattle for a long time.  And they continue to maintain their high standards.  It is rather pricy.  But the quality of the food and the quality of service are both excellent!  The décor is warm, rich and comfortable.  We went on a Sunday evening when traffic congestion and parking are not the issues they are the rest of the week.  And the place was full, even on a Sunday evening.

Customer 2642.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2642.Content: We were celebrating our 40th wedding anniversary and so this was a special occasion for sure.  Had a couple of drinks in the bar first and then to our table.   Bread and butter was great, ordered a bottle of wine, very nice.  She ordered filet mignon with mashed potatoes and I ordered a 10oz Delmonico with steamed veggies.  The filet was perfectly cooked and very tasty and the mashed potatoes were very good!  My meal however was not so good.  The steamed vegetables were hard and undercooked. The steak was just a bad cut of meat.  Tendon or something right through the middle.  It was prepared as I ordered it but was extremely tough and chewy.  I was very disappointed. I must say though, the restaurant treated us well and asked if they could cook another steak for me,. I declined though due to time. These things happen I know and we have been to the Met Grill many times in the past and never a bad meal.  I just wish it had not happened on such a special night.   :0(

Customer 2643.Name: Chuck
Customer 2643.Content:
It was time again for our annual 'special' dinner date, and this time we chose The Metropolitan Grill.  This was our first time eating here, and it was a phenomenal experience.

Everything we consumed (or took home) tasted wonderful.  The cocktails (tasty), appetizers (savory), the wine selection (listen to their Sommelier; it's well worth it), the entrees and sides (filling and delectable), and dessert (bananas foster tableside for two) with a flight of ports were all decadent.  Run on sentence?  Yes.  Irrelevant when you taste their cuisine.

It's built around great cuts of meat, so bring a healthy appetite.  And use their valet parking service.  It beats trying to find a parking space in the city.

Customer 2644.Name: JF2014
Customer 2644.Content: You get what you pay for and it was well worth every penny!!! I'll be back again soon.

Customer 2645.Name: SweetPete
Customer 2645.Content: Steaks are, of course, amazing.  Side dishes I would give a definite "meh".  The Brussels Sprouts were woefully undercooked and inedible which was a shame since we were looking forward to yummy roasted Sprouts.  The waiter took no notice of the fact that the entire serving remained uneaten.  Since it was my husband's birthday, I didn't want to embarrass him by mentioning it during the meal.  I did, however pull the waiter aside as we were paying the bill to let him know. I did not insist he take them off the bill, and NEITHER DID HE! Ugh...

Customer 2646.Name: SuperCubGal
Customer 2646.Content: We worked through lunch so we moved our 7:45 pm reservation to 4:30 pm via Open Table. We started  in the classic bar with a Patron Silver margarita and a Grey Goose Martini - both were crafted perfectly! Then we were escorted to our table by our very capable and super fun waiter (nice touch) who explained the menu and specials. Since steaks are the specialty we knew we needed a nice bottle of wine and requested the Sommelier to come by. He was friendly, very knowledgeable and honored our request for a hearty Washington red - his choice was perfect as were our steaks. We split my enormous baked potato and shared (and loved) the side of root vegetables which we normally don't care for. For dessert we indulge in the mountainous chocolate layer cake with vanilla ice cream - dense, super moist, and amazing! We'd watch two adjacent tables have bananas foster prepared table-side with great flames and flare - reports were that it was delicious and portions plentiful! There was even a wedding proposal (and acceptance) at the adjacent booth. Two glasses of 20-year old port and FOUR hours later we rolled out of the Metropolitan Grill beyond satisfied and happy! We'll be back!

Customer 2647.Name: marebear
Customer 2647.Content: We had one of the best meals we have had anywhere in the world. The service is fantastic, great menu. The prime rib was superb. Can't wait to go back.

Customer 2648.Name: Rich4food
Customer 2648.Content:
Food great, Service excellent, dress code NOT enforced which made you feel overdressed.
Almost like casual dining

Customer 2649.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2649.Content: The food was excellent and the service also excellent. Very enjoyable time.

Customer 2650.Name: aes11490
Customer 2650.Content: Great all around. Excellent service, excellent food. The Met is a classic.

Customer 2651.Name: SabrenaM
Customer 2651.Content: Excellent service.  Impressive wine list.  Incredible steaks!

Customer 2652.Name: RobertG
Customer 2652.Content: Excellent service, really a cut above. Food was very good.

Customer 2653.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2653.Content: Very nice... exactly as expected.  We've been going here for years for special occasions.

Customer 2654.Name: Julia
Customer 2654.Content: Please bring the sweet brown bread back (whatever that bread call but u served that bread for many many years). That is the reason why I go there.and plus the bake potato. The best!

Customer 2655.Name: DarelM
Customer 2655.Content: Amazing top notch food and service. A real treat  and worth every penny.

Customer 2656.Name: celebdiner
Customer 2656.Content: Our reservation was seated quickly in a nice booth that had sat Bill Clinton and Bill Gates previously.  We had a happy and informed waiter and all the items from appetizer to salad, steak and fish was wonderful and perfectly prepared.  We will be back to celebrate other birthdays in the future.

Customer 2657.Name: RCccc
Customer 2657.Content: Such a treat to go to The Met! Wonderful place! The food and service are fabulous!

Customer 2658.Name: Nonickname
Customer 2658.Content: Wonderful servers, terrific food and beautiful atmosphere.   Will go again.  A bit expensive

Customer 2659.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2659.Content: The service is quite good. But they don't have snow beef today so that's a minus. Overall, I will recommend this restaurant.

Customer 2660.Name: TomekaL
Customer 2660.Content: Wonderful time celebrating my anniversary. The server was great in explaining different cuts of meat and how each cut should be cooked. This led to an amazing dinner!

Customer 2661.Name: Karen
Customer 2661.Content: The noise level in the main room was quite loud however we were seated in a booth in the back dining room and the noise level was muted.  Food, service and ambiance were outstanding.  Tremendous restaurant and dining experience.  We have already made reservations to return.

Customer 2662.Name: KimberlyB
Customer 2662.Content: Roger (waiter) & Kevin (the Maitre d') always make sure our experience at The Met is memorable. The Sommelier even remembered the wine we ordered last time we were there...6 months ago. You are clearly committed to your craft when that type of thing is part of your memory bank!!  The Met sets the standard and creates definition to "The Dining Experience" .

Customer 2663.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2663.Content: Been there quite often and it has always been a perfect event

Customer 2664.Name: KASIAGIRON
Customer 2664.Content: Service is always incredible and food was delicious. One of my favorite restaurants.

Customer 2665.Name: Martissimo
Customer 2665.Content: Energetic with pricey, good food and great service from Pi!

Customer 2666.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2666.Content: The food was delicious and the service was stupendous.  A great way to spend a special occasion.

Customer 2667.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2667.Content: This was hands down the best prime rib that i have ever had. The staff was friendly and made helpful recommendations. Will be coming back every time i visit seattle!

Customer 2668.Name: Brian
Customer 2668.Content: First time ever we had the slowest service on the planet.  Food and drinks - as always is amazing

Customer 2669.Name: rbitv
Customer 2669.Content: Great restaurant in the "old steakhouse" tradition. Walls are covered with great photos. The food is better then "good 4/5 star" steakhouses. Fresh veggies in the wedge salad, the American Wagyu  top sirloin, were all above the top. Service impeccable, the wait staff was interesting and engaging. A top 5......

Customer 2670.Name: MsAnn
Customer 2670.Content: I have always considered The Met to be an upscale restaurant,but, I have to say, I was a little taken aback by the waiter bringing me a straw in his bare hands.  This was not our assigned waiter,but, someone assisting.

Customer 2671.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2671.Content: I've been to steakhouses all over the nation but this is one of the worst for sure.  The American Waygu top sirloin wasn't even edible.  To top it off, the service was so bad that's we had to walk out after talking to the GM.  He ended up offering some us food to go but we were afraid to even try it.  For sure, a chain steakhouse like Salt Grass or Longhorn is much better!!

Customer 2672.Name: CarlaB
Customer 2672.Content: We've been here many times, but this particular evening the wait for the food was unreasonably long. Over an hour wait when the restaurant was not very crowded seemed extreme. I should say it was at least an hour.

Customer 2673.Name: jenb
Customer 2673.Content: Excellent meal and service.  Great way to end a long weekend visiting Seattle.

Customer 2674.Name: Thomas
Customer 2674.Content: American Wagyu Filet:  Steaks have shrunk by 3 ounces since last year, still tasting excellent and preparation is awesome

Customer 2675.Name: Metlover
Customer 2675.Content: Todd and Craig are amazing!  Such a fun night! Worth every penny

Customer 2676.Name: DBLMO
Customer 2676.Content:
Very good, very expensive. If you have a special occasion this would be a fantastic place to go. But if you're looking for a casual night out go somewhere cheaper. 

Worth the money for a once a year celebration or when you need to impress for work, but if you're looking to try their signature beef meals make sure you're planning on spending $125+ per person with drinks.

Customer 2677.Name: Coop
Customer 2677.Content: Always wonderful ... World class at everything!!!!!!

Customer 2678.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2678.Content: Very nice staff. Great environment. Food was awesome. Staff was very attentive and courteous. Overall a fantastic evening in Seattle .

Customer 2679.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2679.Content: Our waiter was Todd and he was fantastic!! We have been to the Met many times and he by far was the best waiter we have had. He was very energetic, friendly and knowledgeable. He knew the menu offerings and other recommendations not on the menu. He was spot on with his recommendations and suggestions. He was very attentive to our needs and really made us feel that our business was important.  I highly recommend the Metropolitan and if you are able to have Todd as a waiter you will have a great experience!

Customer 2680.Name: LudiP
Customer 2680.Content: Great ambiance, food, and service! We were impressed at the attention to detail and how attentive the wait staff was. The food was very good. We would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends!

Customer 2681.Name: TLM6
Customer 2681.Content: Marla was the best!!! There was another guy that spoke to us who cleaned our table. He was great! I hope we get the chance to see them again :)

Customer 2682.Name: Tast
Customer 2682.Content:
10/21/16 we (had lunch at Metro Grill, our waiter was Kevin who first welcome us, very friendly and smile . We ( 5 people ) spent $175 for lunch but it worth the value because Kevin's great service , we felt WELCOME.
However, on 10/14/16 we (7 people ) went to Metro Grill for dinner to celebrate B Day with relatives from Boston.  Maria was the waitress, she was not nice, attitude was not friendly. We had the wrong orders ( we ordered 3 18oz prime ribs, but she gave us 2 12 Oz instead ! ). We asked her for another cup of hot water , she asked us "why  need another one " ???? not happy with her service and we spent almost $600 that night ! Her service attitude needs to be improve .  We usually had great service when dinning at Metro Grill !

Customer 2683.Name: Threepointedstar
Customer 2683.Content: the evening was amazing, everything was exceptional, always delicious.

Customer 2684.Name: Advsr
Customer 2684.Content: Wonderful atmosphere if a perfectly prepared steak dinner is in order. We've never been disappointed and always been seated on time or early. Knowledgable wine Somm and plenty of menu choices; some pricy but most in line with what you'd expect. Highly attended by the tourist trade but enjoyed by locals as well. Book a private room if your night out is a group or melt into the comfy seating and sit back for a memorable evening.

Customer 2685.Name: maried
Customer 2685.Content: It was the height of the lunch hour but still, the service was very slow.  My guest's beef stroganoff was lukewarm.  My chowder and spinach salad was very good and the chowder was the right temperature.

Customer 2686.Name: robertmfreeman
Customer 2686.Content: Superb again, worth changing your flights for! Great steak, wine and service.

Customer 2687.Name: TheEdman
Customer 2687.Content: I love how the waitstaff will move out of your way and give you a big smile when you are walking to or from your table. Every one of them. Every time. Classic steakhouse food is excellent...

Customer 2688.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2688.Content: The food and drinks are superior.  Our server was a lot of fun.  The place was jammed full (on a Wednesday evening, no less.  It must be ragingly popular!), so it was pretty noisy.  Overall, I think it was a really great place to go once, or maybe very occasionally, but the price makes it not something I would want to do very often.  (Based on how full the place was, I think I am in a minority about that.)

Customer 2689.Name: DB01
Customer 2689.Content: I had a business dinner at The Met while at a conference. There wasn't a single missed step. Seating was right on time, the meal was perfect and the table-side dessert was amazing. Simply outstanding.

Customer 2691.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2691.Content: Excellent food. Classic steakhouse. Great service! Superb winelist

Customer 2692.Name: ChuckL
Customer 2692.Content: Wonderful restaurant.    Great food and service.   Very pricey.

Customer 2693.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2693.Content: You will pay more then average for your steak but worth it. A variety of meats to choose from and a martini done right.

Customer 2694.Name: John
Customer 2694.Content: I really enjoyed the panko crusted scallops in a white wine sauce and the crab cakes. I ordered them for appetizers for my group and everyone loved them. The Alaskan halibut was cooked just right and the bone in filet was so tender. The bone in filet is not on the menu but is usually available per the waiter we had. Bananas foster done tableside was a big hit with everyone.

Customer 2695.Name: JudiC
Customer 2695.Content: Lunch was fantastic.  The service is always top notch.  Food is impeccable. Atmosphere was musty.  I think I stick to the Bar area.

Customer 2696.Name: hamoaboy
Customer 2696.Content: The entire evening was terrific.  Great steaks and fabulous wine list.  We try to fine here when in Seattle as it does not get any better than the Met, especially after a game.

Customer 2697.Name: Kristen
Customer 2697.Content: My husband and I have eaten at The Met several times & have never been disappointed until our visit on 10/16 following the Seahawks game. The restaurant was fun and lively due to many other Hawks fans and Russell and Ciara passing through to private dining.  However, our baked potato and our broccoli were grossly undercooked and our ribeye steak was chewy & full of gristle. I hope this was a one-time fail and it continues to be consistent in quality in the future.

Customer 2698.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2698.Content:
I visited the Met twice in the last 6 days. Both times underwhelming. We had brunch prior to the Seahawk game and it took the waitress a long time to acknowledge our presence even though she chatted with the table almost next to us for a long time. The food (Joe's Scramble) seemed prepared well in advance and was not the usual Met quality. A person in our party ordered a drink after the food came and it never showed up and he finally cancelled it as we had to leave.
For the prices they charge I expect everything to be very high quality and these last two occasions they definitely were not.

Customer 2699.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2699.Content: Went for brunch before the Seahawk game. Food was excellent, service was excellent. Always a good time at The Met.

Customer 2700.Name: RyanW
Customer 2700.Content: Met for brunch before Seahawks game, had an amazing eggs benedict and drinks.

Customer 2701.Name: JohnH
Customer 2701.Content:
Always fantastic with service and quality in mind. I have never been disappointed here and every time I bring someone new they are also blown away. The best steak I have ever had and the service is really incredible. You have to try it for yourself.

JohnH

Customer 2702.Name: jennifern
Customer 2702.Content: Best steak ever!!!  served by a staff that is charming, personable and truly cares about making the evening memorable. Pleasant buzz in the room.

Customer 2703.Name: SeattleBorn
Customer 2703.Content: Having been to the Met a number of times my general impression has not changed. It was a wonderful steak house about 20 years ago and now is just another overpriced restaurant. Drinks were super sweet with no taste of liquor. First course artichoke hearts dry with wilted parsley. Steak nothing to write home about - especially compared to my steak at Canlis earlier in the week. Price was very close to Canlis but food and service was not even close.

Customer 2705.Name: Scot
Customer 2705.Content: Impressive menu and equally awesome wine list to support it.  Friendly, knowledgeable and attentive wait staff and sommeliers.

Customer 2706.Name: Brian
Customer 2706.Content: Im VIP but they still charged me for parking, food was amazing this trip there wasn't so much amazing about the experience even though I told them it was my 50th Birthday, you guys missed hitting a home run MET.  Been going here since 1999 but starting to think of finding a new spot.

Customer 2707.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2707.Content: Went here for a birthday dinner. Service was good but food was average. Our hash potatoes were smelling of old oil.  But they were open to changing them and gave us a complimentary dessert for the occasion. Our server was delightful and even sang us a happy birthday song.

Customer 2708.Name: Goodfoodluver
Customer 2708.Content: Great food and wonderful service. The menu has a nice variety.

Customer 2709.Name: TPowers
Customer 2709.Content: I usually love the Met but this trip was disappointing. Service was slow, steak was average and I poured the decanted wine for the table. Not up to usual standard. Didn't eat half of my 8 oz steak and no one asked why.

Customer 2710.Name: Jeff
Customer 2710.Content: The ambiance, quality of food and service was wonderful.  Our waiter went out of his way to figure out how to get us the best cut for us and prepare it as we wanted.

Customer 2711.Name: FoodiePS
Customer 2711.Content:
This was my first experience at Metropolitan Grill, and I was not disappointed. I splurged on the Snow Beef and it was the most tender, flavorful filet I've ever had! The waiter was incredible, and very knowledgeable and was able to split a salad and sides for me. 

I highly recommend this if you're really wanting a fantastic steak!

Customer 2712.Name: Noongsters
Customer 2712.Content: THE MET IS A FAMILY FAVORITE AND HAS NEVER DISAPPOINTED.  YES ITS A BIT SPENDY BUT YOU HAVE YOU PRICED PRIME USDA STEAKS BEFORE?  NOI OUR WAITER WAS ON POINT, WE ASK FOR HIM EVERYTIME AND HE NEVER LETS US DOWN.  SEE YOU NEXT MONTH!

Customer 2713.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2713.Content: One of the finer steak houses in the state.  It would be hard to imagine anyone being dissapointed after an evening at the Metropolitan.

Customer 2714.Name: TJN123
Customer 2714.Content: This place has been a classic since the day I first entered its corridor in 1998. I have not been back in about 7 years and was greeted by staff who have been there and served me with a smile since that day. You just cannot beat the service, quality food, classic menu selections and top notch wine list and meats. If you want the very best you come here.

Customer 2716.Name: Sarah
Customer 2716.Content: My wife and I went for dinner for our anniversary.  As always, wonderful service, friendly staff and of course the best steak!  If you have never been before you must try the calamari and the carrot cake with Makers Mark ice cream!

Customer 2717.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2717.Content: Neither of us that ordered steak were impressed. I have noticed a decline in quality the last few times I've been in for lunch.

Customer 2718.Name: arikohn
Customer 2718.Content: Came to buy birthday lunch for a friend.  Very good food; incredibly good service!  Thank you, Ari Kohn

Customer 2719.Name: Disappointment
Customer 2719.Content: Wonderful ambiance, attentive waiter, delicious food and a special treat for the birthday woman make this THE place to be for a birthday lunch gathering of 6 and under...

Customer 2720.Name: RonB
Customer 2720.Content: Best steak ever!  Truly unique taste, nearly indescribable. Don't miss it!

Customer 2721.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2721.Content: My son was celebrating his 13th birthday and he wanted a good lobster (go figure).  Anyway The Met Grill did not disappoint.  His lobster was excellent and so was the rest of the food.  The overall dining experience was as advertised

Customer 2722.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2722.Content: Attentive, thoughtful service and great food make for an enjoyable evening. Yes, it's a bit expensive, but the cost is reasonable for the quality.

Customer 2723.Name: BryanM
Customer 2723.Content: I can not recommend this place because they sat us 25 minutes after our reservation and seated people with reservations later then us first. Also after we were served our appetizer, they forgot my salad and it took over an hour for our food. I ordered a bottle of wine and they came out with another one that I did not like. Bottom line was 2-1/2 hours to get an appetizer and a main coarse.  I will be going to any other steakhouse in Seattle.

Customer 2724.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2724.Content: Server was friendly, but didn't write down an order for a party of 4, and numerous things were wrong, including a diabetic getting a huge side of carbohydrates.

Customer 2725.Name: KaylaH
Customer 2725.Content: Great dinner not an average night out something special for sure great service they were very nice to our one year old as well would go back for sure

Customer 2726.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2726.Content: Lots of great suggestions to visit here, and had the standard $65 Ribeye.  It was good, but nothing spectacular nor any better than a $30 ribeye elsewhere.   Food tastes good, but simply overpriced for what you get.

Customer 2728.Name: David
Customer 2728.Content: As usual, outstanding steaks, served at the proper temperature .  I liked the expanded options

Customer 2729.Name: ChristieB
Customer 2729.Content: Starter -polenta dry, not creamy.  The wedge amazing.  The French onion soup many in our party said best they ever had.  Carmel bacon delicious.   Meat-signature items good, not spectacular.

Customer 2730.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2730.Content: I eat here with my employees once a month. I often have the portabella brie sandwich, which is no longer available, but which I enjoyed. This time I had the roasted vegie and coleslaw sandwich. This is the worst meal I have ever had at the Met. It was sloppy, the vegies drenched om BBQ sauce, the only flavor that came through. What a disappointment! Bring back the portabella and brie sandwich, please.

Customer 2731.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2731.Content:
We absolutely loved our dining experience, and the staff was very engaging. We did request a table for business conversation, but felt we were put a bit close to the kitchen considering the % of diners at the time. Also, it did seem to take a while to get our cocktails; again, considering it did not seem to be very busy at the time. Very much hope to return though.

Thank you

Customer 2732.Name: KCTX
Customer 2732.Content:
For our 35th Anniversary, we took a trip to Seattle.  Many of our friends who had been there told us we had to dine at the Metropolitan while we were there.

The were all correct...it would have been a shame to have missed out.

Texas (our home) brags about their steaks, but quite a few of our upper level steak houses could take a few pointers from the Metropolitan.  For openers, there are different levels of beef you can choose from,  from beef sourced from their own domestic cattle breeds all the way to Japanese Wagyu beef.

I chose the Filet Mignon, and my wife a NY Strip.  Both prepared exactly as we ordered.  The salads were excellent (Ceasar).  The baked potato on the side came out with just the right amount of toppings (you could taste the potato...not just the toppings). 

We mentioned to our hotel Concierge that we were dining at Metropolitan, and she called them to make sure we were taken care of.   We were treated to a creme brulee and coffee after our meal.

It's not an inexpensive night out, but for what I consider a world class meal and dining experience, it's hard to beat the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 2733.Name: USMCmatt
Customer 2733.Content: This was by far the best experience I have had at a steakhouse. I love the fact that it has the old style steakhouse kind of vibe. It felt like it could have been in Washington DC filled with politicians. Just a good upscale vibe.  The prices are incredibly fair for what premium steaks they offer. I love the fact we got sides included with our entree. Not many places do that anymore. Best steak I have ever had in my life. I will come back and next time get the even more premium cut sampler plate. Drinks were strong and bold and fairly priced as well. The customer service was superb and unrivaled. The attention we received was the perfect amount and professional. Our server was busy with several tables but you never would have known. Very knowledgeable as well. Many good recommendations were given and none failed to deliver. 10/10, this is a must visit.

Customer 2734.Name: David
Customer 2734.Content: Great food and an extensive wine list in a classic setting with excellent service. It's not cheap, but worth it in my view.

Customer 2735.Name: Steakanator
Customer 2735.Content: Went here for my dad's 72nd birthday. You better be a steak connoisseur or you will not appreciate it. I'm not one, so my review is probably biased.  They sell you on committing to the high price of their steaks by trying to impress you, telling you "facts" and terms you didn't know  nor really matter in the end to show you they are the best steakhouse in town. While the steak was delicious, I could've gone to Safeway, bought the same cut, cooked it the same, and it would've tasted the same...  at a mere fraction of the price. A 8oz fillet mignon costed me $72 and I wanted to break out the scale. It was definitely closer to 6oz. I went with adding king crab for $38. I got 3 crab legs... uh, what?  Plus the entrees don't come with salad. So that was another $15 or so for a wedge. If this wasn't a special occasion I would have complained directly to the restaurant about bang for buck. Otherwise the service was great besides the awkward "trying too hard" aspect that I assume is part of their way to not have you feel ripped off at the end of the night. I'm sure this review sounds super negative. They do well at what they're best at I just felt like most of the experience was an overpriced facade.

Customer 2736.Name: Gail
Customer 2736.Content: This restaurant has been well-known for its  style, food and service for decades.  It never fails to please!

Customer 2737.Name: JayJay
Customer 2737.Content: Very good food. Excellent service. Steaks are cooked right. Steak selection and finished product superior to steakhouse chains, but you will pay for it. Waygu was good, so were the filets. Get the crab claw appetizer. Their mixed drinks and wine list also are good. Booths are comfortable. Bottom line, it's a nice establishment, with very good food and excellent service. Make reservations -- it was jammed Friday night.

Customer 2738.Name: CChang
Customer 2738.Content: Our server was competent, but not the best - we was not welcoming, but he wasn't rude.  It was very basic service - we were not told the specials, our waiter did not introduce himself, he was short with responses, but not rude.  the food came quickly, and we never had to ask for anything, so he was a good server, but not outstanding like some of the others.

Customer 2739.Name: Jules
Customer 2739.Content:
Came to celebrate my birthday. The place was packed with Bussiness people being very loud. The server never asked about our special celebration. She visited our table only 3 times. Then gave us a hard time because we had Costco gift cards. 
Very disappointed and expected much better service and atmosphere. Felt rushed and not welcomed

Customer 2740.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2740.Content: The waiter was able to provide a more inexpensive dinner with small servings.  Very helpful

Customer 2741.Name: Cowgirl
Customer 2741.Content: We don't usually visit steak house type restaurants but came to Metropolitan on a recommendation from a friend who heard we were visiting Seattle. The menu has lots if selection but unless you are a huge eater I'd suggest ordering entries to share. Our medallions were perfectly prepared and delicious. The wine list is 60 pages  long and reasonable. The service was excellent. This is a meal worth the $$$$ check.

Customer 2742.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2742.Content: Amazing experience.  Dessert prepared at table with flare and the best I've ever had!  Chateaubriand was to die for.  Waiter was a hoot.

Customer 2743.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2743.Content: We had a fabulous experience. Food and service and as excellent. Thank You!

Customer 2744.Name: Zel1012
Customer 2744.Content: Our reservation was at 915. Didn't not have to wait to be seated. They were busy that night. We didn't get our appetizer 30minutes after we ordered. They gave us a free dessert in the end, crime brûlée. I have to admit though I've tasted better crime brûlée in the past, at other restaurant. Out server was okay. The other server that was serving the other guests, I wish we had him as our server. The service was slow. We didn't get bread and drinks as fast as you normally could. It's understandable, I use to work in the restaurant business myself. I ordered the filet mignon, medium rare. I didn't expect it to be that chewy. Normally it should melt in your mouth, not much effort to chew but I was chewing like a steak that's well done. The appetizers and the other entree and other dessert we ordered tasted amazing though.

Customer 2745.Name: CCRod
Customer 2745.Content: Excellent food, service and ambiance.....great dining experience.

Customer 2746.Name: John
Customer 2746.Content: My wife and I went for our anniversary and the staff went above and beyond what I would expect from a restaurant. They made the night truly exceptional and the food was absolutely excellent.

Customer 2747.Name: Joboco
Customer 2747.Content: This is our annual football trip and the Met has been an experience that our sales people would normally not receive in the Cities they live. after 7 times the venue remains great, the service has lacked luster and the food was warm at best,. Sorry but it was disappointing.

Customer 2748.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2748.Content: Our service couldn't have been better!  Marla our server was so warm and knowledgable, Lance our wine captain was so helpful and such a character!  We loved the locally raised meats...  Everything was cooked to perfection!  Thank you so much to the whole team!

Customer 2749.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2749.Content: The food, atmosphere, location and servers were top rated . The server Bruno gets an A+ for knowledge of the menu and kindness as a server. The overall price was justified. I would recommend this place to everyone who asks for a wonderful place to dine in Seattle.

Customer 2750.Name: jimm
Customer 2750.Content: Everything was perfect. The service across every aspect of the Metro Grill is first rate.  Our family felt special from the minute we walked in the door.  Our waiter Bruno was funny, helpful, and attentive throughout the visit.  Our cocktails were amazing!  Our meals amazing!  With every visit to Seattle the Metropolitan Grill is always the best part...

Customer 2751.Name: SharonB
Customer 2751.Content: Great experience!  Expect exceptional food and service. Can be loud at times.

Customer 2752.Name: IamB
Customer 2752.Content: Celebrated our anniversary here for the second year in a row and were not disappointed. We appreciate the excellent customer service and memorable experience.

Customer 2753.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2753.Content: I've been before and was disappointed.  The food was average at best.  Mac and cheese did not have enough cheese, dry.  Crab cakes didn't have enough crab.  Steak was ok but not premium.  The server was good.

Customer 2754.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2754.Content: Good bar, great bartenders Bar is a fun happening place quality ofthe food isgood but missing on flavor. Bone in rib eye isabeautiful pieceofmeat but lacking flavor. Brussell sprouts ordinary.mushrooms terrible mashedpotatoesgood

Customer 2755.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2755.Content: I hadn't been there in 10 years, yet, it didn't disappoint. Everything about this place is class and deliciousness. One of my favorite restaurants anywhere in the world!

Customer 2756.Name: RachelM
Customer 2756.Content: Ambiance is like a New York Steakhouse.  Food is high quality and priced accordingly.  Great for a special occasion, but likely too extravagant for every day dining

Customer 2757.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2757.Content: Love this restaurant. Our waiter, Jim, was fantastic. Food was perfect.

Customer 2758.Name: JohnS
Customer 2758.Content: Food and wait staff service was good, but the food took too long to come to the table. My business guest (a client) had to leave before me so he could make a meeting he was late for. I thought it took too much time to get seated (we arrived on time and had an OT reservation), and the food took too long (a salad and pasta dish) to get to the table.

Customer 2759.Name: lsh41
Customer 2759.Content: The chateaubriand was excellent. Drinks were great. It is known for steaks and we saw some huge ones go by, a bone in huge ribeye, also the filet looked really nice. I was happy with my choice but it's a lot of food! Their carrot cake is amazing! Not enough words to describe it. We had heard of it while visiting Seattle and had gotten just the carrot cake to go after a different dinner location that wasn't great. Gosh it is good! Service was also excellent.

Customer 2760.Name: Nancy
Customer 2760.Content: Fabulous!  Our favorite place for special occasions.

Customer 2761.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2761.Content: We were there to celebrate my husbands 50th birthday. Everyone that we were in contact with were absolutely fantastic. I have some food allergies (dairy and citric acid) and was concerned I wouldn't be able to find much to eat but I had no problem. The only thing I didn't have was dessert but I was so full it was fine. Everyone's steaks were made to perfection. Absolutely wonderful!

Customer 2762.Name: WBER
Customer 2762.Content: Such a special treat to dine at the Met!  Amazing staff that always makes us feel at home.  We missed Kimberly - but enjoyed meeting Vanessa.  Thank you Craig, Romy, Kevin & Charlie for a wonderful experience!!

Customer 2763.Name: GHansen
Customer 2763.Content: Wonderful food and superb service!  Our special occasion go to.

Customer 2764.Name: MH618
Customer 2764.Content: This place is awesome! We had the chateaubriand for two and it was delicious! The valet parking was definitely a plus as well.  It is expensive, but so worth it. We will be coming back the next time we are in Seattle!

Customer 2765.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2765.Content: We went for our 25th Anniversary dinner and it was simply outstanding in every way. We have dined here a number of times and it has never been anything but superb. We recommend it without hesitation or reservation.

Customer 2766.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2766.Content: Do not order the Prime Rib. Worst we ever. I think the food is overrated and very overpriced. The ambience was great, beautiful old building with interesting  architecture. Better just have a cocktail in the bar.

Customer 2767.Name: Dave
Customer 2767.Content: Outstanding steak. Extremely high quality beef available is not offered at most restaurants. You will pay for it though. Worth it on rare occasion for steak snobs.

Customer 2768.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2768.Content: We always make it a point to visit your restaurant when we make it down from Alaska.  We always walk away way to full and happy.

Customer 2769.Name: Hopewel1975
Customer 2769.Content: The service was better than the food - my waiter made a good meal into a great meal.  Being solo, that was great.  The drinks were good (not  measured) and the food was good, almost great.  I will return when back in town.

Customer 2770.Name: coquine
Customer 2770.Content: My favorite restaurant in town, both for personal and business events!

Customer 2771.Name: Anne
Customer 2771.Content: Excellent meal. Steak was delicious and service was also great. Hard to talk as it is noisy.

Customer 2772.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2772.Content:
I had made a reservation for three for lunch but we ended-up having one more in our party. The hostess made the change without issue and we were seated within a few minutes. My wife had a burger, I had the steak sandwich, and our freinds had a steak and the steak salad. Everything came to the table hot and everyone really enjoyed the food. We also had some red wine and our waiter was on top of low glasses. All-in all a great lunch at a historic Seattle steak house.
Cheers,
JP

Customer 2773.Name: FoodieGuy
Customer 2773.Content: I've gone to the Met on numerous occasions,  but on this visit to celebrate my birthday, everything felt mediocre from the food, the drinks, the service, the ambiance.  Our server didn't even ask if we were celebrating a special occasion or what brought us to the restaurant in the first place.  It was unimpressive, so I will likely not return for awhile.

Customer 2774.Name: ggcouv
Customer 2774.Content: Mixed bag for the food. My son was very happy with the (Wow! Expensive) Ohmi beef. I was extremely disappointed in the halibut entree I ordered (I know - steakhouse!) and the garlic mashed potatoes (dry and basically inedible).

Customer 2775.Name: BrianM
Customer 2775.Content: We have eaten at your restaurant on a few occasion now and have always been very pleased with everything, food, wine, great staff. We would make it more often but money is a issue, but every chance we have a little extra in the piggy bank we like to make a night of it. Thank you

Customer 2776.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2776.Content: Our favorite restaurant in Seattle.  Great for Seahawks pre-game brunch!!  Service is always exquisite, food is perfect, atmosphere is wonderful.  It is always an amazing experience.  There just isn't a better place to dine in Seattle - there isn't!!

Customer 2777.Name: DeanaM
Customer 2777.Content: We came before a Seahawks game for brunch...Be careful the size of the meals are huge. But not bad prices and yummy bloody marys too.

Customer 2778.Name: thebeachkid
Customer 2778.Content: Three of us had Seahawks game day brunch and it was really good. Sat in the bar, had fine cocktails and fab food

Customer 2779.Name: She33
Customer 2779.Content: Friendly and attentive staff.  Nice Seahawks brunch menu.  Food was very good.

Customer 2780.Name: TamN
Customer 2780.Content: Dinner was amazing. The seafood was fresh and the steaks were cooked perfectly. Our server was very helpful in answering our questions about the menu. Although a little pricey, it was worth it.

Customer 2781.Name: Stizz
Customer 2781.Content: Great steak house!  Will not disappoint!

Customer 2782.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2782.Content: Classic steakhouse, dark wood trim, old style booths and lighting, celebrity pics on the wall, etc.. Cool ambience. Service was very good, friendly and personable waiter and staff. My wife and I split a wedge salad and steak after long day of eating and snacking at Pike Place, and the waiter was very accommodating. And no "spilt plate" charge. Food was tasty but expensive, but no different than any other steakhouse (i.e. Mortons, Ruth Cris, etc). Our steak was a bit overcooked but I'm sure they would have taken back if we asked. Was still very good. Overall   the experience met our expectations.

Customer 2783.Name: MagnumMan
Customer 2783.Content:
What can you say about the Metropolitan Grill.  I travel over 600,000 miles per year on business, I eat in Steakhouses from New York to Chicago to Dallas to Las Vegas to Los Angeles to San Francisco and I put the Metropolitan Grill at the very TOP OF THE LIST.  Everything is exceptional, but most of all, their steaks.  Anytime I get to Seattle, it is to the MET I GO!

If you have never eaten at the Metropolitan Grill, I highly encourage you to give them a shot.

Customer 2784.Name: MelW
Customer 2784.Content: Our server was very well trained and we learned a lot from him. They had our favorite bottle of wine, and the steak!!! Steak is by far my favorite meaty food and it was the best I've ever had!!! Definitely worth the price, the whole experience was wonderful. We will go back!

Customer 2785.Name: Meatlover1
Customer 2785.Content: Cool spot and great atmosphere but the cost was outrageous.

Customer 2786.Name: JeffC
Customer 2786.Content: Classic steakhouse but with a twist...some interesting appetizers.  Try the beef tips, wow! Steak choices included three grades of beef, very nice.  By the way, my steak was outstanding.

Customer 2787.Name: Bridget
Customer 2787.Content: Outstanding service and food. The prices are high, but its worth the pay.

Customer 2788.Name: Ralph
Customer 2788.Content: Wow - on of the best steakhouse I have ever been. Seafood was also overwhelming. Nothing more to say.

Customer 2789.Name: LindaT
Customer 2789.Content: We celebrated our anniversary at The Metropolitan, and it was lovely! Food is excellent, as was the wine, and service is outstanding.

Customer 2790.Name: Conejo
Customer 2790.Content: Met, also good, a little quieter in the back area, lunch is popular, so is after work happy hours,

Customer 2791.Name: James
Customer 2791.Content: Best steak in Seattle.  Traditional dark wood décor.  Outstanding Steak and service.  Expensive, but well worth the price.  Great for that special occasion dinner.

Customer 2792.Name: KenH
Customer 2792.Content: The food was very good, but not worth the price tag. The steaks are as good of quality at other fine establishments such as Daniel's Broiler, Palisades, or my favorite, Prime Steakhouse in Redmond.  I would not say it was better. Very good, just not any better than other top steak houses. The service from our waiter was minimal to say the least, and my wife was super excited to see a desert menu...however they brought out a lemon tart or something..it was delicious but we never got to look at and order what we want. It was their way of surprising us (they knew it was our anniversary) but really was inconsiderate considering we would have liked to order our own deserts.  People were dressed mostly casual, it was definitely a comfortable atmosphere.  I'm glad we went, but its unlikely we'd return as we can get a similar experience for about 70% of the price at other fine steakhouses.

Customer 2793.Name: AnnaR
Customer 2793.Content: Food was amazing! A little hard to hear at points but overall great place and highly recommend the filet!

Customer 2794.Name: ScotchAndSteakSavant
Customer 2794.Content: I was in town for a major convention, meeting friends I see maybe 2-3 times a year.  The plan was to get superb steak and sides, great mixology before and after the meal, and a great bottle of wine during it.  The Met hit on all fronts, with a great ambiance that feels both welcoming and affluent at the same time.  My group were treated superbly despite not being in button-downs+ties, and the kitchen staff served me one of the best steak flights (same cut, different sourcing) of my life.  My pre-dinner cocktail was a little on the sweet side, but that was at most a fleeting pothole in an otherwise great evening on the town.

Customer 2795.Name: NathanL
Customer 2795.Content: They welcomed us in at the front. Had a semi-private room set up for us in the Chairman's Room. Phenomenal steaks and the service was exactly what of expect from a place like that. Food took a long time to arrive but it was a Saturday night.

Customer 2796.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2796.Content: Mckenzie was our waiter and he made the experience for myself and three friends the most amazing dinner experience we have ever had.  I visit this restaurant every time I come to visit Seattle and the waitstaff and food have never disappointed me. This last trip however with Mckenzie, was the most memorable. The experience has always been high class and the food exceptional. I will continue to make this a must stop on my future visits.

Customer 2797.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2797.Content: My husband and I went to celebrate our one year anniversary, after reading through many reviews we decided to go here rather than somewhere else. The place is nice and staff is very friendly from the moment you walk in and we defiantly felt catered to. Our experience was great, food is pricey but good for special occasions.

Customer 2798.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2798.Content: The Met is the perfect place for a very special occasion.

Customer 2799.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2799.Content:
Came here with my wife for dinner to celebrate our wedding anniversary.
 Excellent food, excellent service, nice ambiance, quiet enough to have a conversation without raised voices.
Only con is that it is a rather expensive dining experience, but in our opinion well worth it (steaks were amazing and cooked just right).
Would recommend for a special occasion or a business dinner.

Customer 2800.Name: JuliaH
Customer 2800.Content: Was recommended this restaurant by a friend, and so very glad I listened! Nice old school atmosphere.  Had a reservation and got seated immediately in a nice private booth.  Ordered the scallops for appetizers...delish.  Husband got the rib-eye and since I'm not a big steak fan, I got the halibut with a side of scalloped potatoes.  Hands-down this was the best tasting food I've ever had.  Husband's steak was to die for and melted in your mouth.  Would have loved dessert, but was just too full.  Was thinking of going there a few days later while still in town, but didn't quite make it.  A definite must if visiting Seattle.  Valet was a plus also.

Customer 2802.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2802.Content: Never a disappointing experience. Food and service top-notch, with staff who know and love the menu. Great place to see who's who in Seattle.

Customer 2803.Name: AWInglis
Customer 2803.Content: The menu is excellent, but the service is outdated and old fashioned. Our server felt pushy and rushed us.  She kept coming back to the table for no real reason, which interrupted our conversation each time. Other than that,  I enjoyed it. Best French onion soup outside of France.

Customer 2804.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2804.Content: Went in with my sister for a "treat yourself"-worthy dinner on her first trip to Seattle - outstanding service and delicious food. The teriyaki tips appetizer is amazing.

Customer 2805.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2805.Content: The steaks were fantastic.  The sautéed mushrooms were some of the best we've had.   We really enjoyed the meal. The only issue was for some reason the holder for the ground pepper was right beside our table and the waiter kept slamming the pepper back in it place and didn't seem aware that this was a problem.  We took pepper out and told him to leave it on the table.  Annoying but  otherwise, great meal.

Customer 2806.Name: JohnD
Customer 2806.Content: The food was amazing...especially the steaks.  The service was very good...attentive but not intrusive.  The wine list was incredible.

Customer 2807.Name: LisaW
Customer 2807.Content: Enjoyed wonderful service, a great tasting steak and lobster mac n cheese.  The large piece of carrot cake was good too!

Customer 2808.Name: Infobitch
Customer 2808.Content: I was very excited to come here since it was voted as best steak in town. What a disappointment.  When traveling I always like to look for a great steakhouse being that I am steaklover. The service was good but I had to return my steak when it wasn't cooked to order, even after that it was still terrible. Don't waste your money and go to El Gaucho. It's a shame I didn't "open table" with them because they would have gotten 5 stars from me.

Customer 2809.Name: MaryHelenS
Customer 2809.Content: Our server was terrific.  She was attentive but did not hover.  The grilled peach salad was scrumptious and the primr rib p

Customer 2810.Name: Trent
Customer 2810.Content: Great food....Great service.... Wonderful knowledgeable  staff on food and wine pairing .... Had a Great Anniversary here and would recommend them to anyone.  I definitely will be coming back.

Customer 2811.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2811.Content:
The "Met" has been a destination spot since the way back days.  Lance Wade is the most polished front man in Seattle Dining.   When other places are trying to do "Retro", the Met has no need to pretend.  Spot on service, kind attention, and the best damn food ANYWHERE!

Look no further, my friends!

Customer 2812.Name: LisaR
Customer 2812.Content: Comfortable table and lovely ambiance.  Staff was amazing.  Jim our waiter was knowledgeable and helpful with the many steak choices!  It was our anniversary and it was a joyful and  tasteful experience.  We hope to take some family members to visit soon!

Customer 2813.Name: SashaS
Customer 2813.Content: Absolutely brilliant steak house. Easily the best steak I've ever had and it was cooked perfectly. Will recommend it to anyone and will definitely come back next time I'm in Seattle.

Customer 2814.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2814.Content: The wait staff was excellent,  the appetizers very good as well.  Both main courses not so great.  Prime rib was tough and the filet was not very flavorful not what we expected  for "prime"  cuts of beef.  Won't  go back and spend another $250 for 2 mediocre  meals.

Customer 2815.Name: RichardN
Customer 2815.Content: We found the steaks overrated and over priced. We each had the prime ribeye and both were disappointed with the flavor and lack of tenderness even though they were cooked to our requested state (medium rare and medium). We found that we much prefer the choice ribeye steaks from Costco that we grill ourselves. The ~$325 dinner was a disappointment

Customer 2816.Name: Diner72
Customer 2816.Content: My wife and I dined at the Metropolitan Grill recently on a holiday trip to Seattle.  We had an early dinner, in order to attend a pre-season football game.  We arrived early, and the manager found us a couple of seats at the bar.  Excellent Hendrick's gin martini at the bar--one of the best I've had.  When the restaurant opened for dinner, we were promptly seated and made our selections.  My steak was perfectly cooked, with a char on the outside, but moist and fork tender on the inside.  My favorite side was the Brussel Sprouts.  Table service was very good (several excellent suggestions that we took and were glad we did), and we had plenty of time to make it to the game.  Recommend Metropolitan.

Customer 2817.Name: KATEco
Customer 2817.Content:
Always my first option when I want something celebratory or special.  They are always
warm and welcoming.  Service is superb and friendly.  I actually took my Vegan
sister-in-law there and they were able to make her happy.
Simply the best Seattle has to offer.

Customer 2818.Name: ientre9y11
Customer 2818.Content:
Classic American steakhouse.  Spinach salad was good.  My wife had the Ohmi filet, it was almost melt in your mouth tender and had a rich, buttery flavour.  Excellent.  The poblano scalloped potatoes were very good, they had a spicy bite.

I had the 4 oz. filet and 4 oz. Ohmi filet combo.  Both were excellent.  The Ohmi was more tender with a more subtle flavour.  Had the brussel sprouts as a side and they were very good.

We shared the Cherries Jubilee for dessert.  It was good but nothing like the Bananas Foster which was excellent.

Customer 2819.Name: JoeH
Customer 2819.Content: Outstanding meal as always. Service was excellent, price not unreasonable for a downtown venue. Both of us were totally pleased.

Customer 2820.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2820.Content: Me and my wife visit Seatle once a year and this is the spot to eat

Customer 2821.Name: arikohn
Customer 2821.Content: This is a favorite restaurant of mine, but I felt ripped off after the lunch 2 days ago:  The strawberry shortcake has always been with REAL strawberries plus included ICE CREAM.  This time, the strawberry shortcake had minus zero ice cream and the strawberries were NOT fresh.  In fact, the "strawberries" were more or less like some kind of jam or preserves.  Just terrible.   I almost asked for the manager.  Not acceptable!!

Customer 2822.Name: LisaW
Customer 2822.Content: Fantastic dinner at the Metropolitan Grill (again). Still the best steak in town. I had the Kurobota bacon-wrapped filet medallions with bleu cheese, and my husband had the large Angus filet. Both were excellent. I tried a new seasonal salad that needed some work, though. The grilled peach salad was a great idea, but could have been better executed: the peaches were underripe and hard, and the tiny amount of grilling wasn't enough to soften them up or add much flavor. The burrata cheese was tasty, but just kind of lay there in a lump. Frisee greens were fresh and the dressing uninspired. With fabulous local peaches still in stores, there's no excuse for using hard, underripe fruit. Interesting idea, but needed better planning.

Customer 2823.Name: Aquavit
Customer 2823.Content: Excellent spot for a wonderful birthday dinner.   Great ambiance, great service and excellent steaks!

Customer 2824.Name: anonymous
Customer 2824.Content: Service was wonderful as always! The food was delicious.

Customer 2825.Name: JenniferK
Customer 2825.Content: Love this place! We try to go when we are in town!

Customer 2826.Name: CGood
Customer 2826.Content: Metropolitan never disappoints! Not only is the food excellent, but the service is attentive, personal, and makes one feel like a special guest. We frequent several of the Seattle steakhouses and each has its own food specialties. Metropolitan wins in service ! We love it  !!!!

Customer 2827.Name: localeater
Customer 2827.Content: Can't beat the Met for client lunches

Customer 2828.Name: reisesandra
Customer 2828.Content: Restaurant is a nice upmarket Steakhouse.  Nice selection of special Steaks . Unfortunately on our visit something went wrong in the kitchen and the food came out cold. Staff tried to fix and send food back but it came back out for the 2nd time also cold. Staff tried to make up for it by offering a glass of wine on the house but in a restaurant like this such a mistake should not happen, and surely not twice!!! Other than that, I am sure this is a great restaurant.

Customer 2829.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2829.Content:
Booked in for 8:15 and were seated on time
Steaks were great & sides were generous portions
Shared 2 generous sized deserts between 3  and  that was plenty.   
Servers were very good and looked after us well
Would go back if in Seattle again

Customer 2830.Name: EBKLAW
Customer 2830.Content: The food was outstanding and the service was excellent.  I was disappointed that many of the diners wore shorts, sneakers  and other inappropriate attire.  A restaurant of this caliber should not allow such casual dressware for dinner.

Customer 2831.Name: HoustonFoodie
Customer 2831.Content: I visit Metropolitan Grill at least once a month and have always had great food.  The staff are consistently friendly and attentive when you need them.  if you want something prepared differently than the menu, always ask.  Most times they can accommodate.

Customer 2832.Name: SteakEater11
Customer 2832.Content: We had dinner here for a date night. The waiter was super awesome and very attentive and entertaining. Then one of the non-waiter staff kept coming by and making us laugh. We weren't expecting the comedy part, but it was very welcome. We'll be back for sure. They also highly recommended coming in for happy hour and getting the skewers... said it was the best deal around for steak.

Customer 2833.Name: Winelover
Customer 2833.Content:
On the last night of any vacation we take, my husband and I always choose a steakhouse for dinner.  This year while vacationing in Seattle, we chose the Metropolitan Grill.  We always like to compare other steakhouses to our favorite, Ruth's Chris.  With that being said, we enjoyed the Met, but as far as the filet, Ruth's still remains on top for us.

For a Monday evening, the Met was a happening place.  Wonderful decor and a great wine list greeted us.  We certainly enjoyed the warm bread that was promptly served, but my field greens salad, although loaded with pears, Gorgonzola and candied walnuts, was overdressed in a not so tasty dressing.  John's French onion soup was flavorful and beefy.  When our entrees arrived, we couldn't wait to cut into our succulent fillets.  I enjoyed mine, but didn't experience that "wow" factor.  My husband's steak was served medium rare instead of the medium he was expecting.  His slice was also a bit fatty, which was surprising for such a top notch cut of beef.  Again, no "wow" factor.

A nice perk, however, was that each entree came with one side.  Our choices,  mashed potatoes and roasted veggies, were plentiful and delicious.  An au jus gravy was also served by the waiter after our entrees were presented.

The highlight of our meal was one of our favorite desserts--cherries jubilee.  Done table side,  the scrumptious cherries were served over some of the best vanilla ice cream we have ever had.  Wow!

Service here was great and the dinner moved along nicely.  We were well taken care of.

Although we wouldn't rate the Met as high as Ruth's Chris, we did enjoy our meal.

Customer 2834.Name: SheilainBelltown
Customer 2834.Content: Lovely club-like feel, including romantic booths and enough room between tables so that we can engage in an intimate conversation.  Service for our party of four was excellent.  Steaks were perfectly prepared.  My generous portion of halibut was cooked through, as requested, and perfectly moist with a lovely lemon butter sauce. That said, I thought that Daniel's preparation was more succulent.  Our party of four shared two orders of Hot Apple Pie, prepared with Granny Smith apples sautéed with brown sugar, butter, cinnamon and cloves. Flambéed tableside and served with Madagascar vanilla ice cream and caramel. Eight thumbs up!

Customer 2835.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2835.Content: Awesome steaks! Michael was an amazing server, took great care of us.

Customer 2836.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2836.Content: Ambiance, service, and food quality was exceptional.   Most people in our party ordered the rib eye and it was  done perfectly.  I would highly recommend that anyone looking for a great steak and wonderful meal to try this place.

Customer 2837.Name: Julie
Customer 2837.Content: We use to go  the Met once or twice a year between 1995 and 2005.  It was always excellent. The steaks were ALWAYS from the very best cuts of meat and cooked to perfection.  And the sides were so unique and delicious that every bite made me smile. And the salads and bread and  wine again were perfect....every time.  It was very expensive but always  worth it...but not this time.  This  time everything  was 100%  mediocre.  And it cost us $250.00.  The New York Strip was completely unremarkable.  The massive pile of roasted root vegetables was mushy  and  tasteless  and  the wedge salad had too much dressing.  The bread was even boring.  Our server was very nice.  And the ambiance was great as always.  But the food made me sad.  Now we have to find a  new fine dining restaurant.

Customer 2838.Name: Randy
Customer 2838.Content: The service was good but not sure if the food really warranted the high price.  Dinner was good but not exceptional.

Customer 2839.Name: LorneD
Customer 2839.Content: Classic elegance, with great steaks and wonderful service.

Customer 2840.Name: RichardP
Customer 2840.Content: steaks were very average, usually get better results at home. Tough and not much flavor. I could be spoiled by the sous vide/sear approach at home.

Customer 2841.Name: AnthonyR
Customer 2841.Content: We celebrated our 10th anniversary at the MET and it couldn't have been any better.  We made a request for a quiet/more private seat and the hostess insisted that we wait an additional 5 minutes for the "best seat in the house" which we later learned was the same seat Bill and Melinda Gates frequently request.  We felt very special and taken care of the entire night and everything that we tried was truly the most delicious we've had and I must say that we consider ourselves "foodies".  Absolutely amazing experience although a bit pricey but worth every penny!!

Customer 2842.Name: Rachel
Customer 2842.Content: Excellent food and great service! Our server was fantastic and knew the menu very well. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a great steak restaurant. The price is a bit expensive but it was totally worth it!

Customer 2843.Name: hikinggal
Customer 2843.Content: It had been sometime since we were last at The Metropolitan Grill and overall she has aged well, but things are starting to look a little worn and a facelift would not hurt.  We were going out for a special occasion and had noted that on our reservation. Our server at the end of the meal did ask if we were celebrating something and then did bring us a complimentary dessert, but in the past notes like that had been passed along and somehow the servers made the whole dining experience that much more special.  The atmosphere was also really loud, which could have been because there was a Guns N Roses concert and people were pre-partying before the show.  The food was good, but for the price it just didn't wow us.  The mac & cheese was dry and for Wagu beef I expected something more.  Overall it was more of an average experience, not that special night out we were looking for.

Customer 2845.Name: Tellufoodie
Customer 2845.Content: Absolutely the finest steakhouse of ALL the steakhouses I have been in the US (and that numbers dozens including all the "best"). Their Delmonico is orgasmic. The wait staff is knowledgeable and perfect. It is what I miss most about moving away from Seattle. It exceeded my very high expectations when I booked for a visit for the first time back in years. Yum and thank you for maintaining your top standing in every level.

Customer 2846.Name: enclam
Customer 2846.Content:
Food and service was not very good (raw oysters, chicken wings).  
Move on to another venue for dinner
Waitress did not come by except for bringing the food

Customer 2847.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2847.Content: Always a solid choice for a business lunch. Id recommend making reservations to avoid a wait.

Customer 2848.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2848.Content: The valet wrecked our car when he parked it and we were notified after the dinner and had to figure out what to do late in the evening. Furthermore we have not been able to get in contact with the Valet Manager after the incident. Overall a dissatisfying experience despite great food and service by the waiter.

Customer 2849.Name: PatriciaC
Customer 2849.Content: If you are looking for a great Steak dinner, this is the place to go. However, it is REALLY expensive, more so than other good steak houses in Seattle. Save up!!

Customer 2851.Name: Dano
Customer 2851.Content: One of my all-time favorite restaurants. I've been going here whenever I'm in Seattle over the past 12 years. A very comfortable and friendly and accommodating place. Great food, great wine list, and great service - every time. Plus, you never know who you might see here. Keep up the great work Met Grill.

Customer 2852.Name: Heiko
Customer 2852.Content: Really nice evening.  Thank you very much for the waiter recommend .

Customer 2853.Name: MilanB
Customer 2853.Content:
The Met has the best steak in town, hands down. We've dined at all the big steak houses, El Goucho, Daniels, Ruth Chris, John Howie. We have either had less flavorful steaks, poor service, less value or a combination of those. But through the years, whenever we go to the Met, it has been great across the board.

If somebody wants to know where to go for a steak, we will only recommend the The Met. Their happy is really good when on a budget.

Customer 2854.Name: RobinF
Customer 2854.Content: Excellent Service, Great Food, Staff was cheerful and attentive. Yay!

Customer 2855.Name: KristenP
Customer 2855.Content: Service was incredible! Good was delicious and the Met really made our anniversary celebration special.

Customer 2856.Name: Rachel1
Customer 2856.Content: After all these years still vibrant and quality is the best.

Customer 2857.Name: BryanT
Customer 2857.Content: Another great time at the Grill.  The servers were very knowledgable and the food was excellent.

Customer 2858.Name: MikeR
Customer 2858.Content: The service and menu was excellent. The food was very good. I will go again

Customer 2859.Name: KarenM
Customer 2859.Content: The food, the service, the ambiance, all perfect !

Customer 2860.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2860.Content: Great experience. We did not expect it but waiter knew it was our anniversary. I did write it down on comments but did not think application would list it.

Customer 2861.Name: DaleS
Customer 2861.Content: Best dinner ever!!!! Would go back in a minute.  Everything was perfect!

Customer 2862.Name: kaallwine
Customer 2862.Content: Dissapointed last few times as quality of the meat is not as good as once was and has been warm rather than hot when served.

Customer 2863.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2863.Content: We went for a birthday celebration. The food was outstanding and the service was amazing. We enjoyed our dinner and really appreciated the free birthday creme brûlée!

Customer 2864.Name: MWelch
Customer 2864.Content: No review needed for The Met. It's staple in eloquent dinning.

Customer 2865.Name: HBHB
Customer 2865.Content: A wonderful experience .  I need to mention that the service was outstanding.  We cannot wait to return.

Customer 2866.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2866.Content: Great service… delicious steaks…desserts are fantastic

Customer 2867.Name: yeathome
Customer 2867.Content: An excellent steak house with quality meat superior to the chains. The featured house label Cabernet was delicious. Service amazing. Very pricey and if it were in my home city it would be for special occasions only.

Customer 2868.Name: BridgetB
Customer 2868.Content: Love the Met. Great service in the bar by Diane and Penny. The food is unbeatable. Best spot in town.

Customer 2869.Name: Thegoodlife
Customer 2869.Content: Great location, service and atmosphere, but food was a little blah, especially considering the outrageous prices. Halibut was a very small serving, which was fine because it didn't taste all that good. Steak was fine, but overpriced. The redeeming factors were the bananas foster and great service!

Customer 2870.Name: NathanL
Customer 2870.Content: A great place for steak and seafood.  The waiters and staff are engaging and informative.  Eating there is a fun as eating the food.  One of my favorite all time restaurants.

Customer 2871.Name: PaulS
Customer 2871.Content: My 11 yo carnivore son had a great time.  This has become a family tradition either before or after pickup from sleep away camp.   Expensive but worth the treat.  Dad and Mom thought the wine service was excellent.  See you next year.

Customer 2872.Name: RichL
Customer 2872.Content: Excellent steak, aged perfectly. Best Steak we ever tried in North America!

Customer 2873.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2873.Content: Our experience at The Met was great! We arrived 30 minutes late due to street traffic around the restaurant being closed. We called them to let them know we were going to be late and as soon as we arrived, they were very polite and seated us right away. Food and service was great.

Customer 2874.Name: KatherineK
Customer 2874.Content: Always love the food. Service is on point... Nothing waits on the table once you are done. Food delivery is prompt and accurate!

Customer 2876.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2876.Content: We came looking for the best steak restaurant in Seattle and weren't disappointed. Not only were the steaks fantastic, the sides were exceptional as well.

Customer 2877.Name: MarkH
Customer 2877.Content: Excellent as usual. Service was a bit off, wrong item brought to table, but overall very enjoyable and by far the best steaks in town

Customer 2878.Name: GenevieveO
Customer 2878.Content: I haven't been to The Met for about eight years and my visit didn't disappoint. Whether in the bar waiting for friends to arrive or taking time to enjoy my superbly prepared meal, it was as wonderful as I remember.  Cannot wait for my next trip to Seattle!

Customer 2879.Name: OgilvieR
Customer 2879.Content: Nice spot for the best steaks in Seattle. Well worth a visit. First class service and an excellent wine list.

Customer 2880.Name: Waimeawahine
Customer 2880.Content: Close to train station so we walked there for lunch. It was very busy at lunch time and the food was amazing. Lots of seasonal foods like a grilled peach salad which was delicious. The vodka martini was crisp and refreshing too. Titis vodka rocks!

Customer 2881.Name: ReneraB
