Customer 2881.Content: The service - Michael - was exceptional. The food exquisite. Could not have asked for more!  Really! Have loved this place for many years and it continues to be my favorite restaurant in Seattle proper. I could rave and rave and rave some more........ just go there!

Customer 2882.Name: johnm
Customer 2882.Content: For a place with such a great reputation and unsurpassed decor the food was surprisingly sub-par.

Customer 2883.Name: JoniH
Customer 2883.Content: Be sure to try their hot apple pie for dessert!

Customer 2884.Name: DanM
Customer 2884.Content: Service was exceptional, ambiance was ok, food was satisfactory, portions adequate,  prices were high.

Customer 2885.Name: Lane
Customer 2885.Content: The Met Grill is as fine dining as you will experience on the west or east coast and anywhere in between. The waters are professionals, not the casual 'must have a job' so-called waiters at many restaurants. The furnishings and dining area is old world and classic. Even use the dark green drapes if in a booth for privacy. The food is expertly prepared. Wine list is extensive. The lobster mac is priceless. You will drop some change but well worth it! Five stars.

Customer 2886.Name: LaBluebird
Customer 2886.Content: Japanese "snow' filet was the best steak I have ever eaten.  Service  was also fabulous!

Customer 2887.Name: RosalindQ
Customer 2887.Content: The service level was superb, very thoughtful amd attentive.

Customer 2888.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2888.Content: Our server Michael was amazing. The food was amazing and the ambience was perfect. We sat in the chairmen's room.

Customer 2889.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2889.Content: Food was excellent - traditional American steakhouse fare plus a very good vegetarian entree for my wife. This is one restaurant where we can both get what we want. Service was top notch from the moment we walked in the door and we were well cared for throughout. Ambience was traditional high ceiling early 20th Century elegance. Not hushed, but able to carry on polite conversation.

Customer 2890.Name: ShannonP57
Customer 2890.Content: It was amazing.  All the recommendation the waiter made were fantastic.  We had Salmon, steak, crab cakes (this was a recommendation), and the wedge salad.

Customer 2892.Name: Tilgh4
Customer 2892.Content: Was about 15 years since my last visit to Metropolitian  - it didn't disappoint. The food and service were excellent.  I highly recommend this as a place to visit when in Seattle.

Customer 2893.Name: JoAnnC
Customer 2893.Content: The steaks were extremely fatty and overpriced for the quality of the beef.

Customer 2894.Name: TravisO
Customer 2894.Content: 26th anniversary dinner - New Yorks carved at tableside. Excellent presentation - food was even better!

Customer 2895.Name: CraigJ
Customer 2895.Content: Top notch steak joint, with excellent service, great food, & extensive wine list.

Customer 2896.Name: StephenF
Customer 2896.Content: My husband  ordered  prime rib  and for the second time was very disappointed. His cut had way too much fat and he could not eat most of it.

Customer 2897.Name: rocket
Customer 2897.Content: love that place  the wait staff is fantastic !! Food is fantastic.... they made it very special and I loved the food   ALL GOOD

Customer 2898.Name: AbuSamir
Customer 2898.Content: Great overall experience, food was great (get the American Wagyu).

Customer 2899.Name: ToyC
Customer 2899.Content: Been to many five-star restaurants. $23 for a glass of average wine is way out of the ball park. The rest of the menu prices fit the quality of dining.

Customer 2900.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2900.Content: We had a great time. The food was outstanding. The Lemon drop pear martini was tasty.  Chef Couldn't of cooked a more perfect steak. Fun place to celebrate my birthday. We flew down from Ketchikan just to eat here and it was well worth it. Our server Jim Falls was also great. Very interactive, polite and on top of serving us.  We Will defantley be coming back.

Customer 2901.Name: JohnH
Customer 2901.Content:
Great prime rib and great service. 
Great prime rib and great service. 
Great prime rib and great service.

Customer 2902.Name: TrudyW
Customer 2902.Content: Except for the large family with five kids, including a toddler and a baby at the table next to us, the atmosphere was fine and noise level tolerable.  Todd, our server, and Donny, back waiter (?) were delightful with good recommendations and both were very personable.  They made our dining experience most pleasurable.  Food was excellent as usual.

Customer 2903.Name: GregB
Customer 2903.Content:
The meals at the Met are always OUTSTANDING !'

The best wait staff on the west coast..

Customer 2904.Name: BarbaraF
Customer 2904.Content: The food and the service were excellent.  We had reservations and were seated right away.  The wedge salad was fantastic.  We both had filet and they were cooked to perfection.  The apple pie cooked table side was amazing.

Customer 2905.Name: CindyG
Customer 2905.Content: I love this place.  We were seated half hr before the reservation time.  Service was great & the food was delicious.  Portion sizes are big & shareable.  We got what we paid for & it was worth every penny from drinks, appetizers, & entree.  We had no room for dessert because we devoured the fresh bread & butter that came out before our drinks came out.  Totally worth the fine dining experience.

Customer 2906.Name: ToddF
Customer 2906.Content: Best Restuarant in the state. Hands down! Amazing steaks. Amazing sides. More amazing service!

Customer 2907.Name: MarisolH
Customer 2907.Content: My husband ordered beef and he said it was fantastic! The brussel sprouts  side dish was fabulous! Sadly, I had a veggie dish and it was not that great. A bit bland and the side veggies were undercooked. The restaurant was beautiful, but the bathrooms were dated and not as clean as I would have imagined.

Customer 2908.Name: JoeS
Customer 2908.Content: We spent our 25th wedding anniversary there on 7/13/2016. I forgot our servers name, but he was awesome. Very knowledgeable about all on menu and wines.

Customer 2909.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2909.Content: THE place to take an out-of-town colleague for a business lunch - my colleague was duly impressed!

Customer 2910.Name: Kathleen
Customer 2910.Content: We had a great experience - our server, McKenzie was excellent.  He steered us in the right direction with our food choices - everything was delicious!  Would highly recommend.

Customer 2911.Name: JesseA
Customer 2911.Content:
This place is pretty old school and that's not a bad thing. Oak paneling everywhere and very busy. Waitstaff is dressy and so were we, but many patrons were dressed very casually. Service was helpful but somewhat abrupt. We were not allowed to order our appetizers while we were still thinking about dinner. 

The waiter was funny, and very quick with the cocktails when we ordered, but brought the wrong garnish for me. I asked where the olives were and he was puzzled, so I pointed it out on the menu again and he quickly corrected it. No big deal. The martini was good, but unfortunately the olives were not firm like I hoped. 

The  steaks we ordered and our salads and everything else was quite good. The steaks were larger than other fancy steakhouses charging similar prices so you get a good deal. However given the ambiance (crowded, many casually dressed patrons, loud and busy), we found it to not be worth it in the end. We felt we could have gone to el Gaucho, spent about the same or less and been more blown away with the flavors (albeit with smaller steaks but still a large meal).

I think if they did something about the atmosphere or lowered prices I would be more interested in dining here again. For the money, you can get a better meal somewhere else.

Customer 2912.Name: Angie
Customer 2912.Content: Excellent service, food and wine!! Will visit again on next trip

Customer 2913.Name: Mylabsryellow
Customer 2913.Content: I love the Metropolitan Grill and have been dining there for many years. The food is always great, the staff is awesome and I always enjoy every meal I have there.

Customer 2914.Name: Jack
Customer 2914.Content: Best steak in Seattle. Professional wait staff providing top quality service. Be mindful that portions are big and often can be split. Quality every time. Hard to beat.

Customer 2915.Name: noname
Customer 2915.Content: We enjoyed our overall experience  of this classy restaurant, but we were not happy that our food arrived at the table barely warm, not hot, and the over-priced brussell sprouts were dry and harldy had any bacon on them.  Our steaks, while delicious, were not at all worth the price. We will not spend that much money on steak again. It's a nice place for people who can afford to throw their money away.

Customer 2916.Name: Dennis
Customer 2916.Content: Food was excellent.  Our server was awesome.  Hands down the best steak I've ever had.

Customer 2917.Name: ShawnE
Customer 2917.Content: Great food and service level was exceptional as usual.

Customer 2918.Name: TabithaM
Customer 2918.Content: Great menu choices, service , wine list, plus food was cooked perfectly. The caramel bacon was delish! . Thanks for the dessert, free of charge,  to help celebrate our 24th anniversary.

Customer 2919.Name: purplepansyz
Customer 2919.Content: We went to Metropolitan Grill for our anniversary.  It was wonderful!  Great service, amazing steak.

Customer 2920.Name: WilliamD
Customer 2920.Content: We had the most incredible dining experience at the Metropolitan Grill. The staff was over-the-top smart on the menu. The Sommelier found the perfect bottle of wine for our dinner.

Customer 2921.Name: brettb
Customer 2921.Content: We just wanted the best steak in town and the Met delivers. I made the reservation on open table and when I walked in they had my name on the list and seated us right away. None of the old "wait in the bar while we find you a table. The water was very knowledgeable on the menu. The food, This is the place to come for a great steak. Prime boneless ribeye was just perfect and my wifes filet was so good she couldn't stop eating it. All in all a great dining experience but I expected that because I have been eating here for years.

Customer 2922.Name: WilliamW
Customer 2922.Content: Steak was great, everything as represented. Miss Marla an excellent server with great sense of humor!

Customer 2923.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2923.Content: Metro is consistently our favorite restaurant in Seattle.  They are our favorite steakhouse, period.  Food, service, atmosphere and experience are outstanding and the prices are commensurate.

Customer 2924.Name: Foodies
Customer 2924.Content: The best steaks in Seattle were anything but the best. The steaks were awful. The service was subpar, the restaurant is old school. We expected HOT steaks when served, they were barely warm. The jalapeño scalloped  potatoes were not hot and were definitely not worth $10. We eat at high end restaurants all the time and this was anything but that. The waiter lacked personality and was  slow. The onion rings and kids meals are your best bet here. Not worth our almost $400 bill.

Customer 2925.Name: memorable
Customer 2925.Content: An excellent team- true professionals - thank you  for  the attention  to detail

Customer 2926.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2926.Content: Well, sorry Metropolitan, I think this will be the last time I will be going there. Unfortunately the food was just average.  All of our steaks were undercooked one especially.  For the $400 we spent it just wasn't worth it and I'm sorry to say the atmosphere is drab and dated. Seattle has so many great restaurants and this is just not up to par.

Customer 2927.Name: LongtimeBeverlysFan
Customer 2927.Content: The Met delivers as usual. Been coming here for years with friends and it never disappoints. The prices are certainly steep, but you get what you pay for.

Customer 2929.Name: mike
Customer 2929.Content: Excellent food and service, perhaps a bit overpriced, but still the best in town.

Customer 2930.Name: vladimirs
Customer 2930.Content: one of my favourite restaurants in Seattle. every trip down to this wonderful city i try & include one dinner at the Metropolitan, they have the best steaks in town & wonderful staff. always a wonderful experience.

Customer 2931.Name: Alan
Customer 2931.Content: This was a terrific evening for us.  The food was spectacular - the chateaubriand for two, cooked to perfection and so tender!  What really made the occasion was our server, Jim.  He was knowledgeable, friendly and helped discuss all aspects of our meal.  I cant remember a more complete experience of a night out with superb service, food prepared expertly and ambiance that complimented it all.  Thank heavens for the valet parking!

Customer 2932.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2932.Content: Food was very salty and ambiance seems a bit run down for the price of the food.

Customer 2933.Name: Cacillo
Customer 2933.Content: Impromptu engagement celebration.  Our lunch server went above and beyond, serving us champagne and a molten lava cake - -the latter on him.  Very sweet and memorable.  Thank-you!!

Customer 2934.Name: Tony
Customer 2934.Content: Sirloin steak sandwich was very good: plenty of well prepared medium rare beef on tasty bread. Excellent value. Accompanying fries over cooked.

Customer 2935.Name: AmyJ
Customer 2935.Content: Every time we are in Seattle we come here. The best steaks you'll ever have. Worth the splurge for a special taste. Had the seafood special also which was great. The table side desserts flambé were excellent.

Customer 2936.Name: harki
Customer 2936.Content: Never a bad choice. Always amazing!

Customer 2937.Name: InaV
Customer 2937.Content:
Wonderful atmosphere. Nice cozy booths. The service was outstanding (thanks Todd!) 
We enjoyed everything we tried. The crab cakes were delicious and the steaks and sides as well. We will definitely be back.

Customer 2938.Name: FredK
Customer 2938.Content: The steaks were cook to perfection and the service was excellent, attentive but not pretentious. If you're willing to pay a premium for a "steak place," Metropolitan is a can't miss spot.

Customer 2939.Name: Birthdaydame
Customer 2939.Content: We used the valet parking, right in front of the restaurant which was so convenient.  They added the $10 to our regular bill.  We arrived early because traffic was light.  Our table was not available so we sat in the bar.  It was very cool in there.  My husband ordered a beer but the waitress kindly asked if he wanted to hear what other options they had.  Good thing, he chose a different beer which he really liked.  I had a gin and tonic, it was so, so.  The tonic was a little flat.  When our table was ready, it was a smooth transition to the table.  I did not want a huge steak so the server suggested a 4 oz option - just right for me.  It was the Waygu beef and very tender.  My husband had the Delmonico.  They were so different from each other!  And we were glad to ask the sommelier a suggestion for the wine because we had no idea how different the steaks would be.  We split a salad -which was plenty for both of us.  And had the mushrooms as a side which contained a variety of mushrooms and a great addition.  We were not rushed at all - hence the reason our table was not available when we arrived.  We overall had a great time and glad we went there for the special occasion.

Customer 2940.Name: MarkL
Customer 2940.Content: Been returning since they first opened the doors, what 30 some years ago ? Can't eat like we used to but the experiance is luxurious.

Customer 2941.Name: JulieE
Customer 2941.Content: Wonderful service and great food at the metropolitan grill.  Great spot for a night out in downtown Seattle.

Customer 2942.Name: TylerH
Customer 2942.Content: One of my favorite places to eat in Seattle, for any occasion.

Customer 2943.Name: Tler
Customer 2943.Content: This was not just a fantastic meal it was a Fantastic experience. Our waiter (Bruno) was awesome! The entire staff made sure everything was perfect and glasses were always full. The food was "the best" I've ever had. I just wish it was closer to our hometown so we could enjoy it whenever we wanted.

Customer 2944.Name: NitaEats
Customer 2944.Content: Found the food and service to be among the best we have ever had at a steakhouse.

Customer 2945.Name: Janet
Customer 2945.Content: My office is in the building next door to The Met. We eat there so often we joke it's our offices cafeteria. My team had a visiting Legacy banker in from Boston and we took him over for lunch. I ordered the steak frites, with a side of ranch for the fries, and asked for my steak to be cooked medium-well/well. When our meal came, my steak was more on the rare side then I prefer. I politely asked our waiter to cook the steak a little longer and encouraged my dining companions to start on their halibut. When my steak was returned, it was done so without any comment or apology and no sauce for the fries. Mildly frustrating but not a major concern. I figured I would ask our sever for some sauce when he returned to fill our drinks, but he never did. We didn't see another staff member until a runner came to pre-bus our table and boxed up the remainder of my steak. Our waiter did come back to present the check and that was the last we saw him. I dine there enough to expect the exemplary service I normally receive. Unfortunately for our guest from Boston, this wasn't a stellar first impression.

Customer 2946.Name: AlmaB
Customer 2946.Content: It was nice going to an upscale restaurant, the food was not great, my daughter had a $70 + crab dish which was bland, I had shrimp with fettuccini which was dried and in need of seasoning, my other daughter had a great chicken and mashed potatoe dish and not to mention the strawberry shortcake which was not fully cooked left a sour taste in my mouth, the $258.00  was ridiculous for food that needed seasoning and who messes up a strawberry shortcake? I was told that it was amazing, not mine. This was my graduation dinner and I am sorry but I was not happy.

Customer 2947.Name: HamidM
Customer 2947.Content: Excellent food and service, my group agreed that it was one of the best steak dinner experience in our recollection.

Customer 2948.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2948.Content: Fabulous deconstructed apple pie. Our whole meal revolved around that!

Customer 2949.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2949.Content: I'm very forgiving with my review because I've been to the Met before and had a better experience. They were very busy and 2 of the 3 meals were served cold and service was a little slow. Again, knowing this is not the norm, I will visit again and give another try. This is not an inexpensive restaurant so hopefully next time is a better experience overall.

Customer 2950.Name: Larry
Customer 2950.Content: The service was outstanding........ But I thought the foodwas pretty ordinary.......still would go again

Customer 2951.Name: LakoraA
Customer 2951.Content: This was a really great experience for my and my date. We really enjoyed the food and the service provided. We would definitely dine here again in the future.

Customer 2952.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2952.Content: I had heard great things about this restaurant and was eager to try it. Having moved to Seattle from Chicago, my expectations were high, but reasonable. Unfortunately, my filet mignon was extremely salty. I notified the waiter, and he was extremely understanding and apologized - saying, it happens sometimes, especially when the kitchen is very busy (as it was that night). The service at this restaurant is great. Our waiter was great. I just was served a piece of meat that was over-salted, which, was disappointing since I expected something great from this Seattle "institution."

Customer 2953.Name: Robij
Customer 2953.Content:
Great steak. Great service. Exactly what u expect when u spend good money on a good meal. We really enjoyed our evening there. We all had Porterhouse steaks. Big and easy to share. French Onion soup is some of the best I've ever had. So were the shrimp and crab cocktails. 
They make great drinks too.

Customer 2954.Name: 604E
Customer 2954.Content:
Pros: 
Appetizers are tasty
Easy to find parking around the area
Excellent onion soup and lobster bisque

Cons: 
Steak quality was a bit disappointed
Prime rib was rare while we requested medium rare
Porterhouse was a bit on the cold side

Overall, The Metropolitan Grill was quite enjoyable.

Customer 2955.Name: LissaD
Customer 2955.Content: Our waiter was amazing. He encouraged me to try two new things (including the pear lemon drop) and his recommendations were spot-on!  I must say I had been a little underwhelmed by my go-to meat of filet mignon (hadn't seemed as flavorful) on my last two visits. When I mentioned this to our waiter, he made some great suggestions and I ended up ordering blackened flank steak, which ended up being the table favorite. I'm hooked!  Everything was cooked to perfection.

Customer 2956.Name: PattiK
Customer 2956.Content: The food was great.  However, they messed up my reservation and my guests were seated in another table to 15 minutes before we realized we had both arrived.

Customer 2957.Name: MariaB
Customer 2957.Content: If you're looking for a classy restaurant with just the right atmosphere and delicious food, look no further. I would highly recommend the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 2958.Name: luv2dine
Customer 2958.Content: Food and service was outstanding. I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant, you must try it when you visit Seattle, you won't be disappointed!

Customer 2959.Name: KevinK
Customer 2959.Content: Great food.  They have a little trouble getting the steaks cooked to their specifications.  My medium well filet mignon was redder than my friends medium rare steak.  Happens about half the time there.  I tried to give a little feedback to the waiter (showed him a cut) he seemed upset with me.

Customer 2960.Name: LisaS
Customer 2960.Content: We have been going to the Met since 1983.  Except for maybe some changes to the menu, they have been consistent throughout all those years.  Service  and food is the best around!

Customer 2961.Name: KatieM
Customer 2961.Content:
I remember the food and service being better.  
... still good though, I'll go again!

Customer 2962.Name: MauiGuy
Customer 2962.Content: The food is amazing.  The crab cocktail was the best one I have ever had EVER and the steak was better than Ruth's Chris and Mortan's in both quality and preparation.  Just superb!  At the same time--- some may find the ambiance and vintage atmosphere nice--- I found it dated and uncomfortable.  You can update the booths and tables and still keep the feel of the place.

Customer 2963.Name: PeggyM
Customer 2963.Content: I have been going to the Met Grill for lunch for many years and my last two experiences, six months apart this year, have been disappointing.  Extremely slow service, 20 -30 minute wait for food and cold when it arrives.  Wait staff, while experienced, not interested in making sure we were enjoying our visit.  Never asked if we liked our meal or checked on us until we were done and asked for our check.  It pains me to leave this review and I am hopeful that service and food gets back to the high level that the Met Grill has been known for so many years.  I won't be in a rush to go back.

Customer 2964.Name: MariaR
Customer 2964.Content: We had a lovely time.  It was my granddaughter's 24th birthday dinner and she was treated royally.

Customer 2965.Name: GaryMcK
Customer 2965.Content:
Excellent evening at Met Grill...quality food, service and ambiance. 
I wouldn't expect anything less from one of Seattle's finest restaurants!

Customer 2966.Name: DANAM
Customer 2966.Content:
The food and service were amazing.   The waiter was very knowledgeable of the food and menu and was very attentive.    The steak was tender and flavorful and my husband said his Salmon was good.   We also had a slice of their 9 layer chocolate cake for dessert, it was very good, and I highly recommend it!!
However, the food and beverages are pretty pricey.   Plan on spending over $125 for a dinner for 2 people, if you go.   And that is just for the main courses, not for the drinks or tip, so just be prepared.
Wonderful overall experience, though!!

Customer 2967.Name: Americandiner
Customer 2967.Content: There is a nice atmosphere here and the steaks were ok but not outstanding if being honest hence the low score on value for money. It is in a good location from a number of  hotels in the area.

Customer 2968.Name: JayG
Customer 2968.Content: Once again, the Met has out performed its self. What a great night with wonderful food and the Best service - thank you Jim!

Customer 2969.Name: skiracquet
Customer 2969.Content:
Five of us dined... It was a celebration dinner so we didn't give real time feed back.  Steaks for two of us were over cooked, and the desserts were luke warm instead of molten.  Salads were very good. Service was attentive and chatty.

Overall: not quite up to expectations

Customer 2970.Name: Maria
Customer 2970.Content: It serves beef I had not eaten before. I was going to order the filet minon & our waiter explained the crossover of a waghu filet with American beef. It was great. The creme brûlée best ever had

Customer 2971.Name: JessicaG
Customer 2971.Content: Always love the food, drinks and service at the Met. It's always on point and they go above and beyond to be sure that you have what you need. We come here a few times a year for a date or special occasion and will be back for sure. Michael had been the best waiter by far we will request him everytime in the future

Customer 2972.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2972.Content: It's a nice venue, good service and nice ambience. However, the calamari and wild mushrooms dishes we ordered were overcooked and cause them both to lack flavors. The steaks however were great and so was the service. We might go back but it won't be our immediate first choice.

Customer 2973.Name: UltimateFlew
Customer 2973.Content:
We chose the Metropolitan Grill to celebrate our five year anniversary because of its long-standing reputation as an excellent restaurant with superb service and amazing food. We were not disappointed.  After a brief wait, we were ushered to a nice table and greeted very quickly with water and drink orders.  
Our server, Sean, was the height of courtesy and professionalism. We had a slight accident, spilling one of our drinks, and without hesitation he helped us procure another [in a less top-heavy highball glass ;-)]  His recommendation of the ribeye was spot on, all the food just SO good; and our evening was crowned by his bringing a burnt cream with a lit candle to illuminate our celebration.
Certainly we cannot afford a $300 evening very often, so we will not make decisions where to go lightly.  For the best selection of the best steaks, for exemplary service and for a room in which to make more happy memories -- select The Met.

Customer 2974.Name: luvtoeat
Customer 2974.Content: As usual we had a great meal.  Thanks to Craig Summers it is always welcoming at the Metropolitan.  Bruno our server was great so it lead to a perfect evening.

Customer 2975.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2975.Content: We had dinner for 7 to celebrate a UW graduation.  Marla took extraordinary care of us as did the rest of the staff.  As is always the case at Met Grill, the food was amazing.  Even when we had one order of prime rib that was overcooked - it was quickly and gladly replaced with one cooked just right.  There just is no place in Seattle that has a better ambiance coupled with amazing food.  The steaks always melt in your mouth with perfection.  The sides compliment the main courses perfectly in taste and appearance.   The deserts are simply phenomenal.  This is our favorite place to go to in Seattle whether for a romantic meal for 2, for special occasions, or to get ready for a Seahawks game!!!

Customer 2976.Name: leons
Customer 2976.Content: Don't order the bacon wrapped filet with Oscar topping.  The bacon was all fat and the filets were not good quality.  The sides were very good.

Customer 2977.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2977.Content: The food and service were both five star experiences.

Customer 2979.Name: Mshbnyehud
Customer 2979.Content:
I don't splurge for dinner often, and haven't been to the Met in quite some time because of their high prices.  But if you are prepared to split their generous portions, you can mitigate much of the hefty prices.  As a foodie experience, you can't do much better.  We loved the wedge salad which is enormous, but a perfect split.  We adored the house rib-eye steak, again split (for $6 extra but that includes two substantial sides per person), and we were treated to a special occasion dessert which was delightful (creme brulee).

The drinks are expensive but again, the portions are generous.  All told, including tax, tip, food, drinks and coffee (plus valet), even splitting all of the portions, it still ended up costing $100 per person.  That's why you save it for a special occasion.

Customer 2980.Name: KathyL
Customer 2980.Content: We found the Metropolitan Grill in a travel magazine and decided to try it while in Seattle.  The food was quite good and while not inexpensive we thought it was reasonably priced for the quality and serving sizes.  What we were most impressed with though was the staff.  Everyone we encountered was friendly, engaging and attentive.  The service was impeccable!  Our waiter, Chad answered our questions, offered suggestions and was otherwise quite entertaining.  He made our dining experience enjoyable.  His manager, Jason spent considerable time at our table talking about baseball stadiums (the reason for our visit to Seattle) and also provided us a list of his top 5 things to do while in town from a local's perspective with insider tips on when to make those visits.  If appreciate good food and great service in a nice atmosphere without the stuffiness of some restaurants, you'll enjoy an evening at the Metropolitan Grill!

Customer 2981.Name: Danasnacks
Customer 2981.Content: The Met has the best steak in town and their service is top notch. From the time we entered the restaurant we were taken care of with top notch service. Both my wife and I had the prime filet and it was cooked to perfection. Thank you to the staff of the Met for making our anniversary one to remember.

Customer 2982.Name: eaterbun
Customer 2982.Content: My husband and I went on a date here and were thrilled with the menu and service. We will return!

Customer 2983.Name: MPR6288
Customer 2983.Content: Great children's menu, good steak, mediocre dessert. Service was great at first and got worse as the night ended.

Customer 2984.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2984.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with this place. We split a $120 meal for two so it was only $60 each for a large amount of food. Best steak I've ever found while eating out! I honestly had a dream about this meal the other night. haha

Customer 2985.Name: JimL
Customer 2985.Content:
Although the food was very good, the staff  was attentive and very personable, which made the dinner complete.

Jim/Terri

Customer 2986.Name: Like2Dine
Customer 2986.Content: Exceptional staff, very helpful and experienced and amazing food made for a memorable evening! !

Customer 2987.Name: AlexisR
Customer 2987.Content: My sister-in-law and I met for lunch and had a wonderful time. The food was, as always, fantastic!

Customer 2988.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 2988.Content: Awesome steak, yummy cocktails and extensive (if expensive) wine. Oak panelled bliss.

Customer 2989.Name: heyray
Customer 2989.Content: The food and service were outstanding ... and so was the price.  We are no strangers to fine dining.  For steakhouses, we typically eat at The Capitol Grill (a chain, but none the less, a good one).  But since The Met was highly recommended on TripAdvisor and OpenTable, we thought we'd give it a try.  The ambiance is far better at the CG, the service is comparable, and the food is substantially better.   So, yes, it was better than the CG but it was twice the price.  $450 for party of four, no alcohol.

Customer 2991.Name: Lisa
Customer 2991.Content: We went to Metropolitan grill for a great steak.  Not only did they give of wonderful steaks but all the appetizers (Lobster Bisque and Shrimp Cocktail) and sides (creamed spinach and grilled mushrooms) were so delicious.  But the most impressive part of our meal was the staff.  They were professional, courteous and entertaining.  They made the night very special for us.  Be sure to arrive hungry!!!

Customer 2992.Name: fromstarwithlove
Customer 2992.Content: My filet mignon was cooked to perfection.   The mushrooms were good, but we may have to try the lobster mac and cheese next time!

Customer 2993.Name: DANF
Customer 2993.Content: Simply the best happy hour in downtown Seattle.

Customer 2995.Name: JenniferC
Customer 2995.Content: I usually like the Met quite a bit. Steaks are great, and the service is usually outstanding. Curious about what the "wild mushrooms" side dish included, I asked the waiter. He said "oysters, porcini, shitake" so we ordered it. When it came, it was half crimini, a few shitakes, chanterelles, and enokitakes. I didn't know what the enokitakes were, so I asked. He told me oysters. I disagreed, so he took a sample back to the kitchen, and came back saying 3 people in the kitchen also identified them as oysters. I am a forager, and know how to positively identify oysters. I got a half-hearted apology and eventually the floor manager came out with a print out identifying them as enokitakes, and explained that the mix of "wild mushrooms" changes all the time. I would expect the wait staff to know that, especially their Friday-night staff. Instead of saying that, he made up some ingredients. Also, if the kitchen staff can't ID the mushroom they handle, that is also concerning to me. And to top it off, they didn't even take the mushrooms off our bill. So this establishment lost quite a bit of luster in my eyes over this visit.

Customer 2996.Name: surfnsnowgirl
Customer 2996.Content: Our waiter was amazing and the service was perfect! We had a bacon wrapped tenderloin skewer for starters and it was wonderful! My husband had the blackened prime rib and I had the petite filet. His was so good and mine was a little tough but still good flavor. Our sides were great as well. Our waiter made our night super fun and special! We really loved our experience!

Customer 2997.Name: JudyD
Customer 2997.Content: Lovely and great ambience. been in business for a long time.  Outstanding service like you used to have!  Steaks super.   And everything a la carte.  Comfortable booths, cozy and private.  a real treat

Customer 2998.Name: MarkE
Customer 2998.Content:
My wife and I put the Met in a special category for restaurants.  My 1st time at the Met was for my prom.  The next few occasions were to celebrate my wedding Anniversary with my wife.  Recently we celebrated our 10th anniversary and had another great evening.  Our steaks were amazing and we ate them up like we hadn't eaten in days.  Combo'd with great service (informative and not pushy) and good ambiance, our special night out was a success.

When we want to have an amazing steak with a world class Seattle dining experience we know that we can get that at the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 2999.Name: LindaW
Customer 2999.Content: We were on a vacation and returned to our favorite Seattle restaurant. Besides the food bring exceptional (crab cakes and steaks), our waiter was just as exceptional. Ask for Todd. He took great care of us and added much to the dining experience. He made certain our steaks were done to perfection! He was personable, attentive and made great menu suggestions.

Customer 3000.Name: JimG
Customer 3000.Content: I had guest in from Chicago on business and they wanted to go a "Seattle Institution." I knew the Metropolitan Grill has been around for a long time so I chose it. The food was excellent - we all had steaks, but the Met is very expensive. Great food but high prices. Would recommend as long as you're not paying :)

Customer 3001.Name: lovebistrodining
Customer 3001.Content: A colleague recommended and I wasn't disappointed. Fabulous food and excellent service. Would definitely go back again when back in town.

Customer 3002.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3002.Content:
We chose this restaurant by looking online. It was booked as Seattle's best steakhouse. We found it to have the kind of service you expect in an expensive restaurant 
I found the wine prices to be "way" over the top but the selection was truly amazing. The wine book must have had 50 - 100 pages!!
We had a great evening.

Customer 3003.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3003.Content: The entire experience was amazing! Would absolutely do it again!

Customer 3004.Name: KarinJ
Customer 3004.Content: The beef is absolutely amazing! Worth the expense to splurge for a very special occasion.

Customer 3005.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3005.Content: McKenzie our waiter was outstanding. He took care of us!

Customer 3006.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3006.Content: This place was amazing. We arrived more than an hour early coming from far away and decided to ask just in case they could squeeze us in. if not we'd have walked around or sat at the bar. within 5 minutes we were seated at a table designed for 4 people and it was just 2 of us. I saw people dressed in everything from shorts and a T-shirt to a suit and tie which made it a very comfortable environment. extremely friendly staff everywhere and people not assigned to our area clearing plates/glasses just because they walked by. Our server was hilarious and made an off-menu recommendation that shocked me but was so thankful he did. steak and seafood were perfect. scallops amazing. Oscar style and bacon wrapped filets truly unbelievable. mashed potatoes were edible but if you're going there for anything other than fine steak you're already wrong to begin with. valet was nice and efficient. a little loud of an environment for a $400 dinner but still worth every penny. i'll never forget it and will go back.

Customer 3007.Name: ssflash
Customer 3007.Content:
Very expensive but very good!
Had to wait 20 minutes even with reservation!

Customer 3008.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3008.Content: It was a very busy night but  our waiter could have been a little more friendly.  Our friend ordered her steak medium and it was almost raw in the center.  The waiter claimed that their medium is warm red center.  He should have told her that when she ordered and again, the inside was all red, almost raw.  We didn't have time to sent it back.  I liked my appetizers (the scallops and crab cakes but was underwhelmed by the Steak Salad which I usually love.  I think I was just in too much of a rush to enjoy it and was not happy with the service and my friend's steak.  Usually I like the Met but this time it was an epic fail.  Lesson learned  - don't go on a busy night when you have a time limit.

Customer 3009.Name: Mylabsryellow
Customer 3009.Content: Dinner with friends before the Billy Joel concert.  Everyone was great in making sure we had a great meal, a great experience and made it to the concert on time.

Customer 3010.Name: Russo
Customer 3010.Content: Absolutely THE BEST evening ever!  The steaks were out out of this world delicious. I never knew one could take a steak to this level. Wine selection was outstanding and service was impressive. We travel the world and we will definitely be back.

Customer 3011.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3011.Content: The food was quite expensive for being just "okay." The steak was NOT the best or most flavorful in town, which was their claim, and was medium rare when I ordered rare.

Customer 3012.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3012.Content: The Met has a long reputation of being a high quality place to eat and it is true. My son recently had a major professional accomplishment and wanted to go somewhere for a great steak and excellent wine. Our waiter immediately picked up on the celebration and made the evening very enjoyable. I totally recommend the aged rib eye. it was well prepared and very tasty. The drinks were well received by all and in conjunction with great food and service, it made for an excellent evening.

Customer 3013.Name: TaraC
Customer 3013.Content: Wine selection is excellent, food is delicious!

Customer 3014.Name: Lobstahboy
Customer 3014.Content: Been here many times. Never had a bad meal. Service is always top notch. Love the Met. Happy hour is awesome too.

Customer 3015.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3015.Content: Went for my boyfriends birthday. They pulled out all the stops. The service was spectacular and the food was the best I have ever had. Perfect steak, lobster mac was off the charts. It was all perfection. Nothing less.

Customer 3016.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3016.Content: Everything from the valet service to the atmosphere is outstanding not to mention the quality and freshness of the food. It is the staff and service is what brings the whole experience together. My wife and I dine there at least twice a month and bring all friends and family there when they visit. To all the staff at the Metroploitan Grill "Thank you for all you do!"

Customer 3017.Name: Customer
Customer 3017.Content: We really enjoyed our experience at this old-school steakhouse. If you're looking for trendy, this is not your place, but if you appreciate a fine steak and outstanding service, you won't be disappointed. The ambiance reminded me of a Mad Men episode, it's the kind of place Don Draper and Roger Sterling would have taken a valued client.  The only thing missing were the postprandial cigars.  We tried the Hokkaido filet and it was superb, well worth the extra $$$.

Customer 3018.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3018.Content: I do not write reviews ...I do not write reviews...I do not write reviews....

Customer 3019.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3019.Content:
This is my 5th time to Seattle and eating at the Metropolitan Grill.  This is one of the best steak houses in the U.S.  and it never disappoints. I took a friend who has lived in Seattle for 6 years and has never eaten at the restaurant.  She was blown away by the service and quality of the steaks.  I will be back again.

Thanks 
Matt

Customer 3020.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3020.Content: We had a great experience treating our boss to lunch at this dining venue.

Customer 3021.Name: Ranger
Customer 3021.Content: We went to the Met Grill as it is always good, wonderful steaks, strong service, and a fine atmosphere.   On the high side, the steaks were cooked as requested and were extremely good.  The side dishes of potatoes, asparagus, and Brussel sprouts were very good.  The desserts of Bananas Foster, carrot cake, and crème brule were not only entertaining but tasty.  The service was good but a bit inconsistent.  Upon arrival, our table was not ready.  We were told in a few minutes, and a few became almost 20.  They put us in a private room which was nice.  Our waiter was helpful, and pleasant but at times he disappeared and no other help was visible.  It would have been nice to have him or someone else check on the room more often.  Overall, a very good experience!

Customer 3022.Name: BernardM
Customer 3022.Content: My wife and I have been going to the Met for many years and decided to go there for Mother's Day. This time we were both a little disappointed. The food was good as usual but was served warm, not hot, as if it had been sitting around for awhile. The restaurant wasn't full, so I don't know why the food wasn't hot.

Customer 3023.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3023.Content: The only dish we all enjoyed was, surprisingly, the creamed corn on special. Other than that, most of our entrees and apps were cold, lacking flavor and/or undercooked. We won't be coming back. There are so many delicious dining options in Seattle at the same price point as The Met. This restaurant is not worth the money.

Customer 3024.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3024.Content:
Metropolitan "ole time" ambiance with the old time elegant service.
We had an amazing dinner of shared crab/lobster cakes and the fantastic
lamb chops carved table side....the bread pudding was  so huge...we had
a difficult time finishing it!  We loved dinner so much we went back for
lunch the next day!  The size of the carrot cake/ice cream was such that
we weren't able to finish it! There are many  fantastic restaurants in Seattle, but don't miss Metropolitan._

Customer 3025.Name: LindaT
Customer 3025.Content: Celebrated Mom's Day here. Service was exceptional, and the food was outstanding. We had the New York, which was perfect, along with Caesar salad and bread. I highly recommend this restaurant. And yes, we will go back!

Customer 3026.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3026.Content:
I've been to the Met for lunch and dinner numerous time and always had a great experience. Unfortunately, today's lunch did not meet the basic expectations one would receive from a basic sit down diner. 

For an iconic Seattle steak restaurant how can you not have a basic baked potato with a steak if a customer requests it for lunch or dinner?  We were told by the manager that it takes 1.5 hrs to bake a potato and that was not part of the menu. I've had lunch at the Met and have had a bake potato in the past. Why was this not on the menu for Mothers Day?  

 The manager today was really disappointing. Took him over 20 minutes to come to our table when we requested to speak with him when so many things were going wrong with the experience. We asked the waiter and other staff where he was and they all rolled their eyes and said he was in his "office". When he came out instead of taking responsibility all he had were excuses after excuses. That to me is unacceptable and not good customer service. Now I understand why the restaurant was half empty when most 4 to 5 star restaurants are booked solid on Mothers Day. 

I don't think I will ever recommend or dine at the Met ever again. Instead of having a great Mothers Day lunch we left with our heads shaking and wondering what happened to this once great Seattle steak house.

Customer 3027.Name: bangbang
Customer 3027.Content: This was a sad dining experience for me. We were seated in an uncomfortable booth in a back corner. The last time I came (1999) we had linen service and a window view. I had a view of 3 Italian businessmen gorging themselves on meat. My husband recounted many similar work experiences. My fish was way too salty. My salad was heavy on cheese. My husband's meat and potatoes were fine. The best thing was my side of asparagus. The wine was fine. Nothing special. Just quaffable--and we tried 4 different options there. The house rolls were uninspired. I never want to come back.

Customer 3028.Name: wustlbear
Customer 3028.Content: My girlfriend and I went while visiting Seattle for the weekend. Our apps and salads were fantastic and the sides were great. We weren't wowed by the steak, mostly because it was barely warm when we got it. We sent it back to be reheated, but generally it didn't turn out well. We didn't complain, but Craig, the maitre d', completely resolved this for us without us even asking. Clearly this was uncommon for them. Rare to find this level of service and we were extremely grateful. They go above and beyond to make sure you leave happy.

Customer 3029.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3029.Content: Your restaurant was recommended by a good friend who did not know it would be a night for a proposal.  Service was amazing.  One of the servers captured our special moment with pictures and shortly after we were served champagne.  Outstanding!!!  If you are asking about value, I asked my new  fiance about the value and she said "well, I got a husband out of the deal"

Customer 3030.Name: M2RMukilteo
Customer 3030.Content: Excellent quality in food and service.  Pricey, but worth the extra cost for special occasion.  I'm a meat and potatoes gal and have to say this is by far my favorite place to go for a cut of beef.  High quality cuts flavored and cooked to perfection.

Customer 3031.Name: boone
Customer 3031.Content: Service was wonderful and the steaks are some of the best in town. Skip the brussel sprouts.

Customer 3033.Name: Cathy
Customer 3033.Content: A typical steakhouse, dark with large velveteen seats and heavy wood tables. Curtains keep your table intimate. Big steaks,for the hearty eater. Attentive wait staff.

Customer 3034.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3034.Content: We found both the food and the service to be impeccable. I love a good  steak and I would have to say this steak ranks as one of the best I have ever tasted! We are definitely going back next time we visit Seattle.

Customer 3035.Name: Steven
Customer 3035.Content: We last had dinner at the grill 13 years ago. Wonderful time! My only complaint was they no longer offered 1900 Madiera that the used to offer by the glass (yes, 116 year old). Everything else was spectacular.

Customer 3036.Name: Hapuna0208
Customer 3036.Content: Classic Seattle dining place. Generous serving sizes-- the pork chops can feed two! The Valet parking for $10 made our drive into the city stress-free. They even put our to-go bags in the car while we walked around town after dinner.

Customer 3037.Name: Luncher
Customer 3037.Content: The Met is always a great place for a great steak, I had the smaller New York steak which was PLENTY since it came with a huge baked potato, I also has a delicious lobster bisque and a side of wild mushrooms, which meant I was stuffed and there was no room for desert.  Valet parking was easy, the servers were always professional and courteous.

Customer 3038.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3038.Content: The food was amazing, but the service was better. My husband and I went for a date night while in Seattle we could not have been happier. We had oysters for an appetizer, great wine, and shared the long bone BEST STEAK EVER! Presentation was great. Such a fun night!!!

Customer 3039.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3039.Content: From the moment you walk in, to the moment you leave - the service here was amazing! We went here for my husbands birthday celebration. The staff were friendly and helpful and the food was perfect! They even brought out a birthday dessert. The lighting and ambiance is romantic and sweet. I would highly recommend this place. It's pricey but very much worth it for special occasions.

Customer 3040.Name: JPM67
Customer 3040.Content: If you like a great steakhouse, this is a bucket list kind of place.

Customer 3041.Name: ABET
Customer 3041.Content: I'll make this short and sweet--if you can swing the exorbitant prices for a special occasion (or if you're just rich), this will be among the best steak you will probably ever find, Seattle or elsewhere. The service was great and the food was exquisite (except for my fiance's broccoli--that was a little under-cooked). No complaints other than that. Definitely put this place on your bucket list.

Customer 3042.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3042.Content: Spendy. But the steak was one of the best I've ever had (13oz filet). Great service too. The free desert for our 25th anniversary was a nice touch too.

Customer 3043.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3043.Content: Great restaurant; service was perfect; food was delicious.  The only issue was the booth we were in was a little tight - I like a bit more room between me and the table. Overall, very satisfied.

Customer 3044.Name: Cass
Customer 3044.Content: Love theMetropolitan for a great steak, good wine list and excellent service.  But a little too pricey to go to more than once every couple years.  $70 for a steak is not really affordable for most people, including us.  If you can swing it, splurge.

Customer 3045.Name: Brian
Customer 3045.Content: Best service and steak place in the USA

Customer 3046.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3046.Content: Came here for our anniversary after several recommendations, we weren't disappointed! Everything from service, to food taste, drink and wine selection etc was perfect. Our waiter even noted it was a special occasion and surprised us with a dessert.

Customer 3047.Name: Bohall
Customer 3047.Content: Our waiter seemed bent on making sure we had the best food, the best time, and the best service possible.   The 64 page wine list spanned from good and affordable to good and way out of my price range.  Totally fun to review.  The creamed spinach is a must have, especially if you order the steak, which you should, because its their thing, but there are other options if it isn't yours. A very special place for a special occasion and good people watching too.

Customer 3048.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3048.Content: Outstanding cuts of steak, cooked to perfection. Wonderful appetizers and side dishes, dessert. Appreciated the considerate wait person who was pleasant throughout the evening and checked on us when the food was a little slow from kitchen to table.

Customer 3049.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3049.Content:
I had the American Wagyu filet mignon, medium rare. It came out perfectly prepared. Service was top notch. Drinks were stiff. My kind of dining experience. A+

Oh and  the carrot cake is awesome!

Customer 3052.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3052.Content: My Ohmi steak was prepared flawlessly.

Customer 3053.Name: KathleenM
Customer 3053.Content:
This restaurant was our go to place for special occasions when I lived in Seattle.  I was visiting my son and took him to celebrate his new job.  I made a reservation almost 1 month in advance.  1)The first table we were given was right on top of people seated in the bar area.  We asked fro a new table
2)  Our main course was served before we finished our salad- talk about feeling rushed.
3)  I ordered my steak medium, it was under cooked
4) After waiting for our waiter to return so I could send it back, I finally tracked down another waiter for help
5) Steak was cooked more and when it was returned, it was too well done.
6) My potato was lukewarm and the cheese sauce was lukewarm and very bland.

$160+ later- I was extremely disappointed with the entire experience.  To add insult to injury, I call the restaurant the next day to complain. The receptionist said manager was busy  but she  would connect me with her voicemail.  i received a recording asking me to spell the person's alst name which I did not know.  I had to hang up and call back again.  I  left a message directly with the receptionist for the manager and was told I would receive a return call.  That was 2 days ago and I have never been contacted.

There is no comparison to how this restaurant used to be. There are sooooo many other choices for restaurants and I am very frustrated that I wasted a celebration and special evening with my son at this restaurant.

Customer 3054.Name: KennyL
Customer 3054.Content: The best steaks in North America.  I travel all over the US and Canada and there are some great steakhouse I've eaten at, but Metropolitan is the best.  The bone-in filet is absolutely incredible.  The lobster mac-n-cheese is a perfect side dish for the steak.  Follow that up with the hot apple pie dessert made right at your table.  The service is  Fantastic!  I have eaten there 6 times and each time has be great.  The combination of great food and top notch service is the reason I eat at Metropolitan Grill every time in Seattle.

Customer 3055.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3055.Content: All I can say is that the food, service, and experience was AMAZING!!!! Wouldn't have ended my Seattle trip any better. Will definitely be going back on my next trip to Seattle.

Customer 3056.Name: CarlP
Customer 3056.Content: Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable about the different steaks.

Customer 3057.Name: dslesq
Customer 3057.Content: The quality of the food was exceeded only by the quality of the service.

Customer 3058.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3058.Content: Overall, great experience. Chateubriande was a delight, and properly cooked to temperature (rare). Prawns were good, but nothing to be excited over. Drink selection was composed of the classics. Waitress was knowledgeable and timely. If you have a tighter wallet, be aware of the pricing before you dine. I did find it was rather loud when I sat down at 8pm on a Friday, and that's due to a high volume of guests.

Customer 3059.Name: DavidM
Customer 3059.Content: I've never had a "steak flight" before! What great fun to taste the different types all on one plate. No spoiler here. Find out which one you like best!

Customer 3060.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3060.Content: They had trouble getting my wife's steak to the right temperature, but they were very accommodating and provided desserts for us.  The burnt creme tasted to much like egg and not enough vanilla.  Luckily not my first time and I will be back.  Service as always was perfect.

Customer 3061.Name: Happynyc
Customer 3061.Content: Staff are friendly and welcoming. The food is out of this world. I ordered the prime filet and creamed spinach. It was delicious, can't go wrong. I highly recommend it and definitely will go back.

Customer 3062.Name: Sevenson
Customer 3062.Content: I have to say that my expectations for the steak were not met.  Quite price for the quality of the food.  While my steak was OK, my friend was half well done and half medium.  Compared to other steak houses such as Ruth's Chris or Mastros the quality is just not there.

Customer 3063.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3063.Content: The apple flambé dessert was a perfect finish to the delicious steak dinner.

Customer 3064.Name: RyanA
Customer 3064.Content:
1st time here.
Great food and staff was great . started with good Moscow mules  and finished dinner with a solid cab sav from wallawalla

Customer 3065.Name: gladwewent
Customer 3065.Content: Very pricey but the whole experience was awesome and worth every dollar. The service, staff and food were excellent and I will be returning the next time in the city.

Customer 3066.Name: KennethD
Customer 3066.Content: Metropolitan Grill is an old school steak house. That doesn't mean "fuddy duddy", it means classic. The kinda place you almost expect Sinatra and friends to walk in the door. The service was impeccable, the food Selection diverse & great, the wine list extensive. We were there for my wife's birthday. I'd mentioned it in the reservation and they comp'ed her dessert. We plan to return

Customer 3067.Name: Macker
Customer 3067.Content: A lovely birthday dinner for my wife and myself, and everything was perfect as usual!

Customer 3068.Name: Noble
Customer 3068.Content: We were seated promptly .  The wait staff was excellent , anticipating our needs.  Our steaks were grilled to perfection.  The  French Onion soup is the best we have eaten.  Overall an outstanding evening.

Customer 3069.Name: RichardS
Customer 3069.Content: This restaurant never disappoints. The food, service and ambiance are always the best. It's not economical, but you surely get  the quality you pay for!

Customer 3070.Name: DonnaT
Customer 3070.Content: My husband and I wanted to come to the Metropolitan Grill because we had heard good things BUT sadly we were disappointed!  The food was good but not amazing, like I had heard it was.  We had so much anticipation of having this amazing dining experience, but upon being seated we had to wait awhile for our waiter to introduce himself to us and then once he took our drink order, he vanished for what seemed to be a long time for just a water and a mixed drink.  We didn't order an appetizer but did order a soup and salad and there again it seemed like a long time for that to arrive.  Our main course finally arrived, and while it was tasty, we sadly found flaws...I ordered the small filet mignon (med well) and my spouse order the cajun prime rib (med rare).  My filet was blood red in the middle and his was barely pink!! We were disappointed but left a nice tip because our waiter was trying hard, but spent more time telling stories, trying to please us I guess.  We came here as a special occasion, we live in Poulsbo and rarely make it to the city, and thought that the Met Grill would be the place to go for such an occasion.  I'm sorry to say that we were disappointed...we had hoped for so much more!!

Customer 3071.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3071.Content:
We have visited here for dinner with great reputation. It was totally true.
We were 100% satisfied with this restaurant.
Fillet Mignon was awesome and wine was just right.
Waiter treated with  excellent service.

Customer 3072.Name: Repeatcustomer
Customer 3072.Content: We came to the Metropolitan Grill years ago so I was excited to go again while on vacation.  I had the 8 oz filet .  It was good but nothing special .  Our waitress told us that their medium-well is like everybody else's medium.  Why not just cook it medium? The service was great but the Grill is way overpriced . For the four of us, with tip, the bill was just about 400.  I'm not sure what to say. Good but not great. Good carrot cake.  Not too sweet

Customer 3073.Name: Bandit124
Customer 3073.Content: The evening at The Metropolitan Grill was an exquisite experience.  It is fundamentally a steakhouse.  Every steak was perfection.  But so was everything else - the drinks at the bar, the wine, the accompaniments, the deserts.  But the most perfect aspect was the service.  Attentiveness to the point of pampering without being intrusive.  And the willingness to make recommendations by everyone we interacted with - the cocktail server, the dining room server, the sommelier - was highly valued, and appreciated for its uncommonness.  Could not give a stronger endorsement to The Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 3074.Name: AdSmith
Customer 3074.Content: This place was the best meal in Seattle for me. While I thought the decor was lame and dated, old school/old lady fancy, the service, food and options were top notch! I'd go back in a hot second and this was the best seafood I think I've had outside of Maine. BRAVO!!!

Customer 3075.Name: Skyhawk73
Customer 3075.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our 10th Anniversary and were first time visitors at the Metropolitan Grill. We were looking forward to a spectacular experience which ended up being mediocre at best. The service was extremely slow and food missed the mark. The Rib Eye I ordered as Medium well was well done and the food took forever to arrive. The side order of mushrooms was bland, devoid of any seasoning. Not an experience I was hoping for on a very special occasion for my wife and I. I have had much better service and food at John Howie's Steak House.

Customer 3076.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3076.Content: Everything about the MET was memorable - food perfectly prepared, service impeccable, and atmosphere private enough but not too quiet.  Love the decor.  Would like to know how to get our photo on the wall.

Customer 3078.Name: MoSha
Customer 3078.Content: Excellent service and food! Attentive and knowledgeable staff. We celebrated a birthday here and had a very enjoyable evening. Barely could roll out of there!

Customer 3079.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3079.Content: The steaks are always amazing here. The service is excellent, very attentive and engaging. This is one of our favourite steak place in Seattle.

Customer 3081.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3081.Content: Service was excellent! Wendy and Kevin took such great care of me and even took time to make me a list of things to do while visiting Seattle.

Customer 3082.Name: Skipper
Customer 3082.Content: The service was outstanding, especially since our server was working an entire section that included a table of over 15 people and every other table in the section was seated at about the same time as we were.  We were impressed that we had a fully attentive and pleasant (almost joyful - thank you Mara) service experience despite her workload! If you want beef, this is a good restaurant to come to; I don't know that it's the best beef or steak in Seattle, but our steaks were tasty and cooked to order. It was interesting to note that the majority of patrons in this large restaurant were men; we were there mid-week celebrating our anniversary, so maybe we caught an afterwork crowd. The french onion soup was "okay," a lot of bread under the cheese in the broth fairly overwhelmed the soup. The claim chowder was also "okay" not superior, but fine for a starter dish. Overall, this is a well established restaurant with a penchant for beef and excellent service.

Customer 3083.Name: Vici
Customer 3083.Content: As always, excellent food.  Service was a little slow, but friendly.

Customer 3084.Name: George
Customer 3084.Content: I have been to steak houses all over the country and this is by far the best one. The steak was perfect and service was exceptional. Their wine recommendations were just as flawless.

Customer 3085.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3085.Content: Our server went above and beyond to make our dining experience special

Customer 3086.Name: LisaW
Customer 3086.Content:
I love Metropolitan Grill and we visit several times a year. It's our go-to special occasion/celebration restaurant. On this visit, though, I was extremely disappointed in the changes to the recipe for one of their classic cocktails, the Smoky Met Martini. I don't drink a lot of cocktails that aren't sweet, but the Smoky Met Martini has always been one of my faves, Ketel One Vodka with a splash of scotch and an orange twist, ideally shaken and poured tableside. Well, the shaken/poured tableside part has fallen by the wayside, and I can live with that, but the recent change to the recipe is another story. I checked the menu before ordering and was surprised to find that the Smoky Met Martini is now a completely different cocktail, with the change to Laphroaig single malt scotch and smoked olives!!? How does this cocktail still have the same name?

Having faith in the Met (and never having tasted Laphroaig), I ordered the new Smoky Met, requesting the substitution of an orange twist for the olives. Oh, aarrggghhh! It's completely different. Instead of the smoky-sweet hint of scotch at the back of the vodka, accented by the tang of orange from the twist, the new Smoky Met slammed my nose and mouth with a blast of formaldehyde and old socks. The twist was lost in the onslaught, buried under Laphroaig funk.  Okay, I admit I haven't found a single malt I'm really wild about, but Laphraoig is so not it. I drank it, partly because it's freakin' expensive and partly because I hoped I'd acclimate to the taste. No such luck. 

I won't say the change in the cocktail ruined the (otherwise great) meal for me, but I'd pleasantly anticipated that cocktail and was sorely disappointed to find it changed for the much worse. I won't order it again, and I hope that in future if the Met decides to change up a cocktail recipe, they give the resulting abomination a different name.

Customer 3087.Name: LeGume
Customer 3087.Content:
Fit  for  foodies  is a  tough call.  Seriously carnivorous foodies  yes, others  not  so much(?). Alcohol of all kinds  also seems  to be  a  specialty of the  house.  If you have  caloric intake  concerns  you're probably  in the  wrong  place.
 Pleasant  old  school decor and  vibe. Hipster millennials  are probably  quite  amused.  Service was  good and not  rushed.  Parking valet  was helpful, as  was the  coat check service.  I did say old  school.

Customer 3088.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3088.Content: We were very disappointed by the service. It was like the sommelier's first day as he kept pointing the champagne at my wife's head. One waiter used the station next to us to clean up someone else's plate and I don't think our server once filled our wine glasses; but we did enjoy him reaching across the table to get the empty glasses. As for the food, my wife had the salmon and asparagus, which was drenched in so much butter she couldn't taste anything and I had the blackened prime rib that was so salty that I had to scrape off the crust. Incidentally, not being from the west, my wife ordered the same dish at Ray's the night after and it was outstanding, night and day to the Metropolitan. We travel often to Seattle and will be putting this place on our no go list.

Customer 3089.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3089.Content:
Such good food! We ordered the 13 oz filet mignon (ate it all) and the 16 oz. peppercorn steak. I was worried about flavor on the filet mignon but honestly it had its own all by itself and was deemed better than my 16 oz. pepercorn steak. 
We got asparagus, mushrooms, and creamed broccoli for the sides- also - all good.
Steaks were cooked to the perfect color (both chose medium)
In regards to noise - it wasn't noticeable, I couldn't choose between quiet or moderate. I wouldn't say it was dead quiet but the noise didn't bother or disturb us at all and we could talk at normal voice levels and hear each other just fine without being isolated in some private corner. 

No complaints! 

Thank you for a great night and delicious food! 

We will be back for my birthday soon!

Customer 3090.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3090.Content: Dined at the Met with the family and we had a blast eating! Our food was delicious. The last time I was here was probably more than 13 years ago. Our waitress was great, she's funny, she had good recommendations and advice regarding our food. They also have a guy that brought our steak out prepped it so that the whole family can share our Long Bone rib eye and the other steaks we ordered. It was like a mini steak buffet sampler on our table!

Customer 3091.Name: LupeP
Customer 3091.Content: We were seated right away. Our waiter was Mackenzie and he was constantly checking to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. The food was to die for .  We really enjoyed ourselves as well as stuffed ourselves. Going back soon. Hope to get Mackenzie as our waiter again.

Customer 3093.Name: francophile
Customer 3093.Content: The steak was good but the rest of the food was so so. The server seemed like she had a lot of tables to cover. She did the best in her ability to serve. I expected more from a restaurant this caliber.

Customer 3094.Name: ChipandDale
Customer 3094.Content: Their service never disappoint. We tried onion soup in Calif. and Vancouver, BC. But find they have the best. There is depth in the flavour. We had the 40oz long bone steak. It was cooked to perfection. Their carrot cake and coconut cake are awesome. The taste is very rich but not too sweet. But the portion is quite big.

Customer 3095.Name: Dave
Customer 3095.Content: Great service. Nice atmosphere. Parking may be a challenge during lunch, since there is no valet during the day.

Customer 3096.Name: LaughOutLoudTracy
Customer 3096.Content: This is our "go to" special occasion restaurant. Food is amazing. They make a steak unlike anybody else. Atmosphere is great fun...old timey swank & charm, but not too pretentious. Service is almost always impeccable. (This most recent visit we had the grumpiest waitress ever. Kind of shocking, actually. She was super slammed, with two giant groups in her section, and it was the Feb coupon season so extra busy, but dang. So grumpy. When a person repeated their drink order, she was super abrupt about saying, "I know already!" And then she ended up forgetting two things, including one of the drinks. She did comp a dessert because of the missed salad, which was a classy move. Although it was a bday celebration and normally there's a comped creme brulee and that somehow got missed. But the birthday girl got her chocolate lava cake comped because her salad never arrived, so it all worked out in the end. I mean, we still had a gorgeous meal and a nice evening celebrating. And everyone can have an "off" night. I empathized with her having to deal with the two large groups (and how the kitchen managed to send 12+ entrees at once is a testament to The Met, for sure!). Best steaks in town. Everything is delicious.

Customer 3097.Name: SeattleMike
Customer 3097.Content: Metropolitan Grill still produces amazing steaks.  The standout for our meal was the bone in ribeye, which is like the steak in the Flintstones (for those who recall that cartoon) where the food tilts the car over.  This is a beast of a steak and enough to feed several people.  It was perfectly cooked with an amazing crust.  We also had the rack of lamb on our table and thought the flavor was excellent, it was a bit overcooked than ordered.  The sides are also great.  Don't come here if you are trying to 1. lose weight, or 2. get your cholesterol under control!  Amazing food, you do pay for it, but the service and food are always excellent here.

Customer 3098.Name: JoseR
Customer 3098.Content: Thank you Marla for a wonderful experience, food and service was fantastic...a birthday dinner so memorable!

Customer 3099.Name: Kris66
Customer 3099.Content: My husband and I went here for our 3rd anniversary and were completely spoiled by the wait staff. The food was delicious - just don't have any money restrictions and you'll have a fabulous time!

Customer 3100.Name: Van604
Customer 3100.Content: Great steak as usual. The only thing is onion rings were little over cooked. We didn't say anything to waiter at the time but it were room for improvement.

Customer 3101.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3101.Content: The service was great, the waiter was very attentive until it came time to get our bill at which time we were not rushed to leave.

Customer 3102.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3102.Content: Great steak. Spend the money for something more than prime.

Customer 3103.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3103.Content: Another win for the Met.  Got the large filet and really could have used a spoon to eat it.  Capped off with the Burnt Cream for dessert, this place is now in my top 2 steak houses.

Customer 3104.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3104.Content: Our family was celebrating the academic excellence of our 3 incredible young folks. We had wanted the opportunity to introduce them to the finest steak house in Seattle, and we were not disappointed. Michael, pour waiter, took excellent (and humorous) care of us all. Great drinks, well-thought-out accommodations of food needs, and that just-right timing of service were all in evidence. My son exclaimed that this was the best steak he'd ever had. My younger daughter got JUST the right steak (filet). And my oldest, and vegan, daughter, had the time of her life, as well as discovering the meaty versatility of Portobello mushrooms. When the opportunity arises again, we'll be there!

Customer 3106.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3106.Content: delicious and perfect as always. must try if you haven't

Customer 3107.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3107.Content: This is my husband's favorite restaurant. We come up every year for his birthday. The food is amazing and our server had a kit of knowledge about the menu, great service. It is very pricey, knowing that ahead of time let's us plan for it so we can have a great meal.

Customer 3108.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3108.Content: The Met never disappoints.  The food is always cooked just  to order and the service is impeccable.  The wine list is very good and the wine steward will never steer you wrong.

Customer 3109.Name: ChampagneDragon
Customer 3109.Content: Service is sloppy and unpolished given the cost of the meal. The steak is good but the other courses are underwhelming substituting size of serving for quality.

Customer 3110.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3110.Content:
We had a fine experience at the Metropolitan Grill. The service was generally very good, with one exception: it took almost an hour to get our main course after the appetizer. Everyone we encountered from the hostess, to the bussing staff, to our server were extremely professional and friendly. We felt a very warm welcome, and out server was great. It was just this delay between courses, which was too long.

The steak was good, but not great. I ordered the rib eye, medium rare. I had high expectations based on the reviews, and this didn't come close to meeting them. It was a little under seasoned and a little overdone. For $60, it was disappointing. Doesn't make my top 10, or even top 20 for best steaks. 

Next time I want a steak in Seattle, I'll try a different place.

Customer 3111.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3111.Content: what it really comes down to is the food. my steak (prime new york peppercorn, done medium) was sheer perfection.  pink center but hot, it literally melted away.  exactly the reason why I insist on returning to the met time after time for the best steaks in town.

Customer 3112.Name: reddwarf007
Customer 3112.Content: Went for a special occasion. Rib eye steaks were awesome.  The Filet Mignon was a little tough, but the waiter gladly change steak.  A little expensive but fun. Great for special occasion.

Customer 3113.Name: bereiter
Customer 3113.Content: always a great dining experience-good food, great service, and all the attention to details

Customer 3114.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3114.Content: Excellent food and even better service. We arrived a little early and were greeted kindly and seated right away. The waitress was incredibly knowledgable about the menu and helped us with patience as we chose our meals. Our steaks were cooked perfectly, and  dessert was heaven. The noise level in the restraint was a little high but not too terrible. We will definitely be returning!

Customer 3115.Name: DavidC
Customer 3115.Content: The entire experience was spectacular. Best lobster Mac and cheese I've ever had and the service was perfect.

Customer 3116.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3116.Content: Amazing Place!!! The service was phenomenal!!! Jim was the greatest waiter I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. Best steak in the Seattle area!!

Customer 3117.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3117.Content: Love the food, staff, and vibe here. Everything is delicious!

Customer 3118.Name: Frank
Customer 3118.Content:
I surprised my partner with a romantic Valentine's Day dinner at The Metropolitan Grill. We arrived 15 minutes early for our reservation and we're seated promptly at exactly our reservation time. We were seated in a very comfortable booth and our server introduced himself immediately and offered us drinks.

My partner ordered wine and I had a Manhattan, which was superb. We ordered the crab cakes and we were so surprised to receive three large crab cakes that were delicious! For dinner, my partner ordered the American Waygu skirt steak and she loved it so much. She let me try a piece and, I must say, I was very jealous. It was so well seasoned and tender - it was fantastic. Our server compared it to an upscale carne asada and we agreed wholeheartedly. For me, I ordered the American Waygu New York Strip and it was top notch. Served medium rare, lightly seasoned, and cut like butter. Our sides included a baked potato, garlic mashed potatoes, and we shared the Lobster Mac n' Cheese. All three were home runs, especially the Mac n' Cheese!
