Finally, we shared the carrot cake for dessert and it was one of the best I've ever had. Moist cake with creamy icing and two scoops of Bourbon ice cream on the side. It put the final touch on an already stellar dinner.

Our server, Nick, was a consummate professional. He served us quickly and kindly and even went out of his way to write down other Seattle hotspots for us to check out (we're new in town). Overall, this was a 5-star experience and worth every penny.

Customer 3119.Name: Cynthia
Customer 3119.Content:
Yet again, The Met has given us a perfect evening.  Starting with days before when The Met somehow found room to allow us to add 3 more people to our existing reservation of 2 on Valentine's Day, to our wonderful table and outstanding service by Handsome Scott Brown.

We had a friend who had never been to The Met before and (just as I assumed) she was floored at the service and the meal.  

Thank you for a great Valentine's Day!!

Customer 3120.Name: LisaH
Customer 3120.Content: A party of 8 for Valentines Day, amazing service and great experience.

Customer 3121.Name: Perfectfeast
Customer 3121.Content: Worst steak ever. $80 and it was overcooked and flavorless. Save your money and go somewhere that doesn't Charge you a premium for gross jerky of a steak.

Customer 3122.Name: TonyT
Customer 3122.Content: Wife and myself haven't been back here since 2007 when we had our wedding reception in one of the back rooms.  Both then and now the service, food and atmosphere were outstanding.  The restaurant found out this was our first return since we got married and gave us a free appetizer and the floor manager was constantly checking in on us to ensure our meal was perfect.  I can't recommend this place enough.  Its a little bit pricey but for the quality of service and food you receive I have no issue with the price.

Customer 3123.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3123.Content: Excellent service and great food! Top choice for steak in downtown Seattle!

Customer 3124.Name: NickP
Customer 3124.Content: Wonderful experience at the institution. Wait staff is on point, steak and wine suggestions followed by a banana foster will knock your socks off. Yum.

Customer 3125.Name: Miller
Customer 3125.Content: First time my boyfriend and I went to the Metropolitan Grill. The food and service was amazing! The waiter really knew the menu, and suggested great appetizers and steaks. We cannot stop talking about the Ohmi tartar.

Customer 3126.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3126.Content: Haven't been  there in 20 years, service was outstanding, I had a filet and my wife the blackened prime rib which wasn't very good at all. She couldn't eat much of it but after telling our waiter he apologized  and  took her meal off the bill. Would definitely go back. Not waiting  another 20 years though.

Customer 3127.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3127.Content: Spend the money get the 100$ steak you will not regret it! Only complaint was it was loud but it was also packed. Great people working there they know their stuff.

Customer 3128.Name: Isolde
Customer 3128.Content: I had the 8 oz fillet, prepared rare and it was perfectly done!  Delicious!  Well worth the price I paid.

Customer 3129.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3129.Content: We ordered the 4-piece filet mignon sampler ($210) and were very disappointed that two of the filets were seared black. The wiater said it must have been a "hot spot on the skillet, since they're pan seared first." For $50+ each, I would think the filets would be/should be cooked correctly.

Customer 3130.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3130.Content: My husband is a steak connoisseur and he gave the steaks a huge thumbs-up.  This place has a very classic feel with dark wood and green-shaded lamps at each table - it is a very romantic spot.  Our server was helpful and spent lots of time with us.  The rest of the food was also great - good salad, bread and sides.  Our dessert was an event - flambeed bananas foster.  Very good.  I highly recommend this restaurant for a special occasion or if you are a fan of good beef.

Customer 3131.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3131.Content: Great service and the food was outstanding.from the moment valet pars your car to paying you check was top shelf. Drove over 300 miles just to enjoy the best.

Customer 3132.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3132.Content: Best fast friendly service and the food was mouth watering!!! A lil pricey but yum yumm yummy!!!

Customer 3133.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3133.Content: Our sever and staff were awesome with every detail of our night thank you for wonderful time

Customer 3134.Name: SteveO
Customer 3134.Content: Went as a family to the "Met" for my son's 28th birthday - a rare occurrence considering all over our schedules.  I knew what we were getting when we arrived - having eaten there in 2011 with another relative.  But scheduling reservations on line was super easy.  The line was minimal, and we were actually seated early (much to my delight).  The dinner was divine (three Oscar style Filet Mignon, and one blackened Prime Rib).  So much so, that my youngest son declared the Filet Mignon the best he's ever tasted.  That's something - for he has tried Filet Mignon at Ruth Chris, El Gaucho and countless other restaurants in the U.S.  Free 9-layer chocolate cake was a nice treat from the Met, and greatly appreciated.  Very happy with the experience.

Customer 3135.Name: BryanK
Customer 3135.Content: I have eaten at the Met many times over the last 15 years, and have ALWAYS had great food and ALWAYS had great service, except this last visit.  The food was outstanding, but the service was VERY poor.

Customer 3136.Name: SeniorDrill
Customer 3136.Content: Good customer service. Food was very good. Server was great.

Customer 3137.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3137.Content: Our server is thoughtful with big smile. The atmosphere is classical and cozy. We have steak salad & sirloin with wine & cocktail. They are amazing. We cannot forget the moment at The MET. It is the best place to enjoy steak in Seattle.

Customer 3138.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3138.Content: This time of year, the Metropolitan Grill offers a Dine on Us Deal ... where 2 dinners are free, when 4 dine.  It's a GREAT DEAL that shouldn't be passed up.

Customer 3139.Name: jimm
Customer 3139.Content: Old fashioned steak house that matches amazing food and service perfectly. If you are in Seattle and don't go to the Metro Grill then you missed the chance to go to one of the best steak houses in the world!

Customer 3140.Name: Ncnctc03
Customer 3140.Content:
Loved the service, it was everything that we needed.  Food quality was just great, perfectly cooked steaks. Really tasty spinach salad, lots of nice additions.

Wish the booths for two were a bit bigger, we needed more room to spread out.

Customer 3141.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3141.Content: From when we entered to the time we left, our experience here was fantastic! Service was great, food was superb! We will definitely be back.

Customer 3142.Name: RCardin
Customer 3142.Content: The Met is a dining experience. Reminiscent of the great steakhouses found in cities like Chicago and New York, this is the best "classic steakhouse" in Seattle. The steaks are well-cut, grilled to perfection, with a phenomenal wine list and some great martinis. I had wanted to go here for years, and was not disappointed. This is a place you dress up to go to, which is rare for Seattle (there were some people in t-shirts, looking abashed at being underdressed). The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. The food was all delicious (crab cakes, salmon, porterhouse, carrot cake) and the whole dinner felt like a special occasion. For me, this isn't someplace I can afford to go to every week, or even every month, which makes it feel more special. If you're worried about the cost, they have a fantastic happy hour with one of the best burgers!

Customer 3143.Name: Libertastic
Customer 3143.Content: Great atmosphere. We loved the old fashioned steak house vibe. Our table for two was tiny, though. I get that more tables equals more money, but it's hard to enjoy your food when you're worried about knocking over your wine glass every second. Service was great, but you could tell our server was super busy... maybe too many tables per server? The person who sat us and the guy refilling our water noticed we were celebrating and wished me happy birthday, but our server never mentioned it. Most important, though, the steaks were delicious. The American wagyu filet was top notch.

Customer 3144.Name: Kiki
Customer 3144.Content:
wine was great
the steaks were alright 
but overall was too expensive

Customer 3145.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3145.Content:
MY WIFE AND I HAVE BEEN DINING OUT AT THE MEDTROPOLITAN FOR OVER 27 YEARS AND HAVE NEVER RECEIVED NOTHING LESS THEN ABOVE AND BEYOUND OUTSTANDING SERVICE AND FOOD.  AFTER OUR GRAND KIDS DINING WITH MY WIFE AND I OVER THE YEARS, BOTH MY GRAND SON AND GRAND DAU  ASKED AND RECEIVED THEIR HIGH SCHOOL PROM DINNER AT THE MED.
(12 COUPLES FOR MY GRAND SON AND 10 FOR MY GRAND DAU) AND OF COURSE MY WIFE AND I
WAS ALONG WITH THEM..  WHEN I SPEAK OF DINING-OUT TO MY FRENDS, THEY ALWAYS  RESPOND BY SAYING "THE MED" I REPLY WITH "ARE THERE ANY OTHER" MY THANKS TO ALL PERSONNEL AT THE MED .

Customer 3146.Name: DKCT
Customer 3146.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a great steakhouse that offers a wide variety of steaks as well as some other choices if you're not in the mood for beef.  My wife and I wanted steak and both ordered filets, she had the 8 oz and I had the combo of 4 oz filet and 4 oz Wagyu filet.  Both meals met our expectations for high quality steak and we did not leave disappointed.  Service was also top-notch, attentive but not intrusive.  It's not cheap at Metropolitan Grill but if you're in the mood to treat yourself to some good steaks this place will fit the bill.

Customer 3147.Name: Jack
Customer 3147.Content: The food was great as usual at the Metropolitan Grill. We got unlucky with a bad server  who was not very friendly and actually shook his head when picking up the check with his $100 tip, as if he was disappointed.

Customer 3148.Name: Nick
Customer 3148.Content: I cannot say enough about the quality of food and service at the Met Grill!  While the cost of dinner, drinks and dessert was high ($600 for 4 people) it was worth the expense for a fun evening out.  The tableside service of the chateaubriand and the hot apple pie were wonderful and both items were delicious!  Don't let them fool you though - they claim the apple pie feeds two...it actually can easily feed 4!

Customer 3149.Name: MinnieMac
Customer 3149.Content: We came to celebrate a special occasion for my 12 year old and the staff was exceptional.  Our server thoughtfully taught him all about steaks while Kevin, the maitre d', came over on two occasions to acknowledge my son's accomplishments and shook his hand.  Our dessert hostess who finessed the tableside flames of our incredible "apple pie" also took time to chat with us and provided a perfect ending to our experience.  And the food was amazing, too!!

Customer 3150.Name: steaksnob
Customer 3150.Content: Cherry jubilee was delicious as usual

Customer 3151.Name: Dudelar
Customer 3151.Content: An old institution in Seattle that obviously hasn't managed to evolve with the times. Felt somewhat backwards and old fashioned. Don't ever need to go back here.

Customer 3152.Name: seattlecamper
Customer 3152.Content: Every time I eat at the Metropolitan Grill, I remember why I come back.  The steak is amazing.  I mean it is so good.  I enjoy every mouth watering bite.  Just writing this review makes me want to go back.  The wine list is fantastic.  They cook the bananas foster right at your table which is fun and decadent.

Customer 3153.Name: Family
Customer 3153.Content: This was a first time dining experience with a 13-month old.  The staff was so accommodating and friendly with a small child.  Wonderful food and service.

Customer 3154.Name: professor
Customer 3154.Content:
THE METROPOLITAN GRILL WAS A GREAT EXPERIENCE!  THE FOOD WAS OUTSTANDING AND SO WAS THE AMBIANCE.   VERY COMFORTABLE SEATING--BOOTHS AVAILABLE.  
THE WINE LIST IS EXTRAORDINARY!  WE FOUND OUR FAVORITE VINTNER FROM CALIFORNIA AND WE WERE DELIGHTED.

Customer 3155.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3155.Content: The Met serves some nice cuts of meat which are well prepared.  Choices for non-meat items are very limited.  Also, prices are very high so for special occasions only or if I have a craving for a great cut of beef.  Occasional special promotions make coming here more affordable.

Customer 3156.Name: Earleatsgreatsteaks
Customer 3156.Content: Everything was great about this establishment. Would do it again the next time I am in Seattle

Customer 3157.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3157.Content: The Met never disappoints. Servers are courteous and informed. If you bring your own wine expect poor service from the wine stewards.

Customer 3158.Name: DaniP
Customer 3158.Content: This was a perfect outing for my husband's 50th birthday!  It was our first visit and a destination experience.  It was worth every second and penny!  We ate and drank incredibly well - and had plenty leftover to enjoy fourth meal!  We will be finding another special occasion this year for an excuse to return.

Customer 3159.Name: Greatmexican
Customer 3159.Content: Excellent as always. Best Steaks in town. We loved our server she was spot on.

Customer 3160.Name: KathyG
Customer 3160.Content: This restaurant came highly recommended by locals when we were in Seattle ! Was a great experience, had a fantastic server! The food was good and  rich ! The cost was very high for a restaurant meal, even by Seattle standards!

Customer 3161.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3161.Content: We had a party of 5, were seated at a nice round table.  It was very easy to hear every one at the table and we still had room for all our food, etc.  Service, food were both excellent.

Customer 3162.Name: localworker
Customer 3162.Content:
I took clients here for lunch earlier this week.  
The menu has a nice variety of salads, soup, sandwiches and entrees.  All of us enjoyed salads that were freshly prepared. Since this is a steak house,  2 of us had steak salads, the meat was tender and flavorful. The service was outstanding.

I would highly recommend this restaurant for business lunches.

Customer 3163.Name: Redd
Customer 3163.Content:
Reception nice, waiter very welcoming, food excellent.
A very San Francisco dinning experience. Only missing the white table cloth.

Customer 3164.Name: LiaK
Customer 3164.Content: This place is definitely the image of a classic steakhouse and has a cool old-Seattle vibe to it. The food was good, but honestly a little pricey for the experience. I've had steaks I've enjoyed more at a lower price. I'd say it's a place for a rare special occasion, for the experience.

Customer 3165.Name: ermohn
Customer 3165.Content: The Met is a must for steak lovers when you're in Seattle. The food is always perfectly cooked and the wine list is very good. In total the Met is one of the best steak houses in the country.

Customer 3166.Name: Amlkrmerm
Customer 3166.Content: Amazing steak!  Amazing service!  Amazing martinis!   I can't say enough about this awesome place.   The kids menu was great and my child enjoyed all the action.   Reservation was right on time too!  Bread, asparagus , Waygu filet, usda prime filet baked potato were all perfect!  Well worth the price!

Customer 3167.Name: Terrorgear
Customer 3167.Content: Football game in bar ruined the romantic dinner I was hoping for. Waiter was sub par and not familiar with the aging process of the $80 steaks he was trying to sell.

Customer 3168.Name: AussieFoodie
Customer 3168.Content: This was our 2nd visit and again it lives up to its reputation. The steaks were great but the highlight this time was the service provided by Jimmy. He was attentive, helpful but not never felt over bearing. Thanks for a wonderful evening.

Customer 3169.Name: WendyS
Customer 3169.Content:
Absolutely first class service and food quality!  Steaks are superb, cooked a little redder than I prefer, but still amazing (desserts too!).

Parking is a bit of a task, but it is downtown and they have valet.  Parking is available at a neighboring lot, but it becomes valet only at 5pm.  So unless you get there before 5pm, opt for the valet or you might get lucky parking somewhere on the street.

Customer 3170.Name: NeilS
Customer 3170.Content: It is what it is - classic, with all the good and bad associated with that label. If you're in the mood for that, there isn't a better place around.

Customer 3171.Name: SeniorDrill
Customer 3171.Content: The was a great lunchtime location.  Went there with friends to catch up and had a great meal and a great time.

Customer 3172.Name: bernard
Customer 3172.Content: We all had great meat, the wine was good, the cocktails super.

Customer 3173.Name: Lizolsson
Customer 3173.Content:
This french dip (roast beef au jus) will ruin you for all others.  I have spent the last 8 years with constant disappointment looking for a French Dip that compares (I do not live in Seattle).  The burger my husband had was phenomenal as well, but the French Dip won!  

If you want a great lunch, that really is not much more than your average restaurant, The Met will not disappoint. (We spent more on breakfast the day before)

Customer 3174.Name: Christian
Customer 3174.Content: Sadly this was not the best steakhouse in Seattle as I assumed when booking the reservation.  Steaks and sides showed up cold and when returned almost immediately were brought back still cold a second time!  I can possibly understand one mix up but once a patron returns something it should be correct the second time around.  Not at the Metropolitan Grill!  This is completely unacceptable for a restaurant of this caliber.

Customer 3176.Name: GorgeCoach
Customer 3176.Content: Fabulous Old Seattle vibe, great staff and memories of the early greatness that made the Emerald City the Alaska-New York intersection.  Best enjoyed with special people. Steak options worthy of any great steakhouse.

Customer 3177.Name: Parts
Customer 3177.Content: This is our go to place for special occasions and celebrations. Best steaks in town, terrific atmosphere and wonderful service.

Customer 3178.Name: Brunoboy
Customer 3178.Content: The place to impress business associates! Food and service are five star and you will never go wrong selecting the Metro when it comes to closing the deal.

Customer 3179.Name: Sweet
Customer 3179.Content: We have celebrated our anniversary many times at the Metropolitan Grill, almost always with friends to make a moderately large group. This time was no different and the entire evening was first rate and lived up to the event we were celebrating. The staff at The Met, up and down the line treat us like family, endure my myriad little wine or food stories and return with their own. It is our go to place for sure and we are always, always treated like old friends.

Customer 3180.Name: arikohn
Customer 3180.Content: The Metropolitan Grill = Always impeccable service, plus very good food!

Customer 3181.Name: RetireBirthdayCelebrators
Customer 3181.Content: The meat was excellent, prepared just right and the server did a good job. He was knowledgeable about the wine list and had good recomendations for the food pairing. The meal seemed to be missing a vegetable or maybe just some parsley twigs. The clean-up and prep staff needs serious work. For instance, one's plates could remain on the table until one finishes one's meal, not having them whisked away while one is still chewing and still having food to eat. The wait station should not repeatedly bang the back of your seat. This is a very upscale restaurant and not the local diner or a fast food local. If you expect a $hundreds$ of dollars evening out, consider another establishment.

Customer 3182.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3182.Content: Loved the food!! Our server was fantastic, really knew how to make our night special

Customer 3183.Name: Al106
Customer 3183.Content: We had an incredible evening. The food was amazing. We could both cut out steaks with our forks. Our server was wonderful. It was very loud in there but honestly you didn't notice once you started eating.

Customer 3184.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3184.Content: Great service despite it being busy, a little nosier then I anticipated, but it did not detract from dinner.

Customer 3186.Name: KinMiami
Customer 3186.Content: Food was OK compare the price, waiter does not know what is the difference between T-Bone x Porterhouse.

Customer 3187.Name: Jeff
Customer 3187.Content: My wife ordered medium rare prime rib which was terrible. Served lukewarm, no marbling nor flavour and dry as opposed to there description of slow cooked to most tender and flavorful prime ribs. Btw, met our friends who also dined at Metropolitan the next day at brunch, they had similar comment on the prime rib.  Shared a medium rare 34oz porterhouse with my son. The strip loin portion was tough with some silver skin but filet portion tender and flavorful. Baby spinach salad and French onion soup was really good. I regreted that We chose Metropolitan over Ruth's Chris☹️☹️☹️☹️

Customer 3188.Name: great
Customer 3188.Content: Had dinner here on New Years Day 2016. The service was excellent, very attentive and informative. I had the filet mignon with baked potato and a aside of asparagus. All of it was delicious, made just right. My wife had the rib eye with mashed potatoes and it was just as amazing. We were only in town for two nights and we couldn't be happier that we selected this centrally located resteraunt for one of our evenings.

Customer 3189.Name: newode
Customer 3189.Content: I found the Metropolitan a good experience for the New Years day outing. the overall feel is that of a traditional east coast establishment. My companion and I spent a few minutes at the bar before moving to the dining room. The staff was pleasant and attentive without being overbearing. Concerning the meal, I had an 8oz filet minion while my companion had a 12 oz NY cut. Both were well aged, prepared and presented. My only negative would be that the filet minion was a bit over salted. This was my first experience with the Metro and would try them again before a final rating.

Customer 3190.Name: TacomaTaster
Customer 3190.Content: All around terrific experience.  Great kids menu as well.  Really great steak preparation.

Customer 3191.Name: SleepyinSeattle
Customer 3191.Content: The Met is a perennial 'where to go for special occasion' favorite (at the prices they charge, it has to be for our wallet).  Luckily, they've never disappointed.  Yes, the staff can be almost too attentive and the comments can border on  snobbery but they do care and you get the feeling that their only goal in life is to make sure you get exactly what you want.  The steak?  Always to die for and shame on you if you order it anything more than medium rare.  Their dishes come full and hearty and after ten years of dining, I have yet to make it to the dessert menu.  We'll keep going back.

Customer 3192.Name: bassg
Customer 3192.Content: The Metropolitan grill is always.  Great service and great food.  The prime rib was fantastic.

Customer 3193.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3193.Content:
The waiter was insulting and rude to my date and I. The noise level was absurd. The comments made by the waiter were unacceptable. The waiter did not fill our water and only removed one set of used plates, not both. 

The busboy did an excellent job serving the water that the waiter forgot to serve and cleared the plates he forgot as well. 

At a high end establishment I expect a certain level of service that was not provided.

Customer 3194.Name: Lindley
Customer 3194.Content:
New Years' Eve was the second time I ate here. The first time, I was impressed with their service and steaks, potatoes, and cocktail drinks, although it's all very pricey. The second time I was much less impressed. I ordered a $59 8 oz Filet Mignon very well done (no pink), and asked to share it with my fiance. They wanted to charge $6 extra to give us an extra plate with an additional side. We didn't want the extra side, just the plate, but they claimed they don't do that. The steak arrived on a single plate. The waitress gave us an extra bread plate, but that small thing wasn't the right solution for a place this pricey. Strike one.

We discovered the steak was quite pink inside and sent it back. No big deal. They let us keep the baked potato, which was excellent. However, when the steak came back it was *still* pink inside. I do not think it was cooked more at all. I suspect they have one of those chefs who believes steak must be served pink, but that isn't the way I ordered it! Strike two.

The waitress offered to bring us completely new meals, starting over. That would be fine; however, she took away our baked potato without asking. There's no reason for us not to finish the side while we waited for the new plates to arrive. Strike three, you're out.

It was then an hour since we arrived, and we had a deadline so we decided we couldn't wait for the new steak and we would just pay for the two cocktails we'd had and go. One bright spot: the waitress said the cocktails were on them. However, we were not given an opportunity to discuss the situation with the manager before we left, which is customary in these high-end places. Strike...four?

Also, my margarita was not served in a margarita glass, just a standard glass. A minor thing but on top of the rest it's worth mentioning.

A day or two later I developed a sore throat. I can't say for sure if it's related to eating here, but I also can't rule it out.

Customer 3195.Name: Coconut6
Customer 3195.Content: Ok...nothing special, like I said...not crazy good

Customer 3196.Name: nageek85
Customer 3196.Content: We spent New Years eve at the Met. Looking for great food and spirits as the main event and that's exactly what we found, service was fantastic and food was memorable. Definitely a place to try if you haven't.

Customer 3197.Name: newyears2015
Customer 3197.Content: we had 4 kids and the wait staff were very friendly and entertaining with them. this was the first experience they had at a higher end restaurant . Thank - you to all those who took such good care of us and made this such an enjoyable experience for  all of us.

Customer 3198.Name: Mary
Customer 3198.Content: Amazing service and amazing food! My fiancé went with another couple for dinner on New Year's Eve and we were all blown away by the steaks! It was a very special and spectacular experience. I highly recommend.

Customer 3199.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3199.Content: Timeless, classic, and consistent. Been coming since I was a kid.

Customer 3200.Name: JTF2000
Customer 3200.Content: As usual the Met has great food and great service.  Old school great place for special occasions.

Customer 3201.Name: Mollyike
Customer 3201.Content: Made reservations for my wife's birthday, which happens to be December 31st. We were fortunate to get a table for our party of 5. The food was amazing and our server, Todd, was great! He was very attentive to our needs and has a great sense of hunor. What I appreciated the most is that the Met did not rush our dinner - we were able to eat at at leisurely pace.

Customer 3202.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3202.Content: We had an amazing dinner. The food was delicious, the wine was wonderful and our service was perfect.  We couldn't have asked for a better New Years Eve Dinner.

Customer 3203.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3203.Content: We have been to a great deal of steak houses and this is one of the best.  Amazing flavor,  cooked exactly to order and good portions.  The price is high but when it comes to good steak I'll pay more for quality.  Highly recommend.

Customer 3204.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3204.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a step or two above our normal price range but we were looking for a special night out and got it. My wife and I had the best meal of our lives. Everything was quality. Including the service and ambiance. We were hoping for a "wow" experience and we weren't disappointed. Can't wait to return.

Customer 3206.Name: Gretchenlovesgoodfood
Customer 3206.Content:
Every year we choose a special place to go with the family during the holidays. Once again we chose The Met and were not disappointed. Everything about the evening was perfect. The Wagyu filet mignon we all ordered was amazing. The roasted root vegetables were cooked to perfection, and the wine made the meal complete. Even though we really did not have room for dessert, we ordered anyway. We each got something different;  banana's foster was prepared at the table, ice cream served in a crispy shell, 9 layer chocolate cake, and creme brûlée. 
We came home  and fell into a food coma. Until next year....thanks Met!

Customer 3207.Name: MadMarg
Customer 3207.Content: Thank you!! Excellent service - great dungee crab app!!

Customer 3208.Name: Occam
Customer 3208.Content:
Everyone knows the Met, so I'll try to just hit a few points from my experience.  Went for a pre-wedding dinner with a group of six. We were nicely dressed, but don't exactly fit the profile of their usual 1 percenter clientele. They seated us in a corner booth at the far end of the restaurant. We ordered a bottle of champagne and a few appetizers to start. The waiter played the jovial entertainer/host in addition to helping us select food and taking orders. I apparently annoyed a wine steward because I wanted the group to decide on their entre orders BEFORE we chose a wine. He didn't come back to our table, the waiter got another steward to come over about 20 minutes later. I selected a wine from the list, but they were out and substituted a more expensive bottle at the same price, which was very good. Kudos for that. The bottle arrived just as the entres were coming.  My steak, which was a nice medium rare, was excellent quality, but arrived a bit cold, which was the only demerit with the food itself. They gave us a huge slice of cake at the end of the evening in honor of the happy couple. 
Overall, the service is attentive, the food is excellent quality, and the atmosphere is classy. The negatives are that the prices are ridiculous and the 'classy' thing can easily tip over into a subtle undercurrent of snobbery, to which no one should ever be subjected when they're paying those prices.

Customer 3210.Name: SheilainBelltown
Customer 3210.Content: Food aside, I would go to this restaurant again just for the elegant, retro decor.  I had the steak salad.  A generous portion of perfectly prepared and tender steak sat atop greens, chunks of soft, rich blue cheese, red onion and radishes.  Spouse chose the sirloin chop burger.  It was mammoth in size, served with fries, and delicious.  The prices were reasonable considering the quality and quantity of the food.

Customer 3211.Name: cedricp
Customer 3211.Content: First time going to The Met great food and great  Service 👍👍👍👍 A must👍 Just missed  Russell Wilson  After the game on Sunday! Go Hawks 💙🏈💚

Customer 3212.Name: Okay
Customer 3212.Content: Went with my husband for date night. I was quite disappointed with this visit. Prices have gone up and the service and quality of food has gone down. On a positive note, they still make the best crab cakes around.

Customer 3213.Name: Bungie
Customer 3213.Content: I have been reading about Metropolitan Grill for the past 30 years and finally made it there. So glad I finally made it and the only question I have for myself is what took me so long. Simply outstanding!

Customer 3214.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3214.Content: We dined for brunch before a Seahawks game. I would have liked to see a brunch menu. I almost felt like they only wanted us to eat Lunch since that was the only menu we were given and the hostess and waiter did not mention brunch to us at all.   I saw the brunch menu on a chalk board in the bar and only saw the three specials. The service was great and our waiter was attentive and helpful.  The waitstaff is what got the 4 stars but the lack of information when we were seated will prevent me from going back.

Customer 3215.Name: Vegasvisitor
Customer 3215.Content: Our server was excellent, his name was Chad. Food was without fault. Drinks super yummy! Thomas the valet/doorman was extremely rude and sadly left a bad taste in our mouths.

Customer 3216.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3216.Content:
Wonderful wines and appetizers!  For scallop and 
A hi lovers they are a must try!  You will not be disappointed at the Met!!

Customer 3217.Name: AndaT
Customer 3217.Content: The food was very good and the service was excellent.  However , we were disappointed  with our table . We were seated in the windowless, blah Chairman's Room.  Considering the expensive menu prices a table in the main dining area would have been preferred. I regret that I did not ask the hostess to move us as soon as we saw our table.  I would return for a special occasion but when making my reservation I would request" no Chairman's Room!"

Customer 3218.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3218.Content: Salt is the heavy handed seasoning from the kitchen that overwhelms the meat and sides.

Customer 3219.Name: hamoaboy
Customer 3219.Content: Best place in Seattle for meat lovers.

Customer 3220.Name: Tedd
Customer 3220.Content: Food was exceptional as always.  The waiter was a bit distracted during our meal which was disappointing.

Customer 3221.Name: MADDY
Customer 3221.Content:
IT WAS A WONDERFUL TIME.  BETWEEN THE METROPOLITAN AND THE OYSTER HOUSE
THE FOOD AND SERVICE IS THE BEST.  THE ATMOSPHERE IS FRIENDLY, HAPPY AND IT
IS ALSO A COZY AND PRIVATE EXPERIENCE.  LOVE IT.

Customer 3222.Name: siverfox
Customer 3222.Content: Whenever we are in Seattle and want Filet Mignon, this the place !

Customer 3223.Name: jano
Customer 3223.Content: AWEFUL PIECE OF STEAK FOR 120.00! I AM NOT HARD TO PLEASE BUT IT WAS SO BAD I LEFT HALF ON MY PLATE.

Customer 3224.Name: Ballardite
Customer 3224.Content: Some friends and I thought we'd treat ourselves to a nice holiday lunch.  This lunch was average at best.  Disappointing. Service was excellent.

Customer 3225.Name: Brunello88
Customer 3225.Content: The perfect pre-Seahawks game meal. We love the Met, always an amazing experience.

Customer 3226.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3226.Content: Our waiter, Micheal, was excellent! He made us feel special for my husband 50th birthday dinner.

Customer 3227.Name: Paul
Customer 3227.Content: Clearly the Met is a 1st class steak house.  A knowledgeable wait staff that is on top of it, I see them buzzing around all the tables taking care of business. This is not your hoyti toyti stuffed shirt kind of place that have popped up all over Seattle these days so if that is what you're looking for then this is not the place for you.   The Met is an old school steak house, the vibe is fantastic. We had 4 different steaks cooked 4 different ways and they came out perfect.

Customer 3228.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3228.Content: The Met is by far one of my favorite places.  I love popping in for lunch and dinner.  The steaks are always done perfectly and service is always prompt and attentive.

Customer 3229.Name: Economist
Customer 3229.Content:
We saw our waiter ONCE. When I tried to get a refill for my drink I asked 3 different waiters...nothing, never got a refill throughout my entire meal. My steak sandwich was impressively  bad. The cut was terrible and I had to spit half of it out as it was not even chewable.  No service, bad food, terrible experience.
Love this place, not sure what was up with them that day.

Customer 3230.Name: ShorelineSue
Customer 3230.Content: We wanted a location for lunch with traditional Christmas decorations and The Met delivered. We had a great time and appreciated the wonderful service. In my opinion, the food is good but not great. My Cobb Salad with shrimp was impressive looking when it arrived but was mostly greens. It was a light lunch, which I enjoyed but not something I would order again. The other items ordered also looked great but came up just a little short on taste. Perhaps this is just a matter of personal preferences because the place was packed and others seemed to be really enjoying themselves.

Customer 3231.Name: SeattleCougFan
Customer 3231.Content: We've been coming here with my sister and husband as part of a holiday tradition for over 25 years. You just can't beat it! So fun and festive during the holidays!  Five stars in every category except value, of course, due it being rather pricey:)

Customer 3232.Name: DianeKK
Customer 3232.Content: Have been for dinner many times and this is a favorite.  Lunch did not disappoint, YUM!

Customer 3233.Name: Lulu
Customer 3233.Content:
Clubby atmosphere although could be updated a bit.  Meat is their specialty and it is indeed delicious!  However, 12 ounces (minimum for a prime rib) is too much and wish they would serve something smaller.  And the baked potato was also huge!  Could not finish my meal and I don't like to take a food bag into a concert.  
Restaurant is convenient to most everything down town although a few blocks off the beaten track for theatre and symphony.  You'll need the walk however after such a big meal.

Customer 3234.Name: Notcomingagain
Customer 3234.Content: I'm afraid the experience was not as good as it used to be.  I've eaten here since about 1995 and have always loved it and have never minded the higher price but not this time

Customer 3235.Name: BIvisitor
Customer 3235.Content: you sink into the booth and are treated like a special guest.  the food is off-the-charts exceptional.  the staff excel in their roles,  all of them, in every position and place in the restaurant.

Customer 3236.Name: KevinG
Customer 3236.Content: We come here every year for our anniversary. The Met never disappoints! Great service, fabulous food,  can't wait to come back!

Customer 3237.Name: Cruzinquick
Customer 3237.Content: Steak Salad can't be beat for a great lunch, almost guilt free!  Just right amount of juicy steak with greens to ease your conscience.  Good business spot for conversation when you get a booth.

Customer 3238.Name: Amanda
Customer 3238.Content: Best filet mignon and creme brulee we've ever had. We waited over 45 minutes for the meals though, which is the only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars for overall experience.

Customer 3239.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3239.Content:
I was looking for a special occasion, the food was good but the service did not elevate the experience I expect for a $125-50/per person meal.  

Several times I went with an empty drink, one guest had her steak taken back twice to get cooked right and ate 30 minutes after the other party members with no offer for free desert or anything to make up for this, I found that awkward.  The table was missing utensils for some courses over and over.

They definitely have a strong signature steak, too salty for me and I like to taste my meat.  We still had a great time, but for the price I've had a better experience elsewhere.

Customer 3240.Name: Richard
Customer 3240.Content: just a great place with a terrific (and exhaustive) wine list to help you wash down your meal! Appetizers,  and even the seafood choices are top drawer, but nothing beats the steak & chop offerings!

Customer 3241.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3241.Content: Disappointing. I went for the lunch burger and it was quantity not quality. I really think the burgers I had at Prime and even Tipsy cow in redmond were better. Gf's steak salad was ok but nothing that amazing either. I'll go there again for steak dinners but there's better choices for lunch. Service was fine.

Customer 3242.Name: Sharman
Customer 3242.Content: We had a group of 6.  It was much noisier than anticipated and hard to hear.  I would suggest taking lunch before 12:00, or after 1:00 to cut the noise.  Otherwise, the food and service were superb!

Customer 3243.Name: Latts
Customer 3243.Content: BEST steaks in all of Seattle ... truly amazing.  The service was outstanding and Rob the Bar Manager is absolutely the best and most customer service oriented Bar Tender/Manager I have ever met.  They truly care about customer satisfaction here.  Yes, it's expensive, but you will definitely walk away feeling like you go a great value for what you paid.  You know it's a special place when Bar Tenders and Waiter's have been working at a restaurant for 20 plus year.  Say's a lot for the ownership!  They know how to treat their employees right and their customers like kings.  Simple formula but few get it right.  The Met Grill nailed it!  Enjoy the experience, I promise you will NOT be disappointed!

Customer 3244.Name: Coop
Customer 3244.Content:
I travel the US and I have been to all the best. The Met is the best. From Service to food the best. You will never be disappointed. 

I Try to make it three to four times a year.

Customer 3245.Name: Betty
Customer 3245.Content: The Met has been on our "favorites" list for years.  Quality food and exceptional service.  Except for this visit.  I booked a table at the Met for my husband's 50th birthday and looked forward to the food and experience.  The service was exceptional, however, the food was sub-par, a true disappointment.  We were a table of 4, each of ordering a different cut of beef.  All four plates were over cooked and under flavored.  Side dishes tasted microwaved and from a box.  The bright side was our waiter, Chad.  He was up-beat, took very good care of our table, and treated my husband to a birthday dessert.  He gave OUTSTANDING service!  I have removed this restaurant from my favorites list because of the quality of food for the price.  Sad.

Customer 3246.Name: UvaldeKid
Customer 3246.Content: Great atmosphere, attentive staff and good food. Other than being a little pricey, this is a great place for any special occasion.

Customer 3247.Name: RichC
Customer 3247.Content: As usual this is a good place and you'll not likely be disappointed, until the bill comes that is! While it remains one of Seattle's best "steak houses" it also remains in my opinion highly over rated and over priced.

Customer 3248.Name: localeater
Customer 3248.Content: Had the steak sandwich, the best in town. Great value

Customer 3249.Name: bigdogdano
Customer 3249.Content: The Met, how do you say, FANTASTIC?!!  The best restaurant on the planet!!

Customer 3250.Name: Nora
Customer 3250.Content: We had been dining in this restaurant for the last 20 years.  We used to live here and worked at Seattle City Light and we come here for lunch.  Since we left WA for MN, we will always make and effort to come with our children who love this restaurant also.

Customer 3251.Name: rray
Customer 3251.Content: My wife and I booked the reservation to celebrate my birthday. We attended the Seahawks game and walked to the restaurant after. We were shown to our table immediately upon arrival which was nice as we had been standing for the last 4 hours. The wait staff was kind, professional, and knowledgeable. The place was quite busy within 20 min of our arrival. If your looking for great steaks! you have come to the right place. If you are looking for bargain prices you might be intimidated by the prices. We found some really nice middle ground on the menu that afforded us the opportunity to get what we both wanted. The 12 oz prime rib was excellent by the way! We did not have drinks so I can't really speak to the price or quality of the wine menu. We did finish the meal with carrot cake. I will tell you order only one as it was enough fro three people. It came with vanilla ice cream and was delicious. Overall very nice. If you have the means, I recommend that you give this place a go at least once. You will not be disappointed. Did I mention they have a 34 oz steak!

Customer 3252.Name: missD
Customer 3252.Content: At the beginning of football season I book a brunch reservation for the morning of every Seahawks afternoon home game. Forget tailgating. Glam-gating with mimosas and eggs Benedict at The Met is the BEST pre-game experience.

Customer 3253.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3253.Content:
Even though I made a reservation it took half an hour to set our table, the put us in the "chairman room" which is more like the "back room" not very nice
Steaks were very good, but were cold, one in my party sent it back because it was undercooked, instead of bringing a new one the brought back the same but now it was dry.
The waiter was in very bad mood.
Overall the restaurant at the main room seems very nice, at the back room it was the other way around.

Customer 3254.Name: nickdlc
Customer 3254.Content: Food was amazing and the service was great. Had the Wagyu Filet great choice flavorful cut.  Rodger was knowledgeable and entertaining.

Customer 3255.Name: Lunch
Customer 3255.Content: The steaks were delicious! They really do a nice job with the food and service. They even remembered to put a candle in the desert for my husband's birthday (which I had requested in the reservation). Even their house items are good.   I ordered the house salad greens which comes with lettuce,  sliced pear, candied walnuts  and Gorgonzola cheese and it was so good, so crispy and fresh. Yummy!

Customer 3256.Name: Mrchip56
Customer 3256.Content: This is simply the best steak place anywhere! From the cuts of meat, to the incredible side dishes, it all comes together for an awesome meal.

Customer 3257.Name: DouglasB
Customer 3257.Content: If people want a very expensive meal that is average in quality, this is the place.

Customer 3258.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3258.Content: This place is where all the celebrities eat. Our waiter showed us picture of him with Russel Wilson. My wife was impressed and that's all I wanted to do. I had the prime rib and it was perfect. I was a little disappointed that they didn't do the table side Baked potato like they used too? Maybe different waiters do it different but the las time I was their the waited asked us what we wanted on it and then fluffed it table side and then served it? Oh well. It was still an amazing evening! And they treated us to creme broulette  because it was our anniversary : )

Customer 3260.Name: Tony
Customer 3260.Content: The absolute best restaurant I've been to in Seattle!

Customer 3261.Name: Deptiger
Customer 3261.Content: Great menu and service is catered to getting out full and out the door before game time. Highly recommended for a change to your pre-game activities.

Customer 3262.Name: GDO1
Customer 3262.Content: We traditionally go to the Met before the Seahawks game and have brunch.  The service is always great but on the last visit the eggs/Joe's Scramble was very cold.  Steer clear and try the bendict of steak and eggs.  I think the scramble may have come out of a warming tray.

Customer 3263.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3263.Content: Our second time at the Met Grill was just as  excellent as our first. Both times we were celebrating my husband's birthday. The many servers we had were personable and skilled.  All were very professional, and the food was to die for. Wish we could dine there every week, but special occasions will have to do. When my husband checked in on Facebook, he received two comments: one from a friend in Boston who said the Met Grill was one of his all-time favorites in the world (he travels all over the world as a consultant), and another in Michigan raved about the Met Grill, saying she dined there when she visited her sister in Seattle.  We'll definitely return!!

Customer 3264.Name: Symphonydinner
Customer 3264.Content: Servers are the most professional that you can find, food is wonderful. Our service was a bit slow with picking up plates and toward the end of the meal last evening but overall, very good.

Customer 3265.Name: Mark
Customer 3265.Content: The food here is very good but the prices are way too high.

Customer 3266.Name: Kaps
Customer 3266.Content: Fabulous service, food cooked to perfection, superb wine and cocktail selection, all the bells and whistles you'd expect at a great steakhouse - done to a T.   As a vegetarian, I might ask they have a few more of their sides available without bacon, but I still found a good option or two for me and enjoyed the meal and the ambiance immensely.  Great for a special occasion coming up for the holidays.

Customer 3267.Name: Dano
Customer 3267.Content: One of the best steaks I've ever had ... exceptional.

Customer 3268.Name: KenR
Customer 3268.Content: A must have restaurant to visit when in Seattle. I love this place. Always the best!

Customer 3269.Name: JohnH
Customer 3269.Content: We had the best service and the thickest filet in town. It was a bone in filet and cooked perfectly charred on the outside and medium rare inside. You really can't get a better tasting steak in Seattle. Have been 6 times now and have never been disappointed. The quality of food and the wine list will blow you away. Then the best service and you have the perfect night out. I would highly recommend as a must try when in Seattle. I am from the great white North and I only wish we had a steak house that could compare. I can't wait until next time in Seattle.

Customer 3270.Name: Achingjaws
Customer 3270.Content: I just have an old-fashioned view that a $70 steak should be better than I can do at home. I found my NY Steak very chewy.

Customer 3271.Name: GeraldineC
Customer 3271.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is our go-to special occasion venue.  Great food and drink, ambiance and service.  You can't go wrong.

Customer 3272.Name: Happy
Customer 3272.Content: The price is on high end but impeccable services and buttery steaks were all worth it!

Customer 3273.Name: Benjamin
Customer 3273.Content: The atmosphere was relaxing and comforting. It was what I expected. The food was amazing. The service was perfect.

Customer 3274.Name: DiningLass
Customer 3274.Content: Any dinner at the Metropolitan Grill is a special occasion.  The servers (ours was Frank on this night) are exceptionally knowledgeable about every item on the menu.  This is one of the best steak places in metro Seattle, perhaps THE best.  There is a Portobello mushroom entrée (which I call a Portobello steak because of its size and shape) for vegetarians.  The Met is a bit of a strain on the wallet, so we reserve the Met for special occasions each year.

Customer 3275.Name: Trainguy10
Customer 3275.Content:
If you are in Seattle, go nowhere else but the Metropolitan. I have dined all over this country, and only now do I know the true meaning of a five star restaurant. 

The food, the atmosphere, the service, all five star. The prime rib is incredible, and that is coming from a die hard Lawry's worshipper. The onion soup superb, the crab cocktail and coconut shrimp terrific.

I think I would consider a return trip to Seattle just to visit the Met.  

Oh yes, don't let the price slow you down. I ate at Chandler's the night before and paid 25% more for less food, poorer quality, and lesser service. The Metropoitan is a bargain.

Customer 3276.Name: Coop
Customer 3276.Content:
Been the best for years and remains the best!

Best service in the US!!!!!!

Customer 3277.Name: Kristend
Customer 3277.Content: Always enjoy the Met.  I enjoy dinner menu more than lunch.

Customer 3278.Name: dahvoice
Customer 3278.Content: The food as usual was outstanding.  The service left something to be desired.  Beverages were not brought until after food arrived.  Food orders were not correct and had to be sent back.  Just an off day for the server, perhaps.  Very off.  Still a great place for lunch.

Customer 3279.Name: KarenB
Customer 3279.Content: I come whenever I am in Seattle. It certainly didn't disappoint this time. The steak was amazing and cooked perfectly, and the bananas foster is always a great end to the meal!

Customer 3280.Name: 420Squid
Customer 3280.Content:
I love this place! Whenever my cousin comes in from New Jersey we come here. It's an annual event and our family always looks forward to eating here.  

Thank you for the great service and amazing food!

Customer 3281.Name: lolavavoom
Customer 3281.Content: I promised my friend I would take him to the Metropolitan Grill when I got a new job. Finally we were able to go. We were treated so well. The service there is impeccable from the hostess to busboy to waiter. The spinach salad was the best I ever had. Great wine recommendation. I took off a star for food because I've had better salmon. My friend, however, was in raptures over his steak. And the flourless chocolate lava cake was out of this world.

Customer 3282.Name: SusanE
Customer 3282.Content: We went here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary and it was fabulous.  Great crab cakes a filet that melted in your mouth with yummy king crab legs.  We had the apple pie which was also yummy.  Especially loved when they flambed the apples tableside.  That was a real treat!

Customer 3283.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3283.Content: Very nice atmosphere.  Blackened  prime rib was a little tougher than expected.  Dessert (bananas fosters ) was the best ever!!!!!

Customer 3284.Name: Tucker10
Customer 3284.Content: Great steakhouse. Perfectly prepared steaks with impeccable service.

Customer 3285.Name: maninblack
Customer 3285.Content:
I went to the Metropolitan Grill based on its reputation as a premier steakhouse- its not-Murray's in Minneapolis is a great Steakhouse- Metropolitan Grill is not in its class for food, ambience, wine, character.
Its not bad- the oysters to start were absolutely fabulous- local Washington fare- really good- I was expecting great things at this point. Had the Fennel salad- what a misnomer- if you tell me its a fennel salad I expect fennel to be a feature- there were so many other flavors going on it was hard to tell if there was even fennel in it- The salad was good- it just wasn't a fennel salad.
Decided to go all out on the steak and had the three 4 Oz fillets including the high end wagyu- 12oz of steak for a $125 list price- I expected excellence- what I got was mediocrity- the high end cut was overpriced hiding the expected flavor- the cook was medium rare- I ordered rare.
Dessert was ridiculous- ordered the carrot cake- it was good but the portion was way too large- was the fact that they brought me such. A large portion meant to impress me- it didn't.
On the plus side, the martini was excellent- served with panache! The wine by the glass was OK- overpriced and probably not from a recently opened bottle, but OK
Overall if you want a high quality dining experience, don't go to the Metropolitan Grill- there are better places to spend a lot of money for food!

Customer 3286.Name: LaurenW
Customer 3286.Content: For all the hype of this place, I believe it to be over priced for what you get. There's little character or care, and I won't be returning.

Customer 3287.Name: memorable
Customer 3287.Content: When the event is one to be remembered - go to The Met. Every entree is delicious, staff is kind and courteous .

Customer 3288.Name: FoodieGuy
Customer 3288.Content: Great food, great service, excellent location, great dessert menu, attentive staff. Overall, excellent!

Customer 3289.Name: Walter
Customer 3289.Content: Service was very slow and my prime rib sandwich had so much gristle and fat I could hardly chew it.  I normally would complain, but was a working lunch and I would have been embarrassed.

Customer 3290.Name: Lewis3312
Customer 3290.Content: I selected this restaurant to celebrate my wife's birthday. Her coworkers insisted that we try it provided that we try all steak houses in Seattle. I must say that we was impressed by the service we received from the waiter and even the bus boy! I would recommend this restaurant for any occasion.

Customer 3291.Name: Pmac
Customer 3291.Content: The steak salad was awesome and i am excited in the future to try more food choices.

Customer 3292.Name: ChristopherH
Customer 3292.Content: Great time, good view of street for people watching.  Good service, good food

Customer 3293.Name: swthyperazngurl
Customer 3293.Content: My husband and I love steak so we always search for the best steak places whenever we travel.  For our 1 year wedding anniversary we tried Metropolitan Grill and it did not disappoint.   The steak was cooked perfectly, and was very delicious.  The waitstaff were also very friendly and attentive.  They made our evening extra special with some complimentary creme brulee to celebrate our 1 year.  They definitely made our 1 year a memorable one.  Thanks Metropolitan Grill!

Customer 3294.Name: Excellent
Customer 3294.Content: We had a wonderful experience, as usual. Service was unbeatable, and the food...well, the food speaks for itself. Great work Met!

Customer 3295.Name: Scotlad66
Customer 3295.Content: We have been to Ruth Crist and now the Met. We prefer Ruth's much more than the Met. The food was really overpriced for what you get, the service was not that exceptional and overall we do not plan to go back. Reputation was why we went, our wait staff was nice, but we have had better. The kids on the valet service were the nicest and the original hostess was very nice, they were the highlight. It was for a special occasion, a birthday, nothing special, no little touches even though I mentioned it when I made the rez, Last year we did the same at Ruth's, that was wonderful, this was lackluster overall.

Customer 3296.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3296.Content:
Nick and Rebecca were amazing!
Thank you

Customer 3297.Name: LWC123
Customer 3297.Content: Excellent, though noisy atmosphere; staff extremely was  attentive, seating a little cramped, best ribeye ever, but size was too much to eat at one sitting and being from out of town did not benefit from takeout; a bit over priced, even for the quality; parking attendants even offered to help acquire transportaion though we did not use valet parking, outstanding wine selection

Customer 3298.Name: superb
Customer 3298.Content: I never disappointed with Metropolitan Grill. So whenever I visit Seattle, I stop by this restaurant.

Customer 3299.Name: Steaker
Customer 3299.Content: Three out of four of us loved our meal.  My ribeye was a little tough and not very favorable.  I didn't say anything but in hindsight wish I had.  When you pay $65 for a steak it should be perfect.  This was my second trip to the Met and the first was absolutely perfect.

Customer 3300.Name: ScottiJ
Customer 3300.Content: The Met never disappoints.  While the food is fantastic, the service puts it all over the top.  When I walk in I feel like I belong there.  The staff is friendly, responsive, and proactive without hovering.  And Carmen Love, makes it all work.  This is one of my favorites.

Customer 3301.Name: HawksFan
Customer 3301.Content: Every time I go here on Seahawks Sunday,  it's always the best experience,  Thanks!!!

Customer 3302.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3302.Content: Food was amazing and everything cooked to perfection. We went for their Seahawks brunch and has got to be one of the best breakfast we had in a long time. Portion size was huge we could have easily shared a plate. We can't wait to go back again!

Customer 3303.Name: Max1
Customer 3303.Content: Best steakhouse in the Pacific Northwest. Amazingly delicious food. Fabulous staff and we were once again lucky to have Michael as our server. Every time we visit Seattle we have dinner at the Met Grill. Consistently outstanding!

Customer 3304.Name: Emmet
Customer 3304.Content: We had friends in from out of town and figured The Met would be a perfect spot.  Amazing appetizers and steaks.  The bone in filet special was outstanding.  The pasta was great.  All had a wonderful time and I couldn't recommend it more.

Customer 3305.Name: malskid
Customer 3305.Content: This has always been one of my very favorite restaurants in the country.  It never dissappoints

Customer 3306.Name: JayW
Customer 3306.Content:
Love dining at the Met. Outstanding food and atmosphere.

Our waiter was wonderful as well. 

Only negative I would say was that the sommelier had an attitude and was demeaning to us.

Customer 3307.Name: SeattleU92
Customer 3307.Content: Come for happy hour in the vibrant bar with staff that look after each customer as though they have known them for years, head to dinner with steaks and wine and service beyond superb, the Met always makes my visit to friends or colleagues the hit of the year.

Customer 3308.Name: Memo
Customer 3308.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a classic steak house.  I had the 8 oz filet mignon and it was cooked and seasoned perfectly.  Great cocktails, extensive wine list though very pricy (3x retail).

Customer 3309.Name: Vici
Customer 3309.Content: As always, the food was great!  Our wait staff was a little slow and actually forgot to bring the dessert menu.  However, that's an unusual occurrence and I will definitely return.

Customer 3310.Name: Bentley
Customer 3310.Content: We were coming home from airport and had a very nice dinner.  The food was excellent and we will go back.

Customer 3311.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3311.Content: Our server was unpleasant and took an extremely long time to take our order.  The Sommelier didn't want to give us the time of day and exuded arrogance.  We will never be back!

Customer 3312.Name: BuffyDunster
Customer 3312.Content: The service was efficient and affable.  Our steak was carved tableside so we were able to have equal portions of the Porterhouse.  We had creamed spinach, mashed potatoes and peppercorn sauce for sides-all amazing. I had had the onion soup in the past and it was still great. The crab cakes were amazing but be warned, they are definitely shareable.

Customer 3313.Name: EHDallas
Customer 3313.Content: Metropolitan Grill never disappoints.  The food is outstanding and the wine list is expansive and has a great selection of local wines from the great Pacific Northwest.  I try to never miss it when I am in Seattle.

Customer 3314.Name: schwarzie
Customer 3314.Content: great service.  steaks were a little on the salty side but otherwise good food. would definitely recommend to others...

Customer 3315.Name: LoveFood
Customer 3315.Content: This was my second meal to Metropolitan Grill. Best restaurant and meal ever. A fabulous meal and outstanding service. I can't possibly say enough.

Customer 3316.Name: Friends
Customer 3316.Content: I've been coming to The Met with my family since I was young and it is still my favorite spot. I just brought  two of my good friends here for dinner and we had a fabulous time. It was their first time. I requested Noi and he never disappoints. We had such a good time that we will be back. Also, thank you for always making it special for my family and I when we come in.

Customer 3317.Name: WendyB
Customer 3317.Content: Excellent food and outstanding, professional service not found elsewhere..

Customer 3318.Name: Lovely1
Customer 3318.Content: Dinning at The Met is always a pleasure.  Entertaining clients from out of state and they absolutely loved the atmosphere, wait staff, food, wine and the overall experience.

Customer 3319.Name: Mathias
Customer 3319.Content: I went to The Metropolitan Grill with my buddies, in oktober 2015. We went there because we wanted to celebrate a birthday. It was very good food and good service, but the best thing was when we told that we were there because of a birthday - they gave away a free Creme Bruleé and it just gave them the fifth star in service

Customer 3320.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3320.Content: it's restaurants like this, that make vacations very memorable.........atmosphere, food and service were second to none.....and over 2000 wines to choose from.......we had zero complaints from 6 hungry foodies......

Customer 3321.Name: TheMet
Customer 3321.Content: Excellent service.  Wine steward chatted, answered questions, etc.  Wonderful restaurant.

Customer 3322.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3322.Content: We visited the Metropolitan Grill to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary.   The evening was wonderful.  The service was great and the food was amazing. It was a great choice for our celebration and we would recommend the Grill to anyone looking for great food, service and a wonderful place to celebrate.

Customer 3323.Name: mah5
Customer 3323.Content: Dined at the Metropolitan Grill for our anniversary.  Everything was superb including food and service.  Would definitely go again for special occasions and recommend to friends.

Customer 3324.Name: CheleBele
Customer 3324.Content: Wow, what a fantastic restaurant! I found via reviews on Trip Advisor. The Metroplitan Grill was perfect in every way. But I have to say what made it extra special was our Server Todd S. He was so kind, so knowledgable, and perfectly attentive to all our needs.  He was hilarious and filled with the history of The Met which was very intriguing. Our food was out of this world. I had the King Salmon and my husband had the filet. We enjoyed the entire night and all of the staff, Charles too, were wonderful.

Customer 3325.Name: mikem
Customer 3325.Content: Made a late reservation but we were seated as soon as we arrived. It was shortly after the Seahawks-Bears game and the place was rockin' with happy 'Hawks fans, especially when QB Russell Wilson passed through with his entourage. The bar was packed and very noisy, with lots of walk-ins waiting for tables.  Service nevertheless was first rate and the food was great -we tried the Wagyu sirloin and a filet. Both were delicious and perfectly cooked and the portions were very large.  Nice cocktails and a comprehensive wine list. All in all a great experience (except for being a Bears fan).

Customer 3326.Name: AMoreno
Customer 3326.Content: Seeing Russell Wilson and also Joel McHale.

Customer 3327.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3327.Content: Had dinner after a Seahawk game with out of town friends.  Wonderful service but not great food, which was a surprise.  Steak had to go back twice and my salmon was dry!  It will be a while before we go back for a meal.....love the bar scene so we will stick to that!

Customer 3328.Name: AlyR
Customer 3328.Content: Definitely try the steak and eggs for Seahawks gameday brunch! Great portion of eggs and potatoes, and perfectly cooked steak! Trust me, you won't regret it!

Customer 3329.Name: thebeachkid
Customer 3329.Content: Had brunch before attending the Seahawks game. Food was excellent, service was top notch and a fun time was had by all.

Customer 3330.Name: Ballerina
Customer 3330.Content: Average food, snail-like service. Restaurant was not up to the hype. A disappointment .

Customer 3331.Name: Dogbert95
Customer 3331.Content: Visited the MET again... and it again met all expectations.  Steak options were ABUNDANT, and they were cooked PERFECTLY.  The Sides were tasty complements to the main dish.  We didn't eat appetizers this time... but the salads were outstanding.  Drink menu was extensive and the wine served was in GREAT shape.  Service is slower than fast food (as expected at a busy restaurant like this), but you can enjoy the ambiance and company while you're waiting between courses.  Waiter attentiveness was EXCELLENT!  It's pricy, so not everyone would want to come here, but for special occasions, or if you just like a good steak... there's no better place than the Metropolitan Grill in downtown Seattle.

Customer 3332.Name: IamB
Customer 3332.Content: Celebrated our anniversary here while in Seattle. The restaurant is elegant, the service is great and the food is wonderful. The Met is known for its steaks but offers other dishes for non-steak eaters. We had early reservations for a Saturday evening. By 5:45 the place was packed, so be sure to make reservations especially on the weekend. We took a taxi from our hotel and were offered, and took, a town car back for a $10 flat fee. We were impressed all around and will definitely dine here again.

Customer 3333.Name: Warren
Customer 3333.Content: Too many people but if you are looking for best American Food in Seattle, this is definitely the very best choice.

Customer 3335.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3335.Content: Filet Mignon was tough.  everything else was great.

Customer 3336.Name: Jack
Customer 3336.Content: It's hard to have a bad meal here.  It's all about beef with a sprinkle of fish.  Whatever they do, it's done professionally and with a sense of confidence that makes it the choice for bringing clients and friends.  You always what you will get, and the service is always great.

Customer 3337.Name: Greg51
Customer 3337.Content: This is the place to go for a great steak! Pull up they park your car. They seat you on time according to your reservation. We go 4 times a year as they never disappoint.

Customer 3338.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3338.Content: Went here for an anniversary dinner while in Seattle. Steaks were phenominal, desserts were great as well. My only complaint is that I felt like my stomach was going to explode afterwards. Kudos on getting the portions right :)

Customer 3339.Name: LolKitty
Customer 3339.Content: Great service and wonderful food.  Loved everything about it.  For a once a year treat, this is the place we go.  Great for gluten free.  Many options and staff was great for the dietary awareness.

Customer 3340.Name: ChristiR
Customer 3340.Content: Great atmosphere and service. Kevin in the bar was a great host. Blue cheese salad was the high light. Prawn cocktail neede better sauce, more horse radish?  Steak is typical, nothing great. Cobbler desert was runny and lacked crust.

Customer 3341.Name: AESeattle
Customer 3341.Content: If you're looking for the best steak in Seattle, look no further. If you're looking for an enormous selection of fine wine and other drinks, look no further. Highly recommend this place, if you're looking for a great, cozy dinner.

Customer 3342.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3342.Content: Went here for our 20 year wedding anniversary. Everything was perfect and the staff treated us like royalty.

Customer 3343.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3343.Content: Was recommended to eat at this steakhouse and having eaten at many 4 and 5 star steakhouses  this was mediocre at best....I never have a problem paying $$$$ when it is actually worth it...this wasn't. ...service was very good though

Customer 3344.Name: KenM
Customer 3344.Content: We went here to celebrate our 1st anniversary. We were going for a great steakhouse experience and this fit the bill. Between choosing from Hokkaido, Ohmi, American Kobe, and US cuts, we had two amazing steaks, great sides, and delicious appetizers. Our service was good, though they didn't check back to see if our steaks were cooked to our liking until we were both 1/3+ through them; fortunately, they were.

Customer 3345.Name: ThatGuyJohn
Customer 3345.Content:
I live and work in the Seattle area and this was my third trip to the Metropolitan Grill (or "The Met" as it is locally known) .  Each time I have been there I was served by the same person, Bruno.  Of Bruno I have nothing but the best things to say.  He is charming, knowledgeable, very professional, but also very personable without being fake.  

As a dinner I am very observant of service, and my wife would be quick to tell you that I can be very critical at times.  From my three trips to The Met I have seen and heard nothing but excellent service from each and every staff member.  The experience for me is always exceptional.

Dinners should note that The Met is a very Seattle institution; you should expect to see families and casually dressed people.  This is not the stuffier, dimly lit, cigar room experience of other steak houses.  Nor is this a super hip dinning destination where all the wait staff is comprised of attractive 20 somethings. The Met is a place for friends, for family, and for great steak.

List of Steaks I've Had at the Met:
1. Bone in Rib Eye
2. New York Strip
3. Long Bone Rip Eye (a.k.a 40 ounces of love). My wife had the US Prime fillet and Waygu fillet combination.

Customer 3346.Name: Nancy
Customer 3346.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is our favorite place for a special celebration meal.  It was fabulous.  Consistently great service and great food.  We had made a special request the day before for 2 twice baked potatoes and it was not forgotten.  Love, love, love the Met.

Customer 3347.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3347.Content: 35 day dry aged 13 Oz filet mignon with a blue cheese fromage was the best steak I have had.  Great service, great wine and top of the line steaks.  Our group of 4 were all very happy and full when we left

Customer 3348.Name: rphmike
Customer 3348.Content:
Bananas foster was prepared tableside, nice presentation, large portion, more than enough for 2.
Steaks were well cooked and delicious.

Customer 3349.Name: LJC13
Customer 3349.Content: We dined at Metropolitan six years ago.  So, when we found out we'd be spending a weekend in Seattle we immediately made a reservation.  It was just as fantastic as we remembered.  Some of the same staff, from six years ago, were even still working.  Amazing food, amazing ambiance, amazing service.  Looking forward to our next visit to Seattle & dinner at Metropolitan!

Customer 3350.Name: DISCUS
Customer 3350.Content: THEY TRIED TO PUT SIX LARGE ADULTS IN A CORNER  BOOTH.  WE REQUESTED TO BE MOVED BUT THEY REFUSED.  NOT IMPRESSED WITH THE TWO YOUNG GIRLS AT THE RECEPTION DESK.  GET SOMEONE WHO IS OLDER AND MORE IMPRESSIVE.

Customer 3351.Name: PDXer
Customer 3351.Content:
melt-in-your-mouth prime rib... best ever!
(root veggies a little undercooked)

Customer 3352.Name: madison1223
Customer 3352.Content: Favorites off the menu- will not be back when better options around.

Customer 3353.Name: Wilpo
Customer 3353.Content: I've tried many steak houses over the years. The Met consistently, hands down, is the absolute, 100% best experience out of all of them. The cuts and the service are second to none. Nothing is cheap... In every sense of the phrase. Truly lives up to "you get what you pay for". If my wife and I have something to celebrate, this is our spot.

Customer 3354.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3354.Content: Awesome everything. From the valet parking to the desert. I even met Michael Bennett by the bar. The night was complete!

Customer 3355.Name: MikeNBonnie
Customer 3355.Content:
Second visit in a few years while visiting Seattle. Remembered a great, less noisy ambience. The old wood, glass, brass, etc makes for a classy environment.  BUT we were seated next to a rowdy crowd of (mostly) males who thought they were still at the bar we guess.  Ear splitting! 

Nonetheless, our table service was exceptional in every way. The waiter knew everything about the menu and kept us in the corner of his eye (never intrusive though) all evening.  He was busy, too.  The wine steward was very helpful as well.

My wife and I both had excellent ribeye with mushrooms, done as requested.  An appetizer of lightly fried callimari in a red pepper sauce was delicious.  Perfectly accompanied by a J Lohr Hilltop Cabernet.  Sorry, no room for dessert.

In sum, we were glad we went back, and we would definitely do it again if given the opportunity.

Customer 3356.Name: CandyJT
Customer 3356.Content:
The Met is what I believe a steakhouse should be with great food and service.  I've eaten here several times over many years and have always had a great meal and my birthday dinner was no exception.  Our steaks were cooked perfectly and the Yukon potato cakes and cedar planked mushrooms were also delicious.  Salad was also excellent, as was my vodka martini.  

My wife had asked the restaurant if they would make beef carpaccio special for me in that it was my birthday.  Currently it has been rotated off the menu, however they honored her request and it was terrific.  They also provided me any desert I wanted without charge, so we got the seven layer chocolate cake - Yum!

This is a wonderful special occasion restaurant that does an outstanding job with both food and service.  We'll be back and we highly recommend it.

Customer 3357.Name: Kuckert
Customer 3357.Content: Stopped on way to catch light rail to SEATAC Thursday evening. Used opentable in am to confirm table at 1745. 10min early but got us right in. Everyone super polite. Checked luggage into coat room (free but do tip). Told waiter we were a little pressed for time and made sure everything went quickly. Had the tenderloin special...AWESOME!! Enough we could split it. Wrapped up and into the James ST terminal in 6min. Highly recommend as a preflight meal before heading to SEATAC.

Customer 3358.Name: GeorgiaGirl
Customer 3358.Content:
Phenomenonal steaks and specialty drinks.
Ask for Nick.  His service was flawless & professional w/ an aide of comical fun!
Pricey but, oh so worth it!!

Customer 3359.Name: Siko
Customer 3359.Content: Last Night in Seattle and so much Fun! WE will always remember the best Steak in town and best Service by Jim! More Tabasco please 😄

Customer 3360.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3360.Content: I've had mixed results at this restaurant in the past.  Today's lunch was very good - food was perfectly cooked and the service was impeccable.   The added "bites from the kitchen" comp was a nice touch, delicious.   Most important, the steaks here continue to be top notch.

Customer 3361.Name: Reds2Bengals
Customer 3361.Content: The steaks were very tender and cooked perfectly.  The creamed spinach and garlic mashed were excellent.  Our server, Juergen, was outstanding, in fact the best we have had in a long time as he was extremely customer oriented in every way.

Customer 3362.Name: CullenW
Customer 3362.Content: The Met is one of a kind and it simply is the BEST restaurant of its type anywhere.  From the time you make the reservation until the valet returns your car, you are treated to a first class dining experience unlike anything else in Seattle.  Known of course for their steaks, they also offer several other options for those not inclined to eat red meat that evening.  The wine list is without equal as well.  The staff from the hostess to the buser are all of the highest quality.  The wait staff see to your every need, usually before you even realize you have it.

Customer 3364.Name: ChrisL
Customer 3364.Content: We went there for a birthday dinner. The food was great and so was the service!  Good wine and cocktails!

Customer 3365.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3365.Content: Dinner was amazing!  Learned about Met Grill from the AA inflight magazine and decided to give it a shot.  They offer a filet mignon sampler that will knock your socks off.   Steak was cooked to absolute perfection - and the service was great.  While an expensive meal, prices were in line for the experience.

Customer 3366.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3366.Content: Outstanding steak, delicious onion soup and a wonderful banana foster prepared table side to finish off.  I fantastic place to have a celebration lunch with friends - friendly, engaging service with good food and drinks.

Customer 3367.Name: osomekh
Customer 3367.Content:
Dining at The Met. Steakhouse is consistently a positive experience. The food is always good, the service is attentive but still light-touch, and I always leave looking forward to my next opportunity to dine there again.
