Keep up the great work!

Customer 3368.Name: Benizzibrhat
Customer 3368.Content:
I have heard several "foodies" say this is the best steak they've ever had, so of course we had to go. I will definitely agree that the steak selection is probably the most impressive I've ever seen, as is the wine list. They are not cheap, but I think one expects that from this establishment.
We started with the baked Brie, which was delicious! 
Then we decided to share the New York strip for 2, prepared tableside. Both the waiter and server raved it was their favorite steak on the menu, and that is saying something considering the prices for some of the other choices were upwards of $200.00
It was cooked perfectly and plated beautifully. (Be prepared to wait 30-40 minutes after you order)
Now for the part you really want to hear,,,,,,, it was good,,,,, but it was just good. The roasted root veggies were delicious and the Brussel sprouts were fair. I honesty make better tasting steaks myself. After everything I heard and looking at the menu and the decor in here, I expected amazing, mind blowing, melt in your mouth highly flavorful steak. But it was just good. 
We also had the apple pie prepared tableside. Again, very fun, very dramatic (it's enough to feed 4!) but just good. It's very very sweet. Best part was the ice cream. That was wonderful!
All in all a lovely place. Feels very old vegas. Service was impeccable. Really first rate. A fun night out and worth it to go at least once.

Customer 3369.Name: Linda
Customer 3369.Content: We went to Metropolitan Grill to celebrate my son's birthday, and he mainly wanted steak. He was not disappointed. The steaks and everything else were perfect. Very expensive, but worthwhile for a special occasion.

Customer 3370.Name: TVW640
Customer 3370.Content: Nice old classic steak house feel.   Wait staff in white jackets and ties,  some in tuxedos.   The food quality was very good,  although I think a  bit over priced,  but it is city dining.   Table side prepared bananas Foster was amazing.   Excellent service.

Customer 3371.Name: Curtis
Customer 3371.Content: We arrived before the garage officially opened but saw a car inside with someone in the driver seat. The gentleman came over to us and introduced himself as Thomas with the Valet crew and stated that they were not open yet. When I explained that I had left my parents in the bar waiting for me. He again introduced himself and assured me that even though he was out of uniform he would be more than happy to take my keys and bring me the parking voucher as soon as he could. An amazing young man who demonstrated perfect customer service skills and attitude.

Customer 3372.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3372.Content:
Took a 2 week vacation, driving and staying in San Fran, Napa, Mendocino, Trinidad, Bandon, Newberg/Portland, finishing up in Seattle. It was our first trip North of Napa. Met Grill was our last night, and intended to be our capstone event. Instead, we were highly disappointed, and included the two separate glasses of red wine, the salad, and especially the prime/dry aged steaks. No comparison with many other high end steak restaurants, both chain and independent. 
Our waiter Scott was very good. The potatoes and bread were good. Overall, it was a $300 bust.

Customer 3373.Name: JCP3
Customer 3373.Content: Excellent service by Todd and Kevin. Let us relax and settle in with drinks and the menu. Helped us with the numerous great selections and all our dinners were cooked to perfection. Highly recommended

Customer 3374.Name: MYLAFASHION
Customer 3374.Content:
The dinner was real nice we whent there for our 25th anniversary 
The filet mignon just melted in my mouth  we will go back

Customer 3375.Name: jarrodjob
Customer 3375.Content:
The Met provides intimate business experiences for lunch on a daily basis.  Each table is setup to make the conversation feel intimate and focused.

I appreciate the professionalism of the wait staff.  From subtle deferment of their walking paths to allow you to path your way to the washroom, to the eye contact when you order.

Trust is established.  Dependable for a great lunch.

Customer 3376.Name: Alwayseating
Customer 3376.Content: Noisy crowded table, steaks not cooked correctly. So-so service

Customer 3377.Name: Chris
Customer 3377.Content: I travel to Seattle 2 or 3 times a year.  I ALWAYS have one meal at the Met.  The food is wonderful, however portions are too large for most to finish.  And the service is prompt but not overbearing.  You are allowed as much time as you want to relax and visit and never feel rushed.  It is my favorite steak house

Customer 3378.Name: Frank
Customer 3378.Content: The food was excellent and our waiter was very helpful and informative.

Customer 3379.Name: NFlover
Customer 3379.Content: I visited this restaurant alone.  Although I reserved a table, I had to wait more than 10mins. But another groups came after me did had tables before my table is ready.    And it was too much to eat one portion for me. Some families were enjoying dinner there, so I suppose it is good restaurant for family who share entree.  But for me, it was hard to find a comfortable food, table and service.

Customer 3380.Name: Davesue1
Customer 3380.Content: We came here for our 24th wedding anniversary and it was really a great dinner from start to finish. Would recommend to anyone that loves a GREAT steak, service. It was all wonderful!

Customer 3381.Name: Thread
Customer 3381.Content:
I'm not sure if it's because I had high expectations.  But it wasn't worth the money spent. The food was ok.   It wasn't bad but it wasn't great.  The service was slow.  Although the guy filling the water was on it.  
It just didn't seem like the fancy restaurant everyone told me it was. 
I don't think I'll be going back.

Customer 3382.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3382.Content: The food and service were terrific and the atmosphere was much less formal than I expected. We were happy to see many people wearing jeans and dressed casually. While you could dress up, you don't have to. The wedge salad was one of the best I have had, Brussels sprouts with bacon were fabulous and I loved the roasted root vegetables that came with the steak. Steaks were amazing and perfectly cooked. The desserts were huge-honestly you should order one and split between two or three people- and I'm not talking about the ones that are supposed to be shared. I loved the carrot cake with makers mark vanilla ice cream. It is my new benchmark for carrot cake excellence. We really enjoyed everything about our dinner here.

Customer 3383.Name: CousinVinny
Customer 3383.Content: Very posh and elegant; upscale through out. Our waiter, Michael, was very helpful and friendly which was a treat. The cuisine was another level above all the fine restaurants that we have dined at from around the country. I would put MG up against any restaurant in San Fran or NY.

Customer 3384.Name: TrojanPhotographer
Customer 3384.Content: Dined last night at the Met. I've been many times but this was one of the worst ( yet scores high - so you should understand most nights its 5+ ⭐️S.  The food was perfect as usual but the service was slow - very slow. You expect a relax pace, but the servers were not attentive. Water glasses we empty, apologies from the waiter for taking so long, etc. after we got out dessert menus it must have been 20 minutes before he came back to take our order.

Customer 3385.Name: BobH
Customer 3385.Content: Good food located in Downtown area of Seattle.  Quality establishment that was very busy.

Customer 3386.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3386.Content: Wonderful restaurant! I have lived here my whole life and this was the first time eating there. Enjoyed it thoroughly. It was a special occasion so we splurged a bit! Most money I've ever spent on a meal. From the get go they made us feel welcome and helped us celebrate. They even provided us complimentary dessert for our occasion.

Customer 3387.Name: Gator
Customer 3387.Content: I was my sons 18th birthday dinner. So I brought him and his sister in. Our server Dianne was incredible...

Customer 3388.Name: GeorgeG
Customer 3388.Content: Go there regularly, and have always been amazed by how friendly everyone is, from the hosts to the servers to the managers.

Customer 3389.Name: Augie
Customer 3389.Content: The Metropolitan Grill does not lack for superb steaks. They were mouthwatering & you could choose from an abundance of sauces.  I tried the lobster bisque for starters & it did not disappoint. It was creamy & had just the right amount of spice. It was the best I've ever had.  We also shared asparagus at our table with a light cheese sauce. Delicious! We each had bake potatoes that were huge & cooked to perfection. It also came with a cheese sauce that paired well with the potatoe. It was my birthday, so we finished with complimentary creme brûlée. Crispy on top & creamy in the center. Perfection!

Customer 3390.Name: VinnieBob
Customer 3390.Content: The service was excellent and the steaks were fantastic. We started with the crab cakes appetizer, which had three 2-2 ½ inch crab cakes with a delicious salad.  The standard filet mignon was exceptionally tender. A friend had the top cap sirloin which he also loved. Desserts are gigantic and the carrot cake could be shared by 2 or 3 people. The wine list is very extensive.

Customer 3391.Name: stunning
Customer 3391.Content: Bruno's service was impeccable and friendly. The space is stunning, with lovely classic decor. The food was out of this world! Amazing clam chowder and this melt-in-your-mouth little beef appetizer, I wish I could have tried everything, because I'm sure it would have all been amazing!

Customer 3392.Name: jkcjr
Customer 3392.Content: excellent steak. great service. seattle's finest steak restaurant

Customer 3393.Name: Share67
Customer 3393.Content: Great place to eat if you like top notch meat and seafood. Food quality and preparation was cooked as ordered and the crab cocktail was outstanding. Our waiter was very attentive and knowledgable. The wine steward was very helpful and had a great since of humor. Would definitely go back when we return.

Customer 3394.Name: Matt
Customer 3394.Content: Food was very good but not great IMO. The service was slow and the staff didn't seem to care. Got a bottle of decent wine ($150ish) and the wine steward seemed annoyed he had to serve it, came off as like he didn't feel we were worthy of his attention. My first somewhat negative experience with The Met. Usually it's top notch. Hope this isn't a trend.

Customer 3395.Name: Diane
Customer 3395.Content: Being new to Seattle we wanted to celebrate my grandson's 21st birthday at a great restaurant. I was told that the Metropolitan Grill was the place to go. Our waiter, Todd went beyond our expectations. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an exceptional restaurant in Seattle.

Customer 3396.Name: Doug
Customer 3396.Content: I was going to have the Prime Rib but Diane the waitress talked me into on of their juicy steaks.  Wow was she right on.  She told me I can get a Prime Rib anywhere.  The food was fantastic and the atmosphere was wonderful.  Right in downtown Seattle, I would recommend this for a special occasion or a fun night out.

Customer 3397.Name: gallagrrrr
Customer 3397.Content: This is a great lunch place if you are getting together with friends.  It is a bit too noisy to have a business or working lunch here.  The service is attentive and the meals are excellent.

Customer 3398.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3398.Content: We were well taken care of by the staff at The Met.  They certainly know how to take care of their guests

Customer 3399.Name: arikohn
Customer 3399.Content: Near my office, but I wouldn't go there unless the service was great and food at least good.  With The Metropolitan Grill we enjoy stupendously excellent service and very, very good food.  Best place in King County for business lunches - no doubt about it.

Customer 3400.Name: Tina
Customer 3400.Content: Celebrated our wedding anniversary and couldn't have picked a nicer spot.  The food was amazing (steaks done to perfection and exactly as ordered) and Michael provided first class service, always there when we needed but did not rush us or hover.  We won't wait so long to go back next time!

Customer 3401.Name: rainierclimber
Customer 3401.Content: Has been several years since Ive eaten at this Seattle dinning "hot spot." Food was cooked to perfection and I enjoyed ever bite. Noise level was distracting as the "gamers" were in town for their convention. Many of these folks drank as if there was no tomorrow. Other than having to put up with these morons, everything met my expectations.

Customer 3402.Name: foodforthought
Customer 3402.Content:
We've been going here for 15 years when we're in Seattle.  Very good steak house (I rank Arroyo Chophouse-Pasadena and Lucky's-Santa Barbara ahead).  The place is always packed and you need a reservation, maybe you can eat at the bar without one.  Good cocktails and wine list.
It seems the food is slipping a bit because of the volume they have to crank out every night.  Had a filet and wagu to compare taste and thought wagu didn't justify upcharge---be careful because they want to pour au jou over your meat at the table which really distorts the taste.  The scalloped potato side looked like it had been sitting in a sheet pan too long as the cheese on top was not hot.
Brussels sprouts were good.  Service was hurried and not particularly friendly (forgot his name);  which is a change from prior visits.
Kevin did his masterful job of tableside bananas foster, always a treat for first time guests......he definitely has put in his 10,000 hours!  Sommelier was helpful in narrowing down a red varietal for us.  We spent $500 for 2.

Customer 3403.Name: JamesB
Customer 3403.Content: We had a great experience and overall service and food were on point in all aspects. What caught us off guard were the menu prices. Had I seen the menu prior to arriving we would have gone somewhere else for dinner. Not wanting to do the walk of shame after seeing the menu, my wife and I did our best to be conservative. I have been to many high end steakhouses in both the U.S. and Canada and this is by far the most expensive. It seems uneccessarily expensive and the prices along would keep me from returning.

Customer 3404.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3404.Content: Súper  !! Te best meat  ever !!! Love the service !!!

Customer 3405.Name: Theindiefoodiereview
Customer 3405.Content:
To start our server Bruno was amazing! We were here for our honeymoon and Bruno explained everything from meat cuts, marbling rating, and how and where the beef was raised. It is pricey but well worth every little penny. A dinner for two with a few drinks each will run 200-300 with tip unless you go for the $112.00 steak which I do not doubt is worth every little penny. The wine selection is literally a novel that is easy to navigate with the largest selection I have ever seen (we've seen a lot as we live in Sonoma Co.) and the mixed drinks had a perfect balance of ingredients. cocktails run from $8.00-14.00, beer $5-14, and wine was all over the map. Everything we put into our mouth was amazing from deep fried artichoke hearts, wild mushroom mix, peach salad, crab cakes (best I have ever had hands down), and finally the Prime Rib! The Prime Rib was simply phenomenal all the way around from the presentation to the taste! Thanks you Bruno for making our night so special.

-Q&J 
Sonoma County, California

Customer 3406.Name: outtoeat
Customer 3406.Content:
We were visiting Seattle for a day and this restaurant was recommended to me.   We decided to check it out before dinner to see what to wear.  The staff were super friendly.  We had a drink at the bar and the bartender and Maitre D'
 were great.  Nice dark wood, steak house looking place.  When we came back they remembered us from earlier and treated us royally.  The food was delicious.  We had appetizers that were great, full meals and desserts!  And the waiter who was our good friend by mid meal even brought out favorite treats of his for us to try.  Just a really fun meal, friendly people and a wonderful bon voyage to our cruise!

Customer 3407.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3407.Content: We celebrated our 40 Wedding Anniversary at the Met!  Service was excellent as was the food and setting.  You will Love it!

Customer 3408.Name: MrRay
Customer 3408.Content: Great food --- great service !!!  A must for travelers to Seattle.  Bring your wallet !!!

Customer 3409.Name: WandA
Customer 3409.Content: We went here for our anniversary. We were given a table in the back which was nice. The food was incredible and the service was great. Would definitely recommend. Be willing to spend $200 or more.

Customer 3410.Name: SeattleFoodie
Customer 3410.Content:
My wife and I dined at The Met for the first time on Friday, July 31st, 2015. We were very excited. We were celebrating my wife being cancer free. Hooray! 

We typically can't afford to go to a place like The Met often, so this was a special treat. We were 15 minutes early for our reservation but were greeted warmly by the hostesses and seated immediately which was nice. However, we sat for at least 5 minutes before being greeted. When our server arrived, she informed us that she had just got out of a shift meeting among the staff. No worries though, she was polite and apologetic. 

We ordered a round of cocktails, my wife ordered a 'Light and Lovely' and I, Woodford Reserve Bourbon on the rocks. Delish!Seeley, could tell we were in no rush and graciously obliged us. 
After finishing our drinks we ordered. We started with the crab cakes. We were pleasantly surprised to see that this was a generous portion of crab cakes, 3 in all. The crab cakes were well seared and settled in a butter sauce and cabbage slaw. They were good, but light on crab meat. They were filled with stuffing and even vegetables. Who knew carrots were in crab cakes?

For our next course we ordered Lobster Bisque. This was perhaps our biggest disappointment. In both our bowls, not one tangible piece or lobster. And to make matters worse, there was a gargantuan amount of creme fraiche and chives garnished on top. My wife hates chives and we did not know they would be served on the bisque. I know most garnishes aren't listed on the menu, but this was too much. It skewed the entire bisque. So thumbs down on the bisque. 

For our entrees, my wife ordered prime rib (MR) and I had the Ribeye (MR). My wife's prime rib was outstanding! Best we've ever had! But unfortunately, instead of receiving a ribeye like I ordered, I received a New York Strip. It was cooked to perfectly MR so I didn't complain. After all, we were out to celebrate my wife's health. The Strip Steak was average for a top tier restaurant.

Customer 3411.Name: Locals
Customer 3411.Content: We enjoyed our experience and much should be attributed to our server and her ability and desire to fill our every request.  She had been with the Grill for over 25 years so that must speak to something good about the venue.

Customer 3412.Name: Oceanview7
Customer 3412.Content: Every time to go to Metropolitan Grill I am impressed and delighted.  Superior food and service.

Customer 3413.Name: Chris
Customer 3413.Content: After reading all the wonderful reviews, we were all very disappointed in our experience here.  The service was good but the food was not.  Great appetizers but the prime rib was a salt ball and had to be sent back.  We replaced this with the halibut which was sadly very dry.  Not one of my best steak house experience.  This is very expensive and if the food was good ok, but it was not.  There are other good steak restaurants in the area.  Proceed with caution here.

Customer 3414.Name: Commuter1
Customer 3414.Content: Lunch was wonderful. The waitress highly recommended the grilled seafood salad which was exquisite and reasonably priced. Wait staff were very attentive. A very enjoyable experience!

Customer 3415.Name: RWID07292015
Customer 3415.Content: When seated, we were asked if there were time constraints, which there weren't.  Despite not needing to be anyway, the service was unreasonably slow.

Customer 3416.Name: Donu
Customer 3416.Content: Food was excellent (as usual) and the waiter was excellent also (as usual).  Love the Met!

Customer 3417.Name: Bjc1
Customer 3417.Content: Consistently good.  Servers are knowledgable, providing solid recommendations...it ain't cheap, but the best thins rarely are

Customer 3418.Name: LaneD
Customer 3418.Content: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday knowing that it was a bit of a treat due to the pricey menu. I was told by a friend that the price would be worth it and I would never forget how delicious the steak was. My friend was right. I had the steak medallions topped with lobster and asparagus with hollandaise sauce and it was the best meal I have ever had. The restaurant itself is super charming, kind of an old school but sophisticated feel. The server was knowledgeable and made good recommendations. I really loved it here and although it was very expensive it was a very nice treat and I will go back.

Customer 3419.Name: Neal
Customer 3419.Content: Best steakhouse in Seattle. Our steaks were cooked perfectly and the service was outstanding.

Customer 3420.Name: Vici
Customer 3420.Content: Took the department for lunch as a "fond farewell" for a much liked employee.  The service was fast and friendly.  The waitperson comp-ed a dessert as a contribution to the occasion.  All in all - a very pleasant experience.

Customer 3421.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3421.Content: Overall fine experience. Great waitress. My steak was delicious but my wife's fish and chips was over cooked and below average taste. The bar area was loud and sounded like a cafeteria . We couldn't hear the standards music being played in the background until the place cleared out near closing time.

Customer 3423.Name: Voldds
Customer 3423.Content: Smell when you walk in is bad and you can tell it was once a nice resteraunt but it has not been very well maintained  drinks were served with lipstick on the rim of a glass and wait staff seemed very snobby and inattentive.  Food was very mediocre for the price you pay.  Would not recommend this resteraunt with all the other great choices in Seattle

Customer 3424.Name: BAMABob
Customer 3424.Content: I visit Seattle once a year for a "conference" and look forward to an annual visit to "The Met". In the past service was always impeccable. This time we had a waiter by the name of Roger. He was terrible. As an example I thanked him for something and his response was "yup". He asked me if i wanted a drink and I replied I will.order with my friend who is right behind you. He walked away and didn't come back for almost 15 minutes. Had to send steaks back to Kitchen 3 times. This experience will not stop me from going back next year but after 12 straight years I will consider other places.

Customer 3425.Name: Murrays
Customer 3425.Content: So enjoyed our latest dining experience at the Met. Tenderloin, crab and lobster in our favorite steakhouse - happy anniversary!

Customer 3426.Name: 4Ladies
Customer 3426.Content: I ordered the soup and salad (as I do many places for lunch).  The ceasar salad had a whole anchovy on the top.  I know ceasar = anchovies.  But never in my life did I imagine a whole one with skin would be on top of my salad.  I removed it - and hid it.  However, the taste was still on the lettuce.  Soup it was.

Customer 3427.Name: Wine46lover
Customer 3427.Content:
We hadn't been here in 15 years (moved out of the area). We had friends visiting from Ohio and we felt it was the only place in town to truly get a great steak. We were not disappointed. From the appetizers to the end of the meal everything met our expectations. It would be nice to see a couple of additional non-meat items but that is not a criticism of the restaurant or their menu.
We even brought a couple of bottles of our own wine (special occasion) and felt the $25.00 corkage fee to be reasonable.

Customer 3428.Name: Luvaduck
Customer 3428.Content: Being a Midwest farmer's daughter, I was raised on steak and potatoes.  This peppercorn steak was probably the best I have ever eaten.  Almost melted in my mouth!  I didn't speak during entire meal!

Customer 3429.Name: Ashg273
Customer 3429.Content: We heard about this place on a celebrity's Podcast- he said it was the best steak he had eaten anywhere so we decided to check it out on our recent visit to Seattle. This place did not disappoint! I had one of the Japanese filets and it was so incredibly tender, flavorful, just falls apart in your mouth.  My steak was very pricey ($100) but totally worth it. My husband had an American NY Strip (the cheaper option at around $50) and loved his as well. Salads and desserts were amazing too. Great service. Not cheap but worth the price for an awesome steak dinner.

Customer 3430.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3430.Content: This place was classy and sophisticated, but also very friendly and fun. The food was impeccable and the service was quite impressive. I would go again and again.

Customer 3431.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3431.Content: Food was fabulous, however, if I am paying 100$ for a 4oz steak I don't want to be sitting next to someone in flip flops. We wish a dress code was enforced, it would change the atmosphere from casual dining to fine dining. We were very excited for a quiet formal dinner but that was not the case. We felt like we had yummy food in basically a diner due to the noise level and the lack of dress code.  We Had high expectations, and while the food went far above our expectations, the rest of the expierence left us telling our friends to seek a different restaurant for special occasions.

Customer 3432.Name: steaksnob
Customer 3432.Content: I am a steak snob, and I have eaten at some of the finest steakhouses in the US (i.e. The 212, NYC, NY; E.B. Greens, Buffalo, NY, etc.)  I had my best steak ever at your establishment, and have been there now 4 or 5 times.  Whenever I am in Seattle, this is where I have dinner at least one night.  I know that the most recent list had EB Greens as #2, and you as #5.  They got EB Greens right, but you are #1 in my book!

Customer 3433.Name: Sacjon
Customer 3433.Content: We had a super time! The food is outstanding  and our waiter, Scott, was great. It is a special place to have dinner with excellent wines and drinks. We would highly recommend!!

Customer 3434.Name: CullenW
Customer 3434.Content: The Met is Simply the Best steakhouse in the Northwest.  From the moment you drop the car with the valet to the moment they return the car, you are treated to a first class experience.  The food is as good as you will find anywhere.  The wine list is without compare.  If you are going for a special occasion or just because, I cannot recommend the Metropolitan Grill highly enough.  Simply the Best.

Customer 3435.Name: Kevin
Customer 3435.Content: Excellent steak specials.  Food was better than expected.  Top service.  Loved the wine.  If you happen to go to the Metropolitan Grill on a night they offer the 40 oz. bone in ribeye you would be an idiot not to order it.  We split this with two sides between two healthy eating men and one gal and it was plenty to feed us.  Carved at the table side with flair and perfection.

Customer 3436.Name: Otisbuckaroo
Customer 3436.Content: Had yet another great experience at "The Met" this week.  Great bartenders and wait staff; the service is always efficient and professional and often, although not always, with interesting and interested personalities.  In our case, we had fun and good conversation with a super bartender and the sommelier turned us on to a wonderful and fairly priced California Cabernet.  My rib steak and buddy's Iberico pork chop were perfectly cooked, delicious and exactly as described.  The strawberry shortcake special desert was the best I have ever had in a restaurant.  They are not bashful on their pricing but fine quality costs; that's just the way it is.  The only downer of the night was that we were charged for a creamed spinach side dish that we did not order or receive--not noticed until the next day when putting the bill away.  Mistakes happen, which I am sure this was.

Customer 3437.Name: Byrner13
Customer 3437.Content: I was  told this restaurant was a must-eat from a few friends and clients and was not let down. Great food and even better service. Mike, our waiter, was polite, helpful and very attentive. We'll definitely be coming back next time we're in town.

Customer 3438.Name: Meandthem
Customer 3438.Content: A venerable dining establishment with excellent service and fine steaks.  The cold, dry, flavorless scalloped potatoes square was a surprise and a disappointment.  Not t o be missed however is the caramel bacon side.

Customer 3439.Name: 7beachie11
Customer 3439.Content:
This was our second visit to Seattle and to the Metropolitan Grill.  Service was excellent and staff very accommodating just as we encountered on our first visit. 
While we are accustomed to spending more for a fine restaurant, I have to say that their pricing on the "side" order of crab legs was ridiculous.  $38 for two pieces of crab, approximately 5-6 inches long each .  It would be more reasonable at $20 - $25 given the fact that it's not even one whole crab leg.  

The cherries jubilee is fantastic!  At $22 it's reasonably priced as 4 people can easily share it, and it's made at your table.  

On our next visit we most likely will try another restaurant, but if you want a well prepared steak with great service, you should try it as the food is very good.

Customer 3440.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3440.Content: The menu has something for everyone.  The restaurant itself is first class.  Great atmosphere, our waiter was super helpful explaining the different cuts of meat, worth every penny spent.

Customer 3441.Name: Ackpack
Customer 3441.Content: We went here while visiting Seattle to celebrate our 30th anniversary. This  is the perfect  restaurant to celebrate a special occasion.

Customer 3442.Name: lba315
Customer 3442.Content:
What a spectacular experience!

 Surprisingly no dress code exists (witness the table of eight next to us, with two of the gentlemen at that table in jeans and ratty T-shirts), but we were serviced as if we were at a formal gala. After ordering wine from their large and varied wine list, my wife & I split the organic baby spinach salad before diving into our petit filet mignons, 8 ounces of superb American Wagyu Beef, wonderfully marbled and oh-so-tender!!  My wife and I feasted on this, along with  creamed spinach and cedar plank-roasted wild mushrooms, so intently that we barely spoke, such was our enjoyment of the meal. 

 Two different servers took care of us, making sure our glasses were full and our meals were outstanding, but also to chat and share stories about the restaurant and some of the famous clientele that have dined there (Joe Torre, Lou Piniella & Bill Gates, to name a few). One of our servers brought out a large NY-Style Cheesecake for us to share, washed down with their wonderful coffee.

 Our experience ended a wonderful vacation in grand style! Steakhouses don't get much better than this, and 21 consecutive years the Metropolitan Grill has made the Independent Retail Cattleman's Association's list of Top 10 Steakhouses in the U.S.  You must try this place!!

Customer 3443.Name: Oceanview7
Customer 3443.Content: Seriously:  you can't get a better filet mignon - period !  The service was perfect, and every bite of every item was spectacular. Wow! Although we have an outstanding steakhouse here in West Seattle - we make the effort to drive and park downtown in order to go to Metropolitan Grill.  The best !

Customer 3444.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3444.Content: Great steak but fish was overcooked, Very pricey

Customer 3446.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3446.Content: i never thought there could be so much difference in the quality of meat...i was wrong.  the metro serves an incredible steak!

Customer 3447.Name: GaryTravelPerks
Customer 3447.Content: I've been coming to the Met for 20 years.  It is my special event and celebration place.  I've traveled the world and eaten at every top steak house possible.  The Met is always one of my favorites, as much for the food as the truly professional service.

Customer 3448.Name: FunVAduo
Customer 3448.Content:
Best Steak...ever...anywhere.  My son, wife and "senior" guest stopped by for dinner before the Seattle Sounders game.  Dressed in pre-game attire, we were not the only ones there doing the same thing.  No matter to the professional wait staff...who understood and seemed to relish in the underdressed traditional pre-game clientele.  

While the dinners were expensive--the service and the food made it all worthwhile.  We were not in the mood to stuff ourselves, and waste too much $$ on doggie bags that we couldnt/wouldnt take to the stadium.  The astute black-tie waiter recommended splitting the Chateaubriand 3-ways--which turned out to be 4-ways...and we each had a cocktail (not for the 14 y o) salad and appetizer.  It was perfect, delicious, and there was none of the "oh, another cheapskate family in soccer jerseys"--our waiter sincerely wanted us to have the best experience and made us feel that we made the perfect choice.  The filet melted in our mouths, and my 14 yo was the most impressed...("Dad, if we lived here, this is where I would want to have my birthday meal every year!").  With drinks, and tip we were in the mid-300s....but the experience was one of a lifetime for my visiting family, and worth every penny.

This is my 4th time in 27 years to go to the Metropolitan Grill...each visit has a story and a memory of near-perfect service and food quality.  It is my favorite of many fantastic steakhouse grills that I have visited around the world.  Even a casual visit to the bar--it feels like what "Cheers" was in the 80s--a local brass rail sports bar on one side and upscale black-tie service dining on the other.   Perfect for the most important events, and also for the quick thirst-quenching stop to catch the game.  

I never write reviews...but couldn't stop myself today.   If you don't mind dropping some $$ for the highest quality--and want an experience that will be perfect....here is your place!

Customer 3449.Name: Bear
Customer 3449.Content: If you're hankering for a steak, this is the place for you. Old fashioned and proud of it, has the feel of a classic family steakhouse - because that's what it is!  Not cheap and the portions are not for the faint of heart but you get what you pay for in quality, service and above all, great beef! But how do you "run out" of steak tartare at 7:30 PM? Oh well, we'll order it ahead next time!

Customer 3450.Name: tccknight
Customer 3450.Content: this place was our favorite. but the last few times we've come we've had mediocre service, and this last time we visited the filet mignons we ordered we well under-done to what was ordered. they took it away, reheated it (hopefully on the grill), and left the veggies. we ate our veggies and waited...and waited... and finally got our steaks back. mine was perfect, but my husband's came back flattened and almost a lesser quality. it was definitely a disappointment. the management came by and said our server would take care of us. well, our server thought a good way to take care of us was a free dessert. meh. how about you offer something off the poor steaks you served us? meh! go, but maybe stick to the bar for better service.

Customer 3451.Name: kenmore
Customer 3451.Content: Valet parking did great job considering the mayors screwball bike lane fiasco

Customer 3452.Name: FloridaLady
Customer 3452.Content: Extremely disappointed with this steakhouse.  We had seen such wonderful reviews but it was very over rated.  Once the waitress found out we didn't want wine  or cocktails, she seemed uninterested in our table.  I ordered the 4 oz dry aged and 4 oz wagyu combo $64 to compare the meat.  Even though they were both ordered Medium, the dry aged was over cooked (medium well) and the wagyu was severely undercooked (medium rare)!  The strawberry shortcake, although big, it was very dry.   The food and service was not worth the unnecessary high price.  Will not be going back.

Customer 3453.Name: Nancy
Customer 3453.Content: It was a fabulous dining experience.  We all had steak and it was incredibly tender. The brussel sprouts were a great side dish to the beef. We had bananas foster for dessert and the table side production was amazing. The waiter had recommended his favorite, the white chocolate coconut cake, so we took a piece home for later. The waiter was always there, but never hovering. It was pricey, but worth it. We loved everything from the cocktails to the valet service in busy downtown traffic.

Customer 3454.Name: Cheatsheet
Customer 3454.Content: First, the steaks are really good. The prime rib was also a lovely cut - tasty but a little on the dry side. The auju that was served on the side was delicious and helped the prime rib. We had good sized baked potatoes on the side - perfectly cooked with a surprisingly good cheese sauce along with the green onions and sour cream. We started out with the artichoke heart appetizer which was absolutely delicious! Highly recommend! Caesar salad was OK. I wish we had ordered the soup instead. Very nice menu selection though. We knew we liked Chateau St. Michele wine, so we decided to ask the restaurant wine expert which one he would recommend. There were 4 cabs on the wine list... Disappointing selection:( it was drinkable but not great. Next time I'll go with the most expensive and take my chances. The one he recommended was not bad but nothing special. Go with your gut.  There were very good expensive wines on the wine list - Silver Oak and Opus One - if you want to go in that direction. Dessert was the most disappointing part of the meal. Couldn't resist ordering the tableside bananas foster, and it was flavorless. The waiter seemed like he was in a hurry to be done, so the bananas were undercooked with a sauce that was lacking in flavor. I make it better at home. You can see it's a good restaurant, so maybe we hit it on the wrong day? We were celebrating a birthday (which was never acknowledged), and squeezed into a booth that was on the small side. I was expecting more. I'd probably give it another chance though. So only 4 stars. Our waiter actually tried but had to only give 3 stars because of his superiors lack of assistance.

Customer 3455.Name: Potterfan
Customer 3455.Content: Great food and great service will definitely be going back

Customer 3457.Name: Carolyn
Customer 3457.Content:
I was expecting excellent food but the steaks were sublime. We all had the Wagyu and it did not disappoint. Yes, it was very pricey but in this case, you get what you pay for. 
I love the atmosphere at the Met, with the servers in their white coats and great attitudes, it feels like a party just walking to your table.
It's been a family favorite for special occasions for many years and once again, the Met didn't disappoint.

Customer 3458.Name: FiveatSixPM
Customer 3458.Content:
Our server Roger was absolutely fantastic. His personality, his energy, his fantastic sense of humor!
Absolutely loved the entire dinner. We also thought Rebecca our Sommelier was just the sweetest thing.  I think this restaurant is an absolute must if your with a group of friends and want a good time. 
Our visit to Seattle was fantastic but our dinner with Metropolitan Grill was spectacular.

Customer 3459.Name: Awesome
Customer 3459.Content: I had been to the Met once before and attended with my friends for my Stag. They were apprehensive because of some of the prices but I told them about the food quality. Once there and they saw the portion sizes, massive pieces of meat, they were extremely happy and the cost made sense. Incredible steak, we all had different cuts, and agreed it was the best any of us had ever had. We will go back without hesitation!

Customer 3460.Name: ProfessorJake
Customer 3460.Content: We've been in town over a week and tried several places. Don't waste your time! We dined here last week and again today. They do a wonderful job. My wife had a 5 oz. Filet and I had the 8oz. Prime Filet.  Just perfectly prepared and delicious. We started with possibly the best French Onion soup I've ever had. This place just delivers a superior dining experience. We'll return next time we are in town again. We're disappointed they don't have a location back home.

Customer 3461.Name: Bobby
Customer 3461.Content:
The steak here is prime aged cuts of the best meat available. I have had some of the best steak dinners 
I have ever had here. Great service and sides as well.

Customer 3462.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3462.Content: Fantastic, iconic Seattle steakhouse.  I never miss it when I come into town for business.

Customer 3463.Name: Peglin
Customer 3463.Content: With horrible traffic we arrived late for our reservation.  They were able to get us in sooner than expected.  The food was incredible.  The evening lived up to all of our expectations and our 80+ parents were thrilled at being able to come to Seattle and drive right up to the restaurant for valet parking.

Customer 3464.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3464.Content: The food was excellent however we ordered salad and lobster bisque soup to eat prior  to the main course and never got it.

Customer 3465.Name: laitsabr
Customer 3465.Content:
Our family celebrated three milestone events at the Met, and it was glorious! Restaurant was filled even on a Monday, and service remained attentive.
Kids had their favorite rare filet mignon, juicy and tender, with just a touch of au jus. Wife and I had our Cajun rub prime rib, rare too, which provided a sweetish and salty flavor unique to the Met.
Finale was the banana foster (you need to ask for Kevin to do it for you): ice-cream, banana and caramel. Perfect evening!

Customer 3466.Name: ChrisB
Customer 3466.Content: We dined at the Metropolitan Grill for our daughter's graduation. The staff was so courteous and helpful and our waiter was superb! The food was delicious, fresh and on point! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone celebrating a special day!

Customer 3467.Name: Vivalasvegas
Customer 3467.Content: we were very disappointed with the entire evening. First, the hostess did not know her tables and caused confusion. Second, we asked the sommelier to ask to recommend a red within $125 price range. He recommended a red that we knew and we're just ok with, when we asked for another choice, he gave us attitude. Then, when we went to order our steaks, we ordered our steaks rare. The waiter said, no you are better to order your steaks medium rare. So we did. When the steaks came out, they all were medium to medium well. So, especially for the  price, what a total disappointment. No, we did not complain, you never know what will happen to your food when they bring it back out. For someone from Las Vegas who pays high prices for meals, this one ranks as the worst meal I can remember.

Customer 3468.Name: Hollytyson
Customer 3468.Content: My mom and I celebrated our birthdays together here at the Metropolitan Grill. We ordered a fillet mignon steak, lobster tail, and a prawn Alfredo, and they were all delicious, perfectly cooked. This place is not cheap though, but the service and the food are all worth it.

Customer 3469.Name: ProfessorJake
Customer 3469.Content: Prime Filet was perfectly prepared. One of the best I've ever had! I will return.

Customer 3470.Name: Bluebell
Customer 3470.Content: When I'm in the mood for a good classic steakhouse with quality food and excellent service, Met Grill is my place. The husband and I shared the chateaubriand and it was so good! The French onion soup was delicious, as was the cherries jubilee at the end. Table side service was just fun..The important things were on point, though!

Customer 3471.Name: JoeH
Customer 3471.Content: Always first class service and quality. Have frequented the Met over the past 15 years...always an enjoyable experience.

Customer 3472.Name: chad
Customer 3472.Content: We were surprised that we were able to have a 945PM reservation despite them closing at 10PM, for our party of 3.  Despite us being there past their closing time, we didn't feel rushed and our food came out with high quality.  Our server was very helpful, and described the dishes well.  We had a pleasant time and enjoyed our meals!  They were even kind enough to recommend other restaurants in the area for us to try during our trip to Seattle!  Great service!!!

Customer 3473.Name: Bray
Customer 3473.Content: Great food and service, but this is a $$$$ restaurant !  I was on a budget of $110 per person and went over that.

Customer 3474.Name: stchucktom
Customer 3474.Content: I ordered a rare strip.  The steak I was served was cooked medium.  I requested a steak at the proper temperature which was attended to promptly.  The second steak was on the medium side of medium rare, still not the temperature I ordered.  I just expected a steak house to be able to serve the steak as ordered - they even list rare in their menu as cold red center which is not what I received.  Everything else was very good and the service was excellent.

Customer 3475.Name: TomandDorothydinner
Customer 3475.Content:
Ceasar salad, steak & baked potato as good as ever (which is great).  We look forward to celebrating our anniversary each year at the metropolitan.
Our server was excelent, efficient & personable (again as they have been each year).  great way to celebrate our 54th wedding anniversary.

Customer 3476.Name: ricky
Customer 3476.Content: The service was not quite as good as it has been on many previous occasions.  Missed the Caesar Salad being prepared at table side.  Seafood Sampler starter was fantastic ,  Steaks were excellent.  Wine list should be printed in bold for easier reading in dim light.  Tableside prepared Bananas Foster was very good but server was a bit too friendly and familiar in his constant conversation

Customer 3477.Name: lulululunch99
Customer 3477.Content: Group of co-workers come here once a month for there lunch specials. Which is amazing. We were disappointed to have different bread served. We missed the previous bread choice, please bring that back. Service was so slower than before. We had lunch here many times and this service was the slowest. We would appreciate quicker service for lunch dinning.

Customer 3478.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3478.Content: The service and ambiance were quite good. However, the vegetables must have been cooked by an apprentice who doesn't understand that different foods must be cooked for different lengths of time. Our carrots were rock-hard, potatoes were raw, eggplant was overcooked in the middle and undercooked around (how do you even manage that?), etc. My mashed potatoes had been sitting under the heat lamp for too long and were lumpy to boot. No complaints about the rest of the meal, but the vegetables were unacceptable even for a first-time cook.

Customer 3479.Name: TGF58
Customer 3479.Content: The Copper River salmon and buffalo were great alternatives to the traditional Filet of Ribeye steaks.  We wife and I enjoyed the food and service and had a particularly interesting discussion with our sommelier which we appreciated.  Unfortunately, we were sitting close to people who were celebrating and it made the whole experience a bit loud for our taste, but nothing the restaurant could have done about it.  We will certainly be back.

Customer 3480.Name: Bill
Customer 3480.Content: Best steak in the land.  Always look forward to eating here.  Expensive, but a good reason to work hard.

Customer 3481.Name: KenA
Customer 3481.Content: We never miss a chance to dine at Metro Grill when we are in Seattle. Fabulous service and excellent food. It's not inexpensive but it is worth the price. Roger was great and the whole staff welcomes you and thanks you when you leave.

Customer 3482.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3482.Content: The wagyu burger was cooked well. Fries were well seasoned.  My friend got the French dip and that looked very good also.  Next time I might opt for a half sandwich salad combo.

Customer 3483.Name: Henry
Customer 3483.Content: this is where you need to go when you want the perfect steak. Very expensive but worth every dollar. And be sure to select the baked potato and say yes to all the toppings.

Customer 3484.Name: dinner6315
Customer 3484.Content: we arrived about 10 minutes early and were seated quickly. All staff from the minute we walked into the restaurant, service by the waiter , bus boy, and when we were leaving was great. very professional an not a bother. It was my husbands birthday also and our waiter presented us with a creme brulee desert with a candle. Perfect ending to a great dinner. Def will be returning.

Customer 3485.Name: SistersDiningOut
Customer 3485.Content: Amazing dining experience if you are interested in spending approximately $100 per person for entree, appetizer and a side dish....it was worth it, but will not be on the frequent dining list due to the very high prices.  Service was truly excelllent and the NY steak and bernaise sauce was melt in your mouth wonderful.  Tried the brussel sprouts with bacon and this was also delicious.  Overall, a very satisfying dining experience fit for very special occasions.

Customer 3486.Name: Dinnerman
Customer 3486.Content:
Well done. Phenomenal crab cakes. Incredible steak and awesome wine list. The service was excellent from the many different people who cared for us. The booth was most private and enjoyable. The atmosphere is classic decor. This would have benefited from classical
Music in the background.

Customer 3487.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3487.Content: The service was phenomenal, better than anywhere else I've been probably ever. The only thing that measured up to the service quality was the outstanding food. The quality of food and presentation was just about perfect. I will absolutely be returning.

Customer 3488.Name: MsGunn
Customer 3488.Content:
I ate at the bar as a solo diner. There was a game on. That made people more talkative so that was cool. 

Solid fillet cooked to perfect temp.  

Amazing bourbon choices. 

I absolutely hate being aware that a waitperson is waiting on me to leave or end shift. 

Please either leave and split a 20+% tip or stay and never let me be the wiser. Over $150 tab for a hassle free diner and you made me feel super rushed. 

I even hesitated leaving a review but the food was good, the place is dependably lovely but that ruined my mid work trip retreat. I was in and out in less than 40 minutes. Apps main and took desert to go I felt so rushed. Couldn't finish the lovely bourbon.

Customer 3489.Name: WadeM
Customer 3489.Content:
Our first visit to Seattle and after a 4+ hour plane ride we were looking for a nice place in the downtown area that was close and would pamper us on our first night in town. Metropolitan Grill was close and had some great reviews. 

To sum up our evening, the Metropolitan Grill did Seattle proud...from the drinks, to the appetizers, to the Wagyu beef, to the Alaskan Copper River Salmon, and finally to the amazing Hot Apple Pie dessert, it was a fantastic experience. What greatly added to our enjoyment was our waiter, Bruno Stolz. To put it honestly, Bruno is the greatest waiter on the planet.  This is a guy that obviously loves what he is doing and wants his customers to have that same experience. He is as knowledgeable about his menu as anyone I've ever encountered and does a wonderful job of explaining the expansive options to the customer.  I appreciate good service and must say I've never been as impressed with anyone as much as Bruno. 

As great as the service was, the food did not fail to deliver.  My family of four were all more than satisfied with their meals and hope we can squeeze another visit in to the Metropolitan Grill before we leave!

Customer 3490.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3490.Content:
The wagyu beef long bone rib eye is one of the best steaks I have ever had.  Over 40 oz is good to share.  Nice char outside medium rare in the center.  Service was impeccable.  Great old steak house ambiance

Also one of the best happy hours.

Customer 3491.Name: greygovernor
Customer 3491.Content: Its a bit on the pricy end, but everyone should try to spurge once in a while and have a Filet and a nice wine to go with it! The service is truly amazing, and the food to die for!

Customer 3492.Name: GraceF
Customer 3492.Content: We came here for lunch with our baby and had a wonderful experience.  The hostess and servers were very kind and wonderful.  They seated us at a table that fit our stroller and did not treat us differently than times we had visited without a child.  Our baby slept through the entire meal.  Based on this positive experience, we came back for dinner with our baby and had a starkly different experience even though our baby, again, slept through the entire meal.  The hostess was less than accommodating, we were seated at a cramped table (even though the restaurant was not crowded).  I felt as though we were treated quite differently (with less care) because we had a baby, even though our baby was not creating a disturbance.  Our server was excellent and food was delicious, but we felt so uncomfortable the entire time that we will likely not return for dinner again.

Customer 3493.Name: JohnM
Customer 3493.Content:
I adore this place and when I have the extra cash to splash out and indulge in opulence and excess, The Metropolitan Grill is my first choice. If you can afford to dine here regularly, then good for you. If you are able to come here once or twice a year like me, then you need to go hard when you do.  Expect to spend upwards of $500 for dinner for two and do NOT get squeamish when it come time to add the gratuity. The staff there is fantastic; extremely friendly, knowledgeable, and in no hurry whatsoever to turn your cover. They were gracious giving us time to parse the menu and then guide us through the extensive wine list. The half bottle we got with dinner jumped out to both of us when it was described and we were over the moon with the selection.

The Copper river salmon tartare appetizer was mouthwatering. It was served with pickled cucumber slices and a jellied wasabi that was insane.

My date had an 8oz Waygu tenderloin medium, which she loved. I was given a piece and while I usually steer away from tenderloin as I find it overrated as a cut, the Waygu (my first experience with it) was substantially more enjoyable than any other tenderloin I have eaten. My preference would be for another cut, so I would not order this, but my date was delighted with her selection.

I had the dry aged Rib-Eye medium rare. Stupid good. Cooked to perfection... such a full mouth of flavor and tenderness. I worry I will never try anything else on the menu in the future because this is the finest steak I have ever had on the west coast (sorry, but Peter Luger in NYC is insane).

We each had mashed potatoes as a side and shared the cedar plank mushrooms for the table and both were outstanding companions to the meat.

For desert we did Apple pie for 2 withe table side prep. I know this presentation is kind of a hockey throwback but I honestly do not care how that confection gets to us as long as it arrives! Every component was mouthwatering and an excellent finish to this meal.

Customer 3494.Name: MarkB
Customer 3494.Content: Te Metrpolitan Grill serves a great Steak!  The ambiance is good and Conversation can be heard among friends at the table.  The serving staff is attentive but not intrusive.  Loved it and would go back again when visiting Seattle.

Customer 3495.Name: Craig
Customer 3495.Content: It had been a while since we had been to the Met after a sub-par dining experience and Met delivered on the high expectations that comes with being one of the best in the country!  It was everything it used to be with the great energy, excellent food and phenomenal service.  The Met is back!

Customer 3496.Name: ZmanbCC
Customer 3496.Content: Try their hamburger for lunch, served "original" style with au jus! Great place for a business lunch.

Customer 3497.Name: Todd
Customer 3497.Content: Great cuts of meat with consistently superb preparation.  Classic side dishes and superb attentive service.

Customer 3498.Name: HaileyM
Customer 3498.Content: Service is always fantastic!  One of my favorite restaurants in Seattle.

Customer 3499.Name: schultet
Customer 3499.Content: Great place to gather with friends and colleagues for a weekday lunch!

Customer 3500.Name: RyanB
Customer 3500.Content:
Food was great as usual, went there for Mother's Day brunch.  Our server was really nice, however, there were just a couple things that bothered me.  First, we ordered calamari to start, plus I had the bisque.  We hadn't had our starters much more than 5 minutes before bringing out our many brunch orders.  I really felt rushed and was amazed our server did not apologize or offer to take back to the kitchen.  

The only other thing, we didn't notice the kids menu so thought we had to order off the main menu for our 5 year old daughter.  And our server did not say anything!  Her dish was so big it could have been breakfast for her for a week!  Plus, hurray, I get to pay $20 for my daughter's meal! 

Come on Met, I expect better than that.

Anyways, like I said, food was awesome, but I there were some misses that I would not expect from The Met.

Customer 3501.Name: GHansen
Customer 3501.Content:
Everything about the restaurant was wonderful as usual.  The draw back for Sunday brunch was
parking.  No valet service and a Mariner's game.  It  took us 10 minutes to find a place to park.

Customer 3502.Name: Edward
Customer 3502.Content: Took wife and son to Metropolitan for Mother's Day brunch.  The food, service and ambiance was excellent!  I have always been happy with everything about the Metropolitan even when I first dined there in 1982. Your restaurant is one of the classiest dining establishments in Seattle.  Eddie

Customer 3503.Name: abbster78
Customer 3503.Content: I surprised my wife with a overnight stay in Seattle and Brunch at the Met Sunday morning. We've had nice meals in the evening and thought the quality would be to Met standards. Our waitress greated us warmly, suggested drinks and took our order. I chose the Chicken fried steak, bacon, scrambled eggs and cottage fries. My wife chose the french toast, scrambled eggs and bacon.  Our food arrived promptly..eggs looked like they'd been sitting in a container for hours, were overcooked and dry. Bacon resembled something you'd get on a burger from Safeco Field. Steak...well, it resembled something more like the tongue off my hunting boots, tough, little taste to the gravy. Potatoes were the best part of the meal. My wifes meal was the same. French Toast was average, no butter. I know it was only brunch but the extra you spend to eat at the Met you expect better than the Denny's 5 dollar menu. I'll stick with the dinner menu next time.

Customer 3504.Name: Cul8r
Customer 3504.Content: The Met is always one of our favorite places to dine. The steaks are excellent (it's not a cheap place to eat) the food taste so good. Our server was great and met all our needs.

Customer 3505.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 3505.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is my favorite restaurant! We went to celebrate my daughter (Karena's) birthday and we received so much attention from the staff, our server, the Maitre'Ds and the hostesses. We are regulars, and we do get treated special, but from I can see, everyone gets treated pretty special. That's what I like the most and food is excellent! We had oysters and teriyaki tidbits, caprese salad, filet mignon, tenderloin medallions, skirt steak, and even burgers and everything was delicious! They all treated us like family and we think of them as family.

Customer 3506.Name: goblue
Customer 3506.Content: Great old boy feel, dark paneling, great bar, expensive but worth it. Best server ever. Will go back

Customer 3507.Name: jdaugh6
Customer 3507.Content: The steaks are some of the best I've tasted...flavorful, tender and superbly prepared. Exhaustive wine list.

Customer 3508.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3508.Content: Arrived at 7:30 pm and was promptly seated.  Waiter was excellent and attentive.  Food is incredible.  This will me a must dine location the next time I'm in Seattle.

Customer 3509.Name: Westerner
Customer 3509.Content: Finally tried The Met after MANY people recommended it. Because everyone speaks so highly of it, my expectations were very high.  The food, service, valet, and wine list definitely lives up to the hype. I was just a little taken aback by the ambiance-  love the old green velvet booths, and hardwoods, but it's just very bare bones.  Nothing fancy, nothing formal, a lot of people dressed in jeans, tees, and shorts-- not a huge deal to me, but I was just surprised. Steak is amazing! So is the crab cocktail appetizer!

Customer 3510.Name: KKLC
Customer 3510.Content: We went there for a birthday dinner. I ordered filet - well done. My steak arrived with my friend's steak which was ordered medium rare. I was skeptical. I sliced into my steak and it was rare (no surprise). I sent it back. I got the same steak about 30 minutes later. It was microwaved. My friend's steak in the mean time was cold - we were there to eat dinner together, after all. The waitress asked how the meal was, when we explained, she grabbed the plates and dumped the food onto a nearby with slam and disappeared. She came back about 15 minutes later and stated the manager would not be charging us for the entrees. We paid for our wine and appetizer and left. It was odd to be treated so rudely for their own mistake. My steak was raw. I didn't do anything wrong. I can't tell you if its the "best steak in town", I never got to eat it. I do know that I will not be back. Ever.

Customer 3511.Name: MarkJ
Customer 3511.Content: Got a bad piece of meat that the kitchen couldn't get right twice. My partner's steak was undercooked as well. We've had very good experiences in the past but notice the quality control has slipped. For $60+ for just the steak, that's NOT worth our future money anytime soon. They did remove my steak from the bill. Our server was outstanding, however.

Customer 3512.Name: farnorthtraveler
Customer 3512.Content: Unfortunately, my memory of past dinners at the Met Grill is better than the actual experience. The place is a classic and it was disappointing. The crab cakes were blah and luke warm, the vegetable tower was the same. Of the steaks ordered at the  table only the double filet with bacon and blue cheese was outstanding. With so many new and great restaurants in Seattle, the Met Grill needs to up its game and not rest on its laurels.

Customer 3513.Name: Etta
Customer 3513.Content: My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary. A perfect choice. The wait staff is dressed in top notch uniforms and bring the elegance level up with style points, as well as the amazing brilliant service. I had the salmon and it was delightful, and they brought us a creme brulee  complementary for our desert. I will definitely be back for another special occasion.

Customer 3514.Name: WokinitBC
Customer 3514.Content: Had a celebratory dinner at the Met with my spouse and two adult children.  We were lucky to be seated in the quieter low traffic dining area.  The food was great with the exception of the Cajun spiced prime rib.  The rosemary and other herbs that were used overpowered the prime rib meat flavor.  That piece of meat was not enjoyable by any of us.  It also looked as though the chef just dumped the seasonings onto the meat and it was not seasoned into the cooking of the meat.  That was the only disappointment. The filet's were fabulous.   The large cut of prime rib was great.  Service was fabulous. French onion soup was great.

Customer 3515.Name: retiredfrequentdiners
Customer 3515.Content: The waitstaff was friendly and helped make it a good evening. The steaks and sides were excellent!!!

Customer 3516.Name: TerryS
Customer 3516.Content: Our server Michael Smith was perfect. All the food was great.

Customer 3517.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3517.Content: Michael did a fantastic job waiting on us.  The food was great and we didn't wait too long for our drinks either.  We would go back in a heartbeat!

Customer 3518.Name: steve
Customer 3518.Content: Good location/atmosphere.  Wait staff friendly.  Food  was prepared as requested.

Customer 3519.Name: SeattleDiner
Customer 3519.Content: In booking the Metroploitan Grill via Open Table with barely 24 hours notice, I asked for a private room if available as the dinner was immediately after our Board meeting. The room, food,  and attentive service were all outstanding! We will be back soon!

Customer 3520.Name: arikohn
Customer 3520.Content: Really outstanding service, absolutely outstanding!  Bad service can ruin food that is well prepared, but  at Metropolitan Grill incredibly good service compliments very good food.  I really enjoy going there at any time, but it is excellent for business lunches.  Just plain excellent!

Customer 3521.Name: AmyliaK
Customer 3521.Content: Went to the Met for a birthday lunch as it's my sister's favorite restaurant. I know they are known for their steaks but I wanted a Philly Cheese steak so that's what I ordered. It was not possible to eat it as a sandwich so used knife and fork. The bun was large and dry and the slice of white cheese topping the steak was almost melted. There weren't many onions but the fries were plentiful and pretty good. I don't recall my sisters saying their lunches were good, but maybe that was because we were so busy gabbing. The server was very patient and accommodating. Service at the Met is always polished so I have no complaint in that area.

Customer 3522.Name: AKLoggie
Customer 3522.Content: Outstanding in every respect - a complete must if you are in the Seattle area.

Customer 3523.Name: Tast
Customer 3523.Content: We went there for Friday lunch - prime rib. Food was great.

Customer 3524.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3524.Content: Amazing steaks! Great apps, great atmosphere! Great service!

Customer 3525.Name: Friendofthevine
Customer 3525.Content: Service was great.  However food was not hot and booths were so tight it was hard to get comfortable. Meat was good.  Sauces were good.  It was a shame it was Luke warm....

Customer 3526.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3526.Content: When I needed a place to bring a date for a steak, as a vegetarian I knew I had to make it good, so I chose the Met. Have never been disappointed and its great to see that standards have not relaxed a bit. Stellar staff,  wonderful food. Perfect Evening. Will go back on our first anniversary. :)

Customer 3527.Name: LoveSaltys
Customer 3527.Content: We love going to the Met Grill for special occasions.  The staff is wonderful making sure you have what you need and make great recommendations.  One of our favorite places.

Customer 3528.Name: kevtrout
Customer 3528.Content: For the prices, I was expecting so much more.  Food was average.  Waiter was a bit of  bug, being overly chatty.   Very little ambience.   I was expecting it to be as good as El Gaucho and it is not even close (other than the price).

Customer 3529.Name: Bebe
Customer 3529.Content: Wonderful service, great waiter, booth was nice for husbands birthday

Customer 3530.Name: Oceanview7
Customer 3530.Content: I have eaten in many fabulous restaurants, but must say I go out of my way to get to Metropolitan Grill for a fabulous Filet Mignon.  Cooked perfect everytime. Top quality food and plenty of it.  Excellent wait staff as well.  Giant deserts that are delightful.  Love it !

Customer 3531.Name: Piggy98168
Customer 3531.Content: This restaurant is great for a business lunch but also wonderful for happy hour and dinner.  This is one of my favorite steak houses in the city.  Great service!

Customer 3532.Name: ColoCane
Customer 3532.Content: Have been 4 times. Very consistent. A steakhouse, that executes exceptionally. Not only wide selection of cuts, but types, i.e.; Waygu, Ohmi, etc. Typical format; choose steak with shareable sides. Excellent options for fish as well. Appetizers; Carpacio, calamari, Dungeness all good. House salad and Wedge a bit of a weak spot.  Food is wonderfully prepared (various filet, ribeye, tenderloin, and halibut this outing - all great). Service is impeccable but not overbearing, nor stuffy at all.  Very, very attentive. Exceptional wine list. The prices are not for the meek at heart. It adds up quickly. Drinks, apps, salad, entrée, dessert, wine, maybe after dinner drink; plan on at least $125/pp including tip. Can easily go higher than that with beef cuts and wine list.  Willing to spend, quite enjoyable.

Customer 3533.Name: Roberto
Customer 3533.Content: Not only are their steaks the best in the state of Washington,  but the service is second to none.

Customer 3534.Name: Scooter408
Customer 3534.Content: I've dined at the Metropolitan Grill on numerous occasions and my experiences have always been exceptional.  I always get the Filet Mignon and it is indeed the best steak in town!

Customer 3536.Name: jaes
Customer 3536.Content:
This was a great pick for a fussy foodie birthday- he really liked everything, which is rare.
They have great oysters and such for appetizers, but the main deal is the steak- which is the best I've ever had. This is a well known restaurant in the city, but I've never been before. I was impressed, especially the service, which is warm and professional

Customer 3537.Name: SerendipityGal
Customer 3537.Content: We were visiting Seattle and the Grill had good reviews and reputation for their steaks.  We were disappointed in the food. Our steak was overcooked... Ordered medium to medium rare and it was well done.  Pork chops and scalloped potatoes were cold.  The best part of the meal  was Jim our server and the pear martini.

Customer 3538.Name: ScottiJ
Customer 3538.Content: Carmen Love and her team put on a show of perfection with the best food and service.  You cannot go wrong with The Met.

Customer 3539.Name: roberta
Customer 3539.Content: My friend and I have been periodically meeting for lunch at Metropolitan Grill for a while now.  It never disappoints.  The service is excellent, the food is tasty and they make us feel like we are the only diners during busy lunch times.

Customer 3540.Name: kjun81
Customer 3540.Content: This place had it all. Incredible service from a very charismatic staff and a steak that is jaw dropping. This was definitely worth every penny.

Customer 3541.Name: DBHguyss
Customer 3541.Content: Waiter was very informative and food was excellent.  Portions generous

Customer 3542.Name: DennisB
Customer 3542.Content:
Seattle Favorite... Food and Service Awesome....

Steaks, Wine and oysters were Fantastic

Customer 3543.Name: msurn
Customer 3543.Content: This is a great steak house! I raved about it last time I ate here and brought family here to experience it themselves and they were as pleased as I was. Couldnt stop talking about how great it was.

Customer 3544.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3544.Content: I ate here twice and both times the service was great and the food was outstanding!

Customer 3545.Name: TravisB
Customer 3545.Content: Their Japanese steak was superb. I'm a big steak eater and this was phenomenal

Customer 3546.Name: Tom54
Customer 3546.Content: When making the reservation I requested a table in the bar, which was available when my friend and I arrived.  Wendy was our server and provided timely, friendly and professional service throughout the dinner.  All the courses were timed perfectly and the all the items we ordered were excellent.  Very good dining experience.

Customer 3547.Name: Meridian
Customer 3547.Content: My wife is the ultimate critic.  M.G. surpassed her expectations.  The bar area was a bit noisy.  The valet helped us find an after dinner venue as we are not from Seattle.

Customer 3548.Name: MattF
Customer 3548.Content: I travel domestically and internationally for business and the MET is one of the best steak places I have ever had the pleasure of eating. Great food, great steaks, awesome service. Must go in Seattle.

Customer 3549.Name: McJagger
Customer 3549.Content: We had gone for a celebration lunch.  It was terrific.  It is truly a shame that the building will be torn down.  It is so iconic, I'm surprised the city is allowing that to happen.

Customer 3550.Name: photographer
Customer 3550.Content: Outstanding table side service ... Chateaubriand was outstanding!!!!!!!!!!!

Customer 3551.Name: Jazzlover
Customer 3551.Content: A downtown Seattle classic.  It has great food, attentive and knowledgeable staff, nice atmosphere, and a great wine list.  It is definitely on the expensive side, but comparable to restaurants of similar quality.  For me it is only for special occassions with a big group, but would also work for a couple.

Customer 3552.Name: SweetSWGrl
Customer 3552.Content:
For years, I've wanted to go the Met, but haven't had the chance (work is my middle name). My husband loves steak and it was his birthday, so why not?

The food, service, and atmosphere were all superb. I like how it's old school (clubby booths and staff dressed-up) but not pretentious; the night we were there, there was everything from very casual to dressed-to-the-nines for patrons. I like how we were Seattle casual (dark jeans, dress shoes, and nice sweaters), but we weren't treated any differently.

My husband and I do well, but we are very humble people and are often put-off by pretension that oozes at some Seattle restaurants; this is  a restaurant that realizes all customers are worth their time. For that alone (and, of course, the excellent dishes), we'll keep coming back.

On a final note, we each ordered a cup of the Lobster Bisque - it was creamy and flavorful. Husband's NY strip steak was cooked to perfection and my prime rib melted in my mouth like butter. We each loved our serving of homemade mashed potatoes and the waiter recommended a beer that actually suited my husband's taste.

Customer 3553.Name: rayray
Customer 3553.Content: Probably the best steakhouse in seattle, very good service,  everything on the menu  was great, the waygu  beef was incredible,  very expensive but worth it,

Customer 3554.Name: tlinson
Customer 3554.Content: We were celebrating our 18th anniversary and had a wonderful dinner.  Best steak I've had in a long time. We would recommend The Met hands down. Thanks for a great evening!

Customer 3555.Name: Carnivore
Customer 3555.Content: Large portions, plenty of food.  Not small like some other places in town. Steaks cooked to perfection.  Twice baked potatoes are delicious.  Servers are knowledgeable and attentive to your needs. They are excellent at making sire you understand the food options.

Customer 3556.Name: LBCFoodie
Customer 3556.Content: Food was excellent and staff equally as well.  I couldn't have asked for better place to dine in Seattle.  I certainly will come back on my next visit.

Customer 3557.Name: SelbyDO
Customer 3557.Content: My favorite restaurants are Metropolitan Grill in Seattle, and Mamas fish house in Maui

Customer 3558.Name: Supermountain
Customer 3558.Content: Overall we had an enjoyable dinner with great service, but not really worth the $300 plus bill for two. I had the prime bone in New York, "Delmonico" for $72. I could tell it was prime, but other than that, not that special. I can grill a better NY at home. My wife had the King Salmon, but it was over cooked. The Dungeness Crab cocktail appetizer was awesome and the delicious shared blue cheese wedge salad were probably the highlights. The huge creme brûlée desert that was given to my wife for her birthday was also a nice surprise. The Met is a fun place with lots of energy, but be prepared for a big bill at the end.

Customer 3559.Name: HermosaBeachGal
Customer 3559.Content: I ate here 20+ years ago and it left a lasting memory for me so of course, I had to go back.  It was even better than I remember!!  We started with the steak tartar, split the wedge and finished with the buffalo steak, which was probably one of the best steaks of my lifetime...  I guarantee you won't be disappointed with the food.

Customer 3560.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3560.Content: Frist time to Seattle. Checked into the Courtyard Seattle Downtown Hotel and let them know it was our anniversary and asked where there were some good places to celebrate at. They recommended your establishment, which is a half a block walking distance from the hotel. I'm very glad they did. The atmosphere, service, and food was above reproach. This is the place to eat if you are staying anywhere downtown Seattle.

Customer 3561.Name: NelsonB
Customer 3561.Content: Doesn't live up to other steakhouses in the area. I think I'd rather go to Capital Grille, Daniels or El Gaucho over  the Met. Everything was sub par in my opinion, from food to service to ambiance. It wasn't bad, but nothing spectacular here, more mediocre.

Customer 3562.Name: Jack
Customer 3562.Content:
Not quite asgood as last time, but still #1.

Waygu and uni disappointing. But prine filet excellent.  Service outstanding, ambience terrific, and spinach great.  Oysters (my first time,  glad i waited.

Customer 3563.Name: Captaindan73
Customer 3563.Content:
From Capt.  Dan  

     Been coming to the Metropolitan Grill for the last 23 years.  Fantastic service fantastic people wonderful atmosphere only thing I've seen is the price of the meat has climbed tremendously the steak is still very good $84 for a porterhouse is extremely expensive .  I just hope the climbing price slows I know rent is expensive in Seattle and it's getting more expensive every year but I would be going more often .

Customer 3564.Name: BethanyInDallas
Customer 3564.Content: We had scallops and halibut (separate dishes). Both were delightful. Next time we'll have the steak. The atmosphere was lively, service was attentive but not overly. I highly recommend.

Customer 3565.Name: steve
Customer 3565.Content: Very good service.  food was excellent.  Wait staff ptovided constant vigilance on the table.

Customer 3566.Name: Izuchan
Customer 3566.Content: If you could have smaller size of steak lunch plate, it would be great. I had a 5 one size but for me it was a still big.

Customer 3567.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3567.Content: The wait staff made the excellent food that much better.  They were all very knowledgable about the menu, had great suggestions from the bar and the wine list and made our 16 year old son very comfortable, engaging him in conversation about his interests.  We really appreciated the waiter suggesting my husband and I share a salad.

Customer 3568.Name: JohnnyX
Customer 3568.Content: While visiting my "second hometown" I brought my fiance back for a special occasion.  We live in Chicago now, so steak is something we know a lot about!
