"The Met" has always been my "go-to" Seattle Steak place for special occasions & a place to impress others.  The servers, staff, hostess, are ALWAYS on point, and make you feel like a regular.  It would take a lot for me to give them LESS than 5 stars.  We had the Chateaubriand Steak, with baked potato, and sauteed mushrooms.  Cooked to perfection (between medium rare for Lisa, and medium for me) they create the Classic Cliff Sauce table side.  This was a beautiful night for us, and if we had room, we would have indulged in the Bananas Foster as a repeat performance from our first Seattle date 2 years ago.  Instead, we had the decadent Burnt Cream to share.  Needless to say, we had the BEST meal on the entire plane for our travels home the next day when we carried our leftovers on.

Customer 3569.Name: Skip
Customer 3569.Content: The steak was delicious, perfectly cooked to boot. Everything else could have come from the kitchen of an Applebee's. Decor is outdated and stale. Server was far too casual for an establishment that charges this much. My Manhattan was bland. Really feel like I got taken for a ride, spent $250 on dinner for two and would have enjoyed Serious Pie for $40 much better. Go to Canlis or El Gaucho. Unless you are into Applebee's.

Customer 3570.Name: Nimimi
Customer 3570.Content: Food, service, decor - all was absolutely fabulous!

Customer 3571.Name: BrendaC
Customer 3571.Content: We loved the restaurant bar area.  I'm the restaurant, my husband's special filet on the menu was served almost cold which was disappointing.  They took care of us  and we will go back.

Customer 3572.Name: AverageJoe
Customer 3572.Content: Best steak in town, hands down! Our  service was fabulous, Noi was personable, funny, and knowledgeable . Had not been there in quite some time, nice to see things havent changed. Great food and great service. Thank you for a wonderful 23rd anniversary experience.

Customer 3573.Name: madison1223
Customer 3573.Content: The food wasn't as good as what we normally are accustomed to at the Met. Hopefully things will turn around. Service is also interesting and very much an upscale situation. We wish we had our usual waiter which makes for a better dining experience.

Customer 3574.Name: RoadWarrior
Customer 3574.Content: Our server, Michael Smith, is amazing.  We always ask  to be seated in his section.

Customer 3575.Name: StuartW
Customer 3575.Content: Steak and baked potato were yummy, service excellent. Only compliant was that the bread they served was awful. Doughy buns wont cut it at the fancy steak house.

Customer 3576.Name: Kurt
Customer 3576.Content: As always absolutely great service.  Steaks were very good and done just the way we asked. Dessert knocked it out of the park with the sorbet and the Bread pudding.

Customer 3577.Name: Jenn
Customer 3577.Content: Unbelievably impeccable service and delectable food and drinks makes it my favourite steakhouse dining experience from soup to nuts.

Customer 3578.Name: briano
Customer 3578.Content:
I love this place.  Is that enough?  

Okay I will explain a bit more then.  

Great food, great drinks. Love the service.  I had the great crab cakes and the delicious Salmon and it was all tremendous, the others at my table had various forms of beef and they loved what they had.  The food, the service, the ambiance, I dare say I will be back on my next trip to Seattle and likely every trip to Seattle from here on out.

Customer 3579.Name: ChuckT
Customer 3579.Content: Eaten at this restaurant on many occasions and on this visit the food was well below par. Steak was tough, full of gristle and undercooked. Not sure if I'll give it another chance or not.

Customer 3580.Name: Luke
Customer 3580.Content: I have lived in Seattle for more than 20 years  and have heard nothing but great things about the Met. Well, I finally got a chance to check it out for our 24th anniversary. The food was fantastic along with the service. A bit pricy but very well spent.

Customer 3581.Name: FoodiePumpkinz
Customer 3581.Content: Is totally overated and the steak is not worth the $$$.

Customer 3582.Name: NathanJ
Customer 3582.Content: The iberico pork was amazing and the Carmel bacon was excellent. The steaks though we're just ok and my filet with lobster on top had like two tiny pieces of claw meat and some Bernaise that was really bland. The service was ok but not anything like I would expect for the prices. Go to El Gaucho, Aqua or Sea Star instead.

Customer 3583.Name: jagjaglee
Customer 3583.Content:
Thank you Metropolitan Grill for making our anniversary dinner so memorable. We had reservations and were sat promptly. Dinner was absolutely divine and we appreciate the attention to detail from the moment we stepped in to your restuarant. 
The portion sizes were large, salads were amazing, bread was delish and the steaks were cooked to perfection. I loved the roasted root vegetables I had with my steak. The cheesecake and chocolate decadence was a cherry on top and a wonderful suprise from our server to celebrate our night out. Loved the atmosphere, the classic music, the plush velvet booth, and especially our warm and friendly server Michael who was an absolute gem.  We will be back.

Customer 3584.Name: Greg
Customer 3584.Content: Very noisy and crowded.  Food was good but expected more for price.

Customer 3585.Name: Andrea
Customer 3585.Content: As usual, The Metropolitan Grill did not let me down.  The service was top notch and the food was delightful.  You can always count on an amazing experience when dining here.

Customer 3586.Name: wannabe
Customer 3586.Content: Always consistently great good and appreciate the good service

Customer 3587.Name: Seattlevegan
Customer 3587.Content: my guests were all meat eaters so they had plenty of choices.  I'm a vegan, low-fat kinda gal so it was more challenging to find something I could eat.  The chop salad without chicken and substituting vi greetrd for the mayo based dressing worked for me!  Service was great.

Customer 3588.Name: Mike
Customer 3588.Content:
It's hard to complain about the Metropolitan Grill.  The setting is beautiful, the servers are awesome and the food quality is the best.  My wife and I have been there several times and try to make it back for special occasions.  When we had a recent day off we decided to give it a try.  We both ordered the filet mignon medium well.  When we received our steaks the true metropolitan taste did not disappoint.  As we got further into our steaks however it became clear to both of us that both steak were nearly medium well toward the outside and closer to rare on the inside.  Mine was so rare in the middle that I couldn't even eat it all.  

For those of you that can deal with a rare steak this would be no big deal.  When I pay top dollar for a steak though I expect it to be closer to how I ordered it.

Customer 3589.Name: Cottygirl
Customer 3589.Content: Our dinners were great.  My husband ordered the rib eye and I had the filet.  Both were cooked to perfection!  It's nice to find that a high end steakhouse where a side dish comes with your steak.  The baked potato is about the size of a football.  One potato could easily feed 2.  We purposely didn't finish our dinners because we wanted to order the banana's foster for dessert.  Unfortunately, it was a bit of a disappointment.  Although good, it just didn't have the flavor of banana's foster we've had at other restaurants.  And like the baked potato - huge portions.  The menu says the dessert is for two, it could easily serve 4.

Customer 3590.Name: none
Customer 3590.Content: Food was good but cold. I was disappointed that given the amount of investment, more than $200, you couldn't deliver food that was warm. Second, the waiter seemed distracted. All in all, it was a good experience but could have been better. Frankly, I expected better

Customer 3591.Name: sammy1
Customer 3591.Content: The met has great food.  Service is plentyful, but I wasn't spoiled enough.  For the price you pay, service should be better.

Customer 3592.Name: Foody
Customer 3592.Content: We had a great Valentine's dinner at the Met.  It was not your typical Valentine dinner with a set menu and rushed service.  Our waiter, Roger, was a pro and made great suggestions and made the night a fun experience.  I tried Wagyu beef for the first time and was not disappointed, it was amazing.  My only slight issues was that early on a glass of water was spilled on my husband accidentally by the waitstaff and although there were numerous apologies and a visit from the manager, it would have been a nice touch to be offered a free appetizer or dessert??  Also when I ordered the La Crema wine, I did not realize they also made one from Willamette.  I was brought that particular bottle, which happened to be $18 more than the Sonoma variety??  I should have been asked and not upsold I'm that fashion.  However, those 2 minor issues did not take away from a great night at the Met!

Customer 3593.Name: breee
Customer 3593.Content: The crab claw cocktail is the best! Love their steak. Could use some updating in the restaurant. Get rid of the old man's club atmosphere. It's not the roaring 20's anymore. But the food is great.

Customer 3594.Name: Brian
Customer 3594.Content: I have been to many upscale New York City steakhouses (Wolfgang, Quality Meats, The Palm (both)) and The Metropolitan rivals any of those spots. We both had steaks and they were prepared to perfection. The crème brulee was fantastic as was the crab cakes; some of the best we ever had. Only complaint was that it took 20 mins to have a table ready. Highly recommend.

Customer 3595.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3595.Content: My wife and I have been here probably a dozen times now, and it has never failed to disappoint. We LOVE The Met!! Eveytime our filet mignon is cooked perfectly, a new great wine to match, and delicious dessert to finish out the night. Whether a date night, double date, or a group, The Met sets an unacheivable bar for all other restaurant's staff and chefs to aspire to, and will always be a great choice!

Customer 3596.Name: sunshine
Customer 3596.Content: Best place to fulfill a steak crave. Great food and wonderful service. We love the Met

Customer 3597.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3597.Content: Wonderful service, wonderful food, wonderful drinks, old school steakhouse vibe-it's just a Seattle classic. Go, and treat yourself to the bananas foster for dessert!

Customer 3598.Name: DannyH
Customer 3598.Content: I won't be telling you much that you haven't heard already - solid steakhouse.  Everything is good, service is on par and the bar staff is excellent.  If you haven't been here you should go.

Customer 3599.Name: ClareP
Customer 3599.Content: An important ingredient was missing from the salad. There was no option to change the order. The bread arrived just as we were finishing the meal. My ice free glass of water was continually refilled with ice. The server seemed very rushed and seemed to throw the food on the table. I was offered a box after about 4 bites and 6 minutes. It was very disappointing and i was embarrassed for my guests. I won't be returning.

Customer 3600.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3600.Content: The food was really good, the service was great too. I would be a regular but it's kinda pricey but worth it on a special occasion.

Customer 3601.Name: Luveatingout
Customer 3601.Content: Its was very good as always.  The service and food was fantastic.

Customer 3602.Name: Brundage
Customer 3602.Content:
Still a Seattle classic but the Met's age is starting to show. The consistently excellent service I remember from my last visit here (it's been a while) has given way to the kind of blase service one gets in a Denny's. We had about a 10 minute wait after being seated before anyone offered us anything. When the waiter did show up he seemed distracted and was so low key I thought we ought to check for a pulse. What happened to the charm that used to be expressed when walking a guest through the specials? How about helpful menu suggestions? Forget 'em! This is a business and they've got better things to do that ensure that you are comfortable and well taken care of.

That said, the beef is excellent and prepared exactly to order. The salads and sides were tasty and dessert was fab (NY cheesecake!). Old school bar and interesting cocktails complete the set.

Maybe it was just an off night. I'd still go back in a heartbeat.

Customer 3603.Name: ErinG
Customer 3603.Content: I have been to the Met more times than I can count and the food, service, and ambiance is always fantastic. Yes it is on the pricey side and yes you can find great food for less but when you go to the Met it is about the whole experience and I personally think they have the best steaks period.

Customer 3604.Name: DineSD
Customer 3604.Content: Great find, recommended by friends while in town.  Outstanding wine selection, all of the sides were delicious and the "long bone" ribeye steak is second to none. Great staff with perfect recommendations for food and pairings. Make sure you make reservations while you're in town.

Customer 3605.Name: MattF
Customer 3605.Content: Fantastic steak house with a great selection of high quality cuts and a good variety of breeds. I had the Ohmi Filet which melts in your mouth as advertised. The cocktails we had were also well crafted.

Customer 3606.Name: RobertB
Customer 3606.Content: Our dinner was great as usual.  My kids and I go the Met during special occasions and this time our experience was awesome, as in the past!      We celebrated my son's birthday and his departure to Germany where he is deployed with The US Air Force.    The food, service, and attention was outstanding!

Customer 3607.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3607.Content: Always enjoyed dinning at the Metropolitan Grill.  The food & service are excellent. So far we never had bad experiences....^0^

Customer 3608.Name: MooToo
Customer 3608.Content:
Metropolitan Grill is quite simply in a class of it's own. 
As a British expat I often find it hard to find a restaurant with the right combination of ambience, food and service and class. This, I'm delighted to report, ticks all the boxes, several times over.

From the moment you enter the restaurant you are met by attentive staff who take your coats, usher you to your table and give you just the right amount of time to settle before prompting your drinks. 
From the maître d' to the sommelier to the dessert waiter, each person played their role to perfection and demonstrated exceptional knowledge of the menu and options available to our somewhat eccentric range of diners.
I would utterly recommend the Wagyu (of course!) and the lobster oscar tenderloin. It would be hard to choose a bad dish here - with every ounce of care and attention paid to making sure the steak is just how you like it, and the timing is spot on.
I would thoroughly recommend and look forward to returning with my husband rather than the very satisfied business party I attended with this time around.

Customer 3609.Name: Fletcher
Customer 3609.Content:
Ive been to the Met for a dinner prior, and was blown away by the Filet. 
Since that time (2012) I been to a lot of great steak places around town and out of town. 
Went with a group recently, 3 of us just the other night.
I ordered the 60 or so dollar Filet.  It was not the 95 dollar one.
I like my Filet or New York Medium Rare.
I found that good steak will melt in your mouth.
This one, I took a bite in the center and I had to chew it for 20-30 seconds.  I would expect this from a 20 dollar steak but 60, not impressed. 
I was with a friend from out of town and my girlfiend so I didnt say anything, nor in general would I. 
Appitizers where good though.

Customer 3610.Name: Pkfinedine
Customer 3610.Content: I've been to the Metropolitan Grill many times over the years, it's expensive but you can always count on a wonderful meal.   This time was a bit of an exception.  The salmon was excellent but the steak overlooked and not quite as tender as usual.   The French Onion soup is one of the best I've had anywhere but my Mom didn't even eat her salad because it was so soaked in dressing.  Our favorite part of the meal is usually the cherries jubilee, we order it every time, but this time it had no sauce at all.  It was ice cream with cherries and a thick paste and there wasn't more then a tablespoon of it.   Despite those errors, we would have walked away with a good experience if it wasn't for the service.  It started out well but after he delivered the entrees, our waiter disappeared for at least twenty minutes (I checked my phone) and my Mom and daughters thought it was closer to a half hour.  The only person we could find was the bus boy and he didn't speak English.  I was willing to go find him but I couldn't even see him and figured he went on a break.  I don't like to complain.  It's awkward and embarrassing and it was my daughters 18th birthday.  I didn't want it to go down that way.  I wanted to preserve the warm feelings we had going prior to the meal.  But delivering food and then going on a break, or whatever, and not checking on us first is unacceptable especially at 65.00 an entree.

Customer 3611.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3611.Content: This is my Favorite place for a tasty steak. Hands down the best Steak around.

Customer 3612.Name: HappyDave
Customer 3612.Content:
This was our first time to the Met....its reputation held for everything from the incredible service, the knowledge of wine, and the incredible food.
Jim was our waiter and as personable as any  and treated us as if he knew us our whole life...we will be back

Customer 3613.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3613.Content:
Best steak restaurant we know of on the West Coast. We love going there. 
Wine prices are outrageous however and should be reviewed.

Customer 3614.Name: Sbolung
Customer 3614.Content: Always the best steakhouse in Seattle! Tried the ohmi new york and it tastes like heaven!!! Melts like butter and crispy on the outside!!! One of the best steaks ive had in my life

Customer 3615.Name: Greenchileyumyum
Customer 3615.Content:
My wife and I went to celebrate a special occasion. I highly recommend reservations because although when we showed up at 6:30 PM for ours it was not too packed, by the time we left at 7:45 PM it was jumping! Hardly a seat free in a large dining space.

There are some very nice touches such as the staff asking to take your coat and checking it for you and the service overall was attentive and well done. Between the two of us we shared the Lobster Bisque (one of the best bites we had for sure), the Ceaser salad, and then the dry aged ribeye. Everything was delicious and even though we split we were not able to finish everything. 

I feel that the pricing of the restaurant was great for the level of quality and service you get. Very expansive wine collection and for you beer drinkers out there they have a decent tap selection augmented by a nice list of custom bottles. There is of course a full bar as well with all the cocktail options available.

We had a great time and will certainly come back. Thanks for a lovely evening Metropolitan!

Customer 3616.Name: labquilt
Customer 3616.Content: On our last couple of visits everything including the food was excellent, however on this visit the food did not live up to our expectations. We will try again assuming this was just a bad night.

Customer 3617.Name: nemoj
Customer 3617.Content: We had great service, great salads, steak, crab, desert, and great wine.... a great time!

Customer 3618.Name: DarY
Customer 3618.Content: The Met never disappoints me.   The only problem I have is not knowing what to order !!

Customer 3619.Name: Michto
Customer 3619.Content: From start to finish, this restaurant never disappoints. Best made cocktails, perfectly prepared steaks, and the tastiest side dishes I've ever eaten, including their bacon infused brussel sprouts - yummy! The servers know their stuff and recommended winning items in all categories by finding out what we were in the mood for. A key attribute to a complete dining experience.

Customer 3620.Name: Earl
Customer 3620.Content:
We visited the Met for dinner prior to the orchestra. One of us is gluten free, and wasn't feeling well earlier in the day. Our server was engaging, endearing, and so thoughtful in helping make menu selections and managing the pace of the meal. 

Thanks so much for a memorable experience!

Customer 3621.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3621.Content: We had a delicious dinner after the NFC Championship game. Great place to celebrate and have a great meal and a nice bottle of wine. Always a great time at the Met!

Customer 3622.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3622.Content: Went to dinner after the NFC Championship game.  The Met was electric that evening!  To say that everyone was excited is a HUGE under statement! When Russell Wilson, Doug Baldwin and Jermaine Kearse arrived to enjoy their post game dinner..the place erupted with applause, cheers, and chanting.  It was awesome.  We have been to The Met numerous times before, but this night was very special.  As always the service, the food and the ambiance was excellent!

Customer 3623.Name: swiss
Customer 3623.Content: The service here was amazing. I can't emphasize that enough. The steak was on point, and I cannot think of a better steak that I've had. When we ordered the chicago top sirloin originally, the waiter was good enough to inform us about why that was different from normal top sirloin, and saved us from a terrible decision! This has been my best dining experience, and I'm eager to come back.

Customer 3624.Name: Sportsdad
Customer 3624.Content: Best steak house in Seattle. This is where steak is steak cooked to perfection with an outstanding wait staff that will take care of you like no other in Seattle.

Customer 3625.Name: Murph
Customer 3625.Content: Never disappoints! This old Seattlw treasure has the very best steaks, fabulous seafood and over the top service! You will live it! We cheered in the Seahawks with the patrons & staff.

Customer 3626.Name: Shoeprincessaddict
Customer 3626.Content:
The Met Grill lives up to it's history and reputation as the VERY best steakhouse in Seattle bar none!
The selection, service, and ambiance is the best! 
Food/Steaks/Service was superior against Mortons, Ruth Chris, Brooklyn, Daniel's, John Howie, El Gaucho, and Jak's!!

Won't regret it!! A must eat at!! Still the very best!!

Customer 3627.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3627.Content:
The Met is one of our favorites. The food and service are special. If you are looking for an inexpensive place to enjoy a casual dinner... this is NOT the place to go. It is upscale and priced to match, but if you appreciate excellent food, service and ambiance, and you don't mind paying for it, you will love the Met. 

By the way, If you enjoy leaving a generous tip or are off put by someone else telling you how much you will tip, go in knowing that an 18% tip is likely to automatically be added to your bill.

Customer 3628.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3628.Content: Took my girlfriend here after receiving some gift cards for it and I enjoyed the meal greatly. Definitely pricey but worth it for the top quality food, service, and location.

Customer 3629.Name: Foodies
Customer 3629.Content: Had another great meal with you folks.  Had a great server too.  Amazing how I always get the best dining experience with you every time.  Just nailed our steak perfectly.

Customer 3630.Name: DonW
Customer 3630.Content: Took the wife for an anniversary dinner to The Met. It was our first time eating here and it did not disappoint. The food was incredible! We had the scallops for appetizer and waygu skirt steak and large filet mignon for main course; amazing plates! For dessert my wife ordered the cherries jubilee; I was already full but had to try it, and I do not regret it. We will return to The Met.

Customer 3631.Name: Chris
Customer 3631.Content: Everything was perfect except for some small service glitches. Prime rib delivered with wrong side....plated wrong. Also, the server started puting pepper on my bisque without asking first (I add pepper to nothing) & started pouring au jus on the rib after we asked to have it left on the table. Otherwise very good.

Customer 3632.Name: seekingbetterservice
Customer 3632.Content: We have been to The Met many many times. We can always rely on a great steak/ meal. This last visit while the food was ok, the steaks were somewhat dryer than normal and the service was rude & lacking. Maybe the waiter was having a bad day? He was rude, annoyed by anything we said or did and wasn't very attentive. Even the water/bread guy was somewhat apologetic and tried to make up for the rude waiter. Hoping that is a "fluke" as The Met has been our longstanding favorite dinner splurge.

Customer 3633.Name: vivi
Customer 3633.Content:
celebrated my boyfriend's bday there :D 

staffs were very friendly and warm that makes everything very different!
I didn't tell them about my bf's bday celebration when i was making the reservation but my server was very understanding and were able to make arrangements for my bf :)

I had a soup and salad lunch combo and a rib eye
My rib eye was cooked to perfection, with the right thickness of crust on the outside that was able to lock in the beef flavor and juiciness of the steak! 
My bf had a lobster bisque and prime rib. Lobster bisque was very creamy but it doesn't contain too much lobster flavor. 

For dessert, we had banana flambe <3 it is my all time favorite! and I will always go back to the Met for it. Everything was just right! they used the right banana, the right ice cream and the right caramel sauce. The banana flambe holds the magic to fulfill my sweet desire.

Customer 3634.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3634.Content: The food was warm. Steak was subpar. I have been a client for 20 years and I will never go back. The competition is great for a better steak in the Seattle market.

Customer 3635.Name: 03jakam
Customer 3635.Content: Had a blast - they go all out for the start of the year and I'm almost hesitant to talk about it at the risk of losing my new hot spot!

Customer 3636.Name: Okearn
Customer 3636.Content: We went here for New Year's Eve dinner and the service was amazing. The oysters and scallop appetizers were so fresh and well prepared. We really enjoyed the prime rib and steak. The wine steward was fantastic and we were not rushed at all. Highly recommend!

Customer 3637.Name: Stella0211
Customer 3637.Content: We took our 3 grandchildren for a holiday treat and had lunch.  We were early but got seated right away in a quiet corner of the restaurant.  The waiter did an excellent job of addressing the youngsters with their orders and suggested items for them.  All of our meals were delicious and portions were beyond what we expected.  Would definitely keep this restaurant at the top of our list for special occasions and just any day good times.

Customer 3638.Name: Crab
Customer 3638.Content: The Met is known for being a great steakhouse and my steak was marvelous but the crab fettuccine stole the show. It is a must have.

Customer 3639.Name: ermohn
Customer 3639.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is one of the best steak houses in the US and the world. It serves perfectly made steaks and sides with an amazing consistant quality backed by great service and very good wine list. Highly recommended.

Customer 3640.Name: Swag
Customer 3640.Content: I haven't been here for 12 years, and it was just as delicious as I remember.  I took my husband for Christmas while we were in town.  We shared the Porterhouse (which they split with no hassle), lobster mac and cheese, and root veggies.  The Met Manhattan was the perfect start to the meal, and Irish Coffees were the best way to end it.  Our server was amazing and the ambiance has the feel of a time long gone.  I love this place and will continue coming back when I'm in Seattle.

Customer 3641.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3641.Content: I almost don't need to leave a review. This place is amazing, and it's no secret. Celebrities, presidents, and the like eat here. We came for a nice family dinner after Christmas and loved every minute. We don't usually go to restaurants like this, so it was pretty much a once in a lifetime meal. While waiting we felt a little out of place since it is so fancy. Our server was amazing. He didn't make us feel like we didn't belong at all. He was friendly and I had anticipated kinda snobby. He had a good sense of humor and wonderful suggestions. This is the type of place you stay a long time, and he might have two tables all night. You get his undivided attention. The food was ridiculously good. My sister and I got the chateaubriand for two. Incredible. If you're interested in an unforgettable experience, this is it.

Customer 3642.Name: arikohn
Customer 3642.Content: Excellent!!  Always excellent!  Really extraordinarily good service and very, very good food.

Customer 3643.Name: sunshine
Customer 3643.Content: As always another great experience at the Met. The food was delicious and our server Todd was excellent. Great service and a funny personality. We have been coming to the Met for over 25 years and always enjoy, I can't say that about any other restaurant. We always go during the holidays and try for two or three more times thru out the year and have never been disappointed!

Customer 3644.Name: zoomsaxer
Customer 3644.Content: I have been going to the Metropolitan Grill since the early 90's.  The service has always been outstanding and the food has been incredible.  Recently I ordered the Chateaubriand for 2 ($136) and Lobster ($86).  Chateaubriand was fabulous!  Lobster was undercooked and very small for $86.  I should have listened to my server and gone for the Alaskan King Crab Legs for $65.  Wine List is incredible and if you have discretionary money to spare, splurge on a nice bottle of wine.  Overall experience this time was 9 stars out of 10!

Customer 3645.Name: Aidnah
Customer 3645.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful meal serviced by an exceptional staff.

Customer 3646.Name: Sparky
Customer 3646.Content: Food and service is always excellent here!  Our waiter, Roger, was both attentive and entertaining!  While It's a bit pricy, it's worth every dime - the food does not disappoint - a must try when in Seattle.  Definitely a five star experience!

Customer 3647.Name: Alexa
Customer 3647.Content: We (my family of 4)  frequent the Met 2-4 times per year and are never disappointed.  The food and service are always excellent.  The wait staff are staples in this establishment (no attrition) which makes the service that much more memorable because they know everything about the menu and what's not on the menu (but the chef will accommodate).

Customer 3648.Name: Food5Critic
Customer 3648.Content:
This restaurant, a Seattle landmark, is desperately in need of a facelift.  The owners should visit Ray's Boathouse and get some tips.  Ray's, like Metropolitan was fading and in need of renovation and improvement on food quality.  Rays is now a great restaurant again, with good food and modern setting.   

First, it did not help that we were seated at a table at the back of the restaurant, sandwiched in between the kitchen and a wait station and a boisterous family.  However, watching one of the waiters (actually, I think he was a water/clearer of table person in black apron) at the wait station vigorously pick his nose was, to say the least, not good for the appetite. 

Second, while the steaks are pretty good, they are not great.  I had the prime filet of tenderloin and it was just ok.  Having just had a nice steak dinner at John Howie over Christmas, where the filet was nicely seasoned (and you did not even have to put the exotic selection of salt on), the Met was disappointing.  I have been to the Met many times over the years and it was great years ago, but I do believe that the food is now mass produced and the restaurant is resting on its laurels.

Perhaps the owners should visit Texas and check out some good steak and come back with some innovative ideas.  There are better places in town to get steak at the Met prices (about $100 per person) and you can bet that is where I will be dining, until at some point, the Met brushes up.

Customer 3649.Name: ItsAllArtt
Customer 3649.Content:
In a past visit part of my delicious left overs we not in my cartons when I arrived home and a call to the restaurant was made but too late to correct the issue. This error was noted on our customer file and a free appetizer was given at this visit. Not necessary but show great concern for their clientele.  Also I know of one of the delicious special items they offer that are not on the menu and asked for it upon placing my reservation. I don't mention this special as there are few of these available an I want mine the next time I visit. 
Service is bar none at this establishment no matter who your server is. 
Take advantage of the Chocolate Lava Cake no matter how full you are. The left overs travel well and I enjoy it for several more days.
The experience dining her is well worth the, I hate to say expense, investment it really worth it. I have eaten at most of the steak houses here in Seattle and other cities in the US including New York and the Met serves the most consistent top quality beef anywhere !

Customer 3650.Name: Run2Eat
Customer 3650.Content: I have always heard good things but was put off by the expense. Finally went and tried... The service was outstanding, and that combined with the ambiance provided a warm and friendly experience. The martini was excellent. The food very very nice. The only surprise was that the steak was cooked more than expected. Both filets were cooked to the next higher level than requested. Very tasty but not quite what was expected. For the price and the expertise I would have expected total perfection. But overall a great experience, if a bit expensive.

Customer 3651.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3651.Content: This is the classic steak house. They have a great atmosphere fits the type of restaurant it is. The service was the best. Older waitress that really made you feel like you were special. The older generation brings back politeness and respect they all taught us growing up, the best. The food was excellent, fresh and prepared peferctly. The wine list was one of the best in the NW, they had it all. Thanks for a great evening for my family. We all enjoyed. Oh yes the chocolate lava cake was the exclamation point on the dinner. Thank you.

Customer 3652.Name: Noongster
Customer 3652.Content: What can you say that hasn't been said?! 👍 a lot of restaurants claim to be "the best steakhouse" with the "best prime steaks".  Come to the one that doesn't claim anything, but does it right! You can't go wrong, and the staff won't let you go wrong!

Customer 3653.Name: Suzy
Customer 3653.Content:
We always spend Christmas eve at the Met. Food was fresh, and perfect as always.

This is the first time we had a server who was a disappointment. He seemed disconnected, forgot items and would disappear.  Service has always been impeccable so this was quite a surprise.

Customer 3654.Name: Tedd
Customer 3654.Content: This was the best dining experience at Metropolitan Grill in the many years we have been dining there.  Our server, Todd, was knowledgeable about the menu, kept the meal paced perfectly, and asked us up front if we had any time restraints for the meal (and we did).  That had never been asked before and was important to us,  Metropolitan grill meal was outstanding as always.  Made our Christmas Eve dining experience exceptional.

Customer 3655.Name: MBP23
Customer 3655.Content: We had 7:00 dinner reservations and decided to have a drink prior to our reservation because we were about 10 minutes early. When 7:15 rolled around, the bartender poured us a glass of wine on the house and completely turned the situation around. At that point we didn't mind that we were waiting 30 minutes for a table. Thank You - we had a great experience.

Customer 3656.Name: CKSeattle
Customer 3656.Content: I'm jealous of all the great service reviews. Wish we'd experienced that for my birthday celebration 12/23/14. Our food, on the other hand, was amazing, as always.

Customer 3657.Name: kbruketta
Customer 3657.Content: I frequent for lunch.  it is a busy place but Carmen and her team take care of each guest.

Customer 3658.Name: Blondie
Customer 3658.Content: Lunch is the bar is always a treat. The food is consistently outstanding. Penny and Diane elevate the experience with their outstanding service and fun personalities.

Customer 3659.Name: wwww
Customer 3659.Content: great for steaks and super service.  it's my favorite in Seattle.  we go for family events.

Customer 3660.Name: MerryMel
Customer 3660.Content: We've been going to the Met for a holiday dinner for over 20 years. It's always great. The best steaks, the best service. In the past several years we've gone more than once a year and even without the holiday hubbub it is still always great. The staff is extremely accommodating, friendly, and professional. Cannot say enough good things about the place, and look forward to our visits each year.

Customer 3661.Name: KellieW
Customer 3661.Content: Great place for our family's annual holiday dinner!  Every year we have the best servers & food.   This year was even better, as we felt as though the staff treated us like family.....remembering our annual tradition! Our favorite scallops now can be ordered as an appetizer & we ordered two!  The clam chowder was perfect as well as the wedge salad which has apples as a a different twist.  My husband ordered lobster & I along with the kids stuck with the outstanding Filet.  We all shared lobster mac & couldn't get enough.....very rich, but so good! Our most memorable end of the night was the presentation of our dessert......bananas foster!  I highly recommend getting it!

Customer 3662.Name: Paris
Customer 3662.Content: Thank you for playing Christmas music at Christmastime. Had a great waiter and wonderful service and food.

Customer 3663.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3663.Content:
Excellent everything. Service, food, location.
The MOST polite employees I have ever seen, to each other and customers.

Customer 3664.Name: jbcapital
Customer 3664.Content: My family and I had dinner here over the holidays.  Our kids are 13,10 and 7 and the staff was brilliant with them, very accommodating and enjoyable.  The Met is a class act, be it a night out with the family or dinner with your spouse.

Customer 3665.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3665.Content: We came as guests from a gift certificate.  I had the salad....steak was cold and chewy.  Not very good.  My husband had a $55 steak....chewy.  He can cook that at home much better.  The Manhattans were good however and our server was great.  But I would not go back....too expensive, not great food, and very noisy and busy.  We were seated quickly however which was nice.

Customer 3666.Name: lovetodine
Customer 3666.Content: We can always count on this place.  It has never failed us to enjoy and have a great dining experience.  Thank you!

Customer 3667.Name: ShorelineSue
Customer 3667.Content:
The Met did not disappoint. We went for lunch, something our family has done each Christmas season for over 60 years, and chose the Metropolitan Grill this time. The food, staff and decorations were exactly what we wanted for this occasion. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and recommend it without exception. For an added festive touch, order the Hot Apple Pie. Created at table-side you will not be disappointed! 

Parking is a bit of a challenge for the mobility impaired but we worked it out. We went to Boka the past two years because of their complimentary valet parking from right in front of their door.

Customer 3668.Name: MIch
Customer 3668.Content: Always great steaks and wonderful service with exceptional wine.

Customer 3669.Name: LadyNguyen
Customer 3669.Content: This was a birthday dinner & a horrible experience. The service was horrible & incredibly slow! For a top of the line steak house many of the steaks were overlooked. I previously sent a complaint to The Met but never received any communication, apparently they don't care.

Customer 3670.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3670.Content: Great atmosphere for Sunday brunch prior to the Seahawks game. Several brunch options available on the menu and all of which were very generous portions. Our server was excellent as well and made sure we were taken care of. Would recommend to anyone attending the Hawks game as it's within a short walk to the stadium.

Customer 3671.Name: Jerry53
Customer 3671.Content: A very consistent and popular steak house in Seattle that serves some of the very best cuts of steak. I have eaten there many times and "The Met" has never disappointed us for quality, service and selection. The wine list is very extensive as you can find about any wine on the list in just about any price range. I would highly recommend this quality restaurant to anyone who wants a high quality meal for that special occasion or for entertaining business clients.

Customer 3672.Name: STILLhappilymarried
Customer 3672.Content:
We went to the Met anticipating a fabulous dinner.  We were seated at the perfect table to accomodate our party of 6.  
Two of us ordered Prime Rib...BIG mistake.  The meat was extremly tough, the second piece even more so.  Of course Management did not charge for our dinner, but I was disappointed not to have been able to enjoy the quality meal the Met is famous for.
Of course I will go back, but a word of warning....DON'T order the Prime Rib

Customer 3673.Name: cheeselove
Customer 3673.Content:
We go to this restaurant for every special occasion, when my friends and i came here for my birthday, and this restaurant gave us free creme brulee for birthday treat!

The skirt steak and the biggest one are soooo good! the fat and the meat are tender and melt in your month.

Customer 3674.Name: Bosc
Customer 3674.Content:
For the price I expected a lot.  The streaks were just OK, the service good but not wonderful and our table we were assigned for our open table reservation was right by the front door.  salads were great though.  I would recommend the iceberg wedge salad which had nuts that wre great.  

try the Mets own red wine before you agree to buy an expensive glass.  It was not good and I was happy with tan other choice. 

none of my party feel they would go back and spend the money again.

Customer 3675.Name: PreTheatherGroup
Customer 3675.Content: This is a great lunch spot, which I found originally.  I now use the Met for business lunches, out of town business dinners, special business dinners and for our 5th Avenue group.   I have included gift certificates in my 2014 holiday gift giving...always a huge hit!

Customer 3676.Name: sybersprite
Customer 3676.Content: Traditional steakhouse taken to a modern level with delicious food! Traditionally-clad service staff are very attentive and helpful, as well as knowledgeable about the menu and services. We had a very nice time here with excellent steak and side dishes. Would definitely return!

Customer 3677.Name: skenestabletalk
Customer 3677.Content: We have enjoyed this Seattle steakhouse for years as we lived and raised our family.  We currently live in Phoenix and travel to northwest often and every time we get to Seattle we try and make it to the Met.

Customer 3678.Name: Lunch
Customer 3678.Content: The Met did not dissapoint! Wonderful food, great service.

Customer 3679.Name: Barbarah
Customer 3679.Content: Jurgeon is the best wait staff we have ever encountered in all respects of his job. I apologize if I am not spelling his name correctly. He is just a pleasure to have as your server.

Customer 3680.Name: TheRightAngler
Customer 3680.Content:
My wife and I had a great dinner at the Metropolitan Grill.  Friday night just the two of us...  Used the valet parking, which helped since there isn't much close by.  We were welcomed and seated right away, maybe 5 minutes before our reservation time.

If memory serves, our waitress was Dianne.  She has worked there a long time, was very helpful with the menu and choices, and the perfect balance of being present and giving us privacy to talk and eat.

We shared a wedge salad to start, which was just the right size.  My wife had the prime rib with creamed spinach and I had a filet with the yukon gold potatoes.  Both steaks were very good...  hardly need the steak knife, and don't need the steak sauce.  I'm not a big spinach fan, but liked the creamed spinach and stole more of that than my wife did of my potatoes.  The potatoes were cooked well and I enjoyed them, but seemed like glorified hash browns.  We finished off with a chocolate lava cake, which was good, but chewier than we like (maybe more caramel than other restaurants).

All in all a very good dinner.  Prices are in the hiogher end of the "fine steakhouse" range, and didn't seem worth it, but dinner was good.

Customer 3681.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3681.Content: My husband and I always dine here when we are in Seattle. The lobster bisque is a must. The staff are always helpful with selections and are attentive to your needs.

Customer 3682.Name: karenjoe123
Customer 3682.Content: When we just want an excellent steak and a peaceful unhurried meal, the Met is where we go. Wonderful selection of sides ( the caramel bacon is to die for) and salads and desserts are top notch. The Met never disappoints.

Customer 3683.Name: Tbone
Customer 3683.Content: Great service and outstanding food!  Waiter was very attenttive and very patient.

Customer 3684.Name: jimbo
Customer 3684.Content: The Metropolitan Grill simply offers the finest dining and service in Seattle. The food is excellent and the service exemplary... You are treated very, very well at The Metropolitan Grill. It is expensive, but it is intended to be a very special occasion and it is.

Customer 3685.Name: dlawson
Customer 3685.Content: After a full day of shopping in Seattle, my wife and I enjoyed a very nice dinner at the Metropolitan Bar and Grill. Our table was ready when we arrived, great service, and the food was simply amazing. We had a wonderful experience. Merry Christmas!

Customer 3686.Name: mrkuen
Customer 3686.Content: It was second visit for me. It was a great lunch like first time!

Customer 3687.Name: LCLA
Customer 3687.Content: Great food and service, once again.... with a sad exception.  Our waitress (Kimberly) was personable and attentive (but not intrusive) and made us feel welcome. The steaks were very flavorful - just what I expected... and the kitchen delivered.  And the accompanying Bernaise sauce - yum!  The supporting cast was also appreciated.   Our sommelier was  pompous and condescending.  We've been around the wine block for many years and know our wines well, but this man was over the top.  The Met Grill did not have a bottle listed on the menu so the sommelier proposed another wine (same region and a similar blend).  It was opened and I tasted it, commenting that it wasn't as good at the Mark Ryan Dissident I was enjoying - this substitute was thin and it wasn't as enjoyable.  My husband said it would be OK so we drank the stuff.  Poor choice on our part.  This wine steward is not an asset to the Met Grill.  His performance and behavior detracted from our overall dining experience.  Too bad, because the rest of the staff is such a pleasure.

Customer 3688.Name: KB14
Customer 3688.Content: Top steak place in Seattle, personally think the best steak restaurant in Seattle!

Customer 3689.Name: BerkeleyBob
Customer 3689.Content: The Met Grill is an iconic, Seattle landmark restaurant and an exquisite dining experience. Know in advance this restaurant is easily among the most expensive steak houses in the country, and while the quality of the meat is very good, is it far from extraordinary. But one goes to the Met for the experience, and that is tough to beat, but not for those on a budget. :)

Customer 3690.Name: SuperPickyEater
Customer 3690.Content: A series of events led us to dine at MG with my cousin who was visiting from out-of-town and my two teenage boys (14 and 16).  I am glad that we went for this Seattle experience.  We were excited at the possibility of seeing some local celebrities - we didn't - but were placated instead by the photographs on the wall and then the menu items.  Our waiter was EXCELLENT, very friendly and extremely knowledgeable and patient with all of our questions.  My 16 year old ordered the peppercorn stead and mashed potatoes.  My 14 year old ordered king crab legs and mashed potatoes.  Both - who are big mashed potato eaters - said they did like the potatoes.  Both complained that they were too lumpy and not hot enough.  Younger said his crab legs were a little rubbery.  I had the Caesar salad.  The dressing was not "anchovy" enough for me; and, although I opted for the addition of the actual anchovy fillets, I was underwhelmed.  Younger ordered dessert - ice cream with chocolate and caramel sauces in a almond brittle "cup" - and that was delicious.  : )  Overall, we had a great night and fun visit and meal with our relative.  Elder rated the overall experience a 4 out of 5 and Younger a 4.5 out of 5.  Would definitely go back to MG with any other out-of-town guest who also desired the same Seattle experience but might not choose MG as the next birthday restaurant; although, the nine layer chocolate cake might be worth the trip . . .

Customer 3691.Name: PaulD
Customer 3691.Content:
The steaks and sides were all good, but not what I expected from a longtime establishment like the Met. My rib eye (usually the tenderest cut) was chewy and tougher than a standard Costco rib eye I could make myself. The wine steward was somewhat abrupt and did not seem knowledgeable. His visit to our table was less than 30 seconds. While a good steward/sommelier should be efficient in their selections, I felt that he was not taking the time to understand our tastes and goals for our wine. It was clear from his vague descriptions that he had never tried the wine that he pushed us toward. For the money (or much less), there are other better quality steak houses, with more personalized service.

On the plus side, our server was very friendly and attentive. The steaks also come with sides, as opposed to making you buy them à la cart like other places. The Met also graciously provided a free dessert to celebrate our anniversary.

Customer 3692.Name: MerryMel
Customer 3692.Content: At least twice a year, I visit the met with various friends and family. It is always a treat. The best steaks ever, and the service to match. We're always treated so well. My favorite is my holiday season dinner with an old pal. We've been going to the met for an extravagant steak dinner for over 20 years. To never have been disappointed in all that time is really saying something.

Customer 3693.Name: SanDiegoH
Customer 3693.Content:
AVOID---So Very Disappointing! 

It was our 30th Anniversary and so I planned our trip and made a reservation through Open Table in August for November; the only request I made was for a table out of the way, off the busy path. They have plenty of those, but clearly were unable to make that one accommodation. The night before we went to Lecosho and the difference was striking; there we were well taken care of and even the owner Matt came by to check on us and chat. Metro Grill is clearly counting on their history to keep them going! If you want to be treated as a valued customer, pick somewhere else!

Customer 3694.Name: Braindoc
Customer 3694.Content: There were 4 of us and all had excellent meals.  My only complaint is that the lamb was a bit too fat, would have probably ordered something else had I known to expect that.  My wife had prime rib that was superb. The Baileys coffee was a great finish to the meal.

Customer 3695.Name: runwench
Customer 3695.Content: The food here is outstanding. It's a bit pricey, but you get large portions. Our server was excellent also.

Customer 3696.Name: Alan
Customer 3696.Content: Excellent waiter who helped us celebrate our 55th anniversary.  All on top of wonderful steaks.

Customer 3697.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3697.Content: This has become our favorite steakhouse. It’s always a wonderful experience. The carrot cake is also to die for!

Customer 3698.Name: Scoutleader06
Customer 3698.Content: If you enjoy steak this is the place to eat it. Lives up to the reputation of one if the best steak house in the USA. Great seating and very nice service . Great wine selection . A bit pricey but overall worth it .

Customer 3699.Name: mikem
Customer 3699.Content: If you like to rub shoulders with famous pepole and athletes and enjoy the best steak in the north west !  This is the place also a great slection wine list not to mention the staff when I say professional servers nothing but the best at your table .They know when to answer qustions -socialise and when to leave you alone .The metropolitan grill is well worth the price . When you are in Seattle it is a must visit and bring your appetite

Customer 3700.Name: Luv2eat
Customer 3700.Content: The steak had a delicious flavor, but was cold. They took it back and reheated it... But then it came back chewy. Eventually, they fixed it and gave us a wonderfully delicious, warm new steak.

Customer 3701.Name: royalk4
Customer 3701.Content: They do an amazing breakfast/brunch menu on Sunday's that is great for pre-game Hawks eating.  High Quality food and service as always.  Steaks are available also if you need one in the AM, which is usually a good idea.

Customer 3702.Name: RestaurantGuru
Customer 3702.Content: Service was great, good atmosphere but just an ok steak. Steak was advertised as melt in your mouth but was tough and chewy. The flavouring was great but for the price I would have expected a better cut of beef.

Customer 3703.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3703.Content: service was "pushy" and appeared to want to rush us out...food was fair for "first class steakhouse. not up to our standards!!

Customer 3704.Name: pvd4me
Customer 3704.Content:
Decor:  Bit over the top... luxurious steak house feel.  Good cocktails and huge wine list although we did not find the wine they recommended to taste as the sommelier described.

Steak:  Went with the long-bone rib eye.  The waiter warned us that the med-rare might be too rare on the bone in cut so we went med well at his recommendation.  Wish we would have stuck with the usual med rare or maybe moved up to medium.  The steak was flavorful and enough to feed 2 (we split the steak for a $6 charge)... sides were good.

Service:  Great except for when we were trying to pay and leave to stretch out a bit from all the food we consumed.  took a while to get our check and then get it back after they ran the cards.

Place is usual high-end steakhouse prices.

Customer 3705.Name: Meeh
Customer 3705.Content: I have heard amazing reviews about the quality of the steaks and service at the Met.  Our group was celebrating a special occasion and saved up for the $600 meal.   Long story short, our waiter didn’t really seem to have anything to recommend other than a $135 steak.  Our meals were served when we will still eating our appetizers. My stake was 75% fat and my boyfriends was extremely tough.  We did get replacements, but by that time everyone had to go.  Very disappointed, when spending $600 on dinner, I expected better.

Customer 3706.Name: caesar790
Customer 3706.Content: Lobster bisque is off the chain. Had the steak sandwich with au jus. Excellent.

Customer 3707.Name: Rojogcs
Customer 3707.Content: Skip the candied bacon if you don't like the English-style cut.

Customer 3708.Name: Cindy
Customer 3708.Content:
Most of my business lunches are hosted at the Met.   Everyone looks forward to a great lunch at the Met and the friendly service.  
I have been taking my clients there for about 20 years and never a disappointment!

Customer 3709.Name: Jacque
Customer 3709.Content: Outstanding service, seafood sampler, wine selections & food.  Bananas Foster entertaining!

Customer 3710.Name: Italianfantastic
Customer 3710.Content:
I search for a high high Quality place to have a great meal, The Met fit the bill.
We went to eat and that is what we did
Very good quality food and amazing service, the older ladies"waitress" reminded me of
the neighborhood Deli servers from when I grew up in Fairfax area of Los Angeles

Customer 3711.Name: Nick
Customer 3711.Content: Great food, fantastic staff.  Makes this one of my favorites.

Customer 3712.Name: rickh
Customer 3712.Content: A classic old steakhouse in Seattle.  It did not live up to its reputation or our high expectations.  the food was good, but not as good as Mortons or Mastros.  The service was mediocre.  Our waiter seemed unhappy and it was hard to get water refilled.  Not as expensive as it seems.  The entree comes with a side, making the price of a steak seem higher than a traditional steakhouse.

Customer 3713.Name: Forky
Customer 3713.Content: Decent steak, but nothing too spectacular.  Maybe a good steak place in Seattle, but honestly similar to Capitol Grill and other major steakhouses.

Customer 3714.Name: cheeselove
Customer 3714.Content: we went here to celebrate my 21st birthday, i had skirt steak which just melting in your tongue, we shared a Caesar salad for stater, which is a generous potion, and the steakhouse give us a free desert for my birthday, which is a big creme bruee with a cute tiny candle lighted on it.  the creme bruee is amazing!!! and super yum!!!

Customer 3715.Name: ed35244
Customer 3715.Content: We chose this place based on all the high ratings it was given.  It was very disappointing. The food was just okay.  Don't get me wrong it wasn't awful, but when you factor in the price to eat at this place, there was nothing special about the food, service or atmosphere (way to loud).  We ordered the filet's and both came out undercooked based on what we told the wait staff.  My husband knew more about wine then their Sommelier which is another disappointing feature about the place.  When your bill is over $400.00 you want to leave feeling like it was worth it not disappointed and thinking you paid based on their reputation and nothing else.  I would NOT go back even if it was free!!

Customer 3716.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3716.Content: My favorite steak place... anywhere. always on our list whenever we're visiting Seattle from Vancouver.

Customer 3717.Name: WestSeattleDiners
Customer 3717.Content:
Always the best steak in town. 
Always the best service.
Always the best drinks.

Ventured away from the steaks and tried the buffalo this time. Outstanding.

Customer 3718.Name: MurrayHillperson
Customer 3718.Content: I forgot my reading glasses and the print of the wine list is small.  The waiter found me a pair of glasses and lent them to me.  Very professional and attentive service.  Food was great also.

Customer 3719.Name: SupremeGoddess
Customer 3719.Content: Although we all hit the worst traffic ever while trying to get to the Met, it was worth it as we enjoyed a wonderful meal and had a great time. The service, as always, was impeccable, the steaks up to expectations which were high.

Customer 3720.Name: DiscriminatingDiner
Customer 3720.Content: Metropolitan Grill has the best steaks in Seattle - hands down !!! After all one cannot survive on fish alone !!!

Customer 3721.Name: 30Years
Customer 3721.Content: Fun, romantic, East Cast feel, GREAT FOOD!  Best meat in town and served just the way I like it.

Customer 3722.Name: KarenG
Customer 3722.Content: Food and drinks were excellent. Their take on Manhattans very nice.  Pricey but a Landmark steakhouse to try while in Seattle.  Had to be reseated to a quieter location although we requested a quiet location when making reservation.  They were gracious in accommodating us to a booth vs table in center of room.

Customer 3723.Name: Malamute
Customer 3723.Content: Great place to celebrate a special occasion. The service is flawless and the food is amazing. Can't wait to go back.

Customer 3724.Name: BJMc
Customer 3724.Content: Go there every time we go to Seattle. Every time is awesome. Wait staff knowledgable and friendly.

Customer 3725.Name: Scrappy
Customer 3725.Content: The service was good but it felt like the waiter was pushing us for our order to turn the table. My husband ordered his steak medium rare and it came out well done and tough.

Customer 3726.Name: steakfans
Customer 3726.Content: The food was fantastic as was the service.  I was a little disappointed that we were the first group to arrive and be seated in a separate dining room and placed right by the machines.  It was pretty noisy being next to the service area.  Kind of distracting, but we absolutely love The Met.  Had a wonderful time.  Next time we are with a large group, I will request not being placed by the ice/water machines, etc.  It would have been perfect if we were sat totally across the room from it.  It made me want to shut the door to keep the noise out as it echoed by where I was seating.  The Met is one of our absolutely favorite restaurants.  We will be back again and again.  Thank you.

Customer 3727.Name: XmasBirthdayDinner
Customer 3727.Content: Amazing as always. The hardest part is trying new things because the Prime Rib is so amazing.

Customer 3728.Name: 6foodandwinelovers
Customer 3728.Content: My husband and I were looking for a good steak and we think we had the best steak ever. Both perfectly cooked with great flavor and the baked potato was ridiculously great!

Customer 3729.Name: Maddog
Customer 3729.Content:
Showed up in time and table was ready - had drinks in the bar first and they graciously whisked us to our seats - personal coat check etc.

Very attentive waiter with great recommendations - split salad and steak entree.  Server forgot and appetizer but remembered in later and said he would make up for it on dessert but we were full.

Overall very solid experience in this benable steak house!

Customer 3730.Name: AlWafa
Customer 3730.Content: The Beef tenderloin was excellent quality and cooked to perfection.The salmon was better than any seafood restaurant. Great service.

Customer 3731.Name: Paul
Customer 3731.Content: As always GREAT. Good service good valet everything was great. It should be as it is number 1 in Seattle.

Customer 3732.Name: slhm
Customer 3732.Content: You can always count on a great, flavorful steak and are comfortable entertaining at this restuarant

Customer 3733.Name: Kenneth
Customer 3733.Content: Good to visit again.  Food and service were great.

Customer 3734.Name: Alaskan
Customer 3734.Content: The service was fabulous, but I think the prices are outrages.

Customer 3735.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3735.Content: Everything from the Valet parking to the dessert was outstanding!   Our serverer Bruno was very attentive informative and extremely pleasant, I highly recommend the Met!

Customer 3736.Name: Roger
Customer 3736.Content:
I had read quite a bit about the Metropol grill and had, had plans to visit it for my birthday. 

The food was incredibly well presented. Well proportioned and flavorful.
I was unsure as to what to order and the waitress suggested a very nice steak. My lady and I split the meal because it was nearly 30oz of meat. 
Unfortunately it came with quite a bit of fat and bone in it. Taking up most of its total ounces. 

The drinks are very, very interesting. Many flavors and items that make your mouth confused and excited. Highly recommend them.

The food was good, made us full and happy. Price was not agreeable for what we purchased though. We ended up with a nice charge for splitting a meal, $10-15 charge of some kind, I forget.

They did give us free creme brulee for my birthday, very classy. Points for that.

Customer 3737.Name: arikohn
Customer 3737.Content: Always good - excellent, from the moment you walk in the door.

Customer 3738.Name: BillD
Customer 3738.Content: Great vintage ambiance, warm and cosy atmosphere. Food was very pricy but worth the cost in flavor and presentation.

Customer 3739.Name: HeisRisN
Customer 3739.Content: Solid high-end steak and seafood! Everyone enjoyed their dinner and the service was outstanding.

Customer 3740.Name: Luv2havedinner37add50toco
Customer 3740.Content: We enjoyed our drinks and wonderful dinner together. The food was very tasty and hot. We were so full, there wasn't any room for desert:(  We would of stayed for another glass of wine,but it became very loud and too much banging of dishes and glasses.

Customer 3741.Name: Eric
Customer 3741.Content: We enjoyed our meal. Pass on the Japanese filet and go with the regular filet. The haselnut brie was great by itself, but paired with grill burned bread not so much. The cream spinach was a great side choice, but pass on the mostly fat Carmel bacon and the potato cakes are just plain hash browns. The white chocolate coconut cake was by far the best we ever had, a must try for everyone.

Customer 3742.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3742.Content: We had a wonderful time.  But, unfortunately somebody messed up our steaks and got them wrong...  and when your paying $62 for a tiny filet (wagyu) I really wanted my steak Rare and I got Medium.. and my guest had the rare, and ended up only eating the outside.  and very expensive piece of meat to throw in the garbage.

Customer 3743.Name: Mousie
Customer 3743.Content: We took my Mom here to celebrate her 81st Birthday.  The food, with the exception of the Calamari starter, was absolutely excellent.  The steaks were out of this world!  The Met has, without a doubt, the best steaks in town.  We were here on a Tuesday night, there wasn't an empty table to be found.  We'll be back again !

Customer 3744.Name: Max1
Customer 3744.Content: Fabulous.......as usual! Every time we visit Seattle we dine at the Metropolitan Grill. No place else will do.

Customer 3745.Name: mangotango
Customer 3745.Content:
Ambience
Came here hoping for a romantic evening, had mentioned on our reservation that my girlfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary, but overall, was left wishing for more. First off, we were sat about two tables from the entrance. It was a particularly energetic night, probably because the Seahawks had just lost a game at home, but even so, it was a high traffic location and didn't seem appropriate at all. 

Service
I also felt put off by the dress of the service staff. There were quite a few that were wearing what seemed to be lab coats. Not sure if that is standard steak house attire, but it made the place seem sterile and cold. The lamp on the table helped some. 

Food
As for the food, we had their French onion soup. Delicious, light broth. Served hot and crispy cheese. A little too much cheese for me, but you can never complain for having too much. 

For the steak, we started off by asking the waiter for his recommendation. He was very unclear about which cuts were good and never asked us more clarifying questions about what we liked. In the end, we wanted to try a seasonal item, so we went with the Snake River Farms top cap sirloin. The server recommended medium rare so that was our temperature. 

Steak was very generously sized, and our server took it upon himself to cut the steak into small pieces for us. Personally, I would have liked for him to ask, as I enjoy attacking a large piece of meat on my own. Steak was rare. As in I took a piece and touched it with my lip, and the center was cold (not warm for a medium rare). I thought it was interesting and continued eating my steak, but my girlfriend had to send hers back for more time in the oven. Too bad. We ended up taking quite a portion of steak home and cooked it more then next day.

Overall
I wish the server would have asked us more questions and tailored our experience a little better. If their medium rare involves a cold center, that would have been nice to know.

Customer 3746.Name: GDO1
Customer 3746.Content: We had a great brunch on Sunday.  I was concerned we would be "pushed" as they would want to turn the table but there wasn't a hint of that.  Marilyn provided great service.  Try the artichoke hearts, they're great!

Customer 3747.Name: whitelight
Customer 3747.Content: A perfect dinner. Try the prime rib w/cajun rub.  Creamed spinach and lobster Mac n cheese were delicious sides.  Our waiter was charming and efficient even though it was a busy Saturday night.

Customer 3748.Name: jlgas
Customer 3748.Content: Took my daughter her for her birthday. Always a treat to go to met grill. Service is always great and the food is never disappointing.

Customer 3749.Name: futurecritique
Customer 3749.Content: Must try the house steak sauce. And the caramel bacon.  The delmonico is fabulous.  We will be definitely coming back.

Customer 3750.Name: Deesdining
Customer 3750.Content: Every thing was outstanding. Steaks we had were butter tender and perfectly cooked. Wonderful, personable wait staff. Creme brulee was the best i have ever had! Go & enjoy!

Customer 3751.Name: mac2
Customer 3751.Content: Quite pleased they honored a request for a "quiet" table as two of my guests were HOH.  All in all a good experience, still a stellar restaurant.  The waiter was especially accommodating and as my quests were visitors to Seattle took the time to explain the dishes and was quite patient with some unusual questions.

Customer 3752.Name: winebuff1
Customer 3752.Content: This was my 1st time having the wild acorn fed pork. Had to slice vary thin as the meat is chewy and some what tough but tasty. Those in our group that had aged steaks had a wonderful meal. wine list and server was top notch

Customer 3753.Name: JusLiv2Din
Customer 3753.Content: Spending the weekend in Seattle and was searching for a great steak house and my wife and i stumbled upon this gem. Our server Todd was OUTSTANDING. I got the 6oz Wagyu, Phenomenal! And she got the NY stripe, which was also very well prepared! The wine list was very diverse with a great selection! I would definitely return for a second dining experience.

Customer 3754.Name: ientre9y11
Customer 3754.Content: Tried the 6 oz. ohmi beef filet.  It was off the charts.  I have never had beef that tender.  The flavour was amazing.  There was no comparison to the Wagyu-Black Angus filet that my wife had.  The Bananas Foster were amazing, I lapsed into a diabetic coma after eating them.

Customer 3755.Name: Ambience
Customer 3755.Content: Year after year the Met proves to be an expensive but very classy way to celebrate a special day!!!

Customer 3756.Name: camcam
Customer 3756.Content: Our experience was excellent, great drinks, appetizers and steaks. Really disappointed in the sides however, the scalloped potatoes were inedible and the mashed potatoes were pasty - twice baked potato was the only good one.

Customer 3757.Name: JoeH
Customer 3757.Content: We've been to the Met dozens of times over many years and have never been disappointed. The food and service are stellar.

Customer 3758.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3758.Content: Hopefully an aberration, but we received very poor service.  Still really good food, but our meal was reduced to an endurance test, waiting for our server to make her rare appearance.

Customer 3759.Name: jmark
Customer 3759.Content: My wife and I don't go to The Met a lot, but it is one of our favorite places to eat when we are in Seattle.  The food is great, the ambiance is terrific and the service is very good.  We love to eat here.

Customer 3760.Name: widmer
Customer 3760.Content: We had a great experience and look forward to returning.

Customer 3761.Name: LRobs
Customer 3761.Content: We were visiting Seattle, and many locals heartily recommended Metropolitan Grill. Their praise was so effusive that perhaps our expectations were impossibly high to meet - that, and we are from Dallas, and not to be all obnoxious and "red state" about it, but we've been to some incredible steakhouses. :) All in all: Metropolitan Grill's food was good, but not the spiritual experience others described it to be. That said, the restaurant's ambiance/style is divine, and I would definitely dine there again.

Customer 3762.Name: prophix
Customer 3762.Content: Simply put, when you eat at the Met, you get what you pay for. Every dish will be the best thing you've ever tasted. The service will be the best you'll ever have. If you haven't gone, make sure you do at least once.  Mind you it is not a cheap place. Expect to pay about $60/steak (with side dish). Drinks are $7-12 each. With tip, i paid $350 for four adult to eat with a drink or two.  Totally worth it.

Customer 3763.Name: Siaki
Customer 3763.Content: My last visit to the MG was in 1996. You had the best steak in Seattle then, and I am happy to report the best steak in town still (except for price, of course). I look forward to returning sooner next time.

Customer 3764.Name: mrkuen
Customer 3764.Content: This is a best stake in Seattle. Soft, juicy stake.

Customer 3765.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3765.Content: This restaurant is a great choice for a special occasion restaurant.  We were celebrating our engagement and the server was so thoughtful.... we received a complimentary dessert. Has a great old school steak house feel....would recommend to anyone.

Customer 3766.Name: Martin
Customer 3766.Content: Whenever I'm in Seattle this is a must stop.  Friendly staff, not pretentious.  I took business associates who had not been to Seattle before.  They very much enjoyed the experience. Interested in specialty cocktails, if it's not on the menu just request it...

Customer 3767.Name: Bissynut
Customer 3767.Content:
Impeccable service and amazing food. I very much appreciated that they bent over backwards to accommodate my dietary restrictions. Our waiter was friendly and on top of everything I really wish I had gotten his name as he was really good. 
We had the prime rib and it was perfect. Cut like butter. We tried the caramel bacon (AMAZING) and afterwards we nearly had to be rolled up the hill to our hotel. 
I loved the gleaming wood and beautiful light fixtures, I know some folks have said the restaurant is looking dated but I didn't see that, I'd hate to have someone remodel the charm out of it.

Customer 3768.Name: PhillyT
Customer 3768.Content:
Great atmosphere, service and steaks.
The wine list was well represented but they did not have the wine we chose.
The steaks were very good but not to the temperature we requested...but still very good.

Customer 3769.Name: Luiwfood
Customer 3769.Content: Enjoyed our evening as we always do. Evening out at the Met.

Customer 3770.Name: dawnjuan
Customer 3770.Content: Another fantastic experience at The Met! This was our first time there for Seahawks brunch.  The food was delicious.  The bloody Mary's weren't the best.  Wonderful service and overall experience :)

Customer 3771.Name: SeahawkFan
Customer 3771.Content: We frequent the Met often!  This occasion was for brunch before the Seahawks game, great atmosphere, food, drinks😃

Customer 3772.Name: chuckrh
Customer 3772.Content: Took my friend to the Metropolitan for a pregame brunch. Wanted to have a special day & she had never been there. Everything was excellent. We arrived a half hour prior to our reservation & the staff accommodated us & gave us a table right away. The walk to the game was easy. We will most likely return for dinner in the near future. A nice option for pre-Seahawk festivities.

Customer 3773.Name: Jeremiah
Customer 3773.Content: Perfect for the night before the big game. Outstanding service. Great Bar and Steaks.

Customer 3774.Name: Scot
Customer 3774.Content: This is a great restaurant. Fantastic steaks and also nice selection of seafood and other choices. Option to add Crab or Lobster to your steak and a reduced price. Really nice selection of side dishes. When we visited, I ordered Buffalo tenderloin and my son had rib eye steak, and we split order of crab legs and a side of lobster macaroni & cheese. Steaks were cooked perfectly, and everything was very tasty. Wine list is deep, with unique selections as well as some reasonable value choices. Only challenge we had was our table for 2 was too small for our order (wine, entrees, side dishes) - the tables and booths for larger groups or much roomier. On our next visit, we ask for larger table so we aren't cramped and playing Tetrus with dishes.

Customer 3775.Name: Wazupwazzu
Customer 3775.Content: Always a must visit when in Seattle.  Amazing wine list, great service, and superb food.

Customer 3776.Name: justsaying
Customer 3776.Content: A wonderful experience overall for celebrating a special occasion. My husband and I felt very well taken care of in both service and food quality. Filet mignon, rib eye, roasted root veggies and mashed potatoes were all delicious. The server was observant and attentive and brought us a creme brulee on the house to help us celebrate our anniversary--a nice touch! The ambiance had a fancy, historical, genuine steakhouse feel without the stuffiness or pretentiousness. A reservation is recommended as the restaurant and bar was both packed on a Friday evening. Thanks Metropolitan Grill--you are our favorite steakhouse in the Seattle area!

Customer 3777.Name: Happy27
Customer 3777.Content: Fantastic food and wait staff. We went there for our very first time to celebrate 27 years of being married and it was a great experience.

Customer 3778.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3778.Content:
I love the Metropolitan Grill, but the past two times my steak had been overcooked.  This time it happened again, so my guess is that the house style for "Pittsburgh Rare" is a half step up from rare as the center was red and warm each time.  Their menu should offer "blue" as a temperature, as Ulrich took that as a temp and the steak came back perfectly.

Also, the wine list is exceptional and the desserts (Cherries Jubillee) were awesome!

Customer 3779.Name: tpilichowski
Customer 3779.Content: The Metropolitan Grill has great service and are well known for their steaks, can't pass it up for a special occasion.

Customer 3780.Name: GHansen
Customer 3780.Content:
Everything is always wonderful at this restaurant.  Perfect place for a special night.  Great service by James.  Also, kudos to the guy 
(sorry I can not remember you name) who carved and presented the Chateaubriand and Bananas Foster.  We all had a great evening.  
Fire in the hole did make another diner jump out of his seat.  We ALL got a smile out of that including him.  Thanks for all your great
work.

Customer 3781.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3781.Content: Exemplary staff, fabulous wine, delicious food and a relaxing vibe.

Customer 3782.Name: SydneyInSeattle
Customer 3782.Content: My husband and I went here for our 4th wedding anniversary.  Nothing could have been better.  From the food to the service, it was all amazing.  I had written in my OpenTable resi that it was our anniversary and they brought us an very large Creme Brûlée with a candle (for free!)  We will be coming back for sure!

Customer 3783.Name: keevoinseattle
Customer 3783.Content:
Wouldn't call myself a steak expert but have eaten at some pretty great steak houses in Chicago and around the world.  This may have been the best filet I've ever had.  

Thank you for a great night!

Customer 3784.Name: Pam2022
