Customer 3784.Content:
All in all a nice dining experience. A couple things, we weren't finished with out salads an appetizer when they brought out main course. 
Then the rib eye was grisly, we were going to 5th ave Theatre, and didn't have enough time to send back.
But our peach salad and the caramel bacon was delicious. Our waitress was fun and helpful.

Customer 3785.Name: Vissidarte
Customer 3785.Content: traditional steak houses! It has a clubby atmosphere, awesome food, artistic plating and great locally sourced produce! What sets this winning eatery apart is the well trained an harmonious team. From the hostess desk to the service staff you get an immediate sense of being in great hands!

Customer 3786.Name: LisaandShawn
Customer 3786.Content:
Another great dinner at "The Met" Our server Michael was attentive without being over bearing, professional and a great attitude!

Special peach salad was very nicely done. Calamari was perfect and the steak was flawless. 

Nice to have such a dependable and reliable place to dine.

Customer 3787.Name: LindaW
Customer 3787.Content: Best of the best steak house!  Food, service & ambience all top notch.

Customer 3788.Name: dahlya
Customer 3788.Content: Nice place, I treated my husband for his birthday at The Met, we both loved the food and the service was amazing! It was a little noisier than I would have liked but overall I would recommend it for a special occasion!(that's coming from a vegetarian!)

Customer 3789.Name: MeatFest
Customer 3789.Content: Everything a great steakhouse should be! Great experience.

Customer 3790.Name: wantagoodsteak
Customer 3790.Content:
My favorite restaurant and I got served the worst steak I have had since boot camp. It looked and tasted like it came from Denny's or Sizzler's. And I am not being melodramatic .I ordered a 16oz NY. It was about 3/8" thick and tough and under done. Wanted med rare, got rare. Do not know if I'll ever go back.
At those prices I expect great steaks, not Denny's steaks.

Customer 3791.Name: CareyNBilly
Customer 3791.Content:
Not too much more to say than "Amazing!".  Excellent martini and house Cab.  Started with a spinach salad and french onion soup (highly recommend both! My husband and I both had fillets (perfection)!  Though already stuffed due to the generous portions we went ahead and ordered the apple dessert cooked table side. Do be warned: though served in two dishes, this dessert is fit for a table of 5-6 people.
Our waiter was superb as was the gentleman who cooked table side.  The entire experience was perfection!

Customer 3792.Name: KrisRD
Customer 3792.Content: Food was amazing but the real gem is the service.  Our server made the experience the perfect dinner that it was. We will definitely be heading back!

Customer 3793.Name: scott
Customer 3793.Content: I love the Met, was only on Seattle one night and that was my obvious choice. Been a few years since I've been there, and while I expect a restaurant of this quality to be expensive, $72 for a New York strip???? Getting a little price prohibitive.

Customer 3794.Name: LJJLMP
Customer 3794.Content: We went before the Seahawks game and it made for the perfect day.  Great food and great lunch.

Customer 3795.Name: markl
Customer 3795.Content: Food was just OK overall but ludicrously expensive. Steak sandwich had a lot of fat, fries were barely warm Service was lackadaisical at best, which is not a goo thing at lunch. Will not go back.

Customer 3796.Name: Foodies
Customer 3796.Content: Always a top notch experience.  I try to get here every time I go to Seahawks games.  As good as the best Steakhouses in Chicago.  Carrot cake with makers mark bourbon ice cream rules!

Customer 3797.Name: cheeks314
Customer 3797.Content: huge disappointment across the board from the bartender's service to the expensive food.

Customer 3798.Name: foodiestu
Customer 3798.Content: After hearing so much about the Met Grill, the hype may have been too great. While the meal was perfectly satisfying, it was not particularly memorable except for the wine and wine service by Aaron. No fault in the place or its ambience. However, when you are paying top dollar, $83 for a 17oz bone-in filet minus 4oz for the bone, you expect a high standard. The meat was good, slightly overcooked on my mistake of not ordering medium-rare, but I've had much better quality and pricing. I can understand it is a Seattle institution, but I would be very surprised if you cannot find better.

Customer 3799.Name: Sixtydgree
Customer 3799.Content: We ordered the Chateaubriand with the crab macaroni and cheese and asparagus. Not only was the food outstanding, but they had an extensive beer and wine list. The restaurant, although very busy, wasn't deafeningly loud. I would most definitely go again.

Customer 3800.Name: sugarbear
Customer 3800.Content: The food was great, and service at the bar and table was fantastic.  Our waiter was very helpful guiding use through the various steak cuts that were offered.  Never pushed us toward additional items and was attentive without being in our face.  The Dungennes crab cocktail was really special.

Customer 3801.Name: Anotherfoodie
Customer 3801.Content: Service was extremely slow.  It literally took 20 mins for server to come & take our drink order.  We decided to time when the server would come by to take our appetizer order, it was 20 mins each course. We wanted to order a bottle of wine so she sent the wine captain over.  We gave him our preferences & we decided on one of his recommendations, a $150 bottle. The wine never opened up & we wanted to discus with him. he must've known it would suck becuz he never came back for our feedback! The best service we got there was from the valet guy! Anyway, the food itself was good (we got ohmi carpaccio, wagyu ny strip & filet mignon) but we still prefer John Howie's steak & service. Unfortunately, Met was not worth driving from Eastside.

Customer 3802.Name: snowboardjoe
Customer 3802.Content: My spouse and I were celebrating out first anniversary and wanted to come back here after the great experience we received last time about 2 years ago.  We ordered the peppercorn encrusted steak and looked forward to our meal (we normally go for filet, but wanted to change it up).  We both ordered our steaks as medium well expecting pink in the middle.  Ian's steak was a bit red, but tolerable.  My steak was rare throughout the center of the steak.  Add to that the crust of peppercorn almost completely covered up the flavor of the steak.  Our server responded and prepared a filet to my liking so dinner got saved somewhat.  They comped our desert, so that helped.  Really surprised something on the menu would not highlight the pepper.

Customer 3803.Name: RetiredMouse
Customer 3803.Content: For over forty years the Met has been our "go to place" with reasons ranging from our special occasions to we simply love to go to our favorite food corner in Seattle.

Customer 3804.Name: suzella
Customer 3804.Content: Not exactly a thrifty meal, but the portions were generous, the food was amazing, and the service was impeccable.

Customer 3805.Name: Dian
Customer 3805.Content: You will always get a perfect meal at the Metropolitan Grill!

Customer 3806.Name: luvtoeat
Customer 3806.Content: We have gone to the Metropolitan for years and have always had an outstanding meal.  You can always count on a delicious meal and excellent service.  They really care about their customers.  They give that "little extra" and remember their patrons.

Customer 3807.Name: disappoinment
Customer 3807.Content:
Looking forward to  great tasting steak but was disappointed with the toughness, grizzle, and quality. Have had much better in the past at the Met.
We might return to try hamburgers for lunch but very let down with the steak.
Tracy Rowley

Customer 3808.Name: Max1
Customer 3808.Content: Every time we visit Seattle we dine at this restaurant. It is simply the best steak house in the Pacific Northwest. The food is incredibly delicious and the service is outstanding.

Customer 3809.Name: Bagpipe99
Customer 3809.Content: Excellent food, service, and atmosphere. Wide selection of beverages. A bit on the pricey side but worth it for a special occasion.

Customer 3810.Name: Calfan2
Customer 3810.Content: We walked in, we were greeted with a friendly smile, we were escorted to our table and had the most fabulous meal.  We eat the best Filet Mignon ever!  It was worth every penny!

Customer 3811.Name: JPhM
Customer 3811.Content:
Great food as usual accompanied by very professional service. Highly recommended.

My only pet peeve is the patrons are dressing down mostly for such a high priced restaurant, some were in shorts and flip flop.

Customer 3812.Name: DessertFirst
Customer 3812.Content: Heard many good things about this restaurant and can confirm the service was very good. The food however was nothing that really set this place apart form others and at the price point did not live up to the hype. May have been just our experience and others would enjoy mire.

Customer 3813.Name: Tom1
Customer 3813.Content:
We had a perfect dinner in your "Chairman's Room" with two other couples as our guests.
We wouldn't change a thing.  It was our first visit in the last 5 years and nothing has changed, just as we had hoped.

Customer 3814.Name: Michael
Customer 3814.Content: Our waiter was surprised that we arrived for dinner at this well known steak house.  But it was close to our hotel and we wanted to walk.  The chef was very accommodating for us as vegans.  We had vegetarian food and asked them to hold the cheese.  The place was packed and was an exciting, lively, yet sophisticated place to eat.

Customer 3815.Name: CuisineSeeker
Customer 3815.Content: Metropolitan Grill is an outstanding steak house. I give them 5 stars because for their professional, friendly, and knowledgeble staff. The food is excellent and cooked to your liking. Also the ambiance is elegant yet welcoming. I have eaten here 4 times and have never been disappointed. I recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great dining experience.

Customer 3816.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3816.Content: $72 16oz Wagyu NY. Tough, flavorless, ice cold on arrival, shredded while cutting, max 13oz. Twice baked, dry, cold ,been sitting out, if not for lance the evening would have been an F-, it was just an F. Reputation is one thing, actual quality, service, knowledge is quite another!!!

Customer 3817.Name: AnniversaryDiner
Customer 3817.Content: I'd been to the Metropolitan Grill about a year ago for my brother's wedding reception. The spread that was served in the Chairman's Room was delicious. This past Thursday (8/21) I went for a second-year anniversary dinner and was blown away. The ambience is warm and inviting; we had a server that was very personable and funny. I had the combination Wagyu filet and Prime filet. My fork just glided through the Wagyu and the Prime had an intensely meaty flavor. Ultimately, this was one of the most fantastic dining experiences I've ever had. It was unquestionably the best steak my boyfriend or I had ever had, or perhaps will ever have.

Customer 3818.Name: RoadWarrior
Customer 3818.Content: We selected Metropolitan Grill because it was highly touted on TripAdvisor and near our hotel.  Our server, Sean, was very knowledgable of the menu (both food and bar) and made valuable recommendations. He was extremely attentive without being intrusive. My husband had the ribeye, which he declared was outstanding (and he is a bit of a steak snob). I had the halibut, which was perfect.   We topped the dinner off with a dessert of Maker's Mark ice cream.

Customer 3819.Name: RetailManager
Customer 3819.Content: "Old Time" is a good thing. Great service. Fine dining with a casual feel. Waite help was spot on, and very helpful. I would recommend this restaurant to any one who wants a great steak. Seafood was also good.

Customer 3820.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3820.Content: We had an great experience. Service was outstanding and food was even better. We will be back on our next trip to Seattle

Customer 3821.Name: TPap55
Customer 3821.Content: I loved the fact that our group was received with open arms by, not only Mike Smith (who was awesome/most knowledgeable person on steaks I have ever met, to the person "performing" the Bananas Foster, with a little help from his friends.  Exactly what I remembered from previous visits....forgot how good it was to eat in a true dining establishment.  Thanks for the great times and Mike, thanks again.

Customer 3822.Name: sammy
Customer 3822.Content: I'm willing to pay top dollar for a great steak and service, but the Met dissappointed.  The server was rushed, and didn't seem to have time to talk to us or give us time to ask a few questions.  3 of us had steaks, and 2 of 3 were very happy.  I was not pleased with the quality.  Not that it was bad, but if I pay $65, I expect pretty close to perefection.

Customer 3823.Name: luv2dine
Customer 3823.Content: I went for a quiet dinner (personal celebration) and wasn't disappointed.  Though they are known for their steaks (which was good), the mashed potatoes and carrot cake were amazing!  I know, mashed potatoes, but they were absolutely delicious and the 5-layer carrot cake was so good!

Customer 3824.Name: SFermin
Customer 3824.Content:
Best steak house in Seattle, WA. Every time we visit Seattle we make sure to have dinner at Metropolitan. The service and food is alway outstanding. Highly
Recommend it!

Customer 3825.Name: CoolDuckDon
Customer 3825.Content: The first time I ate here was incredible and you're always scared the experience will not be the same...wrong, so wrong.  Brought my wife the 2nd time around for our anniversary dinner and was blown away by how will the saff took care of us.  We ordered Calamari for our appetizers and some cocktails before settling on the meal.  My wife ordered the 12oz. Prime New York Strip Loin with Asparagus & Béarnaise Sauce and I ordered the 18oz. Blackened Prime Rib with a side of Caramel Bacon...too much food done to perfection.  The food was better than I remembered and I continue to recommend this restaurant to anyone willing to listen to me.  I wish we had a Metropolitan Grill in the Bay Area!!!!

Customer 3826.Name: TonyC
Customer 3826.Content: Loved the food and service. Great place to celebrate.

Customer 3827.Name: raptorlover
Customer 3827.Content: Love the Metropolitan Grill.  The food is amazing, everything is cooked to perfection.  The service is top notch, the people are attentive, friendly and fun!

Customer 3828.Name: Sandy
Customer 3828.Content: I am been to the Met many times, and this time was for my birthday.  We were seated in an area with 3 other groups celebrating birthdays, which we thought was charming.  Meal was one of the best we've had here.  Had a top sirloin, usually get filet minion.  Sirloin was beautifully prepared, one of the most flavorful cuts I've had.  Hubby had the prime rib and raved about it.  Enjoyed a full course, drinks, apps, dinner, wine and dessert - Wonderful! Service was perfect, even car valets were friendly.   This is a great place for a special occasion or celebration!

Customer 3829.Name: Jake
Customer 3829.Content:
The overall dining experience and food quality fell far short of expectations.  Metropolitan is known for its steaks which is why we came here.  But each of our three stakes was mediocre.  I tasted the other two stakes in addition to the one I ordered.  One of our guests ordered a pasta and crab dish. My steak, in particular, was overcooked.  But none of the steaks was particularly memorable.  One of my guests said the mashed potatoes were more memorable than the stake.  But at $70 an entry, you're not paying for the mashed potatoes.  

The ambiance left a lot to be desired too; we were in a booth that didn't comfortably seat all four of us.  We were in a long line of booths so could see people walking up & down the aisle all night.

Customer 3830.Name: MichaelB
Customer 3830.Content:
We were escorted to our table which was in the lower level sitting area. The place smelled really bad with very old decor which has not been updated or even cleaned in years. The booth had stained and dust on the seating cloth. The carpet was old and dirty. The waiter was the worst. He only checked on us twice one to take the drink order initially and second when he went to get the food. The steak came out cold and dry.
If you want to pay overpriced steak, poor service and dine in old dirty establishment, this is your place otherwise there are tons of steak houses in Seattle that take the food and service and ambience seriously.
One of the worst dinning experiences in a long time

Customer 3831.Name: Darci
Customer 3831.Content: Delicious food and great service. One of my favorite spots in Seattle!

Customer 3832.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3832.Content: The waiter was very attentive and his timing with everything was perfect.  He was light-hearted and relaxed.  The food was spectacular!  The steak was cooked to perfection.

Customer 3833.Name: PNWtransplant
Customer 3833.Content: Service was great. Steaks were great but roasted veggies could have used a bit more seasoning.  Lemon pear drop cocktail was excellent. Nice ambiance.  Enjoyed our experience.

Customer 3834.Name: kbyrd101
Customer 3834.Content: Tom and I celebrated being a newly engaged couple this past Friday night at the Metropolitan.  We were in a time crunch partially due to his flight to Seattle from Medford being a bit late and also due to the fact that we had tickets for the 9:30 performance at Jazz Alley.  Everyone at the restaurant (from the hostess to the cocktail servers to the waitress. to the chef to the bus boy) fully accommodated our short schedule and did everything they could to make our dining experience a wonderful one to always remember.

Customer 3835.Name: Yakivegas
Customer 3835.Content:
Steaks were absolutely cooked to perfection. Extremely tender, excellent flavor.
Our server, Kim, was friendly, engaging and knew the menu inside and out.
One of the best restaurant experiences I have had in years.

Customer 3836.Name: yzzilk
Customer 3836.Content: I favor the Met over El goucho, morton's and Daniel's. They all have good food, but the Met is a cut Above the rest.

Customer 3837.Name: Traveler
Customer 3837.Content: We had a very nice booth as requested and were greeted promptly by our server. He explained the menu and cuts of meat as well as the specials. Our meals were prepared to perfection and as ordered. Everything was delicious. If we return to Seattle this will definitely be on our list.

Customer 3838.Name: Tjugirl
Customer 3838.Content: Wonderful steaks. Tables a little worn looking. Server was nice but didn't make much suggestions about wine or food.

Customer 3839.Name: Love
Customer 3839.Content: Great service and wonderful service. This place had the most flavorful steak I have ever had. I was there with my husband and my dad. My mom past away in September And we were there to homer her.

Customer 3840.Name: Jsmith
Customer 3840.Content: This is the place to go to when in Seattle...  The food was wonderful... service top notch... and the experience something we will look forward to when back in seattle

Customer 3841.Name: BAMABob
Customer 3841.Content: Been going to the "Met" for 15 years and have never once been disappointed. This time was no different. Wonder steaks. Generous drinks and fantastic service. Also within walking distance of most of the major downtown hotels. Simply said it does not get and better.

Customer 3842.Name: Travels2dine
Customer 3842.Content:
First of all, we're from LA.  We have great steak houses…..and we were duly impressed.

We started with drinks in the bar…and they even transferred over the tab…and the wine steward offered us a wonderful choice in our price range.
Our waiter guided us with some choices on steaks, and starters and we selected the almond crusted scallops…which were outstandingly amazing!  We savored every bite.  The lettuce wedge was by far the best ever….lots of yummy surprises like apples and more…
We shared a large sirloin and baked potato which were both flavorful, and tender as any filet.  

A true Seattle find.

Customer 3843.Name: p33833
Customer 3843.Content: Pricey, but worth every penny.  Best steak in the United States, bar none.

Customer 3844.Name: CraftyGirl
Customer 3844.Content: We always make sure to visit The Met during our visits to Seattle.  We always enjoy it!

Customer 3845.Name: RLTs
Customer 3845.Content: My oldest daughter turned 13 years old and she wanted a really good steak....so she chose "The Met".  She was star-struck with all there was to offer and she said this was the best birthday ever. She was over joyed!~

Customer 3846.Name: SteakLover
Customer 3846.Content: If you're looking for a good cut of beef, stop looking. The steaks here are the best in town! The service is also second to none.

Customer 3847.Name: Tast
Customer 3847.Content: The Clam chowder was too salted. Told the waiter but nothing to change.

Customer 3848.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3848.Content: staff well trained and observant, food was great, a bit overpriced compared to premiere steak houses in other major cities.  service good but at time meal served had 3-4 options (pepper, baked potato toppings, au ju,...) which seemed more designed to show service than to enhance the meal. was good but 4 person booths were very tight fit for 4 men to have comfortable business dinner and discussion.  in fairness, we were there on busy night.  in another city, this wouldn't be as highly rated but Seattle doesn't have many choices for truly great steak houses.

Customer 3849.Name: Canuck
Customer 3849.Content:
Service is hurried and interruptive.
Can use a smile 
Wine list is extensive but excessively marked up
Food great
Ambience and setting awesome

Customer 3850.Name: runnergirl15
Customer 3850.Content: This was absolutely the best dining experience i have had in many years. We didn't feel rushed and the food was excellent!

Customer 3851.Name: FresnoDBA
Customer 3851.Content: Excellent service with good food. Appetizers were great, crab cakes, calamari, oysters.  So full, could hardly handle dinner.  Steaks and lobster mac n cheese, excellent.

Customer 3852.Content: This was the best meal my wife and I have ever experienced. It was high end pricing but was worth every penny. I had the ribeye it was the best steak juicy and tender and flavorful.  My wife is not a big beef fan but the filet in mushroom sauce may change her perspective. Service was friendly. If we lived in seattle this would be a once a week dinner.

Customer 3853.Name: Sherri
Customer 3853.Content: Great restaurant! Food is outstanding...even on the children's menu. Good place for all types of people...we were there as a family but there seemed to be numerous groups of people as well.

Customer 3854.Name: Vegasfriends
Customer 3854.Content: It was a very enjoyable evening. I had never been, Scott our server made it very enjoyable with some great recommendations!

Customer 3855.Name: seattlerestaurantfan
Customer 3855.Content: The steaks were cooked to perfection.  Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable. The only negative is the noise level. It is difficult to have a relaxing meal with good conversation when the overall noise is so loud.

Customer 3856.Name: Steve
Customer 3856.Content: My wife and I purchased gift cards for the Metropolitan Grill several months ago and had forgotten about them until recently. Once we re discovered them we made a reservation and had dinner Saturday. We have missed a lot by not dining there previously: the food and service were outstanding and we were treated wonderfully by the entire staff, but especially by John our server. The portions will satisfy anyone's appetite and be prepared to take some home as well. The almond crusted scallops are truly sublime. Everything was wonderful and we will eat there regularly for special occasions

Customer 3857.Name: Mouritsen
Customer 3857.Content:
This place was a big disappointment. Impressive selection of beef and after advice from the nice servant we chose their own steaks. I got a 16 ou peppercorn New York Strip an my wife a 12 ou New York Strip Loin. I ordered mine medium rare but it was medium - at best. My wife ordered medium but it was only slightly reddish inside. Their cooking scale is wrong. But even worse. The steaks were utterly dry. I think they had been frozen. The baked potatoes were great, but that didnt make it upmfor these extremely overpriced medium quality steaks!

The wine list is ridiculuously expensive. They multiply with at least 5. Only few wines below 125 dollar.


We will never come back and never reccomend this place to anyone. Waste of a lot of money.

Customer 3858.Name: arikohn
Customer 3858.Content: Metropolitan Grill is always better than good.  This time, in addition to good food the service was better than extraordinary.

Customer 3859.Name: sheronc
Customer 3859.Content: Excellent customer service, and atmosphere.  Halibut w/ Brussel spouts and bacon was delicious!  Highly recommended having dinner at the Metropolitan when you're in Seattle.

Customer 3860.Name: Mike
Customer 3860.Content:
This trip to the Met, my wife and I asked to share the smaller tenderloin, as the full size steak is about twice as much steak as we each normally eat.  The resturant is very accomodating of this type of request and duplicates all the sides for each of us on our own plate.  This was perfect for us.  The steak was cook a perfect med rare as we each ordered.  They cut the steak in half, berfor thy cook it, so it has a nice presentation, done on all sides.

Air conditining was too brisk for us at our first table, but they quickly relocated the 5 of us when we complained.

We started our visit at the bar, and would have been quite happy to eat our dinner there.

Customer 3861.Name: SeattleMet586
Customer 3861.Content: My girl friend and I went to the Met for out 2nd year anniversary. They service was outstanding: everything from the greeter, the waiter, and the buser were all great. Food was large and delicious plus the drinks were always full.

Customer 3862.Name: Andu
Customer 3862.Content: Incredible establishment. A truly unique marvel. We have no complaints. Everything was incredible. Our only regret was that we were late arriving at the restaurant. Even then, they very accommodating. Outstanding!

Customer 3863.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3863.Content: This was a great place for an informal or business lunch.  Service was professional and informative.  Food was plentiful and delicious.  The booths provided privacy and a quiet environment for discussion.

Customer 3864.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3864.Content:
We were a party of 5 and expecting an exceptional meal. We were all very disappointed. Appetizers were the best part of the dining experience. Salads were drenched in dressing. Steaks were average; too salty and without flavor! Mushroom encrusted tenderloin was bland. Halibut and sauce were also lacking flavor and served lukewarm. Pork chops was the best entree served at our table. Side veggies were over cooked. Strawberry shortcake mediocre but a huge portion. With alcohol and tip our bill was $180 per person. We expect  an outstanding meal for that expense. So surprising this restaurant missed the mark on so many items.
Recommend Happy Hour only!

Customer 3865.Name: SteakSupreme
Customer 3865.Content: Seriously, don't go anywhere else.  This is by far the best steak experience in Seattle.  From the beef, to the drinks, to the service, it's all grand.

Customer 3866.Name: Lilkasino
Customer 3866.Content: Great service, tasty steaks, little pricy but worth it.  Try the Carmel bacon!!

Customer 3867.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3867.Content:
This was the first meal I've had at the Met that really underwhelmed me. I had the New York Peppercorn, cut of the steak was unimpressive and tough, the peppercorn sauce was light and the scampi tasted like they had been sitting in bleach. 

My son's meal, prime rib was outstanding as well as our Caesar salads.

Customer 3868.Name: Steaklover
Customer 3868.Content: Amazing meal had at Metropolitain Grill.  Best steak I ever had (American Kobe filet) that literally melted in my mouth.  Great service, great wine.

Customer 3869.Name: PJ16
Customer 3869.Content: Absolutely incredible experience my girlfriend and I were first timers there and they treated us with amazing hospitality our server Aaron was great he knew everything from the back of his hand and to top it off what really blew us away was that they gave us a free crème brulé compliments of the Metropolitan greeted us a happy anniversary when I mentioned it was our anniversary on the reservation I was not expecting that, that's what I call great hospitality and going above and beyond for a restaurant to treat us the way they did will be coming back and letting my friends and family know of our experience!

Customer 3870.Name: lor898
Customer 3870.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is quickly becoming one of my favorite restaurants.  The food is incredible and the service impeccable.  Truly one of the very best dining experiences I have ever had.  A must try!

Customer 3871.Name: Tomz
Customer 3871.Content: Very good but expensive. Definitely worth it for a special occasion!

Customer 3872.Name: Theguyin4B
Customer 3872.Content: Great restaurant, suburb food, outstanding service. A truly great restaurant. The steaks, seafood, wines all off the charts good. Service cannot get any better. This place is my favorite restaurant in the Northwest. Expensive, but worth every penny.

Customer 3873.Name: seattle2014
Customer 3873.Content: Metropolitan Grill was amazing. We had impeccable service and even though our steak was not cooked as desired, they maitere d' responded quickly and had our steak cooked as desired.  He also offered us complimentary dessert since we had to wait for our food.  Diane was our server and she was super sweet and friendly.  If in Seattle, you should definitely eat at this restaurant and you will not be disappointed.

Customer 3874.Name: NavyCaptAmerica
Customer 3874.Content: I've been here countless times for lunch, and it's always been good.  This past visit was no exception, but one thing to note:  the wait staff did not inform us of the price of the specials, and I didn't think they'd be too much out of the ordinary (I've ordered specials here before).  But, my friend ordered the Copper River Salmon, which was very expensive.  Delicious, but spendy.  Just be forewarned.  Other than that, another great lunch at the Met.

Customer 3875.Name: Brad
Customer 3875.Content: Wonderful , wonderful food.  the service was absolutely outstanding.  Would recommend this restaurant in an instant.

Customer 3876.Name: BruceAtLarge
Customer 3876.Content: Went for a birthday treat and found the service excellent. It was super pricey though.

Customer 3877.Name: kris
Customer 3877.Content: Great location, excellent service, and very good food.

Customer 3878.Name: deborahbateman
Customer 3878.Content: Spending the month of July in Seattle, and when friends from Scottsdale were passing through for a few days - we decided to meet at Metropolitan Grill.  The bar is authentic and fabulous, and just the place to have a drink and share some fresh Oysters!!!  Dinner .... was incredible, perfectly prepared steaks, and we topped the evening off with cherries jubilee, prepared tableside!!  Wow!   What a night.  Fabulous Food, and an extraordinary experience.

Customer 3879.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3879.Content: food was great, service was great, but they forgot the spinach salad! For a $200 dinner, it was surprising that they would forget a little detail of a spinach salad!

Customer 3880.Name: Luv4steak
Customer 3880.Content: I have mutiple reasons to return to Seattle. If you got rid of them all, I would come back just for this restaurant. They have a great selection of premium steak. They are the first restaurant I found Iberico pork. The staff is helpful and quite attentive. More importantly, my wife and kids loved the Met. The place looks stiff and formal at first glance, then you find how warm the folks are.

Customer 3881.Name: Kilroy
Customer 3881.Content: This was a very nice steak house with tremendous food.  The Hybrid beef was phenomenal.  Our server was great, very involved and enthusiastic, but not over the top.  The atmosphere was a bit "close" (we were right on top of our neighbors) and loud for our tastes but it wasn't bad.  I would have preferred a more intimate setting.  Overall, great meal.

Customer 3882.Name: LovemyGrits
Customer 3882.Content: My husband used to travel to Seattle and enjoyed the Met, so we had high expectations.  The Almond Scallops were perfectly cooked and seasoned.  We shared a yummy Wedge Salad.  For supper, we ordered the Chateaubriand (24oz for 2) - medium rare.  It came with baked potato, baked tomato and mushrooms, and added a side of creamed spinach and lobster mac & cheese.  The steak was overcooked to our taste.  The creamed spinach would be more aptly described as "au gratin," as the concoction bore no resemblance to the classic.  The mac & cheese, while tasty, would have served us as an entree.  We were VERY disappointed that our waiter, while VERY friendly, allowed us to order so MUCH food.  Most expensive and least favorite meal in 10 day vacation.

Customer 3883.Name: businesstraveler
Customer 3883.Content: I've always loved my dining experience at the Met.  I will say that the "classic" feel does sometimes come off a bit stale, and for the prices it's hard to give a 5/5.  You won't get a better cut of meat and the wine list is superb.

Customer 3884.Name: FroYoLover
Customer 3884.Content: We returned to Seattle and remembered eating at the Metropolitan Grill from 7 years or so ago and really enjoying it - they did not disappoint! We had their salmon (I know, no steak at a steakhouse!) and it was the best we'd had - cooked perfectly. Loaded baked potato on one and their tasty roasted root vegetables on the other. The only item that was a little off was the Ceasar - good but not as flavorful as we'd remembered. The waiter was great - stopped by just at the right moments and the sommelier was very knowledgeable and shared his knowledge on the local Washington wine. Will definitely return the next time we are in town.

Customer 3885.Name: Zibber
Customer 3885.Content: Excellent service and food.  Definitely will be returning!

Customer 3886.Name: Monte
Customer 3886.Content: our visit was wonderful, it made our aniversary very special, can't wait to come for dinner again

Customer 3887.Name: eljefe79
Customer 3887.Content: The MET is a great restaurant period.  The diversity of the menu and elegance of the dishes makes this one of the best restaurants in Seattle.  The consideration and professionalism of the staff makes you feel like royalty.  The meals are exceptionally well prepared, with steaks that you can literally cut with a fork.

Customer 3888.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3888.Content: If you go here, expect good food, but you pay for it.    The service is ok.  But, for the expense  of the meal, I expected a bit more attention to detail.  They do have desserts that are made tableside and are delicious.  So, save room.

Customer 3889.Name: TNHawkeye
Customer 3889.Content: This place may be great for power lunches and red-meat junkies, but the menu and setting seem rather dated in comparison to most upscale eateries. If the "1950's traditional steakhouse" is the look they're striving for, at least do that right and clean the place up, hiding wiring and improving the windows and entrance. The wine selection is outstanding, as is the beef selection, but if you're not looking to drop a wad on rarefied beef, don't bother, there are too many other good options in this town.

Customer 3890.Name: DiverJoe
Customer 3890.Content: The wife and I had an intimate food and service experience for our 3rd anniversary.  We appreciated the Corkage service as well.

Customer 3891.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3891.Content: The food and services are great as always. I go to MG when I have special guests from out of town. Reservation on line was very easy and quick. The wait staffs are courteous and above all, the food is never disappointing. My guests were very happy with their dining experience in MG. I'll come back and I am sure many friends/guests would be back again. Thanks!

Customer 3892.Name: AKBryan
Customer 3892.Content: I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone! It was a suggestion from a friend and he was spot on. Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. We had the Sommelier come to the table and explain the wine list to us and make a suggestion based o our steaks. Definitely suggest you order the lobster mac n cheese!

Customer 3893.Name: seattlesteaklover
Customer 3893.Content: It was hard to decide what was more indulgent the food or the service.  Everything you would expect from this venerable fine dining restaurant.  Exceeded all our expectations.

Customer 3894.Name: Dinner42
Customer 3894.Content:
Walked in and table was ready to go (I hate waiting when I have a reservation). Table for two was to small to be table for four but way to big to be table for two. Having a simple conversation was difficult because my wife was to far away. There were some actors and football people sitting near me and the waiter seemed very interested in talking to them and less interested about getting us started with two glasses of water. 

After things got started it was good. The food was excellent and serviced with timing that allowed for consumption and digestion at between servings. A complimentary (thank you, 20th wedding anniversary) creme brulee desert (very tasty) was served without asking (not good) if we wanted to see a desert menu.

Customer 3895.Name: Koala
Customer 3895.Content: They don't call themselves the Best Steak In Town for nothing. The steak was high quality, and the taste was exquisite. The scallop appetizer was also excellent, leaving you craving for more. Only thing negative about this is the time commitment. Expect to be here for 2 hours.

Customer 3896.Name: maryinsnohomishwashington
Customer 3896.Content: This was our 2nd visit.  All being equal, the Met has better atmosphere & service than Daniel's but Daniel's has better food.   Disappointed in the filet as was not as tender as expected & scalloped potatoes a little dry.  Great waiter though.

Customer 3897.Name: CALwinelover
Customer 3897.Content: Great wine list, found it interesting they talked up their "grain fed" beef- quite pricey but very nice flavors, restaurant décor could use updating- looked a little shabby.

Customer 3898.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3898.Content: We had a awesome experience. Todd was amazing from beginning to end! We will be back.

Customer 3899.Name: Yakiman
Customer 3899.Content:
I forwarded the email from o poo open table that was titled "how was Metropolitan Grill".  My girlfriend provided the title here.   Amazing. 

The food selection was immense and the quality outstanding.   The appetizer of almond crusted scallops was superb. 

My prime and her filet were prepared perfectly. 

The service by Jim was spot on. 

Thus is a great place.

Customer 3900.Name: CrazyinQ8
Customer 3900.Content: This is the place you can go to alone or with a date, or even with a group. The atmosphere is energetic and the staff is World Class in regards to manners, politeness and knowledge of the menu and food.

Customer 3901.Name: thoughtitover
Customer 3901.Content: Excellent as always.  I especially appreciate their remembering my favorite table and seating us there.

Customer 3902.Content: I live in Houston but from Seattle......the last time I was at The Met was 16 years ago for my dad's birthday. I was in town for graduations as well as my mom's birthday and decided to treat her for dinner because I know she loves it. Had a few of her friends surprise her and all was a success. I THOROUGHLY enjoyed my steak and everything else I had, as did the rest of the table. Our waiter was extremely pleasant and attentive. I cannot wait to return the next time I am home.

Customer 3903.Name: Laurel
Customer 3903.Content: We were very impressed with both the food and service.  Had the chateaubriand - cut like butta!  It's flavor is that of days once thought long gone.  Can't wait to experience this Seattle icon again!

Customer 3904.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3904.Content: I didn't catch his name but our server was phenomenal. Able to give honest recommendations on the steak and when one of the meals was served and the steak wasn't cooked to their liking, he agreed, and sent it back with no hesitation. Very nice and polite.

Customer 3905.Name: iheckofacook4sure
Customer 3905.Content:
Was good.  Prefer the lower level.
Service not all that great!

Customer 3906.Name: sueo
Customer 3906.Content: The food was delicious.  Our bartender was very helpful and friendly.  Our server Michael was lots of fun

Customer 3907.Name: dj9033
Customer 3907.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is still a great steakhouse, little bit stuck in the 80's look, needs little bit of a modern upgrade.  The steak was not as excellent as I remember it, but the prices were not as expensive as I remember it.  The food was still good, especially their garlic mash potatoes.  Calamari appetizer was also great - plenty for two people to share.  We also had the 18 oz ribeye - slightly dry - and Banana Fosters for desert - which was great.  The servers were very friendly and knowledgeable...  Just that the overall dinner took over 2 hours.  Overall - great steakhouse - would recommend!

Customer 3908.Name: Spuds4
Customer 3908.Content: My husband enjoyed the best steak of his life at the Met 11 years ago. When we decided to take a vacation to Seattle, I made OT reservations as a Father's Day gift. Our two young sons and two friends joined us for the most beautiful, delicious and fun 3 hour dinner. The prime rib, house salads, cocktails and desserts were fabulous. Our waiter, Roger was charming, funny, and very kind to our 8 and 10 year old sons (the only children we saw dining there that night).

Customer 3909.Name: ChuckB
Customer 3909.Content: My daugher and I went here for fathers day and had the best time.  The steak was awesome along with the great onion rings and chocolate lava cake.  The best wait staff too boot.  If you want to go for that special occasion, this is the place.  Also if you have a craving for a great steak, i would also recommend.  Have not had there others dishes, but looked at some as they were servered nearby, and i am sure they are also top notch.  Will have to try there Copper River Salmon next time

Customer 3910.Name: RyanMcQ
Customer 3910.Content: Unbelievable steaks and great sauces to garnish them with, but a true steakhouse i feel needs a good creamed corn side, which the metropolitan grill lacks.

Customer 3911.Name: wendy
Customer 3911.Content: Seated immediately great service the calamari and oysters were ok the sides of asparagus ok Brussel sprouts were good and steak decent for the price would rather go elsewhere

Customer 3912.Name: AmberB
Customer 3912.Content: I've heard a lot of good things about this restaurant from friends so it was time to take a trip to see what it was all about. We live about an hour and a half away so it's something we can't do very often. But it was so worth it. The steaks seem to just melt in your mouth. And after dinner they brought out some coconut ice cream since they knew I had a problem with dairy as a special treat for our anniversary. It was a little loud but that's because it was so busy. And now I understand why it was so busy. We will definitely be coming here again for our anniversary next year.

Customer 3913.Name: MaryH
Customer 3913.Content: Food and service were good, but not exceptional. The menu is fairly conservative, not particularly fresh or exciting--your typical steakhouse menu. I think there are many restaurants in Seattle that provide much more interesting fare, for a much more reasonable price. I doubt I'll ever go back to The Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 3914.Name: islandgem
Customer 3914.Content: Our food arrived 1.5 hours. The waiter did not apologize or offer bread (we had to ask repeatedly). The $60 copper river salmon arrived cold. We sent it back and returned dry and tasteless. Our red meat was excellent but the root veggies were so undercooked they were inedible. We had special guests present and just wanted to leave after a disappointing dining experience so planned to follow up with management. But for the prices charged, the fish and service were poor. Usually this place is outstanding in every way.

Customer 3915.Name: Krendogs
Customer 3915.Content: Outstanding food, personable service and class all the way.  Made our anniversary very special.

Customer 3916.Name: eleazor
Customer 3916.Content: I came back to the Met after quite a stretch and was glad I did.  I dined here quite frequently in the late '90's and came back twice over the years and now get the opportunity to bring my family to my favorite restaurant in the country -- the combination of food, wine, attentive service and overall warmth couple together to create a total dining experience unlike any other. Years ago I met friends for dinner one night and after a particularly challenging day - I really just wanted a cheeseburger.  Lisa went away and came back with the most satisfying burger I have ever had.  Off-the menu, but within their capability - she went the extra mile.  Congratulations on a job well done and I am looking forward to dinner saturday night.

Customer 3917.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3917.Content: Simply outstanding steaks and world-class service from Bruno

Customer 3918.Name: TransplantedTexGal2
Customer 3918.Content: My husband and I always go to the Met for dinner.  This was our first time ever to go for lunch.  My husband has been dining here since the early 80's and loves it.  However, not return for lunch.  It's not the same atmosphere, service, or food.  Cannot say enough good about the Met for dinner.  Lunch was a total disappointment.

Customer 3919.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3919.Content: The matre D'  was fabulous and made our whole experience wonderful!!

Customer 3920.Name: miketerri
Customer 3920.Content: Our server Sue was fantastic, Craig the Maitre D was outstanding. The food, atmosphere and value were great. A not to miss in Seattle. Next trip there we are going back

Customer 3921.Name: Kariano
Customer 3921.Content: Roger was our server for the night and he was awesome!!!  He was very friendly, especially to the kids!  He made our night even more enjoyable!!

Customer 3922.Name: TomandDorothydinner
Customer 3922.Content: Service great & everyone seemed to take the extra time with us.

Customer 3923.Name: Wanderlust
Customer 3923.Content: Whenever I have clients to entertain in the down town core this establishment is the preferred venue. Service and food are predictably outstanding so the focus can be on the communication.

Customer 3924.Name: DJ4417
Customer 3924.Content: I enjoyed the evening. The food is very good but the cost of dinner is expensive.

Customer 3925.Name: peety3
Customer 3925.Content: Four of us enjoyed dinner at The Met before seeing Lily Tomlin at the 5th Avenue Theatre.  Our waiter, Noi, was fantastic: exciting, fluent in the menu and great choices, and able to read us very well.  The filet sampler was flavorful, the portabella plate was divine, and the Copper River salmon was phenomenal.  Even the brussel sprouts got high marks by all who chose them!

Customer 3926.Name: Rickoshay
Customer 3926.Content: We selected "The Met" for our celebration as we had dined there previously and wanted to have a "special" experience while visiting Seattle from Montana.  Our waiter, Todd, was just super, very knowledgeable and most attentive.  My husband really enjoyed the "long bone" steak selection and I the devoured the crusted scallops.  Kudos to all and we highly recommend!

Customer 3927.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3927.Content:
Although our soups were very good, and the service was great, our entrées came to us cold.

We felt very well taken care of, and will probably give it another try.

Customer 3928.Name: NY99
Customer 3928.Content: The food was mediocre. You can pay these prices and get a much better meal at other steak houses in the Seattle area.

Customer 3929.Name: yuriinseattle
Customer 3929.Content: I've been to The Met many many times. It's truly tried and true place - always good food, great service, great bar and excellent stakes and seafood.

Customer 3930.Name: AngieV
Customer 3930.Content: We come to the Met to celebrate special occasions. They never fail to impress with their food, wine and service. Always impeccable!

Customer 3931.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3931.Content: I have been to the Metropolitan Grill many times, but this time, the steak was over cooked, despite requesting Medium Rare, with an emphasis on rare, the air conditioner was blowing so hard the large chandelier over our head was swinging, we waited 20 minutes to be seated, despite having reservations and seeing other similar sized groups seated before us who arrived after us, and the kitchen was slower than normal.  Not sure I will want to go back after that experience.

Customer 3932.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3932.Content: There were 6 in our party.  The booths/seating was GREAT!  Private and comfortable.  There were mostly steaks on the menu and 4 out of 6 of us wanted that, so if you like steak...come here.  Those who got steak said it was the best steak they'd ever had; and that is saying something!  I got the scallops special (appetizer) and a side of mushrooms.  The mushrooms were good, but cold.  The scallops were good but TINY!  Service was great.  Of course it is VERY over-priced ($222 with tip for 2 people), but will go again on a special occasion.

Customer 3933.Name: rob0rah
Customer 3933.Content: While visiting Seattle, we always make it a point to dine here.  We have been going here since the mid 80's while living in Alaska and the many business and pleasure trips to Seattle.  The food, service, and atmosphere are great as always!  The Met is always on the top our list!

Customer 3934.Name: OzTravels
Customer 3934.Content: Looking for an old school steakhouse, then the Metropolitan Grill ticks all those boxes. Lots of VIP pictures as you enter, velvet lined booths and dressed waiters. The Crab Craw entree was fresh bountiful and tasty, my Angus/Wagyu blend steak was cooked to near perfection, the mashed (smashed) had just the right mix of butter and the Brussels sprouts (with bacon) had that slight char to complement the flavours. A house Au Jus to add a little more and the meal was complete. A class of the Wine special and Viola an old Steak Meal to enjoy. To finish a fine desert spirit, a coffee and a scoop of the house whiskey ice cream. Never fear your meat craving will be looked after here!

Customer 3935.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3935.Content: love the met.  service is always great and the food was fabulous

Customer 3936.Name: Jody
Customer 3936.Content: Everything here is great!  Service, food, ambiance.  there is a reason this restaurant is rated #1.  If you haven't eaten here yet, ask yourself why not?

Customer 3937.Name: Samuel
Customer 3937.Content: Going to The Met is a special thing for my husband and I.  We enjoy it and are never disappointed in the service, ambiance or food!  Truly a memorable place.

Customer 3938.Name: AmyLynn
Customer 3938.Content: My husband and I are originally from the greater Seattle area but now reside in Houston, Texas. During our recent visit to Seattle, we decided to dine at The Metropolitan Grill for my husband's birthday. The experience was incredible. Not only was the steak and Copper River Salmon made to our liking, and amazingly seasoned, but the service was better than I have ever experienced, and I am very hard to please when it comes to customer service. In our reservation, we requested a private, intimate setting, and they provided this for us. I would recommend this  restaurant to anyone looking for a wonderful evening on the town, and will definitely dine there again.

Customer 3939.Name: Luvtwodine
Customer 3939.Content: Our first time there, the service was outstanding. Our food not to mention was the best steak and mashed potatoes we have ever had.

Customer 3940.Name: shoes
Customer 3940.Content: It had been 18 years since my wife and I had been in Seattle and we still remembered vividly our first visit to the Metropolitan Grill. It was just as good this time around. This is one of the true great steakhouses in the US. I am sure other things on the menu are great, but steak is why we come to the Metropolitan Grill.  The wait staff has been there for years and are true professionals. The place is expensive, but well worth every penny.

Customer 3941.Name: Boisevisitor
Customer 3941.Content: Went with high expectations and the MG exceeded them!

Customer 3942.Name: JuJuDiner
Customer 3942.Content: Thanks to our server, the Maitre'D, and hostess who all served and informed us so well. Our steaks were incredible, drinks were perfect, and service was unmatched. Very impressed and my business guests were so impressed that it actually took our work to the next level.

Customer 3943.Name: ColbyV
Customer 3943.Content: The Met was our go-to spot for many years. Unfortunately it hit an awkward period when the steaks weren't as good and the experience was only so-so considering the amount of money spent (this was about 10 years ago). We just went back to try it again and thoroughly enjoyed the service, the food, and the ambiance. The fillets were delicious and the bananas foster prepared table side was fantastic. I'd put their steaks against any other in the city!

Customer 3944.Name: davidm
Customer 3944.Content:
This restaurant is definitely going on the short list of "places you have to go while in Seattle" Charles was our waiter and he was excellent.
The atmosphere is classic and cool and then comes  the food. One of the BEST dinners I have had in a long time. Thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience, can't wait to go back.

Customer 3945.Name: ActionPak
Customer 3945.Content:
I've heard many mixed reviews about The Met. Some love it. Some not so much. Some say it's overpriced for what you get. Some say it's about the same compared to other higher end steakhouses.

My experience is a mixture of almost all of those things I mentioned. There were 3 of us for dinner and after ordering a martini, the waiter didn't come back for 20 minutes to take our order. The service was just okay at best. Felt like he was always trying to upsell everything to us and he didn't really ask how our steak were.

The food overall was not bad. I had the Del Monico, my gf had the Chicago cut and my friend had the NY strip.

Would I come back again? I doubt it. Not for $375.

Customer 3946.Name: Lonnie
Customer 3946.Content: This was my first time at the "Met". I was excited to go for my Bday. The crab cake apetizers were cold, and the steak was not good at all. I was very dissapointed. I read online that the Met won 2013 best steak house and this is why I chose it for my birthday plus the fact I had always wanted to go. I was very dissapointed and especially for the money we spent I expected so much more. Our favorite steak house has always been Jaks on California ave. It still is. However, great atmosphere and all the employees were really nice. There was a table of 3 men that were pretty intoxicated sitting behind us arguing loud and cussing. That also added to the dissapointment. I get a little loud sometimes but in the bar only. Thanks

Customer 3947.Name: Jeff
Customer 3947.Content: Great, great steak joint.  My wife and I visited on our 1st anniversary trip and it was an outstanding place.  It's an old boys club atmosphere with pics of a ton of athletes that have rolled through there over the years (by the front).  Excellent service and arguably the best steaks we've ever had.  Will be back here every time we visit the city

Customer 3948.Name: Bear
Customer 3948.Content: Loved the food and service.  My wife and I were treated excellently.  No long wait.  Food was made and prepared as we asked.  Patient, kind and attentive staff from beginning to end!

Customer 3949.Name: Mommawhoeats
Customer 3949.Content: Our waiter greeted us at the door and took us to our table and took great care of us!  When he learned it was our 15th wedding anniversary he brought creme brûlée with a candle!  The food was exceptional.  Very enjoyable environment.  Highly recommend!

Customer 3950.Name: yogaine
Customer 3950.Content: Diane, our waitress, was perfect! No rushing, individual consultancy for drinks and food combination, attentive but never annoying! The food was just great! Whenever I come back to Seattle and have something to celebrate or just want real good dining, I will go there again. Defenitely, a "good" credit card or enough cash has to be in your pocket ;-)))

Customer 3951.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3951.Content: Justin maybe the very best waiter I have come across. My wife and I had not been into the Met in well over a year. He came over to us called out our previous order and got right into conversation. That is true service and the Met has it in spades.

Customer 3952.Name: steakluvr
Customer 3952.Content: I used to have dinner at the Met at least once a month, but stopped going because of the noise level.  Made an earlier dinner reservation this time and enjoyed it very much. They are top notch with service and the food is the best in town. You must go if you want to be pampered with style!

Customer 3953.Name: Roberta
Customer 3953.Content: I recently enjoyed The Met while treating my hard working son to a much deserved Birthday lunch.  We were warmly welcomed, professionally served and our lunch was the delicious, wonderful experience I've come to know and love about The Met.

Customer 3954.Name: Quiltnqt
Customer 3954.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was fabulous as always.  Would not go to Seattle and not go to the Met.  Great food and service.

Customer 3955.Name: gr8place
Customer 3955.Content: Metropolitan ranks with Bern's of Tampa and CUT of Las Vegas for steaks and atmosphere in my opinion. Our server, Michael, was tops and answered all our first time questions, including those we had about the various cocktails. We plan to make Metropolitan a must-go during our future trips to Seattle.

Customer 3956.Name: Bree
Customer 3956.Content: The food was excellent absolutely great and so was the atmosphere and the presentation of the dinner was wonderful and the dessert was to die for and I loved the presentation of the dessert. It was like a dinner and a show a great romantic date for me and my husband

Customer 3957.Name: MikeS
Customer 3957.Content: This was a really nice dinner for my wife and children to celebrate Mother's Day. We always enjoy the Met.

Customer 3958.Name: dawnjuan
Customer 3958.Content: Love the met!  The food is always delicious.  Love how down to earth the servers are.  This is not a stuffy restaurant what so ever.  Always a fantastic experience.

Customer 3959.Name: Beanie
Customer 3959.Content: Staff was friendly and most were helpful.  Some food was terrific, the nine layer chocolate cake, outstanding!  Some was disappointing.  The lobster tail was over cooked and not at all sweet.  I ordered the smallest size, $65.  The waitress said it was really too tiny.  So I changed my order to medium, $85.  When the bill came they had charged me for large, $105.  When I complained, they changed it and blamed it on "miscommunication" but I felt they tried to take advantage of a tourist.  All in all, a disappointment.

Customer 3960.Name: FunatthePier
Customer 3960.Content: Our server Charles went out of his way to make our 38th wedding anniversary dinner a truly memorable occasion.We  dedefinitely return when in the area.

Customer 3961.Name: bgh867
Customer 3961.Content: I travel to Seattle rarely, but always try to stop at the Metropolitan Grill.  It is consistently one of the best steakhouses in the US.  The service is attentive, but not obtrusive.  The wine list is spectacular, with strong selections by the glass.  The food is prepared to perfection.  My only negative is that I have to eat at least 1/2 of the cost since I can't in good conscience submit the total bill for expense reimbursement--but, it's still worth every penny...

Customer 3962.Name: tmn456
Customer 3962.Content: 5-Star Service!  We wanted to split some of the dishes we ordered and our wait-person was kind enough to put some items on separate plates. He was very accommodating to our requests.  The right level of attentiveness and giving us space.  The steak was delicious too.

Customer 3963.Name: birthdaydinner
Customer 3963.Content: This was a great place to go for a special occasion. The service and food was delicious.

Customer 3964.Name: Biiga
Customer 3964.Content: The Met is usually outside our price range, but thanks to a gift card my wife and I enjoyed dinner there recently prior to a show at the 5th Avenue Theater.  Unfortunately, our ferry into downtown was delayed which put some time pressure on our dinner; however, when we mentioned that to our waiter (Noy?) he cheerfully and enthusiastically promised he would alert the kitchen and that we would be well taken care of.  He was true to his promise -- our soup, salad and entree courses came out right when we were ready for them, and the food was fantastic.  We were able to enjoy a relaxing meal that wrapped up exactly (to the minute) when we needed to finish.  An all-around positive experience!

Customer 3965.Name: RonS
Customer 3965.Content:
It is a long drive from Snohomish but that is why we are picky about where we dine we we decide to come to the City.
The Metropolitan Grill is always the top of our list. It just does not disappoint.

Customer 3966.Name: SusanR
Customer 3966.Content:
Our waiter, Juergen, was terrific, along with a great sense of humor! We thoroughly enjoyed our cocktails prior to dinner, not watered down. The prime rib melted in your mouth and cooked perfectly, along with the Iberico pork loin. We should have shared the prime rib as the portions are quite large.
The only negative is the price, rather expensive!

Customer 3967.Name: jtzilla
Customer 3967.Content: My wife and I have gone to the Met for special occasions over the years. The servers have always been Outstanding, not pretentious like El Gougo! If you've been there you know what I mean. Crab cakes are to die for. I have had 2 bad Prime ribs (Way to much gristle and fat, and one blackened that was so salty I was holding water for a week:) that I should have returned but overall has been a very good experience for dinning in Seattle.

Customer 3968.Name: mallen
Customer 3968.Content: The service, the food, the atmosphere....what a great way to spend a Saturday evening.

Customer 3969.Name: Eatwellalways
Customer 3969.Content: Service was exceptional and they truely do have the best steaks ever!

Customer 3970.Name: LadyTaurus
Customer 3970.Content: We came here on a free evening during a business trip.  Very festive on a Friday at this lovely old school steak house. Both food and service were superb.  Since I'm not so much of a meat eater, I saved room for dessert.  The carrot cake was absolutely amazing and also added a side of Maker's Mark ice cream with it.  Just the best carrot cake experience ever!!!  My husband said his steak was truly special.  Highly recommended--a very fun evening.  Also they have a good wine list.

Customer 3971.Name: annivout
Customer 3971.Content:
I don't go out to expensive restaurants very often.  When I do, I sort of expect a little above the norm in service, food, etc.
The restaurant was very busy and we had a short wait, beyond our reservation time, to be seated.  Service started out great with relatively quick service and appetizer's brought shortly after being ordered.  Then things took a turn for the worse as we sat for about 1 hour before our dinner was brought to the table.  When the steak arrived, it looked completely different than what was displayed in a case when you arrive.  It looked like someone had ran over it and it didn't taste any better than the $8 steaks I can get at a store yet it cost about $50. However, my wife's prime rib was very well done and tasted great

Customer 3972.Name: skeptomai
Customer 3972.Content: Food and service are always superb.  We were there for our 16th wedding anniversary, and enjoyed it immensely.

Customer 3973.Name: Brierrose007
Customer 3973.Content: If you want great steak, this is the place to go. The three different types of beef are worth the money because each has a different taste profile and texture. Be bold and try something new, the buffalo is excellent, and the pasta is cooked correctly (al dente) While the parking is a little hit-or-miss, unless you valet of course, the food never fails to impress me.

Customer 3974.Name: poohbear
Customer 3974.Content: Awesome food here, esp the lobster mac n cheese. My problem was, even with reservations, we still waited 20 minutes before being seated. They were really busy and so service was slower than before.

Customer 3975.Name: yumtum
Customer 3975.Content: My waitress seemed to have a sixth sense of what I was looking for on the menu.  I ordered something I thought sounded delicious and she knew to warn me that it was a thinner cut and would not be thick and hearty as I wanted.  She recommended another dish wish was exactly what I was looking for- even my date was jealous of my order!

Customer 3976.Name: Frankie
Customer 3976.Content: Food was great as always. Service was very professional and attentive

Customer 3977.Name: eastsidegrandma
Customer 3977.Content: The restaurant was very loud.  We were with a friend and we had to shout to hear each other.  Our waiter was very nice and the food was good, but for the price we paid I wouldn't go back again.

Customer 3978.Name: Mike
Customer 3978.Content: We arrived after 2 pm  last Tuesday and had a wonderful filet of halibut and filet mignon.  Excellent atmosphere - one of our favorites.  And excellent service from Adam!  Thanks for a great time.

Customer 3979.Name: wanana
Customer 3979.Content: Attentive service!!  Delicious menu items!!  Our #1 Favorite place to have dinner!!  A must try, if you haven't already!!

Customer 3980.Name: SlyFoxAdventures
Customer 3980.Content: The food, service, wine selection, and beer selection are all top notch. The noise level is too high to be romantic, and the seating is pretty crowded so no matter where you sit you are in close proximity to other tables, walkways, or booths. Noise and seating aside, this is one of our favorite restaurants. We visit every year on our anniversary and when special friends come to town.

Customer 3981.Name: Tast
Customer 3981.Content: We had to wait longer than 45 minutes to get the steak ready ..... waiting time was too long ! not worth it !

Customer 3982.Name: Kellyying
Customer 3982.Content: We came every year to celebrate our anniversary.  We love steak and all other foods was great as well.

Customer 3983.Name: laitsabr
Customer 3983.Content: The Metropolitan Grill experience never ceases to please us every time we visit. We have never experienced less than stellar service, from valet parking to table service. The steaks are really good. Done to exactly the desired temperature. The only criticism would be that children's meat entrees are cooked only 1 way: well-done. Better safe than sorry, I suppose. For the quality of meat served, rare or medium-rare have been our favorite choices. The filet mignons from the regular menu were juicy and tender, with a nice crisp on the outside. The sirloin cap form the wagyu section was a surprise. Flavorful, juicy and a little more chewy. I loved it, especially with a little horseradish on the side. Banana caramel closed off the meal nicely.

Customer 3984.Name: Teresa
Customer 3984.Content: We had $750 in gift cards to pay our bill. The total was $626 but the server said she could not give cash back on the cards and therefore could only take $600 in gift cards. THIS IS THE MOST RIDICULOUS THING I'VE EVER HEARD! Gift cards indicate money the restaraunt already has so they are taking no loss in allowing customers to use them for the ENTIRE BILL and gratuity. I have never been to a restaurant that was not capable of leaving a balance on a gift card so there is no reason we could not pay the entire thing using gift cards and leave a small balance on the card for another visit. This policy means we will be less likely to ever get gift cards to this restaraunt again which means our entire family will likely never go back.

Customer 3985.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 3985.Content: We are always treated like royalty when we come through the door. Everything was splendid as usual! Thank you.

Customer 3986.Name: Garrett
Customer 3986.Content: The food was ok, not as outstanding as I remember in past visits. The service on the other hand, while usually very fast and attentive, was exactly the opposite.

Customer 3987.Name: Beth
Customer 3987.Content: Every course was incredible! From the moment you enter the restaurant you know that it is going to be a great dining experience. It was worth splurging for this delicious culinary delight!

Customer 3988.Name: Bunesta
Customer 3988.Content: The restaurant was a little noisy. I suppose that is because it was a Friday night happy hour.  Loved the food.  Excellent as always.

Customer 3989.Name: Henderson
Customer 3989.Content: Great food, wine list and service!  We had dinner in the bar, loved the atmosphere and the people watching!

Customer 3990.Name: diner
Customer 3990.Content: Great place.  Excellent service.  Always on top of their game.

Customer 3991.Name: Bceagle
Customer 3991.Content:
Great food steaks were perfect 
great sides
great service

Customer 3992.Name: EastToWestBlessed
Customer 3992.Content: I took my fiancé there for her 1st time for our 5 year. She loved it! 6:30pm reservation on a Wed evening & the place was seemed packed. We were seated within 5 mins, at a table for 4(next time I'll reserve a booth) She LOVED the tenderlion appetizer. I killed the steak tartar!! She had the wagyu filet & I enjoyed the 40oz bone-in wagyu ribeye. More than enough for an addition meal or two ;-) & you may even catch a glimpse of a celebrity or professional athlete or two!! Gonna drop a few bills here for 2 but well worth it!!

Customer 3993.Name: HRFoodies
Customer 3993.Content: A friend and I were in town for business and came to dine on a busy Tuesday evening. Roger was charming and funny, even though his section was very busy. The teriyaki appetizer was the best teriyaki my teriyaki-crazed friend had ever had. Great drinks, artichoke hearts, and ribeye. No room for dessert so we got Nine Layer Chocolate Cake slices to go. Thanks for a memorable evening!

Customer 3994.Name: Cynthia
Customer 3994.Content: We had a great Anniversary at The Met!  Our server, HSB, was OUTSTANDING!!  Thank you for being part of our special night...

Customer 3995.Name: Kevin
Customer 3995.Content: Never a disappointment. Food was great and the staff give you a great experience!

Customer 3996.Name: luvtodineinseattle
Customer 3996.Content: The service was beyond compare.  The raw oysters were succulent and full of notes.   Excellent.  The wine list was a great trip.  The filet, blue, rare, exactly what we desired, to our taste.  The garlic mashed potato was lumpy, and perhaps this is the most popular way to serve nowadays ........  The cheesecake;  perhaps i miss-interpreted the menu.  My preference is for the baked variety, and not too sweet.   BUT, I will definitely be back.  We LOVED the ambience.  Thank you for asking.

Customer 3997.Name: Go4fun
Customer 3997.Content: The steaks looked excellent with all if the expected fine service but the rack of lamb was outstanding in every way. If course the food and wine is pricey as expected for big city steakhouse but for the special occasion Metropolitan Grill can't be beat!

Customer 3998.Name: Kimmie
Customer 3998.Content: As always a great place for a great steak. Correction, The Best Steak! I did notice however that the prices had gone up a bit. The $50 steak is now more like a $60 or $70 steak, yet the sizes have not increased. Seems like the wine and drink prices have gone up a bit too. Kinda bummed about the increases.  Service exceptional as usual.

Customer 3999.Name: Walter
Customer 3999.Content:
I love dining at the Met on special occasions.  Not a 5-star restaurant, rather, an old Seattle tradition.  My only frustration is the service in the bar.  The last few times I have dined here we like to arrive a little early and have a drink in the bar.  Very difficult to get the waiters (or anyone in the bar) to pay attention to us.  I usually end up ordering from the bartender by crowding up to the already full bar.  Then, as soon as the drinks come, the waiter appears.  They could improve the service here.

Dinner was great!  We tried the lamb chops that are cut at the table.  This and the Apple Pie flambé, both served table side, are awesome.

Customer 4000.Name: Seattleadjacent
Customer 4000.Content:
I've been to many steakhouses, and this one sits at the top of the pile. Excellent waitstaff, perfect food, tasty cocktails, and the best steaks we've ever had.

By the way, so I can save you the torture other parents were experiencing: this place is not for kids. Don't bring them, don't have a birthday party there like we saw the night we attended. Get a spitter and enjoy your evening.

Customer 4001.Name: tbaseball21
Customer 4001.Content: Service was great and food excellent. Would recommend for all occasions.  Plan to have retirement celebration at the Met.

Customer 4002.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4002.Content: The Metropolitan Grill had the most impressive assortment of steak cuts, wines, and desserts that I have every seen.  Although the prices were on the high end, the serving sizes and the quality of the food made the meal well worth it. The blackened prime rib that I ordered was easily the most delicious steak that I have ever consumed in my life, without exaggeration.

Customer 4003.Name: Van604
Customer 4003.Content: This is always been my favorite steakhouse to go.

Customer 4004.Name: DianeKK
Customer 4004.Content: Our server, Nor was excellent, extremely friendly, professional with the best smile.  The food, as always had the best of flavors!  And Kevin did an awesome Banana's Foster and shared a great story!

Customer 4005.Name: Kevin
Customer 4005.Content: We brought a special receipt for a 2 for 1 coupon but were missing the card that went with it.  They were able to identify from the receipt that it was legit and saved us $140!

Customer 4006.Name: CStewart
Customer 4006.Content: Our waiter was very attentive and the food was excellent. The four of us requested different steak preparations and they all arrived at once to our done-ness specifications.

Customer 4007.Name: VinceT
Customer 4007.Content: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary. This was our first visit to the Metropolitan Grill. I have heard so many great reviews from friends about the steaks and overall dining experience. We were not disappointed at all. The steaks were delicious. The lobster mac and cheese was amazing. The Chocolate Lava cake melted in our mouths. And because it was our anniversary our waiter surprised us with the Burnt Cream dessert which was completely unexpected very enjoyable. I was also very pleased with my Old Fashioned drink. One of the best if not the best Old Fashions made in Seattle! Thank you so much for a wonderful experience!

Customer 4008.Name: valerie
Customer 4008.Content: This is a awesome place to dine~

Customer 4009.Name: cheeselove
Customer 4009.Content: my two best friends come Seattle and I insist on invited them come to eat at the best steakhouse at Seattle. they were a couple, we ordered some wine and the 18oz rib, which is amazing! and the skirt steak I had which just melted in my tongue, and I still cant forget that taste. the bread basket was soft and delicious, since we all ordered the large potion steak, so we skipped the appetizer and string to the steak, and try our best to finished them all. such great steaks should not become leftover or waste!!!!!! three people cost about 200 dollar, included tips, we tipped the waiter about 30 dollar since he was just so nice to us !! and bring fun to our dinner!

Customer 4010.Name: Nyyankfan
Customer 4010.Content: This is a very good old school high-end steak house, like you would find in NYC or another East Coast City. The steaks were excellent. Prices are high, and all sides are extra (as is usually the case in high-end steak houses), but you get what you pay for. Our server was very attentive and excellent as well.

Customer 4011.Name: Korvas
Customer 4011.Content: The food and service were both outstanding as usual. My client specifically requested the Met, he has very good taste. We were not disappointed. The only thing I didn't like was our table. The location was not ideal and the server had a difficult time reaching everyone at the table. I never really felt comfortable.

Customer 4012.Name: diner
Customer 4012.Content: Fantastic venue, menu, food, and, especially, attentive service staff!

Customer 4013.Name: Dscovki
Customer 4013.Content: The food was nothing to write home about and the cost was high. Enough said.

Customer 4014.Name: Vickie
Customer 4014.Content: I found the food to be very high quality and the waiters and waitresses were very helpful. The staff had great character that made the experience even greater. It's a great place to have a special occasion with the perfect ambiance.

Customer 4016.Name: seattlerestaurantfan
Customer 4016.Content: it took an hour to get our food and then they only served 3 out of 4 of us. My Halibut was overcooked (perhaps it occurred while waiting for the the 4th dinner). Service was inexcuable for a restaurant of this cailber. The restaurant did not appear overly busy there were a few empty tables. We have been there before several times and had not experienced this so hopefully it was an isolated event.

Customer 4017.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4017.Content: Very expensive but we know that. Best steak I have ever eaten. Cooked expertly and the waiters know how to hype your appitete as they prepare the food infront of you. Asked about our experience twice. Refreshing to be served exceptionally when not ordering drinks.

Customer 4018.Name: joliebain
Customer 4018.Content: We try to stop by every time we are in Seattle. This like all the other times was a wonderful evening with truly delicious steak.

Customer 4019.Name: TheNapkinGuy
Customer 4019.Content: One of my favorite places but this visit the steak was not up to par. On the dry side. Banna's Foster was very good.

Customer 4020.Name: George
Customer 4020.Content: Wonderful food and service. Parking is toug , but valet is available. After a few turns around the block I opted for the valet.great place for a celebration, but not inexpensive, so save up your pennies... :)

Customer 4021.Name: DaveF
