Customer 4021.Content: Thanks again for a terrific experience. Superb service, the best steaks!!

Customer 4022.Name: Lexy
Customer 4022.Content: Dined here twice within a month. First time the rolls were rock hard, but we had a friendly server. The prime ribs we ordered were good. The second time we had dinner here, our server barely said a word to us and our prime rib was mostly gristle. He bought a smaller replacement, but still not great. I would highly recommend the citrus mojito (non alcoholic), the lobster mac and cheese, and the portabello mignon. The chicken dish was okay. If you are going for steak, this place is hit and miss.

Customer 4023.Name: Boutonski
Customer 4023.Content: Great vibe, excellent service, but the Turkey sandwich a bit bland and boring. Otherwise great lunch. Thanks

Customer 4024.Name: Divey
Customer 4024.Content: Metro Grill is your typical old school steakhouse. Everything is very proper and by the book. I liked the fish selection, added a nice touch to the typical meat menu.

Customer 4025.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4025.Content: The appetizers were great! Out two steak dinners with bake potatos, disappointed. Would go back for Happy hour to try burgers and onion rings!

Customer 4026.Name: Wearymom
Customer 4026.Content: Our party of 5, and were able to get a back corner table. This was wonderful,allowing all in our party to hear. I ordered the prime rib and it was chewy and tasteless. My husband ordered the halibut, and he said the same. I ordered my salad with a "little dressing", but found it drowned in dressing. I should learn my lesson and remember to ask for the dressing on the side. I also made the mistake of getting the "cheese sauce" on my potato, and I will NOT be making that mistake again! We had the bananas foster for dessert, but the server did not engage with us, and seemed rushed. It was tasty though. For the pluses - my white cosmopolitan was perfection! And our waiter, Roger, was excellent - very attentive and did not rush us.

Customer 4027.Name: JeffR
Customer 4027.Content: The Met is my favorite restaurant in Seattle, from the food to the waiters it is first class. My wife and I spent the day in Seattle for our 24th wedding anniversary and went to the Met after riding the Great Wheel. We had a great day and it was capped off by a great meal.

Customer 4028.Name: Sndycheeks
Customer 4028.Content:
They make the best pomegranite martini Ive ever had, down to the blueberries:)
I prefer my Prime Rib a little more well done than most. It was perfectly
cooked, lightly seasoned, yet so tender and juicy,, very flavorful!
I wood definitely be back my next visit.

Customer 4029.Name: EricM
Customer 4029.Content: We used to love this place. The service was poor and the overpriced steaks were OK. We won't go back anymore.

Customer 4030.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4030.Content:
I was excited to have dinner at The Met. I could not have been more disappointed. I ordered the Steakhouse Chicken. My wife ordered the Blackened Prime Rib. Chicken tasted very much like my Wife's Prime Rib....like nothing. I have never had a piece of meat with so little flavor. The Chicken tasted like it was boiled (and look like it too). My Wife's "blackened" Prime Rib had the same flavor.

For a $300 meal....it was not worth it at all. I don't cook and I make more flavorful meals. Save you money ant time. Go to Jak's in Issaquah. the meals are 100% better and 200% cheaper.

Customer 4031.Name: LadyM
Customer 4031.Content: Another great food experience at The Metropolitan. My husband picks this restaurant to celebrate his birthday every year.

Customer 4032.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4032.Content: least favorite steak house in Seattle

Customer 4033.Name: ST4745
Customer 4033.Content: Nick our server was great. He gave us just enough of the right kind of service. We found a wine favorite on the list and the steak was mouthwatering. Really nice date night.

Customer 4035.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4035.Content: 8:30 reservation. Table ready for us at 9. Steak was not up to usual Met grill standards. Cooked to perfection but a rather tough piece of Kobe beef. Nevertheless had fun as usual.

Customer 4036.Name: Customer
Customer 4036.Content: Nice to have a wait person that really knows the business, as well as knowing when and how to make conversation with a table.  Well done.

Customer 4037.Name: Henderson
Customer 4037.Content:
Food and service were outstanding, always is.
We were seated near a large party (18-20 guests), they were very loud. We knew that they wouldn't be there all evening and just waited for them to leave.
That is when the evening improved, and that is what my response is based on.
Have always enjoyed the ambience at The Met! Will be back, and next time if I was getting seated by a large noisy group like this one, I would ask to be reseated.

Customer 4038.Name: SFBizTraveler
Customer 4038.Content: Took a group of six there for a business dinner. In general an excellent steakhouse. Fine cocktails, excellent wine list, very good (traditional) steakhouse fare. The only problem is that our table was really far too small to accommodate a party of six.

Customer 4039.Name: caevans
Customer 4039.Content:
Enjoyed great cocktails in the luxurious bar followed by a fantastic meal in the restaurant. Thank you waitress 'Cat' for being so attentive and fun! Thank you waiter Michael for supurb service.
Can 't wait to come back!

Customer 4040.Name: HughP
Customer 4040.Content: an absolutely fantastic experience all the way around.

Customer 4041.Name: Hatetherain
Customer 4041.Content:
We have been to the Met several times over the years and were really looking forward to a great meal. Unfortunately, all four of us felt the steaks were flavorless and dry. This was especially disappointing because we all had different cuts of meat. I discussed my disappointment with a co-worker on the following work day and she had experienced the same disappointment a year earlier.

Your money would be much better spent at Daniel's Broiler in Leschi or Bellevue. There is very little value to be found in a $500.00 dinner experience if the signature menu items leave you wanting.

Customer 4042.Name: SpecialNiteOut
Customer 4042.Content: This was my first time to eat at Metropolitan Grill, and it definitely won't be the last! The service was friendly and professional, the food was, quite simply, amazing. We split the ribeye steak, it literally melted in my mouth. And the cherries jubilee for dessert was a perfect way to end the night. Two huge thumbs up!

Customer 4043.Name: Newmom
Customer 4043.Content: Waiter was attentive, polite, engaging and had good food recommendations. Waiter was overall fantastic!

Customer 4044.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4044.Content: I am disappointed by our evening. I requested a private, secluded booth for a special event with friends. We were placed on the main entrance pathway exactly where it intersected another main path. It was directly by the bathrooms, the kitchen, and the servers' station. It was not private nor secluded. It was however a booth, but one too small for the 4 of us to sit comfortably, and when food was served it was down right cramped. This is my second disappointing evening at the Met, and while the steaks were good and the servers were polite, I'm not sure I will ever chose to return. For a place with a reputation for Seattle's nicest steak restaurant, I expected better.

Customer 4045.Name: RMoorhead
Customer 4045.Content: The Met is a classic (expensive) steak house, and we enjoyed our evening. Favorite part of my meal were the fantastic raw oysters...amazing! If you really love steak and can afford a very expensive night out, go for it! I doubt I'll go back, but it was a fun night out.

Customer 4046.Name: AB13
Customer 4046.Content: I come from NY where there are many steakhouses. I have never seen one that was this over priced. The food was good but not exceptional and certainly not worth the price paid. I mean $65 for a 12 oz stripsteak -really??? And on top of the outrageous prices you have to pay $9 for valet parking which since street parking is limited you have no choice but to use it. I would not go back.

Customer 4047.Name: Ks1995
Customer 4047.Content: Always has been a great restaurant. Cuts of meat are great. Service is great. Only comment is that the interior is a little musky. This restaurant has been around for years, might be time for renovation and updating restaurant furniture!

Customer 4048.Name: 16thBirthday
Customer 4048.Content: Every year we take a ferry from San Juan Island and drive to Seattle for our son's Birthday. We have celebrated his last three birthdays at The Met. He loves the food and experience as much as we do! The service is always personal and you feel special. The food is amazing and always well worth the three hours it takes us to get there!

Customer 4049.Name: SCraigVashon
Customer 4049.Content:
this is a steakhouse, in all its glory. The various cuts are displayed in a refrigerated case inside the front door of the restaurant. They range from "quite large enough for any human being" to "my god, that's huge, let me take a photo of it." Stick with the house prime meet (raised in Idaho), it is fabulous. If paying double or triple the cost you can order wagyu beef (U.S. equivalent of Kobe beef) or an even higher grade from Japan (better bring along an armored car to carry your cash if you order one of these steaks).
Sides are huge, easily enough for two or three, plus you get potatoes or vegis with your meal. They have great appetizers, focusing on NW shellfish, and the desserts...my pear bread pudding was unbelievable.

Customer 4050.Name: sunshine1
Customer 4050.Content: The Met always is great. Wonderful food and great service. We have gone for many yrs. and never been let down. Expensive but well worth once in awhile.

Customer 4051.Name: JacobD
Customer 4051.Content: I take my wife out to dinner to celebrate her birthday and after having some of Seattle's best steaks and drinks, we have chosen to return to the Metropolitan Grill for three years straight. The entire experience is what you want from a high end dining establishment. Our coats are checked at the door, we are sat in the bar until our table is ready, then we are promptly seated and begin dinner. The wait staff is extraordinary. No new guys/gals learning the ropes here. These guys are seasoned and anticipate what you need or like. Now the food; we never get the same thing, my wife and I. She got the steak and I got the salmon. I also got the limited time only Buffalo steak. All I can say is we are going back next year.

Customer 4052.Name: jmeador3
Customer 4052.Content: I've been to Metropolitan Grill twice and it was great both times. The first time I had just moved to Seattle and we brought my 15 month old son with us (as we didn't have a babysitter in the area yet). I was nervous bringing him to a nice restaurant, but it was a great experience. The staff was very accommodating and the noise level was perfect… low enough so you could have a conversation without shouting, but loud enough that a little baby noise wasn't going to bother anyone sitting around you. The food was excellent and they have an awesome wine selection.

Customer 4053.Name: enjoysgoodfood
Customer 4053.Content: One of the platinum standards with regards to beef.  The Prime rib and Rib eye are my favorites here and one should not refrain from trying the house wines for excellent value and taste.  Reservations are strongly recommended and one should expect an evening without disappointment.

Customer 4054.Name: lilpip
Customer 4054.Content: The food is great, drinks are great, service is great. A Seattle classic that is always a treat.

Customer 4055.Name: tastedivine
Customer 4055.Content: I finally got to go here for dinner, even on a Monday night the place was vibrant and mostly full... I had the oysters (incredible), crab cakes (incredible)... wedge salad (incredible), split a boneless 18oz ribeye Oscar style cooked medium (incredible), split a HUGE loaded baked potato (incredible)... 2 glasses of wine that I don't remember what kind (incredible)... at this point I'm so full I can barely breathe but we had to split and try the Bananas Foster... that was HUGE, I barely could eat half (incredible). Nuff said....

Customer 4056.Name: Vicki
Customer 4056.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 37th anniversary. Our experience at the Metropolitan Grill beat our expectations! Delightful evening all around. Our waiter was attentive, the food was wonderful and the entire staff friendly. I'm so happy we saved room for desert!

Customer 4057.Name: Kimpossible0301
Customer 4057.Content: We flew in from Dallas, Los Angeles and San Francisco to celebrate our 50th birthday and we were not disappointed. John our server was so attentive. He made drink suggestions and made the night a success. The food was exquisite. We shared almost every appetizer. I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone celebrating a special occasion or just a night on the town.

Customer 4058.Name: Deee
Customer 4058.Content: Great dinner! Our server, Sean, was excellent. Prior to this visit, the service had not been up to par -- we were very happy to experience the level of service we expect at the Met. Thanks!

Customer 4059.Name: selfproclaimedfoodie
Customer 4059.Content: My husband and I don't often get to indulge in an expensive dinner, but once in a while we treat ourselves. We were not let down at the Met. I started with the almond crusted scallops, and they were divine. Hubby had the french onion soup and he said it was also fantastic. For my entree, I had the New York Strip and my husband had the Porterhouse. Both steaks were flavorful and tender- cooked to perfection. For dessert, we enjoyed the bananas foster; it was prepared tableside and tasted like heaven. The server was friendly and did not rush us through the meal. I do recommend making reservations. We made reservations and were seated right away, while others in the lobby had to wait.

Customer 4060.Name: Paddleboardgirl
Customer 4060.Content: Service from walking in the door to the moment we left was excellent, as I would expect. Everyone from the hostess staff, wine stewards, waiter, and bus staff was friendly and polite. This is and always will be a "go to" high end steak place in Seattle. The only off portion of the meal was that the steaks basically came out raw and barely warm. Even with their under grading compared to other steak restaurants we had a conversation with the waiter ... and even by Met Steakhouse standards on their menu we all agreed the steaks came out 1-2 grades under cooked. Even though they quickly offered to reheat, it still throws the whole pace of the meal off. Maybe it's because we were dining late, but still inexcusable from steak experts.

Customer 4061.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4061.Content: BOTH steaks were cooked incorrectly. Medium rare was cooked medium well and a medium was cooked medium rare. Waiter noticed and acknowledged the mistake, but only corrective compensation was a free dessert which we otherwise wouldn't have ordered or wanted. Of course it was a great dessert but we didn't come for dessert, we came for great steak which we did not get due to incorrect cooking. Will not be back and cannot recommend.

Customer 4062.Name: Rainkitty
Customer 4062.Content: The burger was juicy and delicious. The woman who waited on us was professional and friendly. The decor is dark and rich. Made me think of Mad Men! I took a friend for her birthday and they brought a complimentary dessert. I was actually blown away by how awesome the whole experience was. The $40 tab for our food was worth every penny. She had a chicken sandwich and I had a "works" burger.

Customer 4063.Name: DocK
Customer 4063.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is an old standby, and I eat there about 3 times a year. The noise level can be a tad high, and the delay between plating food and its delivery can occasionally mean that the entree/protein and sides are at wildly different temperatures. That being said, almost everything is supremely positive. Good knowledgable staff, solid cuts of meat in many iterations, and a willingness to accommodate very specific requests make this one of the best service staffs in the city. Highly recommend. And ask for what you want; they will do it within reason.

Customer 4064.Name: WillB
Customer 4064.Content: Delicious steaks, professional service, stellar wine list. Enough said. Try it.

Customer 4065.Name: Mschelseas
Customer 4065.Content: Was an amazing birthday dinner. Very pricey but well worth it

Customer 4066.Name: Jill
Customer 4066.Content: Felt extremely taken care of with this being my first experience in the outside world being wheelchair bound. We couldn't have asked for anything better. Amazing!

Customer 4067.Name: siverfox
Customer 4067.Content: Total experience was great, food , service, presentation, seating arrangement and total ambience, we will return again and again.

Customer 4068.Name: BirthdayBunch
Customer 4068.Content: The staff at the Metropolitan Grill were all very friendly and welcoming. As with the best fine dining restaurants, the service was attentive but not obtrusive... things just appeared and disappeared when appropriate and without fuss or fanfare. The Caesar salad was excellent, the lobster bisque rich and flavorful. Petite filet tender and superb taste. Crabcakes, Dungeness crab fettuccini all rich and satisfying. Huge creme brule dessert. Of course, all this (plus drinks) can make for an expensive night out. Still, on this, a very special birthday occasion, and like a special vacation spot or superlative wine, the meal was memorable and well worth the cost.

Customer 4069.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4069.Content:
The steak "The Met" was sub-par and tough to chew as compared to comparable NY steaks.
The temperature was excellent with help from the server, but the texture and taste did not match up.
If I didn't know better from a place that wants to preserve its reservation, I would think they did it on purpose assuming that I wouldn't know the difference. (Even though they were given a heads up by the reservation).

With a better starting product, I would give it another try. Until that is assured.. Not.

Not worth what I paid by any stretch.

Customer 4070.Name: specialtreat
Customer 4070.Content: wonderful time. food delicious as expected. will return in the future.

Customer 4071.Name: goodexp
Customer 4071.Content: great service food prepared just as ordered

Customer 4072.Name: Waiyin
Customer 4072.Content: We've always had great food and service. The extra perk was they were offering a dining special for the month of February--Have Dinner on Us.

Customer 4073.Name: Luveatingout
Customer 4073.Content: It is always a pleasure to go to the Metropolitan Grill, we have never had a bad experience there

Customer 4074.Name: Libby
Customer 4074.Content: We had our 3 year old grandson with us and all staff were very accommodating! service was wonderful and food was presented so we never felt rushed.

Customer 4075.Name: Deborah
Customer 4075.Content:
We were pleased to be seated a half hour before our reservation. And, when sitting near the front door caused sudden bursts of cold air to blow by our table we were also pleased to be moved to a warmer table.

That's where the atttentiveness of the staff ended. As soon as we requested an order to share, everyone just disappeared. We ordered a very large, expensive Sirloin Steak and paid the extra plate charge I specifically asked about when I made the reservation and was told by the hostess there was no charge for sharing!

I asked to take home the remaining steak - the man left all the good remaining pieces on the tray - very odd.

We were disappointed to be treated like second class citizens for sharing a meal. Go to Sullivans!

Customer 4076.Name: seekingbetterservice
Customer 4076.Content: Great food & great service. A great Seattle icon restaurant. That said they should consider investing in updating the very worn chairs/booths.

Customer 4077.Name: DiningDiva
Customer 4077.Content: Once again, the Metropolitan Grill has lived up to our expectations. Hubby ordered the Prime filet mignon and American Wagyu Filet, and I the Iberico Pork Loin. Both were fabulous. Jim, our waiter, always very attentive and happy to make recommendations. A glass of Malbec, the dinner was complete.

Customer 4078.Name: OReading
Customer 4078.Content: Easy reservation through OpenTable. Valet parking, coat check, delicious drinks in the bar while waiting for our table. Staff seems very professional, the evening flowed smoothly. Great waiter, didn't rush us, even brought the wine expert to our table to assist us in choosing the perfect bottle of wine. :)

Customer 4079.Name: Bonnie
Customer 4079.Content: My husband and I decided years ago that we would rather celebrate an anniversary or birthday at The Met then spend the same amount for a weekend away. We live in Gig Harbor, so for my birthday last Friday we spent the day shopping in the city, dinner at the Met and then walked to the Marriott to spend the night. Perfect!

Customer 4080.Name: izzynco
Customer 4080.Content: Great steaks! Best time of year to go is during the dinner on us promotion. Can't beat it

Customer 4081.Name: Donlin
Customer 4081.Content: Best food and service, especially the service. They were very attentive without being over bearing. Love this place!

Customer 4082.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4082.Content: Fantastic bar, fabulous steak dinner, baked potato, yum

Customer 4083.Name: Jerry53
Customer 4083.Content: Hi quality steak house that's great for special occasions or for bringing clients to. Great wine lists and the food/service is second to none. You can't go wrong eating at The Met.

Customer 4084.Name: Prish
Customer 4084.Content: Great place to eat meat. It is over the top expensive. Food is always terrific. Sides are good, but make it a BIG meal. Fun for special occasions service is friendly and attentive.

Customer 4085.Name: Finediner
Customer 4085.Content: This restaurant has been one of my wife's and my top three favorites and we frequently dine here. Until this visit our food had been flawless. This time my steak (New York) did not meet my expectations for flavor and tenderness. And, they ran out of vanilla ice cream. Who can run out of vanilla ice cream, and why not just go get some more? Their substitution did not pair well with our desert. A disappointing, albeit rare, miss for this usually flawless dining experience. This time the value was not there. Maybe Daniel's next time?

Customer 4086.Name: Lovebirds
Customer 4086.Content: Great food. Wonderful service and just an all around great place.

Customer 4087.Name: Echolake
Customer 4087.Content: My wife and I have been to the Met a number of times and have enjoyed the experience each time. The food, ambiance and service is consistently excellent. Our server, Scott, was the model of professionalism and courtesy. They say that they serve "The Best Steaks in Town" and in their case, it's not bragging because it's true. We will be back.

Customer 4088.Name: Dinner
Customer 4088.Content: Met Grill is very nice place, the food was very good and the portions are large, you will not go away hungry. The only thing is, the price for a steak its just to much, I can't see spending $75 for a steak. So I had the salmon which was very good and was more in price to other good seafood restaurants. Still I spent over $200 for two. It all adds up quick. The place is a little crowded too and noise level is more than the norm. The Met is not a romantic place for that reason.

Customer 4089.Name: Luv2dine
Customer 4089.Content: An average steak house. The waiter was outstanding.

Customer 4090.Name: 2satisfied
Customer 4090.Content: Food is so good. Had the lobster and the prime rib and both were incredible. We even got to see a celebrity there

Customer 4091.Name: ChipandDale
Customer 4091.Content: The onion soup is the best we have tasted. The taste is rich and complex. The 36 oz bone-in rib steak was a bit disappointing. We have requested medium rare and it came a bit on the rare side and the meat around the bone was nearly dripping in blood. We told the server it is a bit rare. And he said as long as the center is cooked to medium rare it is fine. I don't understand what that meant. I thought the whole steak should be done to perfection considering this restaurant is famous for their steak. And I had the steak done to perfection even the bone area at this restaurant before! Their dessert is to die for. So far we have tried their chocolate cake, coconut cake and carrot cake. The portion is big.

Customer 4092.Name: DorisRN
Customer 4092.Content: This was the 2nd time at this restaurant. The 1st time was really good. The 2nd time the service was slow, my steak was over cooked (Out Back does a better job with their steaks), the wine that was a recommendation by the waiter was box wine quality. The noise level of the restaurant is loud. The over all experience was not worth the money.

Customer 4093.Name: Nick
Customer 4093.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is a restaurant that holds a great tradition of classic dishes made with a twist of originality. I have visited the Met 4 times before and it has always been consistently good for quality meals and great service. My fiancé and I recently visited for Valentines day and the experience was flawless. Thanks to the Met we had a great meal that was not too outlandishly priced considering that this is an institution that pays to have great chefs and quality servers who are trained well.

Customer 4094.Name: Hawks2014
Customer 4094.Content: My lady and I have been going to The Met for special occasions 7 years now, and the food and service are never a disappointment. The food is always well prepared and the service is second to none. Look forward to our next dining experience at The Met.

Customer 4095.Name: Howard
Customer 4095.Content: We have been here many times over the years and as usual the steak is delicious. However, it felt like they wanted to turn the tables extra fast on this particular visit. Even with drinks, and appetizers with our dinner, we were in and out in an hour. There was also no acknowledgement of our special occasion which they had done for us in the past. In summary, great food but the experience was not enjoyable and a honestly a little disappointing.

Customer 4096.Name: BCBabies
Customer 4096.Content: We were seated at a table in a room that was very remote from the main dining area. It was creepy and felt like we were asked to "sit in the back of the bus". It may be time to begin a new Valentine dinner tradition for next year. Susan Capogna

Customer 4097.Name: Customer
Customer 4097.Content: I sat at the table right behind the front desk entrance, so I could see all the people coming in and out on Valentine's Day. Our server did the bare minimum. She got our drink/food orders, and never came back to check on how our food was. I had to get the front desk manager to reheat up my food, and she was super nice. The server didn't really care about us at all.

Customer 4098.Name: JackR
Customer 4098.Content: This is the second lunch I have had at the Metropolitan Grill . Both times I had no wait with my reservation. Service was excellent and the Friday prime rib was perfect!

Customer 4099.Name: laitsabr
Customer 4099.Content:
We were there for am early Valentine's Day dinner and it was marvelous! The steaks, prime rib, and sides were very well prepared to the temperature we wanted, the service was attentive, friendly and efficient despite the crowd. We had the banana caramel cream which was prepared at our table and it was quite a performance!
The price may be high, but we got what we paid for. We also pre-registered for the "Dinner on us" program which gave us a coupon for two free entrees the next time we visit!

Customer 4100.Name: wanana
Customer 4100.Content: Treat yourself and your sweetie at The Met---you will not be sorry!!! We will return!!

Customer 4101.Name: Rickquatre
Customer 4101.Content: Food was great. But the constant up sell wasn't needed.

Customer 4102.Name: runnerstu
Customer 4102.Content: We had a great night of excellent drinks and perfectly prepared steak. The Met provided us with a great birthday dinner.

Customer 4103.Name: fernando
Customer 4103.Content: one of the best steak houses on es pacific coast¡¡¡¡

Customer 4104.Name: Cynthia
Customer 4104.Content: Thanks again for the best night! We celebrated our Valentine's Day on Monday, February 10th (I work nights)- our server, "Handsome Scott Brown" made our night perfect as usual! The food was exactly as ordered and wonderful. We always have a great time at The Met, but H. S. B. somehow manages to make it even better. He is the best!!

Customer 4105.Name: HermosaBob
Customer 4105.Content:
The Met is a must every time we travel to Seattle. We used to go to Morton's in various cities but since Landry's acquired them a couple of years ago the food and ambiance at Morton's has declined.
This leaves the Met as THE place for us to enjoy a GREAT steak!

Customer 4106.Name: Lyle
Customer 4106.Content: Everytime we go to the Met we have great servce, each waiter or waitress makes you feel special, and makes you want to return.

Customer 4107.Name: SlyFoxAdventures
Customer 4107.Content: The 35 Day Dry Aged Top Cap Sirloin was one of the best steaks, if not the best steak, I've ever eaten. It was tender like a rib eye, but it was as lean as a sirloin. I usually order steaks medium well, but the waiter recommended I get it medium (with lots of pink in the middle). He was right! it was so tender and juicy and flavorful.

Customer 4108.Name: Tedd
Customer 4108.Content: Food was excellent, as always--But, the service we had was one of the best. First thing, he asked if we were under any time constraints (which we were) and then adjusted his service to ensure we had a wonderful dinner but being mindful of a deadline we had to complete our meal. Made recommendations for dinner for both of us which was excellent.

Customer 4109.Name: Tamberlee
Customer 4109.Content: You just cannot go wrong with The Met. We only go a few times per year because we live about an hour away. When we do go into the city, I'm always glad we stick with The Met and not try something new! :-) It really is THE place for amazing steaks in Seattle.

Customer 4110.Name: jackh
Customer 4110.Content: food was good but wasn't worth the money

Customer 4111.Name: RobM
Customer 4111.Content: As always the food is excellent. We have been going here for years and have never had such rude servers. Most of the staff was great but our server was condescending, rude & disingenuous. The Sommelier was even worse. Had no time for us and was extremely condescending and had no interest in our table. We spent $1,200 for a party of 4. You would think we would have been treated in a way we might want to come back. We will of course, but I hate to think about having either of the aforementioned staff be involved in our service. I'm hoping this is an exception and doesn't become the rule.

Customer 4112.Content: for the price the steak was not as good as steaks that if have had all over the country. I am comparing them to some of better steak houses in America. The Porter House was too large for a small steak and way too greasily even for a rare steak

Customer 4113.Name: JeniS
Customer 4113.Content: Had a enjoyable dinner at The Met .. The food was awesome and the service was awesome... Definitely would recommend you save your money and go there.

Customer 4114.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4114.Content: I don't plan to go very often because it's very expensive, but it was a nice treat. The waitstaff was all very friendly and the food was good.

Customer 4115.Name: JRS1
Customer 4115.Content:
THE SERVICE: Our server was more interested in the 2 tables behind us & completely ignored the rest of her section. She did not check on us from the moment the food was delivered until the bill was delivered (ex: no water refills).

THE FOOD: My steak was fatty & undercooked (she said it was low in fat content: wrong. My wife's Wagyu would've passed for Tuna with how rare it was). There was nothing extraordinary about the food. It was bland and underwhelming in everyway possible.

My wife & I both had high expectations of The Metropolitan Grill – both based on reviews & the amount of money we were willing (and going) to spend. For the cost of the experience, we should have received exemplary service and better than mediocre food. Shame.

Customer 4116.Name: PundiitCopyWriter
Customer 4116.Content: The 28 day aged steak actually melted in my mouth and the T-Bone was so big my dinner mates eyes bugged out of their head when they arrived at the table. Our waiter was very attentive we knew what exactly was going and never had to wait more than a moment for anything even though they were very busy and it was 6:30pm on a Saturday night. The velvet like drapes at our booth were fun and could be pulled closed if you want more privacy or romance.

Customer 4117.Name: Lynda
Customer 4117.Content: Wish they would do something to improve the comfort of some of their booths. Some are quite cramped and have legs under the booth that block any place to comfortably put your legs:(

Customer 4118.Name: AprilK
Customer 4118.Content: One of the best meals I have ever had in my life. They offer rare, high quality meats such as Ohmi and wagyu beef, and Iberico pork. Very few restaurants in the United States even serve those fine meats. The whole meal was beyond incredible, from the complimentary bread to the sides to the main courses and dessert. And the service was as wonderful as the meal. I can't wait to visit Seattle again just for this meal. I highly recommend dining here, it will be an experience you won't soon forget.

Customer 4119.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4119.Content: All I can say is that for great steak this is, in my opinion, the best restaurant in Seattle. The service is great and the food is unmatched.

Customer 4120.Name: MVDiner
Customer 4120.Content:
My wife and I went to the Met for our anniversary, and were not disappointed.
The staff had the perfect balance of attentiveness and information when we needed it, and letting us have our space when we didn't need them.
The prime rib, and New York strip that we ordered were perfectly prepared.
My only regret was that we didn't have room for the beautiful desserts that we saw going by.

Customer 4121.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4121.Content: Second time at the Met, and it didn't disappoint. Our waitress was very friendly and accommodating. We were a large work party of 11 with a per diem, so we had to pay with separate credit cards, she ensured us that she would work it out for us and she did. I know it we more effort but appreciated it. Food was great!

Customer 4123.Name: Angie
Customer 4123.Content:
I really loved the service and friendliness, knowledge of the staff at Met Grill, but the food wasn't worth the price. I ordered salmon. It had little to no flavor, though it was cooked to my liking. The potatoes served with it were lukewarm. The cake we had for dessert was freezer burner (white choc chip coconut cake). And the mashed potatoes, though delicious, were excessively salty.

The salad we had was amazing. But all of the above wasn't worth nearly $60 a person. I won't be coming back, Met. Sorry!

Customer 4124.Name: Mark
Customer 4124.Content: Good food, good service...but bring your wallet and your ear plugs.

Customer 4125.Name: Greg
Customer 4125.Content: Come prepared to spend a fair amount, but it's an elevated experience that's worth it.

Customer 4126.Name: Dean
Customer 4126.Content: It's not often that I'm in Seattle, but when I am, I try to dine at the Met. I enjoy the food, the wine list, the service and the ambiance. I've never been disappointed.

Customer 4127.Name: billy
Customer 4127.Content: Service was outstanding from everyone! Bruno was our Waiter. My wife and I both ordered "medium rare" filet mignon. Hers was cooked perfect. This was very important to me since it was her first visit. Mine was a little over cooked around the edges, but the center was perfect.

Customer 4128.Name: mimi
Customer 4128.Content: Been here many times and it is never disappointing. The service is the best in Seattle. They are real pros and of course the steaks are amazing. Always a treat and you never know who you might see dining next to you. Thanks Met!

Customer 4129.Name: LoveofFood
Customer 4129.Content: If you line steak and great knowledgable staff this is the place to go.

Customer 4130.Name: iLikeCake
Customer 4130.Content: I made reservations at the Metropolitan Grill for my 10 year Anniversary with my wife. Dinner was amazing! I highly recommend the French Onion Soup to start. The steaks were melt in your mouth ridiculous! To top off the phenomenal food, our server sent us home with free desert to celebrate our Anniversary. Thank you so much for a fabulous evening and a great meal!

Customer 4131.Name: Vancouver
Customer 4131.Content: We had lunch and the menu was very limited. I tried the Waldorf Chicken salad & it had too much dressing & the chicken was dry. My husband had the beef stroganoff & he said it was good but I didn't think it was anything special. The restaurant was very noisy. Certainly isn't a quiet place for lunch.

Customer 4132.Name: DaveF
Customer 4132.Content: Consistently excellent service and great steaks! It remains one of my favorites.

Customer 4133.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4133.Content:
Outstanding, attentive, and engaging waitress who made a great impression right away when my female guest wanted a salad, but not with the topping that was offered. She asked that the topping be held off ( I'm sorry I dont recall what), and the waitress suggestied a blacken salmon alternative that my friend said was one of the best salads she ever had. Then she completed our fine luncheon experience by complimenting a burnt creme desert for my other guest who was celebrating a birthday! Overall a great lunch.

The only negative, a very minor detail that would be difficult to change, was that we were seated very close to the front door on a chilly day and had to eat with our coats on.....otherwise excelent- Thank you

Customer 4134.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4134.Content: Having come to the Met for many years and always eating exceptional steak, I was disappointed that our medium rare steaks were almost charred on the outside. This would have been okay for a twenty, or thirty dollar steak, but each steak was almost seventy dollars. The service and ambiance was excellent, so it made the food all the more disappointing. I was celebrating my boyfriend's birthday and had been praising the Met for weeks leading up our dinner, but by the end of the meal, he didn't even want dessert for fear he would be again disappointed.

Customer 4135.Name: IvanB
Customer 4135.Content: I asked for a candle on our desert and it didn't come. I didn't remind the hostess, but I wrote it on the reservations ooen table page. Regardless, it was great!

Customer 4136.Name: RomanT
Customer 4136.Content: Went to the NFC Championship game and went to the met after the game. Awesome food, great wine, and to top it off...some Seahawks came by for dinner as well. When you want the best steaks in town, with a great bottle of wine the choice is simple... The Met!!

Customer 4137.Name: Cori
Customer 4137.Content: We had a great brunch before the Seahawks game. Would definitely recommend and will be visiting again soon.

Customer 4138.Name: Hawkfan
Customer 4138.Content: One of our fav Seattle restaurants; always an excellent meal and attentive wait staff. On-line reservations much appreciated!

Customer 4139.Name: BRIANR
Customer 4139.Content: steak was great but not quite hot enough

Customer 4140.Name: TracyW
Customer 4140.Content: We have been here many times and been extremely happy with all aspects of the restaurant. This time however it was an extremely poor experience. Two people ordered the prime rib - one was a terrible cut of meat, but he was so hungry he tried to eat it - the other was lukewarm when it arrived and had to be sent back twice. I had salmon and it was excellent, but I was the only one happy with my meal. The most disappointing part of the evening was the service. Our waiter could hardly be found - three times one person had to get up from the table to find someone to help get us more drinks and to get bread. Our waiter was completely disinterested in providing good service. If he had told us his name I would put it here, but he never did.

Customer 4141.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4141.Content: This continues to be our favorite restaurant for special occasions and excellent food. We love it!!!!!!

Customer 4142.Name: Hydrodon
Customer 4142.Content: Really enjoyed the great food and service.

Customer 4143.Name: Kelliw
Customer 4143.Content: I am NEVER disappointed when I dine here! The food is ALWAYS superb, the service outstanding, and the feel is special! I would and have, recommended this restaurant to anyone who loves great food!

Customer 4144.Name: Julie
Customer 4144.Content: Every visit to the Met is always a fantastic one! They have the BEST service in town, and the BEST steaks that we've ever had. We took my parents & brother for first time, and decided to order to share. Our server offered to cut the steaks for us so we didn't have to do it on our own. We didn't realize everything would be carved tableside and presented so beautifully for us. The food was delicious and it was truly a special first time dining experience for my family! Thank you!

Customer 4145.Name: GeorgeN
Customer 4145.Content: The Met is always a great place for a drink or a fine dinner.

Customer 4146.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4146.Content:
We planned a meeting with customer in a good place.
the table we got was in the road to the kitchen and full of wind from the airco.
the waitress did not listen to our questions and put 18 glasses on the table for water, we were with 6 people..
the steaks asked for medium cooked, they were raw, and not good.
beside the fact it took too long before we got the foot, we ran out all disappointed and could not believe what happened here.
no good feeling and really,really disappointed.

Customer 4147.Name: ermohn
Customer 4147.Content: The Met is truly one of the grest steakhouses in the world. The quality of what they do shows in every part of the experience from the moment you walk in the door. Highly recommended.

Customer 4148.Name: Girlloves2eat
Customer 4148.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 7th anniversary and decided on Met Grill. Our steaks were fabulous....veggies were not. Roasted root veggies and a side each of asparagus & brussel sprouts. The asparagus was good. Since it was our anniversary we were surprised with a DELISH creme brûlée. Overall a good meal.

Customer 4149.Name: Randy
Customer 4149.Content: The food was great and the service good. The atmosphere was a little too loud and busy to be considered romantic. We were celebrating our 26th wedding anniversary and the only acknowledgement we received was a complimentary creme brûlée which my wife doesn't really care for. Although I would go again for the food, I won't go back for an anniversary.

Customer 4150.Name: GDO1
Customer 4150.Content: We made reservations for lunch prior to the Seahawks game on January 11th, 2014. The service was great initially built as they got busier the waiter got overwhelmed with too many tables. I ask for a second drink and it never came. We would have lingered for a couple of more but we would have missed the game waiting for service.

Customer 4151.Name: WillB
Customer 4151.Content: This place always delivers. Have been here more than any steak house and have never been disappointed.

Customer 4152.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4152.Content: A very special place for a specail occasion. Our service was very good, and the food was as well.

Customer 4153.Name: vinmin875
Customer 4153.Content: The steak I had not as good as before, everything else was ok.

Customer 4154.Name: Ludlowdiner
Customer 4154.Content: Everything was fine from the greeting, the food, the best wishes at the end. We come for special occasions because this is a special place.

Customer 4155.Name: Camswis
Customer 4155.Content: could use a carpet cleaning or new carpet. It smelled like my grandma's house.

Customer 4157.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4157.Content: My second time at the Met and it too was great. Our waitress Kim did a fantastic job to do what we ordered. The food was great as it should be for the price.

Customer 4158.Name: djohn
Customer 4158.Content: When you spend $500 for a meal, they should get your order right. Took our parents out for their first time. Dinner came but they forgot our two dishes for the table. By the time anyone came near our table again, we were already halfway done with dinner. Loud and chaotic atmosphere. Much different from times we've been there in the past.

Customer 4159.Name: Belleviewer
Customer 4159.Content: An early dinner on Saturday evening, with a last minute reservation. The tandem 4 oz steaks were excellent. Walking distance from the Symphony Hall and Art Museum. The wine list is "too damn long".

Customer 4160.Name: Foodie1883
Customer 4160.Content: Highly recommend. The food was excellent, but the service was better!

Customer 4161.Name: MichelleS
Customer 4161.Content:
Perfectly cooked steak, huge wine selection, top shelf cocktails and great ambiance.
Will contine to come back everytime we visit Seattle.

Customer 4162.Name: David
Customer 4162.Content:
Everyone we came into contact with during our visit was very pleasant and professional. Our server Noi was very friendly and informative. The sommelier helped us pick the perfect bottle of wine for our dinner and Kevin prepared a desert for us that helped finish the evening in style. After just our second time at the Met, we were made to feel welcome and comfortable, never hurried and well taken care of. Thank You.
ps. We will see you next year for our third annual celebration at the Met.

Customer 4163.Name: hoge
Customer 4163.Content: I relocated from Japan and used this steakhouse twice. The style is as Japanese imagine just as American traditional. Taste is excellent and portion always satisfies me and my guests from Japan.

Customer 4164.Name: LoveFoodandWine
Customer 4164.Content: My ratings says it all. Many thanks to our server "Captain" Jim and the Maitre D' Kevin. Both gentlemen made our experience truly amazing. Both our kids were treated with the best service and my wife and I were immediately won over. This was the best way to celebrate NYE with my family while visiting Seattle from Hawaii. Service emulated the Aloha Spirit we are accustomed to.

Customer 4165.Name: Nancy
Customer 4165.Content: Fabulous food. Fabulous service. Best steak.

Customer 4166.Name: RichardS
Customer 4166.Content:
This was recommended by friends and we were not disappointed. This restaurant brings back the kind of service and ambiance that I assumed (incorrectly) was never to be seen again. The food was outstanding, I has a cup of the lobster bisque and a sliced roast beef sandwich and my wife had the Salad with tenderloin beef. All I can say is that it was all exceptional.
This place is very pricey, but if you're out for great food, service and atmosphere it is well worth the money.

Customer 4167.Name: SeattleDiner
Customer 4167.Content: I have been to the Met for many times. Food is great as usual. But this time after we finished with lunch and gave my credit card to the server, we had to wait for close to 15 minutes before the server came back.

Customer 4168.Name: Seahawkfan
Customer 4168.Content: We make trips to Seattle a couple of times a year. We usually enjoy the fine seafood Seattle is known for. Thought we would try something different this time so we booked a reservation at the Metropolitan Grill. The menu selection is outstanding. The food was great. The atmosphere was loud and busy. We would have liked it to be a little more quiet and relaxed especially with the price of the meal. We will probably stick with seafood while in Seattle.

Customer 4169.Name: RibEyeGuy
Customer 4169.Content: If you like a perfect steak this is the place! 3 of us dined, 2 ordered the 8 oz. American Wagyu Filet, I opted for the combo 4 oz. Prime Filet, & 4 oz. American Wagyu Filet. The American Wagyu beef is by far the best beef I have ever eaten. The service at the Met is as good as it gets, the professionalism is unmatched by any other steak house that I've been to. The Wine Captain was very entertaining and made a great pairing to our meal. French onion soup was great. The only negative was being over ruled on the asparagus w/Béarnaise instead we had the Brussel Sprouts which I found to be slightly undercooked and the sprouts were a bit chewy. I will return to try the bacon wrapped pork chops next. Truly a unique & enjoyable dining experience.

Customer 4170.Name: CarolynR
Customer 4170.Content: This experience was great! I was blown away by the level of service by the staff -- the most professional and gracious I have ever experienced. My only tiny qualm would be that the portions were enormous! Other than that -- really great spot.

Customer 4171.Name: FredW
Customer 4171.Content: We went for a birthday and because the Met may not survive in its current form once the construction of the new tower starts. Great service, very respectful to kids and special needs. Wonderful service - like the server assistant who checked every inch of the perimeter of the kids' plates to ensure they were not too hot. Reliable place for a nice traditional meal. Huge portions.

Customer 4172.Name: Sabr
Customer 4172.Content: We had one of the best meals of our lives at this restaurant, from appetizer all the way through dessert. The servers were all really nice, but seemed to be inattentive to small details, such as refilling waters and trying to remove food before we were finished. The amazing food outweighed the slight misgivings in service and I highly recommend this restaurant. We came to the restaurant for the steaks, which were very high quality and ended up leaving equally impressed by the white chocolate coconut cake we had for dessert. The fact that the restaurant had superb food from start to finish means we'll definitely be back again.

Customer 4173.Name: hyjude
Customer 4173.Content: We have always enjoyed dinner at the Met but have found in recent years that lunch is even better. We always order the kobe beef dip. It's the best. When we take our grandchildren, we order an extra one to go even though they also have half of their lunch in a doggie bag. Never get tired of the Met.

Customer 4174.Name: Peter
Customer 4174.Content: Outstanding food and service, probably the best restaurant for a steak dinner in Seattle.

Customer 4175.Name: PJB1
Customer 4175.Content: We arrived early for our reservation and were seated immediately. The waitress was knowledgeable and friendly. The food was excellent - my daughter decided after her prime rib arrived that she wanted it cooked more and that handled that perfectly - took it back and brought one cooked just right. I asked for bacon for my potato and she brought that right away! I told her we were also celebrating an excellent grade point after the first semester of college - she brought creme brulle to add to the celebration. Not too noisy - a lot of people were there on Christmas eve.

Customer 4176.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4176.Content: The service was perfect and the food even better

Customer 4177.Name: Gretchenlovesgoodfood
Customer 4177.Content: This was our third year celebrating with family here. The food has been consistent, although there was nothing new or exciting. We were not happy, however, being stuck in a round booth. We were six adults that were uncomfortable during our meal. In my online reservation I did mention that this was a special event and felt like we should have had a better table.

Customer 4178.Name: MavenLane
Customer 4178.Content: Amazing steaks at this Seattle icon. Wow - also the Dungeness Cocktail was out of this world! Top-notch service, and just an amazing steak.

Customer 4179.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4179.Content: We have going to this place for about twenty years. Between our last visit in July and this one, some practical joker got ahold of this place and ruined it. The server was elusive. The food was below average and menu defied common sense. For example, one of us ordered the barbeque cheeseburger. Not noted on the menu or by the server this turned out be a one pound patty!!! with some warning we would have not ordered it. It looked like one of those things you win a t-shirt for if you eat the whole thing. The server thought it was quite funny we were shocked by this thing. This is the same guy who did not know what ABV meant.

Customer 4180.Name: MetDinner22
Customer 4180.Content: We annually go to The Met for our special pre-Christmas Dinner. We usually love the ambience, food and service. However, this time, on Sunday-December 22nd, it was right after the Seahawks game and the place was overflowing. That could be absolutely fine, but it was quickly obvious that there wasn't enough staffing to handle it and our service suffered tremendously. We constantly had to wait for our orders and it was obvious that our server Christine (I don't blame her, she is GREAT) was running the entire time. Same with the rest of the staff. Now, we LOVE The Met with unbeatable ambience and food, but we should not have spent over three hours there. Most of the time waiting and wondering when our orders would arrive.

Customer 4181.Name: BuxLaw
Customer 4181.Content: Brunch is OK; lunch and dinners are great.

Customer 4182.Name: GoHawks
Customer 4182.Content: From the appetizers to dessert, everything was outstanding.

Customer 4183.Name: Sharon
Customer 4183.Content:
Our group of 4 enjoyed our meal, but found it difficult
to talk above the ambient noise. Would have liked more mon-meat
options. Portabella entree was tasty, but more veggies and less mashed potatoes!

Customer 4184.Name: Schnapps
Customer 4184.Content:
Four people, $535 with tip. Had better steaks. Had Top Cap and Ribeye. Neither one justified the price.
Great place if you're not buying.

Customer 4185.Name: winelover98
Customer 4185.Content: Always great food and service! Main reason my husband and I love the Met Grill.

Customer 4186.Name: wwww
Customer 4186.Content: The Met is super. Red meat, great atmosphere, great service. we go at the holidays and for some birthdays. We'll be back!

Customer 4187.Name: DiningDenizen
Customer 4187.Content: My wife and I had not eaten at the Metropolitan Grill in many years. Wish we hadn't stayed away so long. We were delighted with the experience. Our youngest son and his fiancée were our guests as a precursor to the Nutcracker. Can't say enough about the way we were treated - the food - the wine - the ambience. It was absolutely perfect. It is at the top of our list - will be back soon.

Customer 4188.Name: DarY
Customer 4188.Content: I've been coming to The Met for a long time; first choice among the coworkers since we work across the street. Excellent food, good selection, sandwich combinations are tasty and quite filling. Desserts are large enough to share with everyone getting their fill.

Customer 4189.Name: IJKMNO
Customer 4189.Content: Everything you want in a fine-dining experience. Great wine list, superbly-prepared food and thoroughly professional service.

Customer 4190.Name: CelebratingCouple
Customer 4190.Content: We have been to the Metropolitan Grill previously with very good service and food. This time one person in our party ordered a prime rib and it was not up to the standards that we would expect from the Metropolitan Grill. It was very fatty and we were surprised that the plate even made it to the table knowing the standards here. The other three dinners were what we would expect from this restaurant.

Customer 4191.Name: larryo
Customer 4191.Content: We've tried them all, and no one does steaks as well as the Met. Not even close.

Customer 4192.Name: Stacey
Customer 4192.Content: Great environment and the meat lovers were excited. Arrived, and they were running about 20 mins behind. -not a big deal. Once seated, we were ignored for about 20 mins. When our waiter finally arrived, she was pleasant, but not interested in serving that night. We had to ask for cocktails, another bottle of wine, etc.. Food was good, but the king crab legs that were ordered were hardly pre-split.. (not usual there) As soon as the birthday boys were given their dessert, our check appeared. We weren't asked if we wanted any other desserts for the rest of the table, coffee, cognac etc. For 650$, we hoped for a little more attention. Not sure if this was a one time thing, but we might stick with Daniels just because the service/food is better.

Customer 4193.Name: lovetodine
Customer 4193.Content: They have the best steaks in town! Ambience is great and the service is excellent!

Customer 4194.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4194.Content: I have been to the Met many times. The food was as good as usual, but ther service was lousy.

Customer 4195.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4195.Content: I can't let a year go by without dining at this Seattle institution, and once again I was rewarded with a deluxe experience - fine cocktails and wines, that wonderful French onion soup, and the second-best steaks in Seattle (sorry, Met, Gaucho is #1), served up by an amiable and knowledgeable staff. i cherish my annual Metropolitan Grill experience and it's never let me down!

Customer 4196.Name: JTF2000
Customer 4196.Content: Like all truly great restaurants the Met is as consistent as it is good. The wine list if diverse and offers a wide range of vintage, type and price. We love large format bottles and they have a bunch to choose from. The meat is as good as any steak house I have ever been to, and better than most. Service cannot be touched either, as the people there earned their striped over the years and are happy to work there. A little rich to eat there every night... but every Tuesday would be fun.

Customer 4197.Name: MetCrash
Customer 4197.Content:
Visited The Met in 2004 while visiting Seattle, enjoyed a snack and refreshing beverage. Walked past the restaurant so many times after moving to Seattle we decided to finally visit for a meal.

Wonderful service, knowledgeable & personable wait staff, professional Hostess.

The food was nice, not memorable. Not as good as it smells from the outside. When walking past the Met the smell of grilled steaks is (to say the least) mouthwatering. When a restaurant charges upwards of $60 for a ribeye steak and there is so little flavor in the meat, it is outrageously overpriced. Yes, the steaks were tender and wonderfully cooked, but tasteless. Dry.

Grossly overpriced. Ophelias (Sarasota, FL) & Slanted Door (SF, CA) are much better value.

Customer 4198.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4198.Content: Had the bone-less rib steak. One of the best steaks I have ever had. It was just great.

Customer 4199.Name: MichaelF
Customer 4199.Content: The food was spot on and our server Roger was a joy.

Customer 4200.Name: Operadiner
Customer 4200.Content:
The only thing missing from the tables filled with business people (men mainly) was heavy cigar smoke. The ambiance is heavy as is the food...but what the heck its a steakhouse and a revered one at that. But really, does a good steak have to cost so much?
Sooooo.if you want a steak and Caesar salad (be sure to tell them to hold the Anchovies) washed down with an overpriced glass of wine this is the place. The food is good, the atmosphere masculine and redolent of the way restaurants used to be, the noise level high (a great place for an assignation), if this is to your taste, then the Met is for you.

Customer 4201.Name: louisA
Customer 4201.Content: Only go once a year for girlfriends birthday. Expensive but worth it due to the great food, drinks, ambiance and service.

Customer 4202.Name: Chuck
Customer 4202.Content: Pleasant ambience, excellent food, and very cordial service but a little noisy for comfortable confidential conversation. We will ask for a table location that might be a little quieter on future visits.

Customer 4203.Name: AKCregar
Customer 4203.Content: We had been told about this place for over a year by our boss who eats here whenever he is in town! We had the chateaubriand and it was AMAZING!!! Their escargot was also delicious! We had cherries jubilee for dessert and we were stuffed! Great customer service and an amazing presentation!

Customer 4204.Name: SteveC
Customer 4204.Content: Great Dinner, Awesome atmosphere, service was top notch and the food was fresh and delicous

Customer 4205.Name: clos2thedge
Customer 4205.Content: My favorite Seattle restaurant. The Met is known for the best steak in town, and I've never been disappointed there. We had the chateaubriand for two and it was magnificent. The meat is carved and the sauce prepared at tableside with mushrooms and a baked tomato. The presentation is lovely and the meat was to die for. Our waiter, Roger was very attentive, and realizing that we were running late for an 8:00 show, was helpful in preparing our bill quickly and even had my coat waiting for me when I stood up. This isn't the cheapest restaurant in town by any means, but you will get every dollar's worth in service and great food!

Customer 4206.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4206.Content: Unique selection of meet - perfectly cooked - very good service - fun and filling

Customer 4207.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4207.Content: I went to this restaurant for my B-Day really looking for the best steak I have ever had. Had reservations for 8:15 didnt' get seated until 10 to 9. We brought our own wine with us since it was a special bottle for my B-Day dinner. I ordered the 35 day aged steak. When it came the chef had taken it upon himself to slice it up for me, like I was a little kid without a steak knife. The meat wasn't as soft as other top end steaks I've had and was a little disapointing. Black and Blue in Vancouver B.C. and Aqua by El Gaucho are two that I would recommend over these guys. They just didn't seem very people orientated. Bill and the end was $150, about what I excpected to pay for a high end steak house, but it was worth $90.

Customer 4208.Name: DarellS
Customer 4208.Content: We enjoyed ever part of the dinner. If there was anything to complain about, it was very cold outside and as guests entered, the cold air chilled my wife as we dined.

Customer 4209.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4209.Content:
Food very mediocre for the price. My wife had a ribeye steak that was tough with very little marbling.
I'm not really sure it was even what she'd ordered. Have been here before with good results. Very disappointed in the quality.

Customer 4210.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4210.Content: Calamari was excellent; wedge salad was excellent but otherwise extremely expensive for good steak and potatoes that I can do at home. The steak salad was disappointing - a pile of lettuce with boring dressing (I think there was some vinaigrette on it) and a few bacon wrapped steak kabobs. Should have gone with original preference of the vegetarian portobello 'steak' dinner but followed waiter suggestion. Stick with appetizers; soup and wedge salad and you will have a delicious and fairly economic meal. They were sweet about bringing a complementary creme brulee with candle in it for our daughter's birthday.

Customer 4211.Name: SouthernBelle
Customer 4211.Content: I took my boyfriend here for his first time to celebrate his Birthday. The Staff and the atmosphere were friendly, welcoming and helpful. We were seated quickly and well taken care of. We started with wine and the Dungeness Crab Cocktail that was so fresh with whole segments of crab. We had the Châteaubriand. They prepared it with the Cliff sauce and carved it at our table. It was served with a roasted Parmesan tomato and mushrooms and we chose the root vegetables. WOW, The meat was cook to perfection just as we ordered. It was so tender and melts in your mouth, roll your eyes back in your head good! Lastly we enjoyed the creamiest Crème Brûlée. The presentation, texture and flavor of all the food made for the best meal I’ve ever had.

Customer 4212.Name: alfy
Customer 4212.Content: Great all around - just have a hard time trying to figure out what to order!

Customer 4213.Name: Youmusttrythisgem
Customer 4213.Content: Service was very slow, and though food was good, this was not the excellence experience I expect for the Met

Customer 4214.Name: drstevie
Customer 4214.Content: I am a regular here, and especially for lunch. My favorite place in Seattle. A bit expensive but well worth it. Highly recommend.

Customer 4215.Name: Bdayparty
Customer 4215.Content: As always this was an incredible experience. If you are looking for that memorable dining experience and price is not an issue, you will be completely satisfied here. We are repeat customers yet it met or exceeded all our expectations once again!

Customer 4216.Name: MikeS
Customer 4216.Content: Doesn't the title of the review say it all? Who knew you could or should make meatloaf out of Wagyu beef? I thought there might have been a law that forbid this. Thank goodness there isn't. And when paired with the Met's mashed potatoes, and a little bacon thrown on top, doesn't get much better than that on a very cold winter day.

Customer 4217.Name: Peppersteaklover
Customer 4217.Content: Had a great time, everything was fantastic. The place was hopping but the service kept up. We really enjoyed ourselves and as always the steaks were perfect!

Customer 4218.Name: SScott
Customer 4218.Content: Loved the ambience, especially visiting during the month of Christmas. Shared the delicious 16oz Rib eye, with old fashioned service at your table. All portioned, and served professionally...with a smile. Affordable wines to be had. We paired Chateau Ste Michelle Cabernet...perfect! Make your reservation and take the time to enjoy. It was an amazing dining experience.

Customer 4219.Name: kevin
Customer 4219.Content: My wife and I absolutely love the Met. the best of everything and highly recommend it.

Customer 4220.Name: Scoobiebike
Customer 4220.Content: We enjoyed everything, our service was outstanding. The prime rib was the best dish at the table. Melt in your mouth. Come hungry.

Customer 4221.Name: djindenver
Customer 4221.Content: We were initially seated at a bussing station with a view of half eaten food. We were moved and walked past a huge tray of half eaten food in another area. The food was good, but next time Ruth's Chris.

Customer 4222.Name: yummy
Customer 4222.Content: It was my mom's b-day and they gave her a free crème brulee. They also helped me pair my wine with ohmi beef so well!

Customer 4223.Name: Debra
Customer 4223.Content: Food is consistenly good, service is generally attentive

Customer 4224.Name: wanana
Customer 4224.Content: The Met is #1 for our choice of a place to eat great food and receive great service!!! Next time, try it for yourself!!

Customer 4225.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4225.Content: There are lots of great Steakhouses in this town yet we always go back to the Met because the service and food couldn't possibly be better.

Customer 4226.Name: Steve
Customer 4226.Content: Wonderful Sommelier. Made a special night even more special

Customer 4227.Name: steakkgguy
Customer 4227.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 15th wedding anniversary here. Started with drinks and shrimp cocktail in the bar, shrimp was cooked perfectly and the Sauce was out of this world. 18 oz aged prime ribeye (best I have had) walnut salad with gorganzola (excellent) Wife really liked Australian lobster tail, baked potato with Tillamook cheese sauce and we both enjoyed the creamed spinach. This place is 3 for 3 with us and has yet to disappoint. Highly recommended.

Customer 4228.Name: DeweyL
Customer 4228.Content: Service was great and the environment was great. Just thought for the price I paid for the food, I expected it to be a bit more tasteful. I had the prime rib and didn't think it was great. Good, but not great.

Customer 4229.Name: John
Customer 4229.Content: One of the best steakhouses in the country.

Customer 4230.Name: Willis
Customer 4230.Content: Ok, so we were in town for a convention and were in Seattle for the first time, but I can't imagine there is a better steakhouse in Seattle. This may be the best steakhouse I have ever experienced. If you are familiar with The Captial Grille, The Prime Rib (Baltimore or DC), Morton's or Flemmings; in my opinion Metropolitan Grill has them beat. Just sayin' !!!!

Customer 4231.Name: Punjab
Customer 4231.Content: While not cheap, the Metropolitan Grill gives great value for money as their steaks are the best I have eaten outside Texas. Plus, much to my joy, they actually brought mine Medium Rare - for some reason a lot of restaurants, in my opinion, seem to think that women don't mean "medium rare" but actually "medium" or even "well done". The sides were also delicious - they do a brussels sprout dish with bacon and small onions that is wonderful. The only disadvantage is it is very busy pretty much all the time so it is noisy and you are close to other tables.

Customer 4232.Name: steveman
Customer 4232.Content: Overall, great food and one of the best steaks I have ever had. The wait between the salad and main course (steaks) took much longer than it should have.

Customer 4233.Name: Fillycheze
Customer 4233.Content: The place was very busy after a Seahawks game. Bar was lively, and restaurant full. Quality of food was high, but standard for this level of steakhouse. Our server did a great job at engaging us and answering questions.

Customer 4234.Name: FoodTraveler
Customer 4234.Content: It's The Met - It never disappoints!

Customer 4235.Name: rockawaygal
Customer 4235.Content: Metropolitan Grill always a great spot to visit, especially for lunch in downtown Seattle.

Customer 4236.Name: Happy50
Customer 4236.Content: Took clients here for dinner. Food was amazing and most of all the staff was great! Definitely recommend to anyone that enjoys a good steak.

Customer 4237.Name: girlwholovesherseahawks
Customer 4237.Content: If you want a steak this is the only place to go. The service is always excellent. I can't say enough about this restaurant.

Customer 4238.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4238.Content: The Metropolitan Grill serves an amazing steak. It is expensive, but completely worth it. All the people we have taken there still speak very highly of the experience, even the vegetarians (there is an amazing portobello mushroom on the menu).

Customer 4239.Name: meatandnothingbutthemeat
Customer 4239.Content:
Everything was great, except the back cushion on the booth bench. Too much pad at my shoulders and none in my lower back. Felt like I was being pushed forward.

The lower dining room was not noisy and just the right lighting. Not too bright. A candle on the table would have been perfect.

The food was excellent. My wife had the steak salad and I had the Buffalo steak and a baked with a dinner salad. The steak was medium rare and melt in your mouth.

We had molten lava chocolate cake with whipped Chantilly Cream. Fantastic. The waiter, Jade, also brought us a complimentary Burnt Cream for our anniversary. Too much food. Jade was great, good attitude, service and suggestions.

Customer 4240.Name: PatM
Customer 4240.Content: As always great food, at a premium price. But worth every cent. Outstanding wait staff that makes you the most important customer that has ever walked in the door!

Customer 4241.Name: EllaSims
Customer 4241.Content:
The ambiance -old world steak house. The steaks were great tasting. The casear's salad -- awesome w/ just the right amount of dressing, filet mignon moist and tasty, the spinach salad -- little too much dressing & the shredded mozzarella cheese (?) seemed out of place. Only complaint was the way the meat was cooked -- really charred on the outside. We understand why but
it should be explained on the menu so you know was to expect. Dessert of flambe apple pie was interesting & delicious but the crust part wasn't that appealing. Would eat there again for a great steak.

Customer 4242.Name: WendyButterscotch
Customer 4242.Content: Not only is the service better than any other restaurant in the city, the food is absolutely artful, distinguished and perfect - every time! I brought my husband here to celebrate a new job and we had a charming booth with servers who had impeccable timing. They were neither hovering nor intrusive, but able to clear a dish at precisely the right time. Everything ran like clockwork from the prompt hostess who greeted us at the entrance to the delivery of drinks, main course, dessert and finally - coat check. Worth every cent to create a memory at the Met.

Customer 4243.Name: RetirementEngineer
Customer 4243.Content:
I've been going to the Metropolitan for decades. It isn't a spot I can afford to visit every month but one that I will gladly spend the money to celebrate special occasions.
When I thought about where I would propose to my soon-to-be fiancee, there was no question in my mind that it would be at the Met. Always excellent, personable service and superb food. I've been to top rated restaurants all over the world and the Met is unique because you are made to be welcome if you are in jeans, having dinner with friends or in a suit having dinner with a business client. Taking my sweetheart to the Met to propose will provide memories for us for the rest of our lives.

Customer 4244.Name: Leftylemon
Customer 4244.Content: Had wonderful prime rib after the Scotch Malt Whisky Society's tasting event at the Rainier Club. The meal at the Met outshone the scotch tasting, and that's hard to do!

Customer 4245.Name: MegB
Customer 4245.Content: We really enjoyed our experience at the Metropolitan Grill. The food and service was excellent. The only complaint I have is that the main course came before I completed my salad. It would have been nice to have some more time between the courses.

Customer 4246.Name: Steve
Customer 4246.Content: Have eaten here a number of times. Food is top-notch. A little pricey, but you get what you pay for ...

Customer 4247.Name: SpecialNight
Customer 4247.Content: Great restaurant for a special occasion - prices on the high side, but old style service and food was exceptional.

Customer 4248.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4248.Content: It was my birthday and my husband and i both enjoyed our meal. The steaks (I had the filet; he had the Porterhouse) were outstanding. The service was perfect. The ambiance was just right. A perfect birthday choice!

Customer 4249.Name: JoanieB
Customer 4249.Content: We absolutely love going to the Met. We use this restaurant for special occasions - this one was to meet with good friends and enjoy a good meal together. The service is fantastic. You have very experienced restaurant staff throughout the restaurant to treat you wonderfully. Haven't found a meal that we didn't like yet.

Customer 4250.Name: 13thbirthdayatTheMet
Customer 4250.Content: Celebrated my son's 13th birthday on Saturday with 2 of his friends. The server patiently explained the various cuts of meat, temperature, etc to the boys. food was good, the boys had fun ordering the priciest steak on the menu, overall a great time! We forgot candles but the restaurant found us 13 lovely candles.

Customer 4251.Name: Swisink
Customer 4251.Content: Me and my wife went to the Met, with the expectation that we would have amazing steak. I, as well as my wife are not steak experts, and honestly couldn't explain the subtle differences between cuts. I went hoping that our server would be able to guide us and make suggestions and be excited to help guide us. We were looking for more than just great food, but hoping for a great dining experience. Looking around we saw other waiters seeming to interact more, our how ever seemed to look down on our ignorance and was not helpful in choosing what to eat. I was very disappointed especially when spending $76 on one meal.

Customer 4252.Name: LavenderBerri
Customer 4252.Content: We came here on a Tuesday night at 8pm for my boyfriend's birthday. It was very lively for a Tuesday night. I had requested a quiet area but there really wasn't much of a quiet area anywhere at this time. This didn't detract from a good experience though. The service was wonderful, the food was really great (as always), and my boyfriend and his mom had a great time. The Met has some wonderful steaks but if you're looking for a bit of quiet with your meal, this may not be it for you. However, if you want a fun night out eating steaks, this is definitely the place to be.

Customer 4253.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4253.Content: A well oiled machine - service top notch - food excellent - overall a very good dining experience!

Customer 4254.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4254.Content: The entire experience was excellent. Was there for a anniversary and the Metropolitan went above and beyond!

Customer 4255.Name: sunshine
Customer 4255.Content: The Met never lets me down for the best food! We all loved our time at the Met. The service was great too. The white chocolate coconut cake was a great ending to my night.

Customer 4256.Name: AnnaLee
Customer 4256.Content: I keep coming back because its such a pleasure. From the perfectly fired steaks to the thoughtful service. You feel spoiled and if you allow yourself, decadent, when you leave The Met. Can't wait to come back.

Customer 4257.Name: axl1972
Customer 4257.Content:
Been visiting here, off and on, since 2006. Always on my agenda when I am in Seattle. Love the food, love the service!!!!! They really know what customer service is all about.
Haven't been to your place in over 6 years (military move), but every time I have a chance to visit the area I try to stop in.

Customer 4258.Name: Jane
Customer 4258.Content: The turkey sadwich was not very good and I would not recommend it to anyone. The service was very good and I've had other meals that were far better than this.

Customer 4259.Name: Matchjl
Customer 4259.Content: This is usually a decent place for food and service . This is the second consecutive meal that was poorly cooked and even more poorly served. Steaks ordered medium rare were well done, water not refilled, etc.. Service was appalling...over 2 hours for four steaks. The wait staff were inattentive and abrupt. Will consider other choices on my next visit!

Customer 4260.Name: lovefood
Customer 4260.Content: As always, we are always satisfied with the food here. We alway take our out-of-town guest here to have one of the best steaks in the country. Service is always excellent!

Customer 4261.Name: lfrank5573
Customer 4261.Content: Everyone went out of their way to ensure that the dinning experience was outstanding. The food was great as always and the server went out his why to help out two year old granddaughter.

Customer 4262.Name: RobS
Customer 4262.Content: Had a great time and closed a deal as well! Thanks Met!

Customer 4263.Name: Mikevm
