Customer 4263.Content: Go to The Met frequently for business lunches. Always excellent food and excellent service.

Customer 4264.Name: jimr
Customer 4264.Content: Everything about the Metropolitan Grill was excellent. The waiters recommendations were spot on. The wine we ordered in the vintage year was not available so the better bottle from the same region was substituted at the same price as the original. When calling in to inform the restaurant we were having trouble with traffic, they gave us a quick alternative and suggested the Valet parking. From the beginning with the Valet to ending with dessert, just perfect.

Customer 4265.Name: Djd421
Customer 4265.Content: Food and service wonderful... My husband and I split a wedge salad, and an 18 oz. ribeye, and the mushrooms. I couldn't have eaten another bite. We had to go to a play afterwards, and so could not easily take a doggy box with us.

Customer 4266.Name: HappyDiner
Customer 4266.Content: The Met was a great place to experience. The food was fantastic and the service was good, for the price I expected a little more personalized attention. They brought me the wrong steak but made up for it by providing a small quick appetizer and a complimentary dessert. I may go back not because anything Met could have done differently but because I think there are other options in Seattle that would provide similar quality and a better overall experience.

Customer 4267.Name: Shooter
Customer 4267.Content: Always my choice for the finest quality food choice whatever the choice

Customer 4268.Name: Roberta
Customer 4268.Content:
It was our first time at the MG, but not the last! The food was delicious, the service was perfect, and the atmosphere very welcoming! You really have to be hungry because the meat dishes are really huge (and so delicious you would feel bad not to finish your plate).
There were so many tasty cocktails I had a hard time to make a choice, and decided to go with the "Fire and Ice" cocktail. Very unique, really feels like fire and ice in your mouth!
Very nice evening, will come again for sure!

Customer 4269.Name: SteveS
Customer 4269.Content:
This is a great spot to host a business meeting. The food and service are always fantastic!!!
Thanks,

Customer 4270.Name: DWells
Customer 4270.Content: My co-workers and I came here for my retirement dinner. We were taken to the Boardroom and it was great. Intimate and we were able to have a great time in a less crowded area of the restaurant. Our Maitre 'd and server were on top of everything, they were friendly and knowledgeable and made the evening enjoyable. The food was the usual-beyond fantastic. This is my favorite restaurant anywhere and I try to get here whenever I can. Thanks for your wonderful hospitality.

Customer 4271.Name: kiddpa
Customer 4271.Content: Food was bone cold when served, which is very poor in relation to the cost and service expected.

Customer 4272.Name: PhillyFoodie
Customer 4272.Content: Before we finished our salads three different people tried to take our salad plates away. It wasn't until after the 3rd attempt that I realized that they wanted to clear our salads because our entrees were being served. In a place like this and at the price we were paying I don't expect to be moved along as if we were in a diner. The server should be able to time things correctly or ask us about the pace we want. Not only were we rushed but no one other than us seemed to think it was an issue. There was no apology.

Customer 4273.Name: murvin
Customer 4273.Content:
I had the special NY Steak. It was the best NY steak I had so far. It had a strong flavour, fat and super juicy. Each bite there was unbelievable juice filled in my mouth. My bf had the special filet mignon. It was very soft, just like marshmallow, but with beef taste. 100% satisfy.
We all regretted that we were full because of the appetizer, besides the onion soup was excellent, we didn't have the room to take any dessert. But we saw other tables had the apple pie which smell good. :)

Customer 4274.Name: Nosher
Customer 4274.Content:
I enjoy the Metropolitan Grill mainly for the ambience but honestly, I have had better steaks, much better. It's also super expensive. For my taste I'd pick Ruth's Chris over the Met as far as the actual steaks are concerned
Just my opinion.

Customer 4275.Name: Beemer
Customer 4275.Content: The food is way astronomically expensive in relation to quality. To charge $56 for an 8 ounce Filet is unbelievable. I ordered it medium, it came rare, after a prolonged wait for it - had no interest sending back.

Customer 4276.Name: jerh
Customer 4276.Content:
We felt like we were not paid enough attention to because we had children with us. This was not our first visit there and we were
disappointed.The children were very well behaved.

Customer 4277.Name: Fritzsword
Customer 4277.Content: Best cuts of beef, great service, extensive wine list, table side final preparation of meal. Foodies will still be full the next day. Expensive but worth every penny.

Customer 4278.Name: snikfard
Customer 4278.Content: Everything was perfect about this place except for the lady at reception desk. My friend and I walked in around 6:45 asking for a table but she said there would be nothing available until 8. I then went on open table on my phone and made a reservation and 15 min later we were seated. Not only did she lie but she was rude about it. Took away from the whole experience of this amazing iconic Seattle restaurant. Other than that the food and service were both amazing! Wonderful meal to celebrate my promotion.

Customer 4279.Name: Darrel
Customer 4279.Content: In a party of three, one steak was overdone. Unfortunately my wife would not say anything. I'm sure they would have replaced it. the lobster bisque was fabulous. My blackened prime rib was excellent.

Customer 4280.Name: Waldo
Customer 4280.Content: The restuarant was bustling with lots people , some for business,celebrations, dates, etc. The energy level was high and the food was fantastic. I made our reservations using open table from Raleigh, NC and when our grouped showed up we were immediatly seated. I will recommend this local restuarant to those who visit Seattle.

Customer 4281.Name: Summer
Customer 4281.Content: I'm never disappointed when dining at the Metropolitan Grill. I bring out of town guests to the restaurant and they talk about it for years.

Customer 4282.Name: Barry
Customer 4282.Content: Have been there for years every time I visit it is a must go place.

Customer 4283.Name: Lismer
Customer 4283.Content: An old style steak house but very good at it, quality food and good service

Customer 4284.Name: TomN
Customer 4284.Content: The Metropolitan Grill isn't trendy, it's just the kind of great that only comes with years of experience - doing everything right. They miss no detail. Paying the check is easy when dinner is perfect!

Customer 4285.Name: boltguy
Customer 4285.Content: We had the most amazing chateaubriand combined with outstanding service and special attention. This was a very special dinner because my girlfriend and I were engaged the night before. The staff at the Met made it special for us and we will return and celebrate again when we get back to Seattle. Excellence all the way around.

Customer 4286.Name: DianeKK
Customer 4286.Content: The quality of the Met's food is so far above mentioning, words wouldn't not be able adequate! We have been to the other steak establishments in town and after our meal we always look at each other and say, we could have been at the Met!

Customer 4287.Name: Chrissy
Customer 4287.Content: We went to the Met for the first time to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and it turned out to be the perfect decision. We had the Chateaubriand for 2 and the food and service was fantastic. Would definitely go back again!

Customer 4288.Name: empisus
Customer 4288.Content: Lived up to its reputation, and very happy we went! Outstanding!

Customer 4289.Name: wanana
Customer 4289.Content: Clam chowder always delicious!! Tried the chicken this time, and was not disappointed---tender and tasty!!

Customer 4290.Name: DrOliver
Customer 4290.Content: Chateaubriand for two was THE BEST steak I have ever had

Customer 4291.Name: maxjakemom
Customer 4291.Content: Everything was nice - the service, the ambiance, the food. But just nice. Our steaks were under seasoned, and my filet was tough. They were cooked at the temperature we asked, and the potatoes were perfectly baked, but there was not one thing that made us think 'wow - this is amazing, I can't wait to come back'. In fact we probably won't be back. Not because they did anything wrong but simply because my 8oz filet was $56, and if it would have been spectacular it would have been worth it, but because it was just nice it wasn't. I can think of a dozen other restaurants where I can get a filet for $20 less than at The Met which is more tender and has better flavor. Really glad we got to try it but it won't be on our 'must do' list for Seattle.

Customer 4292.Name: Marcella
Customer 4292.Content: We live in Australia and always book a meal at The Metropolitan Grill before we leave home. We would not dream of missing the experience when we are in Seattle. I dream about the steaks in between the visits.

Customer 4293.Name: Macker
Customer 4293.Content: Best steak and wine in Seattle, as we celebrated our wedding anniversary in a very cozy comfortable booth!!

Customer 4294.Name: TravelingDVM
Customer 4294.Content: The crabcake appetizers were just so-so, but the steaks and potatoes were truly excellent. Great selection of whiskeys at the bar, great old school steakhouse decor and feel. Really fun meal!

Customer 4295.Name: boxer4me
Customer 4295.Content: The steaks that we ordered were amazing, the best we've ever had but 1 person in our party is a vegitarian and had the Portebello Minon and it was not good. The plate was a lake of tasteless juice and the portebellos were warm at best. The asparagus was very tough and there was so much cheese on the spinach she had to scrape it off to get down to the spinach.

Customer 4296.Name: Leftylemon
Customer 4296.Content: The Met is, and has been for years, the best spot for us in all of the State of Washington. It is old school, old style, elegant and classy.

Customer 4297.Name: wwww
Customer 4297.Content: We enjoy the Met; we will be back.

Customer 4298.Name: HungryINSeattle
Customer 4298.Content: Rack of lamb was dry and smelled. According to the waitress the chef didn't know the difference between glaze and soy sauce. Anyway, expensive but not special. Would not go back. Wait staff too casual for a place they try to be.

Customer 4299.Name: LittleQueen
Customer 4299.Content: My husband and I have been going to The Met together for 16 years. It is a consistent steak house with an excellent wine list. The meat is superb and the choice of accompaniments (sides and salads and appetizers) are very good. Because it was our 15th wedding anniversary, our dessert (creme brulee ~ YUM!) was comped by our wait person.

Customer 4300.Name: Coco
Customer 4300.Content:
Excited to take my Niece out for a birthday celebration expecting to have the best steak in town. If anything I'd call it the most moderate steak in town. Steak was salty and dry, calamari greasy and salty. It was a bit disappointing at a ticket price of $600 for our celebration, I was hoping for perfection.
Our dessert was fantastic, banana foster and the creme brûlée were the highlight of our evening. I think we might have been there on an off night, and will try them again.

Customer 4301.Name: nooo
Customer 4301.Content: good food, excellent service, pricey but worth it

Customer 4302.Name: Sarah
Customer 4302.Content: Patrick our waiter was great! Food was, as always, amazing!!

Customer 4303.Name: Jack
Customer 4303.Content: The Met has been round forever because you can count on a very good meal and great service

Customer 4304.Name: samantie
Customer 4304.Content: The restaurant was excellent. We enjoyed a quiet evening with another couple and found the environment intimate, quiet, and truly enjoyable. The food was exceptional. We will be back to Seattle and the Metropolitan.

Customer 4305.Name: JenniferD
Customer 4305.Content: Warm and welcome environment. Food was great. My Alaskan King Crab Legs were huge and incredible. A lot of food so bring your appetite.

Customer 4306.Name: RooseveltGrad
Customer 4306.Content:
The wait staff was outstanding. They truly wanted to make our experience a good one, and they were neither intrusive nor unavailable. These folks are very good and some of the best in Seattle.

I was terribly surprised this particular evening. The steaks we ordered had been poorly cooked. We had two filet mignon and a center cut rib eye. The exterior of the steaks were somewhat tough and dry. Perhaps 'scorched' would be the best description as to how they may have been cooked; almost like they attempted to hurry them along when cooking. The root vegetables I had with the steak were soft and the flavor unremarkable. Frankly, I was rather stunned as that evening's food seemed completely out of character for this restaurant.

Customer 4307.Name: SweetPea
Customer 4307.Content: Went there for their wine list and was not disappointed. Order 1 steak for 3 people and you still have leftovers!

Customer 4308.Name: RBell
Customer 4308.Content: Went for 37th anniversary and it was great, as I expected. The food was plentiful and cooked perfectly. It's a little pricey, but you get what you pay for.

Customer 4309.Name: Slinky
Customer 4309.Content: When you spend upwards of $100.00 per person for dinner, you do not expect the waitress to ask for your order 3 times in a 2 minute time period when it is clear you are still looking at the menu, you do not expect your main course to come when you are 1/2 way through your salad, you do expect your glass of wine to arrive with your main course and not 10 minutes later only after reminding the waitress twice, and you expect your dessert to come before closing time. When you spend upwards of $100.00 you expect a lovely dining experience. This restaurant is a great big steak overpriced steakhouse and not a fine dining establishiment. The steaks are fine but way overpriced.

Customer 4310.Name: Disappointed
Customer 4310.Content: On our trip back from Victoria, Canada, we had one night to spend in Seattle before going home to Southern California. Where should we eat? Having eaten at Metropolitan Grill seven years ago, it took us two seconds to decide to eat there again. Our memory served us well, and we were not disappointed. Fabulous waiter (Scott). Spot on, memorable food, from the appetizer to the entree. Next time we're in Seattle, we'll look forward to going there again.

Customer 4311.Name: KennethC
Customer 4311.Content: Service is always good, but this timne it exceeded expectations. Waiter Roger and assistant Kevin were friendly(genuinely, not put on), and right on top of things. I will ask for Roger next visit.

Customer 4312.Name: OwenK
Customer 4312.Content: The Metropolitan Grill always impresses with it's excellent food and service. They know exactly what they're doing with their food, and they're steaks are second to none.

Customer 4313.Name: Lorimccar
Customer 4313.Content: We've eaten at some of the top steak restaurants in the country and this is one of our favorites. Everything was excellent! You can't go wrong here. Menu was very well balanced between Omhi & angus beef as well as fish, pork & lamb dishes. Sides were very well prepared too. Wait staff was very knowledgeable & attentive without being intrusive.

Customer 4314.Name: Washington
Customer 4314.Content:
I went here for my guests who wanted the best steak in town. I was going to have fish. Waiter takes me into the finest steak they had. Very displeased. It was gritty and dry and charred even though I specifically asked for none to minimal char on a Medium cooked filet. My guests didn't think it was great either.
What was great- Mushrooms and the Lobster Bisque were excellent. Polite service was excellent. But not spending that much money on steak that was not even OK.

Customer 4315.Name: Stickman
Customer 4315.Content: The steak sandwich was terrific! Great Service!

Customer 4316.Name: woosie
Customer 4316.Content: Meat Was great. You worth to visit once.

Customer 4317.Name: AndaT
Customer 4317.Content: We enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere at MG. The only disappointment was the manner in which some diners were dressed! Sloppy! Faded t-shirts, jeans and sneakers--really? Shorts? We know Seattle is a casual city, but please people-- learn to dress up a bit! The show "What Not to Wear" should come to Seattle!

Customer 4318.Name: Terry
Customer 4318.Content: Great service from experienced and mature servers making recommendations rather than order taker being functionaries. Quality food prepared to our taste with the chef's artistry. Sublime-we'll come back!

Customer 4319.Name: Yabaduu
Customer 4319.Content: You will not find a Steak House like these antwhere. The ambience, the incredibly good service, and the great quality of the food all merge to provide you an unparallel experience in dinning.

Customer 4320.Name: ChristmasEve
Customer 4320.Content: I haven't traveled to Seattle for years. Previously I always made time to dine at one of the very best steakhouses on the west coast.. So I went there on a recent trip after 6 years and It was just as I remembered. I guess you can, after all, go home. Nice job!

Customer 4321.Name: DutchDuck
Customer 4321.Content: Had my meal at the bar, since traveling alone, served by a very nice and capable bartender. Very attentive. The prime rib was reasonable.

Customer 4322.Name: JonM
Customer 4322.Content: Food was beyond perfect. Service was great. Little pricey but worth it. Hint - our server recommended trying the USDA beef instead of the Kobe beef and we weren't disappointed.

Customer 4323.Name: Italian
Customer 4323.Content: Steak was excellent, servings were large, I felt prices were pricey.

Customer 4324.Name: Peter
Customer 4324.Content: Metropolitan Grill's steaks were among the most tender I've had, but I was less impressed with the flavor compared to other steakhouses in the city (tried their Prime Ribeye and Prime Top Sirloin). Other food was tasty as well, no issues there. Impressive wine list!

Customer 4325.Name: Nagranni
Customer 4325.Content: We were a group of 10 people. Although it was a Monday night the place was three quarters full. Very welcoming and professional service, Steaks were exceptional and the recommendations from the sommelier appropriate and knowledgable. From our experience it is clear the Metropolitan Grill really strives for perfection on all fronts. ONE OF THE BEST STEAKHOUSES I´VE EVER BEEN IN.

Customer 4326.Name: Notafive
Customer 4326.Content: Well, our 3 year anniversary and we were very excited to be at the best steak house in town, from out of town. And here we go.. The steaks we ordered were reverse cooked. Also, she received my cut of steak and I received hers. Two completely differently cuts, and the waiter could not explain what cut was what, very odd. We waited quite a while for drinks and the attention we received from dinner was far from the price we paid. As a guess, I think he was embarrassed and stayed away from us once he made some very bad errors. Not a great experience of food, service and the price we paid, from what we were expecting.... Not one to complain BUT, you asked.

Customer 4327.Name: Davek
Customer 4327.Content: This was our first visit. Our steaks were incredible! The service was 'OK', but our bill was $200+ for two people (an appetizer, two steaks and a few drinks). Our waiter seemed distracted, our food took a long time to arrive (our visit was 2 hours) and for this price range I expect a little more of a personal service. BUT - did I say that the steaks were incredible?! Some of the best we have ever eaten!

Customer 4328.Name: SeattleDiner
Customer 4328.Content: Have always had the best service, food and atmosphere.

Customer 4329.Name: Michael
Customer 4329.Content: Great food and great service. Expensive.

Customer 4330.Name: eatinseattle
Customer 4330.Content: we spent more than $350 on dinner here and service was slow and inattentive. food was ok, but for the price of the meal i expected more. bread tasted like it was day-old. water glasses were empty for most of the 3 hours we spent in the restaurant. when i asked for a new glass, because there was something in mine, they took it away and I was left thirsty for the rest of the dinning experience. dessert and cocktails were good, i will give them that. we do not plan to return.

Customer 4331.Name: HoHumm
Customer 4331.Content: I've been to the Metropolitan Grill before, a few times in the last 7 yrs. Always claimed that it was in the top 10 best steak meals around, with great service. This time, my 12 oz New York with house cut fries was just ok. Something I'm capable of on my BBQ. It just wasn't that special...the plating, the service, the food. The bread was dry & stale. Service was very capable, but not overly great. I hate to think that the Met has turned into just avg food. If it did, then they must lower the prices alot. I thought I had a fav steak house in the Met, but I'll have to try other joints now. Casual vibe is what brought me there in the first place. Other steak houses seem a bit more formal. Choc cake just OK too, burnt cream good.

Customer 4332.Name: Will
Customer 4332.Content: We have dined at Metropolitan Grill on and off for 25 years. It used to be one of our favorite restaurants in town, but lately the food has really gone downhill. Desserts which sound like they should be great (hot apple pie) are practically inedible. Steaks are served with hash browns (creatively called "potato cakes"). Mac and cheese is the worst in town. It's a shame. We want to like it, but it doesn't deserve to be liked recently.

Customer 4333.Name: KC7407
Customer 4333.Content: I wanted to take my friends from Australia out to dinner to someplace they wouldn't forget. The Metropolitan Grill was absolutely perfect. The meal was delicious, the server was right on point and it felt really cozy and comfortable. Would definitely recommend this place to all my friends. The filet mignon melted in our mouths, along with everything else we had to eat. Two thumbs up, and thank you for making their experience to the Pacific Northwest one to remember.

Customer 4334.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4334.Content: The food and service is consistently outstanding

Customer 4335.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4335.Content: The steaks melt in your mouth. The gigantic baked potatoes are delicious. The carrot cake, rated the best he's ever had by one of our party, was out distanced by the white chocolate coconut cake. The servings were so large, half of each piece was taken home. Our waiter, Michael, made us feel special. We'll be back soon.

Customer 4336.Name: foodee
Customer 4336.Content: Ordered crab cakes, filet, wild salmon and roasted wild mushrooms grilled on a plank. Crab cakes were supposed to be dungeness and king crab, yet no lump meat and a fragment of king that we could barely find. I'm impressed when a restaurant does what I can't do myself - but my own crab cakes blow these away. The salmon I grilled in the backyard was better and the check lightened my wallet by two weeks groceries. The wine list is 3 digits with many 4 digit prices... many of these are at Costco for under $100. With all of the options for dining in Seattle, I can't see why anyone would spend this kind of money for such mediocrity. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone but a business entertainer with an expense account trying to close a sale.

Customer 4337.Name: JRinHawaii
Customer 4337.Content:
Even though we made reservations months ahead of time we saw others just walking in after us seated ahead of us, dressed much less than "business casual". We waited over 15 minutes to be seated. That was the low point of the evening.

The meal and table service were excellent! The meal would have been 4 stars if not for the poor start keeping us waiting. They could've at least offered us space at the bar where we would've gone if they didn't say we'll seat you in a couple of minutes. That was most disappointing. We thought we were going to dine at a 5-star establishment. Turned out to be more like 2-3 stars.

Customer 4338.Name: SuzeQ2
Customer 4338.Content: I brought friends from out of town here for lunch; they are from the Southwest and they were very impressed with the service, food quality, and the restaurant itself. Our server was excellent

Customer 4339.Name: EliM
Customer 4339.Content: Although we had very positive previous experiences with Metropolitan Grill many years ago, I did not feel that the steak quality was as good as it used to be. A filet no matter the cut should be very tender and mine was not. I have had better quality filets at Morton's and such and I always had considered MG to be better but no so anymore.

Customer 4340.Name: PaulB
Customer 4340.Content: The prime rib was cooked perfectly. I can't wait to go back and have it again!

Customer 4341.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4341.Content: The Met is my "go to" spot for lunch in downtown Seattle. They are fast and the food is always good. The wait staff has been there for years, which I always think is the mark of a good place. They know their clientele by sight and often by name. I always feel well cared for at the Met!

Customer 4342.Name: fantastico
Customer 4342.Content: Very attentive, food & service was outstanding...total of 5 servers who didn't miss a beat...Seattle at it's best! Bring the special one here.

Customer 4343.Name: KathyP
Customer 4343.Content: If you want the best service in town, coupled by outstanding food, this is the place. It is pricey, but worth it for special occasions.

Customer 4344.Name: Husky11
Customer 4344.Content: We had an amazing time at The Met! Everything from our waiter to the food to the ambience. The interior of the restaurant is very well decorated and designed and you feel like they really cater to you.

Customer 4345.Name: DWells
Customer 4345.Content:
My wife and I went to the MET for our 35th wedding anniversary. We were treated like royalty. The Executive Chef Eric Hellner came to our table and introduced himself so we felt completely honored to meet the man making all that great food happen.

Everything was perfection. Our server was Joan and she made us feel like family. Everyone was friendly and made it a very special dinner.

Please accept our deepest thanks for an over the top superb experience.

Customer 4346.Name: BHop
Customer 4346.Content: We went to the Met for triple birthday surprise. The food was great as usual!!

Customer 4347.Name: AlexB
Customer 4347.Content: When I made my reservation on OpenTable, I stated that we were celebrating my husband's birthday. I guess no one read it because as we were seated, we were asked if we celebrating a special occasion. We ordered the prime rib, asked for it to be cooked medium - it arrived blue. Side dishes were completely uninspired and poorly prepared - potatoes au gratin were luke warm and the brussel sprouts were undercooked. When we complained, they comped us dessert. We would've much rather been comped the sides. Upon leaving, we noticed a chalk board with the night's specials - we hadn't seen it from where we were sitting and our server never bothered mentioning them to us. WIll never go again!

Customer 4348.Name: Butter
Customer 4348.Content: Very impressed, went to another well known steak house in the city while visiting and the Metropolitan had better food and service. Highly recommend.

Customer 4349.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4349.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our evening. Everything was superb. Don't fool yourself though its going to cost you a pretty penny but well worth it.

Customer 4350.Name: AMG4RPM
Customer 4350.Content: The best place in Seattle for red-meat dining. Service is impecable, outstanding wine list (and a knowledgeable sommelier), and steaks cooked to perfection. Red meat in Seattle just does not get any better than this.

Customer 4351.Name: Gajoung
Customer 4351.Content: It's not somewhere i would go every week or even month, rather it's a place you go once a year to treat yourself for a job well done. It is very overpriced, but the food is that exceptional. I loved it.

Customer 4352.Name: JenniferB
Customer 4352.Content: Loved, loved, loved. Fantastic on all fronts-service, food, ambiance. Not a single complaint from visitors from Cleveland!

Customer 4353.Name: panchofv
Customer 4353.Content: Filet was, without a doubt, the finest cut of beef my wife and I have ever enjoyed. Entire dining experience was exceptional.

Customer 4354.Name: Carnivore
Customer 4354.Content:
If you are into great food and an eating experience you must try this restaurant its well worth the price.

Its got an old Chicago feel with a flare of nostalgia you will love it.

Bon Appetit

Customer 4355.Name: PhileasFogg
Customer 4355.Content: The Metro Grill is one of the best steak houses on the planet; it rivals Peter Lugers in the Bronx. This restaurant is iconic and classy. Best steak in Seattle, best in Washington State and possibly the best steak on the West Coast of the United States. You can count on the Metro Grill for top notch service and a great meal. If you are looking for a budget meal, this is not it.

Customer 4356.Name: Mike
Customer 4356.Content: Had the prime fillet and the wagyu fillet as a side by side comparison. Both were great steaks, but the wagyu was easily worth the small amount extra. Probably one of the best steak I've ever eaten. Wild recommend this to anyone.

Customer 4357.Name: Auge28
Customer 4357.Content: We have had 11 wedding anniversaries, the last three anniversary dinners have been at the steak house. Yes, it is that good.

Customer 4358.Name: Tyler
Customer 4358.Content: I had never been to the Met and my first experience met every expectation I had (and exceeded them). Best meal I've had, period.

Customer 4359.Name: Rimstar
Customer 4359.Content: My husband and I were visiting from San Francisco. This restaurant was highly recommended by friends who live in Seattle for the steaks. It didn't disappoint. The steaks were amazing! I had a fantastic cocktail to start the night. The french onion and lobster bisque soups were delicious. The waiter was funny, not intrusive, and knowledgeable. We will definitely go back the next time we are in Seattle.

Customer 4360.Name: Laura
Customer 4360.Content:
the wine list is overseen by an AMAZINGLY talented man. The choices are broad and delish!
The service as well as the food were beyond expectations. This will be my first stop every time I go to Seattle!

Customer 4361.Name: RufHa
Customer 4361.Content: Metropolitan Grill is one of my very favorites, especially when out of town guests are visiting.

Customer 4362.Name: Leem
Customer 4362.Content: Was very expensive so you would only want to go for a special occasion.

Customer 4363.Name: Misty
Customer 4363.Content: We typically go to el gaucho for Our anniversary dinner decided to try something new for 25th so went to the met. The restaurant was nice but the service was below what I would expect for that type of restaurant and the food was not nearly as good as el gaucho

Customer 4364.Name: NScottsdale
Customer 4364.Content: I hadn't been to the Met in years since last visiting Seattle but it was a great as I remember the last time I was there!

Customer 4365.Name: LisaLou
Customer 4365.Content: We just took our 2 teenage daughters to the Met for dinner. It never fails us for a special occasion! The atmosphere is lovely, the waitstaff is elegant and fun, and the food is out of this world! Portions are huge, so we always split an entrée, and they will give you each the sides that come with it gladly. You have to try this for an anniversary or just a great night out. It's spendy but it's worth it!

Customer 4366.Name: ToddE
Customer 4366.Content: The service and food was amazing. We have been many times and will return. Lobster, new York strip and filet were some of our orders and they were all outstanding in flavor and proportions. The mac and cheese is a great side. no complaints as usual.

Customer 4367.Name: Ekoorb907
Customer 4367.Content: Delicious with impeccable service. Truly a steakhouse of yesteryear, yet completely relevant and not kitschy. *swoon*

Customer 4368.Name: Great
Customer 4368.Content: The food was awesome. Our Waiter Bruno was topnotch all the way and provided excellent service. We can't wait to go back.

Customer 4369.Name: Jepa2
Customer 4369.Content: The food was excellence! The servers were very attentive. We just wish we lived near by so we could have taken leftovers with us. Portions were generous!

Customer 4370.Name: Sdeediner
Customer 4370.Content: I have been to the Metropolitan Grill on several occasions and they have never failed to impress. This time I brought some friends from Alaska who were looking for a fine steak dinner and they certainly got that and more. They were very impressed by the service, the ambiance and the food. A five star dining experience!

Customer 4371.Name: arikohn
Customer 4371.Content: Plain and simple, The Metropolitan Grill is excellent.

Customer 4372.Name: Baseballfans
Customer 4372.Content: Made reservations on a whim. Turned out to be a great decision. Kobe beef was unbelievable with perfect sear. My teens steaks were actually just as good in their own right even though not Kobe. Atmosphere very old world traditional steakhouse but staff very current! Hot apple pie made at table was a hit as was the waiter who performed. And the fact that a Major League Baseball team was dining next to us did not go unnoticed. Wonderful night.

Customer 4373.Name: LisaL
Customer 4373.Content:
This has to be the top steak house in Seattle. New York style service, prime meats, great table service and knowleable staff.
Chefs know what they are doing, nothing was sent back.

Customer 4374.Name: RenaV
Customer 4374.Content: Great food and lots of choices!!! You always can gauge a resaturant by their bread and appetizers. Artichokes were fabulous!!!

Customer 4375.Name: Juggernaut
Customer 4375.Content: Stepping into The Met is like stepping back in time. The place is beautiful, the bartenders and wait staff are elegantly dressed, the service and food are both outstanding. My husband and I go there when we want to enjoy a special evening out. We never feel rushed and dinner there is worth every penny. And as bad as it sounds, it is always a pleasure to dine without children running around and /or crying. We love this place!

Customer 4376.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4376.Content: Our steak orders were done to perfection - couldn't have asked for anything more. Server was attentive despite the heavy demands on him (too many people were getting ready to go to a concert).

Customer 4377.Name: Eddel
Customer 4377.Content: Though this is a nice restaurant, wheelchair accessibility could be improved... ramps are appreciated but ramps must also be functional and practical... in regards of service, ambiance and food preparation there are no complaints....

Customer 4378.Name: greatdin
Customer 4378.Content: Dinner was great! Banana Foster amazing! and our server! MARLA was the best! friendly and helpful!

Customer 4379.Name: Vici
Customer 4379.Content: Most everything was delicious. There was only one disappointing bit - The Met is famous for its mashed potatoes and ours were too salty. My friend and I agreed. We pointed it out to our waiter who let us know that even if he were to replace them, all the potatoes were in a large batch, so the replacements would be too salty for our liking as well. We appreciated the honesty. However, he didn't offer a replacement with any other side or offer to give us a small break on one of our other dishes. We ordered a side of asparagus with béarnaise (delicious!), glasses of wine and coffee and dessert (also delicious!). Plenty of chances to make the one off thing right. We didn't ask and so we didn't get. Not what I'm used to at The Met.

Customer 4380.Name: BizTraveler214
Customer 4380.Content: I eat out for business in upwards of 100 times a year. The Metropolitan Grill was recommended by a colleague of mine and it did not disappoint. Our server Angela made us feel very welcome and she gave great recommendations. Between the three of us we had the bone in Delmonico and bone in ribeye. Both steaks were incredible. The drinks and sides also exceeded our expecttions. The Met will be my first stop during my next visit to Seattle.

Customer 4381.Name: sunshine
Customer 4381.Content: The food was outstanding as usual. Great service too!

Customer 4382.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4382.Content: Steaks melt in your mouth. Carrot cake it outstanding. Excellent service. Made to feel special.

Customer 4383.Name: wannabe
Customer 4383.Content: Food was good; salmon for non-meat eaters was done very well. Good wine list and great accommodating staff.

Customer 4384.Name: Brian
Customer 4384.Content: Every time I am in Seattle I make time for the metropolitan it never disappoints!

Customer 4385.Name: Taiporoad
Customer 4385.Content: Good food, nice atmosphere, great services!

Customer 4386.Name: CindyB
Customer 4386.Content: We had a great time. The food was delicious. The wait staff was excellent. The room was beautiful. We had a table for 6 reserved and had 1 more person that wanted to attend, I called the met and the hostess was very accommodating and made it happen. Everyone enjoyed themselves. Thanks for making our anniversary night fabulous..

Customer 4387.Name: Jake
Customer 4387.Content: For what it was the food was overpriced by about 50%. On top of that the waiter neglected to tell us about any of the specials and seemed either rushed or ignorant of the wines.

Customer 4388.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4388.Content:
Great place for diner or anytime, food is exellent,service out standing.
Celabated my son getting a job as a firefighter.

Customer 4389.Name: bruce
Customer 4389.Content: the food is great the lava cake the best ever

Customer 4390.Name: Farooq
Customer 4390.Content: I was in Seattle for a weekend and this Resturant was recommended and was suppose to be a top 5 steakhouse in America. I was not that impressed by the food. I ordered the Cajan Rub Prime Rib, bad idea! The brown sugar rub does not work at all. The beer selection is good, the appies and sides are also good, but when you get beef wrong at a steakhouse it doesn't sit well with a foodie. Prices are high for the quality of food. The Keg a regular steak resturant franchise in Canada is much better in terms of quality.

Customer 4391.Name: Urnbr6
Customer 4391.Content: The food just was not that good. Everything was very salty. The mashed potatoes seemed to have been siting around for awhile. I would skip this place.

Customer 4392.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4392.Content: If you are thinking of a steak in Seattle, the Met is always a top choice. Tonight was our 16th anniversary so we decided to go somewhere nice in Seattle. I had only been to the metropolitan grill 1 other time years ago. It is exactly how I remembered it and exactly what I expected. Great food, great service, just not my favorite for ambiance. We split a blue cheese wedge salad to start and the onion rings. We had the salad cut for us in the kitchen. The hazelnuts on the salad are a nice touch. The onion rings were really good, thick cut with a fresh chutney catsup. For the entree we shared the rib eye with a huge baked potato. The rib eye was perfect!! We also ordered the poblano chile scalloped potatoes, also delicious.

Customer 4393.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4393.Content: Wonderful time celebrating brother's birthday. The prime rib was exceptional. Truly a fun time with excellent sevice as well.

Customer 4394.Name: LouChez
Customer 4394.Content: It was a pleasure arriving to three smiling faces- it's nice to arrive and having your table ready for you, so make reservations. As for the food the way to order hands down is the Wagyu steaks. My favorite and not on the menu is the French onion rib eye. "A little piece of Heaven"

Customer 4395.Name: tmwp
Customer 4395.Content: The dinner was fantastic. I had the onion soup and it was the best I have had in my life! I had the portabella mushroom meal and could not finish it all. My friend had a wonderful steak, cooked to perfection and then we shared the chocolate cake. Beware the cake is great, but definitely to share with 2+ people.

Customer 4396.Name: FoodLuvr
Customer 4396.Content: When the price of the meat ranges from forty dollars to well over a hundred dollars (a la carte) you expect to be wowed by the food and the service. Neither happened for me. The food was good but not spectacular. The service was so so as the lady attending to us made a number of mistakes (brought drinks requested without ice on the rocks, had to be asked two to three times for refills, etc.). We also had mishaps like plastic pieces in a dessert and the waitress spilling a drink on our laps. On the plus side, I give a big thumbs up to their sommelier who made an excellent recommendation of wine for the given price point. My friends in Seattle always have very positive things to say about this place so it likely is an isolated incident.

Customer 4397.Name: GungaDin
Customer 4397.Content: The best steak I have ever eaten! Superb service!

Customer 4398.Name: Trent
Customer 4398.Content: This is a my favorite place to eat in Seattle, without exception. The steak was cooked to perfection, the service was great, we brought out son to 'celebrate heading to middle school' and they really made him feel special. Overall, just a perfect evening. Couldn't have been happier with everything.

Customer 4399.Name: MCJC
Customer 4399.Content: The service was excellent, friendly, helpful. We had the filet mignon and prime rib. Both dishes were excellent, tender, melt in your mouth, and tasty. The mash potatoes were plentiful and delicious. We also has a side of asparagus w/ béarnaise sauce, very good. The asparagus was cooked just right, tender and fresh.

Customer 4400.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4400.Content: I was visiting Seattle from Texas, decided to check out The Met. So glad I did! The service was quick and professional, the food amazing, especially the Wagyu beef. I can't wait to come back and eat at The Met again!

Customer 4401.Name: KJSeattle
Customer 4401.Content: I eat at The Met regularly for business lunch meetings. The service has really slipped -- last 5 visits I have noticed that the meaningful decline in service (waiting for drink refills, bread, delivering the check, touching base after food is delivered, missing parts of orders). It's a shame because the food is great. What's happening to the service?

Customer 4402.Name: Dlish
Customer 4402.Content: Fantastic atmosphere, the food and staff are awesome! Come dressed up or come in jeans, you'll never feel out of place. Best Steak House in WA and the team there is very accomodating. I can't wait to go back!!! :)

Customer 4403.Name: Mathew
Customer 4403.Content:
We celebrated here after I proposed to my girlfriend, and had a great night. Upon hearing about our engagement they graciously provided us with complimentary champagne. Very nice touch! We already were big fans of the food, and per usual, the food met expectations and was quite delicious. I had flowers delivered to the table as surprise, which were waiting for us upon arrival.

When we got dessert, the also gave complimentary as engagement gift. Very cool, and made evening special for us both. This place is top notch, and I have high standards in customer service. The Met delivers!

Customer 4404.Name: dj2911
Customer 4404.Content: Celebrated our 25th anniversary. Perfect spot. Loved the food and attention from all staff. Pricey, but worth every penny.

Customer 4405.Name: Alfcgy
Customer 4405.Content: Make sure you take your reservation confirmation number with you as they don't always have it. Can be embarrassing especially if you are with clients.

Customer 4406.Name: hansenp
Customer 4406.Content: My husband and I were celebrating his birthday & I noted it on our reservation. Unfortuantely we still have a table right next to the hostess. The service was slow and the portions were very big. For the price I would have much rather had a more attentive wait staff, smaller portions and fabulous flavor. The best steak house in the area is still John Howie Steak.

Customer 4407.Name: wyatt
Customer 4407.Content: It was my son's 16th birthday. The service staff made him feel very special. The food was wonderful! My only negative thing was that the music was a little bit too loud. It was hard to carry on a conversation with a table of four. We will definitely be back!

Customer 4408.Name: Mindy26
Customer 4408.Content: I took my fiancée to the Met for his birthday, as we both have never been and he loves a good steak. I have a lot of food allergies and it isn't always so easy going out to eat, since a lot of servers don't take the time to know all of the ingredients (being a server myself, I know what can be done). This experience was definitely one to remember. Our server was very friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating to all of my food sensitivities. It made us both feel at ease, we had delicious meals and a wonderful experience. Definitely will keep it on my list for other special occasions.

Customer 4409.Name: Tianyu
Customer 4409.Content: I went to this met grill because of yelp. The service is really comfortable and pleasant. However it is really noisy. So I only gave 3 stars. But the food is good though.

Customer 4410.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4410.Content:
We have dined at the Metropolitan Grill over the years and have never been disappointed; however, this was not the case on Father's Day.

Dad's steak was superb, but our daughter's special, Wild Alaskan King Salmon filet, was definitely undercooked. Our waiter called it to the attention of the manager, who graciously returned it to the kitchen for further inspection. He returned soon, agreeing that the filet was undercooked and he offered to replace the entire meal, which he did. The problem was that by the time our daughter received it, we were finished with our meals. It was a special occasion that turned out to be not so special.
We felt her meal should have been complimentary given the situation.

Customer 4411.Name: Birthday
Customer 4411.Content: This is the first time we had tried this restaurant. We were celebrating a graduation from graduate school as well as Father's day. We had previously frequented Morton's in Seattle as well as Ruth Chris in multiple locations. I would say the Metropolitan measures up well in all aspects. The choices for beef were excellent. There were several organic and local grass fed beef. The beef was excellent albeit a bit pricey. Service was slow at times, but this is very understandable given it was Father's day and that 2 major universities in the City were having graduation. We will definitely come back again.

Customer 4412.Name: Fugella
Customer 4412.Content: I was disappointed with the strawberry shortcake; should have asked if it came with ice cream before I ordered it - very few strawberries too! Everything else was great though!

Customer 4413.Name: iheckofacook4sure
Customer 4413.Content:
Atmosphere is the way a steakhouse should be. A place for a special occasion. Having more than one maitre'd made over and beyond classy and service rendered.
The menu was extensive in the food, and wine list. The food was the way it should be...delicious. Chateau Briand carved table side and desserts flambe prepared table side was over the top.
Highly recommend this restaurant!!!!

Customer 4414.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4414.Content: The food was amazing. Best steak I have ever had. And the desert... Mmmmmm. However, the prices are extreme. No steak is worth their prices.

Customer 4415.Name: greygovernor
Customer 4415.Content: The Met has absolutely fantastic service and the best steak this side of the rockies (and I'm a cattle rancher so I would know)

Customer 4416.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4416.Content:
The food is always stellar at The Met.
Unfortunately patrons have seemed to disregard any form of proper dress for such an establishment. Suit and tie should be the norm, and it no longer is. There were customers in t-shirts cargo shorts and sneakers. Women in jeans and a shirt. The restaurant deserves diners that will dress the part; that is part of the allure of going to The Metropolitan. Otherwise, the lofty prices and tuxedo wait-service seem a bit on the pretentious side. I hope Seattle-ites and other guests will find their way to a button down and some slacks (and cocktail dresses for the ladies) before they next go to The Met.
The food, the service, and drinks are all superb at The Met. Good on ya'

Customer 4417.Name: Andrew
Customer 4417.Content: Went for lunch June 13 only to be told I couldn't have a soda because the machine was not working. Seriously? Why wouldn't someone on staff run around the corner to the nearest Bartell's and buy 4 cases of pop as a backup. My meal was not enjoyed because I couldn't have my choice of beverage.

Customer 4418.Name: jdilks23
Customer 4418.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is a wonderful place,great atmosphere, wonderful people and the food is impeccable if you are in the Seattle location you must try even if not for steaks then try their Seafood dishes. The waiter is very knowledgeable in everything they serve and how it's prepared, they are very friendly and personable. I highly suggest this restaurant to any one.:((

Customer 4419.Name: luvtoeat
Customer 4419.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was great as usual. We have gone there for many years and never have had bad food or poor service. This is our favorite restaurant.

Customer 4420.Name: orwein
Customer 4420.Content: A dress code for customers would improve the atmosphere. Food was good, very plentiful, but lacked a gourmet's touch. Desserts were the hit. Very noisy with kids and T-shirted men celebrating. I was expecting an elegant old steakhouse.

Customer 4421.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4421.Content: Pricing itself out of market for me.

Customer 4422.Name: April
Customer 4422.Content: Great date night or special occasion. Fabulous food. Best service around

Customer 4423.Name: smbmax
Customer 4423.Content: We enjoyed our dinner here. The food was wonderful and as always our server was attentive and very knowledgeable.

Customer 4424.Name: Noshie
Customer 4424.Content: The Met has such fantastic, consistent service and the best steak in town. A great place for lunch, a delicious cocktail in the bar or a special dinner!

Customer 4425.Name: Matt
Customer 4425.Content: There's a lot of competition in the Emerald City for high-end steak, but the Met is the most consistent of the main contenders. I've never had a less than great meal at the Met; whereas I cannot say that of John Howie, El Gaucho or Daniel's Broiler. Plus I find the service to be pleasantly old-school.

Customer 4426.Name: Vici
Customer 4426.Content: As always, the service was impeccable, the food GREAT! One of our favorite restaurants.

Customer 4427.Name: Kirk
Customer 4427.Content: The steaks are the best in the Pacific Northwest! The service is first class all the way!

Customer 4428.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4428.Content: I would highly recommend the Met to anyone looking to get out and have a cocktail. Or for a special romantic occasion. Service and food was spectacular!

Customer 4429.Name: AndrewC
Customer 4429.Content:
Food was awesome, waiter was great!

Super disappointed that our reservations were pushed out almost 40 minutes. Your hostess was "matter of fact" about it, no apologies and not very helpful or accommodating. Told to go to the bar and someone will come get you. Later in the evening, as we were finishing up, your maitre'd, kept giving me looks like it was time to go and we were still eating, because we were seated 40 minutes late! Love everything about your restaurant and were there 2 nights that week but the front house was not providing the level of service expected.

Customer 4430.Name: BobBrenda
Customer 4430.Content: Had a great business lunch meeting. The Thursday lunch special, beef stroganoff, was exceptional! The service was attentive and fast.

Customer 4431.Name: DJMC
Customer 4431.Content: Food was great and service was outstanding. Roger kept us well served and entertained all evening.

Customer 4432.Name: Sandy
Customer 4432.Content: The Met is one of those places where you go for a special occassion, when you want to know you are going to have a special meal. The service seemed a bit off tonight (seated more than 15min past reservation time, wait staff not as attentive as normal), but the food was exceptional, as always.

Customer 4433.Name: sitkagirl
Customer 4433.Content: Confusion on drink menu on Manhattan choices. Shared rib-eye carved at table, cooked to perfection, extremely tender; confusion on 2 sauces (cheese and one for the steak - couldn't tell which was cheese for potato/ which was for steak.) Gigantic hot baked potato, spinach was weird; i may be wrong, but thought it was to be 'creamed'; was tasty but baked dry with cheddar topping (?) - at any rate, not creamed. Fresh baked tomato -large/excellent flavor. Shared Caesar, fresh/ good. Wonderful fresh oysters! Tons of food, took home for 2 more meals. My B'DAY; comp (THANK YOU) Creme Brule, absolutly exquisite/plenty to share! Even the coffee was wonderful. BEST/Most Fun server anywhere! SO, I could go on and on, but you wouldn't want me to (;

Customer 4434.Name: CarrieK12
Customer 4434.Content: The food at the Met Grill is fabulous. I have dined here twice now and have been blown away by the quality of the food on both occasions. However, if you are looking for a balanced meal, this is not going to happen. You get either a starch or a veggie with your meal and whichever you choose is a double (or triple) portion size. I wish they served their amazing cuts of meat with appropriately portioned sides. They offer the option of "family sized sides" but if it's just 1-2 people, then you don't need all of that extra food either.

Customer 4435.Name: sunshine
Customer 4435.Content: Love the food at the Met. Everything from steaks to crab cakes-we love.

Customer 4436.Name: willtravelforfood56
Customer 4436.Content: So many steakhouses in Seattle. This is just another ho-hum steak place. They say they're better than the "chain" steakhouses but I'm not sure they are. Cosidering I paid $65 for my steak I didn't expect to have gristle. Brussel sprouts were way too crunchy and had a greasy taste. Bananas Foster is to die for.

Customer 4437.Name: DeniseW
Customer 4437.Content: The steaks are consistently tasty and made to order. Their desserts are wonderful as well. I have some dietary restrictions, which the staff was very accommodative to.

Customer 4438.Name: KandB
Customer 4438.Content: The food was great but our waiter was just ok. Lovely cocktails in the bar before dinner and the barman was awesome.

Customer 4439.Name: Jennifer
Customer 4439.Content: The steaks are huge. The potatoes are huge. The Cherries Jubilee is huge. Everything was tasty but not really amazing. Very friendly staff, and our booth seating had a curtain we could pull for extra privacy which was fun.

Customer 4440.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4440.Content: Went in with a large group last month. Service was great, food was superb and upbeat vibe. This place surprised me as it didn't looks pretty subtle from the exterior but once we stepped in, it was bustling with high energy. The filet mignon was cooked to perfection, very tasty and flavorful. Even better that that other steak restaurant in Bravern Bellevue :) Even the side mushrooms taster delicious. As a matter of fact, everything was very tasty and delicious. Would come back again and definitely will recommend to friends.

Customer 4441.Name: Bulaman
Customer 4441.Content: The food and service was fantastic.

Customer 4442.Name: dcw1
Customer 4442.Content: Great food! Great service! Will definitely be coming back!

Customer 4443.Name: Okay
Customer 4443.Content: I love the Met. They continue to deliver excellent food and service every time! The waitstaff is the best that I have encountered. They are extremely friendly and knowledgeable of their menu. I love the fact that you can come and have a fancy dinner without having to dress up. The environment is fun and relaxed. Awesome steak and crabcakes!!!

Customer 4444.Name: MelloB
Customer 4444.Content: We booked to celebrate our wedding anniversary and couldn't have had a better meal. Aaron, the sommelier, really made the evening special - great advice on wine and a special pairing to go with our dessert. Wangu fillet mignon was the BEST beef I have ever eaten. Definitely do not miss this place!

Customer 4445.Name: 4thThanksgiving
Customer 4445.Content: The steaks of coarse were amazing! But the four cheese macaroni is the best I've ever had, wasn't expecting that!

Customer 4446.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4446.Content: Service was excellent, great salad and apple pie, Coffee and tea good also.

Customer 4447.Name: LisaW
Customer 4447.Content: The Met is our go-to special occasion steakhouse. Our dinner this time was wonderful, as it almost always is.

Customer 4448.Name: steffen
Customer 4448.Content: woudl always go back. excellent wines

Customer 4449.Name: runnerstu
Customer 4449.Content: The Met provides excellent service, fantastic food and many great cocktail and wine options. It was a wonderful dinner, as expected based on their reputation and previous experiences.

Customer 4450.Name: Kevin
Customer 4450.Content: Every time we dine at the Met the food is wonderful and the service is exceptional!

Customer 4451.Name: bringiton
Customer 4451.Content: Second time I have eaten here and the food was fantastic!

Customer 4452.Name: mmrare
Customer 4452.Content:
My wife & I enjoyed our time @ Metropolitan. My Porterhouse was done perfectly and the mashed potatoes were delicious. My wife enjoyed her Mac & Cheese and a salad, along with a few bites of steak.
I really enjoyed the booth's for two, they are elevated a step up from the floor for easy in/out seating and a unique dining position I've only experienced @ the Met.
We made reservations online the day before. Our experience with all levels of the staff was welcoming and professional start to finish. I'm looking forward to the next "special occasion" to enjoy this wonderful restaurant.

Customer 4453.Name: Gourmand
Customer 4453.Content: Came for dinner on Sunday nite and had a fabulous feast! My husband touted the French Onion Soup as better than he has even had in France. I loved my lobster bisque. He had Buffalo Tenderloin and I had filet mignon, both were expertly prepared and very flavorful. We topped it off with tableside Cherries Jubilee, my favorite!!!! A delightful evening, we will be back!

Customer 4454.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4454.Content: A year ago we had a birthday celebration with my father (94) and brother (68). Dad is gone now, so we are keeping a tradition alive with celebrating my brother's birthday at this fine establishment. The food is very good, and the service is exceptional. We will return. We also had our son's pre-wedding party at this same establishment and the guys are still talking about it.

Customer 4455.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4455.Content:
We had a wonderful Dinner at Metropolitan Grill. Our server was truly charming and attentive. We had a great time and my boyfriend can't thank me enough for his amazing birthday dinner.

I highly recommend for a great dining experience.

Customer 4456.Name: datenight
Customer 4456.Content: We have been to The Met several times now - once again it was a great experience. The service as usual was fantastic. We arrived 5 minutes prior to our reservation, so I figured it was Saturday night and we may have to wait a few minutes - not the case. We were seated immediately. Our server (I do not remember his name) was fantastic. Answered all of our questions and provided a couple of great suggestions (almond crusted scallops, mac and cheese side dish).

Customer 4457.Name: diner
Customer 4457.Content: As always, spectacular food and service. Beautiful decor.

Customer 4458.Name: Dancer
Customer 4458.Content:
The food is always exceptional as it was on the 15th. Service is always good too.
Kudos to the Met to keep the quality at the highest.

Customer 4459.Name: Greg
Customer 4459.Content: Consistent staff, quality meat, excellent managers, special events like the Sounders or SeaHawks circulating. A Seattle mainstay....all great except for the people who will pay for expensive steaks yet could care less about appearances with worn Tshirts and baggy dated jeans.....shame!

Customer 4460.Name: JeanMA
Customer 4460.Content: For us this is a place to get a special dinner. We always enjoy the food, the service is friendly and consistent but never over-bearing. We truly enjoyed our meal here. Valet parking is getting a little pricey but for us it is worth it.

Customer 4461.Name: pa88
Customer 4461.Content: This restaurant is a must for a nice night out and I try to go here every time I come to Seattle.

Customer 4462.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4462.Content: It was mothers day and the Met Grill was very busy. We waited over an hour and a half for our dinner. The Service was good and the waiter came to the table several times to let us know they were working on our meal. The food was outstanding and well worth the wait!

Customer 4463.Name: DeeDee
Customer 4463.Content: The food was fabulous. Had Australian Lobster, Rib eye Steaks and Escargot. All cooked to perfection. Waiter was knowledgeable with the food, but was unaware of added items to the menu including additional wines. Apparently they were added on his day off. The only real "discomfort" was the actual booth itself. They were sunken in dramatically causing leg pain and left us with wanting to hurry our dinner just so we could stand up. The seating needs to be either updated or at a minimum re-upholstered. At least add cushioning to the seats. The seat we were in was 19/1 in case you care.

Customer 4464.Name: Jamison
Customer 4464.Content: Took mom for Mother's day,she was dreaming of a delicious lobster feast.They arrived looking over cooked.Not too concerned though it's "The Metropolitan Grill", will be delicious @ $105 per lobster.Wrong.1st bite was dry,bland,rubbery. Looked at mom working on her's,disappointment fell on her face.We tried the middle hoping it might be better,nope.I apologized to her,she apologized to me,felt bad for my wallet for the worst eating experience ever.I do not complain at the establishment,if I have issues,I simply do not return and advise others through reviews and word of mouth.Took our hardly touched lobsters home,doctored it up w/herbs, garlic, hot sauce,made it edible.Sad,could have had much better lobsters at The Keg for 1/4 the price.

Customer 4465.Name: SusanB
Customer 4465.Content: This is by far my FAVORITE restaurant in Seattle!!

Customer 4466.Name: Teebyrd
Customer 4466.Content: We loved the comfortable dining room atmosphere. Everyone was friendly and relaxed. The service was impeccable. The salmon was cooked to perfection as was the steak. If you like mashed potatoes, I highly recommend you order them. The portions were very generous.

Customer 4467.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4467.Content:
Our waiter was wonderful and the food was excellent. The waiter asked up front if we were limited by time constraints.
Everyone had something different. Two members of our party split their dinners and the kitchen did a terrific job.

Customer 4469.Name: Glamgrrl
Customer 4469.Content: I was anxious to try the Met again after our last experience (lousy service - long wait), Well, our perfect server made our experience wonderful - she knew the menu and individually helped us pick the perfect entree. We brought our own bottle of wine and the steward was very accommodating. Everything was so perfect - now I can't wait to go again.

Customer 4470.Name: Af72
Customer 4470.Content: As always, great food, great service! We keep going back for more!

Customer 4471.Name: hskr
Customer 4471.Content: Fine meal as always. High priced & worth it. The Lobster Bisque is fantastic, so is the bone in Filet.

Customer 4472.Name: Phil
Customer 4472.Content: Good place for a business lunch or dinner.

Customer 4473.Name: LesH
Customer 4473.Content: I went here while at a conference. The food was amazing; the staff were helpful funny, and efficient.

Customer 4474.Name: Mylabsryellow
Customer 4474.Content: Service was excellent. Food was fantastic. Highly recommend The Met!

Customer 4475.Name: JCinPA
Customer 4475.Content: Impeccable service all around. One of my favorite steakhouse restaurants anywhere.

Customer 4476.Name: FoodTraveler
Customer 4476.Content: The finest dining experience at the finest Altar to Red Meat in Seattle!

Customer 4477.Name: michealb
Customer 4477.Content: Extremely average. I really hope this isn't the best steakhouse in Seattle. I had their Wagyu New York strip and it was tough. My wife had the regular prime New York and it was flavorless. We moved here from Spokane and thought the restaurants here would be better, but if this is Seattle's best steakhouse, Spokane's Churchill's has Seattle beat by a mile.

Customer 4478.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4478.Content: This restaurant had quick bar service and very knowledgable staff on both the steak menu and the wine list. The food was delicious, if a bit pricey, and the wine list was on par. The staff was very polite and accommodating. As an older establishment in Seattle the booths were a little cramped but this is a perfect restaurant for a special occasion or a romantic evening.

Customer 4479.Name: GLdawg
Customer 4479.Content: What a wonderful place for a fancy steak dinner. Good food. Good friends. Excellent service and the best surf and turf in town.

Customer 4480.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4480.Content: As always an excellent steak. Superb service!

Customer 4481.Name: Tenor04
Customer 4481.Content: Valet parking was extremely handy and the fellows were on the ball. The waitstaff was helpful and friendly. The food was top notch and the wines divine. Would definitely return.

Customer 4482.Name: Kyle
Customer 4482.Content: The service here is really great. The food is classic steakhouse fare. Overall a great place for a good steak and an old school atmosphere.

Customer 4483.Name: DuPont
Customer 4483.Content: The best steaks in Seattle. Great service. Always a home run.

Customer 4484.Name: localeater
Customer 4484.Content: Always outstanding food and service. I've been dining there for 25 years and the Met never let's me down

Customer 4485.Name: jkreese
Customer 4485.Content: Just took my wife to the Metropolitan for her birthday. It was an awesome experience. The food was excellent, albeit a bit pricey. But it was worth it for such a special occasion. Our server was a long-time employee and very knowledgeable about the menu items. All the employees were very personable and all had a very good sense of humor...No stuffiness here! I had the dual Filet Mignon(4 oz. Prime and 4 oz. Wagyu); my wife had the 8 oz. Filet Mignon. We both ordered the Classic Bearnaise sauce. Both orders were cooked to perfection. We would highly recommend the Metropolitan Grill for any special occasion - Pricey, but well worth the experience.

Customer 4486.Name: DianneD
Customer 4486.Content: The wait staff was outstanding particularly the young gentleman assisting the waiter. Very efficient, attentive and helpful.

Customer 4487.Name: Cynthia
Customer 4487.Content:
Well, Handsome Scott Brown did it again! Not only was the food perfect, the drinks divine, but the service~ WOW! From the hostess, to the busser, to the valet, to Handsome Scott Brown, everyone was great and everything was perfect.

We were celebrating our anniversary and Scott made it all very special (or as special as one can get on a Tuesday night)! :)

Thank you Scott and The Met for being consistently a special and integral part of our celebrations...

Customer 4488.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4488.Content:
My wife and I haven't been to Metropolitan Grill for about 20 years...
It's as we remember and perhaps much better. We will certainly not wait that long for our next visit(s)...

Customer 4489.Name: EdwardG
Customer 4489.Content:
best prime rib I ever had
best crab fetticini, also

Customer 4491.Name: MattyG
Customer 4491.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill continues to be the best steakhouse in Seattle and one of the best nationally. The service is excellent and the food remains wonderful. My only small complaint was that after they cut the two steaks my family was sharing they were not temperature hot by the time they arrived in front of us at the table.

The porterhouse remains excellent and I was impressed by what they did for two family members birthdays.

All in all, a continued great experience.

Customer 4492.Name: DNewton
Customer 4492.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Met, the steaks were perfect. The booths provide a very intimate dining experience. The Met is a true Seattle Gem.

Customer 4493.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4493.Content: Amazing. Everything about this place was perfect. I marked 'fit for foodies', though some might disagree. This place is a classic steakhouse with amazing food. One of the best steaks I've had. The portions are likely bigger than many 'foodies' are used to, as they are, again, quite classic. Go. Enjoy. Have a martini (it'll knock your socks off).

Customer 4494.Name: DarylW
Customer 4494.Content: More of a name than a great restaurant. Food was good, but not exceptional. Prices were much higher than they deserved to be.

Customer 4495.Name: DianneD
Customer 4495.Content: Only draw back was evryone keep checking the availability for turing our table. To the point that it made us feel unfomfortable.

Customer 4496.Name: abidik
Customer 4496.Content: It was very good as usual. The wine that was recommended was good. The people friendly. We have been to this place several times and we enjoyed it everytime.

Customer 4497.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4497.Content: Its the best old school restaurant! I would love to come back for the dishes with steak and potatoes. The waiter are very amazing and very helpful to meet our expect.

Customer 4498.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4498.Content: We had a wonderful time, celebrating my husban's birthday.

Customer 4499.Name: JenniferM
Customer 4499.Content: Fantastic food and service like usual!

Customer 4500.Name: Silvano
Customer 4500.Content: The Met never disappoints. The filets were just so tender and juicy. The carrot cake and Creme Brulee were the perfect finishers.

Customer 4501.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4501.Content:
We've been to the Met several times before, but this was our least enjoyable experience by far. The initial wait was short (6:45PM reservation), but we were seated at a table that was honestly far too small for four people. Yes, we're a tall family, but this table would've been small for average height customers. Also, when we sat down, the area smelled like "sweat", which was not at all appetizing :(

The wait staff -- upon my prompting -- was able to relocate us to another table. It was more comfortable, but also in a higher traffic area. We didn't receive our meal until after 8PM, though, which was a longer-than-expected wait. Meal was good, but overall not a great night for any of us.

Customer 4502.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4502.Content: By reputation we knew it was going to be nice. We were not disappointed. The meals exceeded our expectations and the service was top notch. My wife and I were thoroughly pleased start to finish. Thank you Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 4503.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4503.Content: We felt rushed despite the upscale nature of the restaurant. The quality of the meat was top notch, but the way it was served and the accompaniments were not up to par for the price.

Customer 4504.Name: jacks0603
Customer 4504.Content: The food and service were outstanding.  I loved my steak and the waitress took very good care of us.  We will definitely be going back.

Customer 4505.Name: pjbj
Customer 4505.Content: without question - the best steak spot in all of Seattle!! Food, service, ambiance are all first class. Not for the budget minded - but worth the price.

Customer 4506.Name: foodiegirl
Customer 4506.Content: I have not been to the met for over 15 years. Shame on me! UNBELIEVABLE in every way from the food to the excellent service. What a wonderfl treat. My steak was so flavorful and tender. wow wow wow!

Customer 4507.Name: Jacque
Customer 4507.Content: Love, love, love The Met!! Our family's choice for celebrating (anything we can think of lolol)! GREAT food, excellent service from very knowledgeable and friendly staff! Always a very enjoyable time!!

Customer 4508.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4508.Content: Been here many times and never dissapointed.

Customer 4509.Name: GrEM
Customer 4509.Content: The Snake River Farms American Kobe steaks are the best I have ever eaten! I had the long bone ribeye, it was great.

Customer 4510.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4510.Content: Good but not great.When spending this much, we expect sensational. Many other options that provide exquisite food and spectacular service for about 40% less. Wouldn't have a reason to return.

Customer 4511.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4511.Content: As always, The Met staff delivered a superb experience that keeps us coming back year after year to celebrate our wedding anniversary (the most recent one was our 16th) and other special occasions. The food, service and ambiance has always been a key hallmark for The Met, and that tradition is maintained to this day. If you are looking for the best steak in the Northwest, The Met is your place! We also highly recommend the Yukon Gold potato cakes!

Customer 4512.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4512.Content: My husband and I went here for our anniversary and the food was amazing. The waitress was incredibly nice, and she even brought us free dessert to celebrate our occasion. The atmosphere is cool. It reminded me of something out of Mad Men. It's really swanky but not snooty. If you get the chance to go, do it.

Customer 4513.Name: Mikee
Customer 4513.Content: Good for a big splurge. Food was good, but not outstanding. Waiter was great. Had to look very hard for a wine under $100 - but when we did, it was great and waiter didn't give any attitude. At these prices, food wasn't worth hurrying back for.

Customer 4514.Name: KarinJ
Customer 4514.Content: We're from out of town and were looking for a great steak restaurant. The Metropolitan was immediately recommended by a couple who lives in the area. We had an amazing experience! The food was absolutely fabulous! We splurged on the most expensive steak and it was incredible, the best we've ever had. The service was fantastic too. It was a very memorable dinner. We're going back next time we're in town.

Customer 4515.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4515.Content: I've always heard great things about The Met, but this was the first time I'd ever been myself. I was blown away by the hospitality of everyone working there and felt completely taken care of. Their service is second to no one and they made sure that anything and everything was perfect. Arrived with champagne waiting and they gave my fiance and I an appetizer and desert in offer of congratulations. Loved this place and will definitely be coming back!

Customer 4516.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4516.Content: Loved it as usual. The Chateaubriand was fantastic...

Customer 4517.Name: travelsalot
Customer 4517.Content: Fabulous evening, good service and great food! Definitely recommended.

Customer 4518.Name: Van604
Customer 4518.Content: Outstanding service by John. Will recoomend all friends to go.

Customer 4519.Name: StephenP
Customer 4519.Content: Made our reservation for our 35th anniversary, and thought that maybe we would have some special treatment, but nothing. Well, the waiter did give us a (1) free dessert. Wow. We celebrated a past anniversary at the Capital Grill, and they actually decorated the table, took our photo, and wished us Happy Anniversary as we walked in the door, and again as we left. Really made us feel special, so I guess we know where to do our next special celebration. Overall, we enjoyed our food, and to be fair, our waiter did come by after seeing our seating card and wish us a happy anniversary.

Customer 4520.Name: JeanMA
Customer 4520.Content: The Met is a great place if you are wanting an excellent steak. The portions are generous and the steaks come with your choice of potato or roasted root vegetables. We usually get one of each and share. The other vegetables you can order on the side are also wonderful and well portioned also. We enjoy an evening here every once in a while when we want to feel pampered and have a predictable, great dinner. We usually use the parking valet but the price has crept up over the years. At least it can be put on the dinner check so you don't need to come up with the amount in cash!

Customer 4521.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4521.Content:
Food is excellent. Dress code is business casual but is loosley enforced if at all. For the price of the food and the advertised dress code, I shouldn't have seen people in shorts,flip flops, and baseball caps or kids in exercise clothing. I felt extremely over dressed in just a collard shirt and slacks.

The steaks however are good enough to outshine all of that.

Customer 4522.Name: Purplepassion
Customer 4522.Content: It was everything that we were told by friends. Steaks were excellent and cooked to our liking. Our server was very knowledgeable and provided more than enough information to help us in our selection of a very complete menu. The support staff was timely and cordial in refreshing our glasses and clearing each course. The atmosphere was lively but subdued, and the furnishing and decor was very stately. Prices are high, but understandable for the grade of food and service.

Customer 4523.Name: Tim1
Customer 4523.Content: great dinner, surprised w/ dessert for special anniversary.

Customer 4524.Name: LKCanada
Customer 4524.Content: I always enjoy happy hour at the Met. Dinner was good on this visit but not excellent. At the price charged for steak - it needs to be excellent. On our visit 2 of 3 meals were very good. The potato accompaniments were so so.

Customer 4525.Name: Susan
Customer 4525.Content: We hadn't been here for a few years (we live out of town), so it was nice to see that the only changes were those to the good. Loved the american wagyu beef, and the dungeness crab cocktail was the best I've ever eaten. The service was outstanding, and we were would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves a good steak dinner, with excellent sides and lovely wine.

Customer 4526.Name: davids
Customer 4526.Content: One of my favorite places in the country.

Customer 4527.Name: Donna1hickox
