Customer 4527.Content: We went there because of the high end beef quality, and thats what we got. Probably one of the best or perhaps the best steak I've ever had! Pricy, but we got what we paid for. Would definately go again. Our waiter was extremly helpful in discussing our ordering options. Very large salads, I split one with my wife and I couldn't finish my half! Perhaps it was because I was splitting a 16 oz ribeye with my daughter which was plenty.finished with the banana fosters. Oh Yeah

Customer 4528.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4528.Content: Our meal was good and our server was knowledgeable. The wine steward came to our table and found a nice wine for my girlfriend. But, for the price, I was expecting a lot more. A small appetizer, 2 steaks, a soda, and a glass of wine ran our bill to $150 before tip. I'm sure that's not a lot for some people but for me it's enough to make me eat Top Ramen the rest of the month. Would have liked a better experience for the price.

Customer 4529.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4529.Content: Best steak I have ever eaten. That compares to many steakhouses in NYC.

Customer 4530.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4530.Content: The food was fantastic. Our waiter was wonderful.

Customer 4531.Name: BobC
Customer 4531.Content: this is the best steakhouse in Seattle with some of the best meats in town (Waygu beef, Iberico pork) prepared and presented superbly. Doesn't get much better than this.

Customer 4532.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4532.Content: The dinner was fabulous and the service very attentive and friendly. We look forward to coming again soon.

Customer 4533.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4533.Content: I said that the food was only very good. I ordered prime rib, and it was actually a little on the tough side. It wasn't realy that good. Everything else, of course, was wonderful. We have visited MG many times. We're not going to worry about one lesser experience.

Customer 4534.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4534.Content: Amazing food and amazing service. Will definitely be returning!

Customer 4535.Name: Moose
Customer 4535.Content: One of the best steaks I have ever eaten.

Customer 4536.Name: Martinilover
Customer 4536.Content: I was a little concerned when we got shuffled aside at the front door by a party of 15 checking in at the same time; and it was all downhill from there. Tho the martinis arrived in a timely manner, they were not nearly cold enough. We eventually got our crab leg cocktail (and it was very nice, to give due credit.) But we had been at the restaurant an hour with still no sign of our dinner; and when we summoned the waitress she snippily informed us that she had turned in the order as soon as she took it; and when promise of a visit by a manager went unfulfilled, we left. Then when we informed the front desk of our decision and the reason, the manager standing there at least claimed not to have been informed of any problems with service.

Customer 4537.Name: Robilars
Customer 4537.Content: Enjoyed celebrating my husband's birthday, especially enjoyed the excellent food. We left wondering why we don't come more often. We will be back soon. Thank you.

Customer 4538.Name: esheeley
Customer 4538.Content: Definitely one of the best places in Seattle to get a premier steak.

Customer 4539.Name: Doug
Customer 4539.Content: Outstanding "white tablecloth" service. Food was “average”. Teriyaki tenderloin appetizer was way too salty. Chicken on the Waldorf salad was under seasoned and overcooked (dry). Overall, food quality was underwhelming given the prices.

Customer 4540.Name: deans
Customer 4540.Content: The Met is a high end establishment. Pricey. While the main course is excellent, the side dishes are not exceptional and slightly detract from the overall plating.

Customer 4541.Name: JaymeR
Customer 4541.Content: Amazing service and food!! A "must" on any food lovers list!!

Customer 4542.Name: Luveatingout
Customer 4542.Content: As always we have good service and the food is wonderful.

Customer 4543.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4543.Content: The food is just outstanding, the best steak I have had in Seattle hands Down. The service was lacking just a bit tho.

Customer 4544.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4544.Content: A great steak place, that I trust with important family and business functions.

Customer 4545.Name: Gardenofhope
Customer 4545.Content: We were in town on vacation and decided to share a chateaubriand for two at what the locals call "THE steak place" in Seattle. The food was excellent, but be prepared--the serving amounts are ENORMOUS. We could have easily eaten another meal from our joint filet. We split a spinach salad, and even that was ample when split. And take money. . .it's expensive, but very fine.

Customer 4546.Name: Sharon
Customer 4546.Content: Delicious but VERY expensive. Good thing we had a reservation, even at 5:30pm because it was very crowded. By 8pm, the crowd was standing in the doorway waiting for tables.

Customer 4547.Name: Tootsie
Customer 4547.Content: great food; caesar salad too fishy; steaks were terrific; calamari excellent;

Customer 4548.Name: susang
Customer 4548.Content: Cannot respond to questions about bar as we did not visit nor are we interested in any social scene. The Metropolitan is our favorite place for special occasions and dining. Love the chateaubriand and filet. Service is always first rate. Sometimes very noisy but we know that.

Customer 4550.Name: TiffanyS
Customer 4550.Content: I never have a bad meal at the Met. My filet is cooked perfectly each time. I look forward to the chocolate lava cake the moment I make my reservations! Yum.

Customer 4551.Name: DaveF
Customer 4551.Content: The Met lived up to its reputation for great steaks, with stellar service and attentiveness.

Customer 4552.Name: Glamgrrl
Customer 4552.Content: Steak and wine steward service were great but the overall table wait staff were terrible. Had to wait for a considerable time to place our order, our food took forever, and the wait staff was not attentive. I've been here many times and know they can do better. Hopefully my next visit reaffirms the belief I hold.

Customer 4553.Name: Zazen
Customer 4553.Content: We eat at MG often and I do think the service is sliding. It took ten minutes to get water. Another ten to take our drink order/ appetizer. The drinks and appitizer came shortly after. We finished both and waited 20 minutes for the waiter to come and take our order and refill the drinks. Food took 20 minutes to make it to our table. Sauces were left at the edge with no explanation (au jus, bernaise, mg steak sauce). The fixing for the baked patatoe were forgotten, we had to ask for them. The steaks were good, always good at MG. but the service! It was NOT busy (reservation for Sunday @ 5pm). Waiter was a old timer ( I've seen him before) but paying $400.00 for 3 people should get you much better service!

Customer 4554.Name: RoseO
Customer 4554.Content:
For us it is Expensive but, every now and then you have to
Treat yourself. We love the casual dress it is so relaxing and
Your server makes you feel so special. Treating you like a friend
For life. If i had the money i would go every month for dinner.
The food is the finest quality. Every thing was perfect.
Thank you all for making my husbands 56th Birthday so special.
God Bless you all.u

Customer 4555.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4555.Content: Food was awesome! Great selection! Price reflects the quality of food.

Customer 4556.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4556.Content: Whether it is a couple celebrating a special occasion, out-of-town family sharing a once-in-a-lifetime dinner experience, or a group of friends getting together, The Metropolitan Grill is the place to dine because this establishment consistently delivers quality food, service and charm. The selections are always world class, and the experienced servers know exactly what to recommend from appetizers to dessert.

Customer 4557.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4557.Content: I heard rave reviews and decided to try the Met. My steak was tough and the lobster overcooked. Very disapointed. I expected much more for the price.

Customer 4558.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4558.Content:
Excellent food, fabulous service, and a nice kid menu. We happened to be seated near a fan vent making it chilly. Immediately after telling our server, the fan was adjusted and more comfortable.
Our server was attentive, friendly and helpful. We did not choose to purchase high end steaks, and we were not made to feel uncomfortable about that. Great place, we would definitely go back.

Customer 4559.Name: RosieK
Customer 4559.Content: Courteous, careful service. Ask for Bill, if you can. The Skirt Steak lunch special was delicious. My friend's Prime Rib must have been good, judging by the look of joy on her face. We have had lunch there on several prior occasions; all were just as enjoyable.

Customer 4560.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4560.Content: Outstanding food, very traditional setting and run by experienced professionls.

Customer 4561.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4561.Content: Great dinner to celebrate our 13th wedding anniversary - they even treated us to a bananas foster dessert!

Customer 4562.Name: DonD
Customer 4562.Content: 3 out of 4 steaks were good, mine was not that great, gristle and a little tough. at 68.00, it should not have been like that.

Customer 4563.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4563.Content: Good value for lunch. get the Steak House food but you can afford to bring a crowd.

Customer 4564.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4564.Content:
I loved the historic feel of this restaurant. Stylish, but not stuffy.

The steaks were correctly prepared and very tasty.

Appetizers were very good, the apple pie dessert was amazing.

Excellent, attentive service. The staff were on top of all our needs.

I thoroughly enjoyed this dining experience. I plan to return again to dine here.

Customer 4565.Name: FoodTraveler
Customer 4565.Content: The best steaks in Seattle and impeccable service. What more can I say?

Customer 4566.Name: MistahJ
Customer 4566.Content: I took my wife for a romantic steak dinner. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! The steaks were perfect, tender, and juicy. perfect ambiance, and a stacked wine list. The only drawback to the evening was that our server wasn't very knowledgeable about the wine/pairing options for the food. But that's easily overlooked considering the sheer size of the wine list and the fact that the rest of the dinner was fantastic. Be prepared to spend at least $50 a person, but you won't regret it. we will be back.

Customer 4567.Name: BANONE80
Customer 4567.Content: THE BEST HAPPY HOUR IN TOWN. The Met has the BEST steaks in Seattle, hands down. Three people and three amazing meals! Try the Teriyaki Bites Appetizer and the Creme Brûlée or Nine Layer Chocolate Cake for Dessert!!

Customer 4568.Name: none
Customer 4568.Content:
As always, The Met never disappoints!! Service is fantastic and they make up for the abundance of background noise! The food, steaks at our table were prepared to order!

Jump on this when you have a chance!

Customer 4569.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4569.Content: The food is pricey, but worth every penny. It was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had and the service is incredible. The staff are impeccably dressed and incredibly friendly. Had the best time!

Customer 4570.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4570.Content: my picky 11 year old son loved his steak and almond crusted scallops. GREAT service. Definitely will return to try more dishes.

Customer 4571.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4571.Content: We hadn't been to the Met for a long time. We had a little bit of sticker shock but kind of expected that. As always, the service was excellent, although our dinner wine didn't get to the table until we were about halfway through. I had the special Filet medallions with mushroom sauce and roasted root vegetables. The filet had some gristle in it and the sauce was so-so. The vegetables were very ordinary. My husband had a petite New York steak which was also a little gristly but cooked okay. His smashed potatoes were very good. All in all, for what we paid ($400 for four people with 2 drinks and a half bottle of wine and one dessert) I can think of a lot of other places I'd rather go.

Customer 4572.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4572.Content: They say that The Met has "The Best Steak in Town." I must agree, as my Prime top sirloin was succulent and flavorful, tender, and totally enjoyable! My wife had the crab claw fettucine, which was also excellent, as were our salads. We took advantage of a "dinner on us" offer that gave us a gift card equal in value to the cost of our two entrees when we paid our check. Now we can go back again and cut our overall cost per entree in half!

Customer 4573.Name: pkdotnet
Customer 4573.Content: I feel like I want to return one more time to the Metropolitan Grill to see if our experience was just a fluke. The only really wrong thing was my wife's lobster tail was undercooked, but the whole experience just felt off for some reason. Nothing I can quite put my finger on, but it just felt... strange.

Customer 4574.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4574.Content: One of the best meals I've ever had! Great service & atmosphere. The food was delicious.

Customer 4575.Name: diner
Customer 4575.Content: Spectacular service and food, as usual.

Customer 4576.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4576.Content:
I go to the Met for the excellent steak.
The serving staff provide great suggestions to make my experience enjoyable.

Customer 4577.Name: PAsreview
Customer 4577.Content: Expensive, but I had one of their signature steaks and it was just OK.

Customer 4578.Name: TonyB
Customer 4578.Content: Great food, super wine list, great service - perfect for that special occasion...

Customer 4579.Name: hondo001
Customer 4579.Content: One of the best steakhouses in the US. Even had American Wagyu and direct from Japan. Only "complaint" is that it's very expensive.

Customer 4580.Name: JuliaR
Customer 4580.Content: Great food, large portions. Good for date night!

Customer 4581.Name: Kevin
Customer 4581.Content: The Met was great as usual. The fantastic service coupled with the consistently amazing food will keep us coming back.

Customer 4582.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4582.Content: Loved the meal at this restaurant and staff was courteous and patient. I'll definitely be back again!

Customer 4583.Name: Sean
Customer 4583.Content: The entire experience was impeccable. The service was very personable but never obtrusive.

Customer 4584.Name: KarinaL
Customer 4584.Content: As always, the service was impeccable at this classic, wood-paneled steak house. The dry, mature humor of our server was a perfect match for our group. Steaks are a must here! I'm a big fan of their wedge salad, the hazelnuts make it unique.

Customer 4585.Name: Crazyben5150
Customer 4585.Content: Seattle's finest steakhouse! Could not have been a better meal, especially celebrating our engagement! Great wine, great service, and great food!

Customer 4586.Name: KarenO
Customer 4586.Content: Steaks are good quality but ruined with far too much seasoning...I couldn't taste anything but salt. Same goes for the potatoes and veg. Out waitress was nonchalant at best. She spoke to us like she was reading off a script and when we asked if she recommended anything special, told us everything on the menu was good. The restaurant itself was extremely busy which made for a good ambience but it felt a little too loud and manic for my taste. The prices are high which I would ordinarily not balk at, but when the food, service and ambience were below par, it was definitely NOT worth it.

Customer 4587.Name: Owen
Customer 4587.Content: Fantastic food as usual. Distracting table next to us had an inappropriate dynamic going on. We were given free dessert as a small apology which was nice. Hard to blame that on the restaurant though as they don't screen reservations. (Obviously)

Customer 4588.Name: KimN
Customer 4588.Content: One of our all time favorite restaurants! We have never been dissapointed.

Customer 4589.Name: sitkagirl
Customer 4589.Content: Chateaubriand was very good, ordered med-med rare; it was quite rare. About $136, serves 2. Next time, I'll order steak. Huge baked potatoes and tasty herbed roasted fresh tomato. Caesar was so-so, like most every other restaurant - nothing out of the ordinary, except the plates were nicely chilled. Best Manhattan, about $14. Visit with a pocket full of $$$.

Customer 4590.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4590.Content: The Met is always a great choice for a great steak and a great dining experience.

Customer 4591.Name: 84fun
Customer 4591.Content: Pricey but excellent food. The tables near the door (any door) are cold and drafty.

Customer 4592.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4592.Content: The restaurant started things off right with seating us in the chairman's room to celebrate a late valentine's day. Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helpful, and the food was the best I have ever had, and I've eaten at many steakhouses before.

Customer 4593.Name: GolferGal
Customer 4593.Content: We were a bit disappointed with our service this time. Our waiter never came back to check on our meal, but that was when it did start getting busier. Meal was excellent.

Customer 4594.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4594.Content: The food was fantastic and the ambiance was very fancy the food took a while to get to us but the waiter was attentive and really nice!

Customer 4595.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4595.Content: We have lived in NY and San Francisco. We have traveled throughout the country and abroad. Metropolitan Grill is THE BEST Steakhouse in THE WORLD. We do not live in Seattle but booked a flight specifically to eat at the Met for Valentines Day! Great Wine, Great Steaks, Great Service! Keep it Up!

Customer 4596.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4596.Content: The front was packed and loud, but they moved us to a room in the back that was quiet and cozy. The food was awesome as usual.

Customer 4597.Name: RBGA
Customer 4597.Content:
The Met is a great place for steak! Anyone that know anyhing about the Met, know it is not a discount place. It is not cheap. But the food. The atmosphere and the professionalism of the staff makes it a very special place to have a nice meal.
I have only been here twice. It is a place to go for very special occasions. If you appreciate the finer things in life, this is a place to go and enjoy.
I have eaten at The Met twice....both are tied for the finest dining experience I have had in my life.

Customer 4598.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4598.Content: EVERYTHING is perfect besides the price & no window view.

Customer 4599.Name: eastsider
Customer 4599.Content: fabulous Chateaubriand, roasted wild mushrooms, onion rings, carrot cake, creme brulee. mediocre roasted vegetables, French onion soup too sweet.

Customer 4600.Name: Jill
Customer 4600.Content: We love dining at The Met. Unfortunately, this experience was not one that we were too fond of. The table that we were given seemed to be in the middle of traffic for the staff. For making a reservation more than a month ahead of our dinner, I would think that our seating location would be a lot better. We felt like a nuisance being caught in the middle of everything. My chair was bumped several times by staff passing by. The food and service was as we come to expect from The Met but our placement was not.

Customer 4601.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4601.Content: The ohmi carpaccio is one of the best I've ever had. The lobster bisque was rich and creamy. The wagyu steak was seasoned and cooked to perfection. And service was impeccable. The wait staff really knew their steaks so I was really impressed. I would definitely go there again and recommend this restaurant to others.

Customer 4602.Name: SusanR
Customer 4602.Content:
The Met came through for me, from my requests when I made the reservation. Very friendly wait staff, they knew of my friend's birthday and even gave him a chocolate dessert I had asked for.
The wine expert recommended a fabulous wine. The service in the bar as well as the restaurant was superb.
Prices are a bit high for your average person, but worth going there for special occasions.
Food (steaks) were cooked perfectly and the sides, salad and appetizer was excellent.

Customer 4603.Name: Rbeloit
Customer 4603.Content: An early Valentine's celebration and it was just what we expected...and more...EXCELLENT food, service and comfortable environment...it's always a treat to enjoy a special meal here!!

Customer 4604.Name: B8caster
Customer 4604.Content:
The food was just ok. Wasn't bad, but not memorable either. My wife and I ordered the same steaks, cooked the same way. Hers was underdone while mine was overdone, not by much, but noticeable enough to miss the mark - plus they were a bit bland. Something I wouldn't expect from the Met. Side dishes were tasty as was the salad. The dessert and service was outstanding. But the place is very loud and noisy. Definitely not a romantic getaway.

Their flagship is their steak, and honestly, I've had better steak elsewhere at a lesser price, and cooked the right way. For that reason plus the noise, I won't be going out of my way to return.

Customer 4605.Name: Steven
Customer 4605.Content: The Met is a perennial favorite. Everything about this establishment is world class. The food and service are flawless. Always a pleasure to return. I have eaten steak all over the world; none have surpassed the Met.

Customer 4606.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4606.Content: On a recent visit to Seattle we wanted to return to the Metropolitan Grill and were fortunate to find that they were running a promotion called "Diner on Us." Whatever you spent on the first visit was placed on a card to be spent on a second visit. Good deal! The steaks were tender and flavorful. Due to time constraints, we returned at lunch time and ordered from the dinner menu (required). Unfortunately, all items, such as baked potatoes and their wonderful twice baked potato, are not available at lunch time. Still, a great deal for a great meal.

Customer 4607.Name: Vikas
Customer 4607.Content: One of he best steak experiences I've ever had.

Customer 4608.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4608.Content: I got the 18 oz. prime rib with twice baked potato and my wife had the 14 oz. prime sirloin. Both were exceptional. It was way more than either of us could have or should have eaten but neither could stop. The steaks were tender and flavorful and the service was exceptional. I have eaten twice baked potatoes before but this one was exceptional. Our only regret was being too full to try the Bananas Foster that we had read so much about.

Customer 4609.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4609.Content: We love coming to the Met. The food is soo good, we always have the best helpful staff.

Customer 4610.Name: tastyeater
Customer 4610.Content: Always quality. A great place for a good dinner catching up with an old friend from out of town.

Customer 4611.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4611.Content: Love going to the Metropolitan...I have to say its really high dollars however, so it's a special occasion only, but have loved it every-time

Customer 4612.Name: seani
Customer 4612.Content: Portions are almost too big, always tasty though! Thanks for the birthday piece of cheesecake! Much appreciated!

Customer 4613.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4613.Content: We were disappointed in our signature rib eye steaks considering the price. On the other hand, the brussels sprouts were very tasty. The burnt cream was also disappointing in taste, but it was a very large serving (two of us could not finish it). The lobster bisque was very good. The server was very attentive and personable but the pacing seemed unnecessarily slow. The upper dining room is extremely loud but we requested a quiet table and were seated downstairs in a booth, which is considerably more quiet.

Customer 4614.Name: WillB
Customer 4614.Content: Always on point and delicious. Service is fantastic. Food is classic and perfectly cooked every time.

Customer 4615.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4615.Content: Great night had by all, Food was perfect, will be back

Customer 4616.Name: JohnC
Customer 4616.Content:
I have been going to the MET for over 20 years.
This was the first time I had a bad meal.
I ordered a 14 oz. NY strip steak for $56.00.
The steak was tasteless and way overpriced.
I have had the same style steakat the Outback that tasted better
and was 30 bucks cheaper.
Very very disappointed.
My wife's fillet mignon was very good.

Customer 4617.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4617.Content: The Met is an institution in Seattle. If you haven't gone, it's a must. Love the feeling of being in the early 1900's while dining here.

Customer 4618.Name: CFosterKane
Customer 4618.Content: As always, first class steaks in a first class atmosphere.

Customer 4619.Name: sford
Customer 4619.Content: I was very disapointed in the service. The food was pretty good but not excellent.

Customer 4620.Name: Candace
Customer 4620.Content: The met grill was amazing! The food was awesome, the service was the best I had ever experienced and the staff was so kind and accommodating. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a good steakhouse. Although it was spendy, we knew what we were getting into. Couldn't have asked for a better place to celebrate. My favorite part was definitely the service. The staff was all so friendly, I couldn't stop smiling all night long!!

Customer 4621.Name: Mark
Customer 4621.Content: Very expensive....but very good food, service and ambience. S Brown has been our server a couple of times now and always takes good care of us. You will definitely enjoy a meal at The Met!

Customer 4622.Name: breee
Customer 4622.Content: Everything was wonderful. The food and service. My only complaint is that the seating is a little dated. The cushions have lost some if their support. But that's my only complaint.

Customer 4623.Name: mh3265a
Customer 4623.Content: Food was underwhelming. I remember the steak being of a better quality. Prices are also significantly increased.

Customer 4624.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4624.Content: THIS IS OUR FAVORITE DINING SPOT IN SEATTLE. THE STEAKS ARE THE BEST.

Customer 4625.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4625.Content: Food was excellent, done to our likeness. Food requests were done with a smile and "we'll take care of it" attitude. Server was expedient and personable, made us feel at home.

Customer 4626.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4626.Content: The waiters really know their stuff here, and are very friendly! The food is wonderful, and this is a great place to go for a special meal out.

Customer 4627.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4627.Content: Excellent food as usual. Sommelier was a little help and all recommendations were on the mid range to high price.

Customer 4628.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4628.Content: Our waiter, Stephen, was wonderful. The food was fantastic. my husband, the birthday "boy" ordered the 38 oz. Porterhouse, and was not disappointed!!

Customer 4629.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4629.Content: We have heard about the Met Grill for a long time and took this opportunity to try it. We had reservations but were seated about 15 minutes later. That wasn't bad, we sat in the bar and had some calamari and a drink. The calamari was a bit greasy, but the acidic peppers on the side helped. The Manhatten was great! We were going to have the Prime New York but were talked into have the Wagyu steak. We were expecting a lot from this steak - disappointed. The steak was underseasoned, tougher than expected, flavorless and flat. The roasted root vegetables were very good. The Brussell Sprouts were a bit undercooked too. But we liked the ambiance, it was cozy and comfortable, conversations in the bar were loud. dining room was better.

Customer 4630.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4630.Content: Visiting from NYC, this was highly recommended. And I have to say, the best steak I have eaten in a long time! (This is in the league of Peter Lugers and Uncle Jacks).

Customer 4631.Name: ChristineL
Customer 4631.Content: We had an excellent dining experience! This time of year at the Met or Elliots, you must take advantage of thier "Dining on us" promotion. We did! Buy two entrees and receive a gift card for the value to use again at either the Met or Elliots. This has become an annual deal we cannot pass up! Always a terrific meal, excellent professional service and always the best to share with friends.

Customer 4632.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4632.Content:
The food was excellent with the exception of the asparagus. I would recomend this to anyone that would like exceptional quality.
The filet and pork loin were amazing and the brussel sprouts were out of this world!
We were there celebrating my partners 30th Birthday and she was very happy!

Customer 4634.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4634.Content: I've been there several times. Always great. I highly recommend the table side bananas foster!

Customer 4635.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4635.Content: Winelist just okay, overpriced (making well over 100% markup) bottles.

Customer 4636.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4636.Content: Great food and a good deal going on right now.

Customer 4637.Name: BJGN
Customer 4637.Content: Great dinnerBest is Seattle for steaks!!!!!Eager to returnNot inexpensive!!!!But worth it

Customer 4638.Name: SusanZ
Customer 4638.Content: We can't stop talking about our experience at The Metropolitan Grill. From the ease of making a reservation using Open Table, to being able to call the restaurant and change it due to traffic problems, to the extra special attention we received in celebrating a 60th birthday, the Met exceeded our expectations in every way. We moved to Washington 7 years ago, and this was our first time at the Met. The out-of-town guests who joined us for dinner can't wait to tell all their airline friends about the food, drink, atmosphere, etc. of this great Seattle establishment. We can only hope that it remains open for many years to come so that we may enjoy it again and again -- now that we have discovered it. Kudos all around.

Customer 4639.Name: Bobh
Customer 4639.Content: The Met deserves the great reputation it has. Great food and a great experience. It's a steakhouse that's people friendly. I use to work around the corner and have dined there lunch and dinner a few hundred times over 20 years. Enjoy.

Customer 4640.Name: SallyS
Customer 4640.Content: Hard to find a menu item that is gluten free and dairy free, but they did accomodate my asking to hold ingredients from their menu items. The food is excellent and the portion sizes are good. The service is top rate and the atmosphere is both cozy & elegant. This is a classy, old-school restaurant.

Customer 4641.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4641.Content: The best steak I have ever had in Seattle hands down. The mashed garlic mashed potatoes are a great choice. Finished the evening with cherries jubilee. Great show put on by the staff.

Customer 4642.Name: AnneB
Customer 4642.Content: Our waiter, Regi M. was very inattentive and forgetful and our sommelier was not on our wave length.

Customer 4643.Name: David
Customer 4643.Content: private time 4 days in Seattle at Camlin Hotel was most enjoyable and romantic surpassed by our 3 hour dinner at Metropolitan restaurant. We were never there before but look forward to returning. The mini bites were great, the side by side 4 0z steaks were great and the bananas foster for dessert was fantastic. We saw it done, asked for it for our dessert and the 4 people next to us asked for it too.

Customer 4644.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4644.Content: We very much enjoyed every aspect of our experience. We were seated right away, enjoyed a lovely, very tasty dinner and were treated to a complimentary birthday dessert for our daughter.

Customer 4645.Name: HarveyS
Customer 4645.Content: I've been several times. The Met never lets me down.

Customer 4646.Name: TomInWA
Customer 4646.Content: Classic restaurant in downtown Seattle. Place to see and be seen.

Customer 4648.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4648.Content: Fabulous restaurant. I called ahead to order a special bottle of wine for my dining companion, who I knew would not let me pay if I ordered at table, and the lovely helpful staff set it all up for me, it went off like a charm. Impeccable service, European style, highly trained hostess, waiters, sommeliers, down to busboys, perfectly trained. Excellent food, if somewhat dense with very large portions (have to justify those astronomical prices!) and one of the best wine lists I've ever seen. Highly recommended for a special night out.

Customer 4649.Name: Sanjay
Customer 4649.Content: Amazing service. We shared the Chateaubriand (for 2) carved table side- presentation and wow factor were top drawer! Definitely an expensive night out, but we were celebrating my new job so it was well worth it! Thanks Met. Hope to see you soon.

Customer 4650.Name: wwww
Customer 4650.Content: a great red meat restaurant. great service. We go regularly and will return again.

Customer 4651.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4651.Content: The food and service is always top notch

Customer 4652.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4652.Content:
5 Star Upscale Restaurant in a Historic Seattle Building. I recommend making a reservation if you just want dinner. We arrive at 5pm and within 20 minutes the restaurant was packed! Excellent cocktails and a wine list like no other. The service was A++++ all the way. We got to sit at VP Rob Sexton's table which was in a great, cozy, romantic, location.
Thank you Metroololitan Grill for letting My Husband and I celebrate our 16th Wedding Anniversary with you.

Customer 4653.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4653.Content: Excellent in every respect. A little pricey, but worth every cent.

Customer 4654.Name: truthbetold
Customer 4654.Content:
We Reserved a table at the MET for our 6th anniversary expecting High quality food and a romantic atmosphere. When we arrived we were seated immediately. I Had requested a booth Hoping for a romantic setting and what we sat in was a tiny two person side booth right up front by the front door. What struck me most was how much it felt like a tourist trap, loud and dingy. The table had not been cleaned off from the previous diners & The payment was still sitting on the table. The green curtain next to the table was covered in dust and grime. If it was not for the expectation of a wonderful dinner i would have left immediately!
That said The steak was perfectly prepared and the service was delightful though over priced because of the atmospher

Customer 4655.Name: Mike
Customer 4655.Content: Awesome as usual! My wife and I had the chateaubriand for 2 and it was magnificent. Had to be the best beef I have ever eaten. Service was also top notch as usual. It's not cheap, but that's a known when you go there.

Customer 4656.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4656.Content:
Hands down on selection of steaks (especially Wagyu beef)and excellent preparation of the steaks! My son loves filet mignon, and he rates Metropolitan Grill no. 1, followed by Daniel's Broiler, John Howie, Ruth's Chris and then Jak's.
I had Iberico and it was absolutely delicious as well!

Customer 4657.Name: JohnK
Customer 4657.Content: Best steak in town with outstanding service!

Customer 4658.Name: ItalianFoodie
Customer 4658.Content: I tried a steak dinner at Metropolitan Grill to see what all the jazz was. It's a good steakhouse, and as expensive as the comments would have it. I couldn't justify the Wagyu or other Japanese beef. The Prime cuts were just like all the others I've had at various steakhouses in Seattle, Chicago, New York, etc., etc. The frites with the steak were exceptionally good. The wine list was extensive with good selections from Bordeaux, Burgundy, Napa, Sonoma, Oregon, and Washington, with smaller selections from a variety of other wine regions. The service was very good, but not outstanding (too many times we were left waiting for the waiter to come back).

Customer 4659.Name: MadelineM
Customer 4659.Content: I thought this would be the best steak in town (and it is definitely priced like it is), but was disappointed in the quality of food. $400 for an " ok" meal for two is a waste. I won't be going back.

Customer 4660.Name: LeslieD
Customer 4660.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill tops our list for the best steakhouse in the US with its wonderful steaks, sides, flaming desserts and exquisite bourbons!
We make a point of eating at this fine restaurant at least three or four times a year. You will not be disappointed.

Customer 4661.Name: JAttilaH
Customer 4661.Content:
Except for the fact that you may have to take out a second mortgage to really do it right here, I can't find one thing to complain about. I've eaten here quite a few times, and they just always get it right.

On 1 January, my wife and I (and friends) celebrated our 15th wedding anniversary. As always, The Met rose to the occasion. The server was amazing. The grill man (who did our Chateaubriand and bananas-foster) and our sommelier (who looks a lot like Bruce Willis) were both great at their jobs and very entertaining.

If you want the closest thing to a state dinner at the White House (like being inside a well-oiled machine), go to John Howie. If you want the best food, experience, and very personal service, eat here.

Customer 4662.Name: Nardo
Customer 4662.Content: We went there for a late night New Years dinner. The food and service was outstanding. The atmosphere was very lively, as can be imagined. We'll be back next New Years!

Customer 4663.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4663.Content: We absolutely love coming to the Met on New Year's Eve. Our favorite sommelier, Thor, is wonderful and always willing to spend time talking with us. Our server, Kim, was also excellent and offered just the right amount of attention. The crab cakes as an appetizer were a great way to begin our evening, and the lamb was prepared just to our liking. As always, we were very pleased.

Customer 4664.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4664.Content: I have been to The Metropolitan Grill before & I absolutely love the atmposhere & food. Additionally, I highly recommend the drinks (White Cosmo & the Pear Lemon Drop are outstanding). If hard liquor is not you cup of tea, they have an amazing wine list/selection. The only thing preventing me from returning anytime soon is the pricing. It is amazing & I will return for another time. But for the occasional dinner out I can not afford to do on a monthly basis. Overall, it is a wonderful restraunt & if you're celebrating a special occasion, I highly recommend The Metropolitan Bar!!! The ombionce is beautiful & you will feel slightly spoiled :)

Customer 4665.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4665.Content: This is a good place to get a stake. This is one of the best steak houses in Seattle. And Seattle has a lot of good places to eat. This is one of my favorite places to go. But it is rather expensive. I like the old fashion charm of the place. I recommend the valet parking. It's about the same price as a parking garage.

Customer 4666.Name: GwendolynP
Customer 4666.Content: It was a wonderful dining experience. It was my birthday and the staff treated me like a queen. Great food. Great wine. Great time.

Customer 4667.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4667.Content: We had heard a few rave comments from friends about The Metropolitan Grill. This was our first time there and it proved to be spectacular. The food was magnificent, as was the service. The old building charm was perfect and provided a lovely ambiance for the evening. We highly recommend it!

Customer 4668.Name: SusanK
Customer 4668.Content: Last evening I took my son to the Metropolitan Grill as a Christmas gift. We visited the restaurant one time before about four years ago and we had an amazing experience. Last night was no different. The entire experience was nothing short of amazing! The food was exquisite, the service second to none and the atmosphere was so welcoming. The entire staff was hospitable, knowledgeable, professional and once again provided us an unforgettable evening. I felt like I had died and gone to culinary heaven. We can hardly wait until we are in Seattle again because the Metropolitan Grill will be on the top of the priority list of places we must go to. Thank you to the Metropolitan Grill for doing what you do best. Happy New Year!

Customer 4669.Name: Littlefoot
Customer 4669.Content: Ordered the corn with lobster and was disappointed. I was expecting just corn kernels with lobster meat, however it was more like southwest corn salsa (onions, eggplant, green peppers, etc.) The plus was a whole lobstertail of meat. The American wagyu filet and filet mignon combo was a good value. The steaks were tender with the right amount of seasoning. Not too salty. Burnt creme (creme brulee) was served cold, good flavor, thicker consistency than I prefer with just the right amount of sweetness.

Customer 4670.Name: Dozersmom
Customer 4670.Content: This is a great restaurant for special occasions. I've always had a good experience and this time was no exception. The only reason for the less than 5 star rating is that the somelier was quite busy and we had to ask for him twice and wait quite a bit for his service. Other than than, our waiter was superb. The food was excellent!

Customer 4671.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4671.Content: yearly visit after the holidays...guaranteed wonderful service and food..thank you

Customer 4672.Name: enjoysgoodfood
Customer 4672.Content:
We took our adult children to lunch prior to attending a performance at the Fifth Avenue. Everything was fabulous. Mike was our waiter. He was WONDERFUL!

Thanks for a wonderful holiday memory.

Customer 4673.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4673.Content: Excellent food, and a great experience. Lobster bisque was sliky and flavorful. Steaks were among the best I have ever eaten. Wait staff attentive and friendly. If you like steak, this will be a wonderful experience.

Customer 4674.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4674.Content: A wonderful place for a romantic night.

Customer 4675.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4675.Content: We've been going here for Christmas dinner for about 15 years and this year was by far the worst. We didn't get what we ordered and the service was not what we expected for the price we paid.

Customer 4676.Name: kshov
Customer 4676.Content: Metropolitan Grill remains my favorite restaurant in Seattle. American Wagyu Filet is one of the best steaks I've ever had.

Customer 4677.Name: Suzy
Customer 4677.Content: We went for Christmas Eve.  Atmosphere is lively.  Food and service excellent.  We have gone here for many special occasions and have always been pleased.

Customer 4678.Name: Jack
Customer 4678.Content: On x-mas eve, ordered the Wagu beef, but got something else.  To their credit, they didn't charge us for the order.  Been there before and it has been excellent.

Customer 4679.Name: TransplantedTexGal2
Customer 4679.Content: Coming from Texas... hate to say it, but this is truly a great steakhouse!

Customer 4680.Name: Tedd
Customer 4680.Content: The steak, wine and service were absolutely outstanding. Only thing slightly wrong with meal with that the baked potato was served luke warm. Still find the Metropolitan Grill one of our absolute favorites and a place to go for special occasions.

Customer 4682.Name: Dancer
Customer 4682.Content: The service and food are outstanding!

Customer 4683.Name: RoyH
Customer 4683.Content: The food and service this time was not there best.

Customer 4684.Name: ChrisH
Customer 4684.Content:
We've dined at the Met for 25 years, probably somewhere around 150 visits. We just celebrated our 21st wedding anniversary and this was our 21st anniversary spent dining at the Met. Is it habit? No, it's just simply that good. Food is always flawless, service goes far beyond any expectations. It's not the newest or flashiest, it's just consistently the best food and best service of any restaurant anywhere.

I

Customer 4685.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4685.Content: The quality of the food is not what it use to be. The cost for a meal is excessive given the quality.

Customer 4686.Name: Cudastu
Customer 4686.Content: Maybe the best beef I have ever eaten!

Customer 4687.Name: kterr
Customer 4687.Content: We went specifically for the steak and it was fantastic. The food was excellent and so was the service! We could not have asked for a better experience. We had a party of 9 and they were able to accomodate us with ease.

Customer 4688.Name: Ttopper
Customer 4688.Content: Bruno and Lance made the evening very memorable for Echa and myself. Definitely go back. Very attentive and friendly staff and grey steak!!!and Chicken too. Escargot great as well ....need a Pike's IPA !!

Customer 4689.Name: sunshine
Customer 4689.Content: We always have a great time and enjoy very much eating at the Met. Food is great!

Customer 4690.Name: GregW
Customer 4690.Content: Excellent Service and food, but VERY expensive.

Customer 4691.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4691.Content: The atmosphere was great for lunch. My reservation was at 1:00 p.m. and they were out of the daily special which was quite disappointing. I tried the open face steak sandwhich instead which was pretty good except for a bit of grissel in one or two medallions. The baked potato soup was great and my companion really like the lunch salad. Service was a little slow, especially getting started. However, the waiter was friendly and professional.

Customer 4692.Name: JonS
Customer 4692.Content: Entering The Metropolitan Grill is like taking a step back in time to great steak houses in large cities with classic martinis, manhattans, and excellent steaks. The steaks were delicious from the first bite. The service was fantastic.

Customer 4693.Name: MelissaL
Customer 4693.Content: The staff is Great!!! Some of the patrons could use a review of their kindergarten manners.

Customer 4694.Name: DonnaG
Customer 4694.Content: Food is AWESOME!!!! Steaks melt in your mouth. Pretty pricey but for a special occasion it is special.

Customer 4695.Name: Aloha9620
Customer 4695.Content: i have frequented this establishment since the day it first opened. The food and service have always been outstanding. The wait staff are there to serve and add a lot of warmth and charm to the experience, especially Thor. We do not live in the immediate area any longer, and only go there for special occasions. Last night was my wife's 64th birthday, not a true biggie, but close enough. We went from the resturaunt to Benoroya Hall for a show, so the evening couldn't have been better. Thank you so very much for always being consistent. Happy New Year!

Customer 4696.Name: ChrisandDiana
Customer 4696.Content: I miss NY. I miss the city. This brought it all back. Great food and good service with plenty of time to relax and enjoy it. We will be back and become regulars.

Customer 4697.Name: MerryMel
Customer 4697.Content: The Met is a holiday tradition with us, plus one or two other times a year for special celebrations. We have a favorite waiter and they oblige our requests to be seated in Scott's section. The service is fantastic, and of course, so is the food. We have never been disappointed, even after 20 years.

Customer 4698.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4698.Content: Took my family, wife and two sons (16 & 12) , after an enjoyable day in downtown Seattle partaking in the holiday festivities. Great time. Staff was very friendly to my kids and made the day with a stop at "The Met".

Customer 4699.Name: Wewiit
Customer 4699.Content: Perfect way to celebrate the holidays. Our waitress was wonderful, the food perfect which all made for a very enjoyable experience.

Customer 4700.Name: KarenA
Customer 4700.Content:
Excellent food and service. Pretty pricey but great for a special occasion.

The table was very small for the 4 of us - had to keep moving things around and getting rid of any spare plates/glasses to make room.

Customer 4701.Name: KevinG
Customer 4701.Content: Another fabulous anniversary at the Met! Loved our time there. The food was outstanding and the service was unbeatable. Always a treat!

Customer 4702.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4702.Content: This was our first visit here and we had a great time. The staff was super nice and the food was excellent!! I will definitely be going back.

Customer 4703.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4703.Content: Food excellent; service superb; staff attentive but not cloyingly so; expensive but worth it.

Customer 4704.Name: Wendy
Customer 4704.Content: We, as always had an outstanding time! I think I may have chose the wrong steak for myself, but other than that it was amazing.

Customer 4705.Name: LarryM
Customer 4705.Content: Always our favorite steakhouse - great outing with terrific service from Steve H and Lance pouring wine - ample portions with great variety - expensive, but worth it

Customer 4706.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4706.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is a restaurant for special occasions. Very pricey - incredible food! Unfortunately on this dining experience our service was very poor. We waited a long time for salads and as soon as we started eating our salads our steaks arrived! Our server asked if she should keep our steaks warm while we ate our salads. Keep a $70 steak warm? With these kind of prices, there is absolutely no excuse for poor service.

Customer 4707.Name: RobS
Customer 4707.Content: had a GREAT time - sommelier sat down with us - it was a blast!

Customer 4708.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4708.Content: Little Noisy when you have a lot of people there but the staff was excellent.

Customer 4709.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4709.Content: One of our favorite restuarants in seattle - Great Steaks!

Customer 4710.Name: Neal
Customer 4710.Content: The service was perfect, the atmosphere was welcoming, the wine pairing was spot on, the dish portions were generous, but the food itself just didn't hit the mark, especially for the price. Dungeness crab dishes are my favorites, but the crab in my dish was stringy, chewy and fishy tasting. I was expecting the mushrooms to be superb, but they too were a huge disappointment and I pushed them aside. I tasted my wife's scampi and it was also chewy and tough. The venue and the servers were great, but without exceptional food, why pay the stiff prices?

Customer 4711.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4711.Content: A must visit steakhouse when visiting Seattle. Top notch service and perfectly cooked meals are always guaranteed.

Customer 4712.Name: alfy
Customer 4712.Content: I would say the food was great. But the service was subpar... When you spend over $300 and would have spent more... but you are FREEZING and want to get out. We booked for my fiancé's birthday dinner (and we booked reservations at an early time slot and weeks ago, noting it was a special occasion), we were sat at the booth closest to the door. Not very special... at all. But worse, our waiter was EXTREMELY distracted, was frequently late on our drinks, didn't take our dessert order and just assumed what we wanted and brought it out (I guess they give every birthday table the same dessert?? we would have paid for something else instead of taking that one for free).

Customer 4713.Name: MilesW
Customer 4713.Content: Everything was great. Above and beyond our expectations.

Customer 4714.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4714.Content: I took my son, daughter-in-law, and 9 year old granddaughter to the Metropolitan for a very special event. EVERYTHING from initial greeting to the best calamari ever to drinks, food, wine AND two special desserts was perfection. You will be lucky if you get served by Reggie. He helped make the evening really memorable.

Customer 4715.Name: PatI
Customer 4715.Content: Went there for our son's birthday as he said he wanted a steak. The food was excellent, steaks done perfectly and the server was friendly and efficient. It is very spendy but well worth it for a special occasion.

Customer 4716.Name: PaulB
Customer 4716.Content: The best prime rib I have ever had. In addition, having banana foster made right at the table was a nice treat.

Customer 4717.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4717.Content: The Met is a no brainer for business lunches. Food is great. Service friendly and fast. I am always amazed that I recognize the same wait staff year after year. What do you do to keep staff for so long? The Met has obviously figured out how to be successful over many, many years...a coup in a challenging industry!

Customer 4718.Name: DeeT
Customer 4718.Content:
Service was very average.. they kept forgetting things, and didn't get what we ordered.
For the price this was very below average...

Customer 4719.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4719.Content: Server and service great. Good business lunch location.

Customer 4720.Name: PDXMom
Customer 4720.Content: We usually love The Met, but it wasn't the same this past visit. The food was barely warm and seemed as if it was not freshly prepared. My Spanish coffee was awful, even on the 2nd attempt. A pretty disappointing meal!

Customer 4721.Name: LunchtimeFoodie
Customer 4721.Content: The Met is always a fantastic experience with their amazing steaks coupled with superior service. Our two school-aged boys were treated well, and the top sirloin on the kids menu exceeded our expectations. Bravo!

Customer 4722.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4722.Content: This is my 6th time at the Met. The small bone-in ribeye was absolutely amazing. We asked for it to be cooked medium well and it came out bright pink and juicy, the fat had rendered beautifully. We shared between 3 women. Best steak I have ever had!!!!! The crab mac and cheese was also a great side dish.

Customer 4723.Name: ermohn
Customer 4723.Content: Excellent steak house, one of the absolute best in the US.

Customer 4724.Name: EliseB
Customer 4724.Content: Amazing food, amazing service! Very friendly, incredibly attentive staff and just an overall fantastic atmosphere. Love this place, we'll be back!

Customer 4725.Name: PickyEater
Customer 4725.Content: The food and service were excellent. The portion sizes were gargantuan - way more than could or should be consumed in one meal.

Customer 4726.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4726.Content: WE loved it. Our waiter was so friendly and efficient, too. We will be back.

Customer 4727.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4727.Content: Made reservation with Opentable on-line for 5:15. We arrived a few minutes early, but were immediatley seated in a quite corner of restaurant. Waiter was excellent and provided great input on the diner and beverage choices. Food arrived within 20 minutes and was perfect. Great business dinner.

Customer 4728.Name: Food5Critic
Customer 4728.Content: The Metropolitian has great steak. The salad was just ok. Focus on the steak, with sauce, because that is what stands out. The waiter, brought a refill on my wine, even after I said no. He had already poured it before I could stop him. At $19 per glass, this annoyed me. I did not like the waiter's wine choice, and would have liked to try another taste, but the waiter seemed short to that idea. But when wine is $19-23 per glass, I think it is fair to get what you want.

Customer 4729.Name: JenniC
Customer 4729.Content: Delicious food, incredible wine list, and attentive service!

Customer 4730.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4730.Content:
I love the "old school" service and truly excellent food.
Waitstaff is friendly and knowledgeable.
Great wine list and full bar.
I always get some type of steak/meat as that is what they are known for.
But my date ordered the crab legs and she said it was the best she ever tasted.

Customer 4731.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4731.Content: It's been another good trip to the Metropolitan Grill. The service is typically steakhouse-nice with knowledgeable waitstaff and wine captains. I had the top cap steak (split with my wife - the portions are large and I can't eat 18oz of meat alone) with steak fries and brussels sprouts (very good), and others at my table had the scallop appetizer for dinner with asparagus, a special consisting of two small filets with blue cheese (side of macaroni and cheese), and a larger ribeye. The fries were a lark, I do not recommend, but everything else was very good - the flavor of the top cap was excellent. The Metropolitan Grill selected wine is a good deal by the bottle. Interestingly the menu seems less expansive than previously.

Customer 4732.Name: reddwarf007
Customer 4732.Content: The steaks were great. Waiter was friendly and prompt. Only downside is the price. Very expensive.

Customer 4734.Name: TheCharpie
Customer 4734.Content:
It has been quite a long while since I ate at a steakhouse proper. As such, I was thrilled to eat here. While I didn't go for the wagyu beef, I did go with Softy Special. I asked for mine to be medium-rare, a risk at lower-end places. However, the Metropolitan Grille was anything but, and mine came out perfectly. The outside was hot and juicy, while the interior was solid and flavorful.

The service was excellent, too. Out server gave us the ins and outs on the different cuts of meats, yet never pushed us toward the more expensive cuts, something I was most appreciative of. Also, the wine list was extensive and their classic cocktails were very good, I recommend the mint julep.

Customer 4735.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4735.Content: Service was impeccable. Although the food was expensive, the quality was worth the price.

Customer 4736.Name: PerfectService
Customer 4736.Content: Had a perfectly delicious steak after enjoying french onion soup among other delicacies.

Customer 4737.Name: angelagammit
Customer 4737.Content: I took my boyfriend there for his birthday. He ordered steak and I ordered a lobster tail. His steak was quite good, but my lobster was beyond salty...not even sweet. It was very disappointing.

Customer 4738.Name: SteveA
Customer 4738.Content: Always a wonderful dining experience. The staff believes in customer service and does not disappoint. The menu and wine list are first class!

Customer 4739.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4739.Content: Food was excellent. Was celerbrating my birthday and would more then likly come back again next year.

Customer 4740.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4740.Content: Everything was good. I was just slightly disappointed in my choice of roasted root veggies. I expected them to be a little tastier. They were al dente. Not what I expected for roasted root veggies. I learned my own cooked from home are much better. Their potatoes were very good and I didn't choose that. I know better for next time. The bottle of wine was over priced at $90. It was good maybe not that good.

Customer 4741.Name: MerryMel
Customer 4741.Content: I have a long-standing tradition of going to the Met when my cousin visits from San Francisco, and also for a holiday-time dinner with friends. It's always great. Best steaks anywhere, superb service (especially from Scott) and a festive atmosphere. It's my favorite restaurant anywhere.

Customer 4742.Name: DaveF
Customer 4742.Content: Still Seattle's best steaks & professional service!

Customer 4743.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4743.Content: We have eaten at the Met many times, and it has always been excellent. The food is wonderful and the service is outstanding. We always take family and friends there when they visit us as well as going for special occasions. We are always raving about the Met. Thank you for being our special spot!!

Customer 4744.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4744.Content: Food was great . The table side steak cutting was awesome. Waiter was super friendly. Enjoyed every aspects. One of my favorite resteraunts.

Customer 4745.Name: bseblgrl3
Customer 4745.Content: Portion sizes are stupidly large. I often feel like I'm wasting food - no human should consume as much food as they serve in one dish. I suppose for the price it's a deal. The Met is consistent and service top-notch but would like to see menu rotations more often - their "daily specials" have been specials for pushing 3 months.

Customer 4746.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4746.Content:
We arrived a few minutes ealry on a Sunday evening and were accomodated a little ahead of our reservation time.

Classic high end steakhouse environment. Food is well prepared and tasty, although the creamed spinach was a bit dry. We ordered white wine with our seafood appetizers and red wine to accompnay our steak. The white arrived after our appitizers were cleared so we sent it back.. One of our appetizers took a flying leap off the waiter's tray and set us back a few minutes while he picked up another one. So, no excuse for the bad timing on our first course wine. Boo-hoo.

One cocktail, two glasses of wine, two appetizers, two steaks, one side dish and no dessert. $196.00 before tip. YIKES!!

Customer 4747.Name: PatC
Customer 4747.Content: My wife had never been to the Metropolitan Grill so I decided our anniversary would be the right time for her special "Met coming-out Party". She is not a steak lover as I am but she was totally and completely thrilled with the Metropolitan Grill. As a testament, she almost ate all of her 8 oz Filet. It was cooked perfectly and the flavor was indescribeable, in her words. I think "The Met" will be in our going out to dinner plans in the future. It was an absolutely wonderful evening and the crowning touch was the complimentary Creme Brulee for our anniversary.

Customer 4748.Name: JohnH
Customer 4748.Content: Never dissapoints. Best steak in town. Great wine list and the food always very fresh. One of my favorites indeed

Customer 4749.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4749.Content: By far the best meal I have ever had in any resturant. A bit expensive for my busget, but a special treat for our special occasian, 22 year wedding aniversary. We plan to be back, price may seem high, but for the quality you receive it is well worth the expense.

Customer 4751.Name: MarcoQ
Customer 4751.Content: Awesome service and food, couldn't ask for a better experience.

Customer 4752.Name: Carol
Customer 4752.Content: The service and quality is hit and miss. At a busy lunch hour, our food took close to 40 minutes. The table next to us, which was seated after us, got their food first. The server was very apologetic, and offered us free dessert. We'd already been there a long time and didn't have time for that. The food was good, but nothing special.

Customer 4753.Name: abidik
Customer 4753.Content: We visit Seattle every year from Europe. This is the third time in consequent three years when we are in seattle that we went to this place. I am very glad to see that the quality has not changed. I think it is very good. Enjoyed the meat which was served the way we wanted it. I would like to commend the Vine chief who suggested a very good vine from Oregon. The desert was also excellent.

Customer 4754.Name: TRideLady40s
Customer 4754.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill lived up to it's reputation of a power-steakhouse. The meat was perfectly prepared, the server and sommelier were attentive and friendly without being annoying, and the wine selection was abundant.

Two things that could have been better: 1. my perfectly cooked filet was over-salted; 2. the asparagus with bernaise arrived to the table just warm (as did my huband's garlic mashed potatoes), and they were cold within minutes.

Aside form those two things, we had an exceptional evening. It's a great place for a celebratory steak dinner!

Customer 4755.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4755.Content: Great place to celebrate our anniversary. The service made the evening. We splurged on the Chateaubriand for 2. We had been given gift certificates as a present from friends, so that offset the cost. The food was very good although the portions were larger than we normally eat. That's ok because they happily boxed up our leftovers & we had a great dinner at home the next night.

Customer 4756.Name: Hooper
Customer 4756.Content: It was a great experience as usual. I love your food, service, and attention to details! I love bringing my wife there for special events and a romantic evening!

Customer 4757.Name: Seahusky
Customer 4757.Content: Dinner at the Met is always a great experience. Fabulous food, great service and great vibe in the restaurant.

Customer 4758.Name: Rick
Customer 4758.Content: They always impress me and my groups. It's a must go whenever I'm in Seattle. Great food!

Customer 4759.Name: Jeff
Customer 4759.Content: My wife and I have not been there in more than 10 years but our recent visit was nothing short of incredible, The food was off the chart,Service was incredible.. We will not wait 10 years to go back!!!!

Customer 4760.Name: MJSimpson
Customer 4760.Content: Metropolitan Grill's food blew away all our expectations. The steak was amazing and worth every cent. It definitely is the best in town, well at least the best of what we've tried so far. The chocolate lava cake is wonderful. Highly recommend trying that out if you have any room left after the main course. Left this place in a food coma.

Customer 4761.Name: Sweet
Customer 4761.Content: The Met is absolutely our favorite place for special dining. The service is superb, matched by the food and the sommeliers. This time we ordered a favorite wine only to find it out of stock in their cellar. Aaron, our sommelier recommended a wine to equal the style we had originally selected. It was however somewhat older, a 2002, which Aaron pointed out and discussed with us. We found it to be a perfect addition and compliment to our meal and is certainly one we will seek to visit in the future. We called upon Aaron a couple of times as our curiosity was peaked about several things on the wine list and we had found a willing ear to indulge our questions. It added so much to our evening, as is usually the case at The Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 4762.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4762.Content: Once again we had a truly outstanding dining experience at the Met Grill. We will keep returning every time we come to Seattle!!

Customer 4763.Name: LaurenM
Customer 4763.Content: For the price, I think the Met has gone downhill. There is no doubt the meats are outstanding, but the rest of our meals were pretty standard fair for high prices.

Customer 4764.Name: Elias
Customer 4764.Content: Great Seattle steak house. The food was prepared perfectly. The service was terrific and the atmosphere wonderful. It is pricey and great for special occasions.

Customer 4765.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4765.Content:
Always an excellent experience. Service was wonderful, food was great, drinks were made right.

Tip to future customers: ask that your steak be prepared how the chef thinks it should be. They do an exemplary job cooking it to your specifications if you like it rare, medium well, etc. But it's really a treat when you give them a little artistic license.

Customer 4766.Name: tlccc2808
Customer 4766.Content: Been to the Met Many times and brought clients in Game. got table in bar waiting the table. Service for drinks was VERY slow, figured a rush of pregame patrons & that we were only there for a drink then moving to a table might be the reason for bad service. We asked to stay in the bar table for dinner. Service poor Still, drinks were slow (we would of ordered at least another round but couldnt get service. When the food was brought out we had no forks since they were taken away with the salads, 3-4 minutes our food sat there while we were trying to flag down a server for forks. Steaks were over done and then when done waited 10 min for plates to be cleared

Customer 4767.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4767.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill is serious about the quality of their food and their great personal service! Living in Tacoma, we try and go to the "Met" for special occasions or want a Great Steak! Without fail, we order the "Lobster Bisque"! It is "To Die For!
I find it incredible that you can order this thick piece of steak and the weight of the knife cuts through it. The dining experience is just fun! There always seems to be an energy in the room.
If you want great steak , The Met is the place to go!

Customer 4768.Name: PatriceG
Customer 4768.Content: This was a perfect ending to a trip to Seattle. We had the NY Strip for 2. They cooked it to 2 different temperatures to perfection. We had Mac&Cheese and Creamed Corn with Dungeness Crab. We shared a 1/2 bottle of Conundrum. Our waiter was absolutely wonderful and attentive. He took the time to find us a bottle to meet our sweet & dry request. We had reservations at 4:30 so we could make a 9:30 flight and had plenty of time even though the restaurant was filled with U of Wa Football Fans. Make sure this is one of the top restaurants on your list!

Customer 4770.Name: Mairecon
Customer 4770.Content: Excellent food & atmosphere but not worth the $170 per person!!!

Customer 4771.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4771.Content: The Met is what restaurants used to be...superb food with exceptional and professional service. There is nothing trendy about it...just a wonderful, old-school approach to fine dining.

Customer 4772.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4772.Content: We all enjoyed our meals very much. Prices were high but we felt the quality of the food was worth it for a special night out. Our waitress was excellent and we really appreciated her service.

Customer 4773.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4773.Content: As always, the Met provided an excellent environment for a business lunch. Food was great and our waiter was enjoyable, attentive but not hovering. Always my first choice for an important lunch meeting.

Customer 4774.Name: Foodie2shoes
Customer 4774.Content: Steaks are amazing! Although the 50 oz steak was a little tough to cut through...a little more rare than I would expect in the center

Customer 4775.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4775.Content: My boyfriend and I went here for our 1 year anniversary and loved the meal! He ordered the 16oz peppercorn steak and I ordered the lamb chops and baked potato. The food was incredible, flavorful, cooked to perfection! Our server was well informed but not pushy, he checked in with us to make sure the food was exactly how we wanted and then let us enjoy it. I would definitely return. We were impressed by the serving sizes and left satisfied!

Customer 4776.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4776.Content: A really nice night out. The Met has the reputation of being very pricey,but the menu is flexible enough with apps. and salads that you don't have to break the bank, a nice surprise. My wife and I went all out(apps,chateaubriand carved tableside. The service is the best,totally professional with out any pretentiousness.Our server guided us through the menu like a friend that had been here before.We had dinner at 8:30 on a Saturday night,the Met was very busy,but we never felt rushed,the staff was perfect at serving us at our pace. Substitutions were met with "of course". Love this place.

Customer 4777.Name: OrganicGirl
Customer 4777.Content: These steaks (filet) were some of the best we've ever had. They have Waygu beef and Prime. We chose prime based on our server's recommendation. She also was a gem. Knowledgable and friendly with just the right amount of attention. The brussel sprouts were fabulous, as were the salads. Just an all around fantastic meal. Full disclosure: this is pricey. Steaks run $40 to $135! For one portion.... and the meal is mostly a la carte. But, worth it.

Customer 4778.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4778.Content: Expensive but worth the price on special occasions. Elegant ambiance but customers were very comfortable wearing casual attire with families.

Customer 4779.Name: Mark
Customer 4779.Content: Fantastic steak, wine list is outstanding, and service was ee.

Customer 4780.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4780.Content: I've been to The Met many times over the years, for lunch and dinner. While the prices are high, the food is consistently wonderful. They serve some of the best steaks/prime rib I've ever had and are always rated in the top 10 steakhouses in the country. It's a great place to people watch, the noise level isn't so high that you can't enjoy conversation with your dining partners, and the service is always professional and courteous...and efficient.

Customer 4781.Name: Bunnym
Customer 4781.Content: This restaurant is great for a business lunch. Its noise level is just high enough to create an energetic feel, and it also provides privacy, as the next table can't hear every word you say! The food is consistently high quality and the service is fast and professional.

Customer 4782.Name: roberta
Customer 4782.Content: Another terrific lunch with very good service. We'll be back again and again.

Customer 4783.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4783.Content: The Met is a fantastic high class steak house. It was my 5th time to the Met and my second time with a particular waitress. She would disappear for long periods and showed some frustration with my colleagues needing separate checks for our expense reports. My filet was excellent, though my colleagues expressed dissatisfaction with their meals. I will still come back every trip though will explicitly not ask for the semicircular table in the back right area of the restaurant nor any other that she is responsible for. It was rather loud in the corner as well as it was close to a secondary kitchen entryway where things were constantly being dropped.

Customer 4784.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4784.Content: Everything was great and we always look forward to our visits because we know we will have an excellent meal served by wonderful waiters. Our family from out of state always insist on coming to the Met when they visit.

Customer 4785.Name: mother
Customer 4785.Content: We had a wonderful meal. Food was prepared perfectly - not dry or over-cooked. Highly recommend The Grill when in Seattle.

Customer 4786.Name: Saftman22
Customer 4786.Content: Food was excellent. Best steak I have ever had. Recommend spending the extra couple bucks and get the Waygu Beef. You will not be disappointed. Only reason I gave this a Very Good is our waiter acted like he was a bit bothered. Probably just an off night for him but none the less.

Customer 4787.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4787.Content: The metropolitian grill is such a nice place! Very incredible selection on dishes and amazing service by everyone in the resturaunt! We came to eat the night before my husband shipped out to Afghanistan and everyone made us feel so special and even took the time to make the expierence fun for my 3 year old son and we were soo impressed :) we cannot wait to come celebrate all our occasions with this restaurant 3 thank you for the greatest memory :) we love the met!!!

Customer 4788.Name: JohnM
Customer 4788.Content: We are in Seattle 2 to 3 times a year and it is always on our spot to dine.

Customer 4789.Name: arrrroooooo
Customer 4789.Content: Metropolitan is top class. This is the place in town to go for steak.

Customer 4790.Name: LisaN
Customer 4790.Content: Fantastic food and great service. Will be back on our next trip to Seattle.

Customer 4791.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4791.Content: If a restaurant is going to charge $68 for a steak, they darn well better know how to cook it. My medium well filet came out rare. Twice. I finally just got a box so I could cook it at home myself. Attentive wait staff, but at over $100+ per person, Canlis or Daniels have better food and ambience.

Customer 4792.Name: LuMurph
Customer 4792.Content: The bar (drink) service was slow- they could use another bartender during UW pregames

Customer 4793.Name: jimbosc
Customer 4793.Content: Great place to eat. The service was outstanding and the food was incredible. The ambiance is amazing.

Customer 4795.Name: rjgoody
Customer 4795.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was probably the best dining experience we have EVER had at a high end steak house! We were greeted at the door by the Sommelier who said "We've been waiting for you....where have you been?"...adorable....whisked us to our table....the waiter was so attentive....every detail from start to finish was perfect....perfect. The food was delicious....I had prawns as a starter....I have never seen such large prawns...and, they were to die for. The Petite Filet was so tender, cooked to perfection, and, just melted in your mouth!....then, of course, there was dessert....don't miss the Lava Cake....the best I have ever tasted. Obviously this sounds redundant...but, I can't rave enough.

Customer 4796.Name: CraCat
Customer 4796.Content: Absolutely wonderful experience. Everything was excellent. Recently visited a steak house competitor in the Bravern in Bellevue. The Met beats the competition on all counts. They are our "go to" establishment for all special occasions and business lunches and dinners!

Customer 4797.Name: foodieworld
Customer 4797.Content: Always consistently good. Will never hesitate to return. Seafood is as good as the steaks. Service is always excellent.

Customer 4798.Name: seabay
Customer 4798.Content: As always, the Met came through. I had the best Chicken Noodle Soup I've ever eaten. And of course everyone at my table enjoyed their entree sandwiches. Everything from the BBQ Burgers to the Roast Beef. Perfectly cooked. Service was also very attentive.

Customer 4799.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4799.Content:
The crab cakes and calamari appetizers were good, but we've had better crab cakes at less expensive restaurants like Anthony's and Elliott's. The Wagyu filet, however, was the best steak I've ever had. Very tender and flavorful. It was also the most expensive steak I've ever had, but it was certainly the highlight of my meal. My wife's New York steak was excellent, but my filet was fantastic. The creme brulee was excellent.

Ambiance was nice. Dark wood paneling and moderate lighting creates a more intimate feel, although space is fairly open, so I stop just short of calling the setting romantic. Our seats were very comfortable. Service was very good. All in all, we had a nice evening at the Met and would recommend it.

Customer 4800.Name: BrianK
Customer 4800.Content: We stopped by before a trip to Hawaii to celebrate our 40th. The restaurant was beautiful, the staff was extremely pleasant, they remembered I had mentioned our anniversary and gave us a wonderful Creme Brulee desert that we could do justice to after having a delicious 28 oz New York steak perfectly cooked and carved at our table. It's not cheap - but we're glad we splurged!

Customer 4801.Name: MJAA
Customer 4801.Content: Outstanding food and service; pricy, but worth it!!

Customer 4802.Name: Archie
Customer 4802.Content: My second trip to the Grill and it was every bit as enjoyable as the first. The two visits were about 5 years apart.

Customer 4803.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4803.Content: Excellent all around, only reason for not giving 5 stars is price. Ruth Chris or Daniel's broiler have same or better quality for less. I had the Wagyu/Kobe sirloin and my wife had the filet mignon. Both were cooked perfectly and tasted great.
