Neither tasted better or was more tender than what we are used to at other high-end steak places. At $70 a piece, they should!

Customer 4804.Name: wantagoodsteak
Customer 4804.Content:
Most expensive dinner out ever. And worth every penny!!!
We had the BEST time.

Customer 4805.Name: GABCARDAD77
Customer 4805.Content: The food was great but our server was kinda bitchie. We had 8 in our group with 4 of those being kids and she didnt seem very patient and then gave me grief about using Met gift cards to pay for the majority of our bill. Not the best time.

Customer 4806.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4806.Content: Amazing service and absolutely heavenly food.

Customer 4807.Name: MsJloe
Customer 4807.Content: I was not impressed with Metropolitan Grill at all. The food, service and atmosphere were "mediocre" to say the least! It is very over rated in my opinion. I am from Southern California, and we have some of the best steak houses anywhere including: (in order of my favorites): Mastro's Ocean Club, STK Los Angeles, and Flemings Newport Beach! The steak at Metropolitan Grill did not come close to either of these places!! I was disappointed!

Customer 4808.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4808.Content: The steak was excellent and the service was good. Had to wait for server because he was chatting with other customer. Thought the conversation with each customer could be shorten. At the end of the dinner had to wait for bill. Our credit card was ran through once, we had to add the vallet parking into the bill and askef the server to ring it again. The next day I found out our account was ran through twice. Try calling the restaurant but no answer, had to drive directly to restaurant to talk to manager, it was very inconvenient. The manager said although the credit card was ran through twice but it will only process once. Anyhow, still waiting to see the final bill. My account was debited twice which had an impact on my limited account bal

Customer 4809.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4809.Content: Reggie was a most pleasant and informative server. Have never been served better steak.

Customer 4810.Name: general
Customer 4810.Content: great food, great service, but it is too loud compared to their competition.

Customer 4811.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4811.Content: I scheduled a late lunch for a relaxed celebration. It could not have been more perfect. I have eaten in many great steak houses across the country and this is tops.

Customer 4812.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4812.Content: The steak was delicious! Our waiter was friendly. Great experience

Customer 4813.Name: Robk
Customer 4813.Content: A classic old school restaurant experience that is always a crowd pleaser.

Customer 4814.Name: SecretSixx
Customer 4814.Content: Was our first time to the Met.  The service and food were great.  Will certainly keep it in mind if we are in Seattle again.

Customer 4815.Name: DVDuck
Customer 4815.Content: A classic restaurant with exceptional food. The wine list is expansive and expensive. Ask the wine steward to choose your bottle for some unheralded treats.

Customer 4816.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4816.Content: This is my fifth time at the Met Grill, which would be unremarkable except that I live 2200 miles away from Seattle. That said, most recently our service was mixed. Very slow. We were stuck at a back table on the little platform that extends back by the foyer, so as the table across the way ordered bananas fosters or whatever flaming thing, we couldn't get out nor could the service get to us. Seems like a fire trap to say nothing of being inconvenient.

Customer 4817.Name: Tegs
Customer 4817.Content: fun time! first time we brought our sons 16 & 19. they loved it!

Customer 4818.Name: WBER
Customer 4818.Content: I have been going to the Metropolitan Grill for many years now - and I appreciate the consistency of EVERYTHING. Great food, fun vibe and amazing service (love Kimberly!!) Looking forward to my next visit. Wendy

Customer 4819.Name: Holiwudd
Customer 4819.Content: Excellent service and food. Highly recommended for those needing a location for a larger group requiring some privacy - the Board Room was totally free from any distractions.

Customer 4820.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4820.Content: Best steak I've ever had- and best wedge salad. Priced commesurate to the quality, but worth it.

Customer 4821.Name: rainier
Customer 4821.Content: You can never go wrong dining at the Met Grill!

Customer 4822.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4822.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was an excellent up scale restaurant for our vacation. We enjoyed the ambience, great service, and the food was superb. We highly recommend the filet mignon. We also had the Caesar salad and the French onion soup. Both were very good. The Bananas Foster was a nice way to finish the evening. We enjoyed the show, as they prepared the dessert table side. We recommend the Metropolitan to anyone looking for a great steakhouse during their next visit to downtown Seattle.

Customer 4823.Name: ConnieA
Customer 4823.Content: The evening was enjoyable with very good food, attentive service and a eonderful pace to celebrate a birthday! Thank-you to the staff for making the evening memorable for my son!

Customer 4824.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4824.Content: We did not go into the bar but the Metropolitan Grill is one of our favorite dining spots!

Customer 4825.Name: SarahK
Customer 4825.Content: This is the type of restaurant you pay $60 for a steak and enjoy every perfectly cooked bite! The staff is friendly, and for the most part, on-top of their game. I ordered the peppercorn NY prime steak which came with mashed potatoes. For dessert my friends and I shared the chocolate lava cake, which is fit for any chocoholic.

Customer 4826.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4826.Content: Amazing Steak and all around amazing food! Been there multiple times for special occasions and date nights and we are always satisfied with the results. Its not cheap, but neither is the service or food! A must-eat for anyone visiting or for anyone looking for an amazing dinner. *Advice: Book a weekend reservation at least a week, if not two, ahead if you plan on eating between 6-9pm*

Customer 4827.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4827.Content:
Great service and food! Pricey but worth it for a splurge or special occasion!

Steve the waiter and Kevin the maitre de hotel were superb!!!!

Treated my boys (12 and 7) like princes!

Thanks to the Met Grill team

Customer 4828.Name: KariF
Customer 4828.Content: Very good food and excellent service.  From the time we entered the door to the time we left we had the best service.  The food came quickly and the presentation of the food was amazing.  Definitely loved the food and the experience.

Customer 4829.Name: JohnN
Customer 4829.Content: A wonderful experience, as always. Although many items are on the pricey side, I have never had a bad experience. Great for special occasions.

Customer 4830.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4830.Content: The service we received for my fiancés birthday was amazing. The food was out of this world. Bruno was fantastic. His voice was like old timey radio.

Customer 4831.Name: suburbanvisitor
Customer 4831.Content: Not the grand dining experience I was expecting. Like Applebee's but with better food and service. Wait staff was smooth and cordial in the dining room, but inattentive in the (not crowded) bar. Dining room seemed filled with hillbillies on vacation. Wine steward seemed like it was his first day on the job. This place seems to be living on its reputation of 20(?) years ago. Good steak though. Great wine list.

Customer 4832.Name: TomL
Customer 4832.Content:
Steaks and Wedge Salads were superb. Service was excellent. Crab cakes and scalloped potatoes were very poor quality
and disappointing.

Customer 4833.Name: Noongsters
Customer 4833.Content: OUr reason to go is for 2 reasons and 2 reasons only. Steaks, and Wine.

Customer 4834.Name: AnneT
Customer 4834.Content: We had a most enjoyable experience. Seemed as if the waiter was there just for us. Food was perfect.

Customer 4835.Name: SGWo
Customer 4835.Content: Still one of my top ten restaurants in Seattle! Very dependable, very enjoyable- you will always have a great meal with great service. You are treated as a valued guest!

Customer 4836.Name: KellyG
Customer 4836.Content: Restaurant is very expensive - really could only go to this restaurant on a special occasion. I can't see going to this restaurant once a month. Can't afford it. But the food was very good.

Customer 4837.Name: TomW
Customer 4837.Content: I've always wanted to eat at the Metropolitan Grill and I finally got there with my wife and closest family members for my 63rd birthday last week. We were not disappointed. Everything – including our table ( a large booth) – was excellent. A very memorable evening and a great start to our Pacific Northwest vacation.

Customer 4838.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4838.Content: True steakhouse atmosphere. The maitre d' was superb.

Customer 4839.Name: RoadTraveler
Customer 4839.Content: Steak, steak, steak...NOT cheap, but good red meat rarely is....!

Customer 4840.Name: lovesushi
Customer 4840.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a very special treat!

Customer 4841.Name: 99IW
Customer 4841.Content: Service was great. I had stated that it was my son's 12th bday and they really came through with a choc sundae topped with a candle which really made it quite special for him. Food was good but for the price not so much, although would consider going there again for a special occasion. The food was not the wow factor as much as the experience, although we've been there before.

Customer 4842.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4842.Content:
We visited Seattle over the weekend to see the Dave Matthews Band at the Gorge. On our last night in town we had a nice steak dinner at the Metropolitan Grill (4/Sep/12).

Wine: Pinot Noir, Walnut City Wine Works, Willamette Valley, 2009
Appetizer: Almond Scallops (nice portion size)
Entree: She had the rib eye and I had the filet minion (American Wagyu)
Sides: Asparagus and Poblano Scalloped Potatoes
Desert: Coffee and Choc Lava cake

* The wine was spot on with cherries

* The scalloped potatoes were out of this world

* I noticed absolutely no difference in my filet minion (American Wagyu) from a regular filet minion

* The cake was somewhat dry, not enough 'hot' lava flow, too much sugar

I would definitely recommend it

Customer 4843.Name: JDBSWB
Customer 4843.Content: Extremely pricey while at the same time noteworthy. Obviously one of Seattle's and the Country's finest. Not really sure however that the entire experience is worth the ticket for admission. In the Tampa Bay area this restaurant could not hold a candle value wise or ambience wise to Bern's or Charley's Steak House, but then again I was in Seattle not Tampa Bay.

Customer 4844.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4844.Content: Excellent food and service, outstanding for special occasion.

Customer 4845.Name: kctass
Customer 4845.Content: Mike was our server and made a special occasion even more special. He had a great combination of professionalism, entertainment, attentiveness and knowledge. He was great! The food, as always was delicious! It was a lovely evening.

Customer 4846.Name: WhidbeyDiner
Customer 4846.Content: We look forward to coming back!

Customer 4847.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4847.Content: Server was very friendly and accommodating. Steak was not cooked to our ordering but it's not the server's fault. He went out of his way to treat us well. I appreciate his effort.

Customer 4848.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4848.Content: Food and service are very good. Prices are moderate to high depending on your order. Some of the daily special items can be quite pretentious in their pricing.

Customer 4849.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4849.Content: This is the first time in all the times we have been to the Grill that I can honestly say I was disappointed with our choice. Three of us at the table ordered Prime Rib......only to be told there was none available. My substitute choice was the shrimp scampi with pasta and even tho the flavor was OK the shrimp was very tough.

Customer 4850.Name: Drinksfirstplz
Customer 4850.Content: The Met is a classic steak house with a well-trained waitstaff and terrific bar selection with a huge wine list.

Customer 4851.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4851.Content: The food was great, atmosphere was enjoyable, and the price was high - but worth every penny!

Customer 4852.Name: Mark
Customer 4852.Content: I would expect steak to be great at a steak restaurant but it wasn't very well prepared and I had to send it back.

Customer 4853.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4853.Content: Overall great experience. Staff was perfect in their wine and scotch recommendations and the food was amazing.

Customer 4854.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4854.Content: The most rewarding thing I remembered was how quick our food came out after we had ordered. It was during lunch hour and usually it's always s rush to get out and eat and make it back to the office. I hope the food can always be delivered that quickly.

Customer 4855.Name: DJDM
Customer 4855.Content: Typical old school steak house. Coming from Atlanta we have a lot of steak houses and Metropolitan Grill was nothing special. Booth cushions were old, lighting too bright, prices were over the top for what you get. Waiters at the bar were cooing over the women patrons at the bar. Too many other options in the city to revisit Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 4856.Name: TammyK
Customer 4856.Content:
The food was incredible as always. We brought two friends who had never been there and they thoroughly enjoyed it as well. We were celebrating two anniversaries. The waitstaff was very pleasant and responsive.
We had a couple of questions prior to our visit regarding parking and corkage fees. I sent a couple of emails to the restaurant and the staff was quick to respond to answer my questions.
I love The Met and look forward to my next visit

Customer 4857.Name: Ak98
Customer 4857.Content: Pricey but definitely worth the price

Customer 4858.Name: csgrhg
Customer 4858.Content: VEry expensive and WAY too much food.  Our server suggested a salad and a vegetable.  We didn't realize how much food that was.  Too bad.  I went home so stuffed, I was almost sick.

Customer 4859.Name: FLabrador
Customer 4859.Content: Ambiance and service outstanding. Quality of Porterhouse was fair to good. Not in same league with Wolfgang's in NYC or Prime 112 in Miami Beach. But enjoyed your sister restaurant, Elliott's Oyster House.

Customer 4860.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4860.Content: It Met is the place to go for an important dinner in Seattle.

Customer 4861.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4861.Content: The Met never disappoints. I have been here several times, for happy hour, romantic evenings with my wife, and this past trip was to catch up with an old friend who came into town. I have had several cuts of their steak and they are always cooked exactly how I ask, very juicy and full of flavor. I would highly suggest pairing it with one of their succulent lobster tails. Lots of people may boast about their wine list (which is amazing) but one of my favorite things about the Met is their extensive selection of Scotch. The serving staff has the ability to manage that fine line of being attentive and helpful, yet giving you your space to enjoy your conversation with your guests. Dining at the Met is always great experience.

Customer 4862.Name: mikey1946
Customer 4862.Content: One of the best steak houses I have ever been to. The food was perfectr and the service better but be prepared to pay for it is not inexpensive

Customer 4863.Name: Vissidarte
Customer 4863.Content: It's always a pleasure to sample excellent food, worthy of its price. Above all it's the excellent service from the reception to the assistant waiters. Marilyn tops it all with her personality and flair, making you comfortable and giving you a sense of "you are home now, relax". She is the bestest of best!

Customer 4864.Name: BillC
Customer 4864.Content:
Service was superb and the food was fantastic!

Try the French Onion Soup!!!!

Customer 4865.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4865.Content: We've been to many different restuarants that are suppose to be four stars around the Seattle/Tacoma area and to this day the Met is still the one place that hasn't dissapointed us every time we come. Other restuarants might be good once, but, then the experience is never repeated, except for the Met... so far. Please keep it up!

Customer 4866.Name: theonlymacca
Customer 4866.Content: Love the Met - never disappoints. Great atmosphere, great service and great food.

Customer 4867.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4867.Content: Service was excellent our waiter went out of his way to make my birthday dinner special! The food was really good, but the steak was too salty, and I would have been happy with half the serving of potato if they could add some vegi's.

Customer 4868.Name: Bill
Customer 4868.Content: One of the best steak houses in the nation! Excellent food and service. The staff goes out of their way to make your dining experience wonderful.

Customer 4869.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4869.Content: An all around great experience but it's really all about the steaks, which really can't be beat. Anyone that loves a steakhouse must go at least once.

Customer 4870.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4870.Content: We had the best time at the Met!! The food and service were absolutely superlative! The ambiance was classically chic, warm, inviting, and most importantly, unpretentious. The waiter gave excellent guidance on the menu and the sommelier was adept and friendly. I can't wait to visit again!

Customer 4871.Name: danieru
Customer 4871.Content:
Possibly the best steak I've ever had! We went there for our 1st wedding anniversary celebration and we were not only greeted with a smile but our waiter took care of us and even provided a complimentary Creme Brulee with a small candle!(my wife's favorite dessert).
We're very appreciative at the level of attention to detail on every aspect of our meal experience. We'll be coming back for more delicious steak.

Customer 4873.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4873.Content: Our waitress spent too much time talking to us, interrupting our conversation for a well check. I would have liked her to make her presence known without stopping the conversation.

Customer 4874.Name: Sheila
Customer 4874.Content: My husband and I made last min. reservation using the OpenTable app. We requested booth seating and were given a lovely booth in the back - very romantic! We were told by one of our servers that we sat @ the same booth used by Pres. Bill Clinton. No joke! . If it's of interest to ya, there were lots of framed pictures of movie stars, athletes, politicians and other notable celebrities on the walls all over the restaurant. The food was what you'd expect from a fine steakhouse. I had the prime rib with garlic mashed potatoes and my husband had bacon wrapped fillet and steak house fries. Both our meats were perfectly cooked as we requested (his rare, mine medium). One negative is that my mashed potatoes was too salty.

Customer 4875.Name: Sengdara
Customer 4875.Content: This is a great place to take your special love ones out to. Expect to spend at least $150-200 when dining for two but it's money well spent.

Customer 4876.Name: girlwholovesherseahawks
Customer 4876.Content: Jim was our waiter and the service was great!!!!

Customer 4877.Name: Deee
Customer 4877.Content: Best steak I have had and the cosmo was awesome. Service was excellent. Looking forward to returning.

Customer 4878.Name: MikeW
Customer 4878.Content: Excellent food and service. Great ambiance. My son chose the Met for his birthday dinner and loved it.

Customer 4879.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4879.Content: Excellent food and service. Expensive but with VERY generous portions. Waiter and maitre'd were very attentive. Would absolutely recommend and go again.

Customer 4880.Name: valencia
Customer 4880.Content: The Met is always a good place for specail occassions

Customer 4881.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4881.Content: It was my daughters 18th birthday and even though I informed the restaurant before hand, no one made mention of it at all. That being said. the food was deserving of the reputation. My daughter had the 13 once filet while I had the 12 oz New York. Both were cooked to perfection and were mouth watering good, We also had oysters for the appetizer, and they fell short of expectation. They were small and there were only 6 of them. For $20.00 it seemed they should have been better. As for the service, the waitress was informative but seemed a little rushed and preoccupied. She was nice, but for the prices that your paying, you might expect a little more attention to detail from your server. In closing, go for the steaks, not the service.

Customer 4882.Name: AnthonyA
Customer 4882.Content: No better steak in the country, I mean it!

Customer 4884.Name: LFA1960
Customer 4884.Content: First visit to Metropolitan Grill. Have decided it is now our favorite place for steak in all of Seattle. We will definitely be back.

Customer 4885.Name: luv2eat
Customer 4885.Content: The Met is a wonderful place for lunch. It is quiet and the food & service are always perfect.

Customer 4886.Name: Francine
Customer 4886.Content:
We love this restaurant and each time we are here in Seattle, we always make sure to pay a visit. This time, we tried the rack of lamb. OMG, it was devine! This is our new favorite. We finished this lovely meal with a nice Louis XIII. My only perogative comment is the restaurant should keep some very expensive snifters around for the ones who order such a fine cognac. Besides that, everything is perfect. Our server, the lovely Marla, is very professional, friendly, which we should also include Michael, who's always come and chat for a few moments with us. We cannot wait to go back to Seattle and dine at the Metropoliatain Grill again. 

See you soon

Customer 4887.Name: westseattlediner
Customer 4887.Content: This would have been a perfect experience but for the waitservice we recieved. It got off on the wrong foot and then everything after that just grated on my nerves. Had I been alone I would likely have walked out. I was very disappointed because the food is, quite simply, amazing.

Customer 4888.Name: Brian
Customer 4888.Content: Horrible service and could not honor three different wine choices from their own menu.

Customer 4889.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4889.Content: I have dined at The Met several times. Back in February, I hard the large prime filet and a friend had the bone-in filet. Both of these steaks were off the charts and were the best steaks we have had anywhere in the country. Some collegues of mine went last month and we all ordered the bone-in filet based on how fabulous it was the time before. Sadly, it was not the same. The steaks were smaller and had a considerable amount of fat, way too much for a filet. It was more like a ribeye. Our server knew we weren't satisfied, but offered nothing to make it up. I went again recently, got the lg prime filet, and it was just ok. The Met’s mission is to always “exceed your expectations” but recently, mine were not exceeded or met.

Customer 4890.Name: hungryed
Customer 4890.Content: The Blackened prime rib was too cajun for my taste, but the king crab was excellent. Great deserts. Bring your deep pockets.

Customer 4891.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4891.Content: The food was fantastic. We had the King/Dungeness crab cakes and they were to die for. Both my husband and I had the filet mignon for dinner. It was grilled to perfection. The wait staff, as always, exceeded our expectations.

Customer 4892.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4892.Content: price of the food did not equal the quality. I expected better food. Service was outstanding.

Customer 4893.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4893.Content: You know the food will be good, but the service is always outstanding and was again tonight. As much as I enjoy the beef, the salads at the Met always deliver. Great experience dining here, again.

Customer 4894.Name: BC21
Customer 4894.Content: We've been going to the Met for years and we're never disappointed. Our waiter made the night extra fun though - he had a great personality.

Customer 4895.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4895.Content: As always, Metropolitan Grill exceeds in all areas. Their impeccable customer service and attention to detail made our evening wonderful. The food is amazing and served with such aplomb. One of the most extensive and well-thought out wine lists in Seattle. We will definitely go back!

Customer 4896.Name: JohnP
Customer 4896.Content: Have visited almost yearly for the past 20 years. It used to be a memorable experience but now nothing special. Service and food were nothing special.....and that is what I expect when go there and drop almost $400 for 3 people. Will give the "other guys" a try the next time. We've had better.

Customer 4897.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4897.Content: Waiter a bit unattentive (for the Met).

Customer 4898.Name: Enthralled
Customer 4898.Content: Had a wonderful time and food was excellent. Have been recommended here by frineds and they did not steer me wrong. Will go back in time.

Customer 4899.Name: FLFLFL
Customer 4899.Content: We treat ourselves to the Met once a year or so. Boy is it worth the wait. We don't skimp on anything and we were not disappointed. Oysters, Chateaubriand for Two, Wyagu Beef and Bananas Foster. All cooked to perfection, with outstanding service. We'll be back.

Customer 4900.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4900.Content: The Lobster Bisque is out of this world!

Customer 4901.Name: JamesLBTravels
Customer 4901.Content: The food was outstanding. I had the Delmonico (bone in NY strip) and it was cooked perfectly. The crabcakes were delicious, finally a crab cake that isn't boring! The brussel sprouts were the best I've ever had. The wait staff was extremely friendly and provided excellent service without being stuffy and boring. Can't wait to eat there again and will make it a regular stop when visiting Seattle.

Customer 4902.Name: StefanieG
Customer 4902.Content: They payed special attention to my niece who was celebrating her 13th birthday. It was wonderful to know they read the special note I added when I made the reservations. Fantastic evening!

Customer 4903.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4903.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was absolutely fantastic. I highly recommend stopping in if you are in Seattle. Prepare to spend some money, but you get what you pay for. I am not a wine connoisseur by any means, but the wine steward was top notch and provided the advice I needed within the price point I wanted, all without seeming condescending or stuffy. I cannot speak highly enough about the level of service, high quality, and professionalism.

Customer 4904.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4904.Content: Food and service surpassed expectations. Thank you!

Customer 4905.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4905.Content: Our waiter, Bruno, was spectacular. He was funny and warm, he gave us outstanding recommendations and tended to our every whim. The food was very delicious as we had expected and the whole experience was very positive. It was my fiances birthday and we dressed up nicely but never felt uncomfortable or stuffy. I look forward to coming back again and again.

Customer 4906.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4906.Content:
I got to the Met about once a month. I like the bar.
First time I ordered the Ceasar salad. I didn't care for the anchovies but that a personal taste.
In the past, I have had very good success with the meat. Last night, was a different story but that happens.
The Sommelier was great and did a great job.
My problem was really with service which was really slow. Our waiter dropped a fork on the floor while setting up a table you just don't put it back on it. We asked the next waitress to remove it.
Might have been a bad night but when you leave the Manager a message and an email to provide feedback, you'd think that 3 days later they would reach to you.

Customer 4907.Name: YongChulK
Customer 4907.Content: Went for lunch. We ordered two daily special -- 12oz wagu ground beef. The serving staff was very honest and helpful to recommend us order a small portion of soup and salad and he would split them in two for us. The food was great and really filling. The medium stake was burnt on the skin. Medium-rare was perfect. The dressing on stake was too salty. Other than that, superb service and great food for lunch.

Customer 4908.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4908.Content: Waiter disappeared. Food delayed. Management seemingly absent. Really disappointing.

Customer 4909.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4909.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill feels like a top end steak house from decades ago. Rich wood paneling, tin ceilings, antique style lighting... it will transport you back in time.

The wait staff are in pressed white, long-sleved, button down shirts. The floor management and sommeliers are all in tuxedos.

Food is very good, and our service was excillent! I highly recommend the Cherries Jubilee.

Customer 4910.Name: BobC
Customer 4910.Content: The finest steakhouse in the northwest & one of the best anywhere.

Customer 4911.Name: MichaelB
Customer 4911.Content:
Always great.....special thanks to Tor, who always seems to be there when we are.
Chateaubriand is special.

Customer 4912.Name: dp21
Customer 4912.Content: Special Occasion because it's spendy. Steak was superb, and has now ruined me from being satisfied with anything less! Sides are good, but the meat is the main attraction. Service is top notch; waiter was near but not hovering. Friendly, kind, forever a smile. A definate treat!

Customer 4913.Name: DawnD
Customer 4913.Content: After 25 years - still the best steak in town! Love the Met, is our first choice for special occasion or just a great night with friends. Thanks!

Customer 4914.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4914.Content: Even with a reservation, we waited 30 minutes to be sit it...ouch!

Customer 4915.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4915.Content: Food was amazing!! Definitely would go back! Loved it!

Customer 4916.Name: yogitati
Customer 4916.Content: our server was excellent. Been to the met many times and this was our best experience yet!

Customer 4917.Name: DustinS
Customer 4917.Content: Classic steakhouse, classic ambiance of wood panels

Customer 4918.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4918.Content: Second time coming here and service was still superb! My husband's filet mignon was overcooked and the restaurant cooked him a new one. It was awesome!

Customer 4919.Name: barbrpcv
Customer 4919.Content: Our evening was perfect! We were given a quiet table as requested, the wait staff was wonderful, and the food delicious. At the end of our dinner our waitress brought out a creme brulee for two, on the house, for our anniversary. The Met is truly Seattle's finest for special occasions.

Customer 4920.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4920.Content: There's a reason they call MG one of the best steak houses in the country.  Food and service was impeccable. A must if your in Seattle for a night.

Customer 4921.Name: TheOldones
Customer 4921.Content: Ist time - waited too long to come -an absolute fine dining experience - probably one of the best restaurants we have ever been to.

Customer 4922.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4922.Content: Mashed potatoes and creamed spinach to die for.

Customer 4923.Name: 84fun
Customer 4923.Content: Awesome experience with a fabulous server! All who work at the Metropolitan Grill are top notch.

Customer 4924.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4924.Content: The Metropolitan is absolutely the best steak house on the west coast.

Customer 4925.Name: Cynthia
Customer 4925.Content: Absolutely wonderful time again at The Met. They can do no wrong. And special thanks again to Diane, the best server ever!!

Customer 4926.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4926.Content: I don't know where else to buy Copper River Salmon prepared so perfectly. I always have a good time here. Bartender is most helpful too. Test out the house personal selection label single malts as they are very interesting, especially the Met Selection Bourbon Flight.

Customer 4927.Name: KevinB
Customer 4927.Content: Overall, we were not impressed with their food. The food was good/decent, but for the prices they charge at this place, the food should be really outstanding. We had the Chateaubriand -- which was good -- but fairly bland. We didn't care for the sauce they made for it either. The mashed potatoes were excellent, however. Caesar salad was pretty good. The service was accommodating and terrific. I probably won't be going back. I'd much rather have a great steak at El Gaucho -- where the steaks are way better, in my opinion. (We both had different ribeyes on our last recent visit (regular eye of ribeye and Wagyu) -- which again were good, but not great.) ... Just way too expensive for pretty good (but not outstanding) food.

Customer 4928.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4928.Content: They make you feel special and the food is amazing, custom ordered and hot, hot, hot!

Customer 4929.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4929.Content: The steak and mash potatoes were very flavorful and definitely ranks in the top three for best steaks that I have ever had. I would recommend this restaurant to others.

Customer 4930.Name: LouA
Customer 4930.Content:
Love this place!!!
My all time favorite

Customer 4931.Name: Mike
Customer 4931.Content: Best dinner we've had in Seattle in years!

Customer 4932.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4932.Content: one of our favorite places, thanks.

Customer 4933.Name: Tess
Customer 4933.Content: I want to emphasize that the staff were extremely friendly. Unfortunately, I can not help but comment on how we felt rushed in submitting our order. We were even more disappointed that our dinner arrived while we were eating our appetizers. The hype of this restaurant influenced our high expectations. Unfortunately, they were not met

Customer 4934.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4934.Content: The meal was spectacular. My wife's vegetarian portobello mushroom meal was the best she ever had. I enjoyed my filet very much. The wine was great with the meal!

Customer 4935.Name: GregB
Customer 4935.Content: The ambiance was straight out of the 30s or 40s era. The seating was a bit tight, and had someone directly behind me very close. Wait staff was excellent, they seem to enjoy their work even at around retirement age and are very eager to please and social. Food was excellent. The only downer is the prices are very high. Probably 30% higher than other excellent restaurants that I've been to in the area. It's definitely worth checking out, but for me, once is enough. Too expensive for regular visits.

Customer 4936.Name: roberta
Customer 4936.Content: My friend and I meet for lunch at the Metropolitan Grill periodically. We always have excellent service and the salads are delicious. Thank you for another terrific lunch.

Customer 4937.Name: Purplenor
Customer 4937.Content: The Met was one of my favorite restaurants for years and that has changed because the value for the money spent is not worth it. The service is always great but the same business scheme and the lack of quality management personnel is not desirable. I am surprised that this establishment is listed in magazines due to it's mediocre existence.

Customer 4938.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4938.Content: We had a really nice time... we will go back again but because of the higher price end it will not be a regular place

Customer 4939.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4939.Content: I really do enjoy the Met. The only reason I gave the food and service a lower rating this time is because my steak was not cooked properly. I ordered medium rare and the steak came out medium well. that is a big difference. This being a steak place, that was dissapointing to have my steak come out wrong. I split the lower rating between the service and the food since I am not sure if waitress or the cooks were the ones who made the mistake.

Customer 4940.Name: NNMM
Customer 4940.Content: For the price of the entrees at the Met, I expect near-perfection. That was not the case with the Delmonico steak. It was neither tender, nor flavorful. The long bone that we also ordered was wonderful.

Customer 4941.Name: SaraSaraT
Customer 4941.Content: Food is impeccable. Our server made a rather rude comment to my boyfriend that was super uncalled for, but otherwise everything was really good.

Customer 4942.Name: Gourmand
Customer 4942.Content: Group of four and we all had wonderful meals! It was lovely and a very compfy atmosphere. We will be back!

Customer 4943.Name: TracyN
Customer 4943.Content: Outstanding. One of the best steak houses in the City. Can't go wrong when you have out of town guests. Great service paired with delicious cuts of meat.

Customer 4944.Name: Barbarah
Customer 4944.Content: We have had the same server the last two times and he is such a pleasure to have. His name is Jurgen.

Customer 4945.Name: coquine
Customer 4945.Content: my favorite restaurant in the city! best food, best atmosphere, best service!

Customer 4946.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4946.Content: For the price that we paid, I would have expected MUCH more from this restaurant in every aspect. There were four of us that ordered steaks, and non of the four steaks were cooked correctly. The mediums were rare, the rare was medium. It was very backwards. The worst offense was my 18 ounce ribeye, which was about 60% fat. A decent amount of marbling and fat is necessary for flavor, but this was just pushing the limit. The prawns in the prawn martini were tough and overcooked. Everything else (the sides and other appetizers) was great, but nothing to write home about. I wanted to love this place, I really did. Unfortunately it just didnt live up to the expectations one would expect from a $600 bill for dinner.

Customer 4947.Name: BK23
Customer 4947.Content:
Both chateaubriands were a bit over-cooked. In both cases we ate them because they weren't grossly overdone. The medium rare came medium. The one that was supposed to be between medium rare and medium was medium or medium plus. On the other hand the filet, which was supposed to be medium rare, was very rare-gelatinous red throughout.

Unusual miss (let alone three of them)for the Met.

Customer 4948.Name: JohnH
Customer 4948.Content: Fantastic night with phenomenal food with class.

Customer 4949.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4949.Content: A fun stop for happy hour or dinner.  Traditional steak house fare with an upscale atmosphere.  The lobster bisque is out of this world.  Our server was fantastic and our overall experience a good one.

Customer 4950.Name: Poz59
Customer 4950.Content:
Excellent choice of Prime Steaks from Porterhouse to Ny Strio and Filet Mignon. Special Wagayu steaks offered as well. All four of our steaks were perfectly cooked. Scallops appetiser was amazing. Steaks are all aged, some dry aged and some wet. Tender and tasty.

Wine list is extensive and the wine stewards helped us with our choices, recommending reasonably priced value wines.

Customer 4951.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4951.Content: Top notch steaks are served here. This place is usually out of my price range. They have very good service. Our waiter was very knowledgeable.

Customer 4952.Name: FredW
Customer 4952.Content: This place was one of our favorites until this last visit. Service was less than professional. The food was lacking in the usual special touches, and the salad was very light in dressing. We have always felt pampered in the past. This time we were left waiting to get the attention from our server who always seemed to be pre-occupied with her favorite tables. We have always accepted this restaurant as higher end, willing to pay more, but I feel they have dropped into the category of average.

Customer 4953.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4953.Content: Best steak in Seattle, never disappoints! You always get what you pay for.

Customer 4954.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4954.Content: We were a group of six and it took a little bit longer to decide what to order. The waitress seemed to be somewhat impatient.

Customer 4955.Name: DianeKK
Customer 4955.Content: I am from the Midwest corn fed beef country, so I don't say this lightly . . . best steak in town!

Customer 4957.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4957.Content: We went as a celebration - my boyfriend had completed the full Seattle marathon and he likes a good steak dinner after all marathons. We're from Chicago where there are lots of great steakhouses and this was probably the best of all we've eaten at.

Customer 4958.Name: KenT
Customer 4958.Content: Too expensive to make it a regular dining option, but can't be beat for a special occasion.

Customer 4959.Name: Bartonstein
Customer 4959.Content: Been here twice from out of state for anniversaries. Amazing food and service, almost like something you would see in a movie. Only place I have ever been that I couldnt finish a meal...twice.

Customer 4960.Name: PUGG
Customer 4960.Content: Everything was wonderful. We met the manager and he was extremely friendly and cared about our dining experience! Our waiter was attentive and had a good sense of humor and personality. We only dine at the Met when we are in the city but its ALWAYS worth it!!

Customer 4961.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4961.Content: Nice treat for our carnivorous middle school graduates and our out of town guests! My first trip and will not be my last.

Customer 4962.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4962.Content: Came back for our 10th anniversary. It felt like being back there 10 yrs ago. Excellent food and service. Almost couldn't finish my meal because I ate too much.

Customer 4963.Name: Shellshokd
Customer 4963.Content: Very expensive for what you get ... The dining room is kind of "cold" and corporate.

Customer 4964.Name: dot2dot3
Customer 4964.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is the place to go for a memorable special occasion. The food is excellent and the ambiance is wonderful. Our filet mignon was cooked perfectly and was very tender. The service was outstanding!

Customer 4965.Name: thoughtitover
Customer 4965.Content: Excellent, as always. In my opinion, the Metropolitan is the best steak house in the Northwest.

Customer 4966.Name: Fuzzybear
Customer 4966.Content: Food and service was fantastic as usual.

Customer 4967.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4967.Content: We celebrated Father's Day at the Grill. The steaks were awesome! Service was excellent. We would certainly go there again for special occasions like this.

Customer 4968.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4968.Content: While the steaks are always terrific sometimes the noise is a bit much for my personal taste. I prefer Morton's for ambience and their Friday/Saturday night prime rib is the best; though the Cheatubriand at "The Met" is pretty hard to beat as far as a steak goes.

Customer 4969.Name: IrvingB
Customer 4969.Content: This was our seventh visit and it only better each time. Service starts at front door and continue until you leave. The staff was very notable with everything on menu. The cuts of meat were outstanding. Everything was cooked the way you ordered.The whole meal was a eating experince..Looking forward to next visit.

Customer 4970.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4970.Content: The food was amazing and the service wonderful! We had crab cakes for an appetizer which were the best I've ever had, followed by a delicious steak, and banana foster for dessert! That dessert is a must have if you go there!!

Customer 4971.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4971.Content: Had a great table with a fantastic waiter. Food was a little slow to be served but over all a very worthwhile restaurant to choose.

Customer 4972.Name: JoeG
Customer 4972.Content: It was, without a doubt, one of the best steaks I've eaten in my life. The wine list is impressive, amazing selection of domestic & foreign wines.

Customer 4973.Name: coquine
Customer 4973.Content: my favorite restaurant! best food and best service anywhere!

Customer 4975.Name: MarieO
Customer 4975.Content: Excellent prime beef prepared correctly, simply! Wait staff is helpful and attentive. Amazing wine list. Pricey, so definitely a special occasion restaurant.

Customer 4976.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4976.Content: The Met's Waygu is the best steak in town, bar none. I've eaten at El Gaucho, Capitol Grille, Ruth Criss, Mortons and the fillet at the Met blows them all away!

Customer 4977.Name: KellyL
Customer 4977.Content: The food is consistently amazing at the Metropolitan Grill. You will never be disappointed with your meal or the service they provide.

Customer 4978.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4978.Content: We were late and called ahead, very accomadating.

Customer 4979.Name: VentureDave
Customer 4979.Content: i think I'm done with this place. They were out of the Wagyu I asked for. The New York Strip I ended up ordering was late (we sat there for an hour and a half) and over-cooked.

Customer 4980.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4980.Content:
First time visit to the restaurant to celebrate two birthdays.
The interior was elegant with dark wood and green upholstery.
Service was superb. He was very attentive to our needs.
The steaks and prime rib were the best we all had ever eaten.
A great place for a special occasion dining experience.

Customer 4981.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4981.Content: I had yet another wonderful experience at The Met. The service is always above and beyond expectations, and this includes ALL the staff. From the person opening the door, to the person boxing up your food. Their customer service is definitely something that keeps us coming back, in addition to the wonderful food!

Customer 4982.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4982.Content: The starches weren't all that good. The bread was slow to arrive and kind of dry. The baked potatos were under done, and there was no BACON. But, the salads were good, the crab cakes excellent and carrot cake was wonderfull. The steaks were just marvelous. And the whole point of our trip was the steaks, not bread and potatos.

Customer 4983.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4983.Content: We dressed for our dinner out and we were surprised to see many people in casual clothes. I've lived here less than a year and am used to certain restaurants requiring a jacket and tie. Apparently, that is not the case in Seattle. The wine list is extensive and expensive. We brought our 1981 Chateau Margaux and they decanted it for a $20 corkage fee. The only other Chateau Margaux they had on the list was a 1983 vintage for $1,600. There are a few, but not many, drinkable wines for under $100 per bottle. The steaks we ordered medium rare and they were cooked perfectly, red all the way through and warm. Side dishes were ok but nothing special. Bananas Foster was delicious for dessert.

Customer 4984.Name: GailM
Customer 4984.Content: Good food and attentive service. Noisey and not very intimate. Plan that it will be expensive. The portions are large; even the small orders would serve two women. Because of the price I wouldn't rate it as a favorite.

Customer 4985.Name: Maxi
Customer 4985.Content: Once we got over the prices we had a great time. If we'd known what to expect it wouldn't have been such a shock. Luckily we were not really hungry having snacked ourselves silly at a ballgame so we split a steak. It was FABULOUS and staff could not have been better, sending my half back for a bit more cooking.

Customer 4986.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4986.Content: Excellent service and ambiance. Food was just okay. My pork chop was small, dry and chewy. Salads and coffee were very good.

Customer 4987.Name: snowboardjoe
Customer 4987.Content: My first time for our anniversary and it was a wonderful experience.  Everything was very pricey, but the food and service was excellent.  Steaks were wonderfully delicious and the Banana Foster's was a delightful end to the meal.

Customer 4988.Name: gscotthj
Customer 4988.Content: First time at Met Grill, great food, great service.

Customer 4989.Name: RobertS
Customer 4989.Content: Great service by the staff and our food was delicious. I brought clients to the Met and they were both satisfied and happy with their meal.

Customer 4990.Name: JeromeC
Customer 4990.Content: Food and service was excellent. We had a special occasion and were treated like family!

Customer 4991.Name: mensan98th
Customer 4991.Content: Top-notch food and service. We were quite glad to find it during our trip to Seattle.

Customer 4992.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4992.Content: Just for fun, I had the comparison 4 oz filets -- Wagyu-Natural beef and their regular prime beef. Both were excellent and perfectly cooked to my taste. This was probably the best steak that I have had. Each steak was different and our server described them to us ahead of time exactly as they tasted so it was not a surprise but a good experience.

Customer 4993.Name: Scuba63
Customer 4993.Content: Best Blackened Prime Rib I have every had1

Customer 4994.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4994.Content: After enjoying this restaurant 10 years ago, I was skeptical to return. Like an old band, I wondered how it would do after maturing. I am happy to report this visit was just as enjoyable as previously remebered. The steak was the same juicy, cooked to perfection, wonder I had enjoyed on my last visit. Bravo!

Customer 4995.Name: ChristieH
Customer 4995.Content: We expected much more from a restaurant with such high prices - $56 for a 6 oz filet is ridiculous. My ordered filet was for medium. What I got was medium rare at the center, and I could not finish it. I did not send it back because the overall flavor of the filet was not worth the wait. The ambiance does not compare with that of Ruth's Chris. Too much noise, no low lighting. We go to Seattle often, and when there again we will have dinner elsewhere. There is a Ruth's Chris at Pine and 8th, that is where we will dine. This was an overall disappointment as we met family members there, whom we have not seen for many years. They had not eaten there before, and we were embarrassed by our choice.

Customer 4996.Name: arikohn
Customer 4996.Content: A block from our office, dynamite service, good food

Customer 4997.Name: BellevueSteve
Customer 4997.Content: Absolutely love Met Grill - the food is fantastic and the service unbeatable!

Customer 4998.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4998.Content: Everything was very good. Service and food ! Really great steaks!

Customer 4999.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 4999.Content: It remains our most favorite place to dine especially on special occasions!

Customer 5000.Name: Susan
Customer 5000.Content: Dinner was fantastic! The crab claws with cocktail sauce appetizer is my favorite!

Customer 5001.Name: AndrewB
Customer 5001.Content: We went expecting excellent food and The Met delivered. It was the service though that really stood out; the staff was friendly and knowledgeable without hovering.

Customer 5002.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5002.Content: The overall experice was wonderful.(Our first time there).Service is exceptionally good, but it should be for the $$. Chateau Briand, was excellent, and the Metropolitan Mashed was the best I've ever eaten! What's in that stuff? I'll be "cravin'it fortnightly",till I have more.

Customer 5003.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5003.Content: Great service. Excellent food. Very knowledgeable waiter. We made the right choice coming here with friends for a birthday and anniversary celebration.

Customer 5004.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5004.Content: I can't think of any "Special Features" related to this restaurant. Very ordinary. Nothing romantic about it - nothing elegant about it either. I don't mind casual dining - if I'm expecting it.

Customer 5005.Name: doug
Customer 5005.Content: Excellent place for business related meals. Wait staff is outstanding as is the food and wine selection. One of the top three steak joints, I have dined at over the past 10 years. The others being St Elmos in Indy and Rosebuds in Chicago.

Customer 5006.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 5006.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is just a wonderful place to have any special occasion. We celebrated my daughters 20 birthday and she felt very special! There was eight of us and we had a 2 year old toddler and everyone was treated very special! The food and service was exceptional! Justin (our server) and Craig (Maitre 'D) left nothing to chance! I highly recommend this restaurant for a celebration of anyone special in your life!

Customer 5007.Name: MattM
Customer 5007.Content: Dinner was amazing, great steaks, service was great!!

Customer 5008.Name: M2RMukilteo
Customer 5008.Content: I've eaten beef in many of the finest restaurants, and this is by far my favorite! The quality of the beef, along with cooking methods and seasonings are superb!!!

Customer 5009.Name: foodforthought
Customer 5009.Content:
Just a GREAT steak and seafood joint! Terrific clams/chorizo appetizer, top quality steaks/preparation, good selection of sides, bartenders who know how to make a drink, nice tableside desert presentation bananas foster (good as Brennans!), cherries jubilee, apple cobbler. High energy; it was packed by 6:00 on a Wednesday. Server was long time pro, good advice, no pretentiousness.....a pleasure. Excellent value for the money!
I've been going back every Seattle trip for 10 years.

Customer 5010.Name: Mark
Customer 5010.Content: Awesome. A must every time I'm in downtown Seattle.

Customer 5011.Name: Wally
Customer 5011.Content: Once again another great dinner at the best Steakhouse in America. Thanks

Customer 5012.Name: Mark
Customer 5012.Content: The evening was absolutly great. Execlent food, service, and crowd.

Customer 5013.Name: BBBo
Customer 5013.Content: Love the Met Grill. Fantastic food, great service.

Customer 5014.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5014.Content: Great food and service though pretty noisy

Customer 5015.Name: Kelliw
Customer 5015.Content: This is my 4th time here. The food, service, and everything in general has never disappointed me! I tell everyone I know how outstanding this restaurant is!

Customer 5016.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5016.Content: I loved the food here. I had the salmon and it was very good and huge portions. I am not a steak eater and they had many other items that I can eat here. My boyfriend had steak and lobster and he said the lobster was very sweet and tender. We ate here for my boyfriend's birthday and had a wonderful time here. We were very impressed and will definitely come back.

Customer 5017.Name: kctass
Customer 5017.Content: We had a great experience! Food, service, ambiance.....all were superb!

Customer 5018.Name: Bill
Customer 5018.Content: Clearly, one of my favorites in the USA. The Met has outstanding food, polished service and a wine list that is incredible. You will not be disappointed in any way.

Customer 5019.Name: FoodTraveler
Customer 5019.Content: A memorable place for the most special occasions.

Customer 5020.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5020.Content:
We celebrated my birthday. It was terrific. The waiter was solicitous and welcoming. The service was fast and the food was very good. This is the second time I have gone to the Metropolitan Grill for a special occasion. Both times were wonderful.
The kitchen staff supports special requests like splitting orders between to diners. Their steak salad was outstanding!
This restaurant will stay on my list of favorite places to go!

Customer 5021.Name: HansJ
Customer 5021.Content: Had lunch once per week for 25 years and food was exceptional. Because of move, had not been for 5 years. Really gone downhill. Service was poor, food not cooked to order and generally not good experience. Very disappointing.

Customer 5022.Name: JandT
Customer 5022.Content: Gigantic, well prepared, tender and flavorful steaks. Not cheap, in fact pretty expensive, but if you are interested in a steak restaurant that offers really great steaks and you are not budget centric this is a great choice. Service was outstanding as well.

Customer 5023.Name: Jenn
Customer 5023.Content: This is the ultimate steakhouse from its classic decor and prime cuts of beef to impeccable service offered by knowledgeable and personable staff. I highly recommend The Metropolitan Grill for groups of all sizes as well as intimate dinners.

Customer 5024.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5024.Content: Both my date and I had a wonderful time, easy transition from bar to being seated, Diane was amazing with the amount of options when we sat down and explained everything from the different cuts of meat to the different types of beef for our steaks. The choices of steak were incredible, and we received exactly what we were looking for in our New York steaks. The courses came out at exactly the right times, with nothing left to be desired. Excellent time!

Customer 5025.Name: BruceJackie
Customer 5025.Content: Although the cost is "up there" the food and service never disappoint. Every bite of our 8-oz filet mignons was delicious, butter-tender, and cooked to perfection.

Customer 5026.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5026.Content: Metropolitan grill truely a Seattle classic that never fails to impress. Amazing service from valet to dessert. The steaks and appetizers from the fresh list were amazing. They had a great wine selection and top notch employees. We dropped about $500 for 4 well worth every penny! Thanks metropolitan grill for always coming through!

Customer 5027.Name: RRG1
Customer 5027.Content: Excellent as always. The Chateaubriand served tablesade for 2 is absolutely wonderful and would recomend to anyone looking for that over the top beef experience. Coupled with a great bottle of red wine, it simply doesn't get much better.

Customer 5028.Name: Traveler
Customer 5028.Content: Old time steakhouse without the stuffiness. Excellent appetizers and steaks.

Customer 5029.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5029.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is worth the drive to Seattle from British Columbia!

Customer 5030.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5030.Content: Fabulous location to dine and ENJOY. We have been there many times. Excellent attention to detail by staff!!

Customer 5031.Name: visitingdiner
Customer 5031.Content: Classic Seattle steak house. Extensive wine list. Seriously good service.

Customer 5032.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5032.Content: We had a burger and a sandwich, they were really salty...

Customer 5033.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5033.Content: had the best meal in years...excellent steaks .....Service was Fantastic .....always the finest dining experience in the Northwest...

Customer 5034.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5034.Content:
A great place to dine. The service is always very good the few times we dined there, the waiter would frequently check up on us and fulfill whatever need we had. Tried everything on the menu except the steaks and all tasted great.(at a reasonable price for place in Downtown Seattle.) There are a few paid parking place around and I think they do offer Parking service as well.(may want to call the restaurant to make sure)

I would highly recommend it to anyone who plan to dine in Seattle.

Customer 5035.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5035.Content: We had a wonderful time. We took our two young employees here for Easter dinner. It was an experience they will never forget. They were surprised, and talked about it all the way home on the ferry!!

Customer 5036.Name: thomas3
Customer 5036.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a classic high-end steak house. The building used to be a bank so it has some neat interior architectural features that have been preserved; we sat in a booth, was very comfortable. The menu is fairly standard with options of choosing different types of steak depending on the origin, being in Seattle, there were more seafood options than you would normally see on a steak house menu. Ordered a 1/2 bottle of wine, the sommelier brought it, but said it had gone bad and brought a recommended replacement. We had the Prime Filet and American Wagyu Filet; did not notice that the Wagyu was significantly better than the Prime, both were excellent. The side of sauteed spinach was overly salty, but tasty.

Customer 5037.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5037.Content: Unless you're accustomed to eating top quality steak, the Met is an incredibly fulfilling experience. A pure, straightforward, no frills meal. The steak was unbelievably tender and had excellent flavor. Likewise, the accompanying salads, drinks, and side items were satisfying and tasty. An all-around good time.

Customer 5038.Name: chrisjg
Customer 5038.Content: Pricey, but the food and service was excellent.

Customer 5039.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5039.Content: Some of the best steaks we have had, anywhere! We had a variety of seafood appetizers to start and they were all great, esp the curry mussels. The filet mignon entrees were melt-in-your-mouth tender and cooked to a perfect medium-rare. Our server was great and was very patient as we took a little too long to make our choice from the extensive menu, and answered all our questions happily. The hot apple pie - a deconstructed apple pie - was made at our table with flamee and tasted fantastic, but one order was enough to feed our table of four. Servings are very generous, steaks are fantastic and service is great. Definitely will go back next time we're in Seattle!

Customer 5040.Name: George
Customer 5040.Content: Had a great steak, and the service was great. My only complaint was being seated at a table in the middle of the dining room, near the kitchen and entrance to the "Boardroom" dining room. There was a constant flow of wait staff and patrons past our table. This was an anniversary dinner, and the ambiance was definitely not romantic. Reserve a booth.

Customer 5041.Name: new2ballard
Customer 5041.Content: Had a medium-rare filet mignon that was great paired with a local Washington wine. Service was excellent as waitress knew when to not interupt conversation (it was a business dinner) and how to gauge our group. Overall, it was an excellent experience.

Customer 5042.Name: thoughtitover
Customer 5042.Content: Excellent, as always. Side vegetables--in our case, asparagus and brussels sprouts-- were especially good this time. Minor complaint: My perfectly done steak was slightly over-salted for my taste. Next time I will ask to have it grilled with a little less salt.

Customer 5043.Name: jay0u
Customer 5043.Content: Great find in the Heart of Downtown Seattle. Quality Steaks! Quality Sides!

Customer 5044.Name: Elle
Customer 5044.Content: The service is excellent. You are greeted right away, and if you make reservations, your table is ready in seconds. The wait staff is friendly and will get you whatever you want, quickly. My husband and I are not big on steak; this is a steakhouse, but we heard it was good, so we had to try it. I got the Alaska King Salmon, and it was excellent- cooked to perfection. My husband got the grass-fed steak and it was really good. We will definitely come back!

Customer 5045.Name: laitsabr
Customer 5045.Content: As always, Metropolitan Grill delivers the goods. The American Wagyu selections were succulent and cooked to the desired temperatures. Service was impeccable and attentive. We had a great time again.

Customer 5046.Name: Sometimes
Customer 5046.Content: When you are looking for steak, look no further as the MET is steak at its best. Try the Bourbon Ice Cream, its amazing as a finish for a big meal.

Customer 5047.Name: tubbyfat
Customer 5047.Content: Noisy. Had to change seats for quieter table. Expensive for what you get. $64 for NY strip? I actually preferred Morton's for taste.

Customer 5048.Name: SteakLover
Customer 5048.Content: Well worth the price. We always get the Chateau Briand and are never disappointed!

Customer 5049.Name: Hellboy
Customer 5049.Content:
Always great service, food, and special care from Carmen and the staff.
Thank you!

Customer 5050.Name: VitorV
Customer 5050.Content: The service and professionalism of the staff were outstanding.

Customer 5051.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5051.Content: Awesome wine list. The steaks are good, but they are huge, everybody ended up with to-go boxes. Same with the banana foster and the chocolate cake! The flambé person is very nice and friendly.

Customer 5052.Name: ChrisB
Customer 5052.Content: The food was good. Bar service was very good. Restaurant service was average. Food was pretty expensive for what was delievered.

Customer 5053.Name: PalmSpringDiner
Customer 5053.Content: Food is always wonderful. The 35 day aged serloin was absolutely to die for. Unfortunately, the booth that we were seated in was so small that we had a hard time enjoying our meal. Never had this problem before.

Customer 5054.Name: Michele
Customer 5054.Content: This is one of my all time favorate restaurants in Seattle. As far as steak houses in the area go, it is the only place that always cooks my meat exactly the way I order it, and everything is always very flavorful. The place has a very energetic noise level, but the acoustics are such that you can easily have a quiet, private conversation with your dining companion(s). They also have an excellent happy hour, and it turns out it is one of the least expensive happy hours in the city (average price for a dinner size portion is $5). I highly recommend this to any steak lover, and will go so far as to say it's the best steak house in Seattle, and I've been to all the big names!

Customer 5055.Name: BobBob
Customer 5055.Content: Really is the"best" steak in town.

Customer 5056.Name: Mark
Customer 5056.Content: Classic chop house. Great food, prepared simply, served in a traditional and elegant atmosphere.

Customer 5057.Name: Christin
Customer 5057.Content: The Rack of Lamb for two was awesome and the service terrific. They made every effort to get us out in time to catch our show even though we arrived a bit late.

Customer 5058.Name: Dian
Customer 5058.Content: The Metropolitan Grill never disappoints! Consistency, is always the key, and in all the areas, food, service, ambiance....

Customer 5059.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5059.Content: service was quite good however they could not figure out how to use a VISA gift card I wanted to use for payment. The sirloin steak was only ok. I was expecting "knock your socks off flavor" The Walla Walla Vintner Cab was wonderful

Customer 5060.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5060.Content: BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER EATEN!!!!!!!

Customer 5061.Name: wanana
Customer 5061.Content: Always great service, and tasty food!! Our #1 place to dine!!

Customer 5063.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5063.Content: Snake River Wagyu/Angus beef was outstanding...best I've ever had. Appetizers, sides were good but not exceptional. Spruce up the accompaniments to the level of the beef and MG would be truly exceptional.

Customer 5064.Name: Marcella
Customer 5064.Content: I dream of The Metropolitan Grill between visits to Seattle. I live in Australia and they do not understand what makes a great steak;I have given up even trying to buy a good steak at the butchers or at a restaurant, regardless of its class. As a steak lover, this means long dry spells between trips to Seattle. Several trips ago, I took a friend to dinner at the Metropolitan Grill and our Server recommended the chateaubriand. From then on that is what I order. It is heavenly, the tableside service and the Cliff sauce is superb. I always make our bookings before leaving home to assure a table. We'll be there again in October.

Customer 5065.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5065.Content: The Metropolitan does not disappoint as a standard steakhouse. It does not impress, either. The cauliflower was doused in cheese sauce and bread crumbs, the mushrooms were over salted. From the onset, the was waitress pushy for a big ticket, but as the night progressed forgot items we ordered. I wasn't impressed, but then again, being a local I seldom visit tourist destinations such as this anyway.

Customer 5066.Name: TinaC
Customer 5066.Content:
The food was excellent! Steaks were cooked to perfection. The crab cakes appetizer were the best we've ever had!!
Service was outstanding from the moment we walked in the door.

Customer 5067.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5067.Content: We really enjoyed our dining experience here! It was our first visit and we will definitely come back. The food was fantastic along with the staff (very helpful, friendly and professional).

Customer 5068.Name: diner
Customer 5068.Content: Always top notch food and service.

Customer 5069.Name: ThomasM
Customer 5069.Content: Not as good as usual. Not sure what was missing.

Customer 5070.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5070.Content: The "old world charm" atmosphere was cozy - loved all the woodwork and warm lighting. The food was fabulous - really enjoyed your filet mignon...definitely the "best steak in town". When we're back in Seattle, we would definitely try to come by again for dinner. Our server was a gem, very helpful and friendly.

Customer 5071.Name: RobB
Customer 5071.Content: Food was great - as expected from Met Grill! Service was also great - as expected from Met Grill. I'm not sure I'll use the open table reservation system again. Table placement in the back next to the kitchen area was a little unexpected from the service. Ambiance at that placement was a little less than top notch.

Customer 5072.Name: MichealT
Customer 5072.Content: This is not our first visit to the Metropolitan, service was outstanding and the food was the same. Great ambience!

Customer 5073.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5073.Content: Hands down the best restaurant in Seatle. And it goes way beyond the superb steaks - I had beef stroganoff for lunch & it was fabulout.

Customer 5074.Name: susang
Customer 5074.Content: Not as noisy as usual. Server was wonderful and food was great

Customer 5075.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5075.Content: I am a huge steak eater. I've eaten a steak just about every week for the last 6 years. The porterhouse I had at the Metropolitan Grill was easily the best steak I ever had that wasn't kobe beef. The steak was so tender and juicy that I could have cut it with a spork. The waiter was very informative and always there if I needed anything. It's a little pricy but if you ever want to spoil yourself with a great steak I HIGHLY recommend the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 5076.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5076.Content: Steak was cooked to perfection. Wine was amazing. My girlfriend and I had a very romantic anniversary. We will be going back soon.

Customer 5077.Name: SteveS
Customer 5077.Content: We were dissappointed. The restaurant was very loud, the tables were cramped, and service was average. Food was fine but not stellar. Steaks didn't live up to the hype. Bananas Foster was average. For our next special occassion we will go elsewhere. There are better restaurants in the price range.

Customer 5078.Name: AZStu
Customer 5078.Content: Good food, but for the price would expect better food and service. Also, was quite crowded (tables too close together)and noisy. The Malbec on the short suggested wine list was excellent and reasonably priced.

Customer 5079.Name: DarY
Customer 5079.Content: Excellent food as usual. I always seem to order your steak sandwich. Generous portion, and the meat is cooked to perfection. The birthday dessert was a very nice touch. Your coconut cake is one of my favorites there.

Customer 5080.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5080.Content: They took care to get us a great table, made it known that it was a Valentines dinner make up which impressed my wife and Mike who had been there for 14 plus years shared stories with us on his time there and some of the people he has met.

Customer 5081.Name: Mimi
Customer 5081.Content: Wildly expensive, and I was on an expense account

Customer 5082.Name: TonyGirl
Customer 5082.Content: Have been there many times, and this was one of the most perfect dining experiences I have ever had at the Metropolitan Grill. The food was perfect, the service was wonderful.

Customer 5083.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5083.Content: This is a steak house but if you must have seafood, order the fresh trout vs. the frozen salmon.

Customer 5084.Name: sunshine
Customer 5084.Content: Great food as always. They could turn our table twice with quicker service. We don't drink and would like just to eat and leave no need to sit for two plus hrs.

Customer 5085.Name: Leslie
Customer 5085.Content: The knowledgeable and excellent wait staff makes the difference.

Customer 5086.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5086.Content: We had a great time celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary!

Customer 5087.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5087.Content: The food was wonderful - we had the filet that was melt in your mouth tender. This is definitely a special occasion restaurant. And we plan to have special occasions a little more frequently so we can visit!

Customer 5088.Name: Sylvia
Customer 5088.Content: Steaks were awesome. The lemon pear drop is tasty and definitely worth a try. Amazing wine list! Only detractor of the meal was that the salmon was a little dry.

Customer 5089.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5089.Content: The food was simply outstanding. The pork chops and prime rib were two of the best my wife and I have had. It is truly on of the great steak houses in the United States. The asparagus was outstanding.

Customer 5090.Name: roberta
Customer 5090.Content: My friend and I had another wonderful and delicious lunch. The food and service are always delicious and professional. We enjoy meeting for lunch at Metropolitan Grill. We'll be back. It's classy and classic!

Customer 5091.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5091.Content: Classic steakhouse with that woody clubby atmosphere. Really good beef dishes that are quintessential American food.

Customer 5092.Name: WolfgangS
Customer 5092.Content:
I expected a much better steak from a steak house being promoted to among be the 10 best steak houses of North America.
The steaks at the Outback are as good for half the price.
The steaks at the 111 Chop House in Worcester are much better!

Customer 5093.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5093.Content: It's a bit noisy, but the food makes up for that. Always a treat!

Customer 5094.Name: rbastian
Customer 5094.Content:
My steak was over-sauced and the bread was stale.

Wasn't worth the $.

Customer 5095.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5095.Content: A Seattle institution that does not disappoint! Great steaks & seafood. Wonderful wine list, too.

Customer 5096.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5096.Content: I eat a lot of steak, and I gotta say... that was some excellent steak. I've eaten at Ruth's Chris, Mortons, Smith and Wollensky, and numerous local steak places, and I've never had a better porterhouse than the one I had at the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 5097.Name: Thomas
Customer 5097.Content: Great Steak, consitent quality for many years

Customer 5098.Name: jkid
Customer 5098.Content: We had the pleasure of dining at The Met again this year for their annual "Have Dinner on Us". It's a great deal that Consolidated Restaurants offers every year and we always love taking them up on it. The steaks are divine, the service is fantastic and we'll definitely be back, again and again!

Customer 5099.Name: JoelH
Customer 5099.Content: My steak was wonderful however my dates was ordered Medium Rare came out Medium well. If it wasn't for that I would have given a better review.

Customer 5100.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5100.Content:
Another fabulous meal and enjoyable evening at the Met! Thank you!

The Dooleys

Customer 5101.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5101.Content: A great experience as always. Expensive but worth it. Only downside; felt a little rushed.

Customer 5102.Name: JoeH
Customer 5102.Content: Overall the Met has the WOW factor, great food, service, location.

Customer 5103.Name: diner24
Customer 5103.Content: I was expecting a lot based on prior reviews and was sadly disappointed. The service was excellent, but the food was a let down. I ordered the $57 wagyu boneless ribeye and was expecting the best steak I ever ate. But it was very average and ridiculously salty. It was not worth the money.

Customer 5104.Name: DawnLJ
Customer 5104.Content: Our server Derek was great! We have had him on more than one occasion and he is always so pleasant. When he asked if we would like to hear the specials, we told him we already knew what we wanted. He instantly replied, "The cap steak right?" He remembered us from the last time we were there, then asked us our names so he could great us by name the next time. In today's world, customer service has taken a nose dive. It's always a pleasure to receive service that exceeds expectations. You have a gem in Derek. He does your restaurant justice.

Customer 5105.Name: Mradovic
Customer 5105.Content: We've been to Met many times, though not within past 5-6 years. I made a reservation few weeks in advance noting that we are celebrating anniversary. So I was very disappointed with several things – They let our guests sit at the table for 15 minutes my wife and I were late), plus once we were there, they wouldn’t approach us for another 20 minutes!? My wife struggled with the bouquet of flowers, no one paid attention whatsoever. Finally she let them sit at one of the side table. I was not happy with the table assigned – it was in the middle of main path, very busy place. With weeks of advance reservation they should have done it better.

Customer 5106.Name: laitsabr
Customer 5106.Content: My wife and I celebrated our belated 22nd Valentine together. It was a wonderful evening, and with the dinner-on-us deal, we get to go again with our family this time for our Anniversary coming up in a few months.

Customer 5107.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5107.Content: The food and service was amazing. We were there for a birthday celebration and the waiter made the event very special for everyone.

Customer 5108.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5108.Content: Our experience at "The Met" was fantastic. Thank you to our server, Regi, for being the icing on this cake.

Customer 5109.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5109.Content: Excellent food and fast service and the staff is very professional and friendly.A+++++ will definatley return.

Customer 5110.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5110.Content: Excellent dinner for my husbands bday

Customer 5111.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5111.Content: The entree sized salads were much smaller than I was expecting, given the price. We were seated promptly, and the service was very good, but the restaurant was very loud. Great place if you are looking for an energetic setting, not so great if you are looking to hear whoever you are dining with.

Customer 5112.Name: Marc
Customer 5112.Content: Too expensive for what you get.

Customer 5113.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5113.Content: food was great. Service was prompt.

Customer 5114.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5114.Content:
Great steaks. Expensive. No view. Service was just right. Nice for a special occasion.
