We got there early & the bar was busy for happy hour. Happy hour specials were a good deal.

Customer 5115.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5115.Content:
I remember going to El Gauncho in Bellevue with my boyfriend for New Years Eve. It was the first time either of us had been to the restaurant. The ambiance was excellent but my boyfriend complained that for the money he was paying he had had better steak before. My response was immediate: "We will have to go to the Met." Sure enough, on Valentine's day, the Met did not disappoint. My boyfriend was very happy with his steak and so was I. 

I've been the Met a few times and I frequently make it a point to bring people there.  It might not be the best in terms of atmosphere or service but sometimes you just want a steak--DAMN GOOD STEAK. For me, that alone is worth 5 stars.

Customer 5116.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5116.Content:
Best NY strip pepper steak I have ever tasted. Glad to be back for it!
On that special Valentine's night, the restaurant hosted 600 guests, including 400 deuces, (including no one else but Bill and Melinda Gates) and we still got all the special attention we wanted!
It really is a fine establishment, and continues to be one of the very best in Seattle!

Customer 5117.Name: TJJinMapleValley
Customer 5117.Content: Looking forward to eating there again.

Customer 5118.Name: matthewg
Customer 5118.Content: Best stake I ever had and the helpful service took a lot of the hastle of ordering off the.menu away from my wife.

Customer 5119.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5119.Content: The food is always excellent and service is superb. We love visiting the Met when eating downtown.

Customer 5120.Name: Cynthia
Customer 5120.Content:
Valentine's Day at The Met. Perfect! Even though a huge accident on I-5 made up AN HOUR late for our reservation (although I kept them updated all along), they still kept our reservation for us and were gracious when we finally made it.

Our server, Diane G., was awesome as usual....the food was perfect, as usual....

Thanks for a perfect evening!

Customer 5121.Name: TukwilaGem
Customer 5121.Content: The Metropolitan Grill never disappoints. Our server, Jim, was very attentive, kind and charming. He gave us a free dessert since we were also celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. Each member of the staff we came in contact with was kind, helpful, and friendly. This is a great place to go for a celebration or just a dinner out.

Customer 5122.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5122.Content:
Best steak experience we have ever had.
The Wagyu was off the charts and the service was outstanding.
And bumping shoulders with Bill Gates was kinda fun too.

Customer 5123.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5123.Content: We were celebrating our 1 year anniversary and it was valentines day. So it had to be good, and boy did it not disappoint! Best customer service and willing to accommodate and eager to please. The food was melt-in-your mouth fantastic I really couldn't ask for more! I will definitely be going back again!!! LOVED IT!

Customer 5124.Name: WillB
Customer 5124.Content: Excellent food and superb service. They always leave you with the burning desire to return.

Customer 5125.Name: CrystalR
Customer 5125.Content: We have dined here many times now. The Metropolitan Grill is always consistent with perfect food quality and flavor and excellent service. No complaints!

Customer 5126.Name: angela
Customer 5126.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was as incredible as everyone claims it to be. The food, the service, the quality - all impeccable. Although it did cost a pretty penny, I will definitely be going back again!

Customer 5127.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5127.Content: We stayed shortest as possible because of bad smell.

Customer 5128.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5128.Content: I love the Metropolitan Grill. This was our second visit and the staff is always so wonderful and the food is melt in your mouth good. If you haven't been here before it is a must.

Customer 5129.Name: Jinxs
Customer 5129.Content: Everybody was friendly. The steaks and appetizer are good. The steaks were done to perfection.

Customer 5130.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5130.Content: Great food, great service as usual.

Customer 5131.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5131.Content: Outstanding food and service, as usual.

Customer 5132.Name: 84fun
Customer 5132.Content: We were so impressed with every aspect of our experience from the moment we entered the restaurant. We were escorted to a wonderful table and our server gave us exceptional advice. She was very attentive - better than almost any server in recent memory. We needed to leave on time for the theatre and our server made every effort to help us meet our timetable without pressure.

Customer 5133.Name: CynthiaR
Customer 5133.Content: I come here often, but mostly for special occasions. My husband loves his meat and always picks to go here for their steaks. 9 times out of 10, our food is great, service is superb and we leave feeling very full and happy. Unfortunately, this was the one time that we left feeling 'unhappy' about our meal. The service was great, but we found ourselves waiting for quite some time for our food and when it finally arrived, we were disappointed to find that our steaks were over done. We ordered Medium Rare and got them more on the Medium Well side. I'll still come here, but next time, I'll make double sure that our server knows what temp we want our steaks at.

Customer 5134.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5134.Content: We go to the Met every month or so, while it is somewhat expensive you do get what you pay for. We would much rather go to a great restaurant every so often than go to a good restaurant every week. This is a great place for food, service, and atmosphere.

Customer 5135.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5135.Content: i love this place. always have. i have yet to be disappointed! yes..its spendy, but worth every single penny! the servers are amazing...the wine list is rediculous lol and you name the burbon, they carry it.

Customer 5136.Name: ExCalif
Customer 5136.Content: Probably the best steak you'll find in Seattle with impeccable service.

Customer 5137.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5137.Content: Food was excellent as usual, thakn you again

Customer 5138.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5138.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is a favorite for years and as in the past the food, service and drinks were outstanding.

Customer 5139.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5139.Content: We were seated right next to noisy kitchen. The waiter was really nice but joking in a kind of awkward manner. He also never really made eye contact with my husband, only with me. Not in a creepy way it was just weird that he addressed me so often and barely looked at my husband. Either way it is a Classic place to eat in Seattle. Great steaks and very friendly. It is no Canlis, but I don't think it is trying to be. Comfortable friendly higher end dining. Nothing awesome but nothing bad either.

Customer 5140.Name: Madcheddar
Customer 5140.Content: We have been to the Met before and had a great experience. They did not live up to our expectations this time. The steaks were delivered very undercooked and after sending them back, they were still slightly undercooked. We did not want to send them back a third time so we ate them medium rare, instead of the medium temp we prefer. The Chicago Cut steak was pretty grissly and I had to fight through quite a bit of sinew and fat to eat it. The service was great as usual and the side dishes were great. But after spending over $50 per Waygu steak we expect them to be done perfectly and have prime-level marbling and flavor.

Customer 5141.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5141.Content: Steak was great. Prime rib was below average.

Customer 5142.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5142.Content: Truely the best steak in town. You get what you pay for.

Customer 5143.Name: Rocky9
Customer 5143.Content: Our waiter (Willian Macy look-alike) was super friendly, attentive and courteous. He helped us enjoy our dinner as much as the kitchen did!

Customer 5144.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5144.Content: This is the best place to have dinner in all of the seattle area. Very delicious.

Customer 5145.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5145.Content: One of the finest restaurants in Seattle. Though pricey, the service and food more than make up it with a dining experience that makes a lasting impression.

Customer 5146.Name: KimM
Customer 5146.Content: I love the Met and have never been disappointed with the food or service. I am already looking forward to my next dining experience!

Customer 5147.Name: EZE1991
Customer 5147.Content: The service and food was good. I would have given it 5 stars except my wife's wagyu rib eye steak was a little too salty. But besides that, the dinner was great.

Customer 5148.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5148.Content: The Met has been my favorite Seattle restaurant since 1989! The food is always wonderful and the people and service absolutely superb!

Customer 5149.Name: PLK1
Customer 5149.Content: The food and the service were good. However, there were 4 people in our party. We all ordered salads and it took 40 minutes to get our food. On a normal day the Met isn't the best place for lunch because they are slow, but this was ridiculous!

Customer 5150.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5150.Content: Upscale foodie steak lovers dream at a handsome price. This last time, I had the wagyu long bone ribeye that was outstanding and turned everyone's heads as they walked by table. Service was, as always, impeccable. They know how to give you the best experience possible by selecting a unique wine that fits your selection or just chatting you and making you feel welcomed. I always see either local sports celebs or captains of finance and industry sitting down to enjoy a stellar meal.

Customer 5151.Name: pickyeater
Customer 5151.Content: … definitely come to the Met.  Best prime rib anywhere!  Onion rings are a meal in themselves.  A Seattle institution.

Customer 5152.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5152.Content: I was disappoint to find out they was out of prime rib 10mins after we ordered. Other than that it was great!

Customer 5153.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5153.Content: THE BEST STEAK IN THE NORTHWEST

Customer 5154.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5154.Content: The Met has become our favorite place in the Seattle area to go for a great steak dinner. Always great food, great service and a great atmosphere! My wife and I highly recommend it for special occassions.

Customer 5155.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5155.Content: The blackened prime rib was perhaps a little dry? And a bit more well done than was requested given the Met's usual flawless standards. But still, a top notch experience. Ate the left overs for days.

Customer 5156.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5156.Content: Be warned: the service can ruin an otherwise celebratory evening. What a terrible experience! Not only did the server completetly mess up my order, any sort of response from management was terrible! I mentioned the service issues to management only to have my concerns dismissed. I would have expected more from this restaurant. I have recieved no response from management since that night despite their "concern" for the issues I experienced. The food was great but unfortunately they fail to deliver on service so given the high prices they fail to deliver on service.

Customer 5157.Name: LunchtimeFoodie
Customer 5157.Content: The food was fabulous and lived up to it's reputation.

Customer 5158.Name: Ballardite
Customer 5158.Content: Stellar service, but I was somewhat disappointed with the steak salad I ordered. Small amount of steak, and way too much lettuce. It would have been better tossed rather than sections of tomato, bleu cheese, and I don't even remember what else was on the plate. It was rather plain, nothing memorable. I've had many wonderful dinners at The Met, maybe that is what they are better at.

Customer 5159.Name: MikeS
Customer 5159.Content: Always a pleasure going to the Met.

Customer 5160.Name: ShayB
Customer 5160.Content: Excellent Service and Food was amazing. Expensive - but it is definatly worth it. Great date night.

Customer 5161.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5161.Content: Excellent service, wonderful food, expect a nice long dinner (don't go here on a time crunch). Complimentary Burnt Cream since it was our anniversary. Beef was melt in your mouth tender. We recommend the teriyaki bites for an appetizer. The Lobster Bisque was delicious and the crab was fresh and sweet.

Customer 5162.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5162.Content: My Girlfriend and I celebrated our one year anniversary at the MET. Me being 21 and my girlfriend being 19 we generally feel patronized and less important when we go out to nice restaurants. Although, at the MET, this was not the case at all. Our server, Reggie, was VERY nice and willing to help with anything. He even offered to hang my jacket which was a first at any restaurant for me! We felt just as important as any other costumer there. The food was simply amazing! Expensive, but well worth it if you want to impress somebody! It is simply an unforgettable experience.

Customer 5164.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5164.Content: If you are in Seattle and you are serious about your meat, this is where you go. There is no better steak served in the city. Food, drinks and service are consistently five-star.

Customer 5165.Name: Shagwon
Customer 5165.Content: What was thought to be a real hot spot turned out to be just the opposite a cold spot - to start with they did not bring bread to the table until after we had gotten our wine and had sat there for about 15 minutes - really was not a bid deal - maybe they were busy but could not have been that busy because I had an 8:45 reservation and when we got there at 8 they had a table for us - appatizers were good - entrees came out with both being incorrect - I had ordered vegtables with my entree and got a baked patato - wife had ordered mashed potatoes and got a baked paotato - by the time they got the entrees back to us they had still not brought our MP lobster tail that we were sharing had to remind them - really an entire mess

Customer 5166.Name: mopsos
Customer 5166.Content: Amazing. Simply perfect in every detail blew away Daniels broiler and John howies

Customer 5167.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5167.Content: So great! Loved everything about it. Steak was more than amazing, as were Craig and Jim!

Customer 5168.Name: Matchjl
Customer 5168.Content: This is a good place for steak! However, the service has deteriorated in the past year. Four for dinner, four steaks rare, an hour and a half wait time. The food was lukewarm as the waitress was busy tending to a table of six men and forgot us! Probably won't be returning!

Customer 5169.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5169.Content: Had a great time! Staff was extremely friendly and professional. Food was outstanding! Everything tasted great. Just be prepared for the price (but you get what you pay for). Drinks were very strong and well done. I would definitely return.

Customer 5170.Name: rStock
Customer 5170.Content:
The American Wagyu New York Striploin was great. The Wagyu beef is from the same farm as John Howie but cooked much better. The only issue I had with my steak was some uneven salting. In general I don't prefer much salt on my steaks and this had some bites towards the end that were overly salty.

Fiance had the two 4oz filets, one was American Wagyu and one was USDA Prime. She definitely enjoyed the American Wagyu more and commented on its buttery flavor and texture.

We will be dining here again.

Customer 5171.Name: Simpl3Bites
Customer 5171.Content: The Met always provides brilliant food and wonderful service!

Customer 5172.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5172.Content: this is one of the best steak houses in town. no need to add anything more.

Customer 5173.Name: kbruketta
Customer 5173.Content: great food and great service as usual.

Customer 5174.Name: Tony
Customer 5174.Content: We enjoyed the staff especially Tor, who was EXCELENT!

Customer 5175.Name: bereiter
Customer 5175.Content: always a great meal. consistent quality

Customer 5176.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5176.Content: The food was absolutely delicious!! Great staff with impressive knowledge of the menu. Completely worth the price tag! You get what you pay for :)

Customer 5177.Name: Button
Customer 5177.Content: Amazing food, fantastic ambience and impeccable service - the best filet I've ever had :)

Customer 5178.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 5178.Content: My wife and I met dear friends for dinner. The atmosphere is very romantic, the service is excellent, and the food incredible. Our steaks (filet mignon) were cooked to order perfectly. Everybody was so friendly and helpful. Craig Summers saw us in the lounge, greeted us and made sure we had a nice private booth and continued to ensure we were treated well. He made us feel like family. My friends were very impressed and pleased everything.

Customer 5179.Name: AttiOtti
Customer 5179.Content: We have been to The Met several times. The food is never less than stellar. The portions are generous. The prime steaks are well...PRIME STEAKS! Amazingly prepared to exact requested doneness. The desserts are, lord help me...something no matter how full can not be ignored and must be ordered. (My last meal on earth will include the Chocolate Lava.) The service...oh the service..unequaled.

Customer 5180.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5180.Content: The service was great, all the staff were very personable and helpful. The food was delicious, and it all came together for a fantastic meal.

Customer 5181.Name: MerleK
Customer 5181.Content: Metropolitan grill is a dining experience one hopes for in a modern city. From the time you step in the door you feel like you are well known. The staff guides you through a wonderful menu and wine list with a knowing clarity. If you want a special experience or a feeling of being special with great food presented for your enjoyment then a choice is easy to make. Thank you grill.

Customer 5182.Name: TAWoodinville
Customer 5182.Content: Continues to be our family's favorite Seattle restaurant! Love the New York Peppercorn! Have been going here for over 20 years and it is always great.

Customer 5183.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5183.Content: Consistently excellent food and superb service

Customer 5184.Name: yuriinseattle
Customer 5184.Content: Food was awesome! Service was slow in the beginning, but was ok at the desert time. Wine was superb. Recommend to get either a half or a full bottle!

Customer 5185.Name: Larrygg
Customer 5185.Content: The food was fantastic and the servioe was top notch. The steaks were prepared perfectly and were tender and juicy. The side dishes were excellent as well. My wife had the crab which was also prepared wonderfully. At midnight the staff handed out party favors and champagne for a celebration.

Customer 5186.Name: ScottS
Customer 5186.Content: My second visit to Met Grill; perfect way to bring in a New Year, any special occasion or just have a great steak.

Customer 5187.Name: weddinganniversarytrip
Customer 5187.Content: This is my favourite restaurant - keep coming back all the time. They know how to do it right!!!

Customer 5188.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5188.Content: The service was outstanding! Atmosphere is typical of a classic steakhouse. The food was excellent the Brussels sprouts were perfectly broiled. Your definitely going to pay $$$$ for the whole experience, but it's well worth it.

Customer 5189.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5189.Content: This was our third visit to the Metro and we really appreciate the excelent service and food. Looking forward to our next visit to Seattle.

Customer 5190.Name: Kimmie
Customer 5190.Content: Excellent food with outstanding service in an inviting environment.

Customer 5191.Name: Reece
Customer 5191.Content: The food is always good as well as the service.

Customer 5192.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5192.Content: The food and service at The Metropolitan Grill were terrific, with the exception of the creme brulee, which was too heavy and eggy, more like a custard. The menu is pricy. Not a place I could afford to be a regular at. We went for my birthday. The big drawback was that despite making a reservation weeks in advance that noted this would be a birthday celebration and seeking a good table, we were seated near the wait station and cross traffic in the middle of the floor. It felt like they just seated us at whatever was available at the time.

Customer 5193.Name: Scooby
Customer 5193.Content: Fabulous food. Fantastic service. Awesome atmosphere. Reasonable lunch prices. Can't believe we haven't been to the Met before!

Customer 5194.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5194.Content: The steaks our table ordered we amazing. I had the salmon. It was a generous piece of salmon which looked amazing but was over cooked and very dry. Have had salmon before at the Met and it was worth every dollar spent.

Customer 5195.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5195.Content: Dinner was excellent of course. I had the skirt steak which was such a pleasant find on the menu, as it's not served everywhere. The steak was very flavorful. My husband had the porterhouse and loved it. The carrot cake was awesome! Thanks so much for a great evening!

Customer 5196.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5196.Content:
If you like steak, this place is the place. You'll adore it from the moment you arrive. Excellent greeting, vibrant bar, great food and over the top service.

Highly recommended.

Customer 5197.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5197.Content: We go for birthdays , anniversaries, holidays, Seahawks games. We usually enjoy our experience at the Met but Dec 24 was different. Granted it was Xmas eve and u had a packed house but your staff was less then friendly & quite a bit terse. The front desk ladies were terse and not warm and inviting upon greeting. The waiter also was lacking the usual capabilities of past servers. He was quick to get the job done. We weren't told of the specials. There was no polite conversation about the menu nor wine list. My steak cam out rare instead of medium & my friend's steak came out rare instead of medium well. Being at the Seahawks game for 3 hours, not having eaten for five hours & our hunger dissuaded us from returning our steak

Customer 5198.Name: kshov
Customer 5198.Content: Metropolitan Grill is my favorite restaurant in Seattle and the best among many great steakhouses. Christmas Eve did not disappoint. Fantastic Wagyu/Angus hybrid filet prepared perfectly.

Customer 5199.Name: TaraC
Customer 5199.Content: My family and I have been going to The Met on Christmas Eve for approx. 25 years. It is one of our favorite traditions. Yes, it has changed (a little) over the years but it is still a wonderful dining experience. The waitstaff is so accomodating and the food is devine! Thanks for being a part of our annual Christmastime tradition!

Customer 5200.Name: timr
Customer 5200.Content: Food was great. Service was wonderful. We went there for our anniversary and enjoyed it very much.

Customer 5201.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5201.Content: Once is enough.  Management not interested in hearing complaints; no response to email sent to management in regards to service.

Customer 5202.Name: DebbieO
Customer 5202.Content:
Everything was great. Their steaks were outstanding, as I remembered from 10 years ago. They also had kid's menus with crayons which is always great. It truly was a memorable time.

On a money note, it was sooo expensive. I know it should be pricey because the food is so good, but we certainly couldn't afford to eat here more than once every 5 years or so. It actually averaged over $100 a person, including each kid. So be prepared.

Customer 5203.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5203.Content: Absolutely outstanding. We went as a group of 6 as a special pre-Christmas dinner amongst friends. We hadn't even had our appetizers yet before we determined we'd be making this a yearly tradition. Everything was incredible--the food was amazing, the service was prompt and every member of the waitstaff was super friendly. We couldn't have had a more enjoyable evening!

Customer 5204.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5204.Content: It was an outstanding experience from start to finish. The staff was delightful and several of them wished us happy anniversary when we arrived. Service was splendid and the beef medallions practically melted in our mouths and were cooked to perfection. Delicious crisp salad and the ample serving of heavenly mashed potatoes were the perfect complements. It was a lively,lovely evening.

Customer 5205.Name: JudyP
Customer 5205.Content: Like many popular restaurants, this one was very noisy, mostly from people having a good time with some wanting others adjacent to them to know it. Kind of an opulent 'hot spot'. We had a special occasion, and it felt very crowded. Lots of options for portion size and pricing, though as expected it was pretty spendy. Frankly, I expected a little more for my money. The staff was very professional and attentive despite how busy it was. The movers and shakers would really enjoy this place!

Customer 5207.Name: HawksFan
Customer 5207.Content: We almost always have a perfect experience at the Met. Very rarely one of our party will get a cut of beef that is not quite as good as we have come to expect, but this last dinner was perfect. My American Wagyu filet was cooked perfectly, juicy on the inside but sizzling hot on the outside. The service was excellent as well. We had requested a waiter that had given us great service in the past, and fortunately he was able to take car of us again. We also appreciate the fact that our teenage son can order a really good cheeseburger (his favorite food) at a very reasonable price, even though it's not on the menu.

Customer 5208.Name: EagerEater
Customer 5208.Content: Have been to the Met a number of times, mostly business dinners. Took my son from the East Coast there for his first visit. He agreed with what I have always felt. The Met tries to match the quality of the best New York steak houses but consistently does not quite make it. I keep thinking about why. For me it comes down the steak not being quite as hot and flavorful, the side relatively uninspiring and the service slightly over relaxed and inattentive. Expect I will be back but still wishing for that 10 - 15% more out of the experience.

Customer 5210.Name: Scooter
Customer 5210.Content: Excellent service; we needed to get to the theater and the waiter let us know how long it would take to grill the steaks and made sure we had our bill ready to go. Made it to the performance with minutes to spare. Food was delightful; next time we'll spend more time enjoying the meal.

Customer 5211.Name: MerryMel
Customer 5211.Content: The Met is a holiday and special occasion tradition for us and it never disappoints. Food is tops, service is over the top. It's high-end comfort to the extreme. Hope to keep going back for many more years.

Customer 5212.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5212.Content: excellent food and service as usual. never dissapointed when dinning here.

Customer 5213.Name: Elsie
Customer 5213.Content: Wow, what an experience. A classic old school steakhouse without the old school steakhouse problems (cranky older waiters, for example). On the barside, crowded, but delicious cocktails. On the food side, huge menu, with more (and bigger) steak choices than almost everywhere else. I am actually not a meat eater (the ahi was fantastic, unusual in a steakhouse setting, as were the seafood apps), but I chose this for my husband's 50th and it was a perfect choice. One warning--it's easy to overorder and overeat, and you really want room for the best bananas foster in the history of the world.

Customer 5214.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5214.Content: My wife and I had a great time as always!

Customer 5215.Name: EastMeetsWest
Customer 5215.Content:
We come here almost as a yearly treat and usually for a special occasion.

As a non-land-meat-eater, it is an odd choice, but given that the boyfriend is an avid steak fan, it is a no-brainer, best steak in town is their moniker and that's what he always says.
That being said, they always have a decent non-meat offering and the service is always decently good.

Cheers!

Customer 5216.Name: jplman
Customer 5216.Content: great evening...but too much food and too small a stomach...

Customer 5217.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5217.Content: My wife and I celebrated her birthday at The Metropolitan Grill on a Friday night. The hostess was able to sit us at a booth so we could have a romantic dinner for two. The server knew to ask enough so he wouldn't "hover" or be gone too long. The sommelier was very helpful with selecting a wine to complement our meal. It was a pricey night out, but well worth the money. I just wish I hadn't waited so long to take her there, but that also made it a special place to dine.

Customer 5218.Name: LaurieM
Customer 5218.Content: Great sommeliers and awesome food. You must have dessert, too!

Customer 5219.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5219.Content: great time, amazing food, excellent service - always a wonderful time

Customer 5220.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5220.Content: it was a good steakhouse with a friendly but not overly ingratiating staff. They seemed professional and yet not condescending.

Customer 5221.Name: Noisy
Customer 5221.Content: Hard to have a business lunch, even in the small room, because it was still noisy.

Customer 5222.Name: SusanS
Customer 5222.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was all that we remembered it to be. It's a wonderul special occasion place - the food simply can't be beat if you're looking for a great steak! Go there soon!

Customer 5223.Name: RonaldF
Customer 5223.Content: The Met has been an outstanding restaurant for many years. It is a little pricey but you get what you pay for and it is wonderful for a special occasion. We celebrated our anniversary here and were not disappointed. You can cut the steak with a butter knife.

Customer 5224.Name: BrettB
Customer 5224.Content: Our family had a unanimous vote that this was the best meal any of our family has ever had. The local Idaho steak list from the Snake River area was unbelievably flavorful and tender. Every single part of the meal was perfect. My wife and I have had many a filet mignon, but none like this. We also has the porterhouse and the top sirloin. We have been frequently to Daniels and Ruths Chris but this experience topped them all.

Customer 5225.Name: liv2explore
Customer 5225.Content: Very attentive service, excellent food, and pacing of the courses was spot on. Each course allowed for time to relax and mingle just a bit before the next one arrived. My partner and I both ordered the Wangyu Filet, medium rare and it was perfect, serious melt in your mouth feel... Pricing is reasonable for the area. Appetizer, salad and entree average $80 per person and I would pay it again!

Customer 5226.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5226.Content: We had a great time and had great service!

Customer 5227.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5227.Content:
Excellent drinks at the bar from Tony. Best prime rib and best service I've had in a great while. When you're willing to splurge for a really good red meat meal, this is the place. Only drawback was the wait. We arrived on time and were told 10 minutes. Were seated about 45 minutes after that. But it was a Friday night during the Christmas season.
One other nit-pic directed toward the diners: When you're going to a place as nice as the Metropolitan Grill, dress for the occasion. I know it's Seattle, but this is not Pike Place Market. Jeans and shirts outside your pants make you look boorish in this upscale spot.

Customer 5228.Name: BelltownBetty
Customer 5228.Content: A traditional "steak house" as you would in NYC or Chicago. Good restaurant but very over priced

Customer 5229.Name: WMBRAIN
Customer 5229.Content:
HAD A BAD EXPERIENCE WITH THE SOMMELIER AND PUT A DIN ON THE ENTIRE EVENING
THIS WAS THE THIRD TIME AT THE GRILL AND CERTAINLY THE LAST. WE BROUGHT AN OLD 1984 BOTTLE OF BORDEAUX AND OUR EXPECTATION WAS INGRACIOUSLY MET WITH A DISDAINFUL AND DISRESPECTFUL SOMMELIER WHO PUSH THE CORK INTO THE BOTTLE WITH HIS THUMB INSTEAD OF REMOVING IT CAREFULLY AND EXPLAINING THE HAZARDS OF OLD WINE. HE RUINED THE NIGHT. THE ENTIRE BILL SHOULD HAVE BEEN PAID FOR BY THE ESTABLISHMENT. FOOD AND OTHER SERVICE WAS APOLOGETIC BUT TOO LATE. THE AWKWARD START SPOILED THE FINISH.

Customer 5230.Name: Skier
Customer 5230.Content: Service and food are both 5 star. Always get fabulous attention from the wait staff and the food never disappoints.

Customer 5232.Name: Likes8s
Customer 5232.Content: Everything was fantastic except for the cold draft. We changed tables and it was a little more comfortable but still a draft. Service was outstanding.

Customer 5233.Name: KevinG
Customer 5233.Content: We had a fabulous time celebrating our anniversary! Everything was outstanding, from food to service! Thank you again.

Customer 5234.Name: EKP80
Customer 5234.Content: This was our second time at The Met Grill and it was, once again, a nice time. We ate here before a show at the 5th Ave Theatre and it was a good start to our evening. Great food; we definitely left full. The service is impeccable.

Customer 5235.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5235.Content: I try to go to the Met at least once a year and every time I go it's wonderful! The American Wagyu was amazing, both the New York and Filet. The atmosphere and service were outstanding. A little pricy, but definitely worth it for a special occasion.

Customer 5236.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5236.Content: Our server was outstanding, the food was great. Fits well for an exceptional occassion.

Customer 5237.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5237.Content: We felt that the food was fine, but not excellent. The food was salty. We've had better food at other steakhouses in town.

Customer 5238.Name: DawnLJ
Customer 5238.Content: We really enjoyed our meal. The Waygu cap steak is incredible. Even better than the meal, was our service. Derek (our server) was right on top of things. We were treated so well, better than I've ever experienced at The Met.

Customer 5239.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5239.Content: Any trip to Seattle should include an evening at the Metropolitan Grille.

Customer 5240.Name: frankm
Customer 5240.Content: I hate to mention this because my steak was the best I ever had, but the Belvenie 12 was completely watered down in the bar. I drink it at home daily and it was obvious. Frank Miller

Customer 5241.Name: KathyM
Customer 5241.Content: This was our second visit to the MET and it was wonderful again. After our first visit we decided to take my brother and his wife to dinner as they would appreciate the wonderful steak-and of course they did. Great night-expensive but worth every penny!

Customer 5242.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5242.Content: The food was great, we weren't impressed by the atmosphere. For the cost of food, I expected a more relaxed atmosphere but it was a little too noisy for my liking. The booths were too close to each other and I could here other people's conversations. Even though the food was great, I won't be rushing back.

Customer 5243.Name: MerryMel
Customer 5243.Content: I go to the Met two or three times a year for special occasion dinners. Especially during the holiday season. Can't beat the steaks or the service. The Met never disappoints.

Customer 5244.Name: bayouwonder
Customer 5244.Content: I thought it was totally overpriced for what we got. The service was not exceptional at all, the noise was quite loud as we had to almost shout for others at the table to hear us (only 4 of us) and I was not at all impressed with the service that we got.

Customer 5245.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5245.Content: As awlays the steaks were outstanding! And so was our waiter, really added to the whole experience.

Customer 5246.Name: BKCampbell
Customer 5246.Content: Always make it a point to visit when we are in town. One the top restaraunts we have ever been to.

Customer 5247.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5247.Content: This has been a great Seattle restaurant, and that hasn't changed over the years. The food couldn't have better. Service was superior.

Customer 5248.Name: Classic
Customer 5248.Content: Always good, but bone in filet was not as good as i would have liked for $72. Everything else was expected and good. Banana Foster was good but really heavy!

Customer 5249.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5249.Content: The food is immaculate and never disappointing. We are satisfied every time we eat here and recommend it to everyone visiting anytime they need an impressionable and tasteful restaurant experience.

Customer 5250.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5250.Content: Service was outstanding. Perfect birthday dinner.

Customer 5251.Name: Susie
Customer 5251.Content: Outstanding Service and wonderful food. Love all the booths.

Customer 5252.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5252.Content: It was a very excellent experience.

Customer 5253.Name: Lea4
Customer 5253.Content: Good steak. A little too dark in the dining area.

Customer 5254.Name: SVANAKEN
Customer 5254.Content: We selected the MET for dinner prior to our concert at Benaroya Hall. The food was superb, the portions generous to share and the overall experience was wonderful. We had a private seating area that made it very romantic.

Customer 5255.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5255.Content: The steak house ambiance was a mixture of businessmen and couples with delicious large portions of exquisite cuisine. Our server was fairly new and not as knowledgable as I had hoped for and we were sat in a booth close to the mainstream of traffic which I felt odd considering we had a late reservation-in other words there were more tables available but nevertheless the steaks were amazing! Another consideration was our reservation, I had taken the time to place a reservation for my birthday but the hostess did not reference it to the server we had to mention it was a celebration.

Customer 5256.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5256.Content: Never disappoints. Superb waitstaff and food.

Customer 5257.Name: DonaldM
Customer 5257.Content: Outstanding as always. I usually have salmon or steaks here but this time I tried the bacon wrapped pork chops. Yes, 2 pork chops wrapped in bacon served with a mushroom cream sause that was awesome. The wine list is superb and the service top notch. Can't go wrong at this place but the prices are a little on the high side so be prepared to pay for what you get.

Customer 5258.Name: ErikGH
Customer 5258.Content: Stately, Traditional, Exciting, Impressive. And that is just what you feel walking in the door. The food and service are tremendous. The steaks some of the best you will have anywhere.

Customer 5259.Name: Cookstersalibi
Customer 5259.Content: We go out to a high quality steakhouse about 6 times a year and it had been a few years since coming back to The Met. No particular reasons why. A good friend of mine always wanted to try a Tomahawk steak where it has a big bone that sticks out. I found it at The Met as they call it the "Long Bone". So my birthday gift to him was the $99 50 oz. Long Bone and he was ecstatic! Great steak, lots of flavor. I wish I had ordered the 36 oz. Long Bone instead of the filet as the taste was just superb. I highly recommend it for you steak lovers. My family will go back in the future and order it for 4-5 of us to share. Great service. It is a bit noisy, but what is a steakhouse without activity.

Customer 5260.Name: DawnLJ
Customer 5260.Content: The Waygu cap steak is so delicious. I came specifically for that and it was not a disappointment. Love it!

Customer 5261.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5261.Content: We were visiting from out-of-town and celebrated my wife's 50th birthday with family at the Metropolitan Grill based on a recommendation from a tour guide. Outstanding cuts of meat with lots of flavor and a phenomenal 9 layer chocolate cake dessert. Oscar topping was ever so slightly dry but very tasty. Vegetables were done to perfection and the cornbread was the best I've ever had.

Customer 5262.Name: disappointed
Customer 5262.Content: Overall a decent experience. The steaks are outrageously expensive without being conmeasuredly good.

Customer 5263.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5263.Content: A classic steakhouse experience. Service and food were as expected, top notch. Nonetheless, upward trending prices at American steakhouses have made us evaluate cooking great quality steaks at home. Is the experience really worth the price increases we've seen in the past decade? In years past, we were a 4-8 times a year vistor to the Met, that has now slipped to an annual visit. Dinner at the Met was never a search for "good value", it was always about the experience and the exquisite food, and the Met has consistently delivered on that promise.

Customer 5264.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5264.Content: Excellent service and amazing food. We come back for dinner ever year on our holiday to Seattle!

Customer 5265.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5265.Content: The outstanding food was exceeded only by the superb service.

Customer 5266.Name: NarzJ
Customer 5266.Content: One of the hardest tricks is to get the vegetables hot and to the table before they are overcooked. The broccoli was perfect. I chose the grilled portobello, perfectly prepared, the tomato was hot yet firm, cheese melted. My wife had the steak salad, crisp bed of lettuce, perfect medallions of beef on top. My daughter had the pork chops, you get 2 huge chops, about 2 inches thick, perfectly prepared. We split creme broulle, they call it burnt creme. Unbelievably rich egg and cream mixture, the crispy carmelized sugar top was a treat to break through, exploding with flavor and texture. Outstanding. Our waiter, Reggie, even pulled out his smartphone to help give us directions on where to go shopping.

Customer 5267.Name: baskdining
Customer 5267.Content: a real american steak house. good food, great service. not cuisine, just good food

Customer 5268.Name: SkookumDon
Customer 5268.Content: I expected the food to be a little better, given the famed nature and prices of the Metropolitan Grill. The steak was fantastic, but the salad and sides were very ordinary, especially for the prices paid.

Customer 5269.Name: dot2dot3
Customer 5269.Content:
Our dinner at the Metropolitan Grill was outstanding.
Great food and Great service!

Customer 5270.Name: Seattleeats
Customer 5270.Content: I thought the entree was overpriced, considering the size of the portion I received. The vegetable was underdone, and mashed potatoes were only lukewarm. The rest of the dinner (soup, rolls, dessert) was very good. It also seemed like there were a lot of waiters, and we first arrived a couple of them were just standing around talking.

Customer 5271.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5271.Content: Best steak you will ever eat in your life!

Customer 5272.Name: Doggz
Customer 5272.Content: Our wine arrived halfway through the meal. Steak tasted flat....quality not good.....compared to Morton's considering the 8 oz. Steak cost us $60.00.

Customer 5273.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5273.Content: The food was delicious, calamari is a great starter with the red pepper aioli. Steaks were prepared as desired and specialty cocktails were yummy! In comparison to El Guacho, the food is competitive but the service left us desiring for our server at El Guacho. The light in the restaurant lots you know you are eating with a crowd of others but your drinks going dry speaks even louder! Wonderful food, good service but El Guacho takes the experience!

Customer 5274.Name: Rbeloit
Customer 5274.Content: As always...excellent food, service and atmosphere...a treat for our family when we splurge for a special occasion!

Customer 5275.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5275.Content: This is the second time me and my wife has enjoyed our anniversary at the Metropolitan. We just love it and always had a great time.

Customer 5276.Name: Hooper
Customer 5276.Content: The Metropolitan Grill has amazing food and terrific ambience! The staff at the Met went out of their way to make it a special evening for me and my fiance. The Met is a real class act!

Customer 5277.Name: DavidT
Customer 5277.Content: The food at The Metropolitan Grill was amazing. My wife had Filet Mignon and I had the bacon wrapped pork chops. The flavors and portion sizes of both dishes far exceeded my expectations. I have never tasted food this good. The wait staff was amazing as well, very helpful and anticipated your every need. I would highly recommend The Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 5278.Name: tbaseball21
Customer 5278.Content: We were treated well and given a table with privacy. It was our anniversary and really enjoyed the Royal treatment. We were given a fantastic dessert after or meal.

Customer 5279.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5279.Content: Food was great, but had to wait to be seated for over 45 minutes even with having reservations.

Customer 5280.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5280.Content: One lunch was cold, the other wasn't cooked to order. Service was poor throughout meal, and waiter hit-on my wife while I was away from the table. Would not return.

Customer 5281.Name: Nick
Customer 5281.Content: wonderful restaurant!! i have been there for four times i love it! i will go again once i have time

Customer 5282.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5282.Content: Classy place. But so disappointed in my ribeye, which was seemingly 50% fat. I know that's what gives the taste, but for a $60 piece of meat, I expected more...meat. The rolls were warm but were chewy as if they had been microwaved?? The wedge salad was great. House wine delish. Service was OK. My water was ALWAYS refilled by the kids but s little slow from my main server. Overall, for $100+ per person, not quite worth it.

Customer 5283.Name: Bobo
Customer 5283.Content: Four of us had a booth for a business lunch. I ordered the 5 oz steak lunch special in a reduced port wine sauce with asparagus. Good bet to order a steak in a steak house. It was perfect and the sauce stood up well. The booth was a bit tight for four normal-sized adults. I will go back as often as I can (i.e., when on expense account).

Customer 5284.Name: 509LR
Customer 5284.Content: "The Met" has never failed us since 1982....still our favorite.

Customer 5285.Name: Usher
Customer 5285.Content: Two of us had the Tuesday meatloaf special-decadent and scrumptious!

Customer 5286.Name: MikeM
Customer 5286.Content: service was great, nice woman was our server. All Metro personnel were friendly and attentive

Customer 5287.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5287.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is one of the elite steak restaurants in the country. The steaks are special and cooked to perfection. The ambience is appropriate for a business lunch or dinner or a romantic night out with your significant other. In this case I went with a business associate and everything--from the service, to the presentation, to the meal, to the wine recommendation and selection--bespoke professionalism and excellence. A special experience in and of itself.

Customer 5288.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5288.Content: The service was horrible - not attentive, not friendly. Absolutely not worth it.

Customer 5289.Name: robertp
Customer 5289.Content: overall excellent food, friendly knowledgable waiter; will come back soon!

Customer 5290.Name: MaureenS
Customer 5290.Content: We had a lovely time. I felt the steak sizes were a big extravagant, but most men like that. For me as a 50 something female, smaller options are better suited. The horseradish sauce was flat, and the delmonico was sl above average. Our waitress was amazing, and everyone had fun.

Customer 5291.Name: maria
Customer 5291.Content:
limited seasonal options and no grass-fed steak options?? really? it's a steakhouse!!
limited wine options too for by the glass.

Customer 5292.Name: fante7
Customer 5292.Content: Quality of steak was fantastic. Somehow, the water server spilled on the table 3 times. Somehow, there were many loud screaming kids even at 8pm on a weeknight.

Customer 5293.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5293.Content:
I'll start with food: My filet was tough on the outside, making a $64 steak taste like one from the Outback, plus I was charged $20 more to have 3 pieces of crab and raw aspargus "Oscared". The scaloped potatoes were overwhelmed with pepper wiping out any true flavor. Three of my guests did not finish their meat plates, so I'm not sure if they did not enjoy the steak or were saving it for someone at home.

Service: My server was very accomodating and helped us make our selections. Unfortunately, is was downhill from there. Our order took close to a half hour to prepare, and we ate early. We had to ask to refills, dessert menues and waited 10 minutes for the server to pick up my credit card to process.

Customer 5294.Name: JohnG
Customer 5294.Content: The $55 aged ribeye was quite tough

Customer 5295.Name: Raleigh
Customer 5295.Content: The Met is my favorite steak house in Seattle. The food is exactly as I order it every time and the service is always very good. I always order the blackened prime rib with garlic mashed potato and love it every time. The restaurant is bright, busy and accordingly noisy. I love it and am looking forward to going back.

Customer 5296.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5296.Content: I enjoyed our experience very much. Although very expensive, for this occasion it was worth it. I'll go again when the time is right.

Customer 5297.Name: NBSp
Customer 5297.Content: Everythings was fabulous as always. Unfortunately, because it was a Saturday with both a Sounders and a Husky game, the kitchen bogged down at 6:45, just as our food should have been prepared. We didn't get our entree until 7:15 (we were seated at 6:15). Because we had to make to leave at 7:45, I took most of my wonderful meal to go.

Customer 5298.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5298.Content: Filet mignon was superb. Top sirloin good but some gristle. Temperatures were right on.

Customer 5299.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5299.Content: The white chocolate coconut cake was the best!!

Customer 5300.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5300.Content: I have never had such a small filet in all my life. It was delicious but tiny...and it still cost $52!!

Customer 5301.Name: Marge
Customer 5301.Content: Table-side preparation of the chateaubriand was very good.  Great place to celebrate a special occasion.

Customer 5302.Name: ByronJ
Customer 5302.Content: Everything was exelent. we arrived 10 minutes early and were seated Immediately, the staff took the time to wish my fiancee happy birthday. The flowers I had ordered were waiting and beautifully displayed. The attention to detail was outstanding. My extra dry martini was perfect and the food was great. I cant wait to go to the Metropolitan Grill again.

Customer 5303.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5303.Content: The food here is amazing. My husband and I try to find the best steak restuarants around the country and this is definitely one of them. We both ordered at 36oz. Ribeye and it was to die for...huge brotosaurous bone sticking out and full of flavor...amazing. If you don't have a budget and want some good classic American surf and turf this is the place.

Customer 5304.Name: th582013
Customer 5304.Content: Best Steaks in Seattle - and the wine list reads like a wine spectator book

Customer 5305.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5305.Content: When we arrived 10 minutes early for our reservation the table was already ready for us. We decided to go to the bar for a couple of apéritifs, which was made even more convenient by a card with our table reservation on it; the drinks were automatically transferred to our table bill. There were two seats open at the bar that we ordered our cocktails from, the atmosphere was vibrant, classy and yet very casual at the same time. It felt like an upscale business person's bar, with very a knowledgeable and quick staff. When I told the bartender we were ready for the table the hostess almost instantly and seemingly magically appeared to guide us. Our waitress was informative and attentive. The steaks were everything we hoped for. A must try!

Customer 5306.Name: Roberta
Customer 5306.Content: As always dinner at The Met lives up to its long standing reputation for delicious food and impeccable service.

Customer 5307.Name: WinnieT
Customer 5307.Content: It used to be the best steak house in town, now there are better options....

Customer 5308.Name: Paulie
Customer 5308.Content: Great lunch couldn't be better. One of my favorite rest. in Seattle.

Customer 5309.Name: BobG
Customer 5309.Content: Food outstanding, perfect for our dinner with our guests from Germany. I told them The Met had the best steaks in the world, and you did not disappoint! We'll see you again, best regards. Bob

Customer 5310.Name: lovesfoodanddrink
Customer 5310.Content: We love the Metropolitan and go there often. It is sometimes very loud with groups having fun but it is not annoying. The overall service and decor are very good and the food is great. This place is pricey but you get what you pay for.

Customer 5311.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5311.Content: FANTASTIC! This restaurant was recommended by a friend who had moved to our town in Idaho after living in Seattle. We purposely put it on our agenda after we read they had Wagyu beef. To say that the food was amazing doesn't even begin to do it justice. The service was outstanding from the person who greeted us at the door all the way to the person cleaning tables. I highly recommend this restaurant and we plan to eat there every time we return to Seattle.

Customer 5312.Name: DanM
Customer 5312.Content: Our waiter was outstanding. Steaks were good but not memorable. Overpriced for the quality.

Customer 5313.Name: Foodie
Customer 5313.Content: Always excellent food and excellent service

Customer 5314.Name: JRSeattle
Customer 5314.Content:
Went to met for a friend's birthday. Ordered the Waygu Ribeye, circa 18oz. Cooked to perfection; albeit the steak was (understanding it is a ribeye) super fatty. A bit disappointed on that front.

They were 86'd the Markham Cab and substituted a wine that was comparable to it. No gripes. Excellent dessert & some of the best service I've ever had in quite some time

Customer 5315.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5315.Content:
It had been several years since my last visit and it was great to see nothing had changed. The food and service was top notch just as I expected. My salad was fresh and looked as if it was made to order, the small filet mignon was perfectly cooked and the parmesan steak fries were crunchy and delicious, not thick and starchy like so many places. For dessert my waiter recommended the Maker's Mark ice cream which I was leery of, but found it delicious, much like a brandy alexander, only bourbon flavored.

I didn't see any steaks under $50 on the menu. Entrees are pricey but worth it in my opinion. One of my all time favorite restaurants, anywhere.

Customer 5316.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5316.Content: Liked the food, but the prices were to high. Had the same meal at a hotel room service, cost less and just as good or better! Nice place, but not worth the price.

Customer 5317.Name: gjtravels
Customer 5317.Content: A great traditional, high-end steak house. Great steaks, great atmosphere. Feels like the kind of place where the power-brokers meet to talk politics and have a great meal.

Customer 5318.Name: Alexa
Customer 5318.Content: I've been to most steak houses in Seattle and on the east-side, and I keep comming back to the Met.  I always bring out of town guests here because the service and food are consistently excellent with high quality.  Most other places have hit and miss service, this place is great and thier wait staff don't turn over like most other places.  You will not be dissapointed!

Customer 5319.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5319.Content: Outsanding restaurant food and service incredible

Customer 5320.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5320.Content: Steak was pretty good and creamed spinach was outstanding. Most of the staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way, but the waiter seemed frazzled and did not check to make sure our steak was cooked ok or pour any refills on our wine (just not something you'd expect when paying a $150 pp dinner). Overall, staff was very nice and dinner was ok.

Customer 5321.Name: TiffanyS
Customer 5321.Content: Always good food and good service. I can walk in with jeans or all dressed up and feel just as comfortable either way...great atmosphere. I'm in a happy place when I take those first few bites of filet.

Customer 5322.Name: meow
Customer 5322.Content:
There is no recession going on in this establishment. Pricey menu and worth it. The food was flavorful and bountiful. Our server was spot-on with efficiency, timing and courtesy.
Know mostly as an awesome steak house and as an after-work stop-at-the-bar locale, this restaurant can accomodate all of your dining desires. I don't eat red meat and still found wonderful, tasty selections. Portions are generous. Recommmend one carrot cake with two forks as a finale.

Customer 5323.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5323.Content: Perfect meal with a delightful team of staff.  A place to splurge for a special occasion.  We loved it and cannot wait to return to Seattle to go again.  Thanks Metropolitan Grill!

Customer 5324.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5324.Content: The Met Grill is a staple for business-on-an-expense-account and special occasion eaters. It boasts the best steak in town--and it's spot on. The service is great: helpful but not intrusive. No hovering, but right there if you need it. Then why the only "good" rating? First off--it's waaaay too expensive. With your steak (cheapest at $50 and rising way up) you get a baked potato. Well, yes that potato has gobs of butter, cheese sauce, sour cream and scallions--but no bacon. They used to have non-stop bacon. And for $9 more we ordered the Caesar salad. Honestly, I've had a salad as good from a bag from the grocery store. IMO a restaurant that aspires to top level needs to be top level all the way. No disappointments allowed.

Customer 5325.Name: alrac
Customer 5325.Content: We go to Metr. Grill every time we're in seattle...one of our favorites!

Customer 5326.Name: GHansen
Customer 5326.Content: Everything was wonderful including the leftovers.

Customer 5327.Name: ilovela
Customer 5327.Content: The only reason this does not get a five star rating / recommendation is the eye-popping cost of the meal. We've been to many steak-houses (Charly's, Ruth Chris, SW Las Vegas, Flemings, Mastro's, Chop House, etc.) and this was the most expensive by at least 15%. While excellent on all levels, just be forewarned that this will set you back. Our meal for 3 (one salad, 2 sides and three steaks) + $57 bottle of wine was $310 + tip. Very good but expensive.

Customer 5328.Name: TomB
Customer 5328.Content: My wife and I have eaten many times at the Met over the years and it has always been expensive but very good with excellent beef. It has gotten more expensive(dinner for two was $395 with tip-our 30th anniversary so we did it right), but my favorite steak the Delmonico was just fair. At this price this just shouldn't happen. I would have sent it back but it was our anniversary and didn't want to spoil anything.Don't know if I'd go back again.

Customer 5329.Name: TunerNix
Customer 5329.Content: Great steak, they know what they are doing with their steak and a rare find in Seattle. having eaten steak in most parts of the world this is a great restuarant.

Customer 5330.Name: MattL
Customer 5330.Content:
It was amazing!!
The food was outstanding and the service was knowlagable, outgoing, and welcoming!

Customer 5331.Name: lba315
Customer 5331.Content:
Having been to steakhouses everywhere, from Baltimore to Philadelphia, from Chicago to Kansas City, from Toronto to New York City (and back to the Garden State!), it was only natural that my wife and I celebrate her birthday at Seattle's Metropolitan Grill. What a spectacular experience!
Surprisingly no dress code exists (witness the table of eight next to us, with two of the gentlemen at that table in jeans and ratty T-shirts), but we were serviced as if at a formal gala. After ordering wine from their large and varied wine list, my wife & I both ordered New England Clam Chowder, nicely flavored with a rich creamy texture, but that was just a warm-up for our Chateaubriand for two. Carved tableside for us & served with enough mashed potat

Customer 5332.Name: Vissidarte
Customer 5332.Content: It's the MET, one of the best in every way with Marilyn being the BESTEST! We had such wonderful food and a great BD celeb!

Customer 5333.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5333.Content: It is a must for steak lovers in a classy ambiance

Customer 5334.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5334.Content: The food was amazing, the service was excellent but the environment isn't as top-notch as expected for the prices.

Customer 5335.Name: WilliamR
Customer 5335.Content: My party each had the 17 oz bone in Ribeyes, but three diffrent sides which were mashed potatoes, crab macaroni & cheese, and the creamed spinach. If your going to have a nice steak, you need to order a nice wine to enhance the flavor of the meat.

Customer 5336.Name: DanReiss
Customer 5336.Content: Deserves its moniker as the 'Best Steak in Seattle. As close as you can get to a NY steakhouse without being in NY.

Customer 5337.Name: CarmenG
Customer 5337.Content: One of the best steak restaurants in Seattle. They do it right and make the effort to ensure that you are completely satisfied. Steaks are tender, succulent and perfectly prepared. The Met is the place to go for lunch or dinner. Always enjoy dining there. The service is excellent and the staff goes the extra mile to remember us each time to are there which is refreshing. Well worth your time for a good time and good food!

Customer 5338.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5338.Content: Always good food, staff and lunch value. Someday i'll have to try The Met for dinner!

Customer 5339.Name: Saucy
Customer 5339.Content: The service was outstanding, and the food was great. You will not be disappointed with dining at The Met.

Customer 5340.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5340.Content: It was my and my wife's first trip to the Metropolitan. Everything about the experience was great from our curbside arrival to the time our car was retrieved for us. The food and service were truly first class and worthy of the Metropolitan's reputation. My wife didn't realize the Cajun crust prime rib she ordered would be too salty for her liking. Our waiter handled the situation with grace and class. He brought her a regular prime rib and ensured she was well taken care of. The menu was rich and had depth. The desserts were excellent and the portion sizes almost assured a take home treat. We had an outstanding experience all the way around. We will be dining at the Metropolitan in the future.

Customer 5341.Name: Twin
Customer 5341.Content: We were celebrating our 34th wedding anniversary with another couple who were married the same day and year as us! We live in California and I go to Seattle pretty often to visit our son - had a great experience and fun evening at Metropolitan Grill and would recommend to anyone. Fantastic filet mignon also!

Customer 5342.Name: DallasBDevil
Customer 5342.Content: I always look forward to an outstanding steak and wonderful service at the Metropolitan Grill when I travel to Seattle. My last visit was for a celebration of a milestone birthday, and the staff at the Metropolitan went out of their way to make it special. In terms of the quality and flavor of the steaks and the overall dining experience, this Texan can think of only one other steak house that might be better (Manny's in Minneapolis). Said another way, dining at the Metropolitan Grill should be on any steak lovers "bucket list."

Customer 5343.Name: hyjude
Customer 5343.Content: I would have given the food and outstanding rating but the newyork steak sandwich was very average. The meat was grissely. The Prime Dip was to "die for". The best ever.

Customer 5344.Name: Kathi
Customer 5344.Content: We ate here on my boyfriend's birthday and it was a perfect evening!  Thank you!

Customer 5345.Name: Lenny
Customer 5345.Content: wine list was very expensive and overpriced. It's a classic, traditional steak house, expect to to over pay for everything

Customer 5346.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5346.Content: Great food and excellent service for a price. This place is not for anyone looking for a deal or an inexpensive meal. The prices are high but you do get an excellent dining experience that you won't forget. The food is very tasty and well prepared. And the staff provides service the way it should be at any restaurant. Definitely a place for special occassions or a place to impress guests.

Customer 5347.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5347.Content: Overall the Met was good the dining room was a bit dated and dark but waitstaff was helpful.

Customer 5348.Name: RalphR
Customer 5348.Content: One of the best New York Strip Steaks I have had in 40 years of going to upscale steakhouses, e.g. Ruth' Chris, Palm, Morton's, Flemings.

Customer 5349.Name: DocE
Customer 5349.Content: Not my first time and have always been Very Happy. So, I took friends "for the first time", bragging all the way. However, the "aged for 35 days, bone-in ribeye" was not very good, for me or my guest! The filets were excellent, the sides very good and service was excellent...just disappointed after so many good times.

Customer 5350.Name: CarmenG
Customer 5350.Content: Consistently good! One of Seattle's best.

Customer 5351.Name: JHSMD
Customer 5351.Content: What a great Steakhouse! Many places call themselves a "Steakhouse" but this place has USDA Prine steaks that are aged 35 days! The wine service was excellent with great stemware. Large sides. Take a great appetite.

Customer 5352.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5352.Content: Great place to start out on for an Alaskan Cruise.The staff could not have been better!

Customer 5353.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5353.Content: fantastic service, fantastic food, terrific ambiance, best dessert my wife and I have ever had. Our waitress and our dessert preparer was absolutely world class.

Customer 5354.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5354.Content: Excellent!!!! we took a friend to have dinner at this place and we had the occasion to celebrate my husband's promotion. Good choice! Wagyu Filet Mignon was amazing, even the mashed potatoes were great!!

Customer 5355.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5355.Content: Service was excellent, and the steak was delicious! I would definitely return.

Customer 5356.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5356.Content: Enjoyed the food and the wait staff.

Customer 5357.Name: Jackie
Customer 5357.Content: The Met Grill is easily my favorite restaurant in the world. The staff is incredibly knowledgeable about the various cuts of beef, how menu items are prepared and anything else you could possibly want to know before ordering. The owner (manager?) came up to my table and personally thanked my boyfriend and I for dining there, and every member of the staff truly treated us like we were the most important guests there. I've eaten at The Met Grill several times and have never once been disappointed. You truly cannot pick a better restaurant to eat at, and it gets my highest recommendation.

Customer 5358.Name: localyokel
Customer 5358.Content: The Met is simply the best steak house in town. The happy hour is excellent, the wait staff perfect, and the prices are high, but worth it. Never, ever a bad experience at the Met.

Customer 5359.Name: ScottK
Customer 5359.Content: Wonderful food. Had a great time.

Customer 5360.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5360.Content: Although very expensive, the steaks are among the best served anywhere. The whole menu is second to none. Just reading the the desert menu, makes you realize the evening is not quite over.

Customer 5361.Name: DianeB
Customer 5361.Content: We celebrated our 35th anniversary at the Met with our children. The food and service were exceptional. Our waiter was awesome! He checked on us at just the right times. We couldn't have chosen a better place for our celebration! Thank you! Mike and Diane

Customer 5363.Name: gforce10
Customer 5363.Content: Hadn't been to the Met in quite a while so had missed the exceptional service. Everything was outstanding; meal was delicious and service was excellent!

Customer 5364.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5364.Content: Ambience was very good. It was conducive to our wedding anniversary celebration. It had a feel of a fancy restaurant without the high end necessities.

Customer 5365.Name: DustinS
Customer 5365.Content: Classic, romantic, also suitable for business lunches or dinners.  Service is fantastic, steaks are first rate.  One of my faves.

Customer 5366.Name: cosmicmd
Customer 5366.Content: Very nice. Food was good. Service was a bit slow. Noise level was high but then again it was lunch time.

Customer 5367.Name: Babs
Customer 5367.Content: A Seattle staple, the Met is always exceptional. The staff is eager to help and answer all mannervof question. They are professional and extremely knowledgable. If you're looking for an exceptional steak, THIS is the place!

Customer 5368.Name: NYTourist
Customer 5368.Content: My wife and I visit Seattle two to three times a year always staying downtown. The Metro Grill was recommended by a family memeber so we decided to give it a try. We both had steaks which were cooked to perfection.The server we had was a bit on the snobby side yet very knowledgable with the wine list and did a good job from beginning to end. The place is busy and loud so be prepared for that and bring your checkbook. Not a place I would go on a weekly basis however we will be back.

Customer 5369.Name: EEWdad
Customer 5369.Content: Excellent service and meal -- first rate dining experience. Seated near front door, though good people-watching, not my favorite spot.

Customer 5370.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5370.Content: Our meal at the Metropolitan was to celebrate our 28th wedding anniversary and our experience was positive from the moment we arrived. We took advantage of the $8.00 valet parking which is worth the price rather than driving around downtown trying to find free street parking (good luck). Both my wife and I followed the waiters recommendation and ordered the prime fillet 8oz and were surprised to find that you can choose from a large selection of sides. My wife ordered the baked potato and I opted for the asparagus which we both split and shared. The steak was perhaps the best tasting steak of my life. The atmosphere at the Met was energetic, our waiter was very helpful and approachable which made for a comfortable/tasty evening.

Customer 5371.Name: KollenG
Customer 5371.Content:
Good food, great service, poor value.

I went for dinner on a Saturday night. I don't know if all high end steak restaurants are like this but The Metropolitan Grill is the poster child for over priced food. The least expensive steaks are $40-$50 with the mid range being $60-65. My steak was cooked perfectly and tasted really good but I certainly didn't feel I got value for money.

My wife ordered the vegetarian option (Grilled Portobello Mignon) at $20 which seems like a bargain next to a menu of $70 steaks but is also over priced if you break it down to mushrooms, mash, asparagus, onions and sauce.

Service was outstanding, can't fault anything there. Our server was top notch, attentive but not intrusive and just a very nice guy.

Customer 5372.Name: Sally
Customer 5372.Content: This is a typical steakhouse. Same meat, same sides. They pack as many people into a room as possible, and charge a fortune for the privilege. I'm just wondering though...which of these steakhouses, Ruth's Chris, Morton's, Met Grill - which one is going to make smaller portions and charge a bit less. It is criminal the amount of food that is wasted at these restaurants because the portions are gargantuan. Can't we start to scale it back, make the meals a bit more healthful and charge a bit less?

Customer 5373.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5373.Content: For me one of the best places in Seattle to eat a steak

Customer 5374.Name: bryonr
Customer 5374.Content: What can I say? This place knows steak, knows how to serve it, and has the wines to back em up. Seattle can hang with ANY town in the US regarding steak joints and the Met is one of the reasons why. They also have an AMAZING assortment of cocktails. It's no wonder why the Met is a Seattle institution. They've earned it.

Customer 5375.Name: Linda
Customer 5375.Content: Best Prime ribs and steaks in the town.

Customer 5376.Name: Tony
Customer 5376.Content: Always a great experience at the Met!

Customer 5377.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5377.Content: Unreal, best rib eye and crab ever had!!

Customer 5378.Name: guido
Customer 5378.Content: it is the classic US steak house; great steaks, even though more expensive than average, in a typical all wood and classic environment. Good service and excellent wine list

Customer 5379.Name: Ryatt
Customer 5379.Content: Loud and nothing special. Drinks were sub par, Steak was so so, service was ok. I would like to say it was an amazing night out at a fantastic Steak House, but I can not.

Customer 5380.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5380.Content: The service was impeccable. The hostess was extremely professional and welcoming. The waitress was extremely well informed and helpful when ordering. The waitress has a gorgeous atmosphere that isn't too stuffy. The only kicker was the price. Very expensive. But overall, a wonderful experience.

Customer 5381.Name: CelesteAO
Customer 5381.Content: Overall our party highly enjoyed our Met evening . A few notes, double cut new york feature for two was a bit fatty w/gristle running through it. Plus, it was carved in an odd fashion (first in half & then each half was cut into lg. square pieces) that did not look terribly appetizing when served. Otherwise, our drinks, wine, lobster bisque, salads, other steaks (no-bone rib-eye & Oscar loin special) & sides were all enjoyed & quite delicious. The noise level was a bit high especially considering we had a round corner booth for the (4) of us. Service was quite good, however a few things took second runs to get (ex: lemons for water, sauces for steaks & bread). Plus the wine took awhile to arrive. Enjoyed but not overwhelmed.

Customer 5382.Name: VisitingFamilyof3
Customer 5382.Content: Good for business lunches.  Menu has nice variety, service is nearly always very good, and the place has a "rich" feel.  Good for a professional lunch.

Customer 5383.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5383.Content: For beef and seafood in Seattle you can do no better and living here we have visited all seven of the high end steakhouses. While the prices are on the high side the food and the service is impeccable making the entire experience well worth it.

Customer 5384.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5384.Content: Definitely worth a go - I've never been to a restaurant who cooks it's meats to perfection and at the correct temperature!

Customer 5385.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5385.Content: Great food and the service was acceptable. Would be glad to visit again

Customer 5386.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5386.Content: When you think steak, think The Met! If you like wine, how about 1700 to choose from?! The Met is the best steak joint in town, with the friendliest staff around. Every time we have gone to The Met, we have gotten into a conversation with our server that is waaaay beyond 'how is everything'. As well, they will do their best to meet any special need you have, or even accommodate a group of 20 in their private room! And oh yea, the fillet will melt in your mouth. Super delish!

Customer 5387.Name: SteveA
Customer 5387.Content: Have been here a few times. The last time was a few years ago and was quite disappointed by ordering medium-rare and getting well done and blue. This time everything was perfect.Happy to have my faith restored. Great service, food and atmosphere.

Customer 5388.Name: SusanB
Customer 5388.Content: Everything very good, was very pricey, but great steaks, and salmon

Customer 5389.Name: DemetraD
Customer 5389.Content: Everything was wonderful from the service to the dinner. We haven't had food that good at a steakhouse in the longest time!

Customer 5390.Name: MaryHelenS
Customer 5390.Content: The Met never fails to deliver a spectacular meal and first rate service.

Customer 5391.Name: Slow
Customer 5391.Content: Service is excellent. Food is very good...especially dessert. The carrot cake and Nine-layer chocolate cake are worth the trip to Seattle!

Customer 5392.Name: mels
Customer 5392.Content: Meals are pricey, but the food and service were excellent.

Customer 5393.Name: LaurieN
Customer 5393.Content: Fabulous restaurant with great food. Perfect for a special event. The service was excellent and the desserts swoon-worthy!

Customer 5394.Name: luvtoeat
Customer 5394.Content: As always the Metropolitan Grill stands up to its reputation.

Customer 5395.Name: acg77
Customer 5395.Content: Runs like a well-oiled machine. There's a reason this place is a classic. Actually, many reasons.

Customer 5396.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5396.Content: Absolutely spectacular meal... we had two orders of the 13 oz wagyu filets, which were the best cuts of beef I've had in a very long time. Exceptional service.

Customer 5397.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5397.Content: The food and service were great, but for the price, I expect a 'higher class' restaurant. There seemed to be no dress code or culture that demonstrated class. If I wanted to sit down with the masses in shorts in t shirt I would have saved my self-$200 and ate somewhere else.

Customer 5398.Name: TonyR
Customer 5398.Content:
The 'Met' is one of those Seattle institutions that keeps going and going. I've been many times with clients and haven't been disappointed. This time I took my wife for lunch on a Wednesday, which is a great way to save dollars if you're on a budget, as dinner for two with wine, dessert and tip can easily hit $200 or more. One of the nice things about the Met is that the service is competent but relaxed; they don't push you out the door.

On this occasion, neither of us had steak. My wife had the Parmesan sole and I had the chicken fried steak, made from Wagu beef. Dessert was cherries jubilee, which was wonderful. Our server, Bill, was great.

Customer 5399.Name: coquine
Customer 5399.Content: my favorite restaurant by far -- I love coming here and recommend it to everyone I know, and I take all my out-of-town visitors here!

Customer 5400.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5400.Content: The best steak I have ever eates, great service, great atmosphere.

Customer 5401.Name: OpenTable Diner
