Customer 5401.Content: Wonderful restaurant! My wife and and I had the Kobe filet mignon and NY strip respectively, and both were excellent. Our server was quite friendly and very knowledgeable of the menu. Truly great restaurant!

Customer 5402.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5402.Content: Every time I have dined at the Met, I have had a great experience. Wonderful wait staff and amazing cuisine. Whether you dine in the bar or in the restaurant, the atmosphere is always comfortable.

Customer 5403.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5403.Content: Consistently excellent food and service. Specials / Seasonal items are worth trying.

Customer 5404.Name: FineDine
Customer 5404.Content: A wonderful meal in every way! Incredible wait staff!!

Customer 5405.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5405.Content: Great place to have dinner, as always. Our waiter had 14 years there and did a great job.

Customer 5406.Name: CaseyJ
Customer 5406.Content: The steak was excellent and the selection was wide, so I had to make a command decision about what I wanted! And the service was awesome. Our server volunteered information, when he noticed our attention about what another table was having to eat or about anything else. We didn't have to ask; it was like he knew what we were thinking. Definitely will be going back!!!

Customer 5407.Name: roberta
Customer 5407.Content: Enjoyed another delicious and pleasant lunch. We'll return again and again.

Customer 5408.Name: Jeff
Customer 5408.Content: My wife and I were visiting Seattle and the Metropolitan was suggested by a friend. We are glad he did because our dining experience was quite enjoyable. Our steaks were cooked to perfection and the wine list is extensive enough to meet everyone's needs. The Banana's Foster prepared at our table topped off a perfect meal.

Customer 5409.Name: nataliea
Customer 5409.Content: This place has been better in the past. Our food came out and it tasted like it had been sitting under the heat lamps. Also one of the steaks came out cooked the wrong way. Our waiter was quickly to correct the steak but the overall experience was not the best.

Customer 5410.Name: PalmSpringDiner
Customer 5410.Content: We are always delighted with our food choices at The Met. Never a bad meal! Their fresh menu is always 5 Star!

Customer 5411.Name: Connie
Customer 5411.Content: We went here to celebrate my son's 30th birthday with his wife and 9 month old son. The staff was so very nice and took great care of us and seemed to really enjoy having the baby there, unlike some restaurants who make you feel guilty. And the food was EXCELLENT! We were thrilled that we chose this restaurant for our celebration!

Customer 5412.Name: CrystalD
Customer 5412.Content: The best filet I have ever had. Would not pass up the carrot cake - ever!!!!

Customer 5413.Name: Cody
Customer 5413.Content: Having been a patron of the Metropolitan Grill for many years, I was disappointed. A steak that costs over $50 shouldn't be that tough. I guess it's time to start visiting some of the other steak houses in Seattle.

Customer 5414.Name: Westwind
Customer 5414.Content: As usual, great steaks and attentive service. We find the wine steward to be a bit pretentious. The restaurant could do with a bit of a freshening-up - the seats in our booth were rather saggy, and worn. Still our favourite place in Seattle for a good steak!

Customer 5415.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5415.Content: Wonderful food, but a tad on the spendy side. I would definitely suggest this place for a special occasion. The steak choices are fantastic!

Customer 5416.Name: dining
Customer 5416.Content: what a great evening for us to celebrate completion of Seattle RNR Half marathon...steak was totally awesome...definitely #1...

Customer 5417.Name: MichelleA
Customer 5417.Content: Great place, great service, food was not worth the price. We had a certificate and still spent too much for the food. Very overrated!!

Customer 5418.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5418.Content: great food and drink,not cheap,but worth it for special dinners

Customer 5419.Name: BobC
Customer 5419.Content: The most outstanding steak in Seattle, and a wait staff second to none. And when the side dish of asparagus was under-done, the waiter removed it from both the table and the bill -- then returned with a complimentary replacement dish. The head waiter stopped by, genuinely interested in how satisfied we were with the meal and wine (very), not just the usual perfunctory ask. As always, an outstanding experience.

Customer 5420.Name: Tavita
Customer 5420.Content:
The best dinner my wife and I had outside of our home in a long time, she had salmon and I had steak. Our server was excellent, and atmosphere was just right, with valet parking it was easy to get in and out.
Thank You... Metropolitan.

Customer 5421.Name: AndyS
Customer 5421.Content: Outstanding steak, friendly and very professional staff.

Customer 5422.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5422.Content: The best meal I have had in a long time. Kind of pricey but worth every dollar. Bruno our server was excellent!

Customer 5423.Name: gogo
Customer 5423.Content:
It was my graduation dinner, and my parents said I could go any where I wanted. I wanted to go to Metropolitan Grill for the Steak Salad, which I had before at lunch and loved it.
But this time the steak was so tough, I couldn't chew it enough. I had to spit out most of the pieces. My father had the same dish and was also surprised how bad the steak was.
The blue cheese is very good though.

My daughters dinner-the Portobella Mushroom Mignon, had mashed potatoes with it, and it didn't say that on the menu. She HATES mashed potatoes.

I was very disappointed that my folks paid for an expensive meal that was not very good.

Customer 5424.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5424.Content:
Service was sub-par this time. My steak was considerably smaller and not quite the quality I was expecting. A good experience but not up to what we were expecting. We appreciate the free cake for my wife's 40th but we had to ask for a booth instead of the worst seat in the restaurant and nothing else was special at all.

We've been to the Met a lot but this wasn't quite at the level of the other times. Not a bad experience just not what we were expecting.

Customer 5425.Name: JenniferK
Customer 5425.Content: The service and the food were wonderful, as always.

Customer 5426.Name: Aaron
Customer 5426.Content:
This was my first time at the Metropolitan Grill in five or six years, and while still a nice experience it fell well below my expectations.
The food was nice, but not excellent (and I expect excellent for $50-$60 per steak) and the wait staff in both the bar and restaurant appeared confused and unsure in their recommendations.
I'd expected great, the experience was merely good. And for those prices, these days, good isn't good enough.

Customer 5427.Name: Scott
Customer 5427.Content: Absolutely the best food in Seattle - if you are a steak lover, you will not find a better steak anywhere on the west coast! Service is incredible - its no wonder their wait staff have all been there over 12 years and some as long as 20

Customer 5428.Name: Lexi815
Customer 5428.Content: Food,service and overall experience not matched by many. Outstanding restaurant all the way around

Customer 5429.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5429.Content: Wow! Simply the best filet that I have ever eaten.

Customer 5430.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5430.Content: The Met is one of my favorite restaurants, and dining there was like visiting an old friend!!

Customer 5431.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5431.Content: Excellent experience. The steak top notch, the drinks exceptional. This was a great night out!

Customer 5432.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5432.Content: Delicious steak and garlic mashed potatoes!

Customer 5433.Name: RONA
Customer 5433.Content: One of Seattles finest eating establishments. The food and historic charm can not be beat.

Customer 5434.Name: TonyGirl
Customer 5434.Content: We frequent the restaurant a few times a year and the service and food is always up to standard. It is beautifully decorated and seems like old school dining, which is something hard to find these days. The service is always top-notch and if something is not correct, they seem to sense it and make it right. The food is very good and there has not been anything wrong with it all the times I have been. It is pricy though, which is why we don't go alot. But they do have a wonderful once a year deal, the Have Dinner on Us. Go once, and they take the amount of two entrees and give you a certificate worth the amount for the next time. Great deal! This is a great place to take visitors to Seattle.Highly recommend!

Customer 5435.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5435.Content: Seriously the best steak that I have ever had! Planning to come back with a larger group this week!

Customer 5436.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5436.Content: I eat a lot of Prime Rib and this was possibly the best ever.

Customer 5437.Name: luvtoeat
Customer 5437.Content:
This is one of our favorite restaurants and has been for years. The continuity for always getting good and great-tasting food is something one can always expect.
The service is fantastic and one person in particular Craig Summers, who makes it a special event.

Customer 5438.Name: DaveM
Customer 5438.Content: As always, The Met exceeds expectation.

Customer 5439.Name: orwein
Customer 5439.Content: Very good steak house with attentive wait staff and comfortable room except for noise level.

Customer 5440.Name: diner
Customer 5440.Content: Exceptional service and food, as is usual!

Customer 5441.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5441.Content: Excellent, excellent experience. We were lucky enough to receive a gift certificate to The Metropolitan Grill and I have to say it was one of the best dining experiences I have had. The staff is friendly, the food excellent, the restaurant itself beautiful. It is definitely an upscale restaurant, but is not pretentious at all. All of us really enjoyed it and would go back again in a heartbeat. I highly recommend it.

Customer 5442.Name: perplexed
Customer 5442.Content: great experience. first time in Seattle. More reason to come back. We loved this place. Food is great and Joan is an excellent server.

Customer 5443.Name: Paola
Customer 5443.Content: I love this restaurant! High quality in food and service, smiling people and very professional............really a winning mix!

Customer 5444.Name: Disappointing
Customer 5444.Content: We've been dining at the Met for over 25 years, and the experience is exceptional every time. The steaks are delicious and fork tender, and the sides are equally wonderful. The service is always perfect. The wine list is extensive, with many fine wines offered at moderate prices. There are a lot more good steak houses in town than there were 25 years ago, but the Met still deserves top billing. It's pricey, but well worth it!

Customer 5445.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5445.Content: Simply put--the best steak you'll ever eat. I've been to the MG about a dozen times and it never disappoints.

Customer 5446.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5446.Content: Best Steaks in the West! Pricey but well worth it!Many steak choices can't go wrong with any of them sizes range from 8 oz to an amazing 32 oz porterhouse. Cream corn with lobster is sweet and excellent. You must go there hungry portions are good size and filling. Great selection of wine and beers as well. You can not go wrong at this dinning establishment.

Customer 5447.Name: Magic
Customer 5447.Content: Knew it was great when bar was full at six. Bar service slow but good drinks and they had three olives vodka. Steak was as good as it gets. Pricy but worth it

Customer 5448.Name: LeslieH
Customer 5448.Content: Service was perfect. The steaks are to die for. I had salmon and it was the best I've ever had. It's kind of loud and crowded, but it still felt intimate.

Customer 5449.Name: Penta5
Customer 5449.Content: Entertaining business partners is perfect at the Met!

Customer 5450.Name: NewYorkerFoodie
Customer 5450.Content: Amazing food and service; too loud and busy though.

Customer 5451.Name: TMarie867
Customer 5451.Content: The Met is such a special place!! We typically go here on special occasions and we have never had a bad dining experience there - ever! The service and the steaks are second to none. Just thinking about the melt-in-your mouth Delmonico steak and creamed spinach brings a tear to my eye and a smile to my face. The cozy ambiance is perfect for either a romantic date or a group setting. The staff (from valet to your server) are very friendly, welcoming and always professional. The Met - the total Met experience - is absolutely worth every penny...every time!

Customer 5452.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5452.Content:
Amazing food!
Great service!
City style dining with class!

Customer 5453.Name: Brystock
Customer 5453.Content: It is hard to find a better steak in the Seattle area than The Met serves. We are consistently pleased when going there for a special occassion.

Customer 5454.Name: stfrancis
Customer 5454.Content:
One of the best meals we've ever had. Wonderful food, great service by Scott. He was great with our kids.
we will be back.

Customer 5456.Name: MichelleH
Customer 5456.Content: Food was great, service was great, the only thing that didn't meet our expectations was the ambience. I had heard it was an upscale restaurant perfect for a romantic date. When we arrived we were very overdressed and found most other patrons in jeans, tshirts and the atmosphere was very casual especially considering the price of food. Maybe it was because of the Mariners game that night or maybe people just don't dress up anymore, regardless it was the only negative thing I can say about our experience. The food was excellent and that was what we came for afterall!

Customer 5457.Name: bglutenfree
Customer 5457.Content: Wonderful dining experience! We were well taken care of and the food was delicious. I am from New York and have been to some of the best restaurants in town; Metropolitan Grill did not disappoint!

Customer 5458.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5458.Content: I normally have had a top notch steak at the Metropolitan Grill, but this was the first time that I ccan say that my steak was not up to the standards that I have had before. I had a bone in ribeye that had alot of fat on and through it, and surprisingly had a few area's of the connective tissue at can not be eaten. Although the steak was cooked to perfection at medium, the side dish of fat and the connective tissue that came of the steak was a bit much. Normally I have a clean plate with no leftover fat whatsoever. My date had the New York that was fantastic, with no risidual fat left on the plate when finished. I would still recommend the Metropolitan grill for friends...I just think that my steak was an abberation and not the norm.

Customer 5459.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5459.Content: The perfect place for a birthday dinner:) We walked out stuffed! Two desserts two steaks and appetizers were all Delicious!!

Customer 5460.Name: JaymeG
Customer 5460.Content: The steak is the centerpiece here...a splurge but worth it in quality and presentation.

Customer 5461.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5461.Content: Good service and great food. No complaints.  Will come back soon!

Customer 5462.Name: JLPT
Customer 5462.Content: The food quality, table service and the overall service level was superb! Thanks to all there!

Customer 5463.Name: KathyM
Customer 5463.Content: We really enjoyed the wonderful filet mignon and garlic mashed potatoes. The salads were fresh and generous. We especially like being seated in booth #18, it's very cozy and quiet.

Customer 5464.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5464.Content: Amazing food! It was incredibly busy, but the server was as attentive as he could be given the situation. Very Hollywood glamour. Great night!

Customer 5465.Name: MarkG
Customer 5465.Content: Fantastic as always! We visit The Met at least once a month and have never been disappointed. Noi, our server, has been serving us for almost a decade and continues to make our visits as special as the first!

Customer 5466.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5466.Content: The food was amazing if you got the right dish. The steak was amazing, The fish was amazing (tasted from my wife's plate). I got a pork chop which was less than I would expect for the 40 dollars I paid for it. Service was good, the kind that gets you everything you need and nothing more. Overall it was very good, but if I didn't have a 50 dollar gift card going into it I would have been disappointed with the value.

Customer 5467.Name: AshleyR
Customer 5467.Content: The steaks were AMAZING!!! However, side dishes were just okay. Service was very disappointing. Would only go again for the steak.

Customer 5468.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5468.Content: The Metropolitan Grill offers great food and fantastic service for a price...it's spendy. Consider it for special occasions....

Customer 5469.Name: ChrisC
Customer 5469.Content: Without peer as a NW Steakhouse.

Customer 5470.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5470.Content: I had a 16oz peppercorn steak with a side caesar salad and the food was absolutely outstanding. The seasoning on the steak, the sear on the outside, the juicyness on the inside were all amazing. The best steak I've ever had.

Customer 5471.Name: KatherineA
Customer 5471.Content: We had an overall fantastic experience. We were seated immediately. When we told them we would prefer a booth, they graciously moved us. Our waiters (all three) were attentive and helpful. The food was again excellent. Very expensive, but proved to be worth every penny.

Customer 5472.Name: BarryM
Customer 5472.Content: Excellent as always. Reggie, our server, was wonderful. Whenever we visit Seattle we always dine at The Met and will continue to do so and highly recommend it to our friends.

Customer 5473.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5473.Content: This is one of the best restaurants in Seattle. The food is the highest of quality and prepared my skilled chefs. It's a welcoming, casual environment. What's great about this place is that it's really nice (and expensive) but you can show up in either a nice dress or jeans and a casual sweater and still fit in just fine. This is my favorite restaurant!

Customer 5474.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5474.Content: Terrific resturant! We make the 3 hour trip at least once a year and the sole purpose of the trip is dinner at the Met!

Customer 5475.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5475.Content: Very expensive. The food is very good but the value for what you pay is only fair. The escargot "special" was NOT, especially at $14. The lobster bisque was too creamy, did not have even a hint of cognac, and was very light on lobster flavor with not a morsel to be found. On the other hand, wait staff excel at their craft and the crab cocktail was outstanding - best I've ever had. Lobster tail was good but undercooked. The filet mignon sampler(two types of beef) was very good but not outstanding as expected (although cooked exactly to order). Chocolate decadence dessert was good, not great. Overall, very enjoyable. But, with a modest $45 bottle of bubbly and appropriate tip, $300 for two was too much to drop in view of the off-points.

Customer 5476.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5476.Content: Our waiter, Steve, made our experience most pleasant. He was funny and helpful without being pushy.

Customer 5477.Name: tsushima
Customer 5477.Content: We were a group of five and we were ALL under the impression that our waitress was talking down to us. It's a shame because I had great experience here in the past.

Customer 5478.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5478.Content: As always, The Met didn't dissapoint. The experience is incredible and the food...well, let's just say it's literally perfect. From the appetizer (calamari), to the salads (spinach), the the steaks (we had New York w/ peppercorn and blackened prime rib), we would have happily gone for ANY of the elements of the meal but are thrilled to be delighted by ALL the elements of the meal.

Customer 5479.Name: KearnyGirl
Customer 5479.Content: Classic steak house and whiskey bar. Good for a special occasion; very pricey for the ordinary night out.

Customer 5480.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5480.Content: The filets that we ordered were delicious and cooked properly. However I thought mine was overseasoned, a little too salty. I also thought the bleu cheese sauce overpowered the filet. Stay away from the roasted root vegetables, they were inedible, dry and flavorless. The baked potato was very good, the lobster bisque soup was delicate and good, but my favorite of the meal was the oysters on the half shell. The most tastiest oysters I have had to date. Our dessert Bananas Foster was delicious and the white chocolate coconut cake we took to go was rich and decadent. Wine list was ample and reasonable. This was a very expensive dinner so save it for a truly special occasion like an anniversary, wedding, big promotion...

Customer 5481.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5481.Content: Great food at very reasonable price. The service is outstanding. I would recommend anyone to go and have a wonderful time there. There are number of parking garage in the area if one is driving, and the restaurant also validated parking service as well.(Check their website for detail)

Customer 5482.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5482.Content: I had very high expectations, and, for the most part, wasn't disappointed. The food just wasn't quite as good as I expected. The calamari appetizer was very good but the saffron aioli was lacking on the saffron. I had the 12oz NY strip (medium). It was slightly overcooked but acceptable. Usually places err on the side of rare. They did the opposite. But, it was very tender and full of flavor. The au jus added a good bit of juicy flavor. The complimentary bread wasn't exceptional. The old fashioned's on the other hand, were very good. Compliments to the bartender. Overall, the food was good but not great. The atmosphere is formal without being stuffy.

Customer 5483.Name: SeattleMichael
Customer 5483.Content: The Met is definitely a place that I will be coming back to again and again. The food was outstanding. Although, the menu is pricey, this is not your everyday place; this is a restaurant that you come to for a special treat or occasion. The staff - from the host and hostess down to the server and busser were all extremely welcoming and helpful.

Customer 5484.Name: BuzzC
Customer 5484.Content: The food here is phenomenal as is the service.

Customer 5485.Name: Aqua
Customer 5485.Content: me and my fiance had a great time in this restaurant. I asked them to book private booth for engagement,and it was a perfect service!!

Customer 5486.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5486.Content:
Maybe it was an off night. Our first visit (us and three teens). Disappointing.
We did soup to nuts - including wine, beverages - so a decent tab ($600+). Not out of line for a steakhouse.
New York and Pepper Steak (dad/son)- lots of gristle in the cuts; overcooked. Good filet cuts though (other son/daughter) and well prepared; good steak salad. 15 minute lag after food arrived to check how we were doing - by which time the others were far enough into their meals my son and I figured it wasn't worth the hassle to send back.
Nice waiter, but too busy I guess (it was a full house). Maybe because we had teens - but they all ate off the adult menu, were polite (at least we thought). Guess we'll try Capitol Grill next time (not been there)

Customer 5487.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5487.Content: Great restaurant. Came with a group of 4 and everything went well. Friendly hosts and servers.

Customer 5488.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5488.Content:
Still one of my favorites in the PNW...
Its a must when in Seattle

Customer 5489.Name: Jackson
Customer 5489.Content: Very expensive for dinner. I think the least expensive steak is ~$50. Is it worth it? Yes. Steaks were outstanding. One dessert was plenty (huge) for our table of 4 to share - I can't imagine 4 people each ordering dessert. If it were less expensive I'd consider going there more than once a year. Good wine list with a nice mix of US and French wines. After spending $500 for dinner I then had to pay $8 (+tip) for the valet parking.

Customer 5490.Name: Evan
Customer 5490.Content: My favorite steak place in the US bar none. Never disappoints with great food, attentive waiters, a top tier wine list. A little pricey but worth it.

Customer 5491.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5491.Content: Food is always good and wait staff is always attentive!

Customer 5492.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5492.Content: I requested my steak cooked in between two of the traditional levels. Came out perfect. The Met's chef was on his game and our dinner was excellent.

Customer 5493.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5493.Content: We had another enjoyable meal at the Met. Service was great as always. First time bring our older boys for the best steak around and they agreed. Our oldest enjoyed his birthday and thanks for making it such a special event!

Customer 5494.Name: obiwong
Customer 5494.Content: We think of Morton's as our benchmark for great steak. The Met surpassed this high standard, with more diverse menu options. Ask for Juergen... he gave us great service.

Customer 5495.Name: nodddy
Customer 5495.Content: Excellent food and skillfully served. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes a good steak.

Customer 5496.Name: Bainbmimi
Customer 5496.Content: I looked online at the menu prior to going but then when our waitress showed up she offered no suggestions rather unhelpful with ordering and just wanted to take our order. After I had ordered I remembered some things I had wanted to try when I had looked online. We had mentioned we had 5th ave coupons thinking they were discount vouchers she let us think this until the end of the meal when we had not intended to have desert and then said the coupons were for desert which I did nt appreciate (we took a few deserts to go)While my son loved his prime rib he didnt touch his fries which is unusual, I tried them and they were over cooked. Ahi tuna and swordfish(little dry) were good but all the sides were flavorless and the root veggies hard.

Customer 5497.Name: laitsabr
Customer 5497.Content: We had our Easter dinner there, 2 adults, a teenager and a 7-year-old. We were recommended a Spanish wine (Gratallops Black Slate 08 which was an excellent dry full-bodied red). Went straight into the entrees: American Wagyu beef (m-rare) was tender, juicy and flavorful, the kid's prime rib dinner was excellent (almost an adult portion for $8!), and the Cajun Blackened Prime Rib (m-rare and med) was pleasantly spicy, moist, not as fatty as most other prime ribs we have had in other places. Our server James made sure we were well-attended and made our experience even more memorable!

Customer 5498.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5498.Content: We went to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We split an appetizer, entree, and a dessert. All were delicious, as they always are. The service was flawless. Will definitely return again and again.

Customer 5499.Name: Johnny
Customer 5499.Content: My husband and I have been to many steak places like Ruths Chris, Flemmings etc. This is the BEST we have yet experienced. The sides were fantastic, the steaks and seafood wonderful. The servers and wait staff were friendly and interested in giving you a wonderful experience. Very well recommended. Not cheap but worth the price.

Customer 5500.Name: TimK
Customer 5500.Content: Sizzler quality steaks. The steaks even the aged ones are nothing special.

Customer 5501.Name: Nar27
Customer 5501.Content: Expensive but memorable and delicious! Come when you want steak. Excellent desserts!

Customer 5502.Name: StevenR
Customer 5502.Content: Best steaks in Seattle. Upmarket without being stuffy or pretentious.

Customer 5503.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5503.Content: Great steak! Make sure to get the filet....nothing else compares.

Customer 5504.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5504.Content: Great for those looking for large food portions.

Customer 5505.Name: Calais08
Customer 5505.Content: I've been coming here for 15 years and have never had a bad experience, and have never been disappointed. The food selection, server and service staffs are the reason for coming back and referring friends, coworkers and visiting company personnel. The server staff are very engaging, and I often leave very happy. I really love the "Have Dinner On us" campaign - and always come back to "The Met."

Customer 5506.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5506.Content: We had a table for 5, and as soon as someone finished their plate it was removed from the table, which is not bad but it did make the last person eating feel like they were being a bit rushed.

Customer 5507.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5507.Content: They are well-known but I question whether they are really living up to their reputation. The service and atmosphere are great but the food is just average. My caesar salad was good but nothing spectacular, the bread was average, the blackened prime rib was a generous portion but over-seasoned and the baked potato was nice and big but actually undercooked. Not something you expect when paying $100/person with tip.

Customer 5508.Name: Steve
Customer 5508.Content: Terrific food and terrific service ... every time. Steaks are always great; wife went for the Dover Sole this time and loved it.

Customer 5509.Name: susans
Customer 5509.Content: We made use of the 'Have Dinner on us' offer and so this time, the entrées were 'free' Had the Blackened Prime Rib and it was made just right, as usual. It was apparent that it was well-aged; the texture was soft on the palate and consistent throughout the cut.

Customer 5510.Name: HinaP
Customer 5510.Content: I was disapointed in the food. The steaks were OK. I was expecting them to be fabulous. Service was very good. Restaurant was very busy and our food took long to arrive.

Customer 5511.Name: Karen54
Customer 5511.Content: This was our second visit (not our last!) to the Met and we had a great time. I love the "old school" service there - they anticipate every need or desire and really work to make the occasion special. Just delightful!

Customer 5512.Name: HawksFan
Customer 5512.Content: We always enjoy the Met and almost always have perfect service. Just the right amount of attention without hovering or disappearing for too long. When our teenage son (who is a die hard burger fanatic) is with us, he can order a cheeseburger that is not on the menu and is reasonably priced. On a recent trip when the restaurant was not too busy, the wine steward actually sat down at our table for several minutes and we discussed several wines on the list and his favorites and recommendations.

Customer 5513.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5513.Content: I ordered the peppersteak, and they brought me a new york strip. a few minutes later they hurried out and poured some pepper sauce over it. wasn't a memorable steak. got a free creme brulee at the end, but i'd rather have been brought the correct steak in the beginning- for $60/steak you'd like to get it right. otherwise, service, martini, and dessert were stellar. I may be back, but i'm in no rush.

Customer 5514.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5514.Content: Normally when I go to the Met, I get a very knowledgeable and attentive server. I'm not sure if the server we had this past time was very busy, but he was nowhere to be found for most of our meal. We waited at least 45 minutes for our steaks to come out and then when we finally got them, they were cooked to the wrong temperatures. We did not make a big deal to the server because we had waited so long for our food and did not want to wait any longer to eat. We were also sat very close to the door and by a large and loud group. I have never been disappointed with the service until this visit so I hope that it will never happen again and ruin my previously great view of the restaurant.

Customer 5515.Name: MichaelH
Customer 5515.Content: Our waitress was great. She was always there ready, but never felt like she was hovering. The food was delicious as usual for the met. I would recommend them.

Customer 5516.Name: TonyGirl
Customer 5516.Content: Like always. the steaks are wonderful, the baked potatoes are the best in the city and the service attentive, yet not smothering.

Customer 5517.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5517.Content: What can you add to what has already been said about The Met. A Seattle institution you don't want to miss.

Customer 5518.Name: SeattleU92
Customer 5518.Content: I have gone to The Met for years, the bartendars are immediately attentive and welcoming; the wait staff superb and the sommelier well schooled....the valet attendants quick and polite.....this is my favorite restaurant

Customer 5519.Name: DrinkneatinBallard
Customer 5519.Content: yummy food when you want good steak!

Customer 5520.Name: Foodie
Customer 5520.Content: Crab cakes and teriyaki tenderloin skewers were fantastic. The ahi poke salad was not a poke salad or even poke. It was more like a tartare not a salad. Steaks were expensive but tasted great- they cooked it how I like it- I like mine medium-rare. Most places overcook the meat, here it was done right. The yukon potato cakes were misleading. They were more like hashbrowns than potato cakes. It was too greasy. I would have rather have ordered mashed potatoes or baked potatoes. We were celebrating my husband's birthday, at the end they presented a creme brulee dessert with a candle on it- nice surprise. Everyone at the restaurant was friendly and curteous. Great experience. Next time I know what to order.

Customer 5521.Name: Westwind
Customer 5521.Content:
Our meals were fabulous - started with a dozen oysters, the Wagyu filets were outstanding,
the wine was perfect ... the only negative was the service. Our server seemed rushed, forgot to order our wine, forgot the sour cream/butter for the baked potato, never asked how our meal was, we had to ask twice for the check. The wine steward had an attitude, and dissed Seattle Restaurant Week and the restaurants that participate for 10 minutes before pouring our wine. Left a bit of a negative impression.

Customer 5522.Name: Fugella
Customer 5522.Content: There were three of us dining this time and we all had the dual filets - the Kobe and regular...the meat was so tender you could almost cut it with a fork - everything was cooked to perfection!! We highly recommend Metropolitan Grill and definitely will go back again!

Customer 5523.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5523.Content: It was the best steak we tasted in our life, the staff are courteous, knowledgeable & friendly. We celebrated my son 19th B-day & it was the best gift we have given him....thank you for the great service & i'm looking forward to have dinner with you again.

Customer 5524.Name: LindaG
Customer 5524.Content: Absolutely wonderful! Our waiter was terrific and very attentive, the food was delicious, an excellant night!

Customer 5525.Name: PeteC
Customer 5525.Content:
As always the Met did not disappoint, you certainly pay for it, but the service, food and experience is outstanding. I had the "bone-in" tenderloin and it was unbeleivably good, my wife had the wagyu tenderloin. The waiter had described that because the bone imparts so much flavor into the maeat that it was a toss-up between the Wagyu and the Bone-in, and he was right, both were excellent, but I would choose the Bone-in tenderloin not only the flavor but then you have the bone to gnaw on while no one is looking.
Don't forget the Makers Mark bourbon ice cream with dessert, it's made specially for the Met and is perfect.

Customer 5526.Name: tilcows
Customer 5526.Content: Boyfriend raved about his perfectly red 8-oz filet mignon and how well the au jus complimented the mashed potatoes. The portobello mignon is one of the best vegetarian dishes I've eaten in a while - nicely grilled portobellos w/ a generous portion of asparagus, sauteed spinach, mashed potatoes and onion rings. The escargot was delicious - still in their shell and not overly buttered. The only con is the high price for an 8-oz filet mignon. Aside from that, it was a very good meal.

Customer 5527.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5527.Content: For the price charged, the food was left a lot to be desired. The Garlic Mashed Potatoes were of very poor quality with a watered down powdered potato taste. The Aspargus was so near raw it was almost not eatable. The steak and the lobster were avearge at best. On a positive note the bread was excellent.

Customer 5528.Name: ErinG
Customer 5528.Content: Always a great time, with outstanding food. However, the Met seemed very busy for a Tuesday night and for whatever reason our service was not up to the "Met" standard I am use to. We actually had more help with the menu from our sommelier than the waiter.

Customer 5529.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5529.Content: Food and service were supurb. One of the best steak houses I have ever eaten at. Highly reccomend this establishment.

Customer 5530.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5530.Content: Good food, good service, but a very noisy environment. Our table was so tiny that we had to move the silverware aside. Rather awkward when the food came. Other than that, it was very pleasant.

Customer 5531.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5531.Content: First time at Metropolitan Grill! Enjoyed my experience there, the only unfortunate situation was that we were seated closest to the entrance in a small booth. When the doors were open, there was a draft and the seating was uncomfortable. I would recommend that you wait for a better seat if you are offered the ones next to the entrance.

Customer 5532.Name: KayR
Customer 5532.Content: Always great quality steaks cooked to perfection.  If you don't like red meat, there is always a fresh fish selection that is also cooked perfectly.

Customer 5533.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5533.Content: I was not happy with my 42 day ribeye. It was charred on the outside so it was tough to chew & cut while the inside was perfectly cooked. The two combinations to the meat was not enjoyable. I could only eat the inside. The crabcakes were amazing. Our overall experience was wonderful

Customer 5534.Name: Laceyroo
Customer 5534.Content:
Classic steak place - large portions of expected food but well done.
I sunk into the booth, but more from spent springs than sumptuousness.. would have rather a chair as it made me feel like a little kid reaching the table and I'm pretty tall.

Customer 5535.Name: BryanC
Customer 5535.Content: Awesome as usual. A classic steak house in the heart of downtown. They do everything right from the moment you walk into the door.

Customer 5536.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5536.Content: We always have perfect service and fabulous food at "The Met"

Customer 5537.Name: BobC
Customer 5537.Content: Great food, outstanding service. Check the back of the wine list for "closeout" specials.

Customer 5538.Name: fayew
Customer 5538.Content: I think I might have had the best steak here I have ever had. It was amazingly tender. The dungeness crab claws were also amazing. No room for dessert. The service was great. Very friendly, knowledgeable and he even bought my husband an oyster to try because they got talking about them. The place has a nice buzz to it without feeling over crowded.

Customer 5539.Name: DennisD
Customer 5539.Content: Although they used to pan fry it, they still make one of the best pepper steaks of any steak house. Their menu has a good selection of great steaks. Their wine list is very good, but a little high priced. However, their own special selection wines are not so outlandish in price and are excellent. This is a memorable place. It is best if it follows a visit to the Brooklyn, a block and a half away, for oysters at the bar as an appetizer to the Metropolitan Grill's great meals.

Customer 5540.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5540.Content: BEST place to eat out in Seattle!!! Hands down.

Customer 5541.Name: Georgiatrekkers
Customer 5541.Content: We came in from the rain to find a warm welcome and a dry comfortable booth. The food and drinks were great. My daughter had virgin strawberry daiquiri that she said was the best ever and they made bananas foster table side. We were not rushed and had a very pleasant meal.The steaks were perfect and they know how to grade the rareness.

Customer 5542.Name: bassandsnakes
Customer 5542.Content: The servers were very friendly. When doing dessert presentations at other tables, they included my table in on it. The server checked up on us in very good timing, so he wasn't bothering or neglecting us. They gave my boyfriend a free dessert for his birthday. The rolls were delicious, the wine was delicious, and the salmon was fantastic. My boyfriend said the steak was great. The only I didn't enjoy was the potatoes, but they weren't bad either.

Customer 5543.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5543.Content: I've eaten here a number of times but this was the best so far. We went to celebrate my mother's 79th birthday. The staff was charming and attentive and th food was wonderful - everything prepared as requested (we had a few special requests). My mother said that her mesquite grilled salmon was the best she's ever eaten and my favorite pea salad - I could have that every day!

Customer 5544.Name: Matt
Customer 5544.Content: I have been to the met many times and monday's visit was very disappointing. The waiter virtualy ignored us. The rib eye was OK, but not nearly the quality I have come to expect from the met and similarly priced steakhouses.

Customer 5545.Name: Roger
Customer 5545.Content: The Metro Grill was as always, a great place to dine. My daughter and I shared the larger Filet Mignon and it was truely the most tender steak I've ever had, even better than I've had here in the past. My spouse was impressed with the Sole. We ordered the Mac and Cheese as a side dish and it was delicious, just much too rich for me. Try in small amounts and take the rest home. The only negative I have is a small one, I don't care for the current style of Escargo (in shell), I thought it was much better on the small tray (no shell), soaked in garlic butter.

Customer 5546.Name: BetteB
Customer 5546.Content: Love The Met. Food was super and the waiter was wonderful.

Customer 5547.Name: JerryJ
Customer 5547.Content: Most disappointing dining experience that I have had in years. It is was off all the way around. Three of us who don't get together often went there while in Seattle for a convention. All of us ordered oysters (actually thought that they were clams when they arrived, except that they weren't large enough to be clams) - terrible. Good salads, but when the beef arrived the wheels came completely off. One of the steaks was so full of gristle it could even be cut, then it took at least 30 minutes for a replacement steak to arrive after it was sent back. The other two of us were finished with our steaks before it arrived. My steak had virtually no flavor. Our server checked in only once ever 30 minutes or so, so we had to flag down other waiters

Customer 5548.Name: Sasss
Customer 5548.Content: The seasonal crab mac & cheese and the french onion soup were the best mac & cheese and french onion soup I've ever had. Avoid the House Field Greens salad. It was so tasteless and bad that my sister and I didn't even finish our split portions. The waygu filet was very good and tender, although it was barely warm when it was brought out. I prefer my steaks sizzling when they are brought out. Still, I'd come back again.

Customer 5549.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5549.Content: This Seattle treasure has the best food, most notably the steaks. Just remember to leave room for dessert, the creme brule and bananas foster are to die for. The service was impecable and the ambiance is perfect for a romantic dinner. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Customer 5550.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5550.Content:
We were a little disappointed on this visit to The Met due to our waiter's service being under par to what we're used to when dining at The Met. Service overall was slow and it felt like the waiter simply had too many tables to tend to. On more than 1 occasion we sat at our table wondering if the waiter had forgot about us. Once he was within earshot of our table and saw us, we could almost see the light bulb come on inside his head and could tell he had remembered what he previously forgot.

Besides the service issue, the food was delicious as always.

Customer 5551.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5551.Content: love their Prime rib (especially the Canjun sauce one)!

Customer 5552.Name: RobinK
Customer 5552.Content: ALWAYS love the Met and our server Diane who we request whenever we dine there.

Customer 5553.Name: hundfschmidt
Customer 5553.Content: Waaay to expensive for what you get.

Customer 5554.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5554.Content: Great food, very traditional upscale steakhouse. Portions enormous. Wine, martini, beer lists lengthy and staff helpful.

Customer 5555.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5555.Content: Can always count on great food, service and ambiance. Always recommending.

Customer 5556.Name: happyeater
Customer 5556.Content: Always have great food and service. Will go back again

Customer 5557.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5557.Content: We visit the Met at least once a year - typically for their dinner events. This time we ate out in the main area. We had a enjoyable experience. The food always surprises me on how good it really is. I have never had a bad steak here. Drinks were good. Definitely a meat and potato type of place with good sized portions.

Customer 5558.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5558.Content: A little pricey, but well worth it! We go here every time we are in Seattle (once a year), and have never had a bad dinner. If you like steak, you will LOVE this place!

Customer 5559.Name: diner
Customer 5559.Content: Excellent food and beverages and fabulous service.

Customer 5560.Name: SamuelB
Customer 5560.Content: It has been four years since I patronized this restaurant. In my opinion, the steaks are overpriced. I paid $63 for the Delmonico. The portion size is smaller and the dish included mashed potatoes only instead of potatoes and a serving of asparagus. A better value can be found elsewhere.

Customer 5561.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5561.Content: As always, the sevice and food were exceptional. We were greeted promptly, seated immediately and it just go better the whole evening. The Filets (Idaho farm) were the best I have ever had and the roasted root vegetables were excellent. Can't wait to go back.....

Customer 5562.Name: 509LR
Customer 5562.Content: We no longer live in Seattle but we still go the The Met when we visit. The food and the service has never let us down.

Customer 5563.Name: Greg
Customer 5563.Content: Have always heard the Metropolitan Grill was "the" steakhouse in Seattle. Frankly I was a little dissappointed in the food, likely related to the high expectations. The ambiance is great and the service was incredible, but the food would certainly not bring me back. For a great steak I'd prefer Jak's in Issaquah any day.

Customer 5564.Name: Thesoj
Customer 5564.Content: A nice restaurant with great service. The service is the highlight of this restaurant with an extensive wine list and knowledgeable wait staff. I got the ribeye done medium, it was not cooked all that well. Parts of the steak were medium but most parts were medium-rare if not rare. I expected a more tender steak with more flavor, being that it is dry-aged and cooked over charcoal. The steak was still a great steak, but maybe not worth the amount. If it was cooked correctly I probably would have enjoyed it a bit more. The desert we shared was quite good and the espresso was top quality.

Customer 5565.Name: STEPHENW
Customer 5565.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill is a good steak house. It has all the standard fair of a top tier steak house. However, that's my only issue with it. There's nothing particularly unique about the restaurant. The staff is great, the feed is perfect and the tables private. It just lacked character.

If you are in the mood for a great steak and all the trimmings, check out the Metropolitan Grill. Just don't expect anything different or unique.

Customer 5567.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5567.Content: Overall the food was great. My wife and i really enjoyed everything!!

Customer 5568.Name: Socaldave
Customer 5568.Content: Another awesome meal! Great work on the 50th visit.....awesome

Customer 5569.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5569.Content: Execellent services and best steaks in town!

Customer 5570.Name: RichardP
Customer 5570.Content: Great service, wonderful food. This is a true Seattle destination for a great steak.

Customer 5571.Name: CampfireCouple
Customer 5571.Content: We expect a restaurant with the Mets reputation to be good, but each time we go there they exceed our expectation. We had the Chateaubriand for two. It was prepared perfectly. The flavor was beyond compare. The staff was knowledgeable, attentive without being intrusive and fun. It is always loud in the restaurant, but it was still easy to carry on a conversation. We will certainly go back again, and again.

Customer 5572.Name: nj77
Customer 5572.Content: Actually, disappointing. The steaks were good and cooked to perfection; however, the steaks we throw on the grill at home are as good or better, and they cost much much less than $50.00 - $70.00! The bernaise sauce had no flavor whatsoever.

Customer 5573.Name: Disappointing
Customer 5573.Content: From the minute you drive up to the curb to the time you leave, the experience is exceptional. Great service and the food is extraordinary. The wine list is extensive, and the Sommelier made a perfect recommendation based on our preferences. We've been celebrating special occasions at the Met for over 25 years, and it will continue to be our first choice. It's expensive, but worth it!

Customer 5574.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5574.Content: Above my expectations. 1st time there after the theater. What a treat. Service "above and beyond".

Customer 5575.Name: RobertB
Customer 5575.Content: Great Dinner as usual. We'll be back.!

Customer 5576.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5576.Content: I have yet to have a better steak in Seattle, there are a lot of good steak houses in Seattle and I have tried most, but this one is great, so I keep going back.

Customer 5577.Name: Lagovine
Customer 5577.Content: Wonderful! Open Tables assessment of cost is WAY off. Cost is 60 to 100 per person.

Customer 5578.Name: Private
Customer 5578.Content: As one would expect steaks were excellent, with Porterhouse and Steak au Poivre especially good. We thought the place was a little dated and tired, understand the Met is going for the Classic Steakhouse look, but the rugs and seats are definitely showing their age. Service was adequete but nothing special, especially for the prices paid for the meal.

Customer 5579.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5579.Content: The steaks were burnt to a crisp on the outside, even though they were cooked well on the inside. The sides were good, but loaded with butter. The staff was excellent though, and they were able to make an exception to their rules and put flowers I had ordered with a third party vendor on the table before we arrived.

Customer 5580.Name: MarcfromShermanOaks
Customer 5580.Content: This was my first time in Seattle; and a friend recommended the Metropolitan Grill. The food was fantastic. We had shrimp and crab apps, which were great. I had a New York bone-in steak, which was amazing (worth every penny of the $70!!). Service and atmosphere were also solid. I loved this place and can't wait to go back.

Customer 5581.Name: lewisclaim
Customer 5581.Content: Food is good but prices are exorbitant.  There are other resturants that offer more for the price or the same for substantially less.  Wine list is outstanding but prices are over the moon.  It is as if they are trying to discourage the consumption of wine with food.

Customer 5582.Name: Customer2BeSatisfied
Customer 5582.Content: Need to update your website here - misleading in price - No regular steak was under $50.00 - much higher priced than expected. Overall Food and Service was very good, but expensive as most 5 star locations

Customer 5583.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5583.Content: Consistently delivers an excellent dinner experience.

Customer 5584.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5584.Content: From the incredible melt in your mouth scallops for appetizers--the perfect salad---the perfect steak to the knock your socks off creme brulee and chocolate lava cake..our meal was truly a treat and a memorable experience.

Customer 5585.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5585.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is always a step above the competition.

Customer 5586.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5586.Content: The service was the best I recieved in a long time. Food was absolutely what you ask for. The steaks are the best!!

Customer 5587.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5587.Content: A great place. I wouldn't change anything.

Customer 5588.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5588.Content: We've eatten at the Metro Grill many times, usually special occasions and the food and service is always 5 star. Keep up the good work.

Customer 5589.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5589.Content: Great food, great service, a little overpriced compared to comparable restaurants where I live...Dallas/Fort Worth.

Customer 5590.Name: ValerieA
Customer 5590.Content: It bit pricey but the food was very good! Had 8:15 reservations and the kept us waiting 20 minutes. Not too happy about that. The wait staff was ok could have been better. The server asked us if we ever had this kind of meat before? What is that suppose to mean? Kind of strange

Customer 5591.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5591.Content: What caan you say about a classic. Everything was perfect. They are one of the best at providing a first rate dining experience.

Customer 5592.Name: fonduelover
Customer 5592.Content: We have been going to "The Met" for special occasions for over 10 years. Lately the food and dining experience has slipped a bit. This time our trip was to celebrate my hubby's birthday. Our waiter was friendly and attentive, advising us on menu items and making sure everything was timed well, not too soon, yet not too long waiting. Our food was fine, but not really any better than our recent dinner at the local Keg steakhouse, yet it cost almost 3 times as much. My baked potato was "huge" and thus not entirely cooked. It was somewhat hard and only warm in the center. The bread they brought at the beginning of the meal was so-so. The standout for me was the carrot cake but again it was a huge slice and cost $11.

Customer 5593.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5593.Content: Watch out if they ask you if it's a special occasion. They brought us a birthday dessert we did not order, and then charged us $8 for it! Both the Salmon and the Chicken were over cooked.

Customer 5594.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5594.Content: Best steakhouse I've been to. Service was great and very friendly. Only thing was that it took awhile for me to place my order, but it was busy at the time so it's understandable.

Customer 5595.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5595.Content: Had to send back a steak to be replaced. Otherwise it was a great experience. They were diligent in solving the problem, the rest of the food was very good, and the service was friendly and attentive.

Customer 5596.Name: KathyM
Customer 5596.Content:
The steaks were so tender & delicious, truely the best steak in town!
We celebrated our 35th Wedding Anniversary there, it was really great.

Customer 5597.Name: Wineswine
Customer 5597.Content: Excellent Steaks!! Lousy Hostess! Our friend was arriving late by plane we called to ask to either hold or push back the reservation and were told the couldn't Thank god for Open Table we changed the res via mobile app. When we arrived 15 min early for our reservation we were told to wait in the bar for our table 45 min. The wine steward was a snob and then botched the cork on the bottle of wine we had brought. Thank god the service made up for it our waiter was attentive helpful and made excellent recommendations and gave great service. Not to mention The Food was outstanding well worth the price.

Customer 5598.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5598.Content: Our waiter was great, but the other waiters that helped him not so good. I had ordered a 42day aged rib eye and when it arrived at my table it was completely black on top. Our main waiter did not bring it but he got it back to the kitchen fast. By the time I recieved my food my wife was working on her dessert. Great time for our aniversery. At this type of restraunt I don't know how the Chef let that piece of meat leave there kitchen.

Customer 5599.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5599.Content: We had a great meal and were there for about 3 hours. Only drawback is the prices, they make this an only once a year restaurant.

Customer 5600.Name: AmandaD
Customer 5600.Content: Such a wonderful place. Best wait staff in Seattle and food is above average.

Customer 5601.Name: Arrpoo
Customer 5601.Content: The 'Met' has always been a must on our list when we visit Seattle. The ambiance is great as are their steaks and fish dishes.

Customer 5602.Name: SheilaM
Customer 5602.Content: This was special occassion b-day celebration. Our hotel had called ahead to let the restaurant know & assured us we would be "taken care of". Well, I can say the steak was wonderful but didn't feel like we were taken care of in any "out of the ordinary" way. We were seated close to the door. We even mentioned we were there from CA to celebrate b-day. We felt like the waiter shifted his friendliness/attentiveness when we chose to split a steak. Neither of us gals can eat a 12-16 oz steak... The bus boy was helpful & friendly, took our picture for us & chatted. It would have been nice to at least received a celebratory dessert or a paid ride back to the hotel in one of the towne cars they had waiting outside... just a little something...

Customer 5603.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5603.Content: This is a great classic steakhouse with a classic bar and dining room.  The service is superb and I have to admit, I lived 3 years in Kansas City, but the bone-in Filet here is the best steak I have ever had!!!  Who would have thought you would have to go to Seattle to get it!!!

Customer 5604.Name: KimF
Customer 5604.Content: Best steak and friendliest service ever. Worth every penny. My favorite place!

Customer 5605.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5605.Content: Most of the fine dining establishments I go to serve great food, but the portion size is relatively small. You never leave hungry, but you rarely take anything home. We started off with fried artichoke hearts, and out come this massive pile off food. I was shocked at how much there was. For our entrees I got the Waygu ny strip, and my girlfriend got the "small" prime rib. The prime rib was advertised on the menu as being 12 oz. I would be surprised if it was under 17-20 oz. And for dessert, I got a chocolate lave cake (something I serve at the restaurant I work at) and it was HUGE!!! and delicious I might add. I couldn't be happier with the food or the service. The table we were at was near the front door so it got a little cold at times.

Customer 5606.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5606.Content:
Along with Daniel's Broiler, one of my two favorite steakhouses in greater Seattle.  The steaks are top-of-the-line, and the trimmings are very well executed as well.  It was here that my wife found, rather to her surprise, that she might like crab-cake after all.

A good spot to eat before a show downtown (5th Avenue, etc).

Customer 5607.Name: JustaBite
Customer 5607.Content: Had a reservation for 5 - the party grew to 8. Even though the restaurant seemed completely full the staff was able to quickly accommodate us at another table large enough for our unplanned guests. Food here is always very good - a variety of orders from steak to salads and burgers - there were no complaints. Service was excellent, even with our changes we were able to complete in time for everyone to meet their schedules.

Customer 5608.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5608.Content: very tasty. bone-in fillet is fantastic

Customer 5609.Name: JG47
Customer 5609.Content: In my opinion the best dining experience in all of Seattle. The food is second to none and the service is outstanding.

Customer 5610.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5610.Content: I've been to the Met for years and I have to say this was probably one of my least memorable meals. I ordered the 32 day aged rib eye for $52 and it was a piece of steak I could easily grill on my own at home. Probably my only disappointment at the Met, have always had consistently tasty, cooked to perfection steak.

Customer 5612.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5612.Content: Food was decent. My NewYork steak was a little on the dry side. Price is higher than what it should be.

Customer 5613.Name: jmark
Customer 5613.Content: We have loved The Met for over 20 years. It never dissapoints.

Customer 5614.Name: LisaW
Customer 5614.Content: Metropolitan Grill is our go-to special occasion restaurant. We went for an early Valentine's Day dinner and it was very good as usual, although service was a bit slower than normal and our steaks, while delicious, weren't as warm as they should have been, possibly because they were a bit busier than normal for a Sunday night. My peppercorn NY was well-seasoned, but didn't have quite as much peppery kick to it as in the past. My husband's prime filet was fabulous as always. His onion soup was good, as was my blue cheese wedge salad. We skipped appetizers in favor of saving room for dessert, burnt creme (always good) for me and a chocolate sundae for my husband. A good meal overall, but not quite as great as usual. Still, highly recommended.

Customer 5615.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5615.Content: We had a great time and were treated very well, even though it was very busy.

Customer 5616.Name: laitsabr
Customer 5616.Content: The steaks were outstanding as usual. My son had the prime rib from the kids' menu which was a good-sized portion (to his delight). The filet from the American Wagyu selection was juicy and tender, the aged steaks amazingly flavorful. The service was excellent as usual. It was a great place to celebrate Valentine's Day with the family.

Customer 5617.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5617.Content: We were near the Chairmans room which was much quieter and cozier than the main dining room. It was wonderful to have our meal there. The food was excellent and our server was great. He was attentive without being annoying and provided us with a night to remember. Loved the last course...Cherries Jubilee!

Customer 5618.Name: DianeKK
Customer 5618.Content: From the first bite of the Delmonico, until totally sated with Bannana Foster made at our table the "experience" was incredible!

Customer 5619.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5619.Content: Good food and great service, but limited menu and not much else to show for. Would be impressive at half of what they charge for meals. Wine selection was great and the dedicated wine advice was appreciated.

Customer 5620.Name: NatNaySEA
Customer 5620.Content: I love The Met. Outstanding service, delicious food. Always a treat.

Customer 5621.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5621.Content: While the atmosphere is classic(been going there for 10 years), my wife and I were astonished to see the price of the steaks for the quality that was received. They were nice cuts of meat, but nowhere near the price charged. My wife's filet mignon was exceptional (not worth $70), but my porterhouse was ordinary with decent flavor (definitely not worth $66). We have loved coming here for 10 years, but we will be looking elsewhere now for a quality steak as The Met has finally exceeded their quality with their pricing. Very unfortunate for us.

Customer 5622.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5622.Content: I hadn't eaten at the Met since summer of 1999 and my memory of that first experience was mainly centered around the cost. This last meal was won of the best I have had, definitely the best steak I have had in a long while. The environment is great, the food was fantastic and overall it was a great evening. While it is still on the high end of the price curve, I certainly believe the experience was worth the cost.

Customer 5623.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5623.Content: There are no proper words to honestly describe our experience at the Met. From the opening of the front door to the the end of the meal, I can truly say that this was the finest dining experience my fiance and/ or myself have ever had. I can find praise for all members of the staff that we met and the food was absolutely fabulous.

Customer 5624.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5624.Content: This was out third time dining at The Met. Service was perfect. Not a single course was rushed to the table. Wine was beautiful and the food was spot on. We want to try other steak houses in the Seattle area but its hard when every time we go the experience is excellent.

Customer 5625.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5625.Content: A Great experience. I would recommend to anyone and everyone who loves excellent food.

Customer 5626.Name: Willy
Customer 5626.Content: This is the real deal, a great old fashioned steakhouse!

Customer 5627.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5627.Content: Consistantly great food and a wonderful business lunch destination!

Customer 5628.Name: Roger
Customer 5628.Content: Everything lived up to my expectations. Just about my favorite place to dine in the Seattle area and one of the few places I'm willing to go into Seattle for. This is an especially good place to have a special occasion dinner. I would dine there more often except I find the city of Seattle user unfriendly, lack of parking just one of my peeves.

Customer 5629.Name: Justme
Customer 5629.Content: Absolutely spectacular in every aspect! We greatly enjoyed an amazing meal and had an overall fabulous evening!

Customer 5630.Name: RitaD
Customer 5630.Content: This was my first time at the Met. I have always heard great things about the restaurant. They were all true. The service and attention were outstanding. The best Fillet Mignon I have ever had. Cooked it exactly how I like it. I would recommend to friends and will go back for sure.

Customer 5631.Name: DaveH
Customer 5631.Content: The steak was excellent but over priced. I felt that we were ignored a bit because the server was very busy with a few large tables. Once he paid attention to us he was very friendly and attentive. He didn't check to see if our steak was prepared right. I felt too that the food was not exactly hot...not cold but could have been hotter. Probably sat in the kitchen for a few too many minutes. Not huge issues but when you pay $70 for a steak you expect perfection. There are other places to choose from that are as nice but less expensive.

Customer 5632.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5632.Content: Amazing dining experience! Loved the food, loved the atmosphere...all-in-all my favorite restaurant of all time.

Customer 5633.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5633.Content: The food was excellent. The service was so-so.

Customer 5634.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5634.Content: We had the most attentive service we've ever experienced at a restaurant. It was like the kind of service you get dining on a cruise. Our waiter and other service people made a point to get to know us a little, and chat a little, but weren't obtrusive. They made it evident they aimed to please. They were also very knowledgeable about steaks, and the steak was sooo tender!

Customer 5635.Name: TomH1
Customer 5635.Content: Still the best steak in town accompanied by consistent excellent service.

Customer 5636.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5636.Content: Metropolitan Grill continues to serve the best steaks in town accompanied by an extensive wine list. The service was top notch and our return experience, after a couple years absence, was rewarded with a memorable, top rated meal!

Customer 5637.Name: JohnB
Customer 5637.Content: It's always an experience to dine at 'The Met' and easy to forget how expensive. Don't forget to order vegetables to go with your meal, otherwise all you get is protean and starch...

Customer 5638.Name: GailA
Customer 5638.Content: I love The Met. I have never been disappointed with the food/service all the many times I've been. Lobster bisque is delish!

Customer 5639.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5639.Content:
As a regular, I can say the food is great here, I can never leave disappointed in one of the Met's amazing steaks and our waitress and most of the staff were a true delight as always.

I am, however, very disappointed with the sommelier. When I asked for his opinion on a couple of wine's, he simply said "you'll like it". I look younger than I am, but sure as hell don't like being treated like an idiot or a chil. He later came back to mention that they were out of that wine, what would be my second choice. I asked him about another wine and again got the "its good, you'll enjoy it" answer. When I asked what the wine was like and if it would be a good pairing, he really brushed off the question with another vague answer. Horrible fo

Customer 5640.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5640.Content: Great food. Great service. Prices are not too bad as well!

Customer 5641.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5641.Content: Had a great experience!..Our waitress was perfect and had great suggestions..Her name was Alyssa or Aleshia...she was great!..It was our first time dining with you and will again in the future.

Customer 5642.Name: DanD
Customer 5642.Content:
This was my fifth time dining at the Met however it has been about 6-7 years since my last visit. I took my 17 year old daughter for her first visit so she may enjoy the very high level of service and quality dining. Although the service was adequate and we both thought our waiter was fun and engaging, I was a little let down. It simply wasn't the high level of service I'd expect when spending over $200 for dinner. I noticed it because I've had more experiences with this however my daughter didn't. I'll quote her "Dad I feel like I'm in the Hello Dolly movie".
On the plus side, the food was just as fantastic as I ever had! You can not go wrong with a steak at the Met! I still recommend you go there!

Customer 5643.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5643.Content: Always a flawless experience at The Met. Consistently superior food and service. Our waitress was very attentive and conversational (just the right amount), and her support staff was on top of keeping the water glasses filled and empty plates removed. Perfection!

Customer 5644.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5644.Content: The food was exceptional, the service not so much.

Customer 5645.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5645.Content: We were celebrating a birthday. The food was fantastic, the service was awesome and the entire staff that we came in contact was were great!

Customer 5646.Name: Mediocre
Customer 5646.Content: The Metropolitan is an institution but it's prices have just gone too far out of control. Dinner for two without extravagance exceeds $150, and that is just silly. The steaks are good, but not that good. The front desk staff was good, but we waited twenty minutes for our table past reservation time. Water was poured and we sat fifteen minutes with no one else coming to the table. Only when I went to ask the front if we actually had a waiter did anyone appear, and he seemed put out that we had summoned him. It is a wonderful restaurant normally and it is fine for a special occasion, but it is now relegted to that status for me because of it's prices.

Customer 5647.Name: GPHB
Customer 5647.Content:
I've been to the Metropolitan Grill maybe 8 times over the past 25 years...the last time was 2004. I go for the quality steaks, excellent wines, great service and comfortable dining area. Costs have been high, but not over the moon.

This time, the noise level took away from the previous relaxing atmosphere. I know that the bar is a popular watering hole, but it would help if it were better isolated from the dining room. It's always been busy, but not raucous. Service was excellent as always, not rushed like some other high-end restaurants. Prices have gone over the moon, the menu is poorly organized & confusing and my rib eye steak, although good quality, was more like a roast (3" thick) - not as enjoyable as in the past.

Customer 5648.Name: PabloYCarina
Customer 5648.Content: A delicious meal, with outstanding service. Our server- Alissa- was truly a pleasure and clearly enjoys what she does. The food was great, the timing was perfect- it was a great evening at the Met!

Customer 5649.Name: Cyan
Customer 5649.Content: My coworker and I stopped by for lunch the other day. It was her first time at the Met. She had the chop salad, and I had the Southwest Chop Salad with calamari. They were both very good, and I had enough left for dinner. The oat and molasses rolls are my favorite. The service, as always, was spot on.

Customer 5650.Name: DavidE
Customer 5650.Content:
Peppercorn steak was fantastic and could not be improved.
Hot Lava Dessert was fine
Escargot appetizer was excellent but a little small on the portion size.

Customer 5652.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5652.Content: Without a doubt, the best steak in town.

Customer 5653.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5653.Content: A must do if you are visiting or live in Seattle!

Customer 5654.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5654.Content: First timers this last weekend, and can't wait to go back.

Customer 5655.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5655.Content: Overall, I had an amazing experience at the metropolitan grill. The food and service is superb. The wine list is the best I’ve ever seen. All the staff gave amazing service and had a great sense of humor. The Bananas Foster is a must try! We loved the dessert so much that the chef gave us the recipe. Nice touch. This earned our service… we will definitely visit there again.

Customer 5656.Name: JuliE
Customer 5656.Content: We waited in the bar for our table (got there before our reservations) and the bartender was not as interested in us as he was the three single girls sitting a few feet away. He mixed good drinks but didnt even bother with eye contact. Our waitress however was outstanding and did just the right amount of hovering without butting into our conversations. The drinks and appetizers were exceptional. I was particularly happy with the oysters, lobster and crab. Dinner was good but the steak and sides were not as outstanding as I had hoped. The place and atmosphere were wonderful and it was a great evening. All in all I was very happy with the experience and we'll be back for the next special occasion.

Customer 5657.Name: Ambience
Customer 5657.Content: The grill as usual lived up to it's great reputation. The service & food are beyond expecations. Since it is quite pricey, it is truly a very special occassion resturant for us. Well worth it!!!

Customer 5658.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5658.Content: Our service was very attentive. The food arrived at a perfect temperature and perfectly cooked. Although I ordered a steak which was the best I have ever eaten, I was pleasantly surprised at the affordable prices on the lunch menu with many items priced under $20. I would love to be a repeat cutomer and try some lunch items.

Customer 5659.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5659.Content: Not quite as romantic as El Gaucho... I'd recommend El Gaucho for that, but in EVERY other respect, the two restaurants are highly recommended. Amazing food, great service... costs a fair bit, but food worthy of the price tag.

Customer 5660.Name: TeacherBecky
Customer 5660.Content: Our waiter was excellent! Our food was outstanding!

Customer 5661.Name: BobC
Customer 5661.Content: Excellent steak, good (and moderately-priced) wine. Not a better steakhouse in the NW.

Customer 5662.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5662.Content: Went to the Met with my daughter as a part of our "Girls' night out" before Symphony. Appetizer (almond crusted sea scallops) was pretty good, but my daughter's NY Strip came out done even though she ordered MR. No pink to be seen inside. Because of our time constraint, the manager comped it instead of redoing the dish, but it was definitely not what we expected when ordering a $50 plate of steak. Overall 3 stars for the staff's professional service.

Customer 5663.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5663.Content: I love the Metropolitan Grill. The service is consistent in the fact that the entire staff takes note that you are present and acknowledging you. The food is fantastic! I've had a numerous amount of items off the menu, and have never been disapponted.

Customer 5664.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5664.Content: all the food was great, but steaks are definitely their specialty.

Customer 5665.Name: ShellyL
Customer 5665.Content: The staff are great. Knowledgeable but not snooty, eager to accommodate but not intrusive, they customize each detail to fit the patron but they know what's important and they give value to the upscale price.

Customer 5666.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5666.Content: Great service but steaks are a little too salty for me. Great quality beef.

Customer 5667.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5667.Content: My boyfriend and I had late-night dinner reservations at The Met for New Year's Eve. We arrived at 11pm and, as expected, the place was extremely busy. Our reservations were for 11:15 and we were promptly seated at that time. We sat closer to the front of the restaurant and there was a bit of a draft from the door, but the service and food more than made up for the periodic breeze. We had the prawn-tini appetizer which came with 4 of the largest prawns I've ever had in my life along with a great cocktail sauce. My boyfriend and I ordered the 42-day-aged ribeye cooked perfectly to our tastes with asparagus on the side. The chocolate lava cake topped off the night and was delicious. Expensive? Yes. But worth the price for a special occasion.

Customer 5668.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5668.Content: One of our guests needed a gluten free diet and they were superb in providing her what she could have. Excellent service!

Customer 5669.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5669.Content: My New York Steak was OK, Not Outstanding like I had Before. Vege's OK.

Customer 5670.Name: JuneOfBoston
Customer 5670.Content: While this is known as one of the best steak restaurants in Seattle, I thought the offerings were very overpriced.  If you love steak and want to pay the money, most likely you will be satisfied with your meal.  I am an excellent grill-master and could have done better at home with premium meat from a local butcher.

Customer 5671.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5671.Content:
