Sadly it was not the best of experience for me at The Met. I was looking forward to a nice anniversary dinner with my wife. I had high expectation and I’ve heard good things about the restaurant. Overall I was very disappointed to spend over $100 to get what the service and food we received.
Things that went well:
• The valet service was great as I didn’t have to find parking.
• The bread was also very good.
• The Portobello Mignon was good. This was a vegetarian offering that my wife chose and sheet enjoyed it.
Things that didn’t go as well:
Service
• The waitress seemed a little preoccupied the entire evening. She forgot part of our order which was sautéed mushrooms to go with my prime rib.
• My drink remained empty for some t

Customer 5672.Name: Dags
Customer 5672.Content: The food was delicious, especially the Porter House; the meat just melts in your mouth with flavor! I forgot all the food that we ordered, but every bite of it was GREAT! The customer service was wonderful, too!...all the way from Valet Parking, to Coat Check, to the Hostess, to our Server and everyone in the restaurant.

Customer 5673.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5673.Content: The food is so delicious! The steaks are simply amazing - - tender and so flavorful! Thanks for the great experience.

Customer 5674.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5674.Content: I wanted to take my boyfriend out to a nice dinner to celebrate his birthday, and after a lot of research about restaurants in Seattle, I ultimately chose The Met on the advice of my brother. From the minute we walked in to the minute we walked out, the service was amazing! Our waitress was extremely knowledgeable and helpful when we were ordering, and her recommendations were spot-on. He had the New York peppercorn steak, and I had the filet combo, and both were absolutely heavenly--truly worthy of the "best steak in town" label. Our waitress even brought my boyfriend a complimentary dessert! We will definitely be back to celebrate other special occasions!

Customer 5675.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5675.Content: It was my birthday and me and my husband went to the Metropolitan Grill. It was very nice. We had a quiet table in the corner. The food was on hit. The service was great. Thanks.

Customer 5676.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5676.Content: Took the train up from Olympia just to have lunch at the Metropolitan Grill. We had a wonderful day and a fantastic Au Jus beef sandwich. Best I've ever had. Alice, our waitress was friendly and attentive without being intrusive. The atmosphere was just right, and the prices were reasonable considering the quality of the meal.

Customer 5677.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5677.Content: If you like an excellent steak this is the place to go in Seattle. Great wine selection.

Customer 5678.Name: BJGN
Customer 5678.Content:
Enjoyed the time/ lunch but nothing Special.. seems to have morphed from great steak and oyster place to your typcial business lunch place.. LOTS of tourists dressed in Jeans and very casual...
Seafood salad.. again OK but not great.. Crab meat on salad appeared DARK...Shrimp grilled last week???
Service was Good but again VERY impersonal.. just "getting the job done"...

Customer 5679.Name: Idadtc
Customer 5679.Content: Excellent service. Waitstaff pay attn to detail.. great experience

Customer 5680.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5680.Content: Excellent choice for a nice dinner out. Very hip downtown atmosphere. Service asked every 10 minutes to take our plates-- quick service or pushy?

Customer 5681.Name: Axel
Customer 5681.Content: We took our family of five and had a wonderful holiday meal. The food was fabulous. My oldest daughter really appreciated the incredible portabello mushroom mignon as she is a vegatarian. You might think in a restaurant famous for ther steaks that the vegatraian mean would be an afterthougt. It was fabulous and a huge amount of food. Great for lunch the next day. Everthing was cooked to perfection, the service was excellent. Thanks for the great evening.

Customer 5682.Name: Keithb
Customer 5682.Content: A great evening after Christmas shopping, the Market, and walking through the Gingerbread houses at the Sheraton. Wonderful steaks and great servers who know the menus and the best pairings for food and wine. Seattle's great steakhouse!

Customer 5683.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5683.Content: The service and food was exceptional!! This was a holiday celebration with friends and the ambiance of the place along with the attentiveness of the server and wait staff and the maitre d' added to the warmth and holiday glow. We enjoyed ourselves immensely!

Customer 5684.Name: LeeRae
Customer 5684.Content: Our server was beyond great. Not only was her service fabulous, so was her personality and demenor. We didn't get her name, but we would ask for her again if we had.

Customer 5685.Name: FrenchAddict
Customer 5685.Content: I was hoping for something really special since I was celebrating the few occasions I could visit my friend in Seattle. The food was so-so and service not really outstanding. Worse, is the noise. I go to premium restaurants to experience something extraordinary. But the place was noisy with TV noise coming out of ESPN.

Customer 5686.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5686.Content: A classic in Seattle, hadn't been there for a few years and I instantly was reminded why it's one of my favorites, if not THE favorite restaurant of any I enjoy. Service is always great, the food wonderful, the ambience, this being just a few days from Christmas, was festive...love the Met!

Customer 5687.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5687.Content:
Busy Sunday with an unexpected Seahawk croud by us. We were greeted well and then were seated only 10min after our reservation. We sat in the Bar and the Barkeep was real slow and overwhelmed with the large crowd. He could have made eye-contact and said I will be with you as soon as I can. Once we were seated our server was one of the best. I forgot his name. The food and service was exceptional. I did however think it a bit cheesy to pay for the Valet parking. You drop a few hundred on dinner and then the 8 bucks to park. Just a little B-team. Enjoyed it allot will return.

Thank you,
Frank Hasselbalch

Customer 5688.Name: MerryMel
Customer 5688.Content: Have been going to the Met for special occasions and to treat out of town guests for years. I find when I stick with my favorite menu items, it's always stellar, and I try something new now and then too. This time I tried the Kentucky Sazerac cocktail. Fabulous! My new favorite. The bone-in filet was wonderful as were the wedge salad, asparagus and bananas foster for dessert. We were delighted to have Scott for our waiter again this time. He is so great. Friendly, professional, and unobtrusive. All the staff is great. Love this place!

Customer 5689.Name: larryo
Customer 5689.Content: Superb. The best steak in Seattle is only found at the Met. Our waiter was a bit distracted or overwhelmed. He was not as attentive as other staff have been in the past. The steaks were great. They provided complimentary creme brulee for each of my parents for their 82nd and 83rd birthdays. A nice touch.

Customer 5690.Name: JStorm
Customer 5690.Content: We had planned our weekend around eating at the Met and it was exactly what he hoped and expected! Great service and wonderful food! If we can save up the money again we will go there again! Thank you for a great time!

Customer 5691.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5691.Content: The Metropolitan Grill lives up to it's reputation yet again. We go to the Metro for special occasions, the service cannot be surpassed, the food is always carefully, and well prepared. The ambiance is old school, high end business establishment, but yet not stuffy. We used "open table" to book our reservation, requesting a booth, we arrived 5 min before our reservation, walked in the door and were seated in one of the nice curtained booths within moments of arriving.

Customer 5692.Name: Krisa123
Customer 5692.Content: We had always heard that Metropolitan Grill was in the top 5 steak houses in the Seattle area but we were disappointed. For the price, one expects top tier service, food and ambiance. The service started out great, but after a while our waitress seldom came back (we don't drink alcohol, so perhaps that was it). The water guy spilled my diet coke all over me/table - it was a mistake and he was a nice guy but the head wait staff were standing nearby and must have seen it but didn't apologize which would have helped the experience of sitting in wet clothes. Their "doneness" scale is skewed well to the right - ask for well if you want it medium. Better yet, go to Daniels or Mortons instead.

Customer 5693.Name: JohnM
Customer 5693.Content: This was my first experience at the Met and was not disappointed. On the contrary the ambience was warm and inviting and the service impeccable, but my prim rib was a bit chewy. Should have opted for a steak. I was under the impression that the Met was more upscale and therefore the clientele would be better dressed. Too may tee shirts and jeans for my taste. Perhaps I am an old foggy, but it was a detractor, even for my eighteen year old son. I will try you again.

Customer 5694.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5694.Content:
so easy making the reservations and thank goodness we did. Very popular during the lunch hour and holiday season...but what better way to be.

The parking at United parking validation has encouraged us to come again soon as that part of the experience can be too expensive...you've just made it earier and more desireable.

Customer 5695.Name: PamM
Customer 5695.Content: WE sat in a booth and thankfully we were two women. There was so little room because the unmovable benches were so close to the table. Two men could not have sat in this booth let alone been able to get into the booth.

Customer 5696.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5696.Content: We had a great time. The table was comfortable for four, and the wait-staff was very attentive. The food was spectacular.

Customer 5697.Name: IvanB
Customer 5697.Content: our server was the epitome of outstanding peronalized service and good people reading. Thank you Mr. Falls.

Customer 5698.Name: Francine
Customer 5698.Content: That was our second time to the Metropolitain Grill. The food was great, wine list was extensive and the atmosphere just right. The only reason why I am not giving the MG a five star when it comes to food is because of how pricy everything is. A steak can cost $85 or more and the plate is not dressed up (no vegetables just a big, huge potatoe). Great place for starving men because of the size of the steaks but for women with a "normal" appetite perhaps they should have smaller portions like a petit filet mignon 2oz. Overall, good place but not the top of our list

Customer 5699.Name: MerryMel
Customer 5699.Content: I've been going to the Met for many years. For most of those years I stuck with my basics: smoky met martini, salad, great steak, baked potato, burnt creme or bananas foster. In recent years I decided to try other options, but I'm ready to return to my faves. I've found items such as the French onion soup, lobster mac and cheese, special ribeye steak with demi-glaze just a bit lacking. Still good, just not up to my expectations after years of being more than happy with my basics. I tried the lemon tart on my most recent visit and thought it way too bland. I hardly knew there was lemon in it. Back to wedge salad, bone-in filet and bananas foster for me. These things the Met does better than anyone. The service is super.

Customer 5700.Name: Andrew
Customer 5700.Content: The prime steak wars in Seattle boast some heavyweight brands: Daniels, Mortons, El Gaucho, John Howie and of course, The Metropolitan. Each claim the best prime aged beef available. So what's the difference? Preparation, service, dining experience. Metropolitan has decent enough steaks, but dining there feels like you've flashed back to the 1980's. For some reason, when I dine at Morton's one of the other prime steak houses, I don't feel ripped off. For some reason when I dine at Metropolitan, I do. Maybe it's the weak, frat-boy waiter style, or the outdated decor, or just the fact that the presentation feels old.

Customer 5701.Name: TerryD
Customer 5701.Content: Fantastic staff, warm and original atmosphere. Excellent cuisine and amenities.

Customer 5702.Name: SeaFav
Customer 5702.Content:
The food was very good. The waitress was not as attentive as I'm accustom to for a business dinner of 6 people. At times we were flagging her down for drinks, requests for water, etc.

My reservation requested: "preferrably a round table to accommodate 7" and then followed up with a call to the hostest for a semi-private or quiet table. When we got there, the table wasn't ready and when they did get one ready, they crammed us into a round table stuck in the corner right next to the kitchen. The wait staff was constantly reaching over the guests seated on the outside, very distruptive and somewhat rude.

Customer 5703.Name: DanielK
Customer 5703.Content: The staff (everyone) were helpful, happy, friendly, etc. Much more apparent than other restaurants. They made the experience exceptional.

Customer 5704.Name: RobG
Customer 5704.Content: This my 2nd time at the Met. Took a good friend to celebrate his new job. Food was great, service was great, and the manager was really genuinely friendly. We will be back!

Customer 5705.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5705.Content: Prime rib was very average. Creamed spinach was les than average.

Customer 5707.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5707.Content:
We have been travelling from Vancouver, BC for over 17 years to enjoy this restaurant. The food, service and overall experience is outstanding!

I have dined at a number of top rated restaurants in the world.. and always have found a night at "the Met" is always a night that I will remember. The only other night at a restaurant that I can recall so fondly is in Paris, at "Jules Verne."

Top quality food, staff, and ambiance. I don't need to tell them to keep it up.. because I know they will.

Treat yourself and someone that you love!

Customer 5708.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5708.Content: This was the best steak dinner I have ever had. The service was fantastic and they treat you like royalty. I will definetly go there again.

Customer 5709.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5709.Content: I frequent the Met almost weekly for lunches and they never fail to deliver unsurpassed service and quality food. My clients and contacts leave feeling impressed and pampered. Other than the golf club, there is no better place to bring clients for lunch.

Customer 5710.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5710.Content: Awsome, lives up the 'Best Steak in Seattle' reputaion

Customer 5711.Name: jerry
Customer 5711.Content: Atmosphere was great, very busy but not overly noisy. Service was excellent with very helpful suggestions. Amazing wine list and deliciously prepared steaks. This restaurant is a Seattle favorite for special occasions.

Customer 5712.Name: RoadWarrior
Customer 5712.Content: The service was awesome! Jim was out waiter and could not have been any better!

Customer 5713.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5713.Content: Go to the Met if you want delicious steaks and the red-carpet treatment all the way.

Customer 5714.Name: Damay
Customer 5714.Content: I think it's maybe the booths and "energetic" noise level that takes the dining experience down a notch. However, that being said, the 20oz Delmonico that my husband and I shared was excellent. I had a nice pear/gorgonzola salad to start. Definitely an upscale steakhouse ( with upscale pricing). The winelist is absolutely outstanding...leave an extra 15 minutes to browse through it!

Customer 5715.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5715.Content: Service was wonderful and food presentation excellent.

Customer 5716.Name: Vissidarte
Customer 5716.Content: As usual and expected, we had a wonderful time. We celebrated a friend's birthday, and she loved it and was impressed w/the food and the service. Marilyn is the best server and so is everybody else from the bus boy to the hostesses!

Customer 5717.Name: KevinJ
Customer 5717.Content: I had read reviews and knew that if I were in Seattle, I had to visit the Met. Valet your car, parking is a nightmare. Arrived on time, and after a short wait in the bar we were escorted to our table. The waiters are all seasoned veterans. After a short chance to review the menu, we (wife & I) ordered the NY for 2. This huge side of cow shoed up at our table and was carved infront of us. Perfectly cooked (but not a lot of seasoning). They offered a white sauce (creamy good) for dipping and cheddar/beer sauce for over the potatoes. Was all good. Finished the night off with the chocolate/carmel lava cake. Was really good. It is a great place. Enjoy!

Customer 5718.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5718.Content: The food was awesome, the service was excellent, and i highly recommend this place to anyone.

Customer 5719.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5719.Content: We came here for the first time and on our 20th anniversary and we had a great dinner and a great experience. And, Opentable made it really easy for us.

Customer 5720.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5720.Content: As always, Metropolitan Grill has an outstanding reputation.

Customer 5721.Name: JoshuaP
Customer 5721.Content: Third time dining there. Excellent as always.

Customer 5722.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5722.Content: Have been visiting Seattle for ten years and each time would not miss a chance to experience dinner there.

Customer 5723.Name: ipuppy
Customer 5723.Content: Classic steakhouse with outstanding food and impeccable service. Extensive wine list, many 3 or 4 figure priced bottles!

Customer 5724.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5724.Content: Great servers......dining, wine steard and buser.

Customer 5725.Name: Simpl3Bites
Customer 5725.Content: Always love my visit to The Met! The staff there are ever so warm and knowledgable. They always put you at ease. The food is always brilliant and service imppecable!

Customer 5727.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5727.Content: We loved our waiter--a guide to a wonderful meal.

Customer 5728.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5728.Content: We had a great experience and will be back again.

Customer 5729.Name: Togetherbydesign
Customer 5729.Content:
This was a business dinner in relation to a Symposium.
Everyone loved the food. Our waiter was wonderful lots of personality and very attentive, but not too.

Customer 5730.Name: Leftylemon
Customer 5730.Content: The Met is always good. It's our first choice in all of the State of Washington. There simply is no better establishment.

Customer 5731.Name: lipsky
Customer 5731.Content: I have had better experiences at this restaurant before. We had reservations but had to wait for 1/2 hour before being seated. Our waiter brought us water and did not introduce himself so we thought he was just the water person...he was our waiter. Never engaged in conversation with us but polite. My partner had steak and thought it was good but not as good as Ruth's Chris. I had the lobster bisque soup--very good--but the scallop appetizer was coated with a slightly crisp and tasteless "panko", sitting in butter...little flavor/not great. The side dish of wild mushrooms was greasy and piled a mile high with little flavor other than 'mushroom'. The chocolate cake was great tho. too bad the dinner was not. The restaurant was very noisy.

Customer 5732.Name: tbaseball21
Customer 5732.Content: We had great service and the meals were excellent.

Customer 5734.Name: diningwitholdpeople
Customer 5734.Content: Honestly, this is the exact kind of dinner I would make at home on an average night. It is a basic steak place and nothing more. The ambiance is diner like. Our waitress would not stop making small talk and all in all, I was wondering why I spent two hundred dollars for something I could do better at home and without constant chit chat about my waiters health insurance, son blah blah blah. It was intended to be a special meal for a family member and it really wasn't. I think this is a good place for out of town business people who are unadventurous and want a big piece of meat. I am not a fan and will not go back.

Customer 5735.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5735.Content: Food was fantastic, restaurant staff was outstanding, and the overall experience was better than expected. Look forward to my next visit.

Customer 5736.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5736.Content: A great spot for a great steak. The best selection in Seattle. Do not Miss this Restaurant

Customer 5738.Name: Madison
Customer 5738.Content: Although we had a reservation for 8:00, we were not seated until about 8:20. Being that this was the Met, they realized we were a little upset and provided crab cakes on the house. They were delicious (the best I've ever had!) We also orded a glass each of the Met's own cab, which was also excellent. For the main course we ordered the Chateaubriand carved table side ( I highly recommend this, it is a little pricey $120, but totally worth it). It smells amazing and tastes even better. After all that we decided to have dessert; the carrot cake, served ala mode and very decadent. What a great way to celebrate a birthday!

Customer 5739.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5739.Content: Excellent food, bit on the noisy side, but great service.

Customer 5740.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5740.Content: Overated. The steak was "average" at best. Overall, I would not rate the entire meal better than a "chain" steakhouse.

Customer 5741.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5741.Content: As a non-beef eater, I had my doubts about The Met, but my father-in-law and husband were celebrating some big events and I wanted them to fully enjoy their experiences.They did, and so did I: I was pleasantly surprised with the food, the service, and the atmosphere in general. We all had a fantastic time in the old-school, uber fancy Steakhouse. My lobster tail was maybe a tad overcooked but then again, I don't order lobster all that often. I would recommend The Met for anyone who wants a really special, big-city-feeling restaurant experience (yes, it's pricey).

Customer 5742.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5742.Content: The food is consistently tasty and fast enough for a business lunch with a sizable group. A favorite with busy downtown people. My friend is a vegan and our server thoughtfully put together a delicious meal for her.

Customer 5743.Name: sadielady
Customer 5743.Content: Great service, good food. But not as good as I remembered. I have to say we now have better steakhouses in Seattle than the Met. Still a good place to have a good steak.

Customer 5744.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5744.Content: Wonderful service and accommodated our group of 12 in a private dining room. Made for a wonderful, intimate 40th birthday celebration.

Customer 5745.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5745.Content: A classy place, but not necessarily tuned into clientele. We were dressed nicely, brought a very nice wine with us, but they tried to seat us in a room with people dressed in sweat clothes near a busing station. They moved us after some effort, and the someliere and waiter were pleasant, but the waiter steered me to a steak that was inedibly tough; he realized this quickly and brought a giant piece of prime rib that was just OK. I should have ordered something different, and the staff went through the motions of making us comfortable, but it felt perfunctory.

Customer 5746.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5746.Content: Excellent service, food and attention to detail. Best place to have that special dinner or an evening out with friends.

Customer 5747.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5747.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is my favorite restaurant. My husband and I drove from Aberdeen, WA to enjoy the city I grew up in, and have a wonderful birthday dinner at the Grill.

Customer 5748.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5748.Content: We had a great time the food was wonderfull. Brian our waiter was a true pro and took great care of us. We look forwark to comming back and we will set in the same table and probably order the same dinner. Overall a terrific experience.

Customer 5749.Name: billd
Customer 5749.Content: Everything was perfect. Exactly what you would expect.

Customer 5750.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5750.Content: the bone in filet was the best steak i've ever eaten. service was very good. a couple that was close to us were louder than i would have liked but the restaurant was amazing!

Customer 5751.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5751.Content:
We sat in the south section - quiet. Other section somewhat loud.

Great server - Jim. Great food.

Customer 5752.Name: WBER
Customer 5752.Content: The Met once again comes through with an amazing dining experience!! Great atmosphere, amazing food and impeccable service!! Wish I could go more often!!

Customer 5753.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5753.Content:
Still the best steakhouse in Seattle!

The food and service are always of the highest quality. I've been here on numerous occasions and have yet to be disappointed.

Customer 5754.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5754.Content: The Met lived up to its reputation! I took my husband for his birthday hoping to hear him say "This is the best steak I've ever eaten." and he did! Todd, our waiter, did a great job describing the menu offerings to us and was attentive but not intrusive. It was a wonderful evening and we are looking forward to returning for our next special dinner out.

Customer 5755.Name: CarmenG
Customer 5755.Content: Had lunch with a couple of girlfriends. We did not have a lot of time and told our waiter this. He ensured that our meals arrived on time and exactly as we had ordered. We even had time for the Bananas Foster which was prepared table side and delicious. The bonus was getting this free after 2:00 p.m. I had the scallops and the garden salad. It was the best I have eaten anywhere. Very filling and was very satisfied the entire day. Looking forward to returning again. Service was very good. Definitely ask for the molasses bread - simply divine!

Customer 5756.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5756.Content: As usual, the food and the service were both superb. My steak was the best I have every tasted. The servers were very professional and friendly. The cost makes this restaurant the destination for only the most special of occasions, for me anyhow.

Customer 5757.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5757.Content: Wonderful meal, terrific wine list, outstanding service.

Customer 5758.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5758.Content: Food was excellemt. Our server was very slow and forgetful. Her busser and assistants were great.

Customer 5759.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5759.Content: The service was fantastic! It helped my future Mother-in-Law to show favor on my side in my quest to secure her daughter as my future wife....

Customer 5760.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5760.Content: The combination of great food, welcoming ambiance, and fantastic service sets The Metropolitan Grill at the top. The only thing missing is the view, but it's usually gray and dreary anyway, in Seattle, diminishing views. Try the Wedge salad; I normally shy away from iceberg lettuce, but theirs is so crisp and fresh, and their dressing sublime...

Customer 5761.Name: Jackson
Customer 5761.Content: great spot for a business lunch meeting. We ate in the dining room so it was quiet and we had very attentive service.

Customer 5762.Name: Kelly
Customer 5762.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was excellent. My husband and I were in Seattle for the weekend and picked The Met to have our anniversary dinner. We couldn't have gone wrong. The food was outstanding! The best pieces of meat we have ever eaten. We ordered dessert(white chocolate coconut cake) and they also brought us out a surprise creme brulee to celebrate our anniversary. We think that The Met was well worth every penny we spent and would recommend it to anyone for any occasion.

Customer 5763.Name: TuttoBene21
Customer 5763.Content: We decided on the Metropolitan Grill somewhat last minute. We were looking for a good steakhouse - it was nearby, had a good rep and had a reasonable reservation time available. It was busy on a Saturday evening - the waitstaff was great: friendly and knowledgeable. We had a lovely wine, a great salad and outstanding steak. My nephew ordered the mac and cheese as a side and it was out of this world. I loved my filet and spinach, but I could have eaten his mac and cheese and been very happy. A lot of food - no room for dessert. It was a great Seattle dining experience for an out-of-towner.

Customer 5764.Name: Feldz
Customer 5764.Content: I had high hopes but was a bit disappointed with everything except the desserts which were amazing. I probably would try another steak place before going back to The Met but I'd definitely stop in for dessert.

Customer 5765.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5765.Content: We found this fabulous restaurant by accident a few years ago. Now whenever we come to Seattle, from Oregon, we make sure we come here to eat. We love it! We even stayed two blocks away just so we could walk to it! This restaurant has the total package, helpful and wonderfully polite staff, great ambiance and the food...it truly is "The Best Steak In Town", possibly the Pacific Northwest!

Customer 5766.Name: DavidS
Customer 5766.Content: An excellent dinner before the theater - great food and service, and very convenient location!

Customer 5767.Name: KarlisZ
Customer 5767.Content: Best steak in town. Beautiful cut of meat, perfectly prepared.

Customer 5768.Name: hks00
Customer 5768.Content: I always have a great experience at the Met. The servers are professional but laid back, always attentive and thoughtful. The food is consistently great and cooked to perfection. The only thing is some of the entree portions are rather large, so if you're ordering the same thing as someone with you, you may want to ask ahead of time if the order can be split for you, unless you don't mind leaving with leftovers!

Customer 5769.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5769.Content: I feel I have had a significant number of steaks from high-end steakhouses, and this was by far the BEST steak I have ever had in my life!

Customer 5770.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5770.Content: Been to the restaurant a dozen times and yet to be disappointed!

Customer 5771.Name: jillf
Customer 5771.Content: We went to celebrate our anniversary. We had heard how great it was for steak and seafood. We brought our own special bottle of wine which was waiting for us, decanted,at our table when we sat down. The seafood platter was fantastic but our entrees were a little off. My dad sent back his salmon to be cooked more to his liking. The rack of lamb for 2 served tableside was overdone. The waiter graciously had another one prepared for us. The restaurant didn't charge us for any of the entrees because we didn't get to eat at the same time-- impressive service! Also, the servings are enormous! We would definitely go back and recommend it.

Customer 5772.Name: Angelina8756
Customer 5772.Content: We were there for a birthday celebration and it was my boyfriend's first time dining there. He ordered his steak Medium and received it well done. He sent it back and received another steak 10 minutes later that was completely rare. By this time everyone else at the table had finished eating so he paid over $50 for a steak he didn't get to eat. They should have offered to comp his meal because it ruined his whole evening. It didn't even matter that everyone else's meals were outstanding, we will never eat there again because of this. The waitress was very nice but acted like none of this was her fault/responsibility. She thought by bringing him 2 pieces of crab in some cocktail sauce made up for it. A complete waste of money on his meal.

Customer 5773.Name: MargaretB
Customer 5773.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill is a spectacular place to dine out and certainly lived up to and beyond my expecations of a true blue All-American steak house. I was impressed by the courteous and helpful service of the wait staff. The Chicago Cut, which I had, and my date's Filet Mignon were very tender and flavorful. The portions of both of our meals were very generous and we walked away being very satisfied. I cannot describe how pleased we both were in just a few words as this would be a disservice to this fine dining establishment's expertise in food preparation.

I highly recommend the Metropolitan Grill for dinner as it was certainly a five star dining experience for the two us.

Customer 5774.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5774.Content: The food was absolutely delicious-just as expected. We arrived @ 6:00 for 6:45 reservation. I thought we'd have to wait in the bar but they sat us immediately. Service was very good, very friendly. Will definitely go again.

Customer 5775.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5775.Content: The pepper steak was excellent. Service was friendly, professional and yet homey.

Customer 5776.Name: David
Customer 5776.Content:
Presentation of steak was great. I had the 36oz ribeye with a long bone. First time I had something like that. Taste of the steak was ok.
Service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and on top of everything.

Customer 5777.Name: ChrisRuth
Customer 5777.Content: Besides the food AND service being outstanding, I just love the fine dining atmosphere but casual dress policy! The Crab Cakes and flambe desserts are a must have!

Customer 5778.Name: MaryethelB
Customer 5778.Content: I took my boyfriend to this restaurant for his birthday, it was his first time and he! was blown away

Customer 5779.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5779.Content: The Met needs no review. It is always fabulous.

Customer 5780.Name: Maya
Customer 5780.Content: Everything went great until I got my steak. It was not cooked the way I had asked it to be. The same thing happened with my husband that night. However, on past experiences this restaurant was 5 star!! I suggest you still try it!!

Customer 5781.Name: SharonB
Customer 5781.Content: not enough space in waiting area and lounge was standing room only while we waited for our table, our reservations were about 1/2 wait time.

Customer 5782.Name: 1stVisittoCrudo
Customer 5782.Content: Best steak in Seattle. Superb service. Boths offer a lot of privacy.

Customer 5783.Name: Burgmeister
Customer 5783.Content: Vibrant atmosphere, very busy, almost too loud. Friendly, knowledgeable staff, but demands on server seemed excessive. Steaks, Lobster & wine were excellent.

Customer 5784.Name: Thomas
Customer 5784.Content: The sign says "Best Steak in Town" and I aggree 100%

Customer 5785.Name: esheeley
Customer 5785.Content: I took my girlfriend Kelly to the Metropolitan Grill for her birthday. We had one of the best dinners that we have ever had and we were treated like royalty. Our waiter Steve was one of the best that we have ever encountered.

Customer 5786.Name: JasonC
Customer 5786.Content: Service was excellent! Food was very good but very overpriced. I've never seen a steak rest so expensive...including New York!! Only go if your not paying or price is no option.

Customer 5787.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5787.Content: Stunning. I was in Seattle on business for just 36 hours, but it seem time stood still inside the Metropolitan Grill. Will visit again!

Customer 5788.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 5788.Content: My family and I went to celebrate our anniversary and my daughters promotion at work. The service was excellent, and the food delicious. Noi was our server he did an excellent job. He was friendly, helpful and very attentive! The Metropolitan is our very favorite restaurant.

Customer 5789.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5789.Content: My steak was amazing and cooked to perfection! I highly recommend spending the little extra on the all-natural beef. Our server was personable and attentive. Maybe it's just a vitamin deficiency on my part, but I can't stop thinking about the cedar planked wild mushrooms. Sure you could spend less somewhere else, but don't sell yourself short. The Met = a delicious meal everytime.

Customer 5790.Name: SandyS
Customer 5790.Content: Everything was very good! Our friend's steak was not cooked correctly (he ordered medium well and got medium rare) which surprised me for Met Grill. They took it back, but still had more pink than it should have. He didn't want to send it back again. All the other steaks were cooked very well. The Walnut Hills pinot noir was priced priced at the low end of the pinots, but was very good! Our waiter, Bruno, was absolutely wonderful! Very attentive, but not TOO much and a very nice sense of humor. A wonderful part was the dinner was the fact that we could hear each other talk! There were 5 of us at a high-back booth toward the back of the restaurant, which cut out any surrounding chatter noise, which was fabulous!

Customer 5791.Name: Fishlover
Customer 5791.Content: If you want a lot of food - this is the place. The portions are HUGE! We had a wonderful time and would recommend it to anyone that isn't afraid of spending money on great food.

Customer 5792.Name: Vissidarte
Customer 5792.Content:
It's always a pleasure to be welcomed by the staff, and Marilyn is such a joy to have as a fun and yet professional server!
We love lunch there, especially Fridays!

Customer 5793.Name: TheNelsons
Customer 5793.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary.  The food was incredibly good and the menu selections were wonderful.  Great wine, too.  Service was a little harried because the restaurant was very busy. This was on a Wednesday night, so we were a little surprised but I guess that is good news!

Customer 5794.Name: JimmyJjammz
Customer 5794.Content: Once again after a time away, the Metropolitan Grill shows why no matter the length of time between visits, why it's "THE STEAKHOUSE" of steak houses! The service, food and restaurant was absolutely fantastic. I can always count on them to tima and time again provide a great and unique dining experience that is complimented by a more than accommodating staff. Hats off the the Metropolitan Grill and their unmatched staff, food and service. Can't wait until the next visit to a premier dining establishment.

Customer 5795.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5795.Content: The Wagyu (kobe) Filet Steak was FANTASTIC! I couldn't believe the tenderness and taste of that steak

Customer 5796.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5796.Content: Met Grill is a a great choice for reliably good food, good service, in an upscale atmosphere. Especially if you like very good beef.

Customer 5797.Name: Miisha
Customer 5797.Content: This was our second time dining at this particular restaurant and they sat us at the exact same table as our last visit. That was a disappoint from the beginning. The restaurant is very noisy, so if you are looking for a relaxing dinner out this is not the place. The food was not up to par this time. The crab fettucini was very salty, there was way too much dressing on the spinach salad, and the steaks were average. The waiter was a very nice guy who was very knowledgable and friendly. However, the food is way over priced for the quality and atmosphere. I'm sorry to say I was little disappointed.

Customer 5798.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5798.Content: Unbelievable and incredible. Can't say enough great things about The Met!

Customer 5799.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5799.Content: What can I say? It's the Met! It's the best steak house around and we come back again and again. I cannot find anything negative to say about the place.

Customer 5800.Name: klo62170
Customer 5800.Content: I took my best friend to the Met for her birthday dinner. We were treated like royalty! Everyone was friendly, starting with the Valet service, to the hostest, to all the wait staff etc...They were great at helping us make complementary choices with our appetizers, salads, entrees, desserts and drinks!

Customer 5801.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5801.Content: It was a very good experience. The wait staff was outstanding. Our food was top notch. It was a much better experience than the last time we eat there.

Customer 5802.Name: MichaelK
Customer 5802.Content: Certainly a high-end dining experience. Extensive wine selection ranging from modest to 4 figures price range. Wait staff exceptionally good. Food was simply the best. Tried the Kurobuta bacon side dish. No way to describe how good it was.

Customer 5803.Name: JoshuaP
Customer 5803.Content: Outstanding once again. I will definitely return for all my special occasions.

Customer 5804.Name: JJOst
Customer 5804.Content: Expensive but a family favorite for special occasions.

Customer 5806.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5806.Content: Amazing food and friendly attentive service. Only downside is the price.

Customer 5807.Name: HappyEater
Customer 5807.Content: Still the best steak around and the most competent and pleasant servers in the business.

Customer 5808.Name: Skijour
Customer 5808.Content: The Grill has everything you would expect a traditional steakhouse to be - excellent service where they know everything about the menu, great selection of steaks, big sides and a big price.  This is our favorite in Seattle but wish there was grass feed beef on the menu.

Customer 5810.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5810.Content: Always great service and excellent stakes. Looking forward to next visit already.

Customer 5811.Name: Ambie
Customer 5811.Content: The food was wonderful, but the ambience is lacking. Too loud and busy to enjoy a romantic meal. The food was superb, but we were looking for a special occasion and a romantic atmosphere. This is a very loud and busy place. But the filet mignon could be cut with a fork, you can't beat that!

Customer 5812.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5812.Content: Great place to celebrate our Wedding Anniversary -- the service was unexpectedly awesome, and definitely made the night a bit more special. Thanks Mr. Mackenz!!!

Customer 5813.Name: DianeKK
Customer 5813.Content: My husband and I have decided that The Met is one of our favorite restaurants in Seattle . . We once again looked forward to going to the Met, and the service was exceptional as always, though we had a few moments of disappointment with the food. This shocked us, because we have never experienced it after all these years of going there. The artichoke heart appetizer [which I have always claimed are the best in the city] were overcooked to the point a couple had burnt sections. My Delmonico steak had that incredible OMG flavor, though my steak was a bit tough. I have never received a tough piece of beef at the Met. The sides were all over the top delicious AND the Bananas Foster was the best preparation that we have ever had.

Customer 5814.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5814.Content: I love the food, and the service is fantastic. So efficient and professional but so warm and friendly.

Customer 5815.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5815.Content: Maybe it's the remaining bad aftertaste from last time but once again the service was not as superb as what I am accustomed to with the Met. The waiter was far better with his attentiveness, well-deserving his quarter-tip but he did once again forget that it was a celebration (yes, the fall has way too many celebrations). I will definitely go again, the food is amazing! But three strikes and I'm looking for another place.

Customer 5816.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5816.Content: The Met is amazing. Everything about the experience was stellar.

Customer 5817.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5817.Content: For the first time EVER in my numerous trips to the Met, the service was abysmal. The waitress forgot to take our order, then seemed to forget about us altogether. She didn't check on us once even after our food came out and, we actually got our steaks before we got our WATER. We amused ourselves by watching a busboy pour wine into a potted plant while waiting for our check which we had to ask the busboy for. Even when I frequent the bar during the busy happy hour, the service is always agreeable, and if ever a mistake is made, they are overly apologetic. The food here is spectacular but the service is what is what keeps us coming. Did I mention that she forgot that it was a birthday celebration even after we reminded her??

Customer 5818.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5818.Content: Without equal in the Pacific Northwest!

Customer 5819.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5819.Content:
For the most part a good experience although we almost gave up on getting to our table at all. Our table was not ready at the time of our reservation & we were kept waiting for a good 15-20 minutes with hardly a word & definitely no apology when we were seated. I suspect they were hoping we would ask to sit in the bar so they could sell us more drinks. Fortunately, the service improved significantly when we finally were seated. The food for the most part was excellent, although the $9.00 sauteed mushrooms were pretty obviously from a can.

Certainly not the worst meal we've had, but there are lots of other better places in Seattle that we'd rather dine at.

Customer 5820.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5820.Content:
Best steak I have ever had, waiter knew everything about them and his suggestions were spot on.
Only negative was being charged for substituting veggies for mashed potatoes when that was not made clear when the substitution was offered.

Customer 5821.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5821.Content:
We had to wait for our reservation for about 30 minutes longer than we expected, but boy were we glad we waited!

My wife had the Wagyu fillet, and I had 'The Met' bone-in fillet. I'd slap my mother in a minute for either of them! The extra money for the Wagyu cut is definitely worth it. The quality of the meat was evident at first sight. The steaks were cooked to perfection.

The Metropolitan Grill ranks right up there with some of the best Steakhouses in the country. Ringside (Portland, OR) and Bones (Atlanta, GA) come to mind.

Customer 5822.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5822.Content: By far the best trained wait staff in Seattle. There was never a feeling of being rushed but yet they were attentive to the tables needs at just the right moment. For potato and meat lovers, it can't be beat. Excellent wine selection to go along with meal. Didn't try desserts due to the big portion main entrees.

Customer 5823.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5823.Content: The food was amazing, service was excellent, and we all had a great time. This is exactly what one should/would expect of the Met. Truly a gem for Seattle.

Customer 5824.Name: Karen54
Customer 5824.Content: This was a great experience and the food was really good. The service was in the top 10% of our restaurant experiences in the past several years. They make everything very special. We'll definitely return for another great meal.

Customer 5825.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5825.Content: Every thing was above and beyond. I really enjoyed the great food and the service was flawless.

Customer 5826.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5826.Content:
This steak was incredible as were all the sides. My filet was like butter and the spinach was incredible. The wait staff were friendly and had great recommendations. I would go back here in a second.

My one complaint is the restaurant is looking tired. It may be part of the charm, but i think it could use a facelift.

Customer 5827.Name: Wesley
Customer 5827.Content: Special spot..brought in four bottles of our wiine..each decanted on table..clean redial glass for each..so we were able to have a vertical tasting..service outstandingv..food special..don,t miss onion rings and try them as a starter,,bone in strip dry aged prime wow,,cooked perfect..expensive but worth every dollar

Customer 5828.Name: JoshuaP
Customer 5828.Content: Excellent food. Best steak I have had in Seattle in almost 2 years!

Customer 5829.Name: victoriaW
Customer 5829.Content:
It was our 2nd anniversary and first time to the MET. Nothing short of an increadible experience from the time we stepped in the door. We love Steak houses and my husband mentioned the the Met has amazing Seattle history. It doesn't try to be like a NY or a Chicago steak house it is true deep Seattle culture.
The service is an amazing experience, the servers are delightful and knowledgable, everyone works as a team like a well rehersed symphony. We had a delightful evening and we are so thankful we chose to go to the Metropolitan Grill for our Anniversary.

Customer 5830.Name: roberta
Customer 5830.Content: My friend and I had a wonderful lunch. We were seated in a quiet section which made it easy for us to catch up with each other. Food was very good. We will return. Thank you for a nice lunch. The chopped salad was excellent.

Customer 5831.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5831.Content: Very much enjoyed the experience. Our wait staff, Jay and Donnie, was friendly and helpful. Food quality was very good. Wine selection was excellent, bourbon selection was acceptable. The jazz music was great and created a nice ambiance. The high back booths were very comfortable and added some intimacy and broke up some of the ambient noise. The bourbon ice cream for dessert was the most unique and memorable part of the meal and I would recommend them sending a sample of this out to every guest, they would be renowned.

Customer 5832.Name: JimmyD
Customer 5832.Content: Our food and service was very good. The atmosphere was also pleasant.

Customer 5833.Name: Timmy
Customer 5833.Content: The food was excellent, with my fillet being perfect. My wife had salmon, which was perhaps the best I've ever had. The wait staff was friendly without intruding into our conversation. Overall it was an excellent experience. I've eaten here numerous times and the experience is always great.

Customer 5834.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5834.Content: This is such a classic steak joint. Great ambience. Terrific service. Steak cooked absolutely to perfection - all the food (the french onion soup, wedge salad) is amazing. A reliable "special evening" place - everything is professional and first-rate.

Customer 5835.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5835.Content: Metropolitan Grill is a very good restuarant. It deserves to be in a conversation with Daniels and El Goucho. The steak had a little more fat that I am used to for a steak that price, but maybe that was because I ordered the Wagyu instead of Prime. Booth was a little snug, but was not unpleasant. Steak comes with Potato which is not usually done at high end steak joints, I appreciated that because it enabled you to also order some of the side items you may not order in favor of the spuds usually. Steak was seasoned and seared to acceptable standards for the a price. I definately recommend The Met if you have already been to Daniels, otherwise, I say Daniels edges it out slightly due to quality of meat and atmosphere (SLU location).

Customer 5836.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5836.Content: Other than my steak being under cooked it was awesome!

Customer 5837.Name: chic74
Customer 5837.Content: Very good service. Steak was just OK especially for this price range. Have had better steaks at Morton's and Ruth's Chris.

Customer 5838.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5838.Content: Our visit to The Met was great. The service is absolutely fantastic and the food was outstanding. We had drinks, app, entree and dessert. The portions are large and everything was wonderful. The only draw back was that the mushrooms tasted canned but other than that, this was a five star meal.

Customer 5839.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5839.Content: Fantastic food in generous amount. Although we were seated in the corner, the waiters constantly check on us and make sure we are taken care of. I will definitely be back and recommend it to anyone. Since street parking is a bit tricky, make sure to call them about their packing garage if you are planning to drive.

Customer 5840.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5840.Content: they have the best wait staff -

Customer 5841.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5841.Content: The bread and butter of this place is red meat - probably the best in town. Their seafood dishes are good, but you can find better seafood for far cheaper on the pier. I don't care for any of the three of their standard sides (baked potato, garlic mashed yukon golds, or fries). All three seem too dry. The wine selection is great. Last time I went I ordered a strip steak with apples and mushrooms in a bourbon sauce. The steak was, as always, fabulous, but the apples and mushrooms (which I had wanted for variation in taste and texture) were overcooked (read bland and mushy). This same thing happened at an earlier visit when I had ordered a pork chop with apples. At this point, I'll just stick with ungarnished red meat. Servers are hit or miss

Customer 5842.Name: Greg
Customer 5842.Content: It is good to see that this icon has stopped the $169 steaks of the prerecession eccess era and now has reasonable prices for great service from Steve and excellent suggestions for food. Should not combine HH food with the dining room as way too filling...but that is why I run the hills on Queen Anne. Will actually return after years of not dining there due to being snubbed....and this is from someone who can still afford to eat out frequently and a member of most restauarant frequent diner programs.

Customer 5843.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5843.Content: It is probably the best steak in town, but it will also cost you like the best steak in town. If you don't mind spilling out some cash, this place is well worth the cost. Just don't be surprised if it ruins all other steak joints and you suddenly become a steak snob. Drinks are also a bit pricey, but not too far off from most nice places in Seattle.

Customer 5844.Name: Donzi
Customer 5844.Content: Buisness dinner to impress an important client. Wonderful food and service. Bring some appitie and a wallet. Its all good

Customer 5846.Name: MichaelT
Customer 5846.Content: Great service and great food. Surprised to see onion rings on the menu but they were amazing onion rings, maybe the best ever.

Customer 5847.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5847.Content: Dining out is something we do quite often and have had the opportunity to travel extensively. We are pleased to say that the Metropolitan Grill in Seattle is one of the finest restaurants we have ever visited anywhere in the world.

Customer 5848.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5848.Content: Food and service were outstanding. Drinks could have been a little stronger!

Customer 5849.Name: wattkenn
Customer 5849.Content: An old established feel in Downtown. Great service. Incredible food. Bring your appetite! Pricey - but, worth it!

Customer 5850.Name: Divegal
Customer 5850.Content: What amazing food & service?! This was my first time to the Metropolitan Grill...and I'll certainly be back! I've heard sooo many wonderful things about this place...so now I can say I've experienced it for myself! ..Oh and.my server was NDI 101...great guy & sooo personable!!!

Customer 5851.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5851.Content:
I've been to the Met many times. Each time, I can be assured of excellent service and food quality. The only reason my food rating is a 4 and not a 5 is because the jasmine rice in my dish became hard on the edges quickly.

I enjoy having lunch at the Met because I can either have something extravagant or something reasonable. I think it's great that they have reasonable lunch specials that make it accessible to everyone.

I love how the servers work with you to provide you with a meal you want. For instance, I wanted to turn an appetizer into a lunch. No problem. Pick your side dishes. No problem.

My favorite dessert is burnt cream, which was brought out for my friend's birthday. It was excellent (not always the case). Thank you!

Customer 5852.Name: Johnny
Customer 5852.Content: Hands down, it was one of the best dining experience I have ever had! The servers were awesome! They were friendly and very engaging. We had the Chateaubriand for two, and let me tell ya, it was one of the best cut of meat I have ever had! They serve it tableside so they do everything, other than cooking it, there. Awesome cut, will be coming back for that. And for desert, that was also served tableside! The Banana Fosters, was excellent from the beginning to end, they would fry the bananas at the table on an open skillet. Everything we had that night was like a show! It was a wonderful experience.

Customer 5853.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5853.Content: A fantastic time. We go there for our anniversary every year and have never been disappointed. Best food we have ever had. Service is the best. We feel as though we are special when we dine there.

Customer 5854.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5854.Content: Loved the food and LOVED the service (our server was Kristin!). We tried the 35-day dry aged rib eye, 4 oz prime, 4 oz Waygu, prime rib, garlic mashed potatoes, mushrooms, and asparagus - all DELICIOUS! Their bread is yummy too. The lobster bisque was good, I prefer Nordstrom Grille's or Duke's - I like it with more chunky bits of goodness. The noise level was quite loud as it was a busy and bustling evening. It was fine, but definitely not romantic. Good place for celebrations/groups.

Customer 5855.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5855.Content: Always, excellent quality food and service!

Customer 5856.Name: MattR
Customer 5856.Content:
The Met is simply one of the best choices to go for a great Steak. Their meat is well aged and they have the perfect wine pairs for everything that they serve. They are most famous for their pepper-corn steak but the 5oz filet is definately worth it when it is available. The Copper River Salmon is a must have when it is in season.

I have been taking my customers to the Met for over 9 years and they have never failed to set the right atmosphere for me.

Customer 5857.Name: LocalDoc
Customer 5857.Content:
26th Anniversary, meeting after work for a special dinner, first time at the Met. Service truly exceptional (Steve), Wagyu steak very good, but side dishes really remarkable (the roasted brussel sprouts and the bacon with onions - who'd a thought?).

This was one of my better meals in Seattle and my wife was delighted. Nice find. Not inexpensive, but clearly worth it if the meal matters.

Customer 5858.Name: 509LR
Customer 5858.Content: Love "The Met"...been going there since the early 80's.. the Dow was at 2000...never disapponts.

Customer 5859.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5859.Content: We'd heard so much about The Met, but had never been there before. The steaks were the best we've EVER had!! Fabulous shrimp cocktail & Caesar salads! The waiter was knowledgable, helpful, and humorus. A very memorable experience indeed -- on the drive home, we decided this might just be our new 'special occasion' restaurant.

Customer 5860.Name: skyk
Customer 5860.Content: A little to greasy for our tastes and a bit over priced for the quality, don't think we'll be back.

Customer 5861.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5861.Content: Had a wonderful time, great location! I wish I would have had room for dessert!

Customer 5862.Name: Unionmaid
Customer 5862.Content: We had a wonderful meal and experience from beginning to end. I would highly recommend this restaurant for business or personal.

Customer 5863.Name: Baggydomer
Customer 5863.Content: Our first dinner at Metropolitan Grill was of expected quality, given the prior comments and critiques. The atmosphere is kind of like an old supper club. On the noisier end of things, but we were able to converse without much difficulty. Service was outstanding. It really could not have been better. Attentive, but not overbearing. Everything was done right. Apps of calamari and crab cakes were very good. I like the latter better. Salads were the one disappointment. I would have chosen a caprese salad, but it wasn't on the menu. Out of our group, we had 3 different salads and they were good, not great. I ordered the combo filets. 4 oz American Kobe and 4 oz standard Nebraska beef. I like the latter best. Cooked to perfection.

Customer 5864.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5864.Content: It was great that I was able to make the reservation on line, it was convenient and had no hassle at the resturant or anything. We didn't have to wait long for our table either.

Customer 5865.Name: MarcM
Customer 5865.Content: We had a great anniversary dinner... our server was helpful and funny.

Customer 5866.Name: Bobd
Customer 5866.Content: The Met has always exceeded my expectations of what a steak dinner should be. On this occasion I enjoyed the Filet Mignon and my date the Top Sirloin special, both prepared to perfection. The service was outstanding, both from the waitress and her help. Would I go again? In a heartbeat!

Customer 5867.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5867.Content: Amazing food! Amazing service. Just loved it.

Customer 5868.Name: arikohn
Customer 5868.Content: I have eaten at Metropolitan Grill many times (it is a block from our office). Usually, it is a good experience. However, this time we arrived at 11:50 and had to wait a very, very long time for our order to arrive. In fact, when we were 15 minutes from our guest having to leave and we still did not have our meals I had to get up and go to staff asking that they expedite the order.

Customer 5869.Name: ChristopherD
Customer 5869.Content: Very nice place, although the decor seemed somewhat dated and it wasnt really quiet.  The food, service, ambiance and drinks were top notch.

Customer 5871.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5871.Content: Definitely a pricier restaurant, but the Prime Porterhouse steak is worth it. Will save for more formal occasions.

Customer 5872.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5872.Content: Another great experience at the Met. The service is always top notch, as well as the food. The wait staff was attentive without being overwhelming or hovering. We did get stuck in the traffic that was detoured for the torch light parade, which we would have appreciated being told about by the hostess when she called to confirm our reservation. Other than that, the actual dining experience was terrific. We had the spinich salad (yum!) and the wedge salad, as well as the Châteaubriand for our main meal with the steak fries; the meat was incredibly tender, served table-side. The recommended wine was also wonderful. Ooohh, that carrot cake is too yummy and big enough for two to split. You just can't go wrong at this restaurant.

Customer 5873.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5873.Content: Wonderful as always. We don't live in Seattle anymore, but always make it a point to go when we're in town. As usual, they didn't disappoint. Fabulous food and service, had the blackened prime rib done to perfection. Not the cheapest certainly, but worth every dime.

Customer 5874.Name: JennF
Customer 5874.Content: Excellent food and ambiance. Service was amazing as well.

Customer 5875.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5875.Content: The steak melted in my mouth it was so yummy.

Customer 5877.Name: DavidB
Customer 5877.Content: Nice restaurant but it has faded noticeably in recent years. The worst part was that the dress code no longer exists except on the website. Bad jeans or shorts, bad t-shirts with bellies hanging out and ball caps are the dress code of the day! Adds an ambiance that can only be matched by McDonald's or Wal Mart.

Customer 5878.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5878.Content: For the price of the meal, the food was average. The decor was tired.

Customer 5879.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5879.Content: The Met has a reputation for being one of the best steakhouses in the country and with good reason: they consistently provide excellent food. Although they do offer great seafood, beef is king and the selection of high-quality meat makes picking your steak a difficult decision. Salads are delicious and big enough to share. The wine list (read: book) is wonderful. We had an Oregon Pinot Noir and a California Syrah - both excellent. If you're overwhelmed by the wine list, a friendly sommelier will help! They also have an extensive top-shelf liquor selection, with inventive cocktails. Their service always stands out though, anticipating needs and never pushy. Be prepared to spend money though (well worth it).

Customer 5880.Name: Vissidarte
Customer 5880.Content:
It's our fave! Fantstic in every way. What makes it so special besides all the things you have come expect and love, is our ever energetic and personable Marilyn! We will be back again and again. It's worth your money in every aspect!
Keep up the good work: Every person involved in the operation, from the hostess desk to every wait staff is unique, well trained, customer-oriented and FRIENDLY and yet professional.

Customer 5881.Name: SGWo
Customer 5881.Content: I have never been (even the slightest bit) disappointed with the Met. I adore it. Everything is impeccable, from the personal, warm and wonderful service to the mouthwatering epicuriean delights.

Customer 5882.Name: MikeM
Customer 5882.Content: Been going for years, service and food consistently excellent. One of the best steak places that we have ever gone to.

Customer 5883.Name: LloydM
Customer 5883.Content: I have been to many steakhouses thoughout the US, and world, and the Met Grill's long bone ribeye is the best steak I have had anywhere, hands down.

Customer 5884.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5884.Content: WE are on the hunt for the perfect steak in Seattle. The Met was the third place we went to and we were pleased with how our steak was prepared, the knowledge and thoughtfulness of the staff, and the ambiance. (4/5 stars for the food and 5/5 for the attentiveness)

Customer 5885.Name: GoodEats111
Customer 5885.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was our choice to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We wanted something with some Seattle-specific history and feel and found a gem in The Met!! Upon booking our reservation, I sent the restaurant an email requesting for wine corkage fees and was promptly notified by the head sommelier, Mr. Thomas Price -- Very Impresssive. Not just because of the occassion, or the attentiveness of Mr. Price, or the fact that we had the absolute best steaks we've ever enjoyed, or the atmosphere which was upscale without being pretentious, or the 2000 Opus One we brought with us for this occassion, but all combined made this our best overall diningh experience to date. Thank you Metropolitan Grill. Well Done!

Customer 5886.Name: DennisM
Customer 5886.Content: Elegant dining with fine table service by the very personable staff. . .loved it!

Customer 5887.Name: luv2eat
Customer 5887.Content: What can I say....exceptional food.....exceptional service.

Customer 5888.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5888.Content: The food was exceptional and the overall experience was excellent. I highly recommend the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 5889.Name: Harvmeister
Customer 5889.Content: I was wondering if anything in the United States (I'm visiting from Germany) could out do the chain "Morton's of Chicago". The "Met" blew Morton's away. The most tender New York Strip I have ever eaten, an imaginative menu, great specials, friendly Seattle service and clientele, and a perfect Washington State potato. If you can get a reservation do it and take home the doggie-bag. Made my month.

Customer 5890.Name: Russ
Customer 5890.Content: As somewhat of a frequent flier of The Met, one of the things that make great restaurants is consistency. Time after time I am never disappointed with the food or service. If you go there only once in a while have steak. But they do the other items so very well also. Love the salmon, the 42 day aged ribeye and the delmonico. The bananas foster is the bomb!

Customer 5891.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5891.Content: Overall the food was very good. The service was a bit slow as it took almost 3 hours for us to complete our dinner. However, everyone was beyond friendly and accommodating. Do yourself a favor and try the Teriyaki Tenderloin appetizer.

Customer 5892.Name: DruA
Customer 5892.Content: The best steaks we've ever had!!!! Wonderful, friendly service. Great wine recommendations. Will definitey go here again next time we're in town.

Customer 5893.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5893.Content: We had a nice meal at the Metropolitan Grill, however, nothing about it was memorable. The food, while good, was nothing special. The wine list was extensive and had something for every budget. Service was very relaxed at the risk of being unprofessional. When asked for recommendations, the server simply pointed us to the menu insert without any additional descriptions or commentary. When asked for a wine recommendation by varietal and taste preferences, she was quick to recommend a wine, however her recommendation was completely off. The wine server even laughed at the server table side when we told him what we asked for to prompt her recommendation. Overall, a nice place, but did not meet expectations.

Customer 5894.Name: Linton
Customer 5894.Content:
We had a reservation for 4 men and got seated promptly at a booth. We felt a little cramped in the booth, but it was still a very good experience.

One in our party ordered a beer and finished a quarter of it before noticing a crack in the pint glass. We alerted our waitress, and she gave a new glass with a fresh pint; we did not have to pay for any of the beer, as it was comp'ed because of that.

Customer 5895.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5895.Content:
My wife and I ate here for our 5th wedding anniversary. The food was beyond excellent--every course. I started with a wedge salad, which was as good as I've ever had. Then we each had a small filet and that, too, was as good as I've had anywhere. The server was kind enough to give us a complimentary creme brûlée, in consideration of our special occasion. It was the best I've had, unsurprisingly at this point.

As far as steakhouses go, I rate this with or slightly above Ruth's Chris, and equal to Sullivan's. It is better than Capital Grill.

Customer 5896.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5896.Content: Wonderful dinner, in all respects. Thank you!

Customer 5897.Name: brittanyt
Customer 5897.Content:
I've been to the Metropolitan Grill twice. The first time was very very nice. When I went this past weekend, it wasn't the best dining experience, it was pretty mediocre. I understand the restaurant was trying to give my boyfriend and I the first available seat but it wasn't a good seat, and they moved us to a more private location after we requested it. My boyfriend said his steak was kind of cold, like it was waiting while my food was finishing. I believe my food made my stomach upset that night and the morning after.
The service was pretty good, they kept the water refilled! The Maitre D was nice.

Customer 5898.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5898.Content: This restaurant was recommended to us on our last visit to Seattle on 7/3/2010. The service was outstanding, and the wine list was exceptional. Our steak was cooked to perfection. All portions were large enough to share, be aware that the restaurant does charge a split fee of $3.50.

Customer 5899.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5899.Content: Great food and outstanding service. The carpet/booths look tired and worn out, in great need of replacement. You don't notice this unless you visit during the day time since the lighting is kept low in the evening. Still, a delicious and enjoyable lunch.

Customer 5900.Name: Paul
Customer 5900.Content: The food was excellent and the service attentive.

Customer 5901.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5901.Content: It was my first dining experience at the Metropolitan Grill. We started off with a drink at the bar while waiting for our table, and the response time to take my drink order was slow. The bar was not busy at all either. This would be my only complaint about my dining experience there. The food and service at our table was amazing. The quality of the meat at this restaurant is top notch. The blackened prime rib is the best prime rib I've ever had. I will definitely be back.

Customer 5902.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5902.Content: Consistently good service and food. Had a small graduation dinner there (9 people) and was so impressed with our service. We never had to ask for more drinks, plenty of staff around to help and was seated in the back room for privacy. The food was wonderful (try the Lobster Bisque, yum!!) and we will be back soon!

Customer 5903.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5903.Content: The restaurant is everything you'd expect at a first class steak house. Good food and great service. My only comment is compared to some of their competitors I think their steaks could have more flavor.

Customer 5904.Name: RoyH
Customer 5904.Content: I have been to the met many times and love it each time. Great job again.

Customer 5905.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5905.Content: Wondeful food. Concierge was extremely helpful with the wine list and even presented some samples to enjoy.

Customer 5906.Name: Carl
Customer 5906.Content: OUTSTANDING...exactly what is expected at the Met! We did have to wait over 20 minutes after our 7:30 reservation, but the Mariners baseball game went into extra innings which undoubtedly contributed. Service and food quality more than made up for the minimum inconvenience. Flambéed Hot Apple Pie dessert exceptional...and a perfect conclusion to a wonderful 38th Anniversary celebration!

Customer 5907.Name: Mike
Customer 5907.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is one of the best steakhouses at which we've eaten. My favorite is still Delmonico Steakhouse in the Venetian in Las Vegas which consistently serves *the* best steak, but so far Metropolitan Grill ranks a close second. I had the bone-in filet while my wife and my Father-in-law had the ribeye. While all were excellent, none were as good as the last time we visited. I ordered my filet rare, center cool, and it came definitely medium rare--quite a disappointment. Especially since my last experience with their bone-in filet was etched in my mind as the best steak I've ever eaten. Still, it's a favorite of ours in the Seattle area! The service was decent--just a few ticks off what's expected at a premium restaurant.

Customer 5908.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5908.Content: Overall a good expercience except for the Somiler passing my table with my glass almost empty and not stopping to fill it on his way to fill another table's glasses. I got the sence he was only interested in tables where more than one bottle of wine might be purchased.

Customer 5909.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5909.Content: Our dinner was perfect! We were celebrating our anniversary and the waiters brought us a very wonderful Creme Brulee for dessert on the house! Service was great! We'll be back!!!!

Customer 5910.Name: Vissidarte
Customer 5910.Content: As usual it was a wonderful experience w/great food, friendly and professional service from the front desk (Carmen, Jamie) and our wonderful top server Marilyn! A true pleasure to return again and again. This was our first luncheon there, and it's more relaxed than dinner. It helps to come after the rush.

Customer 5911.Name: Ricks
Customer 5911.Content: I had old friend in Town so we went out-- it was not the best Night for the Metropolitan food was cold but tasted good fine/ its like going to you mother house and paying 300.00 for dinner.

Customer 5912.Name: RoseO
Customer 5912.Content: VERY PLEASANT EXPERIENCE. MY PARENTS FROM ARIZONA WERE VERY IMPRESSED.

Customer 5913.Name: Zack
Customer 5913.Content: I have been to many of the other upscale steakhouses in the area with the likes of El Gaucho and the recently opened John Howie topping the list. I felt that while the meal was good, it did not quite meet my expectations. Also, while the service was good, it didn't hold a candle to the aforementioned places and the ambiance was nothing more than a normal restaurant in my opinion. I ordered the 35-day Chicago Cut American Wagyu Medium-Rare and it was not nearly as delicious, tender or succulent as the Wagyu I ordered from J. Howie. While it may be a classic, and by no means shabby, I feel it has been upstaged by the newer kids in town. With it's reputation come high expectations and unfortunately I was left a little underwhelmed.

Customer 5914.Name: JanetH
Customer 5914.Content: Service was terrific and food was excellent though fairly heavy and traditional. Prices were quite high. Given the food volume, you could make it more affordable by sharing.

Customer 5915.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5915.Content:
The service was lacking, they cheaped out on the food by putting extremely large portions of cheap foods like mashed potatoes, they messed up my wife's order, they were not presentable and were extremely over priced especially compared to other fine dining experiences I have been to.

Overall, if you want a nice place for a special occasion or to take your family, please, steer clear of this place. You will waste your time, money and be incredibly dissatisfied.

Customer 5916.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5916.Content: I had a great first experience at The Metropolitan Grill. My husband and I participated in the Have Dinner on Us Dining Experience, so we went to Elliott's a few months ago and received a coupon which we used at The Met. We started with some almond scallops before dinner, which were delicious and cooked perfectly; I could have made a meal out of them. But I'm glad I didn't because I had a delicious filet mignon--it was so tender and flavorful. My husband had a NY cut, which was tasty but was more marbled and fattier than he likes. The side dishes were perfect--we shared asparagus and a baked potato. We were too stuffed for dessert. Our server was very knowledgeable and helped us decide what to order. The whole staff was attentive.

Customer 5917.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5917.Content: The Met is not only my favorite restaurant it is the best steakhouse in the Northwest. I'v been to Ringside in Portland and others steakhouses in Seattle and while many are good, none compare.

Customer 5919.Name: dede
Customer 5919.Content: We loved it but the bartender spilled a good part of a martini on the table while pouring, no apology he just said he was distracted. The waiter didn't put a napkin on the spill, or make any effort to clean it up. Not too good for white linen service establishment. WE loved the sommelier.

Customer 5920.Name: Roger
Customer 5920.Content: We have eaten at the Metro Grill many times and have always had excellent service no matter which waitperson was assigned to us. Definitly a bit pricey and not where I would dine every week, We find it to be a great place to go for any special occasion or just to change the pace from our ordinary restaurants. The Metro is my favorite restaurant in the greater Seattle area.

Customer 5921.Name: VM2016
Customer 5921.Content: One of the best dining experiences I had while in Seattle. The food was excellent. The service was freindly and timely. The staff was both knowledgeable and helpful.
