While I thought the prices where worth the quality of food, it is on the higher end of the price scale. For a party of six, including drinks and desserts our check was $734.00. Metropolitan Grill ranks at the same level as Peter Lugers, if not a little more expensive.

Customer 5922.Name: GaryB
Customer 5922.Content: Staff were friendly and well trained in their respective roles. Unfortunately, our main course came not cooked as we'd ordered, which was instantly recognized by the server and wait staff. The Maitre d was very professional in handling the problem to our liking with an alternate dish and in handling the bill accordingly. We will most certainly be back and recommend the Met to our friends.

Customer 5923.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5923.Content: Food is AMAZING. A bit expensive so we go there for special occasions only but really enjoy it. Drove 4 hours there and 4 hours home. Would reccomend it to anyone for special dinners or celebrations. Atmosphere is very busy and tables are close together, but still nice.

Customer 5924.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5924.Content: Best steak ever! Service was perfect and we really enjoyed ourselves. Great Restaurant for a special occasion splurge!

Customer 5925.Name: JamesE
Customer 5925.Content: Outstanding food and service. I can't wait to go back.

Customer 5926.Name: pklseattle
Customer 5926.Content: The food is good, but the price is expensive

Customer 5927.Name: Angelica
Customer 5927.Content: Outstanding food, ambiance and service. Although pricey, its worth it for a guaranteed good meal and/or special occasion. Be sure to make reservations if dining on a busy night.

Customer 5928.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5928.Content: This experience was a real let down. I had considered Metropolitan Grill one of the best restaurants in the US, until this week. The steaks were good, but unremarkable. At this price level, I expect the steaks to be outstanding. The calamari appetizer, a tiny portion, consisted of fishy tasting bits of tentacles on a very large pile of chopped tomato. The "signature" flourless chocolate torte was a huge disappointment which had been stored in the chill box too long. The microwaving of it produced a unacceptable result with hot spots next to cold spots, and bits of sugar which had recrystallized. I am happy to pay $350 for 3 people, but I expect an exceptional dining experience. This week, Metropolitan Grill failed miserably.

Customer 5929.Name: DanielC
Customer 5929.Content: We eat at the Metropolatain Grill occasionally when we are in the mood to splurge on a great steak. The excellent wait staff and casual environment make for a very relaxed enjoyable experience. The steaks are in a league of their own. The old saying that "you get what you pay for" rings true. But if you are willing to pay, you won't be disappointed.

Customer 5930.Name: Jayray
Customer 5930.Content: My husband & I had the chateaubriand which was absolutely fantastic. The food was all excellent except for the asparagus which was undercooked.

Customer 5931.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5931.Content: Our wedding anniversary at The Met was wonderful. The service was outstanding. Our sommelier was so helpful, finding us a fantastic wine that was well within our price range. Our server was also very kind and friendly. Our steaks were incredible, of course, and the creme brule had us both speechless. A wonderful meal.

Customer 5932.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5932.Content: The food was great...I would recommend the bone-in filet w/ four cheese macaroni.

Customer 5933.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5933.Content: My son and I were there for a special celebration. The steak and dessert, soup, et al, that my son had were delicious. I had the chicken with mashed potatoes. I have had better elsewhere in Portland at Paragon, where the chicken is crisper and the mashed potatoes were not quite as soggy, so that dish was a disappointment. I guess the lesson learned is to have steak, but for the price, I didn't finish my meal.

Customer 5934.Name: JBfromSG
Customer 5934.Content: Excellent as usual. Can't go wrong at the Met!

Customer 5935.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5935.Content: What an experience! On a week-long trip in the Northwest, this was by far the best restaurant we encountered. We were able to compare an American Kobe-style beef with a Nebraska corn-fed beef (4 oz. filets of each) which was quite a culinary experience for us. The service was outstanding. Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who would enjoy beef of the highest quality.

Customer 5936.Name: RoriW
Customer 5936.Content: We had a great meal....I would highly recommend the clam chowder as a starter and the wine list offered many options. My husband and I each chose one of the specialty steaks from Idaho and my filet was definitely the way to go. Extremely good. His sirloin steak was fine, but not worth choosing again. The wait staff was excellent and we never felt rushed. This is the second time in two months that we have visited and we intended to make it a regular spot!

Customer 5937.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5937.Content: Best Chateaubriand in Seattle - Cooked to perfection every time.

Customer 5938.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5938.Content: It was a place where a person could conduct business and have great food and a wonderful setting. Definitely a place where a gentleman could take a lady. The food was what a great steak house should put out. However, it was truly old world and had a special personalty long gone from today's restaurants.

Customer 5939.Name: wannabe
Customer 5939.Content: A little steep in price, but I knew that was par for the course. Darn good service. Great wine choices but again, quite a steep markup. One must be prepared to pay more than what you'd expect here, but it's the "prestige" factor that does it.

Customer 5940.Name: NewYorkerFoodie
Customer 5940.Content: We celebrated my boyfriend's birthday there and the overall experience was excellent. The reservation was very flexible. The food was delicious and the people were all super friendly with all smiles and greeted us as we walked by. Even the Manager came by to chat and such; super friendly service and made us feel very special.

Customer 5941.Name: Wendy
Customer 5941.Content: I had requested a private table so business could be discussed and they came thru. Great table, great service and great food.

Customer 5942.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5942.Content: Food was great! Only bad thing is that we had to wait 20 min for a table and we even made reservations! :(

Customer 5943.Name: ScottM
Customer 5943.Content: Service and food were generally very good. The Met is speciically known for steaks, and one of our guests had a very sub-standard ribeye. To their credit, managemnt immediately took the item of our bill.

Customer 5944.Name: Fuzzyone
Customer 5944.Content: Most excellent. Prompt professional service. Marvelous steaks.

Customer 5945.Name: HandC
Customer 5945.Content: My wife and I had a great dining experience. Our wait staff did their job incredibly well.

Customer 5946.Name: TiffanyS
Customer 5946.Content: Every meal at the Met is fabulous and the food and service is consistently wonderful. My filet was perfectly done and I could have sliced through it with a butter knife...it was that perfect!

Customer 5947.Name: Snos
Customer 5947.Content: Great food and service was excellent for our group (6). The wine guy was fantastic, made some great recommendations and also binned one of our wines coz it was corked. You dont see corked wine that often but the man picked it up and took it away like it was poisin. Execllent experience, highly recommended.

Customer 5948.Name: RoseO
Customer 5948.Content:
WE HAD A WONDERFUL DINING EXPERENCE. THE FOOD WAS AWESOME. THE WAITER (NOI)WAS SO KIND AND ALWAYS THERE TO FILL THE WATER OR COFFEE. THE BEST PART WAS DESERT(JUST KIDDING). I LOVE THE CARROT CAKE IT TRUELY IS THE BEST IN THE WEST.
THANK YOU FOR A GREAT CASUAL EVENING OUT.
THANKS AGAIN,
ROSE

Customer 5949.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5949.Content:
I have been to a few of the top end resturants in town and yours lets you be yourself. It is not stuffy and I didn't feel that I had to be a different person to enjoy my time there. I will recommend to everyone and will deffinately be back. Thanks for the fun time.

Oh and the portions were far bigger than I would have ever imagined. That is a huge plus.

Customer 5950.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5950.Content: First...even with a reservation they attempted to stick our foursome in the back room, next to the kitchn door, in a cold room with a fan that seemed to be aimed right at the table. I would have froze...with a little smirk the hostes went back to the main door...retrieved us and sat us in a cozy little booth in front. You'd think they would do that first??? I believe they try to fill the bad ambiance room first and if you don't complain you are stuck there. So..complain and get what you came there for to begin with. The food was good..not as good as it used to be...the service was slow...but we were there for the experience. We think the Melrose in Renton has better food and from now on we'll frequent the Met less...

Customer 5951.Name: Tony21
Customer 5951.Content: Great combination of excellent food, mature, professional servers and a wonderful steakhouse ambiance.

Customer 5952.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5952.Content: The leg of lamb was the best I've had in many years. The Metropolitan Grill's attention to detail is unmatched. Service is wonderful.

Customer 5953.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5953.Content:
I regret our special night out with an old friend did little to meet expectations. We arrived early and after several of the wait staff walked past, we flagged one who went to get "our" waiter. We then were able to order a drink. We had to flag him down to order an appetizer.... Calamari, which was very good., however the two $12 martinis were weak.

We each ordered prime rib, mine the 12oz. plain, he the blackened. We agreed they were among the poorest cuts either of us had ever had. They were dry and very fatty. The Creme Brulee for dessert was very nice, but $4.50 for coffee (no offer of refills even)....you've got to be kidding..! Ambience...cozy, but noisy; service...fair; food...inconsistent; pricing...too high for the quality.

Customer 5954.Name: Roberta
Customer 5954.Content: As always our dining experience at The Metropolitan Grill was fabulous; quality of service, food some of the best in the city. We will definitely look forward to another evening of dining at The Met.

Customer 5955.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5955.Content: Dining at "The Met" was an incredible experience! It was the perfect restaurant in which to celebrate our anniversary. The crab cakes are one of the best things I've ever eaten. Not just the best crab cakes, but one of the best dishes I have ever tasted. The steak was prepared just how I wanted it and the Pear Lemon Drop cocktail was delicious. I highly recommend this for a special occasion. When we told our server it was our anniversary, he provided us with a free Burnt Cream dessert that really made our night! Be prepared to spend liberally. Our bill was over $140 by the night's end...but it was well worth it!

Customer 5956.Name: Yellowjacket
Customer 5956.Content: Standby for great steaks including Wagyu beef. Come for a beef overload if that is what you want. All great. Vegetables fresh and hot. Very good wine list

Customer 5957.Name: JacquieK
Customer 5957.Content: Very pricey, but the food was great! Other than the fact that we waited a little too long between the first course and our main course, service was great and it was worth the wait...everyone's steak was cooked just as ordered and delicious. I ordered the special - just-caught Copper Salmon - and it was to die for, especially with the yummy mashed potatoes and asparagus. We had a corner booth and it was very cozy and quiet. I like that they offer half bottles of wine as we were there on a Sunday night and my husband and I didn't want to drink a whole bottle, but wanted more than one glass. I've heard a lot about this restaurant and it did not dissapoint!

Customer 5958.Name: LeeG
Customer 5958.Content: Really nice atmosphere. Kind of typical steakhouse setup with lots of wood almost saloon or pub like while remaining a bit high end. Our server was great. Food was pretty much what you would expect at a steakhouse in this price range. Almond crusted scallop appetizer was great as was the wine. Steak was very good. My medium rare came out slightly overdone and my wife's medium well came out underdone. But they were close enough and tasted good. They do seem to focus a bit more on seasoning the steaks than I am used to at this kind of steak house but the seasoning was good and did not diistract from the quality of the meat

Customer 5959.Name: Mermaids
Customer 5959.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is one of the best steak houses in the Puget Sound, but it is also a great staple for downtown Seattle. Power lunches, moms and daughters, visiting celebrities, good friends and parties are all welcome in this diverse atmosphere. The servers and hosts are exceptionally helpful and friendly -- everyone we encountered recently at a large birthday dinner were attentive and fun. Metropolitan Grill is a nice place for lunch, dinner or cocktails. There is a terrific drink list with innovative martinis and the wine list is great.

Customer 5960.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5960.Content: Dinner was fabulous! Meat cooked to perfection. Garlic mashed could have been a little hotter. The service was fabulous as always. The asparagus was cold. How is that possible at such a fine restaurant?

Customer 5961.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5961.Content:
Our waitress was rude. She was casual in her demeanor and conversation with us. For a celebration (my husband's birthday) this was a disappointment. We had to ask for our drinks to be refilled, she criticized us for not finishing our dessert, and constantly leaned on our table when speaking with us. This made for a sour night and it was not the fine dining experience we had all hoped for to reconize a birthday on the town.

However, the steaks and food were tasty and other staff were kind, it was not enough to make up for the expensive price tag and poor service from our waitress.

Customer 5962.Name: AMG4RPM
Customer 5962.Content: Impeccable service, outstanding beef, excellent wine, a great evening. If you’re looking for organic-mushroom-tamales-with-sweetbreads-in-a kiwi-ancho-reduction you’re in the wrong place. But if you want the best steak west of Chicago, The Met is the place to go. A martini, a salad, Wagyu NY Strip and a bottle of Barolo, all with courteous, knowledgeable service: “All goods worth price charged” (Mr. Jack Daniel).

Customer 5963.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5963.Content: The food and whole experience was awesome. My husband took me there for my birthday. The server was so helpful and attentive.

Customer 5964.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5964.Content: We had a FABULOUS night! A very big thank you goes to Craig for making our anniversary night so special!

Customer 5965.Name: wocrgc
Customer 5965.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful time at the Metropolitan. The food was outstanding, and our server made the luncheon a truly memorable experience.

Customer 5966.Name: roberta
Customer 5966.Content:
My friend and I had an enjoyable lunch at the Metropolitan Grill last Friday. Our waitperson, Marilyn, was outstanding. She was genuinely friendly and enthusiastic. I would ask to be seated in her section again.

I had the traditional chopped salad which was delicious.

I would definitely have lunch at the Met again. Pleasant, terrific wait person and good food.

Customer 5967.Name: FelishaE
Customer 5967.Content:
Great classic old steakhouse feel, waiters who have been there for decades, amazing wine and the steaks...YUM!

Anytime I have friends new to Seattle, I take them to the Met.  They always say, "Oh, I saw that in the airline magazine..."  Then they meet the talented waitstaff and their first bite of, well anything, and then they understand why it is in all those magazines.  I love it!

Customer 5968.Name: Lyle
Customer 5968.Content: going to the Metropoitan, is always great.

Customer 5969.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5969.Content: This was a return visit to this restaurant - the food met and exceeded all expectations - best steak anywhere.

Customer 5970.Name: LavenderTrin
Customer 5970.Content: We had a wonderful anniversary dinner, served by Steve, who is an experienced waiter and very attentive to our needs. Our food was fabulous- so much so that we could not have dessert, so Steve packed it up and sent it with us. We would definately go back.

Customer 5971.Name: Bill
Customer 5971.Content: Great meats... but the side dishes were not up to par (mushrooms and spinach).

Customer 5972.Name: SeattleFoodLover
Customer 5972.Content: Table was not well configured for a business meeting, but otherwise the food and service was excellent!

Customer 5973.Name: BrianW
Customer 5973.Content: I have eaten here quite a few times in the past, mostly for business dinners, but it was nice to be able to have a relaxing evening. There was no wait and we were seated on time for reservation in a more quiet part of the restaurant--meeting a special seating request. The service was attentive and friendly as one would have expected. Well-made cocktail and nice malbec. The size of the steaks was a bit daunting but I settled on a 14 oz New York and my parents had prime rib and salmon. All was pronounced very good. The creamed spinach was a bit dry compared to others I've had at Ruth's Chris, or El Gaucho (I seem to recall theirs was sauteed). Despite taking home a doggie bag (and yes, she loved it) there was still no room for dessert.

Customer 5974.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5974.Content: Excellent food and service. Very comfortable. I am not much of a steak person but I will go there again.

Customer 5975.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5975.Content: Our steaks were amazing and the wait staff was very knowledgeable about the different types of steak on the menu.

Customer 5976.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5976.Content: Was an very lovely meal. Waiter was perfection! First was seated across from a very loud service area but after walking back to hostess staff and expressing my unhappiness we were moved to a booth. King crab legs best I've ever tasted. Expensive but for a special meal is worth the money. Steaks were very, very good.

Customer 5977.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5977.Content: Great service, great steaks, a landmark restaurant in Seattle - you're not a seattelite if you haven't been to the Met even just once.

Customer 5978.Name: jtzilla
Customer 5978.Content: Always love this place. Very comfortable environment, some wear jeans, some dress up, some bring kids. I Highly recommend the crab cakes, it was the first time I tried them, and it won't be the last. My Filet Mignon with crab and asparagus was excellent. Next time I'd have the garlic mashed potatoes, however the baked potato is served with cheese sauce plus sour cream and onion.My husband got his usual, the Cajun Prime Rib. It was great as usual, however a bit salty, and fatty this time.Excellent service, and buzz.

Customer 5979.Name: Kerrab
Customer 5979.Content: Meat was excellent. Side items (mac and cheese, scallop potato) were really bland and not good. Mariner martini was recommended by server and was great.

Customer 5980.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5980.Content: I love the Met, it provides world class food.

Customer 5981.Name: Davidsonchick
Customer 5981.Content: Outstanding service and terrific food! The waiter set the tone for the meal, and he was absolutely top notch!

Customer 5982.Name: Judy
Customer 5982.Content: We had a very pleasant dinner here. The waitress was very helpful and attentive. When our steaks came out a litte too rare for us they immediately took them back for a little more cooking. Also, when I didn't like the presentation of one of the appetizers, the waitress asked me what I wanted and they fixed it how I wanted it.

Customer 5983.Name: LorieT
Customer 5983.Content: Our meal was wonderful. The service was excellent.

Customer 5984.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5984.Content: The food was great, the service even better. It was a bit too loud.

Customer 5985.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5985.Content: We were up from sf. I must say this is one of the best steaks houses around,just love it . Our server was on top of it. The food was great. Thank u very much for showing us a wonderfull time.

Customer 5986.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 5986.Content: The food at the Metropolitan Grill is the simply the best. I went my family wife and 3 children 2 of which are adults now. We were celebrating my daughters 18 birthday, we all had steaks (ribeye's, filet mignon's) were excellent. Appetizers and desserts were decadent, delicious, and addictive. The service was exceptional.

Customer 5987.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5987.Content: The service was great, and the food was amazing. I had no idea the portions would be that size which made for a every enjoyable evening. I will definitely have to return to try the other dishes.

Customer 5988.Name: SandyM
Customer 5988.Content: As always, it was a great meal, with lovely service and just a good good experience. Kind of like visiting your favorite aunt - you leave feeling so special and fortunate to have had such a nice evening! Always see people you know - and always get to try something new.

Customer 5989.Name: RobertB
Customer 5989.Content: As usual, I was not disappointed with the food and service. Our server Kimberly was awesome and friendly. I will go back soon.! I had the salmon and it was out of this world.!

Customer 5990.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5990.Content: Have been to many steak houses in NY, Chicago, Dallas, Nashville...this was good but for the quality, quantity and variety EXTREMELY over priced. Didn't ask to pay for the entire cow for god's sake. I had to ask the waiter to provide an ice bucket for the white wine - it had been opened and left on the table!!!

Customer 5991.Name: Cynthia
Customer 5991.Content: Awesome time as usual. Our server, Jade was great! We were there for our anniversary and everyone was fantastic! From the great booth to the complimentary dessert...Thanks!!

Customer 5992.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5992.Content: A real "Guy" restaurant. The portions were tremendous! However they treat the women like ladies, very old school. We enjoyed the evening very much.

Customer 5993.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 5993.Content: We came from out of town just to eat at the Met, we were not disappointed the food, service and atmosphere were great. Thanks for the start of a great evening and memorable weekend.

Customer 5994.Name: jjmw
Customer 5994.Content: The Japanese Ohmi Tenderloin was the best steak of my life! A bit pricey at $100 for 6oz but a definite treat. It was tender and full of flavor and definitely memorable. The server this go around was okay but not as good as the ones from our previous visit but the food made up for it.

Customer 5995.Name: EatOutOften
Customer 5995.Content: Met was fabulous. They truly have a great menu and professional waiters.

Customer 5996.Name: George
Customer 5996.Content: Great as usual. A definite stop if you are visiting the Emerald city.

Customer 5997.Name: marycontois
Customer 5997.Content: My favorite place when we travel to Seattle for our anniversary and my birthday.  the carrot cake with madagascar ice cream is to die for!!!

Customer 5998.Name: AnniversaryDinner
Customer 5998.Content: Everything was top notch. The food was phenomenal and the service was outstanding. Every year we go to Seattle and choose a different restaurant to go to that we haven't been to before. While this was our first time at the Met, it definitely won't be our last. I think we've found the restaurant we'll be coming back to year after year.

Customer 6000.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6000.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at The Met. The service is impeccable and our server went out of his way to make sure our meal was fantastic. It was our anniversary dinner and we were given a complimentary dessert! The food (as always) is superb!!! The filet mingon and peppercorn steak was cooked perfectly with rich flavor. The Met is always our restaurant of choice when celebrating a special occasion.

Customer 6001.Name: hskr
Customer 6001.Content: The Met maintains it's high level of service and it's reputation as one of the Northwest's outstanding Steak Houses. Expensive and well worth it.

Customer 6002.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6002.Content:
A great experience overall. Certainly one of the best steak restaurants in the country. But you don't have to be a carivore to enjoy a meal here. The menu, while focusing on steaks, has a variety which are all prepared in an excellent manner.
Very nice wine menu as well.
Although I would not qualify The Met as a kid friendly restaurant, I had 5 and 10 year old boys with me and the staff (and menu) attended to them very well. They, like their parents, had a wonderful time.

Customer 6003.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6003.Content: Not only was the service inexcusably bad, the manager didn't even acknowledge our complaints. The noise level was too much.

Customer 6004.Name: ChristineL
Customer 6004.Content: The Met has always been one of my favorites, especially to celebrate special occassions. The food and service are always superb!

Customer 6005.Name: rkakarala
Customer 6005.Content: Great food the best service worth every penny

Customer 6006.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6006.Content: great service!  we love coming back.

Customer 6007.Name: KellyM
Customer 6007.Content: As always, the Met delivers. Great food, helpful but not hovering server, awesome wine list (comes complete with friendly, very knowledgable sommolier), and lots of noise. Do wish they'd institute some sort of dress code, however. It's amazing what Seattle-ites think is appropriate wear for this level of restaurant (short-shorts and t-shirts were on display last Friday night)--it kind of kills the ambience to look at people who look like they barely managed to make it out of bed to stop by Denny's for a bite.

Customer 6008.Name: Aloha9620
Customer 6008.Content: This is one of the great steakhouses, it should not be missed.  Fairly expensive, but well worth the price.  You will not be disappointed.  A great place to see and be seen!

Customer 6009.Name: RoyH
Customer 6009.Content: I have been to the met before but this was the best yet. First time i had the apple pie desert. It was the best, and they cooked it at the table.

Customer 6010.Name: ToddL
Customer 6010.Content: My Mom's 60th was made very special here!!

Customer 6011.Name: GailL
Customer 6011.Content: Classy, uptown atmosphere, memorable anniversary celebration. Attentive staff, great food and drink. Try the calamari appetizer. The steaks are the best we've had. My husband has celebrated his birthday at the Met Grill for 20 years.

Customer 6012.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6012.Content: Dinner was great! Food is delicious and nicely presented, service was perfect. Overall, a wonderful "date night."

Customer 6013.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6013.Content: When I made my reservation, I included that it was for my boyfriend's birthday. As soon as we checked, everyone seem to know it was his birthday and they all greeted him and even asked him how his birthday meal was afterward. He was surprised and very impressed.

Customer 6014.Name: LeeAndDi
Customer 6014.Content: The Met is great for special occasions/celebrations. The steaks were wonderful and the salads and sides complimented them perfectly.

Customer 6015.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6015.Content: Very good food, outstanding service. Pricey, but worth it for very special occasions.

Customer 6016.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6016.Content: The Met was great - as usual. Really enjoyed the food and the service was superb. Looking forward to receiving our certificate for a return visit.

Customer 6017.Name: RRG1
Customer 6017.Content: Food, service and atmosphere was fantastic as always. One of the great Steakhouses in the Seattle area and anywhere for that matter. Always great, always consistent and service is top notch. I highly recomend for any meat lover and for that special occasion with friends or loved ones. Pricey but worth it.

Customer 6018.Name: Carl
Customer 6018.Content: As always, an excellent meal. Service exceptional...at one point, we had 4 waiters bringing us wine, bread, and 1st courses!

Customer 6019.Name: George
Customer 6019.Content: This was our second time dining here in the past few months. While the food was equally good, the service on this visit led a bit to be desired. We were seated at a table for two that was literally in the middle of a back dining room and in the path to the kitchen for the waiters and other service personnel. Nothing quiet and romantic about this experience. The service was fair at best. There was a significant delay between courses of the meal. The waiter seemed a bit overwhelmed and we saw him rarely. Drinks and water glasses remained empty, and a side dish was forgotten until we asked about it. Sure these were minor annoyances, but when I am paying upwards of $200 for a dinner for two, I expect good service and a memorable evening.

Customer 6020.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6020.Content: Wonderful first time experience at The Met for my date. Best steak he's ever had. Also, first time EVER that he's eaten a steak without A-1 steak sauce (euwww). Thank you!

Customer 6021.Name: RichardM
Customer 6021.Content: It made our 25th Anniversary! Our server was outstanding and I would recommend her to anyone as she truly understands customer service! Thank you!

Customer 6022.Name: Pego
Customer 6022.Content: The waiter and the service was wonderful!The food was great- not a restaurant for children.

Customer 6023.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6023.Content: Wonderful service - our waitress was knowledgeable, friendly, and attentive. I had the American Wagyu filet side by side with the traditional filet mignon. Both were delicious and the idea of pairing the two was fun. This is a great special occasion restaurant.

Customer 6024.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6024.Content: Food and service is always outstanding.

Customer 6025.Name: Talkhardbeheard
Customer 6025.Content: As always, the food at the Met is fantastic. This time, however, our waiter, who had been there for more than 15 years, mixed up our order, ordering mine medium well and my wife's steak medium rare (which for well-done folks is frustrating). She forgot my drink order twice, and left us a bit unattended. That's never happened before at the Met - so I'll chalk it up to a tough night (although it was a Tuesday . . .).

Customer 6026.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6026.Content: Nicest restaurant ever! Great for a special occasion! The nine layer chocolate cake was to die for! Yes...nine layers!!!

Customer 6027.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6027.Content: The service was fabulous! I love dining at the Metropolitan Grill. My filet mignon is always cooked perfectly. My only complaint is that the mashed potatoes could be a little hotter. I think that the potatoes are scooped on the plate and sit there while the steak is cooking. My sister and I prefer piping hot mashed potatoes. Luke warm just does not thrill us. We take a couple of bites and the rest of the potatoes are cold. Both my sister and I have mentioned this on several occasions to the wait staff and the manager and nothing seems to be done. Please take my advise and serve the potatoes hotter.

Customer 6028.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6028.Content: We went to the Met for our 32nd anniversary. We have a tradition of going somewhere nice on our anniversary. We had never been to the Met so we decided we would this year because my sister raves about the place. The food was very good. The service was well below what we have come to expect at a fine restaurant. We were finally seated at 8:40 PM (25 minutes late) just before we were going to walk out and find something else. The service was very slow. By the time we finished dinner it was 9:45 PM. For the high cost in this restaurant I would have expected great service. Not so. Based on this experience I think we will stick to the Brooklyn or Daniels Broiler. Not impressed.

Customer 6029.Name: Carolyn
Customer 6029.Content:
If you have beef lovers in your party, the Metropolitan is a sure winner. The many varieties of meat are cooked perfectly and the salads and sides are delicious as well. The wine we drank was a fun new discovery but many more moderately priced options are also available.
We come to the Met when we want an excellent dining experience. The members of the staff are all extremely friendly without obsequiousness. They are knowledgeable and attentive and I love the rich but accessable ambience.
I love this restaurant!

Customer 6030.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6030.Content: First time at this restaurant and our first time in Seattle. It lived up to the hype. The steak was excellent and the service was superior. It made for a memorable evening. My wife ordered the pork chops and was guilt ridden that she couldn't finish them all. We're from California and in the memorable words of our Governor- "We'll be back".

Customer 6031.Name: IanS
Customer 6031.Content: Great steaks, dessert was also delicious and entertaining (Bananas Foster)

Customer 6032.Name: YAYALady
Customer 6032.Content:
6 of us had a lovely birthday dinner. Be prepared to spend lots of $. You get tons of food but you pay for it. the food it wonderful but everything is ala carte. We had drinks before dinner and a bottle of wine and our bill was over $600 for 6 people.
It was a special ocation and worth the price though.
Service could have been a bit better for what we were spendig the waiter was not that attentive and he spilled some of a drink he had just served and did not offer to replace it.

Customer 6033.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6033.Content: Great experience! Expensive but worth it. I just wish it was a little cheaper so I could head over a couple times a week!

Customer 6034.Name: gofo
Customer 6034.Content: WE HAD 3 FOR B'DAY DINNER - I ORDERED A RIB EYE AND GOT A NY STRIP AND IT WAS FULL OF FAT AND GRISSLE - ORDERED A GIBSON/ROCKS AND WAS BROUGHT A GIMLET UP WHICH SHE CORRECTED - HAD TO ASK 2 TIMES FOR BREAD WHILE WE WERE HAVING SCALLOPS AND BREAD CAME AFTER THESE WERE FINISHED - A COUPLE OTHER SMALL ISSUES BUT ALL IN ALL DIANE WAS VERY PLEASANT ABOUT THE PROBLEMS AND TOOK THE STEAK OFF MY BILL - MY NEPHEW/WIFE DINNERS WAS A OK - HAVE BEEN TO THE MET MANY TIMES OVER THE YEARS AND NEVER HAD A STEAK THIS BAD - GUESS EVEN THE BEST AND MOST EXPENSIVE CAN MAKE A MISTAKE

Customer 6035.Name: KennethC
Customer 6035.Content: Pricey, but the food & service were great.

Customer 6036.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6036.Content: Our service was extraordinary. We requested a private booth for four for a special occasion and the hostess acknowledged it on our arrival. Very nice. The four of us couldn't have had a nicer evening.

Customer 6037.Name: DSmith
Customer 6037.Content: Excellent all around. The most delicious steak I have ever had. Made for a wonderful special anniversary date night.

Customer 6038.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6038.Content: Expensive! Expensive! Expensive! Did I say expensive yet? This was a good meal, but hardly worth the price. We got the specials which included side dishes. That is probably the cheapest price one could pay. We easily paid $85 per person.

Customer 6039.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6039.Content: The night and meal was perfect. It was both my wife and daughters birthday and it was wonderful. Thanks Jack

Customer 6040.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6040.Content: This is not the type of place I frequent, for the simple fact, money. However, as a treat for every one of my senses...wow! It's worth it! Making a dining experience the entire activity of the night and feeding myself the most delicious steak I may have ever had, well all I can say is thank you. Thank you Metropolitan Grill! You made me comfortable, you made me smile, you more than satisfied my hunger, you just flat out kept the goodness coming. I already have and will continue to recommend and rave about you.

Customer 6042.Name: Alexa
Customer 6042.Content: If you are a steak lover, this is a must and hands down the best in Seattle and East side.  The service is excellent, the ambiance is classic bold mohagany and we are never dissapointed.  The prices are fair all around.  The bar is also excellent, where you can get a full service meal if you like.

Customer 6043.Name: FamilyGuy
Customer 6043.Content: Special evening at the Met, my son's 16th birthday. The Met knew, but they didn't give us a good table, although there were plenty available. ALthough we were there for dinner, paying dinner price off the dinner menu, we didn't have linen service. It was a two-and-a-half hour dinner. Service was amazingly slow and without explination. The waiter seemed busy, although it was Sunday at 4 p.m. Strange. Dinner was good to great. Table was aweful. Service was nice but slow.

Customer 6044.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6044.Content: The restaraunt was very busy the night we went, so we had to wait for our table and a very long time for our meal. The meal actually wasn't that warm when it arrived. This distracted from our experience, especially considering the price of this restaraunt.

Customer 6045.Name: seattlediner
Customer 6045.Content: The food was wonderful and the service was top-notch.

Customer 6047.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6047.Content: A classic city steak house with superb service. Unobtrusive, attentive and knowledgeable staff. Not for the faint of pocket however. Expensive, but value for money for a special occasion.

Customer 6048.Name: AndreasV
Customer 6048.Content: As usual, top notch service coupled with perfectly prepared steaks. The Met never disappoints.

Customer 6049.Name: GreggS
Customer 6049.Content: It was a great night, it was my wifes 1st time to dine at Met Grill. I am now in trouble for not bringing her sooner.

Customer 6050.Name: DJWilly
Customer 6050.Content: Solid place that you can always count on for good food, wine and service...The menu always has something for everyone and changes enough to give you variety.

Customer 6051.Name: PHADEAUX
Customer 6051.Content:
The food was great,and service was good.
The restaurant prices are way out of line,however,and I will limit my patronage of the Met in future. John Fado

Customer 6052.Name: Chris
Customer 6052.Content: Tired room, living off of its reputation. Standard, not spectacular fare for a high end steakhouse, but needs serious updating. Newer entrants such as El Gaucho Eastside and John Howie only reinforce how "behind the times" the Metropolitan Grill is. Service was slow and unhelpful and simple things like running a credit card seemed to take forever. If you're looking for a great steak house, there are much better choices.

Customer 6053.Name: Dakota
Customer 6053.Content: Great steaks!! Waiter was very attentive and got us on our way to the opera on time without rushing our meal.

Customer 6054.Name: 509LR
Customer 6054.Content: We have dined at the Met for many years. We can truthfully say that the food and sevice has always been great. The steaks are fabulous. The bar makes good drinks. The service is top notch. We love it.

Customer 6055.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6055.Content: The menu selection is fit for a famished carnivore. In our red meat selections, the portions where more than adequate for even the most hardy eater. The meat was prepared precisely as requested “no redo's required here”. Even though I indulge myself with fine meats I still love my greens I found the salad a little small for my consumption but tasty never the less. The over the top finish was an apple crisp flambé prepared table side looked fantastic smelled great but the crisp tasted like old refrigerator “not good”.

Customer 6056.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6056.Content: Food was great and the service well worth the money i will be back again when in the area

Customer 6057.Name: KarenH
Customer 6057.Content: Applause to the Kitchen Staff at the Metropolitan Grill. On another note, the wait staff had no idea who we were but continued to want to share their tales of recently waiting on a Hollywood Celebrity visiting Seattle. This caliber belongs at a Denny's not a Met, if that is what they are striving to achieve.

Customer 6058.Name: JohnR
Customer 6058.Content: We had a celebratory dinner planned, and the restaurant came through with flying colors. We were seated on time, there is a very attentive staff, especially considering the restaurant was packed, and the steaks...those steaks...outstanding meat, and a surprisingly large menu of options, which was much appreciated. The side dishes are what you expect: creamed spinach, mac and cheese, but perfectly done and a nice portion. Outstanding wine list with many reasonable options, including specials that were very well priced.

Customer 6059.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6059.Content: My only comment is that the food was so good and so abundant that my stomach hurt from over eating!

Customer 6060.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6060.Content: I have lived in Seattle for almost three years now and finally went to the met on friday afternoon and took a few clients with me. Although the food was good i do not think it lived up to the reputation that i thought it had. The food was ok but not what i expected.

Customer 6061.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6061.Content: I have been to the Met many times, and this time I took two friends that have never been before. They were quite pleased with the whole dining experience.

Customer 6062.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6062.Content: Best steak I have ever had. Seasoning was terrific and cooked to perfection!

Customer 6063.Name: George
Customer 6063.Content: For us, this is a special occassion restaurant. The food is amazing down to the rolls in the bread basket. The steaks were perfect. We made sure to take some home in order to save room for dessert - The coconut cake did not disappoint. The service was top notch. Will definitely be visiting again.

Customer 6064.Name: DanLoyola
Customer 6064.Content:
Appetizer:
The Fried Calamari was excellent.Perfectly cooked, very tender, very tasty.

Oysters in a half shell: Excellent.Extra small and super tasty, super fresh.

Dining summary:
Very nice place, excellent service, very good steak.

However, for the price we pay for their steak - my expectations are way higher.
($56.00 for a Rib Eye Steak)

Steak:
Very tender, very juicy, cooked perfectly. No complaints there.

However, no seasoning is applied to the meat so I had to put salt & pepper on my own steak.

Their Steak is supposed to be grilled with imported Hickory Wood, however there were no grill marks on their steaks. I like to see grill marks on my steak.

Basically, overall, very good food....overpriced meat.

Customer 6065.Name: VinoKatt
Customer 6065.Content:
We did not have quite as leisurely of a dinner as we had hoped. I was not quite halfway through my soup when our entree arrived. Our waiter apologized and said she could keep my meal warm for me but then returned with it 2-3 minutes later, well before I was ready.

We did appreciate the complimentary dessert. We were celebrating an anniversary.

Customer 6066.Name: Banaltra
Customer 6066.Content: Had a wonderful, leisurely meal with friends. Felt like I was in a European restaurant where the pace was easy going. Never felt rushed to order or that our table was needed for the next in line. All had meals that were A+. It was a little noisy but then where isn't it! Will be back again!

Customer 6067.Name: JimSmith
Customer 6067.Content: This was a terrific restaurant and I recommend it to anyone interested in a really good meal.  Service was great and the restaurant was quite nice.  The menu has enough to satisfy any desire.

Customer 6068.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6068.Content: Drinks weren't overpriced and the food was decent. Our service was subpar. We had to ask waiter several times for different things such as a bread basket. After two requests we just gave up as our food had arrived. We were there celebrating a special occasion. Overall the experience was a bit of a let down.

Customer 6069.Name: MichaelB
Customer 6069.Content: Always been at the top of my list. Expensive but worth it.

Customer 6070.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6070.Content: Although pricey, a memorable evening to celebrate a special occasion. The exclusive bottle of house red wine perfectly complimented our meal.

Customer 6071.Name: michaelk
Customer 6071.Content: tables for two are a tight fit (neither my wife nor I are widebodies) Service was friendly, if not overly so, the steaks were assuredly divine, although I couldn't rave about accompanying dishes. We enjoyed our visit, as we have in the past, and have no reason not to return.

Customer 6072.Name: PHunt
Customer 6072.Content: Wonderful. Our personal carver was great at engaging conversation, finding commonalities to chat about. Waiter was attentive but not evasive, and every accomodating. Everyone was delightful and made our evening a wonderful treat. Thank you.

Customer 6073.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6073.Content: The food is excellent and portions much to big for one person. Overall the food was the best thing there. We had made reservations only to be sent to the bar and wait a half an hour before being seated. I thought that reservations are made for that sole purpose of being reserved. We were then seated an hour late and our dinner was served 45 minutes after the orders had been placed. I have enjoyed the restaurant the numerous times that we have gone but this was a special night and we had people come from out of the country to join us only to be disappointed with the service.

Customer 6074.Name: Gretchenlovesgoodfood
Customer 6074.Content: The food was good, although very rich. I would like to see some healthier choices.

Customer 6075.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6075.Content: Great steaks but pricey. Waiter guided us through the menu, and made great suggestions, even had the kitchen split the salad for us. We got Bananas Foster for dessert and it was delicious. Great selection in the bar.

Customer 6076.Name: Cooter
Customer 6076.Content: excellent steak and service cant wait to go back

Customer 6077.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6077.Content:
The Metropolitan Grill is always a wonderful dining experience! That's why we keep going back!
The servers are fun, knowledgeable and made your experience that much better.
The steaks are the best around!
I can't say enough good things about the establishment!
Be prepared to spend a couple of hours to enjoy your visit!
You won't be disappointed!
PMN

Customer 6078.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6078.Content: The service was amazing. Charles was informative, very helpful and efficient without being intrusive. We needed our meal to be completed in time for a concert but not rushed and our request was honored to the minute! All courses were delicious and presented perfectly. The only thing we didn't care for was the noise level. It was quite loud. Overvall, the experience was amazing.

Customer 6079.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6079.Content: We had our first anniversary dinner at the Met. The experience was great. The staff led us to our rose petal covered table and incredibly attentive all night. The only downside of the evening was my steak, which was prepared correctly but was just a really tough piece of meat. They were even gracious enough to comp my entree because of it though, so overall I still say you can't go wrong at the Met.

Customer 6080.Name: Didi
Customer 6080.Content: The service is the best part of the Metropolitan, followed closely by the ambiance. When it comes to deciding how you want your steak cooked, pay attention to the menu. If you like rare, order rare (not medium rare). Stick with green veggies as a side and avoid the mushrooms (they tasted bland and not mushroom-y). Still, a great place for a romantic night out.

Customer 6081.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6081.Content: My family and I had a great time, and while it is pricey, the food is worth it! My husbands steak was phenominal; it almost brought him to tears. The service was excellent. We had Julie, she was fun, light hearted and fit the night we we re having excellently. That was the second time that we've been, and it was far better than the first.

Customer 6082.Name: diner
Customer 6082.Content: Wonderful service and great food. Overall a great place to dine.

Customer 6083.Name: gabriellef
Customer 6083.Content: We were celebrating a belated valentine dinner. We asked for a quiet table, they set us up with a lovely high-backed booth in the corner. We had to try a couple of their signature drinks, lovely. The escargot and oysters on the half-shell next, perfect quantity the champagne mignonette incredible. We decided on two of the specials the crab stuffed halibut, quite rich and beautifully silky, but I found my Wagyu filet combination to be the star. I haven't had a opportunity to try Japanese Wagyu and getting to compare with American Wagyu on the same plate....genius. My fear of the fat content was so misguided, it lacked the heavy fat flavor I get from heavy marbling. The best beef I've ever had, seasoned perfect. Table-side Cherries Jubilee Ó

Customer 6084.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 6084.Content: We were celebrating my wife's birthday, and really like the Met because they treat us like family. From the attractive hostess that greet with a smile, and guide you to your seat. The servers are all hardworking and attentive (a rare combination). Our server was Kimberly, she was courteous, knowledgeable, and prompt. My wife had a special request of drink, and she insured that it was made the way my wife requested. Craig the Maitre d made several trips to insure that we were enjoying the night and that we were taken care of for the evening. The fillet Mignon were cooked to perfection. The sauteed mushrooms and spinach were excellent addition to the garlic mashed potato I had and the baked potato my wife enjoyed.

Customer 6085.Name: DarinC
Customer 6085.Content: Very busy Seattle institution.  Steak was good, not the best I've had, but still good.  Fish was cooked perfectly and sides were fine.  Dined during a promotion where they send you a certificate good for the value of the entrees on your first visit.  Another trip to the Met is sure to follow.

Customer 6086.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6086.Content: Great experience, the food was good, their amber ale was the best I've ever had. The service was fast and friendly.

Customer 6087.Name: ScottZ
Customer 6087.Content: Honestly...it wasn't my best experience at the Met. Our steaks were fresh, but they were not seasoned very well. The oysters were average.

Customer 6088.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6088.Content: The Met is simply to place to go for a steak and dessert.  Simply amazing service and all around fun time.  Yes, it is expensive, but so worth it...and if you arent convinced, get on their mailing list and receive a coupon.  Go, have a conversation with anyone, and walk away full of some of the best around!

Customer 6089.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6089.Content: One of the best steaks I have ever had

Customer 6090.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6090.Content: We loved our food, the service was excellent. We will return when we are in Seattle.

Customer 6091.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6091.Content: The Metropolitan Grill staff did a fantastic job over Valentine's Day weekend making sure we had an awesome experience. The staff paid attention to every detail over the course of the evening showing us the best service we have had at any restaurant. The waiter was knowledgable about the dishes and wines, helping to choose the best of both for us. Great steak and wine selections!! If you are willing to spend the money, you will have a great experience!

Customer 6092.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6092.Content: I had really high expectations for the Met and was honestly a bit dissapointed. The food was absolutly divine but the ambiance and service fell pretty short. The tables were crammed closely together and we felt like we were just shoved in a corner. When your spending over $100 per person I believe you are not only looking for a good meal but also a good experience. When we asked the wine server to explain to us what his favorite cab's were he told us his two favorites and then just kind of stared blankly at us. I would expect much more description and sophistication. I have worked in the hospitality industry for years in hotels and on board cruise ships and let me tell you I would be embarrassed to represent a place like the Met.

Customer 6093.Name: PeteC
Customer 6093.Content: The Metropolitan Grill is the best dining experience in Seattle. Very pricey but worth every penny, everything; the cocktails, appetizers, wine, entrees, accompaniments and the desserts and coffee were wonderful. Preparations were perfect on all and the service is unsurpassed. I am somewhat of a food snob and I generally don't like to pay high prices, but I would recommend the Metropolitan Grill to anybody who wants a great dining experience in Seattle. Simply the best!

Customer 6094.Name: annk
Customer 6094.Content: The resturant had great food, but sevice took a long time to be served...

Customer 6095.Name: Glutengobbler1
Customer 6095.Content:
Overall, we find this to be a great dining experience. The staff is professional and well trained. The food has been outstanding and if you are into wine, the list is extensive.

I think the cost is reasonable.

Customer 6096.Name: Mike
Customer 6096.Content: We had a very enjoyable evening at the Met. We were seated promptly and treated to great service. The food was top notch and we left very full. Highly recommended.

Customer 6097.Name: MichaelynnR
Customer 6097.Content: Loved it! Can't wait to go back. If you like steak, this is the place to go.

Customer 6098.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6098.Content: The Met is a very special restaurant that Seattle is very lucky to have. You leave full and happy. The service is typically impeccable and their extensive wine list and staff of sommeliers makes for a spectacular pairing. Have been going there for years and will continue for many more.

Customer 6099.Name: JenF
Customer 6099.Content: Great place to bring a client for lunch. I'm sure it is good for dinner too, but I have most often gone there for client meetings. Service is always great, plenty on the menu to choose from, etc.

Customer 6100.Name: Napan
Customer 6100.Content: Outstanding! We ordered Three Filets Mignon. Each was perfectly done!Julie our server with 20 yrs experience at the Met was also outstanding!

Customer 6101.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6101.Content: The waitress was extremely pleasant. The food was fabulous and their wine list is amazing.

Customer 6102.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6102.Content: The food was amazing and the atmosphere was great. However, it took much longer to get our meal than was acceptable (35 minutes) after we gave our order to the waitress. When my husband had to search for our waitress, or someone, to inquire about the time frame he was met with a rebuff, and told that it really hadn't been that long. We were visiting Seattle and having dinner with a friend who resides there. Although she claimed she had never had a experience like that there, We won't be going back! Try the Brooklyn down the street, you can't beat the quality of food, attentive service and atmosphere for the price!!

Customer 6103.Name: WayneS
Customer 6103.Content: Excellent. Service and food were outstanding. A great experience as I knew it would be.

Customer 6104.Name: KWey
Customer 6104.Content: It was an amazing dinner. One of the best steaks I've ever had. And the service is perfection.

Customer 6105.Name: Rlomb
Customer 6105.Content: Had a steak salad for lunch. Unfortunately the lettuce in the salad when uncovered was frequently brown and old. Sliced steak in the salad was okay, but nothing special, and a lot of it.

Customer 6106.Name: RobertB
Customer 6106.Content: Fantastic experience. And the Food was as usual superb.! Kimberly our server was superb.

Customer 6107.Name: KenT
Customer 6107.Content:
As usual the food, service and overall ambiance was great. I would like to see a regular "tossed dinner" salad put back on the menu. The salad I ordered was not exactly what I was seeking, although it was good, I am not big fan of the type of lettuce put in it. (real leafs etc). I should have ordered a Caesar and just had the kitchen make it with 1000 dressing instead of the caesar...that is what I was looking for.

OVerall, an excellent meal.

Ken THompson

Customer 6108.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6108.Content: We had a fabulous dinner at the Metropolitan Grill. Our waiter was fun, knowledgeable, and witty. We had a wonderful time.

Customer 6109.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6109.Content: Vastly overpriced for food that is barely acceptable. My American Waygu skirt steak was quite simply fatty. My wife felt her grilled salmon was dry. The accompaniments (creamed spinach, French fries, Yukon gold potato patties, breaded artichoke hearts) were uniformly greasy and flavorless. For this they charge $125? And for God's sake, what is the point of plastering photographs on every available wall space? To convince you that if famous people threw away their money, you should too?

Customer 6110.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6110.Content: Had same steak at Daniels Lake Union night before. Daniel's significantly better quality of meat.

Customer 6111.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6111.Content: Excellent service by our waitor but the kitchen was a bit slow. The food was so good it made it worth the wait. Bar is very slow at getting your drink orders filled.

Customer 6112.Name: Cynthia
Customer 6112.Content: Our time at The Met was wonderful as usual. It is such a wonderful experience...Our server, Scott G. was gracious and fun. Thanks for a great time!!!

Customer 6113.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6113.Content: Best food around, A+ service. I would go everyday if I could afford it!

Customer 6114.Name: CEC27
Customer 6114.Content: Heard great things and it didn't disappoint in the least. Great place!!

Customer 6115.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6115.Content: Great place that has the feel of the classic steakhouse. Very male dominated audience. The food portions and quality were excellent. I will go there again.

Customer 6116.Name: daisymay16
Customer 6116.Content:
Excellent steak. Medium was cooked perfectly. The service was wonderful and very friendly, hard to find at higher priced establishments.

Would not recommend for kids or a group larger than 8 as there is limited arrangement for larger parties in the booths.

Customer 6117.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6117.Content: I expected the best steak in town from The Metropolitan Grill, and I got it! On top of that, our server was amazing! Service was excellent and the sommaliers were so knowledgeable and courteous. Definitely will be back.

Customer 6118.Name: Mermaid
Customer 6118.Content: Great service - it was a Sunday night.

Customer 6119.Name: bprsm
Customer 6119.Content: Absolutely fantastic. Far better than any of the "chain" steakhouses. Food, service, wine list -- all excellent. Don't miss this place if you're in Seattle and in the mood for steak.

Customer 6120.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6120.Content: My husband and I always look forward to coming to the Met! We always plan to come around our birthdays (both in January) and the food is always outstanding! The service is impeccable and we are always pleased with everything. The food is fresh and consistently delicious. We have never had a bad meal. We are always interested to see what differences are on the menu. This past visit our server brought us two desserts for both of our birthdays. Above the call of duty, but it was wonderful that we were celebrated equally. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Customer 6121.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6121.Content: Fabulous, as always. Wonderful food and accompanyments. Very good wait staff.

Customer 6122.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6122.Content: It is a great dining experience to eat at the Met. Our waiter was most personable and provided great service. The salads, main course, and deserts were all excellent.

Customer 6123.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6123.Content: This was our first visit to The Met. The server was wonderful. She explained the different cuts of steak and made great recommendations. We will definitely return.

Customer 6124.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6124.Content: The best part of the experience for me was the service of the waiter. He was enthusiastic, knowledgeable, caring, and just the right attentiveness. The food was good, not necessarily great flavor wise for me. I had the 42 day aged boneless Rib–Eye. It was the perfect tenderness, but just lacked flavor a little. My fiance enjoyed her bleu cheese medallions and had no complaints about it. The scene was very nice, ambiance was nice. Overall; great experience. Its something to try in your lifetime.

Customer 6125.Name: enjoysgoodfood
Customer 6125.Content:
Exceptional!
Dine here whenever in Seattle.
Last dinner, specifically came to Seattle for the Met. The reason, my friend's 60th BD.
Flew him up from Palm Beach, FL just for the T-bone. Could not have been money better spent.

Customer 6126.Name: GDO1
Customer 6126.Content: Great service but New York strip steaks were very dry.

Customer 6127.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6127.Content: My husband and I dined here for the first time for our 5th anniversary. The meal was wonderful. One of my steaks from the Prime/Wagyu combo was over cooked - they took the steak (leaving me the rest of my meal - yay!) and returned with one cooked to perfection. I was very happy and on top of all of that, they bought my husband and I dessert for our anniversary. Thoughtful. Flavorful. A wonderful dining experience.

Customer 6128.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6128.Content: The service was fantastic. Our server Joan was very personable. The food was great. The cocktails at the bar were fantastic. All in all a great dining experience.

Customer 6129.Name: Billy
Customer 6129.Content: As usual, The Met was a great place to meet good friends visiting from out of town. The service & food are always outstanding!

Customer 6130.Name: JPKB
Customer 6130.Content: I travel on business extensively and have the pleasure of eating at great, top-flight restaurants all over the country; unfortunately the Metropolitan Grill is not one of them. I don't mind high prices if you get value in return but that's not the case at the Met. Prices are exorbitant which might be acceptable if they delivered superior quality but I have been there twice in two months and both times was served the toughest steak I have ever had. The wine list is extensive but over-priced. There are some terrific restaurants in Seattle that I will enjoy before I consider returning to the Met.

Customer 6131.Name: GlennE
Customer 6131.Content: THIS WAS BY FAR THE VERY BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER HAD IT WAS WELL WORTH EVERY PEANNY

Customer 6132.Name: Paris
Customer 6132.Content: Lost its sparkle. Filet Mignon and chocolate lava dessert were very good as to be expected. House green salad was tasteless. There are lots of really good restaurants in Seattle. Met Grill needs to step it up once again. We will not be returning for some time; there are way too many better restaurants. I would not take out of town guests there now at this time. It was also my husband's birthday and he was not acknowledged at all although I included it in my reservations. Disappointing evening that I was so looking forward to based on the first time we dined there three years ago.

Customer 6133.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6133.Content: This is a restaurant that has been around for a long time and locals immediately smile when you mention Metropolitan Grill. The Steak takes center stage with many cuts and varieties to choose from. The sides are good and filling as well. You will not leave hungry! The waitress was quite knowledgeable and helpful in helping us choose our dinners. The staff are friendly and helpful. We loved everything about this restaurant!

Customer 6134.Name: reviewerRL
Customer 6134.Content: As usual, a great dining experience at The Met.

Customer 6135.Name: 509LR
Customer 6135.Content: "The Met" is our favorite Seattle restaurant. We have been going there since the mid 80's. The food is excellent and the service has always been great. Four maybe five times a year for all those years says something about their consistency!!

Customer 6136.Name: Chloesantafe
Customer 6136.Content: This is classic steak house that offers good service, a large wine list with some moderately priced wines and generally high prices for everything else. Dinner for 2 with the mid priced meat selections,salads, one cocktail, a $40 wine, a $10 brandy and one dessert was $250 with the tip. For us, other choices in Seattle offer a much better experience for the money

Customer 6137.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6137.Content: Always a treat to dine at The Met. The blackened prime rib is chock-full of flavor ad juice. Ca't beat the french onion soup. Service is always first-rate. A last bastion of old-time Seattle.

Customer 6138.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6138.Content: We came to this restaurant because of the steak and we were not disappointed. We have had Japanese Wagyu beef before and were excited to try The Met's version of it. I had the combination 4oz. American and 4oz. Japanese Wagyu filets. My significant other had the Ohmi Tenderloin. We were blown away. The meat was so tender it melted in your mouth. The American and Japanese Wagyu steaks were both very tasty. We also got the crab mac & cheese, which was good but, tasted a little like processed cheese. The asparagus with Bearnaise sauce was delicious. And for desert get the 9-layer chocolate cake, can feed 3 people easily! Very good experience here. I would come back every week if it wasn't so expensive. But it was worth it.

Customer 6139.Name: Brystock
Customer 6139.Content: "The Met" never disappoints. The food, service and ambiance all combine to make an extremely enjoyable dining experience.

Customer 6140.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6140.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our first anniversary. The food was amazing and our servers were entertaining and genuine.

Customer 6141.Name: Purplenor
Customer 6141.Content: For the first time that I have dined at this restaurant, I was disaapointed with the quality of the food. My steak had rubber consistency, which I brought to the attention of my server. She was an outstanding part of our evening and catered very well to request.

Customer 6142.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6142.Content: The Met experience was great. Service was 5 star with attention paid to each request me made.They follow through all the way through dessert.

Customer 6143.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6143.Content:
Writer's note: Keep in mind that this review is based on our visit, New Year's Eve. This is likely one of the restaurant's busiest days, ever. So your experience may vary. Now, on to the review.

The food was the best part, my mouth is still watering from that trio of filets, the American Prime, the American Wagyu and the Japanese Wagyu all side by side.

Service from the get go was a bit confusing.

We were on time for our reservation but the restaurant wasn't so we were directed to the bar. It was impossible to get a drink or a place to sit in the bar - we might as well have been the cattle.

Once we were called to the table, service was impeccible and the food, again, excellent. Highly reccomend the experience.

Customer 6144.Name: Tyler
Customer 6144.Content: We've been to the Metropolitan Grill many times over the years and the food quality and service have seemed to decline each time.  We may not choose to return for a while.

Customer 6145.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6145.Content: Great night at the met.very warm and relaxing evening.

Customer 6146.Name: OccasionalVisitor
Customer 6146.Content: Our experience at the Metropolitan was excellent. We were hoping for a warm and romantic dinner experience. We were not disappointed. The service and food were both topnotch. We had the fillet mignon and was probably the best steak we've ever eaten. Being from Anchorage, we were hoping for a special evening with good food. The Metropolitan served us up with one of the best and unforgettable evenings we've ever had.

Customer 6147.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6147.Content:
We've been meaning to try their steaks for a long time (we hear they're the best in the country), but when we got there, we were so tempted by the stroganoff (a Thursday lunch special) and the tuna that we ordered those instead. Both were phenomenal (albeit the stroganoff was a bit salty for my taste) -- flavorful, well-done -- and this was at a steakhouse!

As a note to readers: while they promote themselves as a business/power lunch/dinner place, many of the ppl there were dressed pretty casually (at least by my standards). No need to get all dressed up / business-y looking for a great meal here :)

Customer 6148.Name: GailY
Customer 6148.Content: The Metropolitan Grill has never disappointed - the food and service are always top-notch. They've added some specialty beef to their menu, but we stayed with the tried-and-true. The portions are large, but our waiter advised us to share side dishes. Although they are known for their steaks, we have always loved their prime rib.

Customer 6149.Name: Yuriy
Customer 6149.Content: The food at the Met was, as always, outstanding! I've seen that many marked this place as being romantic. I would disagree with that, as the atmosphere was more of a busy place with a lot of large and loud parties. Interior is very worn and old for an expensive restaurant. It needs an upgrade. The service was very good, and the food was, again, excellent!

Customer 6151.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6151.Content: Best Chateau in the city. Not free but worth it for special occasions.

Customer 6152.Name: JessicaK
Customer 6152.Content: I had been to the Metropolitan Grill several times before but my family was in town for the holidays so we decided to do something special. Everyone in my family loved the Met! Especially my dad. The service was warm and friendly and the food was incredible!

Customer 6153.Name: GaryW
Customer 6153.Content: Everything was great in our party of three. I reluctantly could not give 5 stars on the food. I ordered the trio fillets last time and were great. This time, I could not tell the difference between the Waygu fillet and the Kobe fillet. The Waygu fillet was markedly better than the prime fillet, but the Kobe fillet was not better than the Waygu fillet. I made mention of this to the waiter and he said the desert was on the house. We all appreciated this gesture. Overall it is always a great experience going to the Met and we will all be back.

Customer 6154.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6154.Content: Our booth was a little crowded for four people. The steaks were good, but the side dishes were uninspired. Having so many different people wait on our table was a little bizarre. Overall a good experience, not great.

Customer 6155.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6155.Content: If you want a steak, there is no place better.

Customer 6156.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6156.Content: Excellent. Splurge for the Waygu. I had the Idaho Waygu Ribeye and it was fabulous. I couldn't quite bring myself to try the $100 Japanese Waygu just on principle, but maybe I'll leave my qualms at the door next time. My husband and I come here every Christmas Eve. Portions are enormous, so take it easy on the appetizers and sides.

Customer 6157.Name: DavidB
Customer 6157.Content: They were incredibly busy (Christmas Eve) and despite the fact that they had a veritable army of staff on hand, some things took a little longer than I would have expected. It seems that our waiter agreed because he removed our after dinner cocktails from the bill because of the wait (without my even saying anything). So, even with a little longer than expected wait times, still an excellent experience and we will go back.

Customer 6158.Name: Tedd
Customer 6158.Content: Everything was excellent. Only regret is not having a table in a pathway.

Customer 6159.Name: Lizzie
Customer 6159.Content: A Christmas luncheon at the Met is an annual event for our group of six, though last year's weather fixed THAT one, but good! We have always had superb service, have always enjoyed our meals. A bit noisy, but we know that going in, and go anyway; and, if we start late enough, it's pretty quiet by the time we are winding down. Always a wonderful occasion.

Customer 6160.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6160.Content: Food was excellent but most notable was the outstanding & friendly service. Thanks for a great experience.

Customer 6161.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6161.Content: Food-Unbelievable. Service-Could not get any better. Absolutely superb!!!

Customer 6162.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6162.Content: I enjoyed my dining experience at Metropolitan Grill. The Restaurant definitely lives up to its hype. Great steak and fantastic service. I loved the food I had the Wagyu Fillet Minon was cooked to perfection. After I was just about stuffed to the brim, my waiter suggested an excellent dessert that was not going to make me keel over. Pear and huckleberry sorbet?! It was absolutely delightful! Cannot wait to revisit.

Customer 6163.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6163.Content: Our dining experience was fabulous, the atmoshphere was very "classic steakhouse" and the service was exceptional. We were seated promptly, we were not rushed by our waiter and he was very engaged with us. We will definitely make this a new holiday tradition.

Customer 6164.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6164.Content: Great steaks. Bed calamari I have had. Excellent friendly and knowledgable wait staff. Laid back but classy atmosphere. Worth every penny.

Customer 6165.Name: Golfnut
Customer 6165.Content: This is unquestionably one of the best restaurants in all of Seattle ... but, oh my, will you ever pay through the nose for the experience. The food is excellent, and our steaks were cooked to absolute perfection (how they consistently get this right is beyond me), but the prices are nothing short of ridiculous. And, charging an extra $4 for an accompanying sauce is downright insulting. When you're paying $60 or more for a steak, you would think that a few dabs of Bearnaise on top would be complimentary. Kind of ruins the experience to realize you're getting ripped off in such a manner ... but the steaks are so wonderful, I'll probably go back at least once a year for a very special occasion.

Customer 6166.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6166.Content: It is always a pleasure to eat at one of the premier steak places in the Northwest. Not only do the have the track record but they maintain the level excellence they are known for! Would recommend The Met in a heartbeat. The steak there just melts like butter and packed with flavor!! I would have to say that it would rival the steakhouses in other states that are know for beef!!

Customer 6167.Name: Harrie
Customer 6167.Content: Outstanding food, great atmosphere, always a pleasure going there.  Excellent service too.

Customer 6168.Name: Slowyeag
Customer 6168.Content: The evening was perfect, the even surprised the table with a birthday desert for my guest. The location is just a little far away from the activities in the area such as Benaroya Hall BUT it is worth the walk or park in between. Considering the food, service and ambiance the prices were very reasonable.

Customer 6169.Name: jefe
Customer 6169.Content: The Met had great food and a great atmosphere, and good service as well

Customer 6170.Name: kenny
Customer 6170.Content: This is a great place for a special occasion. We were about 45 minutes early, thinking we would have a drink. We were pleasantly surprised when they were able to seat us within about ten minutes in a roomy booth. The food and service were wonderful, a real treat for our family. Diners need to be aware the portions are quite generous.

Customer 6171.Name: cupofjoe
Customer 6171.Content: Leave the kids with a sitter and take that special someone to the Met for a memorable dinner. Maybe I don't get out to nice places enough, but this was by far my best dinner experience. The Met is known for it's great steak, but don't let that stop you from ordering their other entrees. My wife had a fettuccine dish with crab claw that was absolutely delish! Everything from the salad, side dish,drinks, to the entrees was perfect. Too bad we cheated ourselves by not leaving room for desert. Of course no dining experience can truly be enjoyed without good service. No problem here, it was our server Bruno who made our experience unforgettable. The Met is pricey but well worth every cent. I look forward to bringing my wife here for our 20th.

Customer 6173.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6173.Content: Everything we ordered was perfect. The wines were incredible. The cheesecake was the best I've ever had! It's not a cheap night out, but the quality of the food and the service made the price worthwhile.

Customer 6174.Name: BMUR
Customer 6174.Content: I took my son for his 14th Birthday and had a very good meal. We ordered the filet for 2 and it was carved tableside which was a nice touch. The service was very informative and attentive to our needs. Our final bill came to $225 with tip so in this respect I thought it was overly pricey compared to some of the other "best" steakhouses in the area. We only go to these "fancy" restuarants once a year on his birthday and the total experience was in the top 2. I highly recommend the 9 layer chocolate cake if you are a chocolate lover - easily the best chocolate cake I have ever had in my life, sorry Mom. One last tip, try to not get a table by the front door as on cold nights you can feel the draft every time the door gets opened. Bon Apetite!

Customer 6175.Name: JimG
Customer 6175.Content: A flawless dining experience. Atmosphere, service, food - the Met always delivers. Best steak I've ever had and the lamb was amazing.

Customer 6176.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6176.Content: I was bummed they didn't have the daily special available and there wasn't any other beef on their lunch special menu. Other than that, it was PERFECT!

Customer 6178.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6178.Content: The entire experience was fantastic. The food and service were impeccable. I could not find a single thing that was less than wonderful.

Customer 6179.Name: OpenTable Diner
