Customer 6179.Content: Our group experience was very nice, we all appreciated the service. Everyone enjoyed the meals they had; the portions were adequate. We were well taken care of not just by our waiter but by the wait staff as it should be. We look forward to coming again and also sharing the experience with other co-workers and groups in our agency so they can realize how worthwhile a trip to the "Met" is. Also found the prices to be competitive.

Customer 6180.Name: MerryMel
Customer 6180.Content: The Met is one of my favorite places. We make a special holiday occasion of going there every year. The place is alive with cheery people. The service is absolutely top-notch. Was not impressed with the crab mac and cheese this year, will return to the wonderful baked potato next time. Otherwise, food was outstanding. Waiter managed to find one last bone-in filet for my out-of-town guest even though official word was that they were out. Bananas Foster is always a hit for dessert, and we must always start with a Smoky Met Martini. Just LOVE this place! One tip: if your party includes short, chubby folks, or even a tall oversised one, you might want to ask for a table instead of a booth.

Customer 6181.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6181.Content: Wonderful evening. Great food. Great Service. One of my favorite restaurants.

Customer 6182.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6182.Content: Great food but not fine dinning @90.00 /plate not a great place. more like coverted pub. mostly booth seating. Good place to have beer.

Customer 6183.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6183.Content: Place is great! They have such good food and a very nice wine selection to choose from. Planning on going back soon.

Customer 6184.Name: JimmyD
Customer 6184.Content: It was very good but pricey. Service was excellent. You can get a comparable filet elsewhere for half the price.

Customer 6185.Name: DawnLJ
Customer 6185.Content: My steak was very good and the server was excellent. I found the restaurant to be a little too loud for my taste. I guess I'm reaching a point in my life that I enjoy the peacefulness accompanying my delicious meal.

Customer 6186.Name: 2oldLadies
Customer 6186.Content: Food was yummy - who doesn't like crab mac & cheese??? Wonderful wine suggestion - great service.

Customer 6187.Name: BremertonDiningDesert
Customer 6187.Content: If you always thought the Metropolitan was too expensive for your budget, try it for lunch- same outstanding food, but affordable prices. Great service, menu, ambiance,and food. Can't wait to be downtown for lunch again!

Customer 6188.Name: AnnC
Customer 6188.Content: We had a very enjoyable lunch and were also able to accomplish our goal of having a meeting. Our table was perfect for our needs. Service was excellent.

Customer 6189.Name: Scout
Customer 6189.Content: Wonderful experience! I've been talking about this restaurant for years to my fiance, and finally we made it to Seattle to visit friends and family - HE LOVED IT! Service, food (amazing!!), and atmosphere were all as I remembered...this restaurant does not disapoint!!

Customer 6190.Name: Ulothrix
Customer 6190.Content: I've been going to The Met for nearly 20 years and it's still one of the best restaurants for steak I've ever been to. They know their steak. And that knowledge comes in handy when you're trying to decide between the Wagyu New York or the Delmonico. The staff are lovely and helpful, and it's always been a great experience. This time was no exception.

Customer 6192.Name: Reece
Customer 6192.Content: If you want a good steak go to the Metropolitan Grill.  It is hit and miss with the service.  Sometimes I get a great waiter, then other times I get a waiter that is a bit arrogant.  Fortunately, this time my waiter was fantastic.  Very respectful and attentive.  The Chocolate Cake for dessert is the BEST!

Customer 6193.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6193.Content: Our dining experience was great. Our server Christine was very attentive.

Customer 6194.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6194.Content: first time ever I've been dissappointed. My prime rib (small cut, med-med rare) was tough and dry. Every one else LOVED their dinners though.

Customer 6195.Name: JoeFranza
Customer 6195.Content:
Our experience could not have been more romantic or satisfying.

Great venue!

Customer 6196.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6196.Content: That was the best steak I have ever had. The service was excellent and I really enjoyed the food. I would encourage anyone to go to the Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 6197.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6197.Content: The experience was exceptional as always.

Customer 6199.Name: DeirdreC
Customer 6199.Content: I dine out a lot in Seattle, from the local take away to the best restaurants in Seattle. I was very let down by The Met, overpriced, the service was disappointing and apart from a really good steak there was nothing to be wowed by. So if you're looking to spend $400 on 2 appetizers, 3 steaks (no sides), two desserts and bottle of wine ($80) - The Met is the place for you. If i'm going to spend that money - it's Canalis, Rovers or Cafe Juanita fine dining for me - I can always bbq a good steak at home.

Customer 6200.Name: KarenFoFaren
Customer 6200.Content: One of my absolute favorite restaurants in Seattle. For an elegant-but-fun steakhouse experience, it doesn't get any better than this.

Customer 6201.Name: Leftylemon
Customer 6201.Content: The Met is the best restaurant in Seattle, and in the State of Washington. The chefs know how to cook, and staff knows how to make you feel relaxed, and the bartenders know everything necessary to make anyone happy. This is a solid establishment that never disappoints. The Met has an old-world charm, and offers traditional meals with the freshest seafood and finest beef you can get. You could not make up a more welcome venue.

Customer 6202.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6202.Content: Loved it....got a good table in back. We arrived early for dinner and it was very private. Fantastic food, classic but not dowdy. Excellent service.

Customer 6204.Name: GaryK
Customer 6204.Content: I've been to the Metropolitan before, but found this was even better than my other visits (and that's saying something). The lobster bisque appetizer was outstanding, as was the prime delmonico. The creamed spinach side was not particularly good (almost average), but the service was outstanding! Extremely expensive, but if you're on an expense account, it's a must-go. Would definitely go back again.

Customer 6205.Name: SGWo
Customer 6205.Content: The Met continues to be the high standard that all restaurants of it's calibar should be measured against. Ambience, service and entrees are all above and beyond other restaurants. I would take any guest there with full assurance that they would completely enjoy themselves and their meal.

Customer 6206.Name: Barbcat41
Customer 6206.Content: I've wanted to dine here for some time. I like resturants with history and days gone by style. The food is excellent, Wine and drinks also. The only down side is the Seattle fire code changes that have added exposed ducting and firewall. Then there's the exposed wiring that they did not or could not put it in the walls takes away from.

Customer 6207.Name: SarahP
Customer 6207.Content: The wait staff in the restaurant was excellent, as was the food, but there was a substantial wait for the food to arrive. I was also a little disappointed by a couple of the wait staff in the bar.

Customer 6208.Name: LizEatsALot
Customer 6208.Content:
I'd read that the Metro is seattle's best steakhouse. I wasn't in love with my meal... and for the price ($300 for four, dinner & one glass of wine each) I thought the food was over priced... My steak (NY strip steak) was tough and didn't have much taste. And the garlic mashers hardly tasted like garlic. Our service was outstanding, though. Very down to earth and fun.
Before dinner - we did have a drink at the bar. One of the bartenders made us a special "taster" to try (for free) so that was nice. But i was still dissapointed with my steak. I'd had better steak at a place like Texas Roadhouse..unfortunatly.

Customer 6209.Name: RandallB
Customer 6209.Content: Excellent service, excellent food, excellent wine list.

Customer 6210.Name: quincy
Customer 6210.Content: Wonderful experience! The service was excellent. Everyone at the restaurant made us feel welcome and special.

Customer 6211.Name: tbaseball21
Customer 6211.Content: The service and food were outstanding. Will probably frequent the Met more often than just special occasions.

Customer 6212.Name: TylerL
Customer 6212.Content:
The Met continues to be one if not my favorite restaurant. The service is always warm and friendly, the restaurant itself inviting and beautiful, and the food unbelieveably delicious. It seems everyone who works there loves it and it shows. It was my 4th Anniversary with my wife and the waitress brought us Crème Brule for dessert for free! It was a very nice touch to an incredible experience!
The pictures on the walls of celebrities is great and Don Rickles had just come in the entrance as were were leaving!

Customer 6213.Name: greatsteaks
Customer 6213.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was everything that we expected with outstanding steaks and side dishes, impecable service and a wonderful ambience.

Customer 6214.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6214.Content:
The hallmark of the Metropolitan is excellence and service. Without a doubt the best steak house in Seattle. But to call it a steak house is nearly to demean it. The Metropolitan excels at what it does because the entire staff understands the meaning of service and seems imbued with a passionate knowledge of the foods served there, the qualities of the wines and the needs of the customers. There is a fine line between excellent service and fawning. The staff knows it. The ambiance is off the chart. The service outstanding. The food to die for.
The Metropolitan tops my list of the "must do" destinations for my visitors and guests to the Northwest. Bravo.

Customer 6215.Name: RandyB
Customer 6215.Content: The Met Grill is a great independent steakhouse

Customer 6216.Name: Adamcvinson
Customer 6216.Content: I have eaten at steakhouses throughout the country and the Metropolitan Grill was good but by no means exceptional. The scallops were divine but my steak was not mind-blowing and for $50 by itself it should have been.

Customer 6217.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6217.Content: I was our first time to The Met and it was even better than than the reviews. The service was very good and the food was amazing. If your looking for a quiet place this may not be for you as it was loud (conversations) but we like a vibrant scene.

Customer 6218.Name: PatriceW
Customer 6218.Content:
Our dining experience was excellent. The food was very good. Just the right amount of sauce to enhance the flavor of our salmon and steak. Very tasty!
We really liked our waiter. He was professional, knew the menu, personable and just the right amount of attentiveness. I wish I could remember his name. He made our Anniversary special! Thank you, Metropolitan Grill.

Customer 6219.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6219.Content: Many trips to the met. This was the best in years. Food and service were outstanding!!!

Customer 6220.Name: Chickling
Customer 6220.Content: Great for special occasions and a leisurly meal.

Customer 6221.Name: wayneh
Customer 6221.Content: We have been to the Met on numerous occasions and have never been disapointed in any way.

Customer 6222.Name: Laurel
Customer 6222.Content: The food was incredible as always! Our server was very knowledgeable and helpful! We enjoyed our experience very much and will be back.

Customer 6223.Name: JerryM
Customer 6223.Content: Food and serivce was good, booth was small and crowded for 4 people, steaks were also very good but overpriced.

Customer 6224.Name: laitsabr
Customer 6224.Content: It was our first time to this restaurant, and it was a grand experience. The steaks were incredible, and my son was happy with his kid-menu prime rib (large enough to be an adult entree in some places...). My daughter had the Wagyu filet mignon which was "the best and softest steak" she had ever eaten, which is high compliment since she is familiar with good beef. My wife's 42-day aged filet was exceedingly flavorful and juicy. My porterhouse did the name justice. I had to bring half of it back, so got to enjoy it twice!

Customer 6225.Name: SGWo
Customer 6225.Content: the Met is like the Grand Dame of Steakhouses; Always comfortable/elegant, fastidious service, always excellent food. When you get the bill, you never think "Lord, that was expensive!", you just think, "Wow! What an excellent meal, served beautifully. I am happy!"

Customer 6226.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6226.Content: While in Seattle for the weekend, I took my boyfriend to the Met to celebrate his 40th birthday on Sunday, Oct. 11 and had a wonderful time! Our waiter, Jason, was very helpful with the menu and very attentive to our needs. We ended up sharing the 50 oz. Bone in Ribeye and enjoyed every bit of it! Unfortunately we weren't able to try anything else after that but we'll definitely be back to the Met on our next trip. :)

Customer 6227.Name: Tony
Customer 6227.Content: Terrible, gristly prime rib. Go there a lot. Now re-considering.

Customer 6228.Name: DPHooker
Customer 6228.Content: We usually only make it to Seattle for special occasions but always manage to find out way to the "Met" for dinner while we are there. We are always impressed with the food and service. We have never had a bad, or even an average experience there. We will continue to return to this restaurant when ever given the opportunity.

Customer 6229.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6229.Content: The food, service and environment was wonderful!

Customer 6230.Name: bathfoster
Customer 6230.Content: By far the best steak ever put in my mouth. (Chateau Briand) Perfectly prepared - the flavor was amazing and the texture was unbelievable! The service was exceptional - so professional yet warm. The music could have been a little louder to accentuate the room, otherwise, it was an outstanding evening.

Customer 6231.Name: kimberlyc
Customer 6231.Content: happy hour is fantastic - worth waiting for a table - get there early to be sure to get a seat

Customer 6232.Name: HangryPanda
Customer 6232.Content: We went for a special occasion and had great service all throughout. Our waitress made excellent recommendations and made us feel at home.

Customer 6233.Name: JohnnyN
Customer 6233.Content: Disappointed server recommended the blacken primerib. It was very dry. I think the regular primerib would be better. Based on the reviewed i read, I was hoping this resturant would beat my favorite resturant, "House of prime rib" in SF. But it didn't.

Customer 6234.Name: Kyne
Customer 6234.Content:
Not sure what to say about this venerable mainstay.
The meat was great, no doubt, but this cannot hold a candle to New York shakers like Sparks or Luger's, and what's worse, is a bad value proposition compared to Steak at Houston's - which should be in a different category all together, but isn't.
In the end, a passable high quality steak that in the end was just a bit 'blah', and not worth the price of entry. Nice ambience but this can't compare to some New York or Chicago mainstays in aged steak.

Customer 6235.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6235.Content: rib eye steak is not good, very chewy and no flavor. wagyu is exceptional

Customer 6236.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6236.Content:
The whole evening was a 10, the service, the food, the drinks!!
one of the best restuarant's in Seattle.

Customer 6237.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6237.Content: Outstanding food, incredible service, over-the-top wine list - I highly recommend the Metropolitan Grill and it was surprisingly kid friendly! Thanks for making our special occasion even more memorable - we'll be back!

Customer 6238.Name: adsjr
Customer 6238.Content: AS usual great food and wine list. I ahighly recomend yo anyone in the Seattle area.

Customer 6239.Name: JeanneJ
Customer 6239.Content:
I've eaten here several times. The beef dishes ordered by my companions were excellent, but the salmon portion was very small for the price. The halibut was good. The service was just okay...we were celebrating our wedding with family and hoped for a special "touch" that wasn't there.

Overall, I hoped for more but had a great time with my new husband.

Customer 6240.Name: seasoneddiner
Customer 6240.Content:
We had a wonderful meal. We went knowing the prices were high and portions large. However, it does seem to us that one could enjoy the restaurant even more (and perhaps go back more frequently) if the portions were cut in half and prices were somewhat reduced. We all took home at least half of our entrees.
The service was spectacular. Our server had input about the differences in taste and texture of each of the steaks. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, but with a very modest ($38) bottle of wine, no cocktails, and sharing salads and desserts, our bill, including a 20% tip, came to $483! Not your everyday restaurant. And, in spite of this, the room was full of happy diners. They are doing something right!

Customer 6241.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6241.Content: One of the most amazing steaks I have ever eaten! The lobster bisque was delicious. I will definitely come back when I return to Seattle. I would highly recommend metropolitan grill to anyone who is looking for a very nice meal.

Customer 6242.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6242.Content: We were seated fifty (50) minutes after our reservation time. Server change mid meal.

Customer 6243.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6243.Content: As always the Met is the best. the beef is second to none. This is always one of my favorite parts of my trips to Seattle and always will be.

Customer 6244.Name: BMCD
Customer 6244.Content: What a great place, we were seated right away, the place was packed and yet the service was perfect, not too slow and not too fast. Our waitress made great suggestions for us all of which were suburb!!! Great wines at a great price, the steaks were to die for melt in your mouth. The Yukon potatoe cakes for a side dish were excellent, and the carrot cake for dessert was fabulous, it is a very large dessert we split it and it was still too much, but way worth ordering.

Customer 6245.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6245.Content: What a great fun place to meet with friends and have a wonderful meal.

Customer 6246.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6246.Content: The steak was amazing but the service was lacking. Our waitress had a very casual attitude but needed more professionalism. I had been to the Met 15 years before and remembered it as more of a fine dining establishment. Not so anymore...great steaks, so-so sides, and mediocre service. Go here if its an amazing steak you want. Lively atmosphere.

Customer 6247.Name: MlelisaS
Customer 6247.Content: Service was incredible. WONDERFUL waiter! Steak was slightly overcooked. Crab cakes good but not wonderful. Sauces for steaks good but not great. Overall fine meal, but not amazing. Don't understand why it is so highly rated on various sites based on my meal. I've had better fare many times. Not a meal that would bring me back, just the outstanding waiter.

Customer 6248.Name: gr8v8
Customer 6248.Content: I took some people there looking for a great steak house. Unfortunately, the best part of the meal was the Ceasar salad and the wine. We had "The Met" a $62 bone in filet that was at best ordinary. The diner ordered the steak fries with it and they were just french fries with some parmesan. The other chose a NY Strip $48 which was promoted as coming from the American version of Kobe beef. It was just awful. It was prepared perfectly, but the steak itself was more gristle and hunks of fat than I have ever seen on a NY Strip. At least 1/3 of the steak was inedible. The baked potato was the best part of the main course. This is an expensive restaurant with disappointing food.

Customer 6249.Name: SeattleTripper
Customer 6249.Content: This restaurant is exceptional. In the past we have had a few minor service issues but this most recent visit was excellent. The food was perfectly prepared and delicious. Both the food and wine service was what we have come to expect from this establishment. They met us in the bar to take our wine we brought and decant it in advance of our seating. It was on our table when we arrived. We have had the best luck sticking with the prime steaks. We dont feel the same value exists with the fancy pants cuts of japanese beef.

Customer 6250.Name: VeryBerry
Customer 6250.Content: My wife and I went to celebrate our anniversary. We were seated immediately, everyone on staff we passed on our way to being seated spoke and greeted us, we felt welcomed. Juergen was our server, we've been served by him in the past. Karen had the Halibut, I had 42 day aged ribeye cooked to perfection. The food was great, the service was excellent, and drinks on point. I am never dissappoited when I choose the Metropolitan Grill. There was so much more to be pleased about, I go on forever.

Customer 6251.Name: seani
Customer 6251.Content: Great food and service, this place knows what they are doing, a first class steak house. The waiter was very good, had good stories and knew when to leave!

Customer 6252.Name: ErinF
Customer 6252.Content: Probably THE best steakhouse I've ever been to!  The food was AMAZING, the decor was perfect, and the service was great even though they were really busy!  Loved it!!!

Customer 6254.Name: MarshaW
Customer 6254.Content: Everything was very good. There are so many very good/excellant restaurants in Seattle. I thought the Met met our expectations. I didn't come away thinking I can't wait to go back. The dinner was very good that night, I took half of it home and ate it the next night, it was delicious. Maybe I just wasn't in the right frame of mind the night before.

Customer 6255.Name: SeattleK
Customer 6255.Content: We had a great experience from beginning to end. We were celebrating a birthday and they made us feel special. Our server was fantastic as was the wine sommelier. We ordered the chataubriand for two and it was absolutely delicious. Literally melting in your mouth. They do the final preparations table side and that's nice too. We had crab cake appetizer and they were amazing as well. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone, but I would also note that the food and dining experience does come at a price.

Customer 6256.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6256.Content: The food was excellent and a great wine selection. The servicer was very professional and knowledgeable about the food.

Customer 6257.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6257.Content: My husband and I love going to the Met. We always have the best time and the service is always impeccable. The food is alway delicious and portions are generous. We try to go several times a year.

Customer 6258.Name: Carl
Customer 6258.Content: OUTSTANDING! Took advantage of the Met's 2fer deal and had a superb dinner. Service by Jason was exception...our next visit we will ask for one of his tables. Only slight negative was our table. We were seated at one of the small...very small...tables along the right had side of the main aisle. It is a constant battle of rearrangement to enjoy the meal. Next time we'll turn it down, even if it's one of Jason's!

Customer 6259.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6259.Content: Great food! Went for special occasion, birthday, and the service was excellent. Made reservations on-line and they didn't remember the reason was for birthday. Make sure you 'remind' them when you arrive. Also, service takes a long time so plan for it...you won't be disappointed or feel rushed.

Customer 6260.Name: RoyH
Customer 6260.Content: Over priced meal.Good food but if i am paying $56.00 for a steak it should be a Great steak.It seems like alot of restaraunts prices are going way up but the food is of average taste and size.The server was friendly,and the food was well timed.The tables for two are very small.

Customer 6261.Name: DigitalSingularity
Customer 6261.Content: The Met was a fantastic place to have my birthday dinner.  Their food tends to range in that "special occasion" realm for me.  Last time I was there, I purchased a steak trio.  4oz each of Japanese Wagyu, American Kobe, and USDA prime.  It was wonderful to be able to taste the difference between the steaks.  Service was good, though the restaurant can be a bit noisy.  But, the food is fantastic and it's a wonderful place to celebrate.

Customer 6262.Name: JonBlum
Customer 6262.Content: Absolutely the best meal in Seattle!!!! A must.

Customer 6263.Name: Luvfood
Customer 6263.Content: The steaks at the Metropolitan Grill have always been top notch. Unfortunately it was a very busy night and while my filet was outstanding and perfectly cooked, my husband's New York was served a bit overdone and worse, cold. By the time the server got back to check on things, we were almost finished. When my husband mentioned his steak was not quite what it should have been, the server offered to replace it or comp it, which he did. A large group behind us was having flambed desserts and since there wasn't much room to work their server was doing it right next to me. He could see I was bit uncomfortable about the flames and when he finished, he treated us to a dessert.

Customer 6264.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6264.Content: My husband and I love The Met! We have eaten there several times and the food and service are excellent. We recommend them to all our friends who want great food and service.

Customer 6265.Name: DBro
Customer 6265.Content: Unbelievable food and service like a king. Be prepared to hefty prices for it though. Great place to splurge on a special occasion.

Customer 6266.Name: HarrietT
Customer 6266.Content: Our first trip to Seattle and first to Metropolitan Grill. Fabulous...food, service, wine and experience. We will recommend to anyone coming to your great city!

Customer 6267.Name: Photoglvr18
Customer 6267.Content: Awesome!!! Great service, too! Would definitely eat here again the next time I am in Seattle!

Customer 6268.Name: Mudfud
Customer 6268.Content: Good meal, focused on the Snake river farms Waygu beef. Two complaints: 1) the medium rare NY steak was well done on one end, medium to medium rare on the other, and 2) the 8 Oz. Waygu Filet should have been advertized as a "quarter pounder". It was way undersized, and next to the massive spud, looked like an oversized potato eye.

Customer 6269.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6269.Content: the best steak in seattle matched with the best service and it all equals the perfect evening... highly recommended. I am a steak fanatic this scored tops in all areas and the steak was superb.

Customer 6270.Name: Shel
Customer 6270.Content: Meat.....excellent!!!! However, the first time I had to pour my own wine in a restaurant.

Customer 6271.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6271.Content: We had a great time and food was excellent.

Customer 6272.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6272.Content: The food was good, not great, but good. Portions were huge and can be shared. I don't know if this is a common theme in Seattle but people were wearing jeans! Loved the decor and the ambiance, maybe time for a jacket required dress code.? Great wine list and wine steward, great service overall.

Customer 6273.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6273.Content: The Metropolitan Grill was outstanding. Everything from the appetizers to the main course to the dessert was delicious! The service was impeccable. We had a table reserved for Friday night at 6pm. The bar scene was happening but we were tucked into a quieter corner were we were able to enjoy a romantic dinner for two! The staff was very friendly and our waitress was superb.

Customer 6274.Name: XYZ123
Customer 6274.Content: Outstanding service, wonderful wine list, typical steak house ambiance, Porter House steaks were world class in quality and preparation, balance of cuisine was medicore (salads and sides) but this is a steak house. Very expensive.

Customer 6276.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6276.Content:
Four for business dinner. We'd never met before but the "Met" provided the ideal setting, food, service and ambiance for quick camaraderie.

We were greeted at the door like old friends of the restaurant staff, seated right on time.
Michael, our server, was amiable without being effusive. His knowledge of the menu and wine list was complete. He didn't push recommendations but was ready with them when asked. He also up-sold items that he thought we might enjoy and were appropriate to the selected entree'. Michael did not hover but seemed to magically appear when needed. He is good.

We selected Rib Eyes and the bone-in fillets...Served quickly, sizzling, extremely Flavorful and cut like butter. Portions & presentation were perfec

Customer 6277.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6277.Content: The Met was always one of my favorite spots. I hadn't been there for several years due to my finances. So the coupon I received was nice and helped me take my nephew out to lunch to celebrate his birthday. We both had a very nice time. The special features that I didn't check are ones that I didn't experience. Thank-you.

Customer 6279.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6279.Content: We've eaten here several times. This time, we had a waiter who felt the need to recite the whole menu to us. Apparently he had expended all his energy at this point, because the service from that point on was terrible. The exception - the young man who provided bread and beverage refills. On the whole, a disappointment, since it was a special occasion and we didn't have time for coffee and dessert. The food, however, was very good. The special spinach salad that was on the fresh sheet was excellent.

Customer 6280.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6280.Content: THE BEST STEAKHOUSE EVER! I HAVE BEEN TO GREAT STEAKHOUSES IN NYC AND CHICAGO BUT THE MET IS BY FAR THE BEST!!!!! BEEN GOING TO THE MET SINCE I WAS 12 YEARS OLD! THEY EVEN HAVE THE BEST PRIME RIB WHICH IS REALLY AFFORDABLE. I TOTALLY SUGGEST THE POTERHOUSE. YOU CAN SPLIT IT SINCE THERE IS MORE THEN ENOUGH. THE TABLE SIDE CAESAR SALAD & BANANAS FOSTER IS TO DIE FOR! ASK FOR A CIRCULAR BOOTH OR MEDIUM SIZE. THE SMALL BOOTHS ONLY HOLD 2 PEOPLE AND ARE SMALL. CHECK OUT THE BAR MENU, REALLY GOOD PRICES. COME EARLY BECAUSE THE BAR GETS PACKED QUICKLY. GREAT RESTAURANT FOR A SPECIAL DATE, BIRTHDAYS, ANNIVERSARYS, BUSINESS GROUPS OR ANYONE YOU WANT TO IMPRESS!

Customer 6281.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6281.Content: Excellent, best steak i have had in sometime. Service was fast and knowledgable. Best dining we had in Washington, bar none

Customer 6282.Name: Shae
Customer 6282.Content: We were visiting Seattle and The Metropolitan Grill was recommended to us. I had the fillet and my husband had the sirloin. We shared crabcakes as an appetizer and everything we had was AMAZING! The fillet especially had the best, mouth-watering flavors! We HIGHLY recommend this restaurant! Also, our server treated us with the utmost respect, kindness and really pampered us! While the prices were a little high, for the quality of the food, it was totally worth it!

Customer 6283.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6283.Content:
My friends and I were excited to go here, we had heard the steak was one of the best. The steak and potatoes were great yet for the service, ambiance, and snotty staff, I would rather make my own steak or go to Ruby Tuesday which is a lot friendlier.
It is definitely not the place to go to have fun, be happy, and gather with friends.
I would not go here again. My party and I felt judged and "frowned upon" as soon as we arrived as if we did not belong. Yet we spent over 250 on dinner and 40 on gratuity.

Agian, for the price, the drive, and the treatment we will not be going there agian.

Customer 6284.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6284.Content: Without a doubt one of the best Restauraunts in seattle!

Customer 6285.Name: Pyro
Customer 6285.Content:
We were very disappointed in the quality of the steak we ordered and the service was very slow. Our reservation was for 7:00 pm and we were at the restaurant at 6:50. We were seated at approximately 7:105 pm. The timing of the reservatoion was not the problem.

The problem was really the quality of the food and not the reervation.

Customer 6286.Name: KarenS
Customer 6286.Content:
OpenTable: you make the reservation process user-friendly and ever-so-convenient.

Metropolitan Grill: Fabulous dinner. Impressive staff. Exceptional experience...so much so that we returned the next day for afternoon cocktails!

Customer 6287.Name: BradF
Customer 6287.Content: Great steaks. They have Bob Betz wines, yummy.........

Customer 6288.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6288.Content: The experience was excellent from start to finish. From the ambience, to the service, the food( which was incredible) to the dessert. I took my son there for his 21st birthday and he and his girlfriend loved it as well. This a a great place for the younger crowd as well as the older. It can be romantic (booths with curtains for privacy) or it can be fun (open tables that can seat many). If you want a great dining experience this is the place to go!

Customer 6289.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6289.Content: We had a great dinner! We came for our 1st anniversary. We each had a delicious steak with a side of mushrooms that were super tasty! I had mine with the peppercorn sauce which had just a nice amount of flavor to it. It was also great drizzled on my baked potato. When we were done, our waiter brought out an amazing chocolate lava cake for us to share, on the house, to celebrate our anniversary. It was extremely rich and creamy and a nice gesture to boot. We were absolutely stuffed when we left, but we had had a very nice evening. Thank you!

Customer 6290.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6290.Content: As usual, we had a wonderful meal! The beef carpaccio was heavenly, definitely a must try. The atmosphere was great and the service was excellent. Can't wait to go back!

Customer 6291.Name: Rich
Customer 6291.Content: The prime rib was one of the worst I have ever had. Very tough, lots of gristle. Others had steak which were ok. Great service.

Customer 6292.Name: KevinF
Customer 6292.Content: I had made a reservation for this past Friday evening at 5:00PM. My guest and I ordered dinner consisting of a selection of appetizers and a large steak salad each along with several martinis. Waitress seemed perturbed that we were not ordering a "regular dinner", i.e. salad, overpriced expensive steak etc etc. I assured our waitress to relax that we would leave her a big tip. Waitress commented that our table was needed for guests who were "having dinner". Gee I thought we were having dinner also?! Advised the waitress that we liked appetizers for dinner sometimes. Anyway with drinks, appetizers and dinner salads our tab came to $190.00 so what was her beef with us? If I want "attitude" from a restaurant I'll go to Canlis next time.

Customer 6293.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6293.Content:
The food was good. However, we did not get good service. I have to complained to the manager the next day inorder to get the discount for the meal. the server did not give me a receipt for the mail and did not credit me the $50 gift certificate I gave her.

After my complained, it took over a week before I get my credit for the $50 gift certificate because the server was not available to verify the fact that I gave her a $50 gift certificate.

Customer 6294.Name: ChristopherF
Customer 6294.Content: Been to the Met many times. Always had a great time and food. This was a special ocasion, and we had a big booth-table, (7 of us) but too near the front door and bar noise for conversation to be held comfortably. The food was cooked to order ,but was not hot on all plates. Some of the steaks and lobster were warm vs what they should have been. Will go back, but will make sure the waiter serves up the plates asap upon to ensure hot food. Cheers.

Customer 6295.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6295.Content:
Very good and tender steak, and big portion.
The waiter was very nice and pleasant. They refilled the water very quickly as well.
The only drawback is that it is kind of pricey.

Customer 6296.Name: JohnH
Customer 6296.Content:
Great Steak!
Impeccable service

We had a great time!!

Customer 6297.Name: Choman
Customer 6297.Content: Food and service were outstanding. Not for the price conscious.

Customer 6298.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6298.Content: We love the steaks, salad, and 9-layer-chocolate cake and the ambience. The only disappointing aspect is that the sides were disappointing again.

Customer 6299.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6299.Content: The Met was great as usual. I can always expect to have a great meal!

Customer 6300.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6300.Content: my boyfriend and i were in seattle for a weekend getaway and found this place online...it turned out to be a great pick...the server was down to earth and knowledgable...the atmosphere was romantic...and the food was AMAZING!!! definatly a place we will make a point of coming back to

Customer 6301.Name: foodie50
Customer 6301.Content: An excellent steakhouse. Our dinner was perfect.

Customer 6302.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6302.Content: My wife and I had dinner at the Met for our 3rd wedding anniversary (6th overall anniversary.) I had not been to the Met in many years, and this was her first time. We were seated almost immediately for our reservation, and our server took time to Get to know why we were there, and proceeded to be available to make recommendations. The food came out well-prepared, on time, and overall EXCELLENT. Our server also brought us a dessert on the house for our anniversary although we protested against it (weakly...we gave in.) An incredible experience and we will absolutely be back, while asking for our server by name to make sure we have him again.

Customer 6303.Name: birth60day
Customer 6303.Content: 84th birthday for our grandfather. Everyone loved the food and the wait staff could not have been more attentive. It was a fabulous night with unparalleled food!

Customer 6304.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6304.Content:
When my family came to Seattle for my graduation 5 years ago, my sister wanted so badly to go to Metropolitan Grill. She is a huge fan of steak and lobster. But, sadly we never made it during that trip. She's in town and I treated her to her steak and lobster dinner. A friend and I shared the chateaubriand. My sister savored every morsel and she looked like she had died and gone to heaven. We did have to roll ourselves out of the booth and up the hill to valet though.

The bad thing about my sister's experience is that we at here on her first day of the trip. Every restaurant we've eaten at since has been compared to the Met and has lost.

Customer 6305.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6305.Content: Food was excellent, as always. Service was nice, but not over the top. Prices are high, but the coupon helped. Overall a lovely evening!

Customer 6306.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6306.Content: Dining at the Met is always a wonderful experience and our last dinner was no exception. We had rare fillets done to perfection!

Customer 6307.Name: p33833
Customer 6307.Content: Best steak in America. Great service.

Customer 6308.Name: mavenmarj
Customer 6308.Content:
Jason and his team were outstanding! Service was constant, yet unobtrusive. Even the gentleman who along with Jason, kept our water glasses filled, made sure that ice did not go plopping into the glass splashing everywhere.
I was not prepared to leave any of my Dungenes crab fettucine behind as I had only been able to make a small dent in it. As it was coming home to Surrey, B.C. Jason expressed his concern about food safety. Being determined, I went to QFC, bought a thermal cooler bag, filled it with ice and put my precious cargo on top. When we arrived home, the bag was still full of ice. Last night's leftovers were wonderful!

Customer 6309.Name: Odiemac
Customer 6309.Content: As usual, food and service were outstnding.

Customer 6310.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6310.Content:
The best porterhouse I have had in years. The onion rings are incredible!
Service was outstanding. It was a very special dining experience.

Customer 6311.Name: KassisConsulting
Customer 6311.Content: very heavy food, but very tasty. overpriced in my opinion

Customer 6312.Name: Seagal12
Customer 6312.Content: Always dependable for excellent food and servers here could teach other resturants how to perform service. Definately, one of the best places in town.

Customer 6313.Name: BetteB
Customer 6313.Content: Fablous dinner and our server was excellant. Great atmosphere. We got there earlier than our reservation and was seated promptly.

Customer 6314.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6314.Content: Our waiter made a great recommendation (long bone Wagyu Rib-Eye) and was overall very friendly and courteous. The steak was absolutely fantasticly cooked and prepared - very tender and delicious. Certainly one of the best (if not THE best) steaks I've ever had. Certainly worth the price.

Customer 6315.Name: MaureenT
Customer 6315.Content: My sons and I enjoyed The Metropolitan Grill. Much better than a chain and a very comfortable atmosphere.

Customer 6316.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6316.Content:
Fantastic all the way around. Normally when going to an upscale restaurant, one expects a steak and two vegetables on a plate filled with "White Space" and a drizzle of 2 cent sauce for "Presentation". Not here, there was so much food on my plate I couldn't see the bottom, even after eating all I could.

While the prices are high compared to your standard steakhouse, the quality and amount of food make this a better value. You can easily share any meal on the menu, and if you are on a budget, I would suggest doing just that.

The waiter was great, there when you needed him yet amazingly unobtrusive.

The price of coffee was a bit high for my taste, and was incredibly strong, not for the feint of heart or of taste buds.

Customer 6317.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6317.Content: Might be the best steak in Seattle!

Customer 6318.Name: DonB
Customer 6318.Content: We found the prime rib to have a sweet taste that I presume is the result of the seasoning rub that was used. We would not order it again. db

Customer 6319.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6319.Content: We did not feel as thought the steak was up to par for The Met.

Customer 6320.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6320.Content:
My ribeye steak was only an average cut of beef, and it was somewhat greasy. I ordered bearnaise sauce, which our waitress forgot to bring and had to be reminded. And then she took her time, bringing it when I was half finished with my steak. In general her attitude was that she was only mildly interested in us or in serving us. In addition, we tried to use a discount card the restaurant mailed out offering a free entree, only to find in the very small print that the offer was only good Monday through Thursday.

We were unfortunately seated next to a bussing station, and the busboy slammed the back of my seat every time he emptied the bussing trays. After this happened three times I was ready to walk out. A bad experience overall.

Customer 6321.Name: newsboy
Customer 6321.Content: sublime steaks and awesome meat smell form the grill

Customer 6322.Name: LloydM
Customer 6322.Content: I've been to many steakhouses throughout the country, major chains (i.e. Mortons, Ruth Chris, etc) and the local favorites and the 36 oz bone-in ribeye at Met Grill is my favorite dish anywhere. Incredible steak, beautifully cooked. Add in a great wine list, especially of WA wines, and it's the perfect dinner (if you are on an expense account).

Customer 6323.Name: No3Gal
Customer 6323.Content: The Met truly is the best steakhouse in Seattle! I've tried many and they simply don't measure up in terms of the food, ambiance and service. Their porterhouse steak is to die for!

Customer 6324.Name: Nicole
Customer 6324.Content: The filet mignon was excellent along with the asparagus. It was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The 42 day aged ribeye was too fatty. My husband filled an entire bread plate full of fat before he got to the meat. The ribeye was not a good example of prime meat. The pear lemon drop martini was delightful. And the nine layer chocolate cake was more than enough for two people to share. Overall, I would recommend the Metropolitan. Just don't order the ribeye.

Customer 6325.Name: AnthonyP
Customer 6325.Content: wonderful experience and outstanding steak and service.

Customer 6326.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6326.Content: we had the best time ever. the food was amazing. and so yummy. the service was great. we had a geat time. cant wait to go back. expensive.. but worth every single penny.. a great place for a special night. highly recomended.

Customer 6327.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6327.Content: The meals were delicious and we ordered a fine wine from their wide selection, but the wine porter hastily dumped the last of the bottle in my glass and I left with a mouth full of bitter sediment; it really took to the polish of what should have been a fine evening. : (

Customer 6329.Name: Mike
Customer 6329.Content: Excellant as usual. Can always count on great food and service.

Customer 6330.Name: JasonP
Customer 6330.Content: Always consistent, never let's me down. I love the Met!

Customer 6331.Name: Corg
Customer 6331.Content:
Tables/booths were very uncomfortable.Tight and tables were too high for seat height.
The restaurant was HOT (temperature wise)
Steak was very good as were the sides. we talked about ordering a dessert decided not to and then it showed up on our table and bill???
Valet parking was added to our as a convience? bill...???

Customer 6332.Name: MichelleJ
Customer 6332.Content:
The food was unbelieveable!!!!!! Service was best ever...

That Chocolate Molton Lava dessert was the best I have ever had

Customer 6333.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6333.Content: I am always very satisfied when I dine at the "Met". The food, service, & spririts are excellent. I love the fact that I always have some left overs to relive the experience the next day. The menu has a wide variety of choices and everything is cooked to perfection. The servers go the extra mile to make sure you have a positive dining experience.

Customer 6334.Name: matt
Customer 6334.Content: excellent all around , food service ambiance you name it the met grill has it !

Customer 6335.Name: MikeC
Customer 6335.Content: The met is always a gem...love this place..

Customer 6336.Name: MerryMel
Customer 6336.Content: I always love dining at the Met. The best steaks, perfectly cooked. This time I forced myself to try something other than my usuals, and was very impressed and pleased. The service is impeccable and very friendly. Having dessert flamed at our tableside is an extra delight and the head guy performed the task with flare and panache. I treated an out-of-town visitor to dinner. She'd eaten there with me four years ago, remembered it so fondly that a trip to the Met was her only request for this visit. Another friend and I have dined there for our holiday season dinner for the past 15 years. Never disappointed. My favorite place!!!

Customer 6338.Name: NancyD
Customer 6338.Content: Fabulous food- truly awesome preparation and presentation. Everything was delicious! However, wait staff should definitely NOT try to oversell. It is a huge turn off. Trying to foist appetizers and desserts does not add to the ambiance. We spent plenty $400 for 6 of us. Loved every bit- service could be more gracious, however. We will be back because the food is terrific.

Customer 6339.Name: JudyC
Customer 6339.Content: We've been here many times over the years and enjoy the ambiance and service everytime,so much so that we keep going back even though the kitchen isn't consistent.

Customer 6340.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6340.Content: This is our favorite special occasion restaurant in Seattle.

Customer 6341.Name: RTse
Customer 6341.Content: This is a classic steakhouse. The service was very professional. The New York striploin I had was very good; juicy and full of flavour.

Customer 6342.Name: Chris
Customer 6342.Content: This was my first visit to "The Met" and to Seattle. The food was excellent, portions where generous and the somelier recommended an AWESOME bottle of wine. It was definitely waiting for our 9 pm reservation, although we probably would've been served if we had come by earlier. I would DEFINITELY go back.

Customer 6343.Name: smilincyn
Customer 6343.Content: Wasn't pleased with the fact that the "hearts of romaine" lettuce was really the center stalk without any leaves of the lettuce -- a bit bizarre and we've eaten in multiple 4 & 5 star restaurants in the world.   They did make up for it some giving us free dessert; however, still was a very odd experience

Customer 6344.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6344.Content: The filet mignon was one of the best steaks I've ever had. The service was incredible and the food was all around outstanding.

Customer 6345.Name: AnnP
Customer 6345.Content:
My New York steak was flavorful but not the most tender and could have been served hotter. Was barely lukewarm. Potato side dish (forget the name but was like crisped hashbrowns with melted sour cream on top) was only mediocre as was the salad. I had heard such great things about this restaurant and was so looking forward to eating there. It did not really meet my expectations. I've had better. The head waitress was "visiting" a bit too often. Interrupted our conversations.
My companion's T-bone was more tender than mine but also not served as warm as should have been. His baked potato was okay but nothing special. Was served with butter on it. Should not do that without asking.

Customer 6346.Name: OpenTable Diner
Customer 6346.Content: We Had a wonderful dinner at the Met. The service and food was outstanding.
